Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Brian R
Reviews.Content: Great Location and the service on the beach was out of this world. The young lady we had Diana was fantastic. So attentive to our needs and so friendly considering how busy she was. The Concierge was abut snooty but that can be overlooked because the rest of he stay was awesome. The guys at the pool and on the beach were very friendly. Downside: Our car was returned filthy it must have been next to a sprinkler, radio station was changed, seats were adjusted differently, the top was down when we turned it in with the top up and the Valet was "like whatever". So that was a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Inconsistent service, Property did not deserve a second visit.”
Reviews.Author: BARON27
Reviews.Content: Historical property with a lot to offer on a south part of Key West. Walking distance from all attractions, but be ready to spend 20+ minutes walking. Front desk and beach boys are two friendly places in the Hotel. The concierge, restaurant waiting staff are poorly trained and sloppy. Place does not make you feel welcome. My room was not ready at 2:30, which was OK, they called me at 17:20 to inform that it is ready. I asked for late check out, got a very unpleasant female voice: we are full, I can give you only one extra hour. Front desk (Patric) said: No problem, you can leave at one. Beach is rocky and has unpleasant water entrance. You can use stairs to get in, but you have to take a walk. Basically you can not run in to the water. After rain hallways are slippery and Hotel does not have mats or available cleaning staff to get rd of the water. Dangerous and slippery. Property did not deserve a second visit.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at casa marina”
Reviews.Author: MeganAS
Reviews.Content: my husband and 10 yr old son and i recently stayed at the casa marina hotel for two nights and we absolutely loved it. the staff were excellent, the grounds are beautiful, the beach atmosphere is lively yet mellow, and the hotel is perfectly situated for walks into town. our room was small but very nicely done in a sophisticated and classy way. the beach and pools are perfect for families as there is a ping pong table and other sports/game activities, many hammocks, and a dock to walk out on to. we loved casa marina and will stay there again if we ever return to key west.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to be Outside!”
Reviews.Author: Ivanna B
Reviews.Content: The greatest part of staying at the Casa is the ability to be outdoors. The pool and private beach are exclusively for Casa guests which are a perfect escape from crowded public beaches. The outdoor facilities have a variety of activities and cater to all age groups. Casa Marina also has impeccable outdoor service thanks to the "pool boys". For the duration of my stay I was treated like a princess by the pool and beach staff, specifically Jason. He always made sure everything was to my liking and delivered water, drinks, ect before I could even ask. He was speedy with all of my requests and really made the trip unbelievable. It was also helpful to have someone so knowledgeable about the surrounding areas and places to eat, as his assistance led to some of the most amazing meals in Key West. The Casa also has a variety of complementary perks throughout the day such as popsicles, frozen towels, and specialty drinks. This hotel has a wonderful atmosphere and I couldn't ask for better service.

Reviews.Title: “Jet Ski Tour”
Reviews.Author: Steffi C
Reviews.Content: I did the Jet skit tour with my family and I LOVED it!!! Our guides were English Tom and Matt. They were both extremely knowledgeable and fun! Matt was very fearless and didn't hesitate to jump in and assist people when they needed it. I would recommend this tour to any and everyone! Definitely money well spent!

Reviews.Title: “I'm also here now and the service isn't that great.”
Reviews.Author: Relay
Reviews.Content: I'm sitting in an ocean facing room at the Casa Marina typing this review on my iPad. Yes this is a stunning hotel in a stunning location but the service we've experienced here has not been great. Lots of staff but problems at the bar and at breakfast where the service is slow and disorganised. Standards of housekeeping have also been rather hit and miss. Prior to our arrival we stayed at the Boca Beach Club (also Waldorf Astoria) and the two places are like chalk and cheese. Here at the Casa Marina the staff appear inadequately trained and poorly supervised. Overall the hotel has a feel of absentee management with largely well meaning kids seemingly running the show. Whilst in Florida we've also stayed at three Westin hotels. I have to say that we had far more engaging service at the Westins. That's a shame because the Casa Marina was to be the highlight of our holiday (and certainly the most expensive). We are coming to the end of our stay in the US and we've enjoyed every minute of it. We've had a fantastic time and we've met so many truly hospitable and wonderful people. I've been genuinely overwhelmed. We will return to Florida and Key West next year but I doubt we'll choose to stay again at the Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Get your family to the Casa and they will do the rest”
Reviews.Author: Valerie V
Reviews.Content: This was a lovely and very easy 8 day beach vacation for my husband and I and our three 21+ year olds. Tip for swimming right off the Casa's beach - bring dive booties or aqua socks. The food and drinks were delicious and the service was even better. Rooms were well-appointed and very clean. Beds and pillows were comfortable. We really enjoyed our two Ocean Vista one-bedroom suites. Room 2006 was roomier and had more pool/beach activity to see and 1020 was cozier with a fantastic view of the beautiful water. Both had small balconies. Many thanks to manager Steve for putting us in 1020; Steven for all the great advice and setting us up daily on the beach and Kohleka for wonderful beach service and sweet temperament. But truly all hotel personnel were helpful and attentive. No exceptions. Any problems we encountered were resolved quickly and graciously by hotel staff. Obviously you should expect to pay for this level of service. We enjoyed activities every day and spent the rest of the time at the beach or at the grill/bars. Try the watermelon salad, conch fritters and bouillabaisse at the Casa and anything at the Reach Chop House. We swam and snorkeled off the docks (free); went on 2 hour snorkeling boat trips ($55 each); took an Eco Tours Kayak trip ($75 each); walked Duval Street (free?); rode the trolley ($29 each); caught dinner on Barefoot Billy's Charter 1/2 day ($800 seats 6); worked out in the spacious gym (free) and our oldest got his Advanced Scuba cert. with South Point diving. All activities were arranged and coordinated by Casa Marina Concierge personnel as were cabs and dinner reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, I'm here now, previous post want something for nothing”
Reviews.Author: Ifloss
Reviews.Content: I booked and PAID FOR, a one bedroom ocean front room and that's exactly what I got. I hate hearing people on here whine about not getting upgraded or complaining for actually having to pay for things. This is an excellent hotel, with a great beach, beautiful scenery, excellent service. I'm in room 1026, very private and great view of beach and water. I can't say enough about the beach/pool side service. There is no hassle for chairs, they come around with Popsicles, drinks of the day, cool towels, and they even offer to clean your sun glasses while your laying out. It's a busy place, so I'm sure waiters forget things, but I did not have that experience. Mark, the pool services director, hand wrote out all the restaurants and activities we should do or go to. I've been her three days, with four to go and he has been on the money. There's a constant gentle breeze on the beach that make laying out in the hot sun very breakable. This is a great place to stay in key west, just make sure you book a large room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Side Service and Jet Ski Tour!”
Reviews.Author: Natalie D
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Reach but often went to Casa Marina's beach during the day. Jason was a wonderful beach attendant (see up our umbrella, got us towels, and anything else requested throughout the day) and Diana was a great beachside server (took our lunch/ drink orders directly from the beach and provided interesting conversation)! We also went on the jet ski tour operated through Barefoot Billyâ€™s. We began the tour directly from the Casa Marina beach area and had such a fun time. Jon was a great tour guide (extremely knowledgeable of Key Westâ€™s history and fun facts, and very encouraging to go at the speed each driver felt comfortable). We took the tour on a day the ocean was rough, and it ended up being even more fun than jet skiing when the ocean is calm! Thanks Jason, Diana, and Jon for the exceptional service!

Reviews.Title: “Walmart collection, not Waldorf....”
Reviews.Author: Welltrvld
Reviews.Content: We have been fortunate enough to have stayed in many of the Waldorf Astoria hotels. Casa Marina is not in the same league as the others.. The lobby and grounds are beautiful, but the hotel layout, quality and rooms are deficient.... We have stayed in Hampton Inns with much better rooms.. We booked early and requested a King bed, we got two doubles in a very small room... The view was of a parking lot and uninhabitable buildings... We are Hilton Honors Diamond members and have been for many years. They offered no Diamond member room upgrades, executive lounges, breakfast, etc.. The TV remote did not work, the clock was not set, both beds rattled, one set of sheets were stained and the sink ran all night.. We asked for another room and were told none are available.. The Diamond Hotline could not move us to another hotel, due to all of them in the area being booked. Very disappointing and we will not return to this hotel..

Reviews.Title: “Total relaxation”
Reviews.Author: Debra G
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Casa Marina Resort for 2 nights March 2012. Perfect beach resort very relaxing,a nice stroll to Duval street, Friendly staff. Only had lunch there which was lovely. Room was nice but not a lot of room for your clothes. Would recomend if you to just chill out.

Reviews.Title: “Matt and Joe saved my life.”
Reviews.Author: patricia s
Reviews.Content: I was having a great time with our company and we chose to ride the wave runners. It was a very windy day and I and my husband decided to go on the wave runners. The mistake we did was going on one together and my husband never drove one before thou they were very good explaining the safety of driving one. We got a couple of miles outand we all cut our engines off to listen to the instructure. We all started our engines up and they took off, we were way behind and we got pushed off the wave runner from everyone else took off and we were too slw stratung back up. Water was very choppy and windy out. Jo seen us fall off and came to help us right away. I swam thru choppy water to get back to the wave runner. I did and I was exhausted plus my life jacket lifted over my head. I could not get back on the wave runner but my husband did. Jo all he cared about it that I was ok. He told me to hold on to the wave runner while my husband drove very slow back to shore. I pulled something in my wrist and I could not hold on with 2 hands so Jo told us to stop and he rushed back to the shore to get Matt and he is my hero. Matt went under the water and held on the wave runner and he let me use his shoulders as a ladder and I got up on the wave runner and we drove back to shore and I was safe. It was a scary experience but Jo and Matt took very good care of me and saved my life. Thanks to them for there fast thinkingand their team work. Thank you, Trish Awsome dudes!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Which rooms make a HUGE difference”
Reviews.Author: mywifemakesmehike
Reviews.Content: This elegant old property has some very bad old rooms. We were shown 3 before we had one that was not borderline disgusting. While the property in general is nice and parts of it are clearly worthy of the Waldorf name, some of the rooms are very old and are nowhere near worth what they charge ~ $350 + resort fee + taxes). They really should consider closing a least part of the resort and doing a re-build or makeover. The common grounds are quite nice (though strangely the resort lacks an actual real restaurant!), but again, some of the older rooms are so bad as to make it an unpleasant experience. Also, while we always feel ripped off by "daily resort fees", it is especially grating when you really do get nothing for it. Casa Marina charges $25/day resort fee. For that, we got one poolside popsicle, one cold towel poolside, and terrible internet service. The wireless was slow, and the 2 computers provided in the lobby were woefully outdated and not up-to-date with software. It took me 10 minutes to print out a boarding pass! And really, $26 for a very pedestrian buffet breakfast?!? Why do that? Again, it just makes you fell ripped off. All in all, very disappointed in this Waldorf property. It was definitely NOT worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “Jet ski tour”
Reviews.Author: Robin S
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently did the jet ski tour at the Casa Marina. Matt and John were our guides, and they were awesome. They were very knowledgeable about the island. We have been to Key West several times, and I learned things from Matt and John that I didn't know before. They were totally cool, and I would do a tour with these guys again. Thank you, Matt and John. You rock! Robin Steadman

Reviews.Title: “Great Place with Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: randy r
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for spring break last week. The weather and restaurants were great. The guys that help you while lounging in the pool area or on the beach were excellent! Steven and Graham gave us great service many days. Sully was great too! What a wonderful stay! Thanks Randy from Virginia

Reviews.Title: “Pampered again March 2012”
Reviews.Author: Deedeemitchell
Reviews.Content: The shuttle driver picked us up at the Key West Airport and delivered us to the Casa Marina for another annual visit. Cathie Henning, our 'personal concierge' made dinner reservations for us at some of our favorite spots. We checked into our room, this year overlooking the pool with a spectular ocean view on the second floor in the historic portion of the hotel. Mark Gray(Barefoot Billy's) Kassie and Matthew (who had some excellent dining suggestions & remembered us from last year), assisted with our favorite mode of transportation (bicycles), they also arrange jet ski trips, paddle boarding, etc. Pool concierges, Steven(life long resident) and Graham (had a great Irish accent), kept us smiling & made sure our favorite spot at the beach or pool was reserved and ready with fresh towels each day (what GREAT guys!). Be sure to treat yourself to a 'couples massage' at the beginning and end of your trip. Luci & Judith are the BEST! Judith even came in on her day off to accommodate us. The hotel grounds are beautiful, amenities galore. Poolside bar staff, Jan, Robin, Patrick (remembered us from last year) & Diana, always made sure we had our favorite food and drink poolside. Pampered again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay as always”
Reviews.Author: Ian M
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel to Key West 2 or 3 times a year and we always stay at the Casa. Yes, there are other nice resorts to choose from on the island - NO we've never considered switching to any of them. I travel weekly for work and the service that you receive here is difficult to find anywhere else in the country so we don't even risk it. From the folks at the front desk to the pool concierge and the servers - you'll be hard pressed to find much at all to complain about. Keep up the good work, we'll be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Jet Ski adventure around Key West!”
Reviews.Author: TheJayJayGuy
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I took a 2 hour jet ski ride around the island with Matt, one of the hotel guides. We had a fantastic experience and I highly recommend asking for Matt. He grew up on Key West and spent his high school days exploring everything in and around the water. No one knows local waters like those who grew up exploring them. Matt took us to several areas that aren't normally seen, and we even saw two small dolphins playing and bobbing up and down in the water. It was very, very cool.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Mark H
Reviews.Content: Arriving to the hotel you are drawn in by the amazing grounds and beautiful building. This continues all around the resort even after you come inside. The grounds are all well maintained and are just as beautiful as in the pictures you'll see on the site. The building really fits in well with the scenery and from the outside is very well maintained and beautiful. Once inside, the lobby is an open inviting space. It gets pretty crowded and the lines for check-in tend to back up. Similar to most people our room was not ready upon arrival. We ended up using our welcome drinks and snack, given to us by Hiltton HHonors Gold status, but I would have rather gotten into our room and made our way down to enjoy the beverage on our own time. Luckily it was just over under an hour and a half wait. Arriving at check-in time this is a very poor welcome, especially as a Gold member, but would be annoying for anyone. The rooms are pretty nice for what they are. We were in an Ocean Vista King room and the view was very nice. On the first night it was actually really nice to be able to sit on the balcony and just listen to the ocean. It's also a great view to wake up to in the morning. The rooms are not too large, but are comfortable for the few hours a day you aren't sleeping there. The bed is comfortable and the shower has good pressure and plenty of hot water. In our room there was a small sitting area both inside and out on the balcony. These were great to enjoy a quick snack or eat lunch at. The room seems to be well insulated. The only noise we heard came from the connecting door or through the balcony door, when very loud things were going on. Overall though it was a very quiet stay and we were able to sleep well. The rooms seem worn in many places. The bed is clearly getting a bit worn out and might improve from a replacement soon. Chromed fixtures are chipping. There were a couple holes in the drapes, easily visible early in the morning. The shower has some dark spots in the caulk. The room was clean and kept clean during our stay very well. But, over time things get worn out and it's clear that's happening here. Most people we interacted with during our stay were very friendly and really tried to make our stay a pleasant one. The beach and pool attendants were fun and were always quick with towels, drinks or a chair. The bartenders were attentive and gave us a few good laughs. The waitresses at the restaurant were quick and provided good service at breakfast. The valet and bellmen were friendly and quick with our bags. The only place I felt like I was being hurried out and not really appreciated as much was a couple interactions at the front desk. Activities at the resort are really nice. There is the beach to lay out on. You can't just walk out into the ocean, so don't expect that. The beach also isn't typical sand and is a bit rocky. But it's big enough for everyone and the attendants help make it a great afternoon. Next door is Barefoot Billy's where we had an excellent jet ski tour. For a morning workout there is also an excellent fitness center. It's definitely one of the best centers I've seen in quite a while. It's clean, has plenty of high quality equipment and bottled water and towels to help you out. Overall it was a very pleasant, relaxing stay. I've definitely had a better overall experience for less, but the grounds and activities around the resort are included in the cost and add a lot of value. For what's available in Key West I don't see how anything could be better though. If I'm back in Key West in the future, Casa Marina would be at the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, very historic”
Reviews.Author: jdyson83
Reviews.Content: Historic hotel, very nice. Loved the amenities, location and feel of the resort. Only problem we had is that you can hear the wooden chairs sliding across the floors in the rooms above and below you. Nothing like a lovely chalkboard feel to wake you up in the morning. Staff was great, concierge very helpful. Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, small but clean rooms, affordable, stay in newer wings.”
Reviews.Author: BobG44
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 days on a business trip, service was great, beachside room was clean, food was very good, and you can't beat the location in the quiet part of Key West. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Locale”
Reviews.Author: Divetraveler100
Reviews.Content: For location, beach, beauty, and amenities, I don't think there is a better resort in Key West. From the front of the hotel it is a short walk to an excellent restaurant/bar called Louie's Backyard with different menus upstairs and down, and a relatively short walk to Duvall Street and many of Key West's attractions and restaurants. The view out back is dramatic and beautiful. When one exits the central lobby, one sees a wide strait path with reflecting pools along the sides and beach, palm trees, and ocean beyond. There are swimming pools on either side and a restaurant in between. There are hammocks and lounge chairs on the beach and plenty of lounge chairs and umbrellas around the pool. The very helpful pool conceirges will arrange towels in chairs and your umbrella for you. If you stay by the pool long enough, you may be surprised by a Jolly Rancher popsickle or a frozen Eucalyptus towel to cool you off. The concierges inside are also quite helpful and busy. The hotel itself is quite attractive, and an elegant but comfortable mix of the traditional and the modern. The room my friend and I shared (a traditional with garden view) was simple and spacious but very nice. The only complaint about it was that the bathroom was quite small and did not have adequate towel racks, and there was only one drawer in the bedroom furniture. Although the service was a bit slow, the waitstaff were very friendly and helpful. Food in the outdoor restaurant and that served in the breakfast buffet ranged from good to excellent. I was on the bed and breakfast plan, and did wish the hotel had self-serve coffee available before I was actually seated for breakfast. There is a boutique which serves Starbucks coffee, but I did not want to pay extra for this or deal with it first thing in the morning. The waitstaff was good about getting me a "to-go" cup of coffee when I asked, but it took a long time, they were very busy, and I hated to ask the next morning. My friend and I each had a massage and thought the massage therapists did an excellent job. We were a bit disappointed that there was no waiting room for the "spa", a converted room suite, and that there was only one chair outside the door into it. Only one of us could sit while we waited for our appointment. The "spa" itself was very small and had no showers, steam-shower or sauna--facilities one usually expects in a spa. Even though there were a few drawbacks, which I have mentioned, the pluses far outweighed them. Overall, this was a delightful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, out of the way place.”
Reviews.Author: snoopydeb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I found Casa Marina to be a very nice place to stay in Key West, but definitely a little out of the way. It has it's own beach, which is nice, especially for eating out there at night. The staff is very friendly and accomodating, and the rooms are clean and comfortable. Meals, as everywhere in Key West, are expensive; count on $40 for two for a simple lunch or breakfast. The hotel is older, and when we arrrived the room we had paid for was unavailable due to a "flooding problem". We were placed in a room with no balcony, 2 double beds instead of a king, and across the hall from the noisy ice machine. We only had to spend one night there, though, and to compensate for it we were treated to a free dinner including wine on the beach, so that was ok. For peace and quiet, I would definitely recommend Casa Marina, but you'll pay the price in transportation to get into town or to the marina and other restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Staff”
Reviews.Author: Ginny M
Reviews.Content: We have been vacationing in Key West for many years with our stay being at the Casa Marina Hotel most times. Our visit this year was 2/25-2/29. In addition to the great service and amenities, the beach personal were exceptional. Our chairs and umbrella were always waiting for us with magazines and cold water on the table in between. The attentiveness was above and beyond; catering to all our needs. I noticed that this went on through out the beach. Our hats off to Jason, Jake, Billy and Mark. Thank you for making our stay most pleasurable. Sincerely, Ginny and Phil Matena PS. We were so thrilled with the property, that we our bringing our family back during Thanksgiving week 2012. Can't wait!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not up to snuff”
Reviews.Author: Diana S
Reviews.Content: Not impressed with this hotel, and we are frequent travelers who rely on Trip Advisor for good advice. When it comes to the value versus cost ratio, the Costa Marina gets a minus 3. Yes, this hotel is on one of the few beaches in Key West and close to all activities. But with the added resort fee rooms are pricey and not up to what you would expect. If we come back to Key West we will go for a quaint B&B next time.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel...but not up to Waldorf standards”
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S
Reviews.Content: First, the positives...great setup: picturesque walkway from lobby to beach, flanked by reflecting pools, beachfront bars and a well-appointed, generous oceanfront patio. The beach, while small (they all are on Key West, I'm told) gets the vibe right with hammocks swaying underneath the palms, complimentary chaises, outdoor spa tables under thatched roof huts, and beach games such as ladder ball and sand volleyball on the lawn area behind the beach. The weather when we were there was 80 degrees and sunny...wonderful! Many activities can be enjoyed from the hotel: water excursions as well as the trolley tour. The gym is good, location of hotel is good - on the south side of the island near the southernmost point. Now, the negatives...the execution. We have stayed at other Waldorf Astoria properties and this one does not achieve the level of service that brand brings to mind. When we checked in, we were given a room that, while facing the ocean, also fronted the street (noisy!). The 2nd room we were given was more "pool front" than oceanfront, yet no incentives or price breaks were offered. We were told, "this is the only room we have available - take it or leave it." Disappointing. The food was mediocre and overpriced and the service was slow and not excellent. "Toes in the Sand," a beachfront dining experience, is a great idea with a great setup, but again, poor execution (overcooked steak, rubbery shrimp, although the desserts were very good). We expected much better for the price. There is a thin paperback publication in the room on the history of the Casa Marina. It was informative, but full of typographical errors. And if I want to keep it, it's $10. Really? I'll pass. The coffeemaker in our room was so loud, my husband had to go out for coffee so he wouldn't wake me. Overall, we were pleased with the weather, the design and layout of the room and the convenience of the hotel (3 miles from the airport). but it was not in line with the excellence we have come to expect from Waldorf hotels. Oftentimes, excellence is in the details. The details are missing at the Casa Marina. The discriminating traveler will likely be somewhat disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Staff in Rooms Control”
Reviews.Author: Stephen K
Reviews.Content: We're returning to the Casa for our first time since 2005 (our sixth trip overall since 1994). Celebrating an anniversary (we were here on our honeymoon), Marshee Ramsey couldn't have been helpful enough in ensuring our return when we booked last August. Recently, when we decided to add a couple of nights, Bridget Jones really saved our trip, when 'reservations' drastically increased our rate. Even Marshee Ramsey offered to help on her day off before Bridget stepped in and fixed everything. Thank you both from the bottom of our hearts! Look forward to coming back to the Casa in a couple of weeks!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect get-a-way!!!”
Reviews.Author: David W
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been coming to the "Casa" for 25 yrs plus. Perfect place to kick back and relax. If you can't relax here then you can't do it on your own. Mark and the group at the beach / water-sports are always on top of their game. Sun-Sun bar perfect place to watch the sun go down. Ocean view suites are perfect for what we want in a room. Expensive yes but paradise is. Kevin the property manager is great. Some of the European staff had a hard time with my Southern accent but not a problem. Will be back next year and the next and the next----- Doc W Nashville Tn.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: woodie2012
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel two years in a row. It has the best beach in Key West. You can see some good sunsets there also. The staff goes out of their way to make your stay as pleasant as possible. Get the package deal that includes a fantastic breakfast buffet. The self serve waffle station is so popular, Muhammed had to step in to keep things under control. He saw that we had been waiting a long time so he made some waffles for us, and then another guest came by and she insisted they were hers! We were almost going to get in a fight - over waffles! Muhammed used his warm smile and settled everything down between us, and made waffles for her too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Clifton M
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Casa Marina, the staff is very attentive and they offer a level of luxury to everyone. A special thanks to Graham, Mark, Steven and Patrick for making our stay memorable and thanks for the papmering. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Robin Y
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a fabulous stay at Casa Marina! The resort is beautiful and in a great location...within walking distance to Duval St. We loved our ocean front room. What set this resort head and shoulders above others we've stayed at was the friendly, helpful staff and the outstanding service they provided! Everyone made us feel so welcome and always asked how our stay was going and if there was anything we needed. I wish I could remember everyone's name, but thank you to Jafre and Patrick at the front desk, to Cliff the valet, to Vio our wonderful server at the beach and pool, Ryan our jet ski tour guide and of course all the "beach guys" (Mark, Jason, Patrick, et al) who made us feel like royalty setting up our beach chairs, bringing a daily complimentary beverage, ice water, cucumber slices for your eyes, Popsicles, etc!! They always had a smile and made us feel like it was a pleasure serving us. After my husband and I travel we say we will have to go back some day but haven't . This time is different...we are definitely going back to the Casa Marina next winter!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed signals”
Reviews.Author: hfarbs
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina has a great location, right on the beach. The pools are nice. The staff were very mixed: the staff at the pools and restaurants and the front door staff were very helpful, but the front desk was sometimes terse and sometimes surly. There is no business center, and even the two computers they allow you to use don't have Word (so you can't print) and were painfully slow. I was first given what must have been the worst room in the place--first floor, noisy, great view of cars in the parking lot. They refused to move me the first night, but they did move me to a very nice room on the 3rd floor after that. I later found out that another person attending the same conference had first been given that same room and she asked to move also. Given that I'm a HiltonHonors elite, I expected better. They need more staff also; room service once took over an hour for lunch.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money but nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sista_Traveler
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Casa Marina for a conference and would not have stayed there if I had to pay for it out of my pocket. First check-in was nice. I got there early (11am) and my room wasn't ready because they'd had a full house the night before. I understand that and so they held my bags and I gave them my cell to call me when the room was ready. I later found out the person who checked me in wrote down the number wrong after they said they tried to call me when the room was ready. The frontdesk said I must ahve given them the wrong number. Yeah, right. Like I don;t know my own phone number. Their menu is very limited and the food is not that good. I had a really dry grilled cheese sandwich from room service. When I ate at the restaurant I had to ask 3 times for pickles to go with my hamburger because they kept forgetting to bring them. The pool area is really nice. The gym is across the street from the property and not elaborate. The beach is okay but there are rocks everywhere. The hammocks on the beach are great. The rooms are not worth $299 per night but they are clean. I could hear the person in the next rrom flushing their toilet so I figured the walls are really thin.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, needs to pay attention to safety”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler068
Reviews.Content: I just staying at Casa Marina for several nigths. The location is very beautiful, but the business center was too really slow computers, not helpful for business travelers. My room was with a window that didn't open, so you could never air out the room, enjoy the weather, or even dry your bathing suit. The lights were out in my corridor at night, and the staff just didn't seem to care that it made the place creepy at night. I asked repeatedly and they said they couldn't fix it, and would find another light source, and never did. How did they not notice this before I called in? Then at midnight twice someone knocked at my door, and barely identified themselves as room service, which I hadn't ordered. I called the front desk to see if it really had been room service, they didn't know, were rude, said they'd call back. Never did. As a single woman on a business trip, I found the front desk staff less than attentive to safety .The pool folks and catering staff were very nice, but the front desk people just seemed not to care about safety. Maybe it's better for vacationers. Overall, didn't live up to the other hotels of this type that I've stayed at in terms of service.

Reviews.Title: “What helpful and friendly people.”
Reviews.Author: Tom C
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Marina last week and had a great experience . I am in a wheelchair and found everyone to be helpful and fun to stay with. I especially want to thank Graham for helping me to get in a pool for the first time in 3 years. He was funny and made me feel comfortable while getting in the pool ...not bad for an Irishman.I also want to mention Suzanne the bartender . She was friendly and funny and made our drinks taste even better . Great place and even better people. Tom Colby

Reviews.Title: “Needs help.”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadforgci
Reviews.Content: There is great potential here, but it is squandered. This property is in an absolutely terrific location, beautiful beach front area, and a short walk to Duval Street, restaurants and entertainment. Unfortunately, the way the property is maintained and the level of service do not live up the Waldorff Astoria brand and both leave a lot to be desired. The room is small and needs a renovation. The grounds would be outstanding if they were spotless, but they are not. We stayed 4 nights and were always running into poor housekeeping and maintence. An elevator was out of service for 2 days. There were "hairballs" in some of the hallways; glassware on the beach or common areas left over from receptions the evening before. The staff was not rude, but seemed not to happy to be working there. We stayed there 4 nights with a conference group; if we go back to Key West on our own, we'll be more likely to check out other options before returning here.

Reviews.Title: “Jet Ski Tour”
Reviews.Author: DanielAnacan
Reviews.Content: Awesome Jet Ski Tour! Matthew from Barefoot Billy's did such a great job with the tour! Thanks for the wonderful experience! We'll for sure be back!! Thanks Again. - Daniel A.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Krishna M
Reviews.Content: Service was top-notch. Lovely view, good breakfast, good bar and restaurant, and best of all - friendly staff. The only thing we missed was a better beach (sand). The sand there was NOT nice enough for my kid to make sand castles. That said - everything else was above our expectations. We have a 2 yr old, he enjoyed the activity area with small games, and the pool. We didn't have enough time to enjoy the water sports or the bicycles that one can rent right there on the hotel property. Sure the stay is a bit expensive (we paid $850 for 2 nights inclusive of taxes, resort fees, breakfast for two, $100 hotel credit) compared to other hotels there - but well worth it. One could park their car themselves across the street (less than a minute walk) if you want to save on valet. Best of all - at this time of the year (Feb) we watched both sunrise and sunset from the private deck of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: bxa145
Reviews.Content: We loved the ambiance at this hotel. It has everything you could want including clean rooms, great views, pleasant staff, beautiful views, and good drinks! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Spendy, but worth it”
Reviews.Author: timfaraway
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is a beautiful hotel, even the rooms not in the main building. The pools are refreshing and the attendants are attentive. They come by to bring cool towels, popsicles, and even to clean your sunglasses. They pointed out the iguanas roaming around, which my daughter loved. There is plenty to do, just expect to pay for it. Drinks at poolside get expensive quickly, but thats par for the course I think. Access to the beach was a great bouns that didn't seem available at most other hotels. We had a great time, and would probably go back for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Costly Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Christian B
Reviews.Content: My wife, son and I traveled to Key West on a family vacation. We thought that we would be safe selecting a Waldorf Astoria property... What a mistake. For $400 a night, you get an extremely tiny room in an annex to the main building(s) that appears to be an old Holiday Inn that was recently given a cosmetic make-over. The room was so small that you couldn't open the exit door and the bathroom door at the same time without becoming trapped... We had a large picture window overlooking someone's run-down back yard and there was a petroleum smell blowing out of our air conditioner. To top all of that, the hotel refused to upgrade us even though we offered to pay a higher rate and we received no housekeeping (despite the fact that we were out of the room for 12 hours) the first day. Finally, we were moved down the hallway to an identical room with a phone that didn't work! Don't get me wrong, we are very flexible travelers... The real problem with this hotel is that the management was embarrassingly inattentive. After multiple phone calls, stall tactics on the part of the hotel and finally us having to check out early and find new accommodations, the best the manager could do was take 50% off of ONE of our nights and give us an insincere "sorry". What a joke! There is a happy ending to my story, we ended up moving to a fantastic hotel!!! Stay at the Westin Sunset Key! Unbelievable place for about the same price! I'm not a shill for Westin, we really love the Sunset Key. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “General Review”
Reviews.Author: Herb1258
Reviews.Content: General management was good but a little disorganized.... the staff, car valet, bellman, etc. were overall terrific. However, the beach staff: Julian, Jake, Jason and Mark were beyond words. It wasn't our first visit and it won't be our last... Herb & Roberta

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not amazing”
Reviews.Author: Cherrie163
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here New Year's and New Year's day having spent the previous 2 weeks staying in some of the best hotels in Florida, we were really looking forward to staying here. We check in at 5pm after a long drive from Miami and were shown to our room by a lovely porter who's name escapes me! This was when the problems started. We were shown to our room in the main building which was meant to have an ocean view. The room we were allocated had only 3 tiny windows about 9 feet up! The room was smaller than my bathroom at home, I actually thought that was only one part of it! We didn't even put our bags down and headed straight back to reception. Due to the fact it was new year's eve they said they had no other rooms in the main building and we had to move one in the new building, even though this wasn't what we paid for. They did send us up a bottle of champagne to apologise and allowed us to move our dinner reservation back because we only got into the room at the time we were booked to eat! Apart from that hiccup the stay was lovely. The husband and I got to see in the New Year from one of the beach hammocks with our free champagne! Would stay again but would definitely upgrade to a suite to makesure I didn't get the tiny room or stuck in the new building!

Reviews.Title: “LIVING LARGE IN KEY WEST”
Reviews.Author: tarynpeter
Reviews.Content: First time in key west and first time at a Waldorf collection hotel. The location is fabulous if you want to chill on the beach rather that deal with the laid back hustle of Mallory Square area. Beach side bar and hammock service, meant we never had to raise our hands except to motion for more drinks and food. Catering to our every whim! The rooms were on the small side and appear due for an freshening, which seemed to be going on while we were here. Everything is right here. We followed the advice of others and parked on the street and saved $18-25/night. Concierge was very helpful and we will not stay anywhere else when we return. Be warned though it is pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: Kbricio
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel but lots of problems. We were paying extra for three people in a suite yet housekeeping left only 2 waters, coffees, chocolates and pillows. Room was dusty. We had to call for TP!! room keys did not work on beach access gate. Location is not close to the action/commerce but if you just want beach, the beach is beautiful. Service poor. Put it this way, it's no ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Jake, Jason, Julian, and Mark (Barefoot Billy's Pool Gentlemen) made our family vacation!!!”
Reviews.Author: Manoj S
Reviews.Content: I am going to review this property in 3 categories: Great, Good, and Bad. My overall rating for this property is 3.5 out of 5. Please read entire review to understand why this property fell short of 4.5/5... The "Great": The service of the staff-- the gentlemen at the pool were amazing!! Every day they had a spot for us reserved (at the pool or the beach) with toys for my twin 2 year olds along with champagne for the adults. Cold towels, popsicles, water, free samples of the drink of the day, etc. We never asked for any of the items provided, which made this experience that much better!! These guys never disappointed and we made sure that we took care of them as well. Shontel (Blonde hair server from Rhode Island) was amazing with our family and took care of anything we needed. She was very attentive in regards to making sure that all our requests for drinks/food were taken care of in a timely manner. She made our family feel like we were at home... Thank you!! Cathie at the Concierge desk-- she took care of us with arranging a wonderful sunset cruise on the Schooner Western Union. She also gave us coupons to great restaurants which we saved a bit of $$$ (the other concierges did not). That was a very pleasant surprise... The Resort-- beautiful in every aspect with the "best" beach available in all of Key West (which is only for resort guest). Very family friendly and plenty of space which made our family feel like we were not crowded (the hotel was at full capacity). The "Good": The food and drink were good, however, a bit pricy... but that's what you get at a resort, so plan accordingly. Housekeeping was good for the most part, but we did have to call a few times to make sure our room was cleaned by the appropriate time as we needed naps for our 2 year old twins by mid-afternoon. The bellmen were good as well, however, with a full hotel, you would think that you would have more folks on staff to help with the guests.. The "Bad": I am a very experienced traveler (67 countries and counting)... The number one item I am most concerned about is "safety" for my family and I. We had an incident on our first evening at the resort that needed the attention of the Key West Police Department. Needless to say, everyone is ok, but we almost had an "missing persons" experience. My major concern is when asking the management staff multiple times to provide updates regarding the investigation on the issue at hand, not one individual updated us during our stay (and we stayed for 7 days). I even tried to contact the managing director (Kevin Speidel) of the Casa Marina multiple times with no response (even though he mentioned to other individuals at the resort that he came to our room and left us a voicemail-- no voicemail was left as I checked every day for a message). As an executive of a Fortune "50" company and Hilton Honors member (Diamond, Platinum, Gold, and Silver status over the years), I expect much better of the Waldorf Astoria and the Hilton Hotels Brand Name. There are multiple reasons why I have let my status with the Hilton Hotels lapse over the last 24 months, but this tops the list. If my experience is any indication of how this property is managed going forward, then I am quite concerned for future guests. With the above said, I am rating the "service" category as 1 out of 5. In my mind, management needs to be accountable for it's actions... and the above example clearly defines that action they chose to take. So this is why I have rated this property a "3.5" out of 5. Thank you for taking the time to read my review.... "MS" from Michigan....

Reviews.Title: “Did not live up to expectations;except the pool service & pool bar”
Reviews.Author: proudwoman
Reviews.Content: Between DH and I we spent over 200 nights in Hilton properties worldwide last year, in addition to other hotel properties, and expected more from this Waldorf. As HHonors Diamond members we were not upgraded upon check-in and had to speak with a manager to even get a room with a balcony. Rooms are small with good amenities, although our room was not serviced one day during our stay so we asked for clean towels which were delivered immediately. The breakfast is extremely expensive ($26 for buffet) and we had to wait at least 5-10 minutes to be seated even though there were empty tables. Rent bikes and take a 2 minute bike ride to the Southernmost Cafe or Camille's for a reasonably priced and delicious breakfast. A quick walk or bike ride to El Siboney for lunch or dinner is a MUST! The guys who service the Pool and beach are phenomenal; from misting and cleaning your sunglasses, to cool eucalyptus towels; Jake, Jason, Julian, and Mark are the most attentive pool staff we've ever experienced. Surprisingly we saw very few people tip these guys and made sure to compensate for that by giving them a little extra. The pool bar staff also works very hard and we received great service from them as well. The BIGGEST problem we had, however, was the screaming children at the pools. As a mother myself I am always aware of other guests at a hotel and make sure my child is repsectful while having a good time. Most of the kids were well-behaved and having a great time but without exception there was always 2 -3 kids screaming (not yelling or talking loud, but screaming) everyday at the pools while the parents (and in most cases au-pairs) lounged about and ignored them. With two pools there is no reason why they shouldn't designate one pool as "Adults-Only" during a period when there is a school break. We'd suggest the regular Hilton properties in Hawaii, Puerto Rico, Arizona, Cancun, Curacao, or Marco Island before recommending this property. We love Key West but will probably not come back to this property when visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: Tour_de_Spain
Reviews.Content: I must say that reading the reviews of the property helped with my expectations before we arrived to the resort. The service at the front desk by Patrick was very pleasant and he was extremely helpful during our 7 night stay. The room, we stayed in a Flagler Ocean Vista and it was adequate but truly not what you would expect from a Waldorf Astoria luxury collection. The sheets were horrible, but I am a linen snob. My husband and I are very well travelled and have stayed at many luxury resorts, Pebble Beach, Sea Island, The American Club and several Ritz Carlton's throughout the world, in relation to these properties as well as other Hilton properties, in particular, the Hilton Los Cabos, the property nor the rooms are up to par with the aforementioned properties. That being said, the resort was very acceptable and probably the nicest that Key West has to offer. The pool and beach service was far above the other places that I have stayed. Steven, Graham and Jason were especially helpful, cordial and very fun. There was never a worry of not having a perfect place to enjoy the sun. We did not have issues like other posts regarding the housekeeping, they were always prompt and the room was maintained very well throughout our stay. I do agree that the service at the outdoor restaurant was lacking, it seems as if they need to change or add additional staff. We were seated at a table near the bar, the waiter walked by us several times in a 15-20 minute timeframe and kept stating that he would be right back, we didn't wait and ended up going to the bar. The service is much better at the bar but they have their hands full as the 2 people are also making all of the drinks for people at the bar, restaurant, the pool and the beach so I can see why service would be slow and the servers have to cross the walkway to pick up drinks from the bar and take them to the other restaurant seating area. It would seem that something that simple could be resolved. We would most certainly return to the resort and we enjoyed our stay greatly but it would be nice if the resort was truly up to par with other 5 star resorts.

Reviews.Title: “loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: jordy96
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel that we have ever stayed at. They wait on you hand and foot. Loved the pools. If you need something the staff is right there to cater to you. You will pay top dollar for this hotel, but it is oh so worth it!

Reviews.Title: “A few things missing from an otherwise lovely upscale resort”
Reviews.Author: kwnNy
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property, no doubt. beautiful beach, employees were very helpful, room was spotless. there were a few oddities that stuck out as compared to other top resorts I have been to. the layout was strange and our suite, which was a complementary upgrade, had no view. I mean zero. The bedroom faced an interior hallway, the living room a street. I've never been at a beach resort with so little light in the room. And there should be a hot tub. somewhere in the lovely grounds they need to make room for a hot tub. And on our last morning we could not get breakfast.. there was a waiting list for seating for the buffet. which at 9:30 AM is ridiculous at a luxury resort. Figure something out!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service let the hotel down, expect more from Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: HopsonYorkshire
Reviews.Content: We had high hopes for our short break in Casa Marina. Whilst we love Key West, we won't be returning to this hotel or recommending it. The rooms are pleasant enough even if the shower room is a little small. The setting is lovely, right on the sea front. The big BUT is the service has been very poor. If attention to detail makes for great service this hotel has missed that point entirely. Every interaction proves to be a disappointment from trying to hand in some laundry - sent to 3 separate people with increasing impatience - to trying to order a drink at the beach - the waitress took 40 minutes to return with the menu then another 30 minutes before we gave up even trying to pace and order - to finding the coffee hadn't been replenished when the room was serviced, which was supposed to be fixed within 20 mins, we are still waiting. This hotel is supposed to be better than this. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with very poor service”
Reviews.Author: marplalatino
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Waldorf Astoria hotel and we were deeply disappointed by the quality is service. From the valet to the front desk and specially the beach and pool staff, you will be called Bud, buddy, Man, or guy. There is no Sir or Madam to be heard, and no relation to what one thinks of when you her the name Waldorf Astoria. Apparently they do not know how to say please air, excuse me, etc. Overall the service in key west is poor, a place where you can only see old people showing their flabby beer bellies and old ladies screaming under the influence of alcoholic beverages. While the actual hotel is very beautiful, it is the former Henry Flagler estate, and the rooms are comfortable, the service does not justify the very high prices they charge. One expects the best service when thinking of the Waldorf Astoria and instead you only get a souped-up bad version of a Hilton. Stay away unless you want to be treated like a drunk in a slinky bar, but with a very expensive price attached to it.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhh, Just what the Dr ordered!”
Reviews.Author: FNYST
Reviews.Content: What can I say- What a GREAT vacation! I have to say, the weather, food, and views were great, but what made the difference was Jason Jones, from the beach service staff. He treated us like royalty. Customer service makes ALL the difference on a vacation, and these folks get that. Also- Robin at the beach bar-Hats off to her! We will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “A Key West staple; beautiful and beach front.”
Reviews.Author: Moof311
Reviews.Content: An island favorite, clearly the nicest in Key West. Expensive, but I feel worth it. Nice service, good food. Lovely pool, gorgeous sunsets. The rooms with walkout to pools/beach are the nicest. They constantly make upgrades, which is nice to come back to see each year. Really just an all around pretty hotel. All around 5 stars because it is my favorite place to stay every year!

Reviews.Title: “Getaway Trip”
Reviews.Author: cszanino
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Casa Marina. We were able to check in early (11 a.m.) and were upgraded to an ocean view in the old (original) building. Room size was nice - only bad thing was bathroom size - TINY. Our reservation included a complimentary breakfast buffet each morning and it was really good. Food was varied and quite fresh! Loved the omelet station. The pool and grounds were lovely. Enjoyed many poolside cocktails. Billy and Jason at the pool were of great help with activites and local places to enjoy. We rented Sea-Doos from the resort and Matt and Tom C were great guides. We also rented bicycles from the resort (quite the deal) and used them on an off for two days. I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel should have Luxury service.”
Reviews.Author: fabover40
Reviews.Content: Our stay was for 6 days and 5 nights. Overall the hotel is great. The service at the desks and concierge were fabulous. The concierge was especially great, considering they were actually nicer than the regular staff. The Bell hops were also great. Not one frown among the bell hops. It would have been nice to have had the housekeeping service clean the room each day, yet we had to call twice to get that done. And the service outside by the pool was wanting. Having stayed in many resorts, I was surprised to see the wait staff at the pool cater to a few families and only those families. There was one pool person, I think from New Jersey who was telling guests that outside of the hotel he was "the man" so much so that a few people tried to get towels from him and ignored them. Getting service on the beach was a joke. The rule is the towels need to be brought to you, however in one instance the gentleman completely forgot. Then we asked a waiter twice for drinks and never received them. However, the couple next to us was waited on several times during our stay. With the exception of the pool and beach wait staff, the hotel really is the best on Key West. We know now, not to expect towels, so we'll bring our own from the room and we'll go get our own water and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth...”
Reviews.Author: KatieConnecticut
Reviews.Content: From our check-in to check-out, our five day getaway to the Casa Marina was heavenly! Staff, most notably, 'Mark on the Beach' was so gracious, friendly, accommodating and speedy! On our last morning we came down to the beach to find our own chairs already arranged with champagne, fruit and treats waiting for us...a really special and thoughtful way to end our stay! Thank you Mark!! Our suite was spacious and cleaned beautifully each morning. The breakfast buffet was fantastic from omelets to waffles to anything else you could possibly desire! And always service with a smile! We are from CT and Key West, Casa Marina is the perfect 'close' getaway destination. We will definitely be back. In fact I will pining for this place until we arrive again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: BearcatEd
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to the Florida Keys, and we were looking for a place that was on a par with something we would get in Hawaii. I think we found it at the Casa Marina. As other reviews have noted, the rooms may be small and not that impressive. It's an older hotel so you can run into that. I guess for a Waldorf property I expected a little more, especially at the price. But, the pool and beach, and the service on the beach went above and beyond. Mark, Jason, and Jack did a great job, and made the stay truly specal. The setup on the beach is terrific, and the service is top notch. This is only place I've stayed where from the same vantage point I could get up in the morning and see a nice sunrise over the water, and from that same spot see the sunset over the water, as well. It's a great spot, dynamite pool and beach, and a very enjoyable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “No doubt! Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Travelscore
Reviews.Content: Want to stay on the beach, sea view rooms, wonderful food. This is the place!!! This is the kind of hotel you can dream when you come to Key West. Everything is conveniently located: sports, beaches, restaurants and naturally a walking distance from Duval st. Try some nice fried squids and nachos at the bar on the beach, or some local good conch fritters. Unique tropical palms scenario will lead you from the reception to the sea. The Waldorf style at a convenient affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Casa creates relaxation and memories”
Reviews.Author: Gary J
Reviews.Content: Great property especially with the ocean front suites. The place is regal yet comfortable. Excellent service from everyone. Pool staff very helpful. Hilton property so be sure to use Hilton rewards points to save some cash. Concierge staff know everyone and can get you reservations on short notice

Reviews.Title: “Beach Crew Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: TheBirthdayGirl56
Reviews.Content: The Sun Goddess and her parents owe a debt of gratitude to Mark and Jason and the rest of the Beach Crew in blue for making this the trip of a lifetime! Yes the rooms are clean and well appointed, especially the dreamy pillows, the food was yummy, try the medi plate, and the front desk personnel were helpful and friendly, but it was Mark and Jason and the rest of the Beach Crew who truly make the Casa Marina a paradise destination in beautiful Key West! Tell them the Sun Goddess sent you for the eucalyptus and cucumber treatment!

Reviews.Title: “Great location but lacking especially for it being a Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: gwinternetman
Reviews.Content: Hotel is an older, historical hotel that has been renovated. The resort has a great private beach and tons of activities on the property. I was disappointed with the rooms. They were very small and only had 20 inch flat screen television. The biggest issue was with cleanliness, there was an empty water bottle on the balcony. For the price, there are better options.

Reviews.Title: “Stay nowhere else in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Holenhund
Reviews.Content: An outstanding resort in a beautiful setting. Excellent accomodations, service and attention to detail. This place is the poster child for "You get what you pay for," and pay you will. Breakfast and an afternoon at the bar will put you in a new tax bracket.

Reviews.Title: “Super attention to comfort needs”
Reviews.Author: Edjayne
Reviews.Content: There is a genuine , consistent level of care throughout Casa Marina. The Staff is willing and able to serve the needs of the guests. Julian, Melissa and Billy at the beach/pool area, exemplified this outstanding attention to us and to other guests. Thank you Casa Marina. We will return. Edward and Mary Jayne Wilson Darien, CT

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, great staff!”
Reviews.Author: Jessandjohnforever
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in this hotel many times, we always have a wonderful time. The staff is very attentive, the rooms are neat and clean. Our only complaints were: that we were on the bottom floor this last stay and the people in the room above us decided to rearrange the furniture at 2a.m.. (although I can't blame the hotel for this, it's not their fault) and the staff, though extremely attentive and pleasant- they must have stopped by our room 4 times one afternoon. Lesson learned- be sure to put out the do not disturb sign.

Reviews.Title: “Ten days in paradise.”
Reviews.Author: Mary S
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Casa Marina 4 times. We originally stayed at the sister hotel the Reach, then it closed, but we had met such wonderful people that worked there, we foloowed them to the Casa and never left. They have the best two bartenders in the world, and I do not even drink as a rule. Jan and Robin are the nicest people you would ever want to meet. They treat us like family. This year to my surprise they had a very attentive pool boy named Graham. He put Ricardo to shame. that kid hustles. His buddy Steve isn't bad either. Then there is Brent our room servicve gentleman for the past 4 years. Again, just very nice people. I would hire any of them in a minute. Mary The Tire Lady

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Helpful”
Reviews.Author: dgs25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stopped at the Casa Marina to ask about availability and, although there were no rooms available at the time, Patrick at the front desk treated us as if we were the hotel's most important guests. Learning that we had rented bikes, Patrick mapped out a scenic bike route, advised us about restaurants for both lunch and dinner, and offered other suggestions to make our stay on the island most memorable. If Patrick is any indication of the service offered at the hotel, Casa Marina must certainly be a wonderful place to stay. Patrick's warmth and concern made this gorgeous hotel also a welcoming one.

Reviews.Title: “Dated Hotel needs work!”
Reviews.Author: Ed M
Reviews.Content: The grounds were beautiful and kept up well and the staff for the most part was pleasant but not outgoing. We had much better services at other hotels that were certainly not nearly as over priced. The rooms were small and weathered and the elevator leading to our 4th floor room was broken for the first 2.5 days of our trip. I would not go back to this overpriced resort. The one positive was the service at Barefoot Billy's. We took an amazing Jetski tour with John that was the highlight of the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: jennifer s
Reviews.Content: We just returned from this gorgeous hotel, Monday, Feb. 13, 2012. Having been to Key West several times before, we had already seen the "sights" and were perfectly content to stay put in this exceptional property. Every single staff member we encountered had a smile and seemed charged with just making sure we were happy and comfortable, which we were. Some highlights: dinner on the beach with the stars over head, popsicles handed out for everyone on the beach, breakfast buffet (included in our package). Just a great hotel in a fantastic location. Be sure to get a room or suite on the beach. Ours was 1018.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, although not a 5 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingCouple2012
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is a beautiful hotel and our room was very modern and comfortable, particularly since it was located in the older part of the hotel. We were able to hear the couple in the next room talking, so obviously they were able to hear us and listen to our conversations. This could possibly have been due to the door which adjoined our two rooms. The service was phenomenal and the staff helpful and polite. The $25 resort fee automatically added to the room charge wasn't a good deal for us since we didn't utilize the amenities, and we did feel it should be an optional decision. Although the hotel is very nice and the grounds beautiful, we didn't feel it justified a 5 star rating and didn't live up entirely to the Waldorf standards in relation to the room rates versus ratings. However, we would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel and You Get What You Pay For”
Reviews.Author: pnhayden
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel with my Hilton Honors points as this place is much higher priced that I usually spend on a hotel. From the pre-stay emails the service set a pretty high bar. I let the VIP coordinator that emailed me know that we were coming for my wife's birthday. The coordinator made sure the room was prepared for the our ETA with a gift basket of local candies. This was a nice touch. The service from there was only average. The fridge in the room did not work and after a service call it was repaired but never worked completely. We enjoyed drinks by the pool although you should be prepared for a shock when you get your bill. This a Waldorf Astoria and expensive drinks by the pool should be expected. We were upgraded to a ocean view that was pretty nice but the room was VERY OLD, although it had received a recent renovation. The new portions of the hotel had balconies that faced the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous splurge”
Reviews.Author: dineandcook
Reviews.Content: The ambiance, the history, the location make this agreat get away for special occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth $385 a night and don't eat here”
Reviews.Author: djoveges
Reviews.Content: This hotel was certainly not worth the $385 a night I spent here. Check-in was not until 4 pm with a checkout by 11 am. The toilet kept running off and on all night. And the restaurant experience was the capper. After waiting 45 minutes from placing my order, the pork chop was not cooked properly. Pink would have been fine but it was raw inside and that's not safe when you are dealing with pork. I did ask for medium and when I showed the waiter, he graciously apologized, got me a glass of wine on the house and said he would ask the chef to butterfly it. Half an hour later, the rubbery overcooked pork chops came out but I ate them anyway because I was starving. To add insult to injury the chef came out and instead of apologizing and making sure my meal was alright, began arguing with me over what color pork should be when you ask for medium. The good news is that my entire meal was comped and the waiter was as polite as can be.

Reviews.Title: “Walls really thin or the couple next door really loud”
Reviews.Author: Rhonda C
Reviews.Content: Jake and Mark!!! They are awesome The couple next door - Too much screaming at 3:00 am. You could hear the bed banging the wall. Yuk

Reviews.Title: “Location is great, but I will not stay at Casa Marina another time if I visit Key West”
Reviews.Author: 1979v
Reviews.Content: Great location only pro Cons: not kids friendly, last day we had to pay 50$ per hr after 12 since my son was taking a nap. And I really don't think the hotel was full. Felt that we were pushed out. Elevator was broken for 3 days and except " sorry for the inconvenience notice " nothing happen.... 25 $ a day parking fee and across the street you can park for free .... Overpriced

Reviews.Title: “Glorified Motel 6”
Reviews.Author: John M
Reviews.Content: If this was a $100/night hotel, I would've rated it a 2. We booked an Ocean Vista room. The first room we were given reeked of cigarette smoke, (throughout our stay there were smokers on the room balconies, smokers outside while we were eating breakfast) in a NON-SMOKING hotel! The room walls seem to be made of parchment paper (hello, this is Key West) - we could hear the people next door barely murmuring to each other, the shower is tiny, the mini fridge did not work, the bed is so uncomfortable with springs popping out of the mattress. The room was dirty especially the shower curtain (moldy), some of the towels on 4 different days had boogers on them, the bed sheets were dirty, the floors were mopped occasionally - but this simply pushed debris around the floor. We left a note for toilet paper and Kleenex as they were both out, along with our daily housekeeping tip mind you, and the request was not fulfilled - but the tip was taken! Save your money - find another place to stay. On a positive note, the pool/beach staff is very pleasant and very helpful including proposing to make dinner reservations, since the concierge is nowhere to be found.

Reviews.Title: “The little engine that couldn't.”
Reviews.Author: MidwestTracking
Reviews.Content: This Resort is listed on AMEX fine hotels list, basically a joke. Awful beds from 10 years ago, tatters bath towels and rugs, shower that worked 50% of the time on hot water, and mold in the bathroom. I am going to push to get this joke of a resort off the fine AMEX hotel. I would hate another high end member be subject to this place!

Reviews.Title: “A Small Piece in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Ellen D
Reviews.Content: My family's stay at the Casa Marina made Key West a week of paradise! We never wanted to go outside the hotel because the beach, pool, staff, and food were outstanding. The Casa Marina offers great activities right from the hotel which really made my family have fun while getting closer together. The hotel also allows you to rent bikes and kayaks for a couple hours or a whole day. One of my favorite parts of the trip was our family's snorkeling trip (booked through the hotel). For two hours we got to experience the beauties of Key West through this hotel. Our room had a gorgeous view of the water, which most of the rooms do. Although we couldn't see a sunset, the colors in the sky were still phenomenal. We also had a great view of the public beach... which was not as pretty. Also parked right outside the gates of the hotel were a couple of men living in their trucks. That scared some of the younger kids with us. That prevented my family from going to a restaurant nearby, but you learn how to deal. Luckily there is no need to ever go to a different beach. The Casa Marina offers a small but beautiful beach. It was so relaxing. The hotel and staff really went out of their way to make everyoneâ€™s stay more enjoyable, and my family definitely felt like that! There were many good things and some bad parts of our trip to Key West, but staying at the Casa Marina was by far my familyâ€™s best decision. The hotel really made our vacation better, especially having younger children with us. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking about going.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: rpodeschi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I traveled to Key West for the first time in November, 2011. The Casa Marina is a beautiful hotel right on the oceanfront. Our 2-room suite overlooked the water. The room was appointed nicely and the Nespresso machine was a nice touch. The room was always kept in clean order as you would expect. The best part about the resort was the service beach side. Mark and his crew of cabana boys would not let you lift a finger to arrange your lounge chair. They would often come by with drink samples, Popsicles, cold washclothes, and other fun surprises. These guys worked hard to make sure you didn't have to do anything but soak up the sun. There was plenty of sunscreen available if you left yours in the room or ran out. The food at the beach side restaurant was great as well (mahi mahi dip and fish tacos were great). One morning, they had our chairs reserved with our names, some fresh fruit and granola bars along with an arrangement of smaller conch shells. It was true relaxation. There is plenty to do around the resort as well. We reserved a sunset cruise from their dock that was spectacular. There are also games like volleyball, "bags", and such on the beach. A ping pong table or some other games would be nice to add in the future to get you out of the lounge chair a little. When traveling back to Key West, I would definitely stay at the Casa Marina again.

Reviews.Title: “dreadful manager”
Reviews.Author: NPWNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: Hotel is unique in that it is an oceanfront resort away from the action of Key West - yet only a 10 minutes walk into the spirit of the town. That is the good news. The other good news is that the staff is excellent - particularly the pool/beach staff. The management, on the other hand, is shockingly bad. We reserved through Fine Hotel and Resorts, an American Express platinum card 'extra' and have never been treated so badly. Although our room was fine with an excellent ocean view on the top floor - we felt that we were sharing a room with the adjoining room as the door between the two rooms must not have had any sound proofing - or the noise came from the terrace. In any event, when we asked to have a change of rooms the next day we were offered a much worse room on a lower floor with no bath and an obvious down-grade. We choose to stay where we were when we were told nothing else was available (tho the hotel was not full as it was during the week) and the management never had the decency to check back with us to see if the situation improved (we wound up blasting the fan to drown out noise). We were also encouraged to pay for parking which was totally unnecessary as there were plenty of spots around the hotel. Breakfast was plentiful but staff insufficient and had to endure long waits for a table which seemed unnecessary as there were plenty of tables and they just seemed to make everyone wait as they were short staffed instead of letting people sit down and explain that it might be a bit of a wait - although most of the breakfast people were using the buffet, so it really didn't seem to make sense. They also had a grass cutting machine using smelly fuel being used alongside the breakfast area - again - obviously a sign of poor management. Generally the hotel is a good idea - but bad top management -

Reviews.Title: “My Favorite Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: doatsea
Reviews.Content: Beautiful grounds, Beautiful Rooms, Great Views and Amazing Balconies!

Reviews.Title: “Best property in Key West”
Reviews.Author: rhaleuk
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay here. The building is impressive to drive up to. It's not a gleaming 5* but a really high quality beach front property that is a teeny bit shabby cheek but working hard to keep it looking nice. Check in was efficient even though the desk was busy and there were lots of people around. Valet parking is well worth it and you do not need a vehicle here. The first room we were given smelt of smoke so we requested to move. This was handled efficiently and we were happy with the second room. The second room we liked but the safe was locked. We contacted the front desk who sent up security. Sadly someone had left some cash in there but they were very professional about how they handled this. The whole thing was dealt with well and we were happy enough. The room we had (Flaggler Ocean View) was lovely. 3rd (top) floor in the main building. We overlooked the pool and seating area, and yes, had a small ocean view. It was lovely. Windows do not open though. There are two bottles of water a day which are free and a nightly turn down service with chocolates. A nice touch. Bathroom smellies were quite nice too. We had drinks on the terrace which was lovely. Service was poor though and we ended up getting them ourselves from the bar. All these little things stop you from totally loving the place despite what a gorgeous building it is. It's so nice that we noticed it was even included on sight seeing tours. Finally, we booked a Sunset Cruise which rather perfectly departed from the Casa Marinas own dock. How convenient is that. It's a great hotel that I do recommend, but it's VERY expensive and do not expect 5 star service.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Bruno T
Reviews.Content: I had a weekend to kill in Miami and figured I may as well go check out Key West while I'm that nearby. I stayed at Casa Marina which was a pleasant hotel. My first room was a bit noisy (airconditioning units nearby i guess) so I rang and they swiftly moved me and my stuff to a much quieter room. A bit smaller and less beautiful than the first room, but as I was staying on my own and only for 1 night I cared more about the quiet than I did about decor. Service throughout was good, especially front desk, concierge and the beach servers were upbeat, efficient and on the ball. Sunday morning I went out jetskiing and the team there were friendly and helpful. Tom, the English guy who took us on his tour, was excellent. He kept a good pace (fast!), highlighted some interesting facts along the way and kept the whole thing totally fun. In all, a nice resort, nice little private beach, people that look after you and good fun.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat service”
Reviews.Author: Lisa607
