Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Casa Marina for a few days and the service was impeccable. We were very impressed with the service of Billy Boy. He advised us of restaurants, activities and just plain, good friendly conversation. It's people like Billy that will make your stay even more enjoyable at Casa Marina. Everyone was extremely polite and attentive to our needs. We will make Casa Marina a regular stop.

Reviews.Title: “Service in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingDuoVirginia
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay at Casa Marina was unrivaled! The pool and beach staff were amazing, specifically Billy, Sully, and Jason with hourly drinks, towels, popsicles, cucumbers, and even local restaurant suggestions. The sunsets we witnessed from the beach bar were fantastic, and we recommend spending at least one romantic evening eating dinner on the pier or sand. The entire staff greeted us every moment with smiles and were happy to accommodate any request. Our room was quiet and overlooked the beach as well as the incredibly manicured grounds. Truly the BEST SERVICE we have ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed review.....”
Reviews.Author: Shaybird1519
Reviews.Content: For as many great experiences that we had at this hotel, there are equal negative experiences! I travel a lot and always stay at a Hilton hotel(diamond status), but I had never stayed at a Waldorf resort before, so I had super high expectations! I was very disappointed First off, the grounds are beautiful! I could've sat on the beach all day long and Drank the delicious piÃ±a coladas! But the service at the beach and pool were annoyingly slow! It took over an hour the one day to receive the Mediterranean salad. But the service at the actual sun sun bar was impeccable! We did the jet ski tour, captain Matt did an amazing job, we also went snorkeling, even though the weather did not cooperate, chalis did a great job! And then we did the sunset cruise, again the weather did not cooperate, the sun set somewhere behind all the clouds, but the crew on the sebago boat was great! We also got a couples massage in the tiki hut on the beach, my masseuse was apparently a smoker and was hacking during my entire massage. I get massages on a regular basis because I'm a runner..... For the cost of this massage, I expected a much better experience. Not very good at all. The room was meh. Not very clean, we had a patio with a view of the neighborhood/tennis coourts, the maid put a used bottle of body wash on the shelf, I threw it out so that I'd get a fresh one the next day, she dug it out of the trash and put it back on the shelf! Gross! I had to ask for a fresh bottle at the front desk. Our last night there, 8:00 AM flight the next morning...... We had a crazy situation in the hallway with our neighbors from 1230 until 200 in the morning. Apparently, they were both drunk out of their minds, one passed out inside the room and the other wanted to beat down the door to get in. That failed so she broke the glass window. after many attempts! It was insane, I'd expect this at the Motel 8, not the Waldorf! This one is a mixed review for me. Not sure if I'd return to this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service up and down”
Reviews.Author: george9
Reviews.Content: I wanted to take a moment to compliment the staff and management for their attention to one guest at a time and really caring about their guests! Maria was especially helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Pool and Beach Staff Awesome”
Reviews.Author: row_finley
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Marina over Christmas 2011. We cannot say enough about the pool and beach staff - Mark, Max and Mitch. We laid out at the pool each day during our stay. Every hour or so we were greeted with iced eucalyptus towels, fruit popcicles, cucumbers and/or the drink of the day from the pool staff. The pool and beach areas are very clean and spacious. The beach is small but right next to the property is the large and famous Higgs beach. We walked there every day also for a change of scenery. The hotel staff was very accomidating to our family. we rented paddleboards and mopeds from the hotel also which were fun. We cannot wait to come back to Key West and stay at Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: elon91463
Reviews.Content: From the moment we pulled up to the front door to the time we left we had nothing but a positive experience. All the staff were very helpful. Our room was great. It was located in the old part of the hotel on the third floor above the lobby. The room was extremely quiet. Our room faced the pool area. The bed was extremely comfortable. We ate a late lunch by the pool and the food was terrific. Great location. Before we left we started talking about when we were returning.

Reviews.Title: “Good spot”
Reviews.Author: 44Suzanne
Reviews.Content: Nice property with excellent food and terrific wait staff. Housekeeping and maintenace could be improved. The hotel was quick to acknowledge a shortfall and provided a complimentary gift which was very thought full.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline K
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel on the water, wonderful pools. Staff from the Bon Bon and Beach Crew were fabulous and made our trip even better. Loved the eucalyptus towels, cucumbers, and special drinks. Special thanks to Will, Kevin, Scuba Steve, Tyler, Steven, Rob, Patrick and Elle. Caroline at the Front desk was extremely helpful. They are all an asset to the hotel. Can't wait to do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel for key west.”
Reviews.Author: Mikebrez
Reviews.Content: Key West is a bit run down, but its a party island city. casa marina is one if not the best here. The outside restaurant, pool area, outside lounge are amazing on the beach. The rooms are a little dated, but only a little. I went over last minute because i was upset with the service at the crowne plaza. They only had a standard room one night and a high tier suite the second. the worked with me on the price of both and made it very reasonable for the situation. Everything inside is small and limited. Everything outside is the opposite, go when the weather is good,

Reviews.Title: “JET SKI TOUR”
Reviews.Author: Jason S
Reviews.Content: Matt was fantastic!! he is definitely an asset to the company. His knowledge and attention to the customer was awesome!! If you choose to do this trip ask for Matt. He is the man!! we had such a great time and would do it again in a hearbeat.. Thanks Matt for the great experience

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: Imunn
Reviews.Content: Great place to go relax! Bartenders outside where great and lots of fun. If you want anything at the beach, look for Jake or Billy. Jake took care of us everyday with a wonderful set up on the beach, one day he even had iced down champagne for mimosas! Billy will hook you up with names of local bartenders so you have a great experience on Duvall st! Fun!

Reviews.Title: “overcharged and upset”
Reviews.Author: thomas f
Reviews.Content: when we first arrived in the room it smelled like mold and mildew.we went to the windows to let fresh air in but the windows were painted shut.we asked the male bellhop for air fresher.he found some for us the next day.then it was so cold in the mornings in our room.. when we put on heat it did not work.it was really cold in there for two days.then when i got home i received my credit card bill with a extra charges on there.when we called them about the charges they said it was for smoking in the room.it was a charge on jan.8 and we had checked out on jan.7.we don't even smoke,it must have been the mildew and mold smell !!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Threepudds
Reviews.Content: Contrary to other posts here, the staff of the Casa Marina was fabulous. We did the breakfast every morning we were there & it was always fresh and wonderful. We were smart enough to book w/breakfast included & were glad we did! The rate was reasonable, our room was clean & nicely appointed, loved the nespresso machine! We had no view but truly, who cares? You're in Key West people! Special shout out to Graham, he installed us on the beach in no time & made our stay enjoyable. I had a facial @ Spa laMare & it was worth every penny. All you whiners, stay somewhere else next time. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “So Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: FMcFS49
Reviews.Content: We recently were at the Casa Marina for my son's wedding.The entire weekend was perfect. We hosted a luncheon for family and wedding party that was amazing. The service was impeccable, the food was delicious-the staff was so accommodating. We had the luncheon on the beach and just thoroughly enjoyed it. The wedding, reception, and breakfast the next day was every bit as perfect as the luncheon. Reina and her staff handled everything so well. The facility is so lovely and well maintained, private beach, away from all the craziness of Key West but close enough to get to on bicycles. Can't say enough about the Casa and their catering staff. Amazing,lovely, magical experience. Many thanks for a job well done!!!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in January”
Reviews.Author: PeterJ08
Reviews.Content: If you want a piece of paradise go to the Casa Marina in Key West. I've been to many fine resorts but this one is off the chart. Have a "Pina Colada Day" !

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina now on HHonors”
Reviews.Author: roadmax
Reviews.Content: Everything top drawer. It's on the south side of the island which is important because when the northers come through, pools and beaches on the north side get cold winds. Staff seems happy to work there and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Casa away from Casa”
Reviews.Author: JoshPierce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay here every summer for our anniversary. Great location, and with their own pier and water sports rentals you can book a great snorkeling trip and never have to leave the resort. The pool / beach staff are awesome. They are always attentive to your needs. The resturant food is ok, there are much better resturants all over the island. The best ammenity is the private beach and swim pier. One morning we went to the pier and there was a school of 20-30 tarpon under the pier. We grabbed our snorkeling gear and swam with those fish all day. What a treat! Yhe breakfast is a bit over priced for what you get, but we splurge on our anniversary. Overall the Casa Marina, is a beautiful resort property and we have yet to have a bad experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great time all around.”
Reviews.Author: gamble696
Reviews.Content: Great location, private beach, nice outside bar, two pools, excellent breakfast, girlfriend and I had an excellent time at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel on the water”
Reviews.Author: Bryan M
Reviews.Content: Great hotel right on the water, concierge was helpful in booking spear fishing trip with Key West Sea Life charter! Nice pool and courtyard. We love it and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Alright, but not Waldorf service”
Reviews.Author: mader12
Reviews.Content: Christmas in Paradise? Almost but not close I expected a five star service â€“ after all it is the Waldorf, right? Well, five star in my vocabulary starts with â€œHow was your trip down here, had you have a pleasant travel?â€� and a â€œWelcome to the Hotelâ€�. Instead we got a â€œWhat is your name?â€� and â€œWe need a credit card.â€� Ok, you say, this can be neglected, I agree, I can, not important that the receptionist is not doing a proper job and you just about to start a wonderful vacation for a couple days over Christmas. So we sorted out the formalities and found our room, but what a surprise the room was almost as big as a closet and we werenâ€™t able to tiny window even a little bit â€“ so back to square one, asking for a new room with a window that can be opened. After a â€œlet me see what I can doâ€� and an oops I hung up on you we got a new room, not bigger, but most certainly with what we liked. So much about checking in into paradise in a five star hotel. Not bad, but could have handled much, much better. Breakfast is ok, almost everything you are looking for, eggs, omelet station, cereals, etc. it makes you happy and full. But give me a break â€“ from one day to another the charge for breakfast increased because they serves salmon!!!!!!!!!!!!!! This is hideous, smoked salmon is on every five star breakfast buffet without an extra charge. Then on our last day, my husband switched to eating oatmeal, they charges us $3.00 more â€“ this time the server forgot to mention this to us when we orderedâ€¦. The excuse, â€œWe changed the item in the cashier, but the menu is not updated yet.â€� Daaahhhh, you do this simultaneously. Housekeeping is slow and not so accurate, donâ€™t be surprised, if there is still hair in the shower or the floor isnâ€™t swept after you return from the pool, at least you do have fresh towels and the bed sheets are changed â€“ or worse the room isnâ€™t even made and you have to hunt down the manager on duty to complain and beg for someone to come along. My tip for housekeeping, reception, and service would be to have a meeting with the guys from the pool area. They are fantastic and make your stay a five star experience. Popsicle, ice-cold hand towels, refreshments, and excellent towel service â€“ with a friendly attitude. They make you feel welcome, they make you want to stay and relax. So bottom-line, it was no major event that affected this rating, just the little things that add up â€“ the Waldorf has a reputation and this time it could not meet my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “It was the best of times, it was the worst of times...”
Reviews.Author: buzzgator
Reviews.Content: The Good: We just returned from a great 3 night stay in Key West. I must say that this hotel has all of the beauty and location that would rival any world-class resort. The grounds were immaculately kept, the swimming pools were sparkling and refreshing, the beach area was as good as anything you'll find in Key West. The view across the pools, the manicured lawn area, and the coconut palms elicited memories of Hawai'i. The pool/beach staff was attentive and friendly. The Bad: The service was not at all what I have come to expect from the Waldorf. We stay at the Waldorf Astoria in Orlando about once a month and have become accustomed to their incredible service and gracious hospitalilty. When we checked in, the desk attendant seemed indifferent. I am Hilton Gold and am used to just a little more courtesy at check in. One evening, we called down for room service around 10 p.m.. The person who answered the phone seemed annoyed that we called and, after I ordered, she told me "All we can do is pizza". There is no excuse for that in a high-end resort. The maid service was equally bad. The maid would be knocking on the door at 8:00 am to clean the room. If you weren't willing to be up and out of the room by that time, they didn't return until close to 5:00. The Ugly: The rooms are definitely old and certainly nothing special. We were in the "historic" part of the hotel. Our room was supposed to be an "Ocean Vista" room but the view was right into the leaves of a cluster of palm trees. No ocean to be seen without bending. The rooms were small and the walls were paper thin. You could hear things going on three rooms down. There was no DVD player or in-room movies. There was a big, long, black hair on one of our bath towels and it just didn't have a really "clean feeling". The carpet in the hallways, the elevator floors, doors, walls were all dirty and hadn't been maintained. If this were a Holiday Inn, I wouldn't have thought anything about it, but once again this is supposed to be a Waldorf property. Overall, the positives (the location and outdoor facilities) outweighed the negatives for us and we will return to this hotel. I just hope they will make improvements in the service and cleanliness of the interior.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: mea h
Reviews.Content: While on a business trip to Miami Beach I decided to extend my stay and take the drive to Key West for a short vacation. The Waldorf Astoria was everything I was looking for in quality, comfort and location. The service was exceptional from the pool "boys" to the surprise fruits and sweets turn down greeting upon my arrival. I love all the history surrounding this hotel and would encourage anyone visiting to read the book provided in the room to truly appreciate what a marvel of engineering it was to build the place

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not for a Waldorf property”
Reviews.Author: smeyler
Reviews.Content: Good resort location in Key West. Rooms are very average (think typical Hyatt/Marriott/Starwood property). Adequate, clean, comfortable but not the level one would expect from a Waldorf property. Very comfortable location, pools, beach, beach rentals all close by. Great for a corporate conference as facilities are great for that type of thing. Better for couples than families.

Reviews.Title: “amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: carol6681
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest places we have ever stayed! Did the jet ski around the island and Mark was such a wonderful help! He even recomended some nice spots for dinner! We ended up booking our daughters wedding there as it really is a beautiful spot!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Paradise.”
Reviews.Author: Snuggleyed1
Reviews.Content: While on a business retreat in Key West, my wife and I chose to turn the opportunity into a vacation. We have traveled all around the world, but the service at The Casa Marina was truly exceptional. The sand beach is laiden with hammocks, and the "Beachboy" crew of Bilky and Jason who cater to your every whim. Absolutely fantastic resort experience!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice!”
Reviews.Author: Jackie R
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we stayed at the Casa Marina and overall it was pretty nice. When we first checked in we were disappointed in our ocean view suite but we're immediately moved to a new room with a MUCH better view. The rooms were pretty cozy. We just wished the balconies were larger. This is one of the few hotels in Key West that truly has an awesome, beach, pool, outdoor bar and restaurant area. The views were breathtaking. We rented bikes and a scooter through the hotel. Matt and John were great to work with and provided awesome customer service!!! Wish we could of stayed longer...we will definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Picture Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jeanine B
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this resort. Whether you want to spend your time laying on the beach or running around the island this is the place to stay. The staff went over and beyond what I would consider their job responsibilities even going as far as to out and get a board game we wanted to play while sunning on the beach that we couldn't find (thanks Billy!). When dining outside of the hotel the staff was able to recommend places to go, make reservations and set up transportation. Our room was gorgeous with a view of the oceon and easy beach access. Thanks to all at this resort for making this vacation such a memorable one. We will be back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wow Wow Wow”
Reviews.Author: Chris F
Reviews.Content: What an unbelievable experience! The hotel staff, in particular the concierge and beach staff (Billy and Jason), were very attentive to our every need, and went out of their way to make our stay the best we have ever had at any hotel. The hotel and hotel grounds were absolutely stunning. See you all next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: HappyTraveler1961_12
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our first trip to Key West. We decided to go there to celebrate our 20th wedding anniversary. As I did my research on where to stay I was not sure if it would be best to stay on the north side where most of the shopping, restaurants and night life is located or stay on the more quiet south side. We chose the south side and the Casa Marina and it was the best option. Key west is only 2 miles wide so even though we were on the other side of the action it was a short cab ride or nice walk to get there. In fact as I toured Key West and some other hotels during our trip it was clear to me that the Casa Marina was the best hotel to stay. It has the best beach and pools in Key West and all the water activities you would want are right at the hotel. The hotel has a long rich history and has that historical charm but has been recently updated so the facilities were in great shape. I am a tough critic when it comes to cusomer service and I have to say the service from all the staff was exceptional. A special call out to Bill and Jason at the beach and pool. They were always right there to make sure we were comfortable and were always asking us what they could do for us. Cheers to the mgmt there...they hire the right folks and train their people well. We loved it and will be back for sure. Not sure I would bring young children there because the crowd is a bit older and quieter and I know my kids would have been bored. But Key West would not be my first choice for a family vacation. But if you are looking for a laid back get away with a loved one or a group of adults with access to exceptional restaurants and fun night life, Key West is great fun and the Casa Marina is a great place to stay and enjoy the day by the gulf.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Boys”
Reviews.Author: Dave M
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina in Key West is beautiful, clean and very efficiently run. The staff is friendly and helpful â€“ especially Billy and Jason â€“ â€œthe Beach Boysâ€� I would choose Casa Marina again.

Reviews.Title: “In need of Customer Experience Training”
Reviews.Author: Mia L
Reviews.Content: Overall the resort itself and the location is great. The pool/beach area is great but don't expect to swim in the water unless you use stairs off the deck. The one disappointment for us was some of the staff. The pool staff was great. The wedding coordinator - a bit of a tone issue. The check in staff could be more friendly. The standard line when you check in and your room isn't ready is that it will be in about 30 minutes. Keep asking and you will get the same response but from different people as they seemed to rotate significantly from 2-4:30. One even told us that the people before us paid for a late checkout at 2:00 so the room was not clean yet. It was now 4:30. I guess he overlooked that we paid for a 4:00 check in. Trust me here - we are far from picky and travel a lot, so we know issues can come up. All I am highlighting is how they handled the issue. There was an "I don't care attitude" from many at the front desk. The best was waiting and watching people check in without a problem and others even come down and ask for a room change due to excessive noise. Oh, and ask to see a manager in hopes of an explanation - not going to happen. They never even came out to see us. So, that being said if you can overlook most of the inside staff, the resort itself is great.

Reviews.Title: “Mark Rocks”
Reviews.Author: Gwen N
Reviews.Content: My family just had a great week in Key West. Casa Maria gave us an awesome view, great walking access to anything we wanted to do, a great fitness gym and all the little perks that made it all the more special. Hammocks to lounge in, cucumbers for the eyes, a welcoming staff who were fun, responsive and a wealth of knowledge about the island. We totally enjoyed ourselves, definitely plan to come back and will recommend it to all our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great service in paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Dan K
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great! We took a guided wave runner tour of the island with English Tom and John- they were both great hosts!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: txlitigator
Reviews.Content: I traveld down to Key West for a destination wedding at this hotel. I've been to the Caribbean before and I am taking into account the more laid back lifestyle down in that part of the world. I am HHonors Gold and was told I'd been "upgraded" to a Flagler Ocean Vista Room. When I arrived I was assigned a room that can best be described as a closet. It was odd-shaped and barely big enough to fit a bed and dresser. After bringing this to the front desk's attention I was assigned a larger room. The room was very sterile and "cheap" looking. It was not well arranged and the furnishings appeard to be of low quality. The chair even had what appeard to be a blood stain on it. The flooring was advertised as hardwood but looked to be of cheap laminate. I was able to hear snoring coming from the next room. The pictures on the hotel's website show a rug under the bed but that wasn't the case in any of the rooms I looked at. The shower had cheap looking ceramic tile and the lavatory/basin appeard to be corian. The common areas of the hotel were not well kept either. The carpets in the corridors were worn and stained. The walls had scuffmarks on them. It's not that the hotel was bad but it deffinitly was not worth the price and didn't live up to the Waldorf Astoria brand's hype. I've stayed in several regular Hiltons, Doubletrees and Marriotts that were furnished nicer than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Such Potential - Very Disappointing (HHonors Diamond)”
Reviews.Author: Kevman123
Reviews.Content: Overall we were very disappointed with our stay at the Casa Marina. Itâ€™s a shame to see a property with such potential fall so short; especially in service and cleanliness. Everyone at the property was so friendly but was just not able to follow through with simple customer service requests. See the list of pros and cons below for more detail. Pros: Beautiful pool and beach area While the staff is not responsive, they are at least friendly Excellent soaps, shampoos, lotions, etcâ€¦ Decent location â€“ about a mile from Duval St. and restaurants Cons: Motel like rooms â€“ VERY sterile and poorly appointed. Furniture is cheap and in poor repair Staff does not follow through with requests. For example, we asked for a properly functioning iron twice and it was never replaced during our stay. Long hold times when contacting the front desk â€“ when/if they ever returned to the phone. Super loud rooms â€“ you can easily hear conversations in adjoining rooms; even footsteps. Housekeeping starts slamming doors nonstop at around 9:00 each morning. Ice buckets were not emptied; no liners available. Coffee was never replaced; I had to search for someone in housekeeping to get coffee each morning. Shower produces a stream much like a garden hose No attention to detail. Many public area windows and doors were so dirty, people began writing their names on them and they were never cleaned during our stay. Internet is so slow itâ€™s virtually useless â€“ barely fast enough to pull up email No movies or on demand options available in the room Diamond HHonors Benefit: Free drink and appetizer in bar (Thatâ€™s it!)

Reviews.Title: “Great key west experience, high end resort with a beautiful beach and hammocks.”
Reviews.Author: oceanseekerDC
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for romantic getaway or for families- the beach activities and pools are great and so is chilling in a hammock with drink service on the beach. Close enough to walk to all the Duval street activity. ~1 mile to center and 1.7 to Mallory square at the far end, with plenty in between. We never took a cab or biked, fun to explore different streets walking around this tiny island. In the other direction there's a great jogging/ biking trail that goes along the public beaches. Must get an ocean view room here though! A bigger resort than I'd usually choose, but it still felt quiet and intimate. Staff were all super friendly. Be sure to use do not disturb card if you're not an early riser- they start knocking for room cleaning at 8 am.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed! I just don't get it.”
Reviews.Author: EastCoastDoug
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria brand has got to quit relying on their legacy to carry them along in today's competative market. When traveling to a new destination, the challenge of selecting an appropriate property can be daunting. Often times, you have to put a little trust in past experiences and the reputation of a particular brand or concept. In the case of Casa Marina, that rule of thumb does not apply. I go to great lengths to insure that my reviews do not evolve into a ranting or venting session. However, with this particular property my level of disappointment is so great that a neutral list of pros and cons is difficult. The natural setting of the property is simply stunning. The pool/ beach area is well manicured and a perfect place to relax and catch an amazing sunset. The rooms, on the other hand are very sterile/cold; creating an institutional feeling. The furnishings are modest and pseudo-modern (Ikea like), giving off a "cheap" impression. The absence of carpet (ceramic tile) lends to an acoustical nightmare. Sound carries terribly from room to room and from hallway traffic. Simple telephone conversations, running water and snoring can be easily heard from adjoining rooms. Footsteps from the rooms and hallways above create a bass-sounding thump that can awaken the most sound sleepers. The wireless Internet is painfully slow, which is compounded by the poor 3G mobile service on this part of the island. Overall, there is a severe lack of attention to detail. There is no "wow" factor. Staff is pleasant, but not responsive. On two occasions, there was no follow through from the front desk on requests. Common areas need cleaning and general operational maintenance. Windows in corridors were so smudged that guests had begun writing their names on them. General (somewhat minor) in room housekeeping oversights were experienced daily. In an effort to be as fair as possible, I revisited the Waldorf Astoria website to gauge the appropriateness of my expectations... "The spirit of each extraordinary experience is inspired by the history and heritage of the destination, and executed with the elegant amenities that grow the Waldorf Astoria legacy." This quote could not be further from the actual on-site experience with this property. In addition, I also considered the self-proclaimed laid back customs of the Island. however, in the end I decided that an overall brand expectation should trump, or perhaps enhance the local culture; not be used as an excuse for a sub-par experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: shireen b
Reviews.Content: The resort is beautiful. The staff are very friendly. Improvement is needed in communication between staff members. Overall, a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Unsanitary Conditions”
Reviews.Author: BL758
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel as a diamond member and was mortified to find a used, blood-stained bandaid on the bathroom counter of my upgraded room. I was promised some extra favours to make up for this disgusting mishap, which never happened. You may have a better experience at the Hyatt, this hotel looks nice, but it is completely unsanitary and apparently the management's philospophy at this hotel is to lie to guests if something is unsatisfactory.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort with helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: tk4books
Reviews.Content: We booked with Hilton Honors points. Our room was a Flagler Ocean Vista, and we were fortunate to have a room right by the elevator facing the ocean. The view could not have been better! We arrived at 12:30, and Patrick called an hour later to say our room was ready. The only negative thing is that we went to the restaurant to eat while waiting for our room, and at least 6 servers walked by without offering a menu or asking if we'd like a drink. We left and walked to Salute! to wait for our room. It's less than 5 minutes by foot, and the food was very good. The bathroom is very small, but it wasn't a problem at all. The two doors were actually quite cute. The shower was large, but the water pressure left something to be desired. The blow dryer was under the sink behind the towels. It's a wonder I even saw it. Everyone we encountered acted like they were truly happy to have us at their hotel. My husband did the Barefoot Billy's jet ski tour which he enjoyed. I didn't mind paying for valet parking after seeing the nightmare of trying to park in Key West. There was a note with our keys that they waived our resort fee which surprised me since we aren't gold or diamond honors members. I had great wifi by the pool which I wouldn't have even know but I got a video call from my daughter on the iphone. The resort was full but I didn't feel like I was at a full resort. The rooms are very soundproof, too. I was thankful for the free fruit water, and the pool was comfortable. The elevators are really tiny! It wasn't a problem, but it surprised me. We took a cab to Mallory Square and walked back by way of Duval. It wasn't a bad walk at all. I highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “For the $$ It should be better”
Reviews.Author: Joe7575
Reviews.Content: I too travel for work and use points at places like this. It amazes me that the more you spend at a hotel the less you get. The Wordolf is supposed to be the premeire of Hotels. Nice as it is ther are some negatives. This is not my first stay at this property but my first experience with dog poop on my patio balcony. The owners of the dog in the room next door could care less about policy and let the dog roam free between balconies. The hotel did not seem to object either. My opinion...dogs do not belong in hotels and this hotel seemed overrun with them. Service was subpar in the resturants. Only one server was worth the tip that was extended, a pleasant girl from Jamicia. The excellent food made up for the lack of knowledgable servers. They all seemed to be refugees from the cruise industry. Second stay and again the room was not what I requested and I could not be accomdated due to fullness of the hotel. Overall it was a pleasant experience and one that I would repeat despite all the negatives I wrote. Again Patrick was great in what he does best. Customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Hope management reads this one!”
Reviews.Author: kfacpa
Reviews.Content: I cut an pasted from my Yelp review and ran over with negative comments by a thousand or so. Room not ready at 5PM on check in. Dog CRAP on our back patio not cleaned up for almost a full day. Wireless is useless my 4G hotspot is better! Great location Great facility, terrible service. No on premise restaurant. Breakfast buffet a joke! As for 2 egg white omelets came back 10 minutes later she's just starting and whole egg omelets.. I ask for do over and come back 10 minutes later and she hands me 1 egg white omelet and I ask here where's my wife's omelet and she looks at me like I'm a moron and said she was just too busy... $25 resort fee includes us of pool!!! wow the pool... the internet is worthless and the fitness is a joke with old broke down equipment!

Reviews.Title: “living the life!”
Reviews.Author: KellBellHocking
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property on ocean with fabulous staff. Relax in a hammock, in a chair by pool, or on the cute little beach. Excellent customer service and attention to detail. We had a small issue with room, but Evelyn assisted us as soon as there was availability (after 2 nights) and our room was fantastic! Next time we stay, I would prefer ground floor with patio. We are staying 10 nights and think location is great...off noisy street and away from crowds. Got rental car and parked on street...no need to pay for parking. We ask where locals like to go for dinner so we can get best food at best price...you can never go wrong with locals. Steven the pool guy sent us to Stock island to hogfish grill and bar and we r going back a few more times.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Young2by2
Reviews.Content: Last year I stayed over 110 nights in a hotel for both work and pleasure. After all that travel I have found two new people to list as the perfect example of Customer service. They both share the exact same name. Patrick...one works at the front desk and one at the pool bar/restaurant at the Casa Marina. Simply amazing is all that can be said about both of them. Their example of customer service is why people stay at a Waldorf Astoria Property. Only two negatives. The internet did not reach our room (194) and you can hear EVERY thing that takes place outside in the hallway in this room. I would not want to stay in this room again. The positive is that our room was immaculately clean and the housekeeping staff were very friendly and nice. The bed was very comfortable and the A/C did a great job keeping the room at the temperature we wanted. The one thing about this resort that I loved is that I could just lay in the hammock on the beach and listen to the waves crash against the shoreline..... heaven..pure heaven....

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation--excellent service, gorgeous views and beyond expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Mcp2012
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this hotel for a mini-vacation after the Ragnar road race~~ 10 groups altogether. Traveling with so many, I was concerned not everyone would be happy with our choice. In the end, none could be any happier. The views from the foyer are spectacular and immediately pull you into vacation mode. The rooms are simple (modern) and comfortable. Would recommend requesting ocean view & one with balcony. The icing on the already robust cake was the beachside service. Mark took care of our every need~~ including beach chairs prepped when we arrived with unique shells, fruit, customized signs for each runner, and champagne. To top it off we were regularly spritzed to cool down, had sunglasses cleaned and cucumber and eucalyptus treatments--what a treat! And all of his efforts made relaxing with a large group seamless & utterly enjoyable. Thank you casa marina, your staff, and mark~~ we will all be back soon!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Time In US Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BRoerig
Reviews.Content: Stayed over the New Year at Casa Marina in Key West. The hotel was sold out as probably many people wanted to escape the cold up north. While some have complained about this property before, one must remember that despite this being in the U.S., it is a tropical island "attitude". Things are done slower here and if you have that frame of mind you will have a great time. The Sunset Bar was great - Nathan and Suzanne were wonderful bartenders who handled the large crowd as well as could be expected given the busiest week of the year in Key West. Anna and Judith provided massages on the beach - which if you haven't tried it, is worth the investment. Prices are up a little from a year ago ($130 for a one hour table Swedish massage), but you will leave relaxed after zoning out listening to the palm trees sway and the ocean waves come ashore only 30 feet from your table. Greg also is on hand to help, as there are up to three table available (under tents) to get your massage. Maria at the front desk was as pleasant and helpful as usual. She is a manager there now and always seems to have things under control. I went by the front desk a few times and no one seemed to be out of sort... Pool service by a young lady who's name I forgot was a little disappointing, but a quick trip to the bar to see Nathan or Suzanne took care of things quickly. Come to relax and enjoy the island, and you will have a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Pas digne de son statut”
Reviews.Author: fifoufilou
Reviews.Content: La chambre que nous avons eu Ã©tait du niveau de ce que l'on attend d'un bon motel mais insatisfaisante pour un hÃ´tel de ce rang, le wifi fonctionnait trÃ¨s mal (pas assez de bornes pour assurer un bon rÃ©seau), la plage n'est pas trÃ¨s agrÃ©able (cailloux lorsque l'on entre dans l'eau) et il faut s'en remettre Ã  la piscine pour se baigner ou alors faire attention. Le lieu en revanche est magnifique, la vue est superbe et la plage est trÃ¨s bien amÃ©nagÃ©e (avec des hamacs).

Reviews.Title: “Waist of money, honey!”
Reviews.Author: travelwithfun77
Reviews.Content: This place should be a convent! The rooms are small, cold and ran down. I have no idea how they call themselves a resort. We came there at 6p.m. and there was absolutely nothing to do. The pool closes at sunset. There is almost no lights outside, no music. People with kids were very disappointed. The area around the hotel is not so good, we did not feel safe wandering around with a kid. We bought a room through Priceline and they sell standard rooms. We found out that the standard rooms are in the old building FACING PARKING LOT!!! If I have known that, I would not even go for this deal. Parking is expansive, breakfast is nothing special and very expansive, internet is expansive! Get a room somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “You've been warned ...”
Reviews.Author: Chris B
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went to this hotel to celebrate New Year ... We had read about this but it seemed liked a full service resort and with the Waldorf brand it seemed perfect. We were wrong. First, when we checked in they put us in a room that had been previously occupied by a smoker. I am very sensitive. After no help from the front desk, we managed to get the manager to agree to move us. The next room seemed fine- until we realized we couldn't really sit on the balcony as people were smoking outside all around us. We asked if there was a non-smoking area but were told there was nothing. Wrong again! First, you could absolutely her everything from the next room and from upstairs. The alls seemed so thin (if a hurricane hit I worry it would just blow away!) Next, all the furniture seemed pretty scuffed- I'm not sure when they remodeled but it is certainly time again! The bed made horrible rattling and squeaking sounds if you even moved a little on it. Neither of us got any sleep- and not for any reason other than the bed made such a horrible racket. Lastly, while I know it was the holidays, the room was never made up - after being out all day we had to call the front desk to ask for the room to be serviced! I will give a couple of pluses- their private beach and pool areas were lovely. The staff at the restaurant and bar was very gracious. And it is a relatively good location with easy access to the heart of Key West. But other that hat- I would advise staying away. I should add we love kids and the other people we met at the resort were quite nice ... But for the rates they charge the quality should be on a different level. Why the Waldorf would attach their name to this resort? What could be next for them-- a motor-lodge off the interstate?

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a Waldorf?”
Reviews.Author: cpal0567
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 8 days between Christmas and New Year. Loved the location and the beach. Enjoyed water sports and cruises...Matt and English Tom very helpful. Daily attention at the beach and pool with all the extras provided by Patrick, Graham and Mark were awesome! Hotel decor, especially rooms, were tired and small. Could have used a better selection of food outside. Would stay there again because we enjoyed outdoor areas so much.

Reviews.Title: “Want to go again...”
Reviews.Author: ymid
Reviews.Content: So Key West in December is pure heaven. I think I could have stayed in a tent on the side of the road and been just as happy but add a great hotel to the trip made it unbelievable. Great service met us as we drove up in our F250 big beasty truck. We decided to self-park as it was cheaper and the parking lot was right next door woith plenty of space. We checked in and the bell hop took our bags. I already had read about hte rooms so I knew the two wings on either side of the hotel were not as nice as the main building rooms but they were also cheaper. The rooms were small but had a nice decor and was comfortable. We had a walk-in tile shower and a sitting area. Water and expresso was included in the $25 resort fee. The best part of the whole trip was Steve and Steven, the pool "boys". They both took great care of us, seeting up the loungers, an umbrella, frozen scented washcloths, popsicles, and Bloody Marys. They both made the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: inish0wen
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my family and can only recommend this hotel, it was good value, the staff were courteous, the food was great. Ideal way to see Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel has come a long way”
Reviews.Author: gingeralang
Reviews.Content: Since the Waldorf Astoria has taken over the resort is very nice. Staff is great food is very good. Rooms are nice but could use a dresser for clothes. All clothes have to be hung . Rooms are a bit small. The grounds are really nice. I would highly reccomed a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Mark T
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week over New Year. Good points first. There is a very nice, private beach with just about every facility you could wish for, including night dining barefoot in the sand. Also there are two pools which are pretty good to lay out at and swim in. Now the not so good. The hotel is located a mile or more away from the main joints downtown in Key West. Secondly, there isn't much to do near the hotel so be prepared to cough up for taxi / pedicab / parking etc. (Neither of these are the hotel's fault of course). Last the bad. The room rate is very expensive and the incidental charges are eye-popping. Try $12 for a pot of coffee at breakfast, $18/day for self-parking, $16/day for WiFi for starters. Drinkable wine is 10 bucks a glass, and breakfast for a family of four will run you over a hundred - that's assuming you are prepared to wait 20 minutes for a table, as I was gleefully advised by quite the rudest greeter I've ever met. You know who you are - the ugly blonde with the surly face - I suggest you find a different line of work such as issuing parking tickets as you seem to delight in making things difficult and unpleasant for others. Our room wasn't up to scratch, with broken tiles and slap-dash decor. With the sofa bed up, you can't get in and out of the main bedroom. And the toilet blocked constantly. The constant noise from weddings and conventions was a pain. New Year's night was a wash-out - the bar staff closed up and fled at 12:10. Service was appalling. Our room wasn't ready after our four hour drive and we were just told to naff off somewhere and come back in an hour. Lunch would take 30 minutes to arrive poolside. You'd be lucky to finish it before the seagulls bomb you for it. I was quite disappointed considering how much we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant”
Reviews.Author: MidwestAlpinist
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina resort is a beautiful property. They did a great job with the renovation. The lobby and grounds are gorgeous. The rooms are nice too though the traditional guest rooms are pretty small (300 ft) for the price. My only other complaint is that the resort is pretty far from Duval Street. If you plan to spend a lot of time there, as my wife and I did, then you might consider a hotel that is a little closer. Cab fare to/from Duval St is $8-$10...

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: Lou34439
Reviews.Content: Love this resort...excellent services, delicious food, beautiful pools (2) walking distance to attractions such as Southernmost Point-90 miles from Cuba.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive family motel not a luxury resort”
Reviews.Author: CrazyHoneyBadger
Reviews.Content: The Casa is undoubtedly in a fantastic location. Our room had uninterrupted ocean views. However, having visited a lot of 4-5 star hotels this is by far the lowest in terms of standard. Cleanliness around the hotel is really poor ( the elevator in the ocean block was flithy for our entire 5 night stay) staff aren't particularily helpful or enthusiastic ( with the exception of Mark at the pool who was brilliant - super helpful and attentive) and food is really pretty poor. Our massage at the Casa 'spa' was very odd ! In a small, noisy, converted hotel room next to the car park our supposedly relaxing massage was interupted by a car alarm, the noisy family in the room above and the therapists phone going off ! Certainly not what I would have expected of a hotel of this supposed rating. Very much an expensive family motel, not the luxury resort we were expecting.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing.....”
Reviews.Author: Janice D
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this property 3 times now, but will not stay there again. I had booked 2 adjoining balcony rooms but was told at the front desk that I had been "bumped" because we were only staying 2 nights and it was the holidays. They offered compensation of 1000 Hilton honor points, which amounts to nothing. The women at the front desk was rude (Patrick is the best, most attentive person working the front desk) and the young lady keeping our room hates her job and acted put upon for having to service our room. As previously stated, I have stayed there twice before and liked it. They are "dog friendly" or use to be.....they have changed the rules so it is a hassle to have fido with you, due to the hotels heavy restrictions.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking hotel”
Reviews.Author: Neroguess
Reviews.Content: Food great , service great , very clear, staff great ,top draw hotel

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service and Facilities”
Reviews.Author: Leslie M
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are incredible, especially at the pool, they will set up towel/chairs at the beach and pool in minutes. Great location only a 10 minute walk to the town. Beautiful historic hotel with modern addition. I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We loved the CASA”
Reviews.Author: cohen2000
Reviews.Content: This was our first time to the CASA and first time in Key West. It took a day or so to orient ourselves but once we did, the CASA was a great experience. The staff could not be any nicer. Everyone is always upbeat and ready to answer any questions or make suggestions when asked. The grounds are spotless and the beach is beautiful. We are going to make our 2012-13 reservations soon.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: jamie F
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at the Casa Marina with our extended family of 10 (kids and adults). The resort is breathtaking! The views are amazing and the staff was wonderful. A special thanks to Mark Gray at the beach for being so wonderful to us and all of the kids. His extra effort really came through and made our vacation even that much better. We can't wait to come back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel with a lot of History!”
Reviews.Author: AJ_Seahawk
Reviews.Content: Ventured down to Key West, Florida with a few friends for a long weekend. Casa Marina did NOT disappoint! Lots of options to hang out at the hotel but the real fun is located in the city. Recommend a Duck Tour that provides a lot of history about Key West, including the Casa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “Barefoot Bills at Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: mjurjevich
Reviews.Content: Matt and John are awesome, Barefoot bills is a legit spot which totally makes the resort.

Reviews.Title: “A GREAT CHOICE FOR FAMILIES”
Reviews.Author: Lisa K
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is a 30 minute walk, or a 10 minute bike ride from the action in town. The pool area is beautiful with plenty of lounges and 2 pools. The hotel is located on the beach and you can partake in parasailing, jet skiing, surfing and the like. The concierge is extremely helpful and I booked yoga on the pier which was very relaxing. My kids (13 and 10) parasailed and we rented bikes for a reasonable $15 each for 24 hours. The staff at the pool is very accommodating and Scuba Steve goes out of his way to make sure that everyone gets the local lowdown. He volunteered some great beaches for our drive back up to Miami. The rooms are standard. The breakfast was reasonable and delicious. Try the oatmeal brÃ»lÃ©e! Should I return to Key West, I would surely stay here again.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Southern Pines, North Carolina, United States
Reviews.Title: “Pampered in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Jeanne Z
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our Christmas stay at Casa Marina. The staff is efficient, friendly and very accommodating. Our room was very comfortable with luxurious bed linens and views. The grounds, pool and beach is just gorgeous. A special thanks to Scuba Steve, Mark and Justin for making us feel like royalty. They have achieved excellence in customer service! This is one vacation that we can't wait to repeat! Jeanne & Bob Z.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at Casa Marina Beach Resort”
Reviews.Author: Claragail
Reviews.Content: This was our second time to stay at Casa Marina. A beautiful resort. We want to thank Mark manager at the beach and pool area. He went out of his way to please. He has great ideas and makes your stay even more special. Also thank you to Max, Mitch, Steven and Justin for working so hard to make our stay so special. Putting out our lounge chairs everyday, always asking what they could do for us. We felt we made new friends, because they cared and gave so much attention to us and others at the beach area. They are a PLUS to Casa Marina. We are there to relax and get away from everyday stress and they couldn't do enough to make our stay so special. Mark has a great staff and he is there to make sure all needs are met. We will return back to Casa Marina again. We love Key West. Thank you Casa Marina for making another vacation so special. The weather was so beautiful for December. It was hard to go back to cold weather and snow.

Reviews.Title: “Best Poolside Service anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: JAN72222
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a number of top notch beach resorts in the Caribbean, Hawaii and around the world, including Ritz-Carltons and Four Seasons. Casa Marina outdoes all of them when it comes to poolside service. Scuba Steve, Steven and the rest of the crew are super-attentive and do the little things that any other hotel could offer, but doesn't. Ice towels, sunglass cleaning, popsicles, drink of the day samples, activities for kids, and more. We had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Good property, disappointing rooms/service, not pure luxury”
Reviews.Author: reviewguy
Reviews.Content: Waldorf Astoria should evoke pure luxury - but this property disappoints. The good: lovely grounds, location, public spaces. Efficient check in. Loved the contrasting dark wood with white stone everywhere. The rooms had no open windows at all! The bathrooms were TINY - I mean really tiny - less than 6x8 feet! The showers could have been better (adequate thats all) - there were no bathtubs. Mattress was TOO springy. Just not acceptable. Nespresso machine did not work (was replaced instantly). Phone speed-dial buttons for services did not work (never fixed). But good powerful air conditioning systems. Make sure you dont get a connecting room. Very little sound insulation or privacy for that matter. Asked for a kettle - never got it or any kind of response that it was unavailable. Asked for a package to be delivered to the room - it took a second phone call a day later to get it. Pool concierge services were good but one individual made it clear that he worked for tips (not cool!) Pool bar (Sun-Sun) staff were efficient and good. As were most of those at the staff at the restaurant (came across one with a bit of an attitude...) Overall the stay was ok. Though absolutely not at par with a Four Seasons or a Ritz Carlton. The staff is not attuned to taking care of you to ensure a great experience. They do their job, reasonably well. I cannot help but compare my present stay to a recent Four Seasons holiday. If you are redeeming your HHonors points, its probably worthwhile. If you are paying - consider several other options in the vicinity. (Did not get to compare the services at The Reach, their sister property, sadly - even though guests have equal signing privileges at both locations.) I wont be returning anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Second time in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Hannah N
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay here at the Casa Marina Resort and need we not say that both stays have been amazing! The poolside service is great and there is never a shortage of someone wiling to set up a chair and umbrella or bring you a beach-side drink. Different from our last stay, we decided to take a jet ski tour of the island which was perfect! Not only did we receive an educational background of Key West and some of its history, but we also had so much fun letting loose and having some fun with the jet skis on the back of the island. None of this would have been possible without such helpful and intriguing tour guides, Tom and John! We even have a complimentary sunset silhouette photo on the water because we took the 4:00PM sunset tour--definitely recommend that, it was the perfect time for the tour! PS- we love Tom's english accent! ;)

Reviews.Title: “icing on the cake”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was very nice. The room was also very nice. The grounds were beautiful with the pools and the walkway to the ocean. But when we sat down in our pool chairs and Mark came by, that was the icing on the cake. He gave us cool towels, offered us pop cicles. He even said i will clean your sun glasses. No where have we stayed and been treated like royalty. We will recommend the casa marina resort to all our friends. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Awesome day in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Stacey V
Reviews.Content: We started our day at the beach. We had excellent pool side service from Max. He was very attentive to our needs, and came back to check on us throughout the day. We took the sunset jet ski island tour. We set it up through Mark who was extremely considerate and helpful finding the right tour for our family. He even loaned his wetsuit to my wife who was concerned she would be cold. Tom and Joe gave an excellent tour around the island, and were extremely safety conscience. They really knew what the were talking about, and taught us a lot about the beautiful island.

Reviews.Title: “We're so glad Mark is Back!”
Reviews.Author: nckeysgirl
Reviews.Content: My husband surprised me with a long weekend over the holidays. We arrived at the Casa Marina later than we expected. Check-in couldn't been smoother due to Patrick's efforts and attention to detail. Happy to say due to time restrictions we had to eat at the hotel and were pleasantly surprised to find the food greatly improved. Glad we had dinner there! We were so happy to see Mark on the beach and were so impressed that he actually remembered our names and even joked about a couple of things from our last stay! What a great guy. My name on the beach is "Sun Goddess" and I really do feel like I am one with Mark's attention. With the drink of the day, fresh fruit, clean sunglasses, chilled cucumbers for my tired eyes, and the frozen eucalyptus towels I had a wonderfully rejuvenating day! We absolutely hated to leave the beach; however, Mark's recommendation for dinner spurred us on. Again, we were not disappointed. In today's world where customer service seems to be a lost art, we commented to each other at dinner that Mark should be teaching others the art of making people feel welcome and appreciated, but we selfishly want to keep him on the beach for our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family vacation- my favorite place in the world!”
Reviews.Author: MaraPMaryland
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending our second Christmas at the Casa Marina in Key West. First one was in 2005, everything was even better this time around. The staff, the Christmas Eve dinner outdoors, by candlelight, the pampering on the beach -- daily popsicles, cold cucumbers for the eyes, icy cold towels for cooling, sunglass cleaning, all provided by friendly, outgoing, WONDERFUL staff. All of us (including our 23 yr old and 18 yr old daughters, and 13 yr old son) had a perfectly wonderful time. We WILL be back for certain. Love, love, love it here! And just a short walk away, down Simonton Street -- great little restaurant - Camille's -- local gem. Key West is pure delight -- beach during the day, glorious sunsets from the beach at Casa Marina, then a nice walk to Duval Street or Simonton for fabulous food!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: annapolissailor
Reviews.Content: We just spent six wonderful days at the Casa Marina. I'm almost afraid to say how great this little piece of paradise is because I would like to keep it our own secret. The property is the best in the area. Our room was very nice and everyone was so friendly and helpful. The beach staff are amazing especially Marc Gray! He could not do enough for us! I can't wait to come back. Nancy L.

Reviews.Title: “Simply perfect”
Reviews.Author: Joia30
Reviews.Content: Stayed during Christmas. Room was huge, clean and comfortable-separate sitting area. Hotel's public spaces, pool area and outdoor breakfast a pleasure. Pool attendants were splendid- offering misting, complementary cool drinks and fresh towels with a big smile. Great choice for a family holiday celebration.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Service”
Reviews.Author: cttmj
Reviews.Content: my family just got back from a 5 day stay at the casa marina and once again the trip was wonderful. We have been going there for years and the service has always been great. Mark and all his coworkers do a excellent job with the beach service. They come around and clean your sunglasses for you along with providing you chilled neck towels, drink of the day sample and popsicle. We also did the jet ski tour and had a wonderful tour guide.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: AmandaG21
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Casa Marina for a week in December and it was glorious. The one most noticeable thing is the STAFF!! All of the staff is extremely friendly, setting up lawn chairs, towels, serving food and drinks, and giving wonderful suggestions on where to go and what to see in Key West. We had amazing experiences specifically with Scuba Steve, Mark Gray, and Jon and Graham as well! If you visit Key West, stay at the Casa Marina - it's the nicest resort on the strip by far!

Reviews.Title: “poolside/beachside attendants”
Reviews.Author: pamfarless
Reviews.Content: my husband, daughter and i spent thanksgiving week, 2011, at the casa marina ... it is a lovely hotel that offers an "old florida" feel to its guests ... we were particularly impressed with the attention that we received from graham and john during our time under the umbrellas beachside .... they were mannerly young men with lively personalities ~! they enhanced our time at the beach with good conversation, attention to detail and quick response to our requests .... they are a credit to the resort ... we love forward to visiting again .... pam farless

Reviews.Title: “MARK on the beach made our vacation”
Reviews.Author: Marv12
Reviews.Content: Mark made our trip he treated us all like sun goddesses he out services any other hotel he is the best thanks mark and steven

Reviews.Title: “best place to stay in key west”
Reviews.Author: forrest73
Reviews.Content: just got back from xmas in key west and loved our stay at the casa marina. this is a picturesque resort on the small island of key west and in our opinion the best place to stay on the island. from the gorgeous resort grounds to the beach, our stay was very relaxing. the service all around the resort was also great and the food was expensive but pretty good by our standards for a hotel. its at the southern end of the island so a bit of a walk to the main area (duval st) but not bad at all. parking is kind of expensive at $18/night (self-park) but overall we thought the resort was a great. would def recommend this place and looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time”
Reviews.Author: JoyandDennis
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Casa Marina in December. What a classy, yet relaxed, hotel and environment! We really appreciated the staff's focus on customer service and their friendliness. The beach was very clean and accessible, and the hammocks provided a nice place to relax after a day of activities. The pool-side staff were outstanding, providing food, drinks, towels, even cucumber eye soaks, all the while chatting us up about our trip and what was available to do/see in Key West. When our car got bombed by ripe fruit downtown, the valet staff even provided materials for us to wash our car. Perhaps because of the week we chose or the high-end nature of the property, the crowd was small at most any place on the property. The only downside of our stay here was the cost of the food on site - but that just encouraged us to get out and try the local restaurants. High-speed wi-fi internet is included with the resort fee package. We'll be back...

Reviews.Title: “best customer service”
Reviews.Author: terri7694
Reviews.Content: The customer service at the Casa Marina is superb. The staff is friendly, helpful, and absolutely determined to make sure you relax and enjoy youself. Every request was met immediately and surpassed expectations. Special kudos to the beach crew; Max, Mitchell, Steven and Mark, you guys ROCK!!!! Also, to Tom at Barefoot Billy's. Amazing how he can remember names from a five minute conversation two days prior!!! My room was exceptionally clean and well furnished. The bed was very comfortable. I was a little disappointed that the walls were so thin. I could hear my neighbor's television and their children jumping on the furniture. I could also hear the bathroom noises of all of my neighbors. Apparently the food did not agree with one of them. That aside, the resort is breathtaking, the staff without equal, the food and drink amazing. I would definately come again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Awesome place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Neikah
Reviews.Content: Loved this place, service was great! The place was awesome, our room was very pretty and had an amazing view. We did the jet skii tour which was sooo much fun. Matt, Thomas and Antonio are super nice, patient, fun and knoledgable. Casa Marina is an amazing place, the only thing that needs a little more work is the Spa, wish it was something as nice and private as the gym. Overall our stay was fantastic and we'd do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Service staff are great”
Reviews.Author: 335Bill
Reviews.Content: Great experience at the pools. Max took care of my family from the moment we entered the pool area until we left. He was friendly, polite and energetic with a sincerity that goes beyond good training. He booked us on the sunset sail which was the high point of the trip! Very comfortable, great crew and an amazing sunset. The crew of Ryan and Benson were fun, capable and made everyone feel at home quickly. Highly recommend! Check in was lack luster and would have been fine for a Hampton Inn, but was not the wow experience I would have expected at a Waldorf. Bar service was excellent! Staff were engaged, efficient and friendly. Great service!

Reviews.Title: “Resort at best”
Reviews.Author: jeruk85
Reviews.Content: Casa is hands down the best resort in town. The property is well maintained and the staff is well trained to accommodate your needs. The private beach and two pools allowed us to stay within the hotel property. The front desk was very helpful in giving us a late checkout even though the hotel was completely sold out. Everyone went above and beyond their duties to make the guests happy.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Southside Mike from Indy
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to Key West and had a really nice stay at the Casa Marina. We read many of the hotels reviews before our trip, and I would say most of the comments were right on. We've also stayed at their sister property, The Reach, and it can't hold a candle to Casa Marina, so don't get fooled into staying there....it's really like a glorified Courtyard or Hampton. Come on Hilton....isn't it time to lift that "Waldorf" moniker off The Reach? Really? Most of the positive comments we read gushed about the pool staff at the Casa Marina, and for the most part they didn't disappoint. "Scuba Steve" comes around and offers cucumber slices for your eyes, which we didn't partake in, and offers great popcicles, which we did. We did set by the pool for three hours the first day and never had one waiter offer to bring us drinks or food.....which was odd. I finally went to the restaurant and ordered a bucket of Coronas, and it took twenty minutes for them to bring it to us! They have two pools, one chlorine and one salt water. Lots of chairs around each, and we were always able to find three chairs by moving some around. They have lots of chairs and hammocks on the beach as well. The pools are refreshing....not too hot or cold. We did find it strange that they don't have any type of hot tub on the property. The maid service DOES happen at different times of the day, but it is very good and the rooms are cleaned very well and the staff does a great job. Our room was always cleaned and straightened by the time we came back in the afternoon..usually around 4:00. The maids bring bottled water each day and provide fresh espresso refills for the coffee makers. We were concerned that we would miss being on the more "happening" end of Duval Street, but this turned out not to be the case. We rented bicycles for the entire five day stay, and they served us well, and we rode them to breakfast and dinner each day, usually skipping lunch to snack by the pool. There are many quiet side streets in Key West and it's easy to ride to most destinations on the island and bypass heavy traffic. It seems like there are more people on bicycles in Key West than people in cars, but Truman Avenue, Duval St. and others can be busy and congested. Try to avoid those if you aren't real comfortable on a bike. We rented our bikes from A & M on nearby South Street. Their bikes aren't as nice or new as some other rental places, but they provide flashing lights for the front and rear of the bikes, and were willing to work with us on a weekly rate. There are many restaurants within a mile of the hotel, and you can easily walk or ride bikes or scooters to most of them. We went to Blue Heaven for breakfast and dinner, Santiago's Bodega, Seven Fish, Flaming Buoy Filet Co. Columbian Grace for dinner....all were great, but Columbian Grace wasn't as good as last year. We also went to Sarabeth's, Pepe's, Banana Cafe and Camille's for breakfast...and they were all great as well. Pepe's would probably be my favorite. It doesn't look like much from outside, but they've been there since 1909, so they must be doing something right. There is one thing that bugs me about Casa Marina. Anybody can access the pool and beach at the hotel....you can walk in off the street and grab a chair at the pool and have yourself a fine time. I really think they should provide guests with wristbands or some other form of identification to keep non-guests from accessing the property....for securities sake if nothing else. There are gates on the end of the resort where they rent jet skis and other water activity equipment....but sometimes they're open and sometimes they're locked and you need a key to enter. Since ours was a points stay, the "resort fee" of 25 bucks a day was waived for us, which is nice. I'm not sure what that fee covers, but it seems stiff to me, and we were grateful we didn't have to pay it. All in all a great, historic hotel that pretty much lives up to the hype. We plan on returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best poolside/beachside service on island”
Reviews.Author: bfernathome
Reviews.Content: The stay was fantastic, but it was Steven and Mark at the poolside that made the stay worth while. Steven has a fan for life in our son, whome he entertained with kindness and enthusiasm. The best!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accommodation, Location, Amenities and Staff”
Reviews.Author: cbbt10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a few nights for a trip to Key West, enjoyed my stay here and recommend it to friends. I found the various sites of Key West (southernmost point, Duval St, Mallory Square, Truman Little White House, etc) to be walkable from the hotel - but I do like to explore by foot . The hotel had great accommodations - pool, dining, hang out spots, water access, and gym. The hotel was knowledgeable of the area, upbeat, sociable and courteous, despite being fully booked during my trip in July 2011. The rooms were contemporary, well laid out, clean, and comfortable. One suggestion - park down the street toward the water (Seminole St, I think) and walk 30 seconds instead of paying for hotel parking. Keep it up Casa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “Best Anniversary Trip Ever”
Reviews.Author: Mary R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Casa Marina from December 15-18th for our anniversary. It was an AMAZING weekend, and one we won't soon forget! The staff at Casa Marina is absolutely fantastic. They are professional, but very friendly and helpful. From the minute we arrived to the moment we left we were treated royally! Patrick checked us in quickly when we got there (a very special Thank You to Rebecca Atkins for our room upgrade!) and we arrived at our room to find champagne chilling with chocolate strawberries. (Thank you Rebecca and Kaitlyn for our surprise!). Our balcony was a welcome spot every morning to enjoy espresso and watch the ocean. We had some wonderful meals at the Sun Sun cafe, but we spent most of our time at the resort pool where Mark spoiled us rotten! He was always friendly and attentive - but without being pushy or overbearing. On our last morning we went down to find his special surprise: our beach chairs were all set up with towels, and personalized with our names. He had starfish seashells on both chairs, and set up champagne flutes with fruit. A bottle of champagne was chilling on ice for us to celebrate our last day there. We love the Casa Marina. Thanks to all of you who helped make our anniversary so special! We can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Top spot in Key West”
Reviews.Author: GDP33
Reviews.Content: All round great experience nicely balancing the old world charm of the renovated main building with extensive amenities and modern architecturally sensitive extensions. The service is genuinely friendly and efficient yet the resort retains a laid back island atmosphere. The whole property is orientated to make the most of its beach setting (rare in Key West which does not have many beaches). The rooms are tastefully decorated and spacious - our ground floor room had a porch from which we had an unobstructed sea view. Wifi is available in the room and there were no problems connecting. The biggest plus was the resort's private serviced beach - although swimming is difficult due to a rocky and uneven sea bed the beach itself is a beautiful palm tree lined sandy strip. Breakfast was excellent. Evenings are for going out and the peaceful resort appears to go to bed early ensuring a perfect night's sleep. If you are in the mood to party I would suggest nearby Duval Street (too far to walk but an ideal bicycle or short cab ride away) where you will find plenty of bars. Bicycles can be hired at the hotel and, having explored most of the island, I am convinced this resort is the best the island has to offer if you are contemplating combining a cultural trip with some relaxation by the sea/pool side and watersport.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Wedding”
Reviews.Author: Scott R
Reviews.Content: We took our whole family to the Casa for our wedding this past november...... Could not have had a better experience! The staff at the pool, Jon, Graham, Robin, Dan "the Man" and Jan exceeded ALL of our expectations!!! From having everything set up in the morning, to making my bride to be feel like a queen on her wedding day. Cannot wait to return! Thanks for the perfect wedding trip Scott and May

Reviews.Title: “Amazing customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Brenda M
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina has provided amazing and consistent customer service. Everyone is friendly, from the concierge to the bar tenders. Several people really exceeded our expectations. Steve, who provided our pool side towel service, was informative, funny and very charismatic. Tom and Tom, who provided our jet ski tour, made us laugh while learning some history of the city. These three gentlemen took our trip from great to fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “What a GREAT beach experience in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Mark W
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I traveled to Key West with a large group of friends in December, 2011. There were 16 of us in total. One of the most enjoyable parts of our stay was the fantastic service received while enjoying the resort's beach. Mark and Steve R (Scuba Steve) and Daniel provided us with rock-star service on the beach during our entire visit, making sure our every whim and need was met. If you want to be pampered, stay at the Casa Marina and hang-out on the beach! Thank you Mark, Steve, and Daniel!!! You guys are absolutely the best. You made the beach our most-enjoyable part of our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Beach”
Reviews.Author: nfetingas
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Casa Marina Waldorf from December 7-14, 2011. It was excellent. We had a great view of the ocean and beach (room upgrade). Our room had a lovely balcony where I sat every morning. The rooms were equiped with an espresso maker which was very nice. My favorite part was laying out on the beach. The Cabanna guys were awesome and made it very special. I'm pregnant and they would not let me lift a finger!!! Mark (beach guy) surprised my husband and I with orange juice (for me) and a mimosa (for my husband) one morning. He had our spot all set up and decorated with beautiful shells. It made me feel very special. The beach guys even came around to wash your sunglasses and handed out frozen towells. I would highly recommend this hotel. Overall it was VERY clean. I always saw people cleaning the walks. Most Key West hotels do not have a beach. If you like to relax beachside this is the place for you!!

Reviews.Title: “Best service on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: MadBeachDuo
Reviews.Content: I have never been so pampered on the beach. Mark welcomed us with a smile and helped our group settle in with chairs, towels and umbrellas while we enjoyed our Hobie Cat rental right there on the property. Next he came by with a cool mist and cleaned our sunglasses. We were already wowed and impressed and the pampering continued with Mark and Scuba Steve bringing us frozen towels, popcicles, ice water, the free drink of the day, and even cucumbers for our eyes. Daniel delivered a variety of fun drinks and a yummy lunch and took good care of us. If you want some beach time on Key West stay at Casa Marina and enjoy the private beach and the great team of pamperers.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the extra charges!”
Reviews.Author: AnnandBob
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel with a rich history (don't miss the in-room book on its history) with an excellent location and fine amenities like a beach. But it is not first class--e.g., no turn down service, small room with contemporary (read "sparce" furnishings) and spotty housekeeping, but I can compliment its choice of good bed and sheets.
