But the all-inclusive "resort fee" doesn't include $18/night SELF parking and, with our upgrade fee for a view and Key West's tourist taxes, our room was fully $100 more than we paid at booking time.

Reviews.Title: “Completely recommended !!”
Reviews.Author: RM3011
Reviews.Content: We just spent our last weekend here .. and what a shame - wish I had a lot more time at hand to stay back!! Wonderful resort, great location and best of all - the beach and pool area is amazing as mentioned by other travellers. Proximity to Duval street is another advantage. I think the chief advantage of the hotel are the amazing staff - our check in by Max was very smooth, the lady at the concierge was very helpful and knows a lot about "where to go" , and then staff at the pool and beach are simply awesome. We took a jet ski tour around the Key West Island - completely recommended if you are a water enthusiast - great way to see the place and go at high speed along the waves!!

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend to worst enemy!”
Reviews.Author: CasieClark
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this place to my worst enemy. We are currently staying here and today it rained. My husband and I were heading back to the room but all of the ground outside is ceramic tile. My husband slipped and fell because anyone knows ceramic tile turns into a slippery mess when wet! Two seconds after my husband fell a woman also fell. Workers came over and asked her if she was ok but did nothing for my husband who is currently bruised and banged and in a lot of pain. They obviously saw that he fell because within an hour there were two wet floor signs. One where the woman fell and one where he fell. Our day was ruined because he was too sore to do much. The people working here are so inconsiderate. I would think a hotel that had any sort of class would have done whatever they could have to make sure he was ok. I would switch hotels but haven't because of how sore he is and I am six months pregnant which would make moving too great of a hassle. We would never return and recommend anyone looking to stay here find somewhere else!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Frankie N DeLis... W
Reviews.Content: We have been to Maui, Bahamas, and Dominican, but found the Key West area to be more friendly and relaxing. Casa Marina is not the ultimate resort, but was nice. The proximity to Duval Street and other attractions made it a great stay. Patrick Ritter was our daily beach attendant and did a wonderful job making sure that we always had everything that we needed. I would suggest asking for him by name if you choose this resort.

Reviews.Title: “What a way to be pampered”
Reviews.Author: SDTraveler01
Reviews.Content: This is the life. Just a couple blocks from Duval Street, but feels a million miles away. First, itâ€™s a beautiful, historic property built in 1920 which has recently undergone a major, multi-million dollar renovation. But for us, the highlight was the beautiful beach and beachside service. The staff made us feel like royalty. Mark greeted us with a smile, towels and chairs, and came back to spritz us with cool water and even clean our sunglasses â€“ mine have never been so clean! We rented a Hobie cat for the afternoon, which was wonderful, and when we were resting afterward, Scuba Steve came by with thinly sliced chilled cucumbers for our eyes â€“ SO relaxing. Then someone even brought us complimentary popsicles, which was quite a treat (not sure who â€“ still had cucumbers on my eyes). Our server Daniel was extremely friendly and attentive; we had a casual lunch and drinks on the beach â€“ everything was so fresh and tasty, but I think my favorite drink was the blackberry mojito w/ fresh blackberries, mint and a sugar crystal swizzle stick, although the pineapple mojito w/ fresh muddled pineapple was a close second. The â€œsparklingâ€� mojito made w/ champagne was pretty amazing, too. Alas, we leave Key West today, but are already looking forward to when we can return to the island, and to the Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Edna E
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is thee place to stay in Key West. It is located on the Atlantic and the view from most rooms is refreshing. You choose to hang out by one of two pools or the beach; no matter what you choose the service is Devine. The staff under Mark Gray spoils you rotten with free cocktail samples, cucumbers to sooth your eyes, herbal cloths for your face, fresh water and lunch/beverage service anytime you desire. Be assured you will not regret is fabulous hotel and all the wonderful amenities! Don't forget beach massages; they are the best!

Reviews.Title: “Service at pool and beach area”
Reviews.Author: Dennis E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is an amazing experience. Most impressive to me was the service outside the hotel by the beach and pool area. In particular, I'd comment on a guy named Mark Gray. Mark seemed to be the guy in charge of the service provided the customers by the beach and pool. Mark saw to it that our time was totally enjoyable. I always tip servers and appreciate them when they are good, but Mark exceeded my expectations in every way, and I plan to return to the Casa and he and the staff he works with are much the reason.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: cderreberry
Reviews.Content: This hotel was an amazing experience in every way. Every single staff memeber was great, the hotel reacted to every question and request in a way that demonstrated their committment.

Reviews.Title: “amazing place”
Reviews.Author: lerpat
Reviews.Content: loved every aspect of this hotel, took our kids and grandkids for my 60 th birthday, the hotel room was clean and comfortable, the pool boys were amazing, took care of all your needs, they went over and above, put seashells and balloons on the chairs, had afternoon activities for the kids, they loved it, the restaurant is excellent, the beach was very nice, loved renting bikes, all 11 of us rode everywhere, perfect location, will go back

Reviews.Title: “Lastminute.com result”
Reviews.Author: Thespaniard_11
Reviews.Content: We turned up without a booking and ended up having a great stay. Good beach, great rooms and all the staff were very friendly - esp "scoobie-Steve" - the second most important person on the beach after the bar-man!

Reviews.Title: “Staff and decor was excellent”
Reviews.Author: OnlineRestaurateur
Reviews.Content: Stayed over for a quick business trip. Had dinner at the hotel's restaurant on beach. Manager Fernando went out of his way to make sure we had a great meal.

Reviews.Title: “wish we could've stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: CentralCoastJo
Reviews.Content: We were only there for one night but it was lovely. We had the two bedroom unit which had lovely views and two bathrooms. The main bedroom was lovely and quiet and dark. The 2nd bedroom was a loft style room with own bathroom. There was also a sofa bed in the loungeroom. The next morning we went on the jet ski tour with 'English Tom'. EXCELLENT. He was very patient as we went with my 11 year old son and it was his first time on a jet ski and didn't mind that we tagged behind at times. We were lucky enough to see some dolphins as well. Definitly recommend the jet skis and ask for Tom.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is going downhill.”
Reviews.Author: Gloria0203
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the casa marina. My husband and I stayed here a few years back and it was much better. The hotel now caters to weddings which leaves them short staffed for the ones staying for vacation. We were disappointed with our stay this year. Our room was never cleaned in a timely fashion. We would sometimes come back at 5 pm and the room was still undone. The staff is too busy catering to the wedding party and the guests. The rooms also need updating. Not worth the price anymore. There are some nice B&B I will look into on my next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, rooms OK.”
Reviews.Author: lostinoside
Reviews.Content: We loved the location of this hotel. Our room was on the first floor with a nice patio and view of the ocean. However, the beds were squeeky, the air conditioner was loud and the cleaning crew was a bit rude. They cleaned our room at 4:30 in the afternoon. When we needed to get in to change for a dinner reservation, they were less than helpful. Be sure to preview the room before you agree to it. Some rooms are definately better than others. That being said - the pool staff was AWESOME - not only did they take care of us poolside, but they also helped us plan activities for the day, find great places to eat and gave us advice about Key West. Overall, I think the Pool Concierge was top notch - Thanks Scuba Steve!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Robert M
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed there for a week in November. The staff was the most friendly & acommodating group we could ask for during the stay. I want to mention several "outstanding" employees: Chris, Max, Patrick & Marcia at frontdesk, Edrico & Marcello, our servers at pool area-Graham, Tyler, Kerry, Scuba Steve & Steven and last but not least, the jet ski staff-Matt, John and Joe. Each and all the other staff made the stay enjoyable. When have already made our reservations for next year at the MOTM.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mike S
Reviews.Content: We came here for our honeymoon and couldn't have chosen a better place! It's got a great beach and all the amenities you would want from a resort. The food was amazing, we had room service breakfast for almost every day we were there! We also had an amazing buffet for Thanksgiving dinner! It had everything you could possibly ask for from Turkey to crab legs to an omelette bar! The place looks taken care of and modern. We had a great stay. Just about our only complaint was that when we arrived, we were told our room was ready but when we got up to our room, it was still being cleaned. Patrick at the front desk took care of us right away though, he got us a room with a better view and got us some comps! Later that night, a bottle of wine and a letter from the manager of housekeeping was delivered to our room...very nice surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SophiavdB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed mid-Thanksgiving week and loved the Casa Marina. The room was spotless (we enjoyed the Nespresso maker), the sheets were crisp, the pool beautiful, sunsets from the dock etc. We would have stayed longer if we could have.

Reviews.Title: “Just sit back and relax!”
Reviews.Author: tnsl
Reviews.Content: We were at Casa Marina for a conference the week before Thanksgiving and extended our stay for an extra day in the end to take advantage of all that this hotel has to offer. Even 1 day here was so great and refreshing that it felt like an actual long vacation! All the employees were both very friendly and professional. The service by the pool was amazing!! They have thought of many small details, and all those little things add up to make your stay a great experience. Besides the things that are mentioned to be included in the resort fee (like free popsicles being served at the pool), every once in a while, employees were walking around offering to clean customers' sun glasses, someone was offering sliced cucumbers to put on the eyes, and even adding a little face massage. We also had this great server, Onur, who was always there when we needed anything. All in all, this is an amazing place to stay, lay back, and relax. It is a little on the pricey side, but for the value you get, I think it is justified.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Jim P
Reviews.Content: The beach at Casa Marina may be the best on Key West. The entire waterfront area is wonderful with two great pools and bars. No hot tubs though. The staff cited there had been "problems" with hot tubs. The rest of the hotel leaves much to be desired. Our "suite" was motel style and not worth the price we paid. If you can, get a Grand Ocean View room, the view and balconies are far superior to the suites and the nightly rate is less. The landscaping was well maintained but the rest of the hotel is in need of some power-washing and paint. The staff were unprofessional, borderline rude and disorganized. Spa al Mare was even a bigger waste of money than the suite. We did a couples massage. The masseurs were unskilled and clumsy. The room they do their spa treatments is just one of the guest rooms with white sheets hung over the walls. Your alternative is to get the massage next to one of the bars on the beach. Overall, I would not recommend this resort, unless you're going in just looking for an average hotel on the beach. If you're expecting Waldorf Estoria service and not just price, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks giving vacation”
Reviews.Author: ben g
Reviews.Content: While hanging out on the beach at the Casa Marina beach we had the greatest host ever. We were continuously pampered with a verity of different treats to keep us cool and comfortable under the sun. Thank you for a great beach staff and especially Steven he made our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Massage at the beach”
Reviews.Author: K S
Reviews.Content: I loved getting a massage by the beach!!We will come back on Summer time now!!I loved even more the service at the bar: Robin...you rock!!Thank you soooo much for your attention with us!see you soon....

Reviews.Title: “Dog owners and "Waldorf" level guests BEWARE!”
Reviews.Author: Carol H
Reviews.Content: At check-in to this supposedly dog-friendly resort, I was handed a paper stating the pet policy. It informed me that pets are not allowed to be left in our guest room unattended. Further, pets are not allowed in any of the restaurants or bars, even outdoors, or at the pool, pool deck, beach,or health club. That means that you can't take your dog with you to sit on the beach, have a meal outside, or even walk around at the beach or pool area. Since you can't leave your dog in the room when you go out, you are virtuallly unable to use the facilities of the resort. When I asked two assistant managers where I was supposed to leave my dog, they looked at me with blank faces. Even worse, I had been in frequent email contact with Caroline [--], concierge at Casa Marina, about bringing my dog. She had assured me the resort was dog friendly. She sent me a list of dog friendly restaurants, which included SunSun at Casa Marina, and made a dinner reservation for us. It is on the beach with tables widely spaced. As it turned out, dogs are not allowed. For non-dog owners, this hotel is in a beautiful oceanfront setting and the service is generally good. However, our oceanfront rooms were not up to par; they were small and bare bones. The bathrooms have no shelf for toiletries, no towel bar outside the shower, very poor lighting, get steamed up(no exhaust fan), and have a fixed glass half-wall that requires you to get into the shower in order to turn on and adjust the water tempurature. The tiny fridge was missing its only shelf, so we had to call for a replacement. The espresso maker didn't work and there was no regular coffee maker or microwave. The desk lamp didn't work. The balcony barely has room for two small chairs and a little cocktail table. Don't plan to stretch out for a private nap on a chaise lounge. Overall, very disappointing hotel that does not live up to its Waldorf Astoria name.

Reviews.Title: “MOTM at the Casa”
Reviews.Author: Steve G
Reviews.Content: we were well cared for at the pool area , each day we had at least 12-15 of us, Scuba Steve H20 Concierge was the best.. he made our trip very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Five-Star Luxury with an Ocean Sunset View”
Reviews.Author: Rebel-Yell-Chicago
Reviews.Content: We spent five days at the Casa Marina and loved it. I attended a conference at the hotel while my wife just enjoyed the property, which is magnificent. The landscaping is outstanding and provides a real tropical feel, even from one of the two large pools that overlook the beach. Lots of palm trees. Outstanding service from poolside staff, who took wonderful care of us. We stayed in one of the ocean sunset rooms with a huge balcony overlooking the pools and beach. Each night, we could sip wine while watchingt the sun disappear into the ocean. For meals, walk a couple of blocks out the back of the property to Louie's Backyard--an exquisite restaurant. The only hiccup we encountered was a screaming errant fire alarm that woke us up twice one night. I guess accidents happen, but twice? That said, we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great atmosphere very friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Ravinator8
Reviews.Content: We were here for 4 days and had a great time. Patrick at the desk was great and all the staff was really friendly and helpful especially all the staff around the pools. They did whatever they could to make everything perfect thanks again! We will see you next time!

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving Week at the Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: Ashley-TN
Reviews.Content: I visited the Casa Marina during the week of Thanksgiving this year (Tuesday - Saturday). I was traveling with my parents. We had 2 rooms in the older part of the hotel during our stay. I would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Key West that is looking for a full service resort. 95% of the hotel staff was outstanding and went out of their way to accomodate us. The resort was clean and had great food and frosty drinks. Max at the front desk checked us in with a friendly smile and helpful tips. Having visited Key West several times, we were looking for a relaxing time on the beach and by the pool. The staff by the beach and pool at the Casa Marina exceeded our expectations for service. Specifically, Graham and Jon provided the highest level of guest service that I have had at any hotel or resort. Generally, my base for comparison is the beach service at the Ritz Carlton in Grand Cayman and these gentlemen certainly stepped up to the task. Richard also provided great service at the beach. Graham and Jon provide plenty of citrus flavored water and have lots of beach towels readily available for guest use......changing them out as often as you request (important to me). Each morning we enjoyed breakfast sitting outside at the hotel. Again, most everyone was nice and accomodating, however, the woman in charge of the hostess stand in the mornings perhaps should reconsider her chosen career in the service industry..... The rooms in the older part of the hotel can be a little noisy. If this would bother you, it might be a good idea to request a room in the newer part of the hotel. However, overall I would send friends or family for a trip to the Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay ....”
Reviews.Author: LynneHP
Reviews.Content: this was our third time at Casa and everytime we love it more! We had a 1 bedroom suite that was ample big enough for 4 of us - and was steps away from the beach and the pool. The pool staff could not have been more attentive - the sunglass cleaning service to the frozen flannels -everything is thought of. We had dinner on the beach one night too - to eat your dinner with feet in the sand - lovely! We will be back - this is the only place to stay in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cath n
Reviews.Content: Another wonderful family trip..Again the Waldorf Astoria did not dissapoint us. Our room and view were perfect. Steve and Mark from the pool were very polite and made our children laugh daily. Patrick from the front desk, continues to provide EXCELLENT customer service. He goes above and beyond to make sure that all the guests enjoy their stay. We will be returning in six months.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: cindypet
Reviews.Content: Our visit to the Casa Marina was one of our best trips. They treated us like royalty, anticipating our every need. The distance to Duval Street was just right- close enough to walk to, but also far enough to escape for quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible and noisy rooms”
Reviews.Author: Annc31
Reviews.Content: While I have to say to pool and beach area are very nice the hotel is way overpriced for what you get. Our room was small and there was mold in the shower. We also had a room with a connecting door and never got a full night sleep. The people next door were loud and smoked and I was pregnant so this was a tough situation. We could smell the smoke through the door and could never sit on our balcony without being overwhelmed by that smoke as our balconies were only separated by a sheet. When we asked to switch rooms they told us the only other room in the entire hotel would be another connecting room which made no difference. After all that they were going to charge us $50 for a 1 pm check out. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Barb C
Reviews.Content: Greatest family trip ever! Beautiful hotel..great food...awesome beach! Patrick at front desk, Steve and Mark on beach and pool area go above and beyond. We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Fest 2011”
Reviews.Author: Boris D
Reviews.Content: First of all, I would like to point out some of the very positive aspects of this property (in no particular order): 1. The Staff is always extremely courteous and helpful 2. The rooms are very clean and comfortable 3. The food is delicious no matter where you dine on the property 4. The grounds of the property, including the beach and pool, are superbly groomed 5. The Gift Shop has wonderful property themed items, Starbucks, snacks and drinks (including beer and wine) This review is to make suggestions in two areas to improve my favorite resort. In fact, the people at Casa encouraged me to provide a review so here it goes. Regarding attire policy, for the beach ONLY, I would recommend that the property have a clear policy regarding topless sunbathing. During the week of this year's Fantasy Fest, there was a conflicting policy that caused confusion and frustration.. While my wife and I were on the beach we were informed that topless sunbathing was allowed and my wife was very excited to be able to work on her tan. Shortly thereafter, there was another communication that the policy did not allow topless sunbathing. The ladies on the beach were disappointed and voiced their displeasure. Shortly after that, we were notified that topless sunbathing was allowed. I understand that children are also at the resort and believe that the beach should be established as adults only, if only during Fantasy Fest week and that it be communicated to all who register that this is the resort policy. My only other suggestion would be for Casa to enable more resort-owned transportation. It was fantastic that they had a van waiting at the airport for guests upon our arrival and also had transportation available for our departure-talk about convenience! It might be worth it to increase that coverage for guests during Fantasy Fest. We tipped our driver upon arrival and again when departing so it would seem like a positive thing for everyone. In closing I want to make it clear that we have stayed several times at Casa Marina and will continue to do so in the future. I travel all over the world and this is my favorite resort for a variety of reasons. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay”
Reviews.Author: mary s
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have stayed at Casa Marina many times over the past twenty years. It's a nice hotel in a good location (away from the Duval Street hubbub but close enough to get there when you want) with a small but wonderful beach. We found the staff helpful and accommodating from the front desk to Jon, Graham, and Rob at beach pool services. On our last night we decided to have dinner at the hotel instead of going out. We had a really nice meal at a table on the beach. The food was great and we wished we had done that sooner. Next time! I do have one complaint. It would be nice to have towel racks in the bathroom and a fan to clear out the steam after a shower.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise ???”
Reviews.Author: golfgti
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights in November to end our holiday. After 3 room changes and several complaints we were given a room below my expectations. Yes the bedroom was large with a very comfy bed. The bathroom was minute. We are not big but this bathroom left alot to be desired, apart from the lovely towels and toiletries. I am assuming that the rooms have had their carpets removed and flooring put down in its place. This has made large gaps beneath all doors and skirting boards are filthy and require painting. The rooms have very thin walls. On our first night we could not miss hearing the 40 minute arguement from the couple next door with distasteful bad language. I would have like to have seen what they looked like. Windows could not be opened. Drawer space was very limited and there was only one comfy chair in the room, with a tiny television. A resort fee of $25 per couple is charged whether you use the beach and pool areas or not. Staff in the hotel were not very friendly apart from the pool area. If there was a function on in the ballroom, this spilled out onto the patio unabling you to get to and from your rooms. Having said all of this, the setting of this hotel is superb and lying on the beach with a complimentary cocktail, popsicle and cold cloth in the sun, was paradise.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorite Key West hotels”
Reviews.Author: hotelman1230
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in just about every hotel in Key West and this is easily my favorite. The pools and beach are relaxing and the concierge treats you great. I took the jet ski tour around the island with my dad and it was probably the best 2 hour part of my trip. John was an awesome tour guide and knew a lot about the surrounding areas. From the back of a jet ski you can learn a lot about Key West and I would definitely recommend going on this tour. Overall this was a great stay and I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Pool Concierge In South Florida ! "Scuba Steve"”
Reviews.Author: Rachel W
Reviews.Content: I just spend 7 wonderful days at the Casa Marina Resort.... Scuba Steve is the BEST!!! I am planning another trip - just to be his guest. He will really take care of you.... Don't miss the opportunity to have him as YOUR pool concierge.... He will provide the services that are included in what the resorts posts on your bill ($25.00 resort fee a day/includes a pool concierge) --- PLUS he provides .....so much more... You have to expierence it to believe it...They have a jewel of an employee and I hope they know it... Scuba Steve - Pool Concierge -- Thank YOU for make my vacation a vacation of a life-time ...... Houston, TX -- R&J

Reviews.Title: “Cabana boy Steven”
Reviews.Author: trailcruzr59
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been one of my favorites since 2004. The 7 days we spent there was relaxing and fun. The pool staff is top notch!! Steven was charming, attentive and informative to anything we needed at the hotel pool or information on Key West. See ya next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: JaeRob
Reviews.Content: This resort was beautiful and we really enjoyed our stay. First off, the staff is great, especially everyone that worked in the lobby (concierge, front desk and bellman). Our room was really comfortable, especially the bed. We really enjoyed the amount of natural light the room provided. The inroom amenities were also great...I never used my own shampoo/conditioner because I really liked their stuff. The pools were great but I didn't like feeling like I should need to tip the "pool concierge" after paying $25 resort fee per day. Now for the downside...we were really disappointed that our room didn't have a balcony or even windows that opened, if this is important to you, be sure to ask at booking. The beach is really small and once you are in the water, it is mostly rock. Also, they say that you can use the facilities at The Reach (the sister Waldorf Resort), however it was probably a 1/2 mile walk and they charged to give you a ride over. We also asked for a cab to the airport so we could take the seaplane and the shuttle the bellman called for us cost $8/person but on the way back, we grabbed our own cab an it was only $12. On a final note, and this does not have to do with the hotel...DO NOT take the pedicab home at night. They charge $1.60/minute and our trip came to a whopping $38 when a regular cab would have only cost about $5. It seemed like such a nice idea at the time since we were tired. Normally we just walked home because it's only about 20-30 minute walk depending on where you are at on Duval. Overall, we had a tremendous trip. We really liked the Casa Marina and highly recommend taking the seaplane to Fort Jefferson/Dry Tortugas!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Bliss”
Reviews.Author: masGreensburgPA
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful vacation! The hotel grounds were breath taking. Atmosphere was so relaxing....from enjoying breakfast just a few feet from the beach, to the wonderful treatment we received at the pool and beach. Cold cucumber slices for our eyes, frozen Eucalyptus towels at the pool, refreshing popsicles, fresh fruit...all delivered with a smile from the Scuba Steve and the "other" Steve! We were met immediately when we arrived by Jesse, a friendly bellboy. He went out of his way to give us ideas for dinner and gave us directions to a "Pittsburgh Steeler" bar so that we could watch the game. He even went as far to fetch the key to the gift shop that was closed, because I needed something with sugar in it to keep in my room overnight in case my sugar plummetted. (Thanks to Chris also who helped with that.) I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: OdeLA41
Reviews.Content: The property looks very nice and the pool area is great. The rooms are updated and pretty clean. However, our stay could not be worse. If not a wedding we were here for, we would have certainly found an alternative to avoid the rude and unaccommadating service at this hotel. First, we got a terrible room facing the parking lot with a lot of noise. One person could barely fir in the tiny and awkwardly set up bathroom. When we asked for another room or an upgrade, we were told none were available that day, but we could pay $125 per night to upgrade. Curiously, that would me our rate above what we could book on the Internet at the same time. Then, in te middle of the night at 2am or so, the fire alarm went off for several minutes blasting through the whole hotel. Then again at 7am. This was pretty annoying, but particularly problematic since we had a 2-year old who was startled and had trouble going back to bed. Stuff happens but the hotel's handling of the situation and total disregard for need for accommodation was amazing and totally inconsistent with the Waldorf name. Instead of moving us to another room, of which plenty were available, the manager again insisted on charging us despite the inconvenience but $25 less. As an alternative we were offered an hour of late check out. Manager Mariya was not only unaccomadating but cold and rude. She clearly has no place in customer service, at least not at a place that purports to be luxury. It's too bad because this property has potential to be great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beachfront property”
Reviews.Author: funkydread
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days at the Casa Marina, and even though the property is right on the beach (nice ocean views, etc.), I was a tad bit disappointed in the service. For a Waldorf Astoria resort, I do not expect to order breakfast to be delivered between 7-7:15am and there was no breakfast by 7:30! I called down at 7:25 and the poor girl was almost in tears saying she was the only one making all these breakfasts and she just could not deliver mine for another 15 minutes! That would have made me late for my meeting so I ended up canceling room service, and went to the meeting without breakfast. Also, the food at the grill (near the pool) is very mediocre, which was kind of a surprise for a 'luxury' resort. In terms of the rooms, they are okay except for the fact that there wasn't a small desk in the room. Doesn't every hotel room have a desk for working? Okay, maybe I should not have been working in Key West:) Apart from that, the Casa Marina is in a lovely location and it is quite relaxing looking out at the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “MARK ON THE BEACH ROCKS!!!! AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: rightouss
Reviews.Content: We came back again. We looked at other resorts to go to but, in the end we decided to come back to the casamarina and the best beach service in the world. We wanted to be pamperd again with all the amenities fruity water ice popes drink of the day chilled cucumbers for our tired eyes he even cleaned our sunglasses made our dinner reservations played games with the kids. He is the casamarina. He had our chairs already sett up each day before we got up. I saw him out on the beach at 7:00 am and he left well after dark. I have a friend who is a gm at a hotel. WATCH OUT CASAMARINA HE IS COMING FOR MARK

Reviews.Title: “Talk about feeling pampered!”
Reviews.Author: AJacklyn
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay! Mark, Scuba Steve and the rest of the beach/pool guys helped to make our stay memorable. I don't know what we enjoyed more between the "drink of the day" samples, the Popsicles, cucumber slices for our eyes, the water misting, etc. They were all very attentive. Wouldn't hesitate to return or recommend.

Reviews.Title: “We left after 1 night; room was tired & like a college dorm scene”
Reviews.Author: Davcan
Reviews.Content: The outside pool area is pretty, and we sat and waited 2 hours for our room to be ready. Dan was a good server for a lunch that was mediocre at best. If you've been to Waldorf Astoria NYC, this won't be anything like it. The name on the room pen is www.luxuryresorts.com but Casa Marina isn't luxurious at all with zero sophistication. The tile floor in our room was so sticky I called for clorox wipes to be delivered so I could clean myself. Our room was on the 3rd floor and the balcony looked out onto tree branches that blocked any view. We were booked for 3 nights but left after 1 because we were so uncomfortable in this room and no other rooms were available.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Services”
Reviews.Author: Samuel S
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina stay was a great experience. The staff as a whole was tremendous. I believe Jon and Graham at the pool side are the best ever. I have never seen employees of a resort work so hard to make our stay enjoyable. We will be back in Feb. and we are bringing friends. Sam and Micki Sitterding from Indiana.

Reviews.Title: “Mark elous!”
Reviews.Author: Sailinshoe
Reviews.Content: Best beach service/concierge... You name it. We were treated like royalty everywhere we went. Thanks Mark, his crew and the entire Casa Marina staff for making our trip an unforgettable experience.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: Sherri M
Reviews.Content: Although I only spent two days in this resort in Key West on the way to another Key, it left me with a smile and a true desire to return there again. The facility is beautiful and the service was wonderful. I especially want to send big compliments to Jon and Graham at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “First Class all the way”
Reviews.Author: Nevada1957
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Casa Marina at Key West, and enjoyed every minute. The resort is first class, from the rooms,staff,resturant,lobby,beach and the entire grounds. The added benefit of being within walking distance to downtown really adds to a relaxing vacation that my wife and I were seeking.

Reviews.Title: “Outside Pool, bar and beach”
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: The outside pool, bar and beach at the Casa is the best on the island. Scuba Steve, the concierge on the beach is phenomenal. He was personable, fast, helpful with local advice and a fun guy. Definitely ask for Scuba Steve if you are by the pool or on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon 11-11-11”
Reviews.Author: EATME111111
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is a great property, the best beach on Key West! The service is outstanding, Patrick at the Front desk, Carlos at the Bellstand, Nate at the Sun Sun bar, Daniel and Scuba Steve on the beach and about the pools..all were great! Also be sure to book the Jet ski tour at Bare Foot Billy's, we had an incredible time with John D. which is a fantastic tour guide! This group has created some Raving Fans, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Key West!!!! Great place for a beach wedding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Katie P
Reviews.Content: My sister just got married on November 14th at The Casa Marina and it was perfect!!! From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave they take wonderful care of you! The food was great.....pool bar, breakfast, room service and the wedding food! One guest at the wedding said it was the best chicken he had ever had! The resort was completely booked and it barely showed.....breakfast service was a little slow but not bad considering that every table was filled. The 100+ person group that we were with was a rowdy bunch and they took great care of us...thankfully there are 2 good sized pools spaced a decent amount from each other so if you wanted a quieter pool you just went to the other one. The pool guys and pool bar staff were incredible especially Mark, Jon and Graham! The pool bar food is wonderful.....we all ate the tuna fish tacos everyday! The day after my sister's wedding I asked Mark to set up something special for the bride and groom and they happily obliged....which they did for another bride and groom as well! On their own, they set up flowers, champagne, bubbles, starfish, shells and reserved 10 chairs for our group! Needless to say they go above and beyond! We also requested early check in and late check out and it was no problem either time! The resort is definitely not inexpensive but I guess you know that going in! Reina, the wedding coordinator was top notch!!! Before even arriving in Key West she was 2nd to non!! She responded to emails sometimes in less than 5 minutes! Even though there were 4 other weddings there that weekend Reina gave us all the attention that we needed and more! We are already trying to plan our next trip to Casa Marina but next time we want to bring our children! We know they would love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for an amazing wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Dana H
Reviews.Content: We just had our wedding here and it was absolutely amazing! The staff and service was outstanding and the food was out of this world! Special thanks to Reina Todd!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Cardfan6
Reviews.Content: Received email from Evelyn a few days before arrival wanting to know time of arrival, departure and anything else we needed. Knowing it was a Waldorf Hotel my expectations increased. Arrived at hotel before 10 AM which I had told them. I was heading toward front desks and Patrick flagged me down, even though he was on the phone, saying he could help me. I wouldn't talk to him until he got off the phone so I waited a few minutes. I thought Patrick behavior was rude. Room was not ready, but he said he would make sure housekeeping would start cleaning as soon as it was vacant and checkout was 11 AM. He took my cell number and said he would call when room was ready. I checked back with Patrick at 11:30 AM he looked on computer and said they were cleaning it right now. We didn't get our room until 1:30 PM so I figure he was lying to me about what was going on. We had a Flagler room at $209. I paid $10 more than regular room which was $199 first part of November. The $10 got us a fairly small window facing the pools and ocean partly blocked by palm trees. The room room was also small with a nice closet, but no other storage space except for one shelf. We had to live out of our suitcases. The bathroom was really small 4" x 5', plus shower. Double doors to bathroom because they opened in and a regular door would have hit the toilet. Very large sink that took away from limited counterspace. Shower only and small curtain that did keep the water from the bathroom floor. We had problems with our room keys the first night and went to desk twice getting lectures both times on how to use them, keep them away from phones, etc. They finally sent a service man to room and ended up changing the whole lock. Clock was 8 hours off and had to have service man fix it. Service at the pool restaurant was so the first day and a little better after that. Very limited menu. Seemed like they could of had more people working. The hotel grounds are very nice with two pools and a beach. The beach is part and part rock. The hotel has a resort fee $25 per day not including parking. We did get late checkout at 1 PM per my request before we arrived. We stayed at hotel because of our music festival and our group took over the whole hotel for a few days. As I said earlier my expectations of this hotel were high because it is a Waldor Astoria Hotel so I was disappointed in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina review”
Reviews.Author: rjfyffe1
Reviews.Content: I arrive at the Casa Marina the Sunday after Fantasy week for MOTM. The hotel and staff are GREAT !!!! Just some of the names that I can remember are: John, Tom, Mark, Scuba Steve, Steve and many more. From the time you check in to the time you check out everyone goes out of their way to make you fill at home. Great view of the Atlantic.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service??? Management?? Doesn't exist!!”
Reviews.Author: MAN0812
Reviews.Content: Would we ever return to this resort u ask? No!! Patrick Morgan (poolside server) would be the only reason we'd consider it. He took care of us from day 1 and though he was serving in other locations for the duration of our stay...he was always there trying to make things better. He should lead a class there in customer care for employees and management. When he is promoted and heading up management...then we will be back. This is an expensive resort and not worth it with the exception of the view. A $250 plus room (with several add on fees after) is not any bigger or better than a $70 room at a Marriot. The basic ammenities that are usually included in most places are extra here. Housekeeping comes when they feel like it and dont do all that great of a job. I had to call down at 3:30 when my room still hadnt been cleaned. They said they'd send someone right up. I went to kill more time (which I told them would be an inconvenience because I needed to get ready for rehersal dinner. At 4:15, still noone had been there. I called again and explained that at this point I just wanted towels and they could clean later while I was out. I then headed back up to my room where I had found that they sent housekeeping anyway and had to wait an additional 25 mins for them to leave. I had to ask housekeeping to actually take the trash with them. A server poolside spilled something on my daughter's jacket, said sorry and walked away. I had to go up to the bar to ask for assistance. Patrick came by and tried to assist with soda water. Graham also tried to help remove the stain. Patrick Morgan and Graham were both great, but was this their responsibility? I watched Patrick go over and tell Candace (who I was told later was an outside manager) what happened. She NEVER apologized and couldnt even be bothered to come talk to me or take the jacket to be cleaned. I went to inside management Maria (who was kind and handled the situation). I just thought the pool manager should handle issues by the pool especially when she was made aware of them. The hotel was at 100% occupancy and yet only one server was assigned to an entire pool and portion of beach. Needless to say there went the convenience of poolside service...you had to walk up to the bar or restaurant anyway. Hotel security was unprofessional, rude and disrepectful. Can we say power trip?? We reserved a snorkel trip for Saturday. We checked in for the tour at 11:30 as scheduled. Walked to the end of the pier to wait for the boat. At 12:15 (45 mins later) we walked back to the check in point to ask the hold up. We were told the trip was cancelled because there were not enough people. When were they going to inform us? Oh wait it gets better...we then proceeded to the concierge (where we purchased the snorkle tour) to advise them of the mishap. The first words out of her mouth "that's not our responsibility" that's funny since the bill came from you. We've traveled to places all over the world and stayed in many resorts. A resort should have a certain feel of Paradise that this one is sadly lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Having a bad day? See the pool boys!”
Reviews.Author: moynihana
Reviews.Content: As always a one bed oceanview suite is a must! The pool has the best staff of all, with some that need to be mentioned! Steve, steven, patrick, and tyler are all worth the trip. A must stay every year we come and will stay that way!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Resort”
Reviews.Author: CocoLoco2010
Reviews.Content: Casa is a nice property with a decent little beach (Key West doesn't really have too good of beaches). Tried snokling but water is too churned up to see anything. It is walking distant or a short cab ride to most attractions. Pools are not deep but very clean & well kept. Only ate a breakfast at the hotel, it was good. Ate out on the town most of the time. Housekeeping did a good job. Rooms are spacious, with robes, umbellas, coffee maker, flat screen TV, ipod radio, & lots of room. My only compliant would be the resort fee of $20-25 per day. It doesn't seem to cover anything that isn't usually including at no extra charge. All watersports were extra. All I see that I got for nearly $100 in charges was a cup of coffee, two bottles of water & one popsickle. They need to either include watersports or something for it or just add it into the room cost.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was terrible”
Reviews.Author: Silesky
Reviews.Content: You would think being a Waldorf Astoria Resort you would get what you paid for....wrong! It was nothing as the photos show, beach was terrible, construction all day and into the evening just outside your door. The constant sound of a jackhammer and bobcat are the most relaxing sounds I could imagine for a vacation. Rooms weren't clean and service was awful. If a request was made it was ignored. No beach service and I could go on and on but hopefully, you get the idea... find a different place to stay. Would not recommend this to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good but needs to decide if its a hotel or venue.”
Reviews.Author: pjeffery
Reviews.Content: We stayed on a recent trip to Key West. Our arrival date was the last day of fantasy fest and the place was buzzing with participants. The front desk staff were very helpful in orientating us on our first night and the room was good if not a bit 'cold' with tiled floors etc but applicable to the climate. bed was comfy, room amenities were good and we had no issue with the housekeeping as other reviews. We were very late leaving the room one day and upon return it was noted and turned down which exceeded our expectations. Staff were always approachable and helpful. Pool was good with all the expected extras for the $25/day resort fee. This also included use of beach furniture and games with water and ice pops offered on a regular basis. The setting and grounds are perfect and it was an enjoyable place to be. Unfortunately the sheen came off on the final days of our trip. The resort became part of our daily routine to escape the hustle and bustle of the town and relax. The final days of the stay were 'hijacked' by the expected Parrot Heads convention which converged on the island. Now i want to be clear that this isnâ€™t pure snobbery. Anyone who pays the money is entitled to their ideal stay but the hotel put on a musical stage in the middle of the bar/beach area and a Parrot Head tribute band played a limited set throughout the day and into the evening. Things deteriorated on our last day when the hotel hosted a convention for the Parrot Heads. The hotel was swarmed with people and I resented being accosted by the event security who had taken over the door who insisted I show my Parrot Head pass. I lost count of the number of time i had to explain to disbelieving security that I had no interest in the meeting and was just a paying guest. I felt that the Casa Maria 'sold out' their guests during this time in favour of the masses descending on the hotel - the menus were changed and cheapened, the music obliterated any idea of relaxing on the beach and it made us both feel like WE were intruding on THEIR event. it made for an uncomfortable end to an otherwise good stay. We sensed that the staff were sensing the divide between guests and visitors and were doing their best to smooth over the gaps, so credit to them for that. I would stay again but i would definitely check what events were planned to avoid the disappointment of having the relaxing atmosphere that the hotel markets itself as having, being potentially compromised again.

Reviews.Title: “Best way to visit the Keys”
Reviews.Author: BAPost
Reviews.Content: Spacious place, very well suited for kids. Great food and ambiance. Enough beach activities and easy access to the highligths of the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing better in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: Amy B
Reviews.Content: Fabulous staff, especially Robert at the desk and Larry in reservations...... Best view on the island.... Always a pleasure to be here, every November for MOTM..... Could update the ice machines on the 2nd floor.

Reviews.Title: “Very well managed property”
Reviews.Author: okcJohn
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Casa Marina in Nov, 2011 for a convention where we had the entire hotel. Was very impressed with property and how it is ran. Like my other reviews, I will try and point out the good and bad although hard pressed for anything bad here. Arrival: Check in was a breeze, plenty of staff to help and very pleasant. Parking options are valet at $20.00 day or self park at $12.00 day. The self parking is immediatley across the street in well lit area. Unless it was raining, I can't think of any reason to valet park as the lot is literally across the street. Room: We stayed in 263 which was a great room as it is just off the staircase and elevator (no noise from elevator though). The room is a handicap room and thus was larger and had more windows at it is on a corner angle. The room has the nepresso coffee maker, a refrigerator, room safe, ipod dock clock radio, and flat panel tv. The remote for the tv was a simplified remote that looked designed for hotel rooms which was nice as you didn't have to figure out which buttons to push to turn the thing on or get to the tv part. Also, the only way to tell the decaf from the non decaf coffee is to look at the foil on the end and it is imprinted on very lightly. Would be nice if the little box containing the coffee and tea had a little label saying which is which. The first full day we were there, we did not get maid service. Went by that evening when we got in about 10 pm and ask the front desk to make sure we got it the next day. The front desk immediately asked if we needed anything like towels and that they would note it in their log. They explained that they were switching their housekeeping management tracking system and for some reason, our room indicated that it was not occupied. The next day when we came back to the room, the room was clean and their was a hand written note from the housekeeping manager apologizing for the missed day and a bottle of nice red wine, glasses, and a corkscrew for our enjoyment. Very well handled. Property: Very well maintained. Had an issue with our door sticking and hopefully will get addressed. The grounds are very clean and well taken care of. There is a starbucks in the lobby. Pools were great looking. Only ate at property once and was late night at pool. Food was decent. Resort fees: Price does not include the $20.00 day resort fee which covers internet and some other stuff that should be included in the price anyway. Includes newspaper but we never got one. Discovered last day that apparently instead of putting at your door, they are available in lobby and on a little table on the floors. We never saw them on the table until the last day. Between self parking, taxes, and the resort fee, our $200.00 night rate was approimately $255 night. No big deal but posted on here so everyone is aware of it when making their decision on where to stay. Would definately stay here again and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious retreat but far from the town centre”
Reviews.Author: LASEQUE
Reviews.Content: Probably the most luxurious place at the Key West. Comfortable room with a nice Ocen View above palm trees. Hammocks on the beach are the signature of the place (can accomodate a couple of two) and you can get your drinks served there too....stunning sunsets can be watched from the far south one naxt to the jetty. If you like watersports, take the jet-ski 1,5 hours tour around the Key West - unforgotable experience (best to rent from the Casa Marina sister resort just a block away). This place IS expensive but totally worth it. Also it is far enough from the airport so you dont hear the air traffic. But again, far away fromt the town centre, if you dont like walking you may want to choose the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Postcard pretty but without the gloss! FREE parking”
Reviews.Author: Lynn-Mari v
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Casa Marina due to recommendations from a friend! absolutely stunning but need the wow factor everywhere. Front desk was quite short when we checked in. With our package of 2night we got a free room upgrade to ocean view. This ended up being a corner room with a side corner window near the bathroom, where you could see the ocean from but from nowhere else! Def not the way you would Imagine a sea view ocean view room. Layout of the room terrible and wish now I went back downstairs asking to be down-graded. we did not as reason'd we're only sleeping there so no point causing a fuss. The Sun-Sun bar offer the BEST snapper sandwich!! Def give that a try. We did not try dinner at the hotel as wine prices over the top and Louise backyard around the corner way prettier setting! Also, please don't get ripped off with the valet parking charges. Both roads to side of hotel have free parking AND in the shade. Rather use that money and go for few drinks in Duvall street. Won't recommend Key west for more than 2days. Rather head up to Islamorado - amaaaazing place in Keys

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: CH-couple-ontheroad
Reviews.Content: This was truly a picturesque stay thanks to the beautiful hotel with its very nice beach and pool area. Breakfast was delicious and offered a vast variety and high quality of food. Everything you need for a perfect retreat.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly people”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: We just attended our 9th MOTM held at the Casa and this year the staff and facilities were outstanding. Thanks especially to Sucba Steve and Steven for their assistance each time we used the beach. All of the staff we met went out of their way to be helpful and their smiles and attitudes were greatly appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel!”
Reviews.Author: CorvetteWI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for two nights for our first trip to Key West. We wanted an upscale resort, with beach access and close to Duval Street. This was the place! Beautiful resort, very peaceful, yet upscale. Nice pools and the food was fantastic at the outdoor restaurant. Drinks were good, but a bit overpriced. The hammocks were a nice touch to relax in the sun! Scuba Steve and Steven went out of their way to make our anniversary trip outstanding!! They truly made our trip special with their service, recommendations and overall generosity to making our trip great! Tip on parking - we found out you can park on the street next to the hotel for free ... ditch the self-parking fee and park on the street! The resort fee also seems unnecessary ... what are you paying for? Free fruit water at the pool, that's about it. They upgraded our room to an ocean view and it was outstanding!! The room was a bit dirty (bathroom), but overall we can't go back. The espresso was also a nice touch in the room. We can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelmed”
Reviews.Author: Tony E
Reviews.Content: This was my first visit to a Waldorf hotel and I will not rush back to another. The Waldorf name I associate with luxury but in truth this hotel was pretty ordinary. Certainly 4 star but not sparkling. The actual building was atractive and the pool areas also very nice. However the rooms were nothing special nor were any of the common areas such as reception, restaurant or bar reflective of the Waldorf name. The main thing going for the hotel was its beachfront location and it was a nice touch to have hammocks strung from the palm trees as they were very relaxing. Eating at the outside breakfast area or by the pool was an interesting experience as the brazen local birds would on accassion dive bomb the guests and grab food from plates or even on one occassion from one screaming young girl at poolside. Perhaps this is just a feature of beachside hotels. The local lizards roaming the pool are oversize (at least 12-18 inches) so recommend to those who like local wildlife. Staff were of mixed quality. Generally anyone poolside was very attentive (as is normally the case where service charges are a factor) and hotel side from good to poor. Again not what Waldorf stands for I suspect. A final note just on Key West. I enjoyed Key West but I did find it a bit downmarket in bits and after a couple of days felt I had done it to death. It is also a long drive from Miami and overall not worth the investment in drive time. Try Naples instead.

Reviews.Title: “A Parrothead Perfect stay at Key West's best resort!”
Reviews.Author: JeffHill3
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th stay at the beautiful Casa Marina Resort and our second attending the Meeting of the Minds Convention. Each stay has proven to better than the last. The faciltiy is perfectly maintained with a georgeous large beach and pool area (2 huge pools) together with a covered outdoor dining area and beach bar. The resort offers a large variety of water sport activities as well. More important, the staff at the Casa was, without exception, outstanding - courteos, friendly, helpful and professional at all times. The small nicities were offered without fail. I highly recommend the Casa Maria Resort to anyone (Parrotbead or not) who is looking to spend some quality time in Paradise - you will never regret the decision.

Reviews.Title: “Beach, views, service.”
Reviews.Author: Sam W
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this resort many times and the level of service is above reproach. When visiting Florida most people want the beach. Key West is not known for beaches, the Casa Marina is the exception. Awesome beach, pool, and view of the Atlantic ocean. infamous Duval Street is just a stroll away. This hotel features lots of extracurricular activites, snorkling, sailing, jet skiing, and fishing. Enjoy the tasty frozen Pina Colada's at the pool side bar and fall asleep between two palm trees in a relaxing hammock as you stare out into the azure blue ocean. It don't get any better than that. Many thanks to Graham, Jan, Robin, and John who made my recent stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary visit”
Reviews.Author: edmando
Reviews.Content: This was the second year in a row that my wife and I have celebrated our wedding anniversary at this resort. What a great place to stay while enjoying Fantasy Fest. It is close enough to all of the activity but you do not feel like you are right in the middle of the action 24/7. We enjoyed spending the day by the pool and the ocean. They have two great pools that over look a nice beach and the ocean. Service around the pool was wonderful and would like to thank Patrick for making our days by the pool so much fun. We did not eat dinner at the resort but once again enjoyed a great meal at Louie's Backyard which is just a short walk from the resort. We rented bikes for our entire stay from the resort and did the jet ski tour around the entire island. The fitness center is above average and is in a separate building across the street from the resort. I would not return to Key West without staying at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Emotions”
Reviews.Author: mauimeplease
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful historic hotel in a wonderful setting, Since it was pouring rain non-stop we ate in the hotel dining room one evening. I had the best Bouilliabasse I have ever eaten and my husbands dinner was wonderful as well. The bartender in the indoor bar and the doormen were also very nice and fun. The balcony of our room had a great view and would have been amazing if it had not been raining throughout our entire stay. I must admit we may have had a better opinion of the hotel if the weather had not been miserable. On the other hand, even though we had a an upgraded room, it was small and full of too much furniture. The front desk management was not very hospitable during any of our interactions with them. We had breakfast at the hotel one morning and everything I got that should have been hot was cold. I did not try an omelet, but they looked wonderful. The bed was comfortable but some of the towels were gray and old. Overall, not sorry we stayed here, but probably would not return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Potential; Too Many Shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: mozacq
Reviews.Content: This property had a major renovation years ago and it is great overall. The location is excellent, the finishes are 4-star and the layout has the potential to be a five-star place. However, there were a few shortcomings in our 4 day stay. Exiting the lobby into the beach front courtyard is wonderful! There is a contemporary layout with pools to the left and right, and dining/bars to accompany each pool. The beach sets the horizon in the background. The service quality is a bit 'manic.' The lobby staff was pretty good. The housekeeping was poor. For instance, every day the housekeeper came to our room, she would ask my wife if she wanted a dish to replace the dirty one, or a new bottle of toiletry to replace the used one... very odd. She didn't close the open sofa bed either. Bottom line: the housekeeping was never a complete service. Another example: We were on the beach with a few friends, along with a few other groups of guests. The beach service attendant came by to tell us that although he had protested to his boss, he was leaving early for the day on boss's orders and this meant he needed to take the umbrella, chairs, and towels we were using. I was pretty shocked that he was told to leave early and then took our things. The bed squeaked with any slight movement whatsoever. However, the furniture in our suite was decent and it had plenty of room. We dined at the beachfront restaurant one evening, which was a nice experience. The wait staff was good and the food was great as well. The Bouillabaisse was excellent! Overall, this place is very good but could pick itself up a bit with an investment in training of the staff and the purchase of some furnishings. We are happy with our stay and feel that these things, while ultimately unacceptable, did not stop us from enjoying our stay.

Reviews.Title: “small missing details ruining the impression”
Reviews.Author: Nomadus
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, trying to be 5 star, but unable to put attention to the detail. They advertised daily newspaper, but it never showed up in front of my hotel room door. Using mensroom next to front desk i realised, the soap dispenser is without soap and no paper/cloth towels to dry my hands. At the sun sun bar I was left unattended for over 1 hour, before i finally asked for the manager. He showed up, appologised and offered me a drink on the house. It would be a jewel among WA hotels, if only they got somebody there to impose quality control across the board.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: julie b
Reviews.Content: We only spent 2 nights at Casa Marina and would like to have stayed longer. Staff were friendly and helpful and the room was fine - I liked the fact it was away from the noise of Duval Street but within easy walking distance. Unfortunately we had rainy weather, but had the sun been shining the beach would have been great to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Fest layover.”
Reviews.Author: johnydolittle
Reviews.Content: I have actually moved down to the Keys since my last review of the property and it is still amazing. I asked for an early check in because we were invited to be on a float and had to be ready by 4 and check in was at 4, they got us in @ 1:30. Used Hilton Honors points for a room during Fantasy Fest. The staff here was AWESOME and being a Gold Member does have its privileges. Free conch fritters and welcome cocktail at the beach bar, came home after being on a float in the parade and we went to the pool which was closed but security was great and simply said, if you are loud, you are out. We were not. Came back to the room to find a tray of amazing chocolates and fruit. Even with there being 70,000 people down for Fantasy Fest and the hotel being sold out eveything went smooth at the hotel. Its a tad more expensive then some other places, however so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and peaceful”
Reviews.Author: Eileen v
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina is on a lovely, secluded beach. Water toys and bikes can be rented there. A long pier gives access to snorkel and boat trips. The restaurants and bar are outdoors. The breakfast buffet was excellent. There are two inviting swimming pools. Our room was comfy and had a patio right on the beach. Bartender Jan was terrific. The main shopping area was a 5 minute drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Fun, friendly and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: SunCruiser1
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina is definitely the nicest place I've stayed in Key West so far. It's a large resort for the area, and that adds to the relaxing, comfortable outdoor atmosphere. Upon arrival, we found that they had not booked the room requested, nor for the correct amount of days, but they quickly rectified the situation with an upgraded room. Other than that little glitch, it was a great stay with extremely friendly, attentive, and fun staff. I live in South Florida, so Key West is an occasional weekend get-away, and Casa Marina fit the bill perfectly.

Reviews.Title: “Even through the rain this was a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: riddleGllendale_CA
Reviews.Content: We hit Florida in the middle of a biblical deluge. We drove to Key West in a blinding downpour that barely relented for the two nights we stayed at Casa Marina. This is really beautiful hotel restored impeccably without loosing the original flavor and ambience of the life and feel of the Keys in the 20s. The grounds and pool area are both glorious and poignant. We could only look down through our rain streaked windows and imagine what it would be like on a sunny day. We would love to come back for a stay when the weather is agreeable. The restaurant was also very good and reasonably priced. Unusual in my experience with hotel eateries. My only complaint was that I could hear every word of the conversation from the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful premises with major staff problem”
Reviews.Author: Diana D
Reviews.Content: This was a return stay for us and we couldn't help but notice a great change for the worse this time around. Good things first: As always beautiful historic hotel, picture perfect location (however do not expect a sandy beach) and great pool area. Also two wonderful guys (a British bloke and Joseph) operating the watersports. This said, the level of service has markedly gone down. The maid service: At 5pm our room was still not made up. The front desk: Repeatedly made us feel like an inconvenience. The breakfast staff: Slow, inattentive. The concierge ladies: Often not available. Further unhelpful and unmotivated. In the end you get billed an additional resort fee of 25 dollars a day, it makes you wonder what for? It is sad to see a good hotel be mismanaged to pieces.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: elf.dml
Reviews.Content: Although this is the nicest hotel and beach in Key Wes,t by no means is this a luxury resort that the WA brand usually carries. My husband has been a HH Diamond member for 15+ years, we have stayed at many WA hotels for vacations so keep that in mind when deciding if my review is helpful to you... At baggage claim, there is a phone to call for van service directly to the Casa marina, $8 p/p, no private car service from the hotel-that would be nice and would be willing to pay $50 each way for personalized service in a Towncar/MB, etc...The bellmen were fast and helpful, every time we were leaving/coming back they held the door open, asked if we need a taxi, even when busy-there were plenty of workers to help. The front desk check-in was ok, no one at the HHonors desk so we checked-in with everyone else. We paid for a basic room, usually get an Diamon upgrade and we did after 2 days. The first room was nicely appointed but very small with tiny,tiny,tiny bathroom and not enough space to hang/fold clothes for 2 people for a week but tall ceilings, large window, faux walnut floors and new bath. After 2 days they moved us to a MUCH larger room with large balcony over-looking the beach. This room was not in as good condition as the first but the trade off of large room w/ sitting area, huge bath and balcony w/ tons of storage was very welcome. I have to say that everyone we met at this hotel (workers) were very helpful, friendly, and seemed to like their jobs! Scuba Steve is one of the best assets that this hotel has. He is friendly to all, helps give suggestions of sun position for max. tanning or not, restaurant advice, tour advice and he is truely a happy, friendly employee and helped make out stay better. We tipped him $5/day and he always had our "area" set up with tons of towels and we didn't have to rush to get a chair/umbrella every day, so sleep-in! We did the jetski tour, 2 hours, 27 miles around the island, fun and cheap tour, only 4 othe couples went on the tour, we never wee on a jetski before and learning in 2 minutes. We did an 80 min. couples massage with Ellen and Lucy, one of the best massages I ever had (Diamond members get 10% off). We chose to have them done in the SPA vs. oceanfront for 2 reasons, 1) the beach smells like rotting seaweed and 2) not very private with vacationers walking by or can see you from their balconies, I think they should put up a trellis with vines or more landscaping on the hotel side of the massage area. We did the Sand Sculpting with MayAnn $49 p/p, It was fun, cheap, 2.5 hours, oceanfront and we had no experience and built a motorcycle out of sand! Mo-peds, we rented a mo-ped for 24hrs during an overcast day, we had fun (10% Diamond discount), went up and down ever street taking photos, we never rode a mo-ped and learned fast. The food/drink at the hotel- we only ate lunch everyday and breakfast 1 day, every dinner we ate out (I will do reviews on 7 restaurants that were all fabulous!), anyways, lunch was always great, good quality and hot, we like the blackened snapper or mahi sandwiches the best. The breakfast was ok, we had the buffet on the last day, $20 p/p ish which was fine but the food choice/quality was okay, but we are not breakfast people so... The drinks, everyday they had a drink of the day that they passed around at the beach/pool which was nice. My husband stuck to beer, in the hot sun he likes any light beer (colder) and they delivered. He drank Coors light, it was freezing cold, with little ice chips in it, he loved it. I had Prosecca (sp?) which was cold and they gave my own little bottle each time so it was like 1.5 glasses, very good. The negatives for us were: the mattress need flipped/rotated- very saggy, we tried to move out of the hole but always woke up in the hole and we like a soft pillow-top, I can't imagine people who like a firm mattress. The maid service was less then average, we tipped the maid $5 everyday and asked for more towels, she did leave more towels but I don't think ever mopped the floor, half-fast cleaned the toilet, never cleaned the balcony, just did the minimum, management should "spot check" the rooms and fire bad maid service. The beach smell, I guess I don't know what you do about that...everyday they did rake the seaweed into a pile, but the pile just got larger-we never saw them remove it, it stinks like sewer. Some people may like to be closer to the "action" of Key West but we loved the location. We walked everywhere day or night and felt safe. Its level so the walking is easy. You are removed from the action but can join in with a short walk! P.S. Stacy the conceirge was fabulous. She helped arrange every tour, dinners and gave ideas. She was very friendly, knowledgable and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Management is a joke!”
Reviews.Author: Pam B
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice outdoor property & the employees that work outside "the walls" are awesome! Bellmen, bartender (Robin) pool boy (Jon) & the servers (Patrick & Daniel) all rocked 5 days straight! But the problem is inside & with management. The hotel is old, noisy and cheaply outfitted. It reminded me of a 1970's Ramada Inn with a beautiful outside. The management was the worst part. On our first morning as we sat for coffee by the ocean a guy who was obviously in management just got in the face of one the beach boys and YELLED at him while we where 10 feet away. This lasted for 5 minutes. My husband called him Napoleon when he saw him again because he was so small. Two days later we had lunch by one of the pools and sat a couple tables from 3 people that in their words were the "management team", we later learned from the server that one was the general manager. I couldn't believe how open they were to discuss employee problems right in the cafe. Then when we checked out the man we now knew as the general manager walked right past us as we were having a billing question and the desk guy had a tough time explaining the $25 resort fee. He glanced at my husband and just got the heck out of dodge. So the bottom line is the people who run the place better shape up or they are going to quickly lose one of the two things this hotel has going for it....service employees. I don't think anything can screw up the beautiful pools and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for making our wedding special”
Reviews.Author: hollys h
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had our wedding and reception on the beach at the Casa Marina, with Karina's assistance everything turned out perfect. I forgot to inform Karina that my cousin needed glueton free foods and within minutes the chef had a whole plate of food for her. We found the service to be outstanding from the bellman to the front desk to the pool staff to the servers. My mom was a former hotel employee and made many requests, one day before the wedding, and Karina was more than happy to oblige. I had choosen stations instead of plated food and my guests loved everything. Many said they had never had so many choices and such good food at a wedding. Yes there is a $25.00 a day resort fee but my guests loved the beach services. Each day they looked forward to their free signature drink, apples, ice water, popsicles and spritzing. I just want to say thank you to Karina and staff for making all our dreams come true. Holly and Scott

Reviews.Title: “5 star service”
Reviews.Author: david f
Reviews.Content: Nice property with fabulous service. Steve and Steve, who provide service at the pool and beach are top shelf. The younger one is a conch (born here) and makes great recommendations for places to eat and things to see. The older one is a service industry PROFESSIONAL. He provides the little things that separate 5 star from the rest and seems to enjoy doing it. They make a great pair. Rooms are nice, clean and everything works. Hotel restaurant is decent but prices are high for what you get. It's a bit of a walk to get to other restaurants. Cabs are $3 per person to get to Mallory Square where most of the action is. We are planning on returning and will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Average. A Hotel not worthy of the Waldorf Astoria brand. This is an average hotel masquerading as an elite hotel. Think twice a”
Reviews.Author: belmiro99
Reviews.Content: As a Diamond member I can safely say I gave stayed at the very best and worst that Hilton has to offer. This hotel on first glance looks amazing. Private beach, grand surroundings and the Waldorf Astoria brand. However as a frequent traveller I can tell you this hotel is at best AVERAGE. The first thing is the rooms are standard fare that you can expect to find in any Hilton hotel. Nothing exceptional. Service is bad to average. Staff are clueless and don't offer that little extra you would expect for the price and class of hotel. The beach is nice but rocky. It's a busy hotel with around 330 guests and it can be a bit noisy. My biggest issues with the hotel are as a Diamond member you get nothing. No room upgrade, no free breakfast. Just a welcome drink and free Internet. You feel second class at this hotel especially if you booked a reward stay as I did. You will be hit with a daily parking charge of 15 dollars and a resort fee of 15 dollars which essentially gets you nothing. If you are a frequent traveller or a gold or diamond member I would say you will be terribly disappointed with this hotel. It's not a bad hotel but it is not special. It offers nothing you wouldn't get at a standard Hilton. If you don't travel so often you will likely find the hotel good. I would recommend the sister hotel "The Reach". It's an older hotel close by that has better rooms with balconies. Nicer furnishings and amenities, better sandy beach and friendlier more switched on staff. Note to Hilton, diamond travelllers deserve far better service and treatment at your top hotels regardless of if this is a reward stay or not. Room upgrades should Be offered and at least free breakfast. Diamond should mean we are special and as your most loyal paying patrons we deserve to be treated well at ALL your hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: NMBarb
Reviews.Content: We booked the Casa Marina for one overnight on our short trip with another couple to Key West, and liked it so much that we decided to stay another night. We loved the pool and waterfront area. Walked out one of the long piers that jut into the ocean and saw colorful tropical fish right under our feet! The saltwater pools are perfect and the staff at the pools and the beach bars are efficient and cheery. Our ocean view room was stylish and spacious--though the bathroom was small--and the bed very comfortable. And the price was great! Front desk staff were superb!
