Smoothly handled our way too early arrival the first day, took care of our luggage and delivered it to our rooms later in the day, while we toured around town. Valet parking attendant produced four bottles of chilled water when we climbed into our hot car the next day. Only disappointment was the food. We decided to have dinner the second night at the hotel. It was served in the fabulous candlelit setting of the beach front. Though the prices and menu appeared to be for sophisticated resort dining, the actual meal was produced in the tiny beach bar grill. The main dining room was not open, as I guess October is off season. Though the fish was fresh and well prepared, the sauce was dull, the salad was ordinary and the vegetables miserably overcooked. Dessert tasted as though it had come from the supermarket. Service was just OK. There also was a dopey selection of tired music on the speakers. The music at one point conflicted with other music from an event on an adjacent area of the resort, and we asked that it be turned off. There didn't seem to be anyone around who could handle that. So our dinner experience didn't live up to the superb setting. The breakfasts and lunch were more or less ok, though the service was slow. Nevertheless, I think we would go back again, and have most meals elsewhere--lots of great restaurants in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property! We will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: Renee M
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is a beautiful property right on the beach. We stayed in the Grand Ocean Vista which had a stunning view of the pool grounds and oceanfront. It is a close enough walk to all the action of Duval Street but far enough away to be romantic and quiet. Our room was very nice and the bed was very comfortable. The outdoor patio was AWESOME!! The only problem is that we could not use our outdoor patio except at the end of our trip. It decided to rain during the first part of our stay. But we had a great time anyway! From the pool to the beach to the great bartenders at the beach. An extra thank you to Jan at the beach bar! You are awesome...and we look forward to seeing you in May 2012! Renee & Skip

Reviews.Title: “Beyond fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: fancyfreerv
Reviews.Content: We were amazed from the moment we stepped into the lobby. It was a calm, relaxing atmosphere the whole weekend. The room was amazing. Just a slow draining tub which was not addressed after we reported it. But the positives far outweighed the minor inconveniences. The hammocks on the beach were perfect. The staff was always friendly. The food was always delish. As were the mijitos at the outdoor bar. If you eat breakfast at the resort, be patient. The food is great but the staff isnt the quickest.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Short Stay...just wish it could have been longer”
Reviews.Author: GAVIN G
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The moment we walked in the plantation style reception with the outlook of the ocean framed by the two swimming pools I knew I was going to be happy and comfortable. The staff were superb with excellent amenities...especially the water activities with barefoot Billys. The front office staff even allowed for us to stay in our room longer than kick out time to shower after an activity. I will be back........as soon as I save up enough cash.

Reviews.Title: “We will be back.”
Reviews.Author: JenSM20
Reviews.Content: We are enjoying the hotel. Service has been great, especially the h2o concierge guys. Food has been fine, but there are so many options close by, it doesn't matter. Our room is nice- very clean, great ocean view. Only complaint is the way too small bathroom. Not enough room for all my stuff, or my husband's. We rented a scooter, which is the way to get around the island. Today we went snorkeling via the concierge and loved it. We would stay here again, for sure. I really like that it's away from Duvall Street, a little more relaxing, but the drinks are flowing just fine.Â

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: Lillian_S_13
Reviews.Content: DH and I stayed at this hotel on Oct 20, 2011. We were celebrating my birthday. Our room was an Ocean Vista King. We had an absolutely beautiful view of the water and beach area. The room was very nice with a very comfortable bed. We had a great time here. For dinner, the concierge recommended Strip House which is located at their sister property next door, I think it is called TheReach. That property was also beautiful. All of the staff we encountered at Casa Marina was friendly and helpful. We had the breakfast buffet, which with coffee and orange juice was $43 for the two of us. I felt that was a bit pricey, but the food was very good. Overall, this was a great stay. We defintely would return.

Reviews.Title: “Expected more from a Waldorf Astoria Resort”
Reviews.Author: Dan C
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel, but could be better. The staff was courteous and helpful, but some of the cabana boys were a bit overwhelming at times with their "constant" attention. Also, we were surprised that a double room, meant "double" sized beds. The last thing we expected in a Waldorf Astoria resort was small beds. They are the wrong size for couples and families with children. We asked for a room with a larger bed, but they could only offer a king size bed at $150 more per night...not very accommodating. Also, I had called ahead in advance to see if there was anything special they could arrange for my wife and I, since we would be celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary, but they seemed pretty much dis-interested in helping us to make it a special stay. All-in-all, not a bad hotel, but not what we expected from a Waldorf Astoria resort. We will be trying someplace different next time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff and a wonderful beach resort!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly R
Reviews.Content: We came to Key West for my Mom's wedding. She was suppose to have a reception on a chartered boat for a sunset cruise. The cruise was cancelled last minute due to weather but the wedding party did not know until after we arrived at the dock. We had no other alternative and didn't even have the opportunity to book something else. Although the wedding party was small, 15, it would be difficult to get reservations somewhere for dinner this late in the evening. We called our hotel, the Casa Marina, and explained the situation. Within 20 minutes they put a table together for 15 and set us up. They met the bride and groom with a Champagne toast with Strawberries and brought out a few complimentary appetizers. The dinner was fabulous and the wait staff was exceptional. They catered the entire meal as if it was a wedding reception and not just a dinner for 15. They even brought out a smaller table with two knives for the bride and groom to cut the cake. The wait staff was amazing and everyone was always willing to help. Additionally, the hotel was obviously gorgeous and the beach area was beautiful. The rooms were great, everything you'd expect of a beach resort like this. There is also pretty decent snorkeling just off the pier. The pools were nice and I even saw the staff bring out rafts for the kids. This is definitely a place everyone would feel comfortable at. Only complaint is the distance to Duval. But cabs are plentiful and the ride isn't that much.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in the US!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Crystal L
Reviews.Content: We came to Casa Marina on 10/8/11 to celebrate my birthday on the 9th of October and my boyfriends birthday on the 10th of October. We had a BLAST!!!! If you want to have a vacation with NO worries at all you need to stay at The Casa Marina Resort in Key West, FL. This Resort has a lot of history and is a sanctuary in case of bad weather. Casa Marina has the biggest private beach on the island. Patrick Mobley at the front desk will help you with anything you need,just ask. Now when you you hit the beach at the resort ask for Scuba Steve, he will treat you like you are royality.( I was the Sun Goddess) Any thing you need while you are on the beach he will get for you. Scuba Steve will set up your chairs and umbrella and get you ice cold water, a drink of the day,frozen wash rags for your face,popsicles,cucumbers for your eyes, and he will clean your sunglasses. Scuba Steve run laps around all the other cabana guys.He have a vast knowledge of great things to do in Key West. He also knows where the good places to eat and drink are. If you happen to come in on Scuba Steve's day off ask for Mark Gray and he will make sure everything is set up for you. If you need sea shells for the kids or just for a souvenier he will get it for you. Oh, and if you plan on Jet sking ask for Matthew over by the big dock and he will take you out for some speeding fun. We were there for 6 nights and the one day that Scuba Steve had off from work he took us around the Keys islands. We really enjoied hanging out with him and he made us feel like we were family. We saw what life was like if you lived there. Which we liked a lot. We are planning another trip there next year (with the kids this time)LOL. Thank you so much! We will be back!!!! Barefoot Billy's you have great staff at The Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Nice time in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Greg W
Reviews.Content: Nice stay until the day we were leaving. It had rained (several inches) and there was flooding in certain areas of town. The staff at the front desk informed us that the airport was closed and all fights had been cancelled. I was instructed by one employee that they tried to call the airport and no one answered. People that had scheduled flights were panicing, attempting to rent cars in an attempt to get off the island. I called AA and was told that our flight was on time. Took a cab to the airport to find that it was "open". Our flight took off as scheduled. Some other airlines had cancelled flights due to weather but not AA. The staff at Casa Marina should, in my opinion, have been more informed. They were giving false information regarding travel conditions. Our stay was great until this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Marvelous Beach Holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Gail C
Reviews.Content: We had lovely lanai rooms which opened directly to the ocean, just steps to the beach where we spent most of our days lounging under umbrellas and being treated royally by the best beach crew ever! They spoiled us throughout the day with fresh ice water, rum and cocoanut drinks, iced fruit pops and even frozen face cloths at the hottest time of the day! The hotel staff was friendly and helpful and gave us great advice as to restaurants and places to visit. The hotel itself is gorgeous and beautifully maintained and we enjoyed every minute of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Paris718
Reviews.Content: I have been to Key West many times over the years, and if you like the beach, the Casa Marina is the best hotel on the island. Most hotels have no (or very small) beach areas. The Casa Marina (and sister property the Reach Resort where we have also stayed) have good beach areas by Key West standards. The Casa Marina is an older property, with a large variance in rooms. Some rooms are pretty bad (think no balcony, musty, ground floor parking lot view with headlights coming in your room at night). And some rooms are great-- large balcony wide open views. If you like to relax outdoors, it's worth the money to upgrade to a grand ocean vista (largest balcony available), or at the very least, an ocean vista (smaller, but more private balcony) to ensure a view. We were able to call ahead and talk with one of the managers to get the room we wanted. The location is nice. If you're used to walking a lot, we found it pretty easy to walk pretty much anywhere on Duval. We had our 7 week old baby with us, so were limited to walking with a stroller, but if you rent bikes, you can really cover a lot of ground. The dining options are endless in Key West. One of my favorites has always been Louie's Backyard for dinner (particularly the ahi tuna, always good). Latitudes Restaurant (at the Westin on Sunset Key) is also good, and a fun little excursion as you take the 10 min ferry to the island. If you like to go to the spa, definitely check out the Spa at Sunset Key (you can use facilities if you get a treatment even when not staying there), and also Little Palm Island (private island resort, amazing spa, you can be a guest if you spend a certain amount on the island). If you like boating & snorkeling, rent a boat and head out to Sand Key, one of the coolest snorkeling spots anywhere. The sea plane to the Dry Tortugas is also a really neat excursion. The Casa Marina has 2 nice pools, and the ocean is nice and calm and perfect for swimming, especially if you don't mind a little seaweed (have to enter from the wooden dock due to rocks). If the Casa Marina were in a different city, I may give it a slightly lower rating. But as far as Key West goes, it's one of the very best properties on the Island.

Reviews.Title: “Mark at the Pool Saved Our Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: BNewcott
Reviews.Content: Well, we would have had a great honeymoon, anyway--how could you go wrong with the Love of Your Life in Key West in October at one of the most beautiful hotels in America? We'd stayed at Casa before and had flawlessly wonderful experiences, but for some reason this time around (of all times!) they stuck us in an awful little room with a tiny window you had to stand on your toes to see out. The front desk seemed way less than interested in helping find us a nicer room--even for subsequent nights. So we headed out to the pool, a little dejected, and set ourselves up on two lounges under a sea grape tree. That's when Mark Gray came by and asked us how we were doing. We said we were doing fine, of course, and added almost as a footnote that it was our honeymoon. "Did the hotel fix ya up?" he said--to which we replied well, funny you should ask, but actually no. "What's your room?" he asked, and we told him, and he laughed and told us how those rooms were built by Henry Flagler as "safe" rooms for guests in case of hurricanes. "I'll see what I can do," he said, and wrote our room number on the palm of his hand. Apparently, the room situation was dire--the place was sold out, and there was no place else for us to go (by the way we'd made our reservations months earlier, with the notation that it was our honeymoon). But that afternoon Mark returned with a "Just Married" balloon to tie to our lounges, and he sat down and filled us in, in great detail, about the most romantic places to eat on the island. He turned us on to the funky/friendly breakfast at Blue Heaven, the charming waterfall grotto at Michael's (where he called ahead and had them greet us with a complimentary split of champagne), the nice-and-easy lunch setting at Louie's Back Yard. Our second morning, we walked out to the beach and found our lounge chairs set up for us, again under the sea grape, again with a "Just Married" balloon and with bottled water and nuts and newspapers set out for us. What's more, when noon rolled around and it was time for me to see if a better room had become available, Mark came all the way in to the front desk with me (they ended up giving us a delightful little room just off the pool). Every day for the length of our stay, Mark went out of his way to make the week even more special for us than it already was. Between the two of us we have stayed at hotels and resorts from Rome to Shanghai, from New York to Bora-Bora, and never have we encountered a hospitality professional who managed to so thoroughly exemplify both words of his title.

Reviews.Title: “paradise found”
Reviews.Author: bvm14
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home after spending an amazing 5 nights in paradise. The resort is stunningly beautiful from the lobby to the endless ocean that is Casa Marina's backyard. The workers from bellhop, concierge, front desk, servers, beach attendants, grounds keepers, massage therapists are both professional and friendly. I would name a few but that would be unfair because everyone is wonderful. The food is first rate. We enjoyed buffet breakfast each morning, but you can also order a la carte. Lunch menu is fresh and fun. You must try sunset dinner on the beach. Beach is perfect. You can swim from the pier to the floating dock. Lots of fish to be seen, especially at morning. Try a snorkeling trip from Sunset, fabulous, it leaves from Casa Marina. Also, have a beachside massage for a very special treat. Our room was so beautiful, but I'm not telling you which one. That is our secret!

Reviews.Title: “Way overpriced for what you get!!!”
Reviews.Author: swapmelui
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited Key West for the first time in October. We chose Casa Marina because of the beach and reviews. The hotel is WAY overpriced. The rooms looked like a standard hotel room at a Hampton Inn. The prices were extremely high (food and beverage). I was drawn to the hotel because of the package they offered (free upgrade, $75 food/beverage credit, and 10% off spa service). You will use up your $75 credit with 4 breakfast buffets ($20 per person/per day + tax). I wish I could say its worth it, but its not. You don't get a large variety of foods to choose from. We didn't get the free upgrade because the "fine print" said "based on availability upon check-in." We were told the hotel was booked and they couldn't offer us the upgrade. Just book a beach front room and don't buy in to the package deals. Beware of the water bottles in the room. You have to pay for those too. There's no sign around them saying you will charged for them, but you'll see it on your bill when you check out. I don't think you want to pay $5 for a bottle of water. I suggest you go to a local store and buy water and canned beer. There is a small fridge in your room. Pool entertainment - NONE. One day we were there, they were having a employee party....needless to say that was the most excitement we saw at that hotel. Suggestion - play some music and perhaps higher a pool entertainer....yawn...the pool is very boring. The only good things I can say about this resort is the beach access and Barefoot Billy's jet-ski tour. Sorry Casa Marina but you need to make some changes before we will return. Lower your prices for your rooms, or provide more food/beverage comps, and for goodness sakes get some life around that pool.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: williamrmeans
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from Key West, it was our first trip to the Keys. Before we went our friends that had gone before said it was ok but some said they liked it but the hotel they stayed in was not very nice. Let me begin by saying we were at Casa for 5 hours and extended our stay, this hotel is awsome. We were back last night and already booked another stay for Dec. 10-14, this hotel made this one of our most enjoyable vacations in a very long time.Derin, hope I spelled his name correctly, at the pool bar was a true mixologist he was great to talk to and went out of his way to make sure we enjoyed our stay.The coladas were the bomb. I wish I could remember the other bartenders names but for some reason I cant but they were good as well.Now on to the infamous SCUBA STEVE at the pool, this dude was awsome also he was full of energy and really enjoyed making people comfortable, he was there by himself our first day and we could tell everyone loved him. On the second day Steven was there with Steve and he was very good also, he knew how to perform his tasks flawlessly. The entire staff from check in to check out bent over backwards to make sure everybody was doing well. To the management of this hotel, it was obvious the staff enjoyed the work environment at the Casa and this has to start with the top.GREAT JOB

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Hertled
Reviews.Content: Jon Hertlein made our stay! Â He was there upon our arrival....provided great info regarding the area...he even remembered our names when we went in and out! Â He certainly knows the meaning of HOSPITALITY!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Casa has a wide range of quality for the value.”
Reviews.Author: crossley2b
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Casa a few times. This visit was for a babymoon, and it proved to be better than anticipated...especially the beach! The cabana boys, most specifically, Steven, Scuba Steve, and Mark gave each of us such special care! We hardly wanted to leave the beachfront! A job well done!! Thank you for the quality care that you provided. We will definitely be returning to The Casa for future visits - minus the pregnant belly ;-)

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous service!!”
Reviews.Author: Mollie M
Reviews.Content: Scuba Steve and his daily popsicle drop was one of highlights while laying by the pool. Everyone was so nice and service could not have been better. I would highly recommend staying here!!

Reviews.Title: “thanks for a great weekend ;D”
Reviews.Author: ben k
Reviews.Content: Our trip to casa marina was amazing ..... it was my first time in the island and we had a blast . My boyfriend brought me to the best restaurants in the area. They are all so close to the hotel, so taking a taxi was no problem . The valet staff at the casa marina especially johnathan were awesome and always had a reccomendation of where to go and what to do .. thanks . There was a pool side bar where Nate, a very nice bartender, took great care of us !!!! .. our room was beautiful and always clean upon our return . also, we did the wave runners tour where Matt and Tom , our tour guides finished an amazing birthday weekend at casa marina with their energy and friendly personalities to be an unforgettable get away .. thanks to all the casa marina staff !!! we hope to come back soon .

Reviews.Title: “Can't Wait to go Back!!!”
Reviews.Author: KpSeaman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a wonderful week at the Casa Marina Resort. While the entire staff was pleasant and helpful, the pool staff was phenomenal! Mark, Scuba Steve, Patrick, John all went above and beyond to be sure that we were having a great time. We cannot wait to return! We will never stay at another establishment in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Heaven in Key West”
Reviews.Author: CasaDulce
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent four nights at Casa Marina on the southernmost end of Key West to attend our niece's wedding, and loved everything about our visit!!! Accommodations are top notch (we had a corner room, ocean view suite, the real deal with an amazing bathroom in the middle, between the living room with a terrace (facing both pool/resort grounds and the ocean) and the bedroom. The wedding event was managed to perfection, a total class act. What impressed us the most, however, was the totally thoughtful, friendly, caring, non-pushy staff we encountered at every turn...maid service, front desk, fitness center, beach/pool staff. We'd also like to log a major recommendation for La Te Da restaurant on Duran, a short walk from the resort, simply charming, intimate poolside dining..brunch, lunch, dinner...we had all three!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, gorgeous resort”
Reviews.Author: Boatdreamer55
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the end of September for a mini vacation. It felt like we were away for much longer. Staff was super attentive. From the time we walked in the front door we felt pampered. Patrick at the front desk could not have been more cordial, accomodating, and helpful. We spent time at the beach and ate at the resturant. The food was outstanding. After only one day Daniel remembered our favorite drinks. I have a food allergy, and the staff was more than willing to accomodate it. The oceanside room was roomy and comfortable. We were relaxed after only one day - can't wait to go back and spend more time.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: remyCork
Reviews.Content: Went to the Casa Marina for our honeymoon and we were really impressed. The only thing I would change would be to stay in an ocean view room rather than an island view room as the view is much better. Otherwise, we loved it! Perfect honeymoon destination!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Historic Hotel; Nice Beach for a Sun Goddess”
Reviews.Author: 2SunGoddess2
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is a great place to stay when in Key West. It is an elegant and historic hotel. If you like a beach, it is one of the few hotels in Key West that has one and I believe the only hotel with a natural beach. Mark and Scuba Steve (the pool and beach concierge) definitely make you feel at home. After getting you situated with a lounge chair, towels, and beach umbrella, during the day they bring you frozen towels for the back of your neck infused with eucalyptus oil, cold cucumbers for your eyes, and popcicles. The drink of the day is an added bonus. Mark goes above and beyond to assist guests. I think he taught Scuba Steve everything he knows! (We love you Scuba Steve!) The watersports at the hotel are also a lot of fun. You can take a tour of the island on jetskis, or go kayaking or paddleboarding. They also rent bicycles to tour the island and scooters. I would defintely return to this hotel. We did not opt for an oceanfront room but the room was nice and had updated modern decor. We walked to downtown and the surrounding areas with ease. A great way to keep off the pounds while enjoying awesome dining at several restaurants in Key West. I walked past all of the hotels and B&Bs mentioned on the list at some point during my stay and would return to the Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: JotaJota56
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights with my wife, and we both really enjoyed it. Location is very good, right on the beach and away from the main street. Beach, pools and related activities are all first class (unless you like running int the water). Service around the pools, beach and in general was outstanding. The only negative was the room. Although it was in the newer section, it was rather small and the AC did not remove the "feeling" of humidity.

Reviews.Title: “Scuba Steve is the best”
Reviews.Author: Georgia P
Reviews.Content: We actually stayed at the Reach but spent the day at Casa Marina, hanging out by the pool and on the beach. "Scuba Steve" was the pool concierge on duty. He was awesome. He made sure everyone was happy and comfortable,spent time talking and joking with the guests and having fun with everyone. He even took time after the end of his shift to take some great pictures of us on the beach. The property is beautiful, the drinks are plentiful and the salad I had for lunch was perfect. It's really fun seeing the iguana's in the trees, especially big red. My daughter had a blast. I don't know what the rooms are like but the property is stunning. I saw that some people complained about the rocky beach but there is a pier that goes past the rocks and has stairs down to the water. Great solution!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect again!!”
Reviews.Author: mauidave65
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Casa Marina and our 2nd outstanding experience with them. This staff could not have been more accomodating and generous. Before we arrived we had requested a non adjoining room and we were told we would be getting one. At the front desk the person helping us, Michaela, became flustered because we were assigned an adjoining room. She apologized profusely and gave us a different room in the same area but that was adjoining also. However instead of just saying "tough luck" she went over the top and upgraded us to a suite. We looked at 2 different rooms and she gave us the one right on the beach. That is the type of service I would expect from a hotel like this. This room was absolutely perfect!! The rest of the stay was just as nice. The guy's at the pool did not stop moving. They brought sliced cucumbers for my wife and her friend to put on their eyes, cleaned their sun glasses and basically made sure their time at the pool was relaxing and fun. The bed was very easy to sleep in and the AC worked non stop and the room was nice and cool. We really did not eat at the hotel, too many other options in town. The drinks and bar food were good though. Another great thing about the bar is that they had Sunday ticket so we could watch all the NFL games as well as the baseball playoffs. We have already started to plan our next trip to the Casa Marina. It is close enough to the fun in down town, but far enough away where it isn't a noise problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort, wonderful help!”
Reviews.Author: Katie T
Reviews.Content: The resort is amazing in and of itselt and the staff is amazing. In particular, John Hertline, a bell hop for the resort, did an excellent job making sure myself and those in my party were taken care of and well equiped to go out into Key West (getting us taxis, telling us places to go, etc.) I will definitely suggest this hotel to anyone looking for a getaway in Key West. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: hugz415
Reviews.Content: This was by far the nicest place I have ever stayed. And I mean both the property and the people! The hotel is gorgeous and we loved that it has a history. When I walked out of the lobby towards the beach/pool, my jaw dropped. The photos do not do this place justice. The fountains and palm trees that line the walkway to the beach are the perfect welcome to the property. When we checked in, we were early for check-in but our room was ready and they also upgraded us! We found our room with no trouble. We had room 299, which had a nice sized living area and separate bedroom. It also had a small balcony - not much of a view but since we were not expecting to have one in the first place we were not complaining! The bathroom isn't huge but was plenty of room for my husband and I. We spent alot of time at the pool. If you stay here, so will you because you will never want to leave! The H20 Concierge guys were awesome! Rob and John addressed our every need - cleaning our sunglasses, offering cold towels and my husbands favorite - the 2pm popsicles! We had quite a few cocktails at the Sun-Sun bar and the staff there was also excellent. Jan, Darin and Suzanne all made delicious drinks and were very friendly. I also had a blissful deep tissue massage at the beach cabana with Josh. He did a wonderful job and told me step by step why he was targeting a certain area and gave me some helpful tips to understand how my muscles interact. I left feeling refreshed and relaxed. The staff at Casa Marina are truly service professionals. They are well trained, friendly and extremely accommodating. I cannot wait to come back. My husband and I were thoroughly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “This property is AMAZING! The beach staff is world class.”
Reviews.Author: Barry B
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Marina for a weekend get away. When I arried, my room was not ready. I was invited to use the beach facilities. To my surprise, it was Bike Week (Poker Run). The desk alerted me and assured me thaty they have made arrangements to insure a pleasant stay. While on the beach, I met a pool attendant named John who gave me the low down on the property and the island. From minute one, John was accomodating without being intrusive (down to scented, frozen cloths). The desk called that my room was ready and transferred my luggage. Before my departure from the beach, John invited me to experience some of the water sports that the Beach Concession offers. He invited me for a Wave Runner island tour. Two days later, I took John up on the invitation. I met John and Tom in the morning along with a couple from NY. WOW!!! What an awesome experience!!! Tom (English gentleman) and John shared their vast knowledge and hospitality with the four folks in my group. No charge for the Dolphin sighting. In closing, the ENTIRE staff of Casa Marina are world class. The valet, Cliff N. was exceptionally professional and detail oriented. The desk staff were present, attentative and professional. HIGHEST kudos for John and Tom at the beach sport concession. When you visit CM, stop by and ask for John. He is a true professional with a vast knowledge and a sensibility for what true high line hospitality is all about. I will DEFINATELY be back to visit and relax at CM.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: UniqueandMonogrammed
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. The staff are very friendly, in particular, Scuba Steve and bellhop Jonathan Hertline. The rooms are small but nice. Doesn't matter much because you don't want to waste a single minute in the room when you could be out and about in Key West. The pools were great. The only real downer for me were the slick tiles that were slippery as ice if they are you were wet.

Reviews.Title: “Mark on the beach”
Reviews.Author: acheek2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is wonderful as always. Mark who handles the beach/pool needs is extremely professional and personal. He made our visit a dream come true. We really enjoy the sun and water and Mark made it perfect. We will return in the near future to relax and enjoy the beach. Mark made this a true 5 star vacation in paradise. Thanks, Alan

Reviews.Title: “Best beach in Key West”
Reviews.Author: betsy c
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in early August 2011. The resort is beautiful, relaxed and the entire staff was fantastic. The beach is the best in Key West. Had a delicious meal at the outdoor restaurant and room service is pretty good too! You are a short walk to Louie's Backyard restaurant which is excellent. I expect to vacation in Key West again in the near future and I will book with Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Mark and Beach staff make visit here A++”
Reviews.Author: Ann D
Reviews.Content: We loved our visit to the Casa Marina! We most enjoyed our days on the beach...the property is absolutely beautiful and Mark and his staff ( John and Graham) made our days truly extraordinary! They provide towels, umbrellas, Ice cold cloths, popsicles...and all are complementary of the beach service! A visit here .......truly Paradise!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jessie C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for our honeymoon and the property was absolutely breathtaking. The beach was incredible and the service was excellent. We stayed in the Ocean Vista One Bedroom Suite. It was spacious and comfortable, the bed literally felt like you were sleeping in a cloud and the view was amazing as the rooms are right on the ocean. We drove all around the island and I have to say this was the best hotel by far on the entire island. We have traveled to several different places and stayed at numerous hotels and this hotel was the only hotel that we said we were absolutely coming back to.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Debbi S
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Casa Marina Resort in Key West, Florida. Our son had vacationed at the resort several months earlier with his fiance. They decided to hold their wedding at this beautiful hotel. We brought 32 guests for the event. We were all treated like royalty. We heard the same remark from guests we met at the beach, the pool, and the bar. No one had a negative thing to say about the staff or the hotel. The staff at the front desk were helpful, friendly, and went out of their way to accomodate our every need. If you need a taxi, the bell hops and valets will have one for you within 10 minutes. And very inexpensive, too. The pool attendants waited on us constantly. We had towels, water, drinks, etc. without ever having to ask twice. Rob was my personal favorite. He's witty, friendly, and takes the time to get to know your needs. The bartenders at the Sun Sun were wonderful! Darren was my favorite. He would personally deliver your food, drinks, etc. Very friendly and funny. And --- they ask your first name and remember it! Made us all feel special and appreciated. The wedding coordinator was fabulous! It rained all day on our son's wedding day. He had planned an outdoor beach wedding at 6 PM. The coordinator had the ball room set up and readyjust in case we needed it. At 5:45, my son made the decision that his fiance was going to have her beach wedding even if we had to stand in the rain. The coordinator and the hotel staff scurried to set up everything outdoors and were waiting with umbrellas to hold over everyone. The wedding started on time, the rain stopped immediately, the sun came out, and we had a beautiful rainbow during the entire ceremony! Gorgeous.... The rooms are spotless, the beds are comfy, free espresso in your room, flat screen TV's, luxurious soaps, shampoos, lotions, etc., The housekeeping staff makes sure you have fresh towels, your bed is made and turned down at night, and replenish the espresso, cups, and water every morning. The balconies have chairs and a table. Our room was a one bedroom suite with a dining area, a living room, a large bathroom, and a good sized separate bedroom. Very tastefully decorated, too. I would recommend this hotel to everyone! We had three little ones with us. 4, 5, and 6 years old. They had a blast! The hotel even has licensed babysitters --- thank you!!! We used this service on one evening so the adults to go on a very fun bar crawl down Duval Street. The entertainment in Key West is nonstop. There's something for everyone's pleasure. We're definitely going back. SOON!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for luxury travelers accustomed to Manhatten/Euro service. Loved it. Very elegant casual resort! Best on the isle!”
Reviews.Author: Cassanita
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic time! Loved our room (ocean vista with private terrace overlooking the reflecting pools and ocean backdrop), lovely service (Scuba Steve is so sweet and hospitable!! Concierge Kathy and Stacey were quite helpful). Jetski tour with Tom was amazing!! Arranged through the concierge, left from the hotel pier. Had a spectacular view of the new navy ship, encountered a pack of breeding dolphins, and a relaxing time at the sand bar. Very nice. Highly recommended. Ideal for luxury travelers who are used to Euro/Manhatten style amenities and service but would like to see the casual styling of Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil R&R..”
Reviews.Author: GeorgieAnn H
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at Casa Marina for convention and stay was very enjoyable. All staff was extremely cordial and accommodating, especially the time spent poolside and on the beach. Graham and Steve were exceptional in their poolside services in making our stay a very relaxing and luxurious experience. Couldn't have been more pleased with the stay! Thanks~

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: susiegrneyes
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Casa Marina on 09/23/2011. We were booked in an island view room. They only had double beds available, so I opted to upgrade to a king ocean view room for $30.00 more a night. Our room was in the original building on the third floor. The room was very small. The bathroom had only a shower and no tub. The room had three small windows that did not open. There was also a tiny television. Our room looked nothing like the ocean view rooms advertised on the website. The hotel claims that the bed was a california king, but it was the same size as the queen I have at home. We asked to be moved to a different room, but the hotel was booked and could not move us. We left for dinner for about an hour. When we came back there was a fruit plate in the room with a card with someone else's name on it. The final straw for me was that there were ants all over the fruit plate. I promptly went down to the front desk and cancelled my reservation. We stayed at the Marriot beachside instead and had a much better experience for $30 less per night.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot! and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Ticatfan
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night using Hilton points, got a room in the old tower, no view, but that's ok, someone has to get those rooms. Overall the hotel was very nice, a luxury feel to it for sure. The gentleman that checked us in was great, and the pool staff was excellent as well. On the negative side, the beach here stinks, but that's Key West's beaches, they have a little dock to go out into some sand bottom water in the ocean, but unfortunately the Mrs. got stung by a Jellyfish (lots in the water right now) but Will from the pool staff was great and helped treat it ASAP. Only other negative was there was no shuttle to downtown, thus we had to pay for a cab to and from, for a luxury 5 star resort a courtesy shuttle should be a give, 2 and 3 star hotels have one. Overall though, a nice place and a nice stay, for $350, maybe not though......

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay”
Reviews.Author: jate7579
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel since I was a very yound kid. It changed owners since I been coming here but it hasn't lost its great service with luxiouious amenities and high quality standards. I have stayed at many other locations on Key West but this is by far my resort of choice. It is Family oriented but not overwheleming with children. It creates the Key West rich Island feel thru the spanish style architecture and the dark woods used in the interior design of this hotel. The pool has chillers so a jump in the water will actually cool you off in the hot hot summers. Its close to the Southernmost Point of KW and far enough away from Duval Street and Mallorey Square that you could enjoy the stroll downtown or hop in a cab. It has a private beach and you can go snorkling right off of their property. Great poolside service and food & drinks are delicious. Lie in a hammock on the property or rent a waverunner or a hobicat for the day. It's a great resort to relax pool/beachside at and if you want adventure, Duval Street is only a few blocks away...

Reviews.Title: “wonderful holiday”
Reviews.Author: susan_jackson89
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the casa marina for 7night and it was wonderful. The staff were excellant and so friendly. The pool staff were wonderful particularly scuba steve and mark on the beach. There were poolside treats all day long you felt as though you were in a luxury spa. We have never spent so much time by an hotel pool, but why go anywhere else when you are treat so well. Also the hotel food is excellant and reasonably priced. If you want a great holiday we highly recommend this hotel. Susan and Barry, Killamarsh, U.K

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Paridise”
Reviews.Author: Nick K
Reviews.Content: I have been vacationing in Key West for the past four years, two years ago I found a real jewel in the Casa Marina Resort. The resort is not only beautiful and well kept, but the staff from check in to pool services is excellent. I cannot imagine staying elsewhere when vacationing in Key West. I want to give an extra thank you to Tyler, Jon and Graham in beach pool services, they were very attentive made me feel like royality.

Reviews.Title: “the most amazing place to stay”
Reviews.Author: karen585
Reviews.Content: i could not say one bad thing about the casa marina it was amazing from the time we arrived to the time we left staff were so friendly and helpful would i stay there again cant wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Mark and the cabana staff made our vacation”
Reviews.Author: yipeeee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the casa for four days it was awesome. From checkiin with evelyn to all the little treats poolside, mark and his staff made our stay. The best stay we have ever had at any hotel period. We can't wait to come back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “unscheduled vacation”
Reviews.Author: jon b
Reviews.Content: In a recent trip to the Keys looking for property, we stumbled upon the Casa Marina. We were trying to find a hotel for a few nights then move on to other islands to explore. The experience the first day/night was excellent. The grounds, room and staff were superior to other resorts we have stayed. We extended our stay all week and are planning another trip back to the Casa Marina before the years out. Scuba Steve tended to our needs on the beach and made the experience all the better.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Lauren R
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Casa a couple of weeks ago and had a wonderful time! It was our first getaway after having our 2nd baby and it was perfect for what we needed. The hotel staff was very helpful and catered to our every need. Caroline at the concierge desk was very pleasant to work with and assisted in getting all of our extra activities and dinner reservations booked. We had actually booked the trip for Labor Day weekend, but due to unforseen circumstances, we had to rebook for later in September. She was very helpful in getting all our reservations changed when we had to reschedule. Our favorite part of the resort was the pool and the hammocks down on the beach. The hammocks were perfect for catching a late afternoon nap. We especially enjoyed the pool bar and our favorite bartenders Jan & Suzanne. Suzanne was especially FANTASTIC! We enjoyed her chocolate pretzel shot creation as well as her friendly service! She made us feel right at home. We even got to hang a bit with Kevin! ;) We will definitely visit the Casa again, hopefully sooner than later! Thank you to everyone at the Casa Marina resort for making our trip a wonderful one!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to Relax”
Reviews.Author: Riversmom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in September of 2011. They were doing some renovations but other than taking a different route to get out of the hotel, you wouldn't have noticed. Everyone at the hotel was very pleasant and being a Waldorf of course the room was beautiful. I cannot say enough about the staff at the pool. Scuba Steve and Steven were great, they came around frequently with water so that we didn't dehydrate. Additionally, the cucumbers on the eyes were just what you needed after being in the sun for a while. The popsicles were also delicious. The sunset cruise with Captain Dave was also great. The concierce Ann came with us on the cruise and was graceful in explaining things in the Keys- her husband was a lot of fun too. I would recommend staying here to everyone, a little off the beaten path so have to drive to Duval street but that was okay with us.

Reviews.Title: “A Tropical Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BradBrian
Reviews.Content: Simply a gorgeous property and equally nice (and comfortable) rooms. Service is very good and there are all kinds of things to do on premises, including parasailing--etc. Clse to Duval Street area. This hotel also has unique history being it was originally established by Henry Flagler. Opt for at least one dinner by the pool at night(steak and lobster are really good) I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive and could be so much better......”
Reviews.Author: Magpiesnest
Reviews.Content: We went against the usual method of choosing a Hotel (Trip Advisor) and went on the advice of one friend who had a good experience here. I would say this could be a really nice resort overall, but choose your room carefully. Ours, described as a suite with a balcony, was dark and dingy and the smallest â€˜balconyâ€™ I had ever seen. The balcony wouldnâ€™t have been any good anyway as the â€˜viewâ€™ was completely blocked by trees that the hotel have planted right next to the side of the hotel. â€˜a small dark outside area - ideal for growing mushroomsâ€™ would have been a better description. The â€˜suiteâ€™ was very sparsely and cheaply furnished and the bathroom distinctly unimpressive. The bedroom would have won an award however for the loudest Air Con Unit â€“ the intake was so loud we had to switch it off overnight and bearing in mind we were on the top floor and one side was an inside courtyard and the other penned in by trees, there was no movement of air, so it was very uncomfortable. The small mini bar was empty. Another disappointing feature was car parking. Most people who arrive in Key West do so by car so I expect the hotels have decided itâ€™s a good easy opportunity to earn a bit more. We were there mid September but arrived in the dark. We were told we could park the car ourselves (there would be a $15 overnight charge) or valet park it for $20.00 per night. As we had just driven down from Ft Lauderdale I let the attendant park the car. When I got up the next day I realised the car had gone about 50 feet and was in an almost deserted car park with free street parking apparently available everywhere (The Casa Marina is further away from the â€˜actionâ€™ than most hotels as its in a predominantly residential area) There were of course some good things about this resort â€“ the pool areas were nice and the staff were attentive and water freely available. The beach was nice and clean. The public rooms were large but very sparsely furnished and it looked like it needed updating. The hot part of the breakfast wasnâ€™t the best - the ingredients (bacon, sausage) seemed low budget. The fruit and cereals were good. The outside eating areas were nice and lunch was very good. The highlight of our trip was the Jet Ski Tour which leaves from right next to the Casa Marina Beach but can be booked by anyone. It lasts two hours and goes right round the island with plenty of time to open the throttle and have a play â€“ great fun. Overall I would say very disappointing and way overpriced for the location and time of year. If I was forced to go again I would choose the best (most expensive?) room I could with a sea view. If you canâ€™t do that I would choose another resort off trip advisor as there are plenty in better position (closer to the action) â€“ we would have expected more for $460 a night (including $20 parking) and I think it can easily be achieved elsewhere in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Overall - average.”
Reviews.Author: Janet176
Reviews.Content: We don't normally stay in "resort" type hotels - but we chose this one as my husband loves jetbiking and the hotel has bikes to rent directly on the beach. Arrival was a bit chaotic. We were in Florida for 10 days but our 2 nights happened to co-incide with Friday and Saturday nights when it seemed many people headed down to Key West for the weekend. The check-in staff seemed a bit flustered and the lady who checked us in seemed to be on "automatic" asking us 3 times if we'd had a good trip down. Our room wasn't ready so she took my mobile number and said they'd call us when it was. So we headed off to the bar for a couple of drinks. 2 hours later, still no phone call so we headed back to reception to be told that our room was ready and no reason given for not ringing. Our room was a fair size - but quite dark and dingy being down the side of the hotel. The bathroom was small and the water in the shower was tepid at best. The best part has to be the beach and pool - and the guys that work out there. They were really nice and very helpful, organising towels and loungers and bringing round ice lollies, iced cucumbers and frozen towels. My husband went out on a 2 hour jetski trip and had the time of his life. We didn't eat at the restaurant - but no-one else seemed to either. There was never really anyone eating in there when we passed. All in all, an average stay. From what I picked up I felt that if you were a Hilton Honours Gold Card holder then you got all the extras and the attention. Everyone else has to fit in behind. It's just a pity that some of the Gold Card Members didn't have more manners and could learn to say Thank You when someone held the door open for them.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, ocean views....paradise!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mzei
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a pampered 6 days at the Casa Marina and we cannot think of one thing that could have been better. The hotel service was over the top!!! We found the rooms to be clean and comfortable. The rooms were not overly fancy but after all you are there to enjoy the outdoors, which we did fully! Loved the beach, pool and the food was amazing. The pool service was OVER THE TOP. Steven and Scuba Steve and Rob made sure that every day we were treated like royalty!! I have never felt so well taken care of and waited on and have never enjoyed staying at a hotel as much as the Casa Marina. We enjoyed all the Barefoot Billy tours located right on property from the great island jet sky tour with Ryan and the convenient bike rental. We had a wonderful time and are certain to make this a yearly event for ourselves. We highly recommend the Casa!

Reviews.Title: “Overall very good but a couple of niggles”
Reviews.Author: PaulaBrightonUK
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from a 7 night stay. We stayed here several years ago and had been given a room with balcony as standard. This time we were told at check-in that a balcony would be an extra $75 per night, which was a disappointing start to the holiday. On the whole we had a good experience, the room (257) was clean and the bed comfortable. It was very noisy though as it overlooked the generators so we did not sleep well all week. We had already changed rooms once as the original one we were given was so small we asked to be moved. We didn't feel comfortable asking to move again so we put up with it all week. On our last day we had a very long overnight journey back to the UK that didn't commence until late afternoon so we were hoping to arrange late checkout or a courtesy room to shower in. We were told this was not possible and didn't feel any empathy from the receptionist. We had to shower at the edge of the swimming pool and dress in the public restrooms which we were emabarrassed to do. For a hotel of this standing we expected better. The pool staff were very attentive, in particular Scuba Steve and Rob.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top Service”
Reviews.Author: Djlambert
Reviews.Content: We attended a professional conference at this hotel and were there for a week. The entire staff were all very friendly and went out of their way to make our stay fantastic. The pool waitstaff were so great...they cleaned our sunglasses, brought ice water and basically treated us like royalty. I have traveled all over the country and to other Carribean resorts and have never had such wonderful service. The hotel is beautiful, clean and has so much wonderful history. The grounds including the pool are exquisite and so clean. The food....amazing! We ate fish tacos every chance we could at the SunSun restaurant. I would say that overall, Key West is not a very kid friendly place to go, but if you are with your spouse, it makes a fun getaway. The Casa Marina is a wonderfully romantic place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “25th Anniversary Could not have been better!!!”
Reviews.Author: John O
Reviews.Content: We recently spent our 25th wedding anniversary at the Casa Marina. We could not have been happier from the minute that we walked into the lobby. The staff could not have been friendlier or more helpful. I emailed ahead and the VIP manager was extremely helpful, provided helpful informatin before we even left and even provided a wonderful welcome package for our special day. Our room was a slice of heaven. OK, we did spend a small amount to upgrade to a room with a full patio, lounge chairs, etc and it was totally worth it! We had coffee and breakfast most mornings on the patio (in our provided robes) looking over the resort and the beautiful ocean. The grounds were impecable and the staff was there for every need you could want. We spent each day lying in the hammock on the beach while being brought towels, popsicles and the "drink of the day". There is a bar overlooking the ocean (which we spent way too much time at) and the pool was incredilblly clean and well-maintained. They have an "H2O Concierge to get you towels, drinks, food or anything you want - it is heaven. Finally, you are staying at one of the most beautiful hoels in the Keys and it is within walking distance of Duval Street - we are walkers and actually walked all the way to Mallory Square. It was a long walk but was an event in itself. To get to see more of Key West a little easier and quicker we rented bikes for the rest of the stay - right at the hotel!!! I want to say that I am a very frequent travelor (I travel for a living) and have stayed at many hotels around the world. The Casa Marina ranks right up there with any five-star hotel that I have ever stayed. I did my research and looked at a lot of hotels and reviews. I finally decided on the Casa Marina and can only say to ignore anything bad you might read about this hotel (some people are never satisfied with anything). I am here to tell you that there were tears shed when we left and we are already talking about returning - mostly because of our experience at the Casa Marina. The worst part of staying at the Casa Marina is that, eventually, you have to leave. I want to personally thank the VIP manager, the lobby staff, the food service personnel and especially the outdoor bar and H2) concierge staff who we worked to death. Thanks to all at the Casa Marina for a SPECTACULAR time and a memorable 25th Wedding Anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Girls Weekend!!”
Reviews.Author: Diane K
Reviews.Content: From the minute we checked in we were treated like royalty. The staff was friendly and helpful........and the facility was impecable. The rooms were very spacious and very clean. Attention is paid to every detail. I was great having the staff come by a couple times a day asking to refresh your towels! Pool staff were on their A Game. They catered to your every need from serving water throughout the day, to refreshing cool face towels to popcicles to cleaning your sunglasses...they were the best. We went on the catamaran which was a wonderful and relaxing evening. The Captain and the staff were again on top of everything you need. We also went on the 2 hour Jet Ski Tour. I have been on similar types of tours in the past but Nikko and Tom make this experience over the top. I could not have asked for a better location to get together with my bestest of friends. Thanks to All!!

Reviews.Title: “Spa al Mare”
Reviews.Author: 317bogie
Reviews.Content: We used the spa services of Judith and Lucy this Sunday. They were the best! Probably some of the best massage therapists we have ever had. My huband and I would recommend them if yu want a professional and fabulous spa treatment!

Reviews.Title: “Horrible customer service! Vacation Ruined!”
Reviews.Author: misbel
Reviews.Content: After spending 5 months planning our getaway and 3.5 hours driving, we arrive to the hotel to find that we don't have the room we reserved and PAID for 5 months ago. When we arrived they check us in and gave us our keys. When we went up to our room, it was not the one-bedroom ocean view that we had paid for. It was a tiny room with a view of the roof below (#271). When we go downstairs to tell them there must be a mistake, they tell us they have nothing else and we have to stay there or in a room that is missing a wall!! Really?! They lied to us and didn't tell us that our room wasn't available from the beginning. They tried to accommodate us by charging us 119 for the room instead of the 369 that we had already paid for and that they could move us the next day to the suite. At this point our vacation was ruined. To us the hotel we stay in is a big part of our vacation and that is why we book ocean view at a Waldorf property. They next day when we go to the front desk we are given the worst customer service I have ever received. Maria Bennett has no idea how to deal with people. She said she could not give us the suite for the same price as the other room and that we would have to pay the regular price. Then she said she would take off $14. Big deal...its not the money, I was planning on spending it anyways when I booked this location. Then she tells us that we can either, stay in our current room for the current price, move to the suite for a discount of $14 off the suite price or CHECK OUT!! She said we had to hurry and make our decision because she had other customers to help. I think that if we had to spend the day before and that morning trying to get the correct room she could at least given us her time with a smile. So we took an offer we couldn't refuse and checked out to another hotel (Ocean Key) for the night. We were basically offered nothing for their mistake. Yea they "knocked off" 200 for the horrible room we stayed in, but we paid what it was worth. They charged us one night ahead of time so that they could guarantee that we would show up. What guarantee do we get that we are going to get the room we PAID for?? On a side note, the room we received had a welcome platter of chocolates and a card addressed to another guest, who by coincidence, we know. He says that when he got there he requested an upgrade. Did he get our room? I must also mention the Evelyn Summers was the girl trying to help us before Maria took over and she was very pleasant and understanding of our situation. I only wish she would have been able to help us instead of Maria Bennett. As for the hotel property and amenities, I can not comment because unfortunately we did not get to enjoy them. We did have the breakfast buffet on Sunday and it was very good, with great service. Will not be back anytime soon :(

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back... didn't want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: ch0c_ice99
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of spending a week at the Casa Marina and enjoyed every minute of it... on arrival as we were on honey moon we were upgraded to the most fabulous ground floor suite which literally opened it's balcony onto the beach.. We want to pay tribute to all of the staff who were courteous and helpful at all times but especially to the two pool/beach side guys Graham and Tyler, they kept us entertained everyday catering to our every need - they made a great holiday even better! Helena & Maureen

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying life”
Reviews.Author: Jane T
Reviews.Content: The all the staff at Casa Marina Resort were very attentive. I would like to thank the pool service with Jon, Graham and Rob was the greatest and your breakfast staffer, Mohamed was the best. It was a great time and did not want to leave. Thank you for making my week very rememberable.

Reviews.Title: “Jetson's”
Reviews.Author: GMTART
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable and relaxing Staff was accomadatiing especially Jon and Gram from beach pool services Mohamand at the breakfast buffet was friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Short but gorgeous stay”
Reviews.Author: sarsyspony
Reviews.Content: The staff were absolutely impeccable. They even went above and beyond when my companion was suffering from gastroesophageal issues, when we arrived one evening after 23:00. They immediately obliged by accessing the little convenience store that 'fortunately' supplied the necessary relief medication. Yes, the beaches do have some seaweed, but it is definately not a major deterrant. The waters are crystal clear and warm. The brown pelicans are an absolute delight to watch as they fish close by. The Osprey and the Iguana are also a treat to observe. Breakfast was rather expensive but the buffet selection was delightful. Location was ideal. Peaceful. Close to Duval St. and the airport. Then at this time of year... not many children. There were a couple of abnoxious young Germans who tend to spoil any romantic atmosphere, with their racial and personal comments - as usual! No fault of the facility of course! Then, many thanks to Rob, who besides being a marvellous attendent at the pool, managed to get us booked with a sunset-dolphin cruise on our last evening. We were professionally advised about the touristic scavenging of the dolphin industry and didn't want to disturb the dolphins in their natual habitat. The trip sounded amazing. Unfortunately when we arrived to check in at Sunrise tours, the cruise was cancelled due to lack of participation. Very upsetting, but again, not fault of the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Key West was the BEST!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: was our first trip to Key West and cant wait to go back. The Casa Marina is one of the best places I have ever stayed, from day 1, the employees were all very nice, and helpful, room was very nice, and clean. like i said all of the staff were top notch, especially Scuba Steve, Key West's oldest Cabana boy LOL, he was very informative, pointed out some very good restaraunts to try out. Scuba Steve Hog Fish was awesome, Thanks!!! Also the jet ski tour around Key West is a must do, our guides were very friendly, helpful, and pointed out alot of cool things. The trip can be booked in the hotel lobby and leaves right from the beach at the hotel. Also while in Key West our group (7) booked a scuba diving trip with Captains Corner [--] @ 125 Ann St. we took their resort course which included training, and two, one tank (45 min-1hr each) dives out on the reef, that was another must do. Those guys were also top notch, made us all feel very comfortable and safe, we had a blast!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ticks all the boxes but lacks the flare you would expect from a Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: sgwlmm
Reviews.Content: It's an odd one this one...Location is great if you want to be slightly away from all the hussle from Duval Street and want nice pools. The beach does disappoint hugely and while we were there there was so much sea weed on the sand it was unpleasant to walk on and it STINKS! The staff are lovely and the whole place is kept very clean and tidy at all times. The pool guys are especially nice, Graham in particular. (the Irish one). The food, although nothing is wrong with it, is pretty unremarkable. The room was very small and the bathroom in particular needed some modernisation. The bed had a cheap base and made a lot of noise. The hotel has different wings to it and the main central section seemed far superior to the other wings so bear this in mind when booking. Although we enjoyed our time there, it is not what I expected for the chain or the money and I would not go back. The watersports department on the other hand were superb and I will review them separately as they made our stay in Key West memorable. They are called "Barefoot Billy's"

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: qube2010
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Marina on a day trip from Miami. Property is very clean, hotel staff very helpful and responsive. The hotel has its own beach. Very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Always a pleasure to return”
Reviews.Author: danoli516
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina always beckons you back for another visit. Maria at the front desk starts things off in a special welcoming way. Don at the concierge knows the island of Key West better than most. Jon on the beach remembers where you want your chair an makes sure it is ready for you. They combine to make the beautiful location even more special. The view from the ocean front rooms is second to none and the island is small enough to walk almost everywhere. I am a returning visitor to the hotel and am already looking forward to my next stay.

Reviews.Title: “The beach staff were Awesome, thanks to Mark!”
Reviews.Author: Georgia H
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, we never expected to be treated so well. We met Mark Gray, the beach attendant and from the time we got there until the time we left, he made sure that we had everything that we needed! We had a slight problem with our room and needed more towels and we forgot our sunscreen, Mark made sure not only did we have that and more, but checked on us regularly to make sure we had a good time. So, thank you Mark and the Waldorf Astoria for making our trip to Key West memorable.

Reviews.Title: “MARK THE CABANA BOY MADE OUR VACATION!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia C
Reviews.Content: From the time we stepped on the beach everyday until checkout Mark was there to accomodate our every wish. From restaraunts to water sports he was spot on. The frozen towels, popsicles, sunglass cleaning, drink of the day, champagne for you skin and chilled cucumbers I have NEVER experienced this level of service at any other resort!!!! Beautiful well maintained facility, and Mark's service made our vacation. Can't wait to return, we have already booked next trip because of Mark. We have already recommended Mark and your resort to all of our friends and business associates. THANK YOU MARK, SEE YOU SOON!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best 40th ever!”
Reviews.Author: Southerngirl37
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled for our second time to Casa Marina Resort with 13 other of my wonderful friends for my 40th. Last time we were there was for our anniversary and we were looking for a romantic vacation. We definitely found it at Casa. This time, we were looking for fun adult time, excellent drinks by the pool, and time away from the kiddos. Not only were we pampered with chair setup for 15 in the sand every day, but we were waited on hand and foot. From the 11:00 "drink of the day" offering, to popcicles in the afternoon, and scented cold towels late in the day- it was perfect. I also enjoyed an outdoor massage by the water which was heavenly. We rounded out our trip with a dinner that was arranged right on the beach at sunset. If you want the fun key-west nights on Duval at the same time as pampered, luxury during the day in a more quiet locale, Casa Marina is a perfect spot!

Reviews.Title: “great birthday getaway”
Reviews.Author: particular-diner
Reviews.Content: My wife had a special birthday coming up and we decided to return to Casa Marina because of the positive experience we had in February. The staff was terrific and made our trip a special one. Thanks to the "two Steves" at the pool who catered to us, Ellen and Judy who provided a wonderful couples massage, the wait staff at the restaurants & pool and John who enables this staff to excel. The resort is a classic facility with all the right services for our getaway Thank you Pat and Mike

Reviews.Title: “Amazing! Amazing! Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Texas1855
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed here for Labor Day weekend and I could not have picked a more perfect location for our vacation!!! Scuba Steve was amazing! I had a bead of sweat coming off my forehead and he was there with a frozen towel laced with eucalyptus oil! My sunglasses were smudged he was there with glass cleaner!! Stacey at the concierge desk was amazing!!! every recommendation was perfect!! I have never written a review for anything, but this place was worth it!! I could not have picked a better place. The location was perfect. Not too close to Deval but close enough to get to it when you wanted! The beach was perfect with thw hammocks and service! The room was amazing! Perfect! I've stayed all over the world and this was my favorite place by far!! Most amazing vacation ever!! My girlfriend had the time of her life!! Thank you Casa!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Outstanding Staff at the beach and Pool bar”
Reviews.Author: Larry P
Reviews.Content: I had a conversation with Tyler, Steven and Mark while lounging at the beach about arriving to KW and my front bridge broke and no emergency dentists available, they spoke to Robin from the bar who has a dentist friend who came to the hotel on her day off and took me to her office and she was able to fix me up so I could enjoy my vacation with a smile. Great team here that really cared about me and wanted me to enjoy my stay. You guys are the greatest and you really know how to make the guest feel welcome and comfortable. The frozen washcloths are off the chain and I love KW and this hotel and staff, I will be back next year and the first drink is on me.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room, pool, beaches, food and staff.”
Reviews.Author: KeyLimeDonegal
Reviews.Content: Just after a 4 night stay at the Casa Marina resort (was booked for 3 nights but stayed an extra night as was such a great place). Had a fantastic time spent most of our time relaxing by the pool and beach.the pool staff especially made our stay memorable , handing out little treats during the day such as cold face cloths, free drinks of the day and even polishing our sun glasses! Jon-Graham was the most remarkable attendant with his close eye for detail, always making us feel welcome and tending to our every need and more. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: Reviewit2
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice and we had no problems. Things I would have like to know ahead of time: The beach area is not nice and I did not go in the water (although there were some people in). The shore was rocky and the water was just not appealing. There is free street parking if you don't want to pay the daily parking fee. There is a nice gym and the pool(s) area is nice. There is supposedly free internet, however we were asked to pay to sign in so we just didn't use it. It is a bit of distance from the Mallory Square area and the docks too. Not a problem on bikes though.

Reviews.Title: “what you would expect from a waldorf property .”
Reviews.Author: walter b
Reviews.Content: everything in place , room was perfect ,clean . outstanding service . even in a crisis situation " water leaking from ceiling and breakfast dining area " the staff moved quickly and efficiently to resolve the problem .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: peggyharrell
Reviews.Content: This was a return to Casa Marina! I don't think you'll find any other resort in Key West with a nicer beach! This is a good location, we always walk everywhere in Key West. We walked to Blue Heaven for breakfast every morning, and then in the evenings we walked downtown for all the festivities. This is a modern, up to date facility with two wonderful pools and plenty of room to spread out. I highly recommend Casa Marina for couples, families or anyway you like to travel. I would even go there alone if I just wanted to get away and relax!

Reviews.Title: “Excellence on every level a true Gem”
Reviews.Author: trina1968
Reviews.Content: My husband planned a surprise vacation @ this outstanding resort in Key West and it far exceeded all of our expectations. From check in to check out the service was fantastic. The resort was beautiful and conveniently layed out. Patrick @ the reception desk facilitated the checkin and out process. Robin in Concierge and Fernando helped set up a special Anniversary surprise for my Husband @ dinner without a blink of an eye. The pampering @ the pool made us feel like we were VIP's the little touches like the complimentary fruity cocktails on arrival to the pool deck and the delicious Ice pops and iced towels were a treat. The pool bar service was friendly and lively overlooking the most spectacular waterfront palm tree lined view. We thoroughly enjoyed the Toes in the Sand dining experience on the Beach and Pier Joe the chef created a delicious meal and Gloria our server couldn't have been more attentive. Anyone looking for a truly distinctive vacation Casa Marina will not disaappoint I cannot wait to return. Kudos to the staff and Management for making our trip so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Location was beautiful. People were fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Charherbert
Reviews.Content: Both Tyler and Rob were wonderful when we hung out at the beach and pool. Robin was great when we hung out at the bar. All of the service was fantastict. The hotel was beautiful and the scenery was breath taking. Had a fabulous time. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Just back from a fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: stan1989
Reviews.Content: Starting from patrick at the front desk who was great and made our trip a memorable one. The resort was beautiful and one of my favorite places to stay. The beach and pool staff were awesome. Scuba steve brought out cucumbers and placed them on the guest eyes along with providing frozen scented towels that were heavenly in the tropical heat. Sunset cruise was outstanding and a must do when visiting key west. All and all a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort!”
Reviews.Author: luvtogoNc
Reviews.Content: We traveled with another couple to the Casa Marina for a quick weekend getaway. From the first meeting with the valet until we last farwell with the front desk, we had a great trip! The Casa Grande Ocean Vista room was very clean and well decorated. Loved the private balcony and view! Service on the beach and pool side could not be better! Graham had your chair, towels, table & umbrella in just the right spot on the beach. Mark made sure to keep the beach fun. All the beach services and attendents----sunglasses cleaning, cucumber water cool down, frozen towels, frozen treats, and water---made for a relaxing day. Around the pool and on the beach Onur took care of anything we needed from the bar or resturant. He was one of the best servers we have ever had!!! He would think of what we needed before we would ask! Everything was taken care of with friendly smile. The Casa Marina was an unexpected gem in Key West! As beautiful as the Carribean without leaving the USA. We look forward to our next trip. Additional note around the island: Blue Heaven for breakfast, Hot Tin Roof (thanks Stacy at the conciegre desk) for dinner, & Better Than Sex for dessert (make reservations it is worth the calories!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Jet ski crew were rock stars!”
Reviews.Author: dowdiva
Reviews.Content: Went on the hotel jet ski tour with Tom and Nikko. Guys were awesome! Customer service was great and they could not have been more helpful. Such a great way to explore the keys. Thanks guys and looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the 'best'... we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Becky A
Reviews.Content: Beautiful view, wonderful accommodations, and fabulous location for an easy walk to Duval Street! The resort special, 'Key Lime Pina Colada' and 'Conch Fritter' was our welcome gift! Delicious and refreshing! Then off to the hammocks, pool, piers, and beach! So Relaxing and something to do for everyone! Our breakfast was made special by 'Susie' from Annapolis. Not only was she attentive but very accomadating to our wishes. Hot coffee and a perfect breakfast started our day on a very pleasent note! We'll stay longer next time!

Reviews.Title: “THE ABSOLUTE BEST PLACE TO STAY IN KEY WEST!!!”
Reviews.Author: anniversaryinfl
Reviews.Content: This is the fourth stay at Casa Marina and the first since the Waldorf has taken over. I always loved this resort from the time the Marriott and then Wyndom owned it, but it is better than ever now!! Just like being in the Carribean and then you can be on Duvall St in 5 minutes for all the craziness. I would not stay any other place in Key West. The service is superb, especially Steve, the pool attendant, what a great employee!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Staff; Ok Hotel; Terrible food”
Reviews.Author: traceynawrot
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the labor day weekend. The hotel has probably the best location on the beach. This beach is much better than the beach at the sister property, The Reach. If lounging on the beach is your main priority, then this is the right place for you. Scubba Steve and Rob will hook you up with fresh, clean towels, hammock and a lounge chair, cold cucumbers for your eyes, plenty of ice water to keep you cool, popsicles and ice cold scented towels in the late afternoon.
