Those guys are great. However, the hammocks are filthy and should be cleaned/disinfected more often. The bar staff is also pretty cool. Rooms are nothing really special but who spends time in their hotel room when on the beach anyway? My biggest complaint about this place is the food. We ordered the mahi mahi tacos for lunch and after about 30 minutes they finally arrived and were under cooked and just thrown together. We also opted to have dinner at the hotel on the beach and, while the setting is nice, the food is terrible and extremely over priced for the quality. I ordered the sea scallop appetizer to start and indicated to our waiter that we'd be sharing it (there were two of us) and you'd think he'd mention that they serve ONLY one sea scallop at a price of $16! The sea scallop they served was too small to share. I also ordered the steak frites which is basically strips of steak served with french fries for like $28. NOT worth the price. I ordered my steak medium well but it came out over cooked and tough. The french fries were soggy with grease. Almost like they cooked them earlier in the day, let them sit out for a period of time, and then tried to recook them. I mentioned to our waiter that I was unhappy with my meal and that the french fries were soggy and he basically dismissed my complaint and brought out yet another plate of equally greasy french fries. Casa Marina is a nice resort and management should take pride in the food they serve. To the Management at the Casa Marina - your kitchen needs help. The food is poor quality. Your resort is very nice but you need to bring your kitchen staff up to par with the rest of the resort. The menu prices for dinner are ridiculously overpriced for the quality of food coming out of your kitchen. You are best to advise your guests to walk around the corner and enjoy a dinner that is both quality, and affordable, at Salute. Perhaps you need to talk their chef into coming over to work in your resort's kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort ..... just lacking a little polish!”
Reviews.Author: Sherie1408
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in a 2br ocean front suite, when we arrived - the first room that we were given was far from ocean front. However the staff did move us to another room - with a amazing view of the ocean. First impression was WOW! It really is an icon in Key West. It is just lacking or a little off in many areas that you would expect from a 5star hotel. Keep in mind that Key West is a long haul for services like linen etc ... so sometimes this can mean the pool towels are late, but overall the staff do what they can to accommodate all guests. Rooms: Our room was beautiful, everything was clean and well presented and the King Bed was to die for! The upstairs room was also very nice - the sofa bed - it was not good, perhaps upgrade the mattress, but as we had young kids sleeping on there it was OK. Just would HATE to be an adult and have to try to sleep on the sofa bed. Nespresso machine - we love a espesso (not this Starbucks dirty water! Yuck!) So imagine our surprise when there was no cups, no caps, no sugar, no spoons ... nothing but the machine? How exactly are you suppose to make a coffee when there is noting to do it with? We called Housekeeping several times and NOTHING! Finally on the 3rd day we received 2 cups - but no caps, no sugar ... we were 4 adults?? REALLY if you are going to have a machine at least give people the necessities so they can use it. Internet: Was OK, speed was slow and dropped out regularly, but when you are on holidays this is not a huge deal. Breakfast: The buffet is good, though we are not big eaters - so we don't get value for money with any buffet. The menu breakfast is very good, but lacking in creativity. The service is VERY slow, there is many staff to a section and they really struggle with the couple of tables they have. The orange juice is wonderful! But at $5.00 a glass so it should be. Restaurants: Hmmm ... again ... VERY slow service. We went to sit down for a meal at 8.30pm and whilst we did not have a booking there were at least 9 tables free. Being 6 people, we understand that sometimes it can take a couple of minutes to put some tables together - however the VERY rude greeter, gave a huge sigh!! and said just sit at the bar it will take about 20 minutes to get your table arranged?? I am sorry. WTF? The 'manager' was no better, when we asked the reason for the delay, he simply replied - we are busy ... Busy are you serious? They had 4 or 5 tables with guests and 5 staff standing around doing nothing. Hence we left and went into town for dinner. Really the service staff here need to go work at a busy restaurant to see how it is done. Pool and Beach: The two pools are nice - not fantastic, in need of some TLC and there and overdue for modernization - but nice and they do the job. It was awful that you could not relax in the pool though - 20+ kids jumping up and down on a huge blue floating thing in the pool ... Really?? Not necessary and certainly not welcome, as there were a few too many ignorant parents not concerned with their children's behavior - where was the adults relaxing pool?? There isn't one! Seriously - I am not kidding, NO adults only pool. I would think that we are not the only adults that would have like to be able to relax, without getting 'bombed' or hit in the back of the head by the huge floating island. The beach - well ... its a nice beach - as good as you get in Key West and at least it is quiet and you can lounge back and relax there. You can try your hand at a little snorkeling - which our kids loved. Overall: The hotel was certainly beautiful, a true Key West icon. I wouldn't want to stay here if you are looking for a quiet romantic holiday. As there is not really anywhere on grounds that you can escape the chaos of kids and there are one too many ignorant parents, who seem to care little about others. The hotel staff are all very friendly and accommodating where possible. However the service staff are far too slow for a 5star hotel. Would I stay here again? It wouldn't be me first choice, Key West is for me highly over-rated and the 2br value for money at $800 a night ... is not really there. But there are few luxury properties with beach frontage in Key West. Personally - travel to a nice island in the Caribbean or Mexico with a nice beach. You only need to see Key West once.

Reviews.Title: “Labor Day Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Seth8799
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina resort was wonderful!! Barefoot Billys Equpiment and tours were awesome!! The beach staff were amazing as they took care of everything from cocktails to frozen towels, ice pops, towels, sunglass cleaners and key west knowledge. We will definitely be coming back!!

Reviews.Title: “Barefoot Billys Jet Ski Tour”
Reviews.Author: Joshcurtis95
Reviews.Content: We had a blast today on the jet ski tour provided by Tom and John at Barefoot Billys (at the casa marina resort). They were great tour guides and super friendly. The tour was amazing!!! We love every minute of it!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Beach Service Tops All”
Reviews.Author: ggd2_11
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Key West for thirty years. The experience we had at the Casa Marina is by far and away the best we have ever enjoyed. In particular, the beach service we received from Mark and his staff was phenomenal and a key contributor to our overall experience. We cannot wait to schedule our return.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: Paula F
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently celebrated our 13 year anniversary at the Casa Marina in Key West. We have been frequenting KW for many years and stayed at a variety of properties but hands down this property is the best! We traveled on a holiday weekend and the property was hosting a wedding, yet they never missed a beat when it came to details on their standard guests. We spent quite a bit of time at the pool and during the 3+ days we knew every staff member by first name (Scuba Steve, Mark, Kerry, Ellie, Steven, Tyler, Jon) and they knew our likes and dislikes and fell over themselves to wait on us. The view, the location, the amenities were impeccible. We WILL be back next year and we'll be bringing our friends, it was truly amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Liz M
Reviews.Content: Easy getaway for the holiday weekend! Super relaxing, friendly staff and great food. The ocean view is pretty spectacular as welI. I would HIGHLY recommend taking the 2hr Jet Ski tour. Tom and Jo are excellent tour guides, and it's a guaranteed good time. That tour was easily the best jet ski experience I've ever had. The only thing keeping Casa Marina from earning 5 stars is the relatively slow service. But that didn't stop us from having an amazing time and we would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back soon!”
Reviews.Author: diane r
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully managed by Kasha-with great front desk assistance from Haythem,Jafre and Shirley. The beach & pool is enhanced by the courtesy & attention provided by Tyler & John. Pool staff brought you popsicles, frozen towels and daily sample drinks...delicious! I loved the hammocks on the beach, so relaxing. Our favorite maid was Marie D. who did a wonderful job and remained with us per our request. Thank you to Alison Cortello, supervisor of housekeeping who was very accommodating. We enjoyed our stay and extended it for an additional 2 days. We also reserved our room for 8 nights during the month of Feb.2012. The hotel cleanliness and courteous staff created a very relaxing experience. This hotel exceeded our expectations. I will recommend Casa Marina to all our friends and business associates. Bernie and Diane Recenello

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and CANNOT wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: Molly P
Reviews.Content: The staff is incredibly accommodating, nice, and personable. They were a pleasure to meet and were very friendly. They also were very good at their job--you feel totally spoiled! We really loved "Scuba Steve" who works poolside. He cleans your glasses, gives you towels, etc. He is very knowledgeable and experienced. He also has a parrot named Loli that he brings to the towel stand every Sunday. The bird is never a nuisance, and beautiful to look at. In addition to the staff, the hotel itself is beautiful. Located right on the beach, there are two pools, and outdoor cafe that brings you drinks and food poolside or at a table. Their restaurant has outdoor and indoor seating available. The decor is modern yet classic, and looks picture perfect in Key West. I forgot I was in the U.S.!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, beautiful hotel, but the service is the driving force of this hotel's success.”
Reviews.Author: Winstonia
Reviews.Content: Every day the pool attendant made me feel like I was his only customer. Always friendly, almost a personal valet, Jon B seemed to make every guest feel the same way. A true asset to you company. I will be returning because of the location, and have a high level of expectation due to his outstanding behavior. Sincerely

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: Mandiesel
Reviews.Content: Matt was the best jetski tour guide!! Top notch! Nick was great too:)

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, we loved everything about Key West.”
Reviews.Author: tlbr
Reviews.Content: Scuba Steve was excellent and helped us out everyday! Rob was also great and helped us out at the pool. They both were very professional and were always there and got us whatever we needed. Matt and Nick were great on our jet ski ride. Matt was an excellent tour guide and we had a blast with the both of them and got to see and learn a lot. All the staff at the hotel were very nice and professional. We had a great time and hope to be back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, but very pricey!”
Reviews.Author: R5C5H8
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for 6 nights in mid-August. The hotel was beautiful, the pool/beach staff was very freindly and always making sure that we were OK. Our room was very nice, however, for a hotel of this caliber and for prices that we were paying, the TV was very small. We didnt spend a lot of time in the room watching TV, but when we did, the small size of the TV was annoying. It is about 1-1.5miles from Mallory Square and the main part of Duval Street. So, be prepared for a long walk or a $10 cab ride each way. If you want to be within easy walking distance of everything on Duval Street, stay at the Westin or the Hyatt. However, if you want a nice beach and pools, stay at the Casa Marina. The food by the pool/beach area was somewhat over-priced, but in line with what you would expect to pay at a higher-end hotel. Most of the ocean where you are swimming at is covered with some kind of seaweed on the ocean floor and is not the beautiful white sand that you might expect. The hotel staff was constantly cleaning, sweeping, vaccuming, etc. They did a very good job of keeping the place clean. Of course, they had to because of the large number of barefooted, wet, people walking directly from the pool all the through the very nice lobby. Overall, it was an amazing hotel, just pricey. I would have expected a little bit more with the Waldorf name attached to it.

Reviews.Title: “Not worthy of the Waldorf-Astoria name.”
Reviews.Author: Mlang83
Reviews.Content: We weren't expecting a true Waldorf experience based on prior reviews, yet we were very disappointed. Originally, we were booked at the Reach but were moved to the Casa Marina and told we were being upgraded from a boutique suite to an ocean view room. The room at the Casa wasnt ready when we arrived, when we finally checked in it felt like a serious downgrade from the suite we were expecting. Small room, overlooking the pool and no balcony. We called the desk and we moved to a small suite in the newer building (note, the rooms were very loud). Overall, service was lacking, the food was mediocre, and the accommodations were only ok. The beautiful property and fact that we booked on points were the only redeeming factors. Even so, I would even spend points here again. Next time I come to Key West, I'll look for a rental property and save the resort experience for someplace that does it better.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected for a Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: Terry T
Reviews.Content: We were not satisfied with the housekeeping. Tthey would forget the towels or coffee or something nearly every day. The elevator was like a furnace and very slow and at times we took the stairs to avoid the elevator. Food was good but not great so we ate at the resort only once. However, the service at the pool and beach area was exceptional. We particulary liked Scuba Steve, and Mark and also should mention Nick at Barefoot Billy's at Casa.

Reviews.Title: “Completely relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Erno1968
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina is a wonderful hotel. Built at the beginning of the XX century and refurbished recently keeping the mystic of the original hotel. Accommodations were great. The bathroom is quite small. Breakfast is great although lunch and dinner could have more variety. The staff is superb starting from the desk, the concierge and everyone at the beach (Rob, Dan and the gang). They really make an effort to keep you happy. Great stay and a memorable weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: LadyoftheLake1
Reviews.Content: Mark and his team at the pool are the most attentive staff you will ever encounter. From poolside restaurant reservations to cleaning sunglasses to popsicles to eucalyptus infused frozen towels and daily drinks they offer it all with hospitality unmatched anywhere in the world. Have stayed many places around the world but this will be THE place we come back to again and again and we will bring our daughter and son in law. Mark is one of a kind and his charm and willingness to assist is beyond compare. If you go you will never want to leave poolside at Casa Marina Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic hotel”
Reviews.Author: ForzaMaterazzi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just gorgeous, set in a large colonial building with it's own private beach. The rooms are really nicely decorated, staff are very helpful and the hotel restaurant does amazing food at decent prices. We headed in to Key West one evening and were stunned by how raucous that appears when compared to the area where Casa Marina is set. The hotel is a calming environment with everything that you could ask for, but there are other restaurants, etc close enough to provide alternative choices. We did snorkelling & jet ski with the waterspouts place and they were both brilliant

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about it”
Reviews.Author: Jadesmother
Reviews.Content: At first glace at the Casa Marina website, I thought the hotel would be too "stuffy" for my family. I couldn't be more wrong. It is a beautiful upscale hotel with a relaxed atmosphere. I asked to be upgraded to a suite, if one was available and they did just that at 50% off. Also quickly moved all our things from one room to the other. Enjoyed one of the many hammocks available on the beach. My family went out on the jet ski tour that left right off the beach while I stayed back to get a massage ocean side. I could not think of one complaint but I would recommend the suite just for the extra space and beautiful large bathroom, if you can swing the fee.

Reviews.Title: “Love Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: eims4gsds
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at the Casa Marina resort - the staff was friendly, without being overbearing. We were upgraded to an ocean view room for our anniversary (it helped that the hotel was not bursting at the seams due to it being the off season). The grounds and view here are beautiful! Of special mention - Matt and Todd at the water sports rental on the property - very helpful - offered us several "insider" tips on where to eat and drink in town. We tried every suggestion and were not disappointed. Many thanks to Matt especially for taking the time to chat with us about where to venture out!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time in a wonderful hotel that only had a couple minor issues.”
Reviews.Author: RappiToma
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton Honors Gold member--love the brand. . This is a fabulous hotel - the grounds and rooms are beautiful-location great- walking distance to hopping Duval street . . It was a very well managed hotel with attention to detail to almost everything ---a great, friendly staff. The pool side bar and restaurant were great - and prices were reasonable. Barefoot Billy's beach/water acitivites Kiosk was the best!! We took their round-the-island jet ski tour which was fabulous-exciting-- Chris, our guide was engaging and fun - it was a blast!!! The highlight of our visit and highly recommended. This is a Wladorf Astoria Collection hotel and it needed to tweak a couple issues to raise it to that standard--First the hotel only had two guest internet computers and one printer --which was broked for three days- couldn't they find a repair man or get another printer. In addition, the Concierge desk is a standup desk at which staff have to stand all day and which can only acommoodate two persons at one time--- despite the fact that it is constantly busy - Move it to a sit down desk acorss the lobby (there's rooom) with at least three attendants to cover all the business--the hotel would make more money!!! . Three- the bed pillows suck- At a Waldorf level hotel most other chains have a selctions of pillows- here no--just the standard flimsy soft or foam pillows- I had to use four to get the height of normal firm one. In addition our bed leaned to the right and I slept in a groove-must have been a very old matress-- uncomfortable- Buy new quality matresses!!! Lastly charging $15 a day to self park is a rip off- you can park on the street across from the hotel for free. Despite these issues- the qulaityof the staff, the amenties and the food far out weights these issues. We had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Best service, friendliest staff, and the most comfortable bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: ifeeltheneedforspeed
Reviews.Content: John the concierge is extremely attentive and provides incredible service. Scuba Steve is very friendly and does a great job. Jan and Robin are great bartenders. This hotel is top notch in every way.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Staff in the U.S.”
Reviews.Author: Skip S
Reviews.Content: Had our annual 8-5 business meeting here and decided to bring my wife along and make it into a mini-vacation for a week. Tons of activities to do all week long, especially on the weekends. The hotel staff was extraordinarily obsequious and could not do enough for all of us. People kept coming up to me during meeting breaks and complimenting the Staff, the rooms, and the overall ambiance--many wishing they had brought along their spouses to enjoy all the resort had to offere and the after hours night life in Key West. Our Point of Contact for the second year in a row was Rebecca Atkins and she is the ultimate! I cannot say enough about how well-pleased we all were with the Conference Room, our rooms, and the provided amenities. She was there to greet us and she was available to ensure each and every day we were therethat all was moving along as intended, without any hassles, and that we were all pleased. Needless to say, all forty-plus of us were very well-pleased with what Rebecca had provided for us. Also, I would like to pass along my personal thanks and appreciation for a gentleman named Brandon. His wonderful demeanor, selfless attitude, his obvious devotion to his customers, and his penchant to not only help, but his seemingly innate ability to actually rectify on the spot all problems brought to his attention impressed numerous conference attendees throughout the entire week, especially those with room concerns, missing items, and personal issues in general. Brandon would actively and reflectively listen until the guest had finished, never once interrupting, and then would provide a viable solution to the guest's benefit. He assiduously provided only the absolute best service that the Casa Marina's professional staff had to offer! I can sum up his performance in the eight days I was there in just one word, supererogatory -- above and beyond the call of duty! Several of my conference attendees (and my wife and I) watched him over the course of a week and he treated each and every customer as if they were the ONLY ones there and that they were his ONLY concern! We were all more than thoroughly impressed. I'd like to point out several noteworthy situations. My room wasn't ready when I arrived and he helped out while Evelyn checked us in. He had our bags brought to our room for us and constantly checked on our room's availability. My wife and I had several issues with Housekeeping and he personally had each and every one of them immediately rectified. He ameliorated one family's perceived exiguous circumstances: late one evening a Danish gentleman explained how he and his wife had to be separated, each one having to take either one or two children, since they were separated from each other by not having adjacent rooms. Brandon explained to them that they would have adjacent rooms the very next day and for the rest of their entire sojourn (one for him and his wife and the adjacent one for the three children); he and his wife were ecstatic to hear that! I don't know HOW many times he was re-coding cards for people for their rooms and/or their parking. He diligently worked the Front Desk all week and many of us saw him fervently working outside assisting people with the loading and unloading of their bags. Our entire Team was completely satisfied (and then some) by everything that Rebecca had set up for us to make our stay and our work week memorable. Also, I just HAD to bring up Brandon's name as a true consummate professional within teh hotel's organization and I would be proud to have someone of his caliber on MY team, too.

Reviews.Title: “Family Time”
Reviews.Author: Tracy P
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year daughter and I spent 3 wonderful nights @ the Casa Marina! The staff and service was fantastic, and the Poolside Ice-Pops a great and welcomed treat in the hot sun! Food was a bit pricey, so we ventured out for most of our meals when was very easy since the main strip, Duval Street was a quick and safe 10 minute walk. We can't wait to go back next year !!!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: TRiedl
Reviews.Content: From start to finish the service was wonderful. My daughter and I felt well taken care of by the staff. The room was good and location even better. I liked how I felt wanted here rather than a bother like some places. I would like to have optional indoor dining to avoid the heat sometimes. Some great staff to mention: Don at concierge and Scharm and Joe at Dinner. I think I may return next year. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina - A Happy Place”
Reviews.Author: Natalie B
Reviews.Content: We just returned home from a great 5 day getaway at the Casa Marina. My husband and I chose this resort as we were looking for a peaceful retreat. The hotel exceeded our expectations, and we can't wait to return. The facility was neat, clean and beautiful! The property was well kept, and had many ammenities that we truly enjoyed. The gym was huge! They had 2 big pools that were facing the water. We loved the Sun-Sun Bar and our dinner on the beach...A must if you want to see a beautiful sunset while dining. We chose to rent jet skiis from Barefoot Billy's conveniently located right on the beach property. We were happy not to have to leave the resort looking for a place to go, we had a lot of fun!!! Also there was a young gentleman Roscoe who helped me out with a problem I was having with my cell phone. Thank you to him for being so kind. The beach employees made our trip happy and memorable. There was also an amazing gentleman who never stops by the name of Scuba Steve. He must have energizer batteries in him as he constantly hustled to make sure everyone was well taken care of. Look for him or Mark as they will help out with anything you need. We were sad to return to NJ as hurricane Irene was waiting for us upon our return home..Sad to be back to reality and already miss Casa Marina...Thank you for the great memories and a wonderful time!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unparallelled Service! Can't wait for our next trip!”
Reviews.Author: barmircat
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at the Casa Marina since the renovations were completed, and it was definitely worth it! Our room overlooked the beach and the atlantic. It was beautiful ... inside and out! The staff were the friendliest I have come across in my travels. I was very impressed with everyone I came in contact with. They remembered my name from day to day, remembered what I liked to drink and more! Even when I simply walked past an employee in the hallway, they would smile and say hello. Particular staff members, Brandon at the Front Desk. It was a busy afternoon with guests checking in. He had took care of our party quickly and efficiently. Tyler out at the pool was the best pool concierge I've ever come across. I found a chair and asked him for towels. He noticed my fair skin and asked if I needed an umbrella. Since I couldn't find one, he found one for me. He got me all set up and even moved the umbrella around as the sun changed position in the sky to help keep me from burning. Every hour or so, he was passing out popsicles and frozen washclothes to help keep you cool in the afternoon heat. He always offered to bring water to us. He even sent Dave, our pool server, over when we first arrived. Between Dave's constant attention and Tyler, we never lacked for anything. It's been a long time since I stayed at a hotel where the service was this top notch. The staff was always one step ahead of us, always anticipating our needs and exceeding expectations. Also enjoy the staff sharing favorite local hangouts away from Duval street. We always enjoy going to where the locals go even if it's a few miles out of the way. We discovered several different places to eat on other nearby keys. Having the trolley stop at the hotel was another plus. We were able to sightsee right from the entrance of the hotel. Wonderful experience and we can't wait to return for our next Annual trip to the Keys.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and would definitely go back!”
Reviews.Author: Mary E
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing time during our stay - we arrived early and were quickly accommodated and able to check in. In addition, for a minimal charge, we were given upgraded ocean view rooms that connected. The rooms were beautiful and the service was outstanding. The hammocks on the beach made it a true retreat and we all returned home relaxed and rejuvenated! In face, the outstanding service, especially by the pool and beach would be what truly brings us back to the resort. Steven, the pool attendant who was no doubt very busy, still made sure each of his guests felt like we were the only ones!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Shari V
Reviews.Content: Our third stay at the Casa and it was the best so far. We felt so welcome and appreciated. Our Hilton Honors were recognized from the moment we checked in...room was up-graded, special welcome snack from room service and a just let us know if you need anything attitude from the front desk staff. Mark, the head of beach services was there when we checked in and asked if we were heading the pool/beach after we got into our room. We replied yes and he said not to worry, I'll have chairs set up for you and let the bell men know you are ready for your bags. Wow! From that day on, our "place" was ready for us. Mark's wonderful crew; Steve, Rob and Will made sure we were very well taken care of the whole time we were there. We watched these guys help all the guests...towels, chairs, umbrellas... whatever you needed. Then there were the extra fun things like ice pops and frozen towels to cool off with each afternoon. The Sun Sun bar on the beach is another fabulous thing about the Casa. It was so great to see familar faces behind the counter...Jan and Robin and of course, our good friend Susan. Lisa was a new face for us and I'm sure we will see her again on our next visit. The service and drinks are so wonderful... A special note to Richard from bar services..thanks for remembering our names from the first order ! Every day the Casa features a special drink and they even offer you a sample just to be sure you will really like it! Very Yummy! I had an issue with a stuck zipper on my dress one evening and Susan came to my rescue with the help of her friend Julie from the Sun Sun grill. Julie also served us a very special dinner on the beach our last night there. We can't say enough good things about our visit...Casa Marina is our favorite beach resort in Key West. We have looked at other places and nothing compares to the beauty, service and attitude of the Casa. A must do in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Second time around - and still great”
Reviews.Author: MikeDimelow
Reviews.Content: This was my family's second visit to key west and the Casa Marina. The staff were excellent from Patrick on the front desk to tom in the jet ski hut. Our children loved the sea, fishes, water skis, pool, Popsicles and so on. My wife and I liked the fact that the kids could get on with their world, obviously punctuated by copious cries of "mum" and "dad" when the children couldn't do something for themselves (often and always!). This is one of my favourite holiday destinations and shall remain so into the future.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Blues958
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for our honeymoon and it couldn't have been nicer!! Absolutely stunning beach and great service!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, overpiced food!”
Reviews.Author: kaska1
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is perfect, great beach, hammocks, nice pools. The service by the pools is A+ and Steve worked great with my kids and earned his tip 100%. Patrick was serving delicious drinks (little overpriced $10 per mojito), but it's not his fault. Front desk service was also great, Patrick here again, a very pleasant guy. You have to pay for parking - with 4/5 star hotel should not be, but that's not the worse. The bad thing about this hotel is the restaurant and the food they serve. It's expensive and not so good! We booked a fishing trip with the hotel and paid 1K for it for 4 guys. They told us that they will cook it for us once we catch something, they forgot to mention that it will cost $18.00 extra plus tax and service just for the french fries and breading for our fish (greasy), per person, when the same fish at Daffys with shrimp on top (fish included) was $20.00 including french fries, salad and bread. Breakfast buffet, little pricy, but was good at this hotel. Overall, the location is perfect, hotel condition great, and service is good. I would stay at this hotel again, but I would not eat or drink there. Daffys is only few min away walking with much better food for the $. I think that the hotel should reconsider their dinning options and prices just to keep the guest eating and drinking there.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location - Incredible guest services”
Reviews.Author: JHOH
Reviews.Content: Hotel has large comfortable rooms, beautiful views, two large pools, and wonderful beach access. Outdoor staff for restaurant, as well as pool and beach staff (Scuba Steve rocks!) are incredibly attentive and professional. Such an easy place to relax in the beautiful surroundings.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable rooms a short walk from Duval Street”
Reviews.Author: fernga
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with very comfy rooms. Was here on conference and the facilities for this were great. Go on the sunwet cruise if possible!!

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: catkerry25
Reviews.Content: this hotel was one of the best i have ever stayed in. the minute we arrived we headed towards the water-the views were amazing. straight away we were greeted by Stefan who served us some lovely poolside drinks and food and throughout our stay was very helpful. our room was lovely and all the staff were great. we sat by the pool most days and Steve and Steven were amazing-cleaning our shades, handing out ice pops, topping up our iced water regularly, giving out cooling towels and of course the sample cocktails of the day! the service was unreal and they made us feel very pampered. it had a really relaxing atmosphere. i could not fault this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: EarthGopher
Reviews.Content: The location is sweet. We walked around and checked out a few different properties. This one is one of the few right on the beach and it's a white sand beach. But you can't walk right into the water from the beach due to rocks and coral. Unfortunately, you have to walk out to the end of the pier and get into the water there or go swimming in the pool. But the beach area is beautiful and the chairs and hammocks are clean. The outdoor bar near the beach serves incredible Pina coladas! The lunch is good, not great at the restaurant on the patio. Rooms are modern and comfortable, and they have Nespresso machines!! Service is very good. Value for price is right on. Would definitely look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay but there is room for improvement”
Reviews.Author: lmarieg056
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel with welcoming staff. Our room had a great view from the balcony overlooking the pool and beach. Loved the popsicle and cold refreshing hand towels at the beach! Suggestions for improvement: Automatic check-out procedure with bill under room door on day you leave so that you avoid standing in line a long time to check bill. Also add front desk staff for faster check-in because two persons are not enough for a hotel of this capacity. Otherwise, it is a great place to stay while in Key West! It is a short walk to a nearby restaurant "Louies Backyard" where we had a fantastic meal. This hotel is also located at a close distance to the Southernmost point in the US. You can take a longer stroll down Duval Street until you get to Mallory Square and share in the sunset with the mixture of tourists and locals. Fabulous! We will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic stay at the casa marina!”
Reviews.Author: J_O_C405
Reviews.Content: Myself and my two friends stayed in the Casa Marina for 5 nights recently and I can't recommend this hotel enough! The hotel itself was really gorgeous, spotlessly clean and in a great location. The highlight of this hotel for me was definitely the laying out by the pool or chilling in one of the hotel hammocks. The poolside staff we second to none and made lazing in the sun after a great night out so relaxing. A special thanks to Steve, Stephen and Stefan...thanks a million for the food, cocktails, free ice lollies, all the iced water and the cold towels, from the Irish girls!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Great resort in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: BucsFanNFL
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying I travel a lot and stay at a lot of hotels/resorts. I had high expectations for this property before we arrived and I was not disappointed at all! We stayed for 5 nights and wish we could have stayed longer! From the moment we checked in to the moment we left we were taken care of and the staff here made us feel welcome! The day we arrived they were busy and didn't have our room ready (we arrived before the 4 o'clock check in time) so they took my cell number and sent us out to the bar. It was worth the wait! We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite that overlooked the pool and ocean with a nice balcony. The room was really nice and the furnishings/decor was right on track for a resort in the Keys. Bathroom was well lit with premium bath products and soft fluffy towels (a bit disappointed with the size of the tub and the faucet (fixture) in the sink). The king sized bed in the bedroom was nice and the sheets/pillows were (above) what you would expect. We had water replenished each night and a espresso machine that made an excellent cup of joe. The only negative really is the noise level from the room next door (our neighbors had a dog that liked to howl when they were not in the room but only lasted one night). Room service was good and delivered on time. The best part of this was the gratuity was NOT automatically added on the check. I'm a good tipper, but I don't like to be forced to tip. I've never stayed anywhere that it was not pre-calculated on the check. The beach was awesome! Just steps from our room we could enjoy the sun and palm trees! The chair guys and wait staff made sure we had everything we needed! By the second day the guys setting up chairs on the beach knew our spot and would get us all ready! Drinks, food, cold towels and the wonderful ice cream treats were always welcome! Wish I would have remembered the names of the guys, but the guy with the goatee will take care of you. We had dinner only one night in the hotel out at the sun-sun. Service was great and the food was good. It was a little pricey but it is what you would expect. The grounds are well kept. The beach is really nice, but keep in mind it is a rocky beach and you can take the dock out to go swimming. We snorkeled right at the hotel and saw several tropical fish. If you want a more traditional beach just go next door to the public beach - We took the water way around the gate and just swam over. All in all I would stay at this property again! We booked our vacation early and got really good deals (plus booking during hurricane season gets you some good prices too). Everyone from management down to the wait staff is super friendly and are there to make your time special. Thanks to everyone and can't wait to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Nyneaxis
Reviews.Content: The room was clean but was not ready when we arrived, the manager had to inspect it before it was ready. We did not have to wait long before they gave us a call. When we got to the room the Internet wasn't working. We talked to the manager and they were able to credit our account for the inconvience. Lots of places to see and the Old Town Trolly came right up to the hotel. There is a concierge right in the lobby that is a great resource for activites. We took a jet ski tour of the island, but due to our inability to operate a watercraft, we just had fun, lol.

Reviews.Title: “A top notch place to stay”
Reviews.Author: tomgna13
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly a resort. 1st let me say the other reviews I read were really close to what we experienced. While there is a "beach" its not what you would expect. There was a red tide while we were there and the beach at low tide smelled a bit. The entrance to the water on the beach is rocky and slimey, but they have a pier you walk out and down stairs into the water that is clear from rocks and is sandy. The other thing people should know, it is on the opposite end of the island from the "sunset ceremony and mallory square". Its a loooong walk at night. That aside, the resort is really spectacular, 2 pools, execursions right there, and the resort service is impecable. The beach area is well taken care of and there are lots of hammocks and lounge chairs. The resort has complimentary coffee BUT only until 7am in the lobby. They also serve popsicles late afternoon, and an incredible mojito "type" drink with no alcohol in it that was excellent. The frozen face cloths in the late afternoon were a nice touch too. If you really want to go to the beach go to the state park which is 3 minutes away. The room we had was 2 full beds and VERY big, tall ceilings very spacious. You wont be dissappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great beachside service”
Reviews.Author: MJD08106
Reviews.Content: Steven and Scuba Steve were great to our group of 6 on the beach this week. They always made sure our chairs and umbrellas were set up and that we had enough popsiicles and frozen towels. Steven went out of his way to help us find a good restaurant. They made the beachside experience perfect

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, as we always do and will go back”
Reviews.Author: hlwjr60
Reviews.Content: We go with a specil group and always have a great time. We love the hotel, staff is very helpful and friendly. Mark, on the beach, does an excellent job. We rent bikes for the week and see the sights on our way downtown. We love Key West and hope to go back many times. Will always stay at the Casa.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: danny2810
Reviews.Content: Perfect Beach and Beautiful resort. Can only recommend it. Nice rooms and pools and the resort fee of 25$ (15$ for HHonors Gold) contains Internet, chairs & umbrellas at pool & beach and drinks, ice cream, etc. These items cost much more at other resorts. Parking is 15$ but there are sufficient free options right before the hotel on the street. Had our first night at the marriott beachside and were happy to move to this resort, you get much more value for your money but location, pools & beach are absolutely convincing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: Joel K
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time at the resort! The resort was beautiful, breathtaking and relaxing. They had a private beach, piers, two pools, water sports, awesome rooms, nothing but, first class accomadations. Dinners tables were also set up on the pier and the beach, we fell in love with it, dinner on the beach every night, food was out- standing and addictive. The pool side bar was delightful, thank you, Suzanne and staff, two thumbs up for your excellent service. Also, enjoyed the spa services and a couples massage with my wife, nothing but first class accomadations at the Casa Marina! Thanks to all from Joel & Suzie

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful, historic resort”
Reviews.Author: bobbysume
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is truly a tremendous hotel, with spacious pools that overlook the ocean, and a staff that is committed to pleasing you. The pool attendants are very personable and provide frozen towels and popsicles to their pool guests. We will certainly go back there again!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: antowell
Reviews.Content: This is a great resort - the service was exceptional, the food and drinks excellent, the pools, beach , gym all great . Having dinner server on the beach under moonlight an added bonus. Room was super - 3 windows with ocean view , plenty of space and comfy bed. I expected the prices to be higher but it was about same we are used to paying in Massachusetts.

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Anywhere Else in Key West”
Reviews.Author: jksr
Reviews.Content: My wife and I as well as another couple (all early to mid-40's) recently spent 4 nights at the Casa Marina. This was our first visit to Key West and considered several locations before settling on the Casa Marina. I poured through several reviews on TripAdvisor and made our decision based on overall reviews, the appearance/feel of the resort and the fact that it's one of the few hotels on the island to offer a beach. Upon arrival at EYW, we only had to wait about 10 minutes for the shuttle which runs every 1/2 hour ($8/pp, same as cab fare). We arrived at the hotel well ahead of check-in but our friend's room was available. We requested and received an upgrade so therefore had to wait longer for our rooms. We checked our bags with the bellman and contemplated our next move. Unfortunately there was a considerable downpour outside so we used the time to explore the hotel. Not too much to see however the original structure built by Henry Flagler has a nice, elegant feel to it and the layout and landscaping of the grounds on the water side is done very well. A pleasing space to be in. We managed to make it to the poolside cafe during a brief letup in the rain and had lunch. We all enjoyed our food (wings, fish tacos, cheeseburger) and later discovered that the prices on the property were not too different from the places we ate at off property. This was a pleasant surprise. Our upgraded room was ready and we were afforded a pool/ocean view room in the original building with a large, uncovered balcony. The balcony accommodated 2 chairs, cocktail table, 2 chaise lounges and an umbrella. While this was considerably nicer than the island vista (parking lot view) room we originally booked, we discovered that we did not use the balcony very much. It's not that we didn't want to, but more often than not the air was very stagnant as whatever breeze there was coming off the Straits of Florida was being blocked by the beautiful palm trees. The room (276) was nicely appointed, the bath small but it was not an issue. Small refrigerator, safe, nespresso machine (never used), flat panel TV. An iron and ironing board as well as an umbrella were in the closet. A hair dryer was in the bath. A "welcome dish" was delivered to our room just as we were heading out. A couple of waters, petit fours, perhaps some fruit. We left it for our return however some unwanted guests, small ants, discovered it before we returned. This was the only problem with our room and was a constant throughout the week. If you have any food items, make sure they are in a resealable container or are kept in the fridge. Our friends' safe was not operating properly but it was fixed promptly. We spent some time with the concierge who was very helpful. I cannot recall his name however I know it was not Don with whom in had been communicating with via email prior to arriving. Don was also very helpful. The grounds/feel/vibe of the property was exactly what we were looking and hoping for. Nicely landscaped, somewhat formal, with two nice, equally sized pools. There is no hot tub/jacuzzi in case you are looking for one. The beach, albeit small, was a nice amenity to be able to lay in a lounge chair with the sounds of the water lapping ashore. The water is very shallow, lots of seaweed (I guess) and fish to swim with you. There's a pier with steps down into the water as well. The pool/beach staff were very accommodating and engaging. We enjoyed our drink of the day samples, Popsicles and frozen towels with eucalyptus oil. Additional notes/comments: Wi-fi: Free wi-fi on the property including the pool areas. If the breeze was blowing thebright direction, you can just barely ge a signal on the beach. Suggestion: 1 adult pool and 1 family pool, please. Internet Station: What's up with the internet connection for the concierge and at the 2 stations near the shop? Our payment couldn't be processed for a tour at the concierge due to a poor connection. I thought in heard the term "dial-up". Really?! Additionally, when trying to check-in online for my flight, it took an extremely long amount of time for the data to finally reach the printer next to me. The poor woman next to me had to wait about 10 minutes for her 10 boarding passes. Can this be addressed? Ants: Are these just a fact of being in the Keys or can this be addressed better? Location: Great location we thought as it was away from all the crowds of Duval Street and Mallory Square. Staff of Note: Front Desk - Jafre Concierge - Entire staff. We had dealings with Don via email, another gentleman (sorry, forgot name) as well as 2 female staffers. Pool/Beach Staff - Kyle, Steve & John Pool Bar/Restaurant Wait Staff - Darrin and a kind female staffer that was willing to locate a microwave and reheat one of our companion's leftovers from her previous day's lunch. Again, I apologize for not remembering her name. Just an example of going beyond to provide great service. Summary: Excellent stay, great staff, great location. We toured the island and we never saw another property that made us say, "Let's stay there next time.". Next visit to Key West, it will be to the Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel, much too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerGER
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the casa Marina. Stayed there for 4 nights in a Grand Vista Ocean Room. Upon arrival, room was not ready. We left our cellphone number and were promised to get a call once our room is ready. 2 h later we went back to the reception to complain about the long waiting time, and as it turns out, they just forgot to call us that the room is ready. It took another 45min to deliver our luaggage. This time they simply forgot to put a luggage tag onto our bags so they did not know which bags belong to which guest. The room was rather small, the bed hardly fits in, there was absolutely no space to walk around the bed, you have to crawl over your partners side to get in or out. Bathroom was ok, clean and spacious enough. The balcony was huge, 2 chairs, 2 sunlounger, a sunshade and a table on it with nice views of the ocean. Both Pools were pretty crowded, so we went to the beach right in front of the Hotel. You cannot walk diectly into the water as there are a lot of big, ugly stone slabs. You can access the water via a wooden plank. Service at the beach is nice, waiters walk around with water, icecream and frozen towels. Distance to Duval Street is approx. 20 min walking time. This all said, we would not stay here again, as for more than 300$ per night there are better places to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Third Trip Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: ROmmen1235
Reviews.Content: Been there twice and going again, has to be the most beautiful hotel and grounds in Key West. We have searched other hotels, most either have no beach or one near as nice and peaceful this close to all the fun in Key West. It's defiantly a 5 Star in my book and at age 48 we have been to many nice places in Florida from Daytona to Key West . This is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: tots238
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last part of our holiday and it was worth waiting for. the room was good, and the service was great. Having a private beach was really nice and the poolside concierges were relly helpful, bringing round cold towels and ice lollies. There were amazing sand sculptures around which makes the atmosphre great.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: jfey01
Reviews.Content: Beautiful place and the service is exceptional!! The pool is wonderful as it is, but Mark on the beach took great care of us providing frozen towels and popsicles to keep us refreshed. They definitely had lots to keep us busy w/Barefoot Billy's on property providing jet skis and hooking us up with a fabulous sunset cruise. We will highly recommend the property to all of our friends and be back sooner than later!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Key West, but not Waldorf customer service”
Reviews.Author: ResortMeg
Reviews.Content: Myself and my family went during the first week of August. My sister and I are in our mid-twenties and my parents are in their sixties so it was a unique family trip. The resort is beautiful and well maintained, rooms were large and nice. We've traveled to many different resorts and do expect a lot as far as customer service and were sadly disappointed in our experience, it seems that either the staff is amazing and outstanding or terrible. We had a WONDERFUL experience with the pool/beach staff, especially Jake and Tyler who were great! The pools are both nice and not too crowded and we enjoyed the beach and swimming pier. There really is no other resort with beach access like Casa Marina which was what we wanted (and got!) We enjoyed the pool/beach amenities, but it should be known that the frozen towels/popsicles/etc are on schedule so if you miss the distribution you may be out of luck. Additionally, we learned that the pool staff are not hired through the resort and are not included in any type of tipping through the $25 daily resort fee. They did outstanding service for our family, if you have the same experience you need to individually tip the pool/beach staff. The restaurant was also very nice, especially for eating lunch on the beach. Daniel was especially excellent as our server multiple times. Additionally, my sister caught fish on a charter and was able to bring back the filets and the chef prepared them for us for dinner with a table right on the beach which was an amazing experience. As stated, the resort is beautiful, pools and beach are wonderful, and restaurant is good. We would not visit again in August because it was SO HOT we couldn't walk around anywhere....we spent a lot on cabs (also you should know that in cooler weather you can walk to Duval St. but that in the heat, or otherwise, cabs are by zone or if more than 4 people a flat rate of $3/person to cab most places). We were glad to use cabs and not have to worry about a car/parking. All that said, beyond the superb individuals mentioned, service was lacking. Specifically, we had lots of issues with housekeeping. Some days we were left without towels, others without shampoo/conditioner/etc, and housekeeping was SO NOISY that we often had to leave the room because they were screaming up and down the hallways. Timing was also unpredictable, most hotels/resorts I have experienced the room is cleaned at roughly the same time each day, here it was typically very late in the day and caused issues with showering after the pool/beach before dinner time. Additionally, our final day I booked our planes late to leave Key West in hopes of an additional pool/beach day but we had to check out at 1pm (they wanted to charge $50 for each additional hour we kept the room!) and they have no showers available beyond the rooms so we were unable to have an extra beach day. I think this resort will be great a few years but the staff may not, in your experience, live up to the Waldorf experience, though after looking and walking all around Key West I still think it will be the absolute best resort experience on the island for your vacation. The resort will also be much improved when they have their own separate spa building which is under construction. The building itself is breathtaking, the views are great, and if you luck into dealing with great staff like we did you should have a very good experience! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Collins060
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed here in July this year and found it to be excellent.We were a bit disappointed with the room/views (onto the road/car park) but as we were there for 2 nights only, and with lots to do, realised that we wouldn't be in our room very much anyway. The beach and beach services were excellent. We only ate at the beach bar but this was really good. It's a short walk into the main streets of Key West but we thought this was better as we were not in, what could be, the noisy town centre. We would certainly go back but with a sea view.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary trip”
Reviews.Author: Marco P
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 25th anniversary at Casa Marina,it was our first trip there,and I promise it will not be our last,we found everything about the resort outstanding,especialy the pool staff,Tyler andJake took excellent care of us,and waiter Patrick.We look forward to getting back there as soon as possible, Thank you all. Marco Perugini.

Reviews.Title: “CUSTOMER SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: beatrice m
Reviews.Content: Beautiful locatiion but lousy customer service with speciql accolade to the front desk staff. Not only are they inefficient but they are also extremely arrogant and show no respact whatsoever to a paying hotel guest. The staff named Brandon was the only one showing professionnalism and customer service skills. Patrick on the other hand requires urgent and intensive training. Finally as for Jafre he needs to find a new carreer away from any sort of contact with a customer

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Icladynred
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I went to Key West for some relaxation, we visited the Casa Marina, Wold of Astoria Resort and immediately knew we made the right decision. We encountered many friendly employees however the one which made our visit the most memorable hands down would be Mark Grey. He was extremely information and friendly. He always made sure we had what we needed and that we were enjoying ourselves. Its because of employees like Mark that we return to the same locations over and over. We hope to see Mark on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: BobNat13
Reviews.Content: I booked this resort as a side trip from a Fort Lauderdale vacation. My family enjoyed the Casa Marina so much that we extended our stay. There are many little details that make the stay special: daily treats at the pool (ice pops, frozen towels, fruit, complimentary sunglass cleaning, etc. The pool/beach staff is very attentive: Tyler, Max, Jake and Mark. The desk clerks are very accommodating and will give you tips on the best local restaurants. The suite was spacious and clean and very close to the pool & beach. I highly recommend the Casa Marina. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best place in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Wife2Frank
Reviews.Content: Got a room at the last minute back in July. Great views! Wonderful staff! Great value for the money. Will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Evelyn and Candice were the best!”
Reviews.Author: TSP8
Reviews.Content: This is my second time at Casa Marina. The service is impeccable. We had a small problem with our bill checking out. Evelyn and Candice were fantastic in helping us resolve the problem. They helped us and removed the improper charges. Thanks Evelyn and Candice. Otherwise our stay was incredible! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “It's okay but wouldn't return.”
Reviews.Author: SteveO23
Reviews.Content: Nice place, with some decent touches, but food was bad and overpriced. Pools felt 94 degrees or higher and "largest beaches" means you get a lot of hammocks and chairs, but cant enter water except off a ominous looking pier- where one side is roped off. I heard many 1st-day visitors comment on that. Staff was nice, and view was beautiful and serene at night. Didn't realize this is a family place though. Had kids jumping and snorkeling in pool one night after 11PM. And one day 1 pool was emptied because of some little fart's floater, and my wife and I pulled several band-aides/icky stuff out regularly. If they would have cleaned the pool THROUGHOUT the day- and I'm just talking a little strainer here people. and maybe add some ice in the super hot temps I wouldn't be so harsh. Rooms were fine and its okay, but not worth the price for some of their oversights. I watched the bar staff deliver hundreds of drinks and pick up dozens of towels but no one picked up the crap from the pool until there was literally crap in the pool!

Reviews.Title: “Week in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: jaypatfan
Reviews.Content: I just spent a week at this great resort in Key West. It is a beautiful property with a nice beach and the greatest staff. A major shout out to Patrick at the front desk. He couldn't have been friendlier or more attentive. Everyone on staff from housekeeping and concierge to the pool staff and the folks at the Sun Sun bar were incredibly sociable and truly enjoyed their jobs. Rooms were beautiful and so was the scenery. There is nothing like bouncing around town for a week on a rented bike(great deal at the hotel) or a couple of days on the beach in a hammock to put all the stress of the work week behind you. Thanks for A GREAT week and hope to see you all again real soon.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Services and Servers Are the Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: beckscomments
Reviews.Content: Max Gram provided my husband and I with the best service to date. He was personable, professional and made us feel pampered! Patrick our server provided excellent service and made us feel special!

Reviews.Title: “This was our 20th year”
Reviews.Content: We have enjoyed staying at "The Casa" for 20 years with family and friends. We always look forward to seeing Mark on the beach making everyone feel welcome and relaxed,Patrick speaking to everyone as he passes by and Suzanne behind the bar making everyones favorite drinks. The rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. Thanks again for another great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Good Service, Expensive”
Reviews.Author: TJWashow
Reviews.Content: To start this hotel has absolutely beautiful views. Me and my wife went for our honeymoon. The beach, although very rocky, was plenty shaded and well taken care of. We had a staff member on the beach make reservations for us at an excellent restaurant. Thats good service right there. After a couple days of beach bumming we noticed that everyone at the place was doing things for "tips". Someone got you a towel, or moved a chair 5ft for you to lay on, gave us the feeling they were expecting some sort of tip. Besides this our stay there was great. Definately a paradise feeling. Oh and the food there is not worth the money, $18 for a vegetarian omlette? Who are you kidding, you are much better off going to one of the Islands better known restaurants. Oh and the last thing that almost sent us over the edge was the surprise charges at the end of our stay. They have a daily resort fee of about $28 after tax is applied to cover things such as your free wi-fi (which makes no sense if it labeled "free") and chairs at the beach, umbrellas things you would expect are included in the price of your room. Overall, key west was a good experience, and our hotel had a great staff, but we were ready to leave by the end of it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but FIRST CLASS SERVICE!!!! We will be back”
Reviews.Author: CarewHouse
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good about the service we got a this beautiful hotel! Mark whom we met out by the beach and pool helped us with every bit of information we needed and made sure we where completely comfortable, including our rental car! Mark and his fantastic friendly and welcoming personality is the main reason why we will return:) Tyler and Jake also had great attitudes and where always willing to help. Yours Truly, Chris and Carol San Antonio, Texas

Reviews.Title: “We keep going back”
Reviews.Author: MARA52807
Reviews.Content: Last year my wife and I spent a great week at the Casa. This year we returned with our grown boys. We loved it and they loved it. They are big boys. One is 6'3, the other 6'7. So we got a one bedroom suite with an airbed. The room was spotless and well appointed. Plenty of towels, and shampoo,soap, etc. We had the buffet breakfast every morning. It isn't cheap, but it was good. We also ate lunch and dinner by the pools. We all thought the food was very good and reasonably priced. Service was great. You should also try the Striphouse at the sister property, The Reach. Concierge desk was quite helpful in booking all our activities. The front desk, and in particular Patrick, was very helpful with any question we had. Location is great. We only used cab to get to wharf for the Dry Tortugas run ( highly recommended ) and airport. We've travelled many places, but love the "Casa". In fact, wife and I are returning in September for her birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: tyao
Reviews.Content: This was an overall great place to stay, with beautiful views, but just some minor things that kept me from giving this place a full 5 rating. Rooms We had a basic bedroom w/ king bed. The bedroom area is very open and spacious, with a small armchair to the side and a bench at the foot of the bed. Full size closet with robes off to the side of the room, which is nice so you don't see your luggage mess when you walk into the room. Bathroom was surprisingly small - contained only a shower stall (no tub), and little sink space. Bathroom definitely felt that design was valued above functionality. The sink faucet is off to the side so it's easy to spill water out. The shower stall is half glass and half shower curtain so you have to keep the water aimed to one side to avoid water from spilling out (this angle would suck if you were taller). Aside from these nitpicky things, no other complaints on the rooms - the look was nice and most importantly, everything was clean. There's also a nespresso machine and a small fridge that had enough empty space to put fruit, water bottles, etc inside. Location Casa Marina is on the south side of Key West, while Mallory Square is on the opposite side to the north. You do need to cab everywhere (around $8-11) if you want to avoid walking in the sun/heat. It's about a 20 min walk to Duval street, and you can slowly go up that street to Mallory Square, but it is quite a bit to walk. The activities we were doing all left from the north side of the island, so we had to keep cabbing over to areas near Mallory Square. The hotel is a bit aways from most of the nightlife, shopping activity. El Siboney (great cuban restaurant) is about a 10 min walk away. The Reach resort, also a hilton property, is close by. Airport transportation is best via taxi, $8 per person. Resort The resort has its own little manmade beach, and is beautiful to look at. I also have to warn you that the beach has shallow water when you enter, but there's a lot of grass growing which creeped me out as I waded through. Sunning chairs and hammocks abound and you can have them help you place chairs wherever you want. There's also two large pools. The resort fee covers the following: wireless internet on property, gym, use of beach volleyball, bocce, pool table, pool toys, hammocks, pool concierge service (popsicles, drinkOTD samples, frozen face cloth that smells like benzocaine), free phone for local and w/in the US calls, newspaper. There's dining by the pool/beach at the Sun Sun grill (typical fare, questionable service from here), there's a lobby bar that services absinthe, and a small gift/supplies shop. The Reach resort nearby has a steakhouse and terrace dining. What would make this place great is if it had its own quality restaurant for dinner on the property - i would just stay right on the resort all day if they had this. We also got two free bottles of water a day, which is a nice touch. Service Housekeeping was great at keeping the place clean the days we spent here. We did call for extra shampoo, but the person gave us ONE bottle of body wash. Not the same. I got a spider bite, and the front desk staff were great. This was late at night, and they called for someone to apply some gel for the bite, and gave me a free bottle of benadryl to help with the itching/swelling. Was a very nice surprise, and was very much appreciated. The concierge for booking activities was a bit different though. They were very helpful and nice but it took me 30 minutes to book a snorkel/sailing trip. I asked about the snorkel and sail trip on the list of activities and how it differed from Danger Charters since the price and description sounded the same (Danger Charters I had separately found on tripadvisor). The guy was like, yeah the two things are pretty similar. Another person there, then told me that the pamplet of activities was very outdated and that the location to meet didn't exist anymore. She then looked through her series of pamphlets and figured out what snorkel/sail the activity was now booked through (ended up being Danger Charters). Everything turned out great but it was just a bit disorganized and confusing to book with them.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous break from reality!!! Can't wait to get back”
Reviews.Author: sfirch
Reviews.Content: The hotel and its location was wonderful. We enjoyed each day including the beach area, pools, hotel lobby, and ESPECIALLY the jet skis!!!! Nick was our main guide both times we went, and he made our "tour" the best!!! Kudos to Nick and his crew! A relaxing place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hospitality Ever”
Reviews.Author: kimberlykane
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina definitely knows how to make sure you have a good time. The people there are really friendly, especially the beach staff. Will was awesome. He definitely made sure I was having a good time, cleaned my sunglasses everyday, and he was super outgoing which was nice since I was solo! Jake was really nice the rest of the days when I sat at the pool. Patrick was an excellent server with a very friendly attitude and really outgoing. I felt at home. They made sure that I knew the best places to go on the Island, and were friendly every day when I saw them!! The definitely made the trip more enjoyable! The food at the beach was definitely a good selection and there was always enough shade with either umbrellas or palm trees that I didnt burn, which is easy to do. The views were amazing and the weather could not have been better. The only complaint would be the tiny breakfast buffet selection. You might as well just order something off the Breakfast Menu and skip the buffet.. the choices on the menu are delicious. Or walk into town to try something with more selection. But everything I ate was really delicious and good value. The front desk staff was super nice and accommodating. The last day I went on a last minute snorkling trip and they let me check out of my room at 1pm so I could shower before I left for the airport. Definitely the classiest hotel on the Island. No complaints and I will definitely come back. I love Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Sublime”
Reviews.Author: FunTimes4Two
Reviews.Content: We came here for a one week stay and had been looking forward to it for quite some time. Each room has an awesome espresso machine, a super comfy bed, a stunning view, and the staff is super attentive. The pools have a view of the beach and several hammocks. Great!

Reviews.Title: “Max and Mark at the beach/pool were awesome!”
Reviews.Author: mrst09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for 7 days. The staff (Max, Mark, Graham, and Adam) at the pool and beach are terrific. Max and Mark provided wonderful service. They can answer any questions you have and provide excellent suggestions for excursions and food. Max goes out of his way to make everyone feel comfortable at the pool/beach. If there's something you need, he will find a way to get it for you. He's a fine young man and his parents should be proud of him. We took the jet ski tour around the island from Casa Marina. For three people who never were on jet skis before, they made it very easy for us! (Recommendation by Max and Mark). We went on the Ghost Trolley Tour which provided a lot of history about the island along with a lot of laughs! (Recommendation by Max and Mark) One excursion you should not miss is the half day (4 1/2 hours) sailing, snorkeling, and kayaking by Danger Cruises. For $75 each, you sail, snorkel, and kayak. They provide soft drinks, beer, wine, water, fresh fruit, chips, etc. during the cruise. Awesome cruise - would do it again! Another recommendation by Max! The only recommendation I would make at the Casa Marina is the pools need a cooling system. This past week it was extremely hot and the pools get extremely warm - it's not really refreshing after sitting in the sun for awhile. Remember to have your flip flops at the pool - otherwise your feet will burn. The food and drinks at the pool are great. You might want to consider splitting 2 meals among three of you because they give you plenty to eat. Also, don't forget the fruit (9:30 a.m.), drink of the day sample (noon), ice pops (2:00 p.m., and frozen eucalyptus washcloths (3:30) all provided to you by the pool staff. Excellent service by the pool/beach staff!!! If you need anything at the front desk, ask for Jafre - he's also wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool & poolstaff....but not really a Waldorf Astoria property”
Reviews.Author: ipobuy
Reviews.Content: When you go to a "Luxury Resort" you expect above average service & that's what you get from Max, Mark, Graham & Tyler poolside. They make you feel welcome and appreciate you as guest, no request was to small, and always completed with a smile. Patrick kept the high standard of service up with making sure we always had cocktails. Kudos to Max for turning in a lost gold necklace while cleaning up the pool area! However that's where it stops as a "Luxury Resort", the amenities were never replaced in our room, no clean coffee cups, the pool had oversized floats and guest showing up bringing their own coolers! Maybe management needs to go back and have a refresher course in running a Waldorf Astoria property and remember that guest are looking for a better experience than being at a Holiday Inn Express!

Reviews.Title: “Not all that!”
Reviews.Author: lovenlaugh
Reviews.Content: A beautiful, historic property but poorly run hotel. We requested the "best view" and got a view of the road. The bed springs squeaked and the towels were worn and frayed. About a half hour after we got room service they knocked on our door to collect the tray, and the maid service kept knocking every half hour to ask if they could come in and clean. Very disappointing and sad as there is great potential.

Reviews.Title: “they go above and beyond for their guests”
Reviews.Author: mlbleamer
Reviews.Content: we just got back from our honeymoon and our stay at the casa marina was amazing. the staff (stephanie wise) did everything to ensure that our stay was memorable, from a bottle of champagne in our room on our first night, to a free upgrade to an ocean view room with a balcony for our last night. nothing could have been better!!!! we will definitely stay again when we go to key west.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to your Pool Staff - (Tyler & Mark)”
Reviews.Author: keywest143
Reviews.Content: These two gentlemen really went out of their way to make our stay fun at this Resort Pool. They exceeded hospitality in more ways than we can express to you. The cold towels, the fresh drinks, ice pots, chair service..all with a smile. You are luky to have these two men on your staff. Thank you, Chris & Paul GravÃ©l Naples, FL

Reviews.Title: “Very pretty hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy0320
Reviews.Content: Went with my husband for 5 day getaway without kids. Patrick at front desk was amazing. Beautiful, historic looking hotel. Room was spacious, bathroom was TINY. Hotel really had everything but beware, kids are allowed in both pools and it wasn't that quiet. We also went during the beginning of mini lobster season and kids are out of school. my only suggestion is they make one pool for families and one for adults. Nice Tiki bar opened late.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service!!! loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tropiclovers123
Reviews.Content: The customer service was so excellent. It made the trip enjoyable for the whole family. The workers by the pool were wonderful, always making sure you had everything you needed, I would defenitley recommend this resort to any family who is looking for a relaxing vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina is nice, BUT.....”
Reviews.Author: BigWhale
Reviews.Content: Back 20 years ago when it was the Marriott Casa Marina.....it was a 5-star hotel complete with exclusivity, pampering, great service & great food......since that time, the place has been owned by 2 other groups.....and although they have spent a fortune with expansion & renovations....they have unfortunately lost the old southern charm and specialness....It's sad to say, but I'll never be back....even if it's 2 nights for the price of one. It is way too expensive for what you get. Very Disappointed. Go stay at The Gardens Hotel instead....a small B&B that knows how to make you feel special.....pay a lot less and be treated like royalty.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: PatriotDad
Reviews.Content: What a great property as long as you understand the general limitations of Key West itself (lack of natural beaches). The resort has done a very nice job with their beach (for lounging) and pool areas. Very well landscaped. Service was impeccable. Everyone had a can-do/will-do attitude. Rooms were very comfortable and well maintained. Can't really comment on the restaurant as we really only had breakfast (buffet which was fine) on the property. The resort is also easy walking distance to the south end of Duval Street. Would highly recommend this property for those looking for a nicer place to stay on Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jillef
Reviews.Content: My husband, brother-in-law, sister-in-law and I stayed at the Casa Marina on July 17. The hotel is not kept up in the manner one would expect for the price (over $250 in the "low" season, plus resort fees, etc) and the "Waldorf Astoria" name. Our rooms had filthy windows, chipped mirror frames, dirty glasses in the hall and around the pool. The lobby has two small bars although one never opened while we were there and the other was not open by 6 p.m. There was no magnifying mirror in the bathroom and amenities were minimal. The setting is nice. The hotel has 2 pools which, due to the hot weather, were too warm to be refreshing. One suggestion would be to designate one pool preferably for adults and one for families. As it is, kids dominate both pools. One nice touch is frozen towels which are distributed to those at the pool and by the beach. it should be noted that the hotel is located in a quiet area which is a trek from most restaurants and shoppes.
