Louie's Backyard is a great restaurant that is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Does Not Live Up To Historical Expectations. Constant Conventions”
Reviews.Author: TravelBugsForever1
Reviews.Content: When reserving at The Casa Marina, we had expected "Old World Key West Elegance." We have seen the exterior of the hotel many times in the past and have been greatly impressed by its historical significance in Key West. We expected, particularly since it is now part of the Waldorf Astoria family... Key West charm combined with resort amenties. The lobby somewhat lived up to our expectations with its hardwood floors and largessse. The staff was all wonderful, outgoing and friendly. The room itself was a disappointment. It was comfortable and clean. However, it may might as have been any standard, clean chain hotel room. Not the old world charm we anticipated whatsoever. The elevator was broken for 5 of our 7 nights and we had to utilize the fire escape. The only meals we had were room service breakfasts which were good, fairly priced, and arrived promptly. There were continuous conventions going on throughout our visit which felt disruptive and did not meld with the atmosphere we anticipated. Further two nights had large wedding parties. The beach is great and we enjoyed swimming in the Atlantic. The bicycle rentals were fairly priced and the beach staff friendly. People seemed to put towels on the poolside chairs early in the morning to "reserve them" for themselves and then really didn't utlize them and left them unoccupied. Thus twice when attempting to utilize the pool we had to opt out as not one chair was "available" 'tho many empty.....they simply had been "hijacked" by towels. This hotel seems to cater to conventions and wedding parties and does not, in our eyes, live up to its historical ideals. We would not return and opt for a more charming bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Was More Than We Expected”
Reviews.Author: GS022509
Reviews.Content: If you want a delightful beach at Key West, stay at Casa Marina! It is a small resort but it is all you need. We swam in the two pools, ate lunch outdoors (very good) and after we jet skied around Key West(great tour and you can rent them at the resort), we sat at the bar for a few drinks. The employees were outstanding all the way around!!! The grounds were lovely, and very clean. The balcony room was ok, but I would recommend that they improve the sink/countertop area! It was clean though! All in all a great mini vacation! We will return!

Reviews.Title: “Beach, fun & sun!”
Reviews.Author: xwebb1
Reviews.Content: Hotel is wonderful. Staff is always friendly and takes care of the guests. Pool and beach are well maintained and extremely relaxing. We love how the pool/restaurant/bar staff always bring around water, popsicles, drinks of the day for your enjoyment! The rooms are always spotless and the beds are heavenly! Shower size is a plus but if you're sunburned the water pressure can be a bit much! Make sure you use sunscreen! It's off the beaten path, but close enough to Duvall and the Southernmost Point, that you get great exercise! We stay here on our yearly trips to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing beach and amazing beach staff”
Reviews.Author: Johnlongano
Reviews.Content: Coming here for years and Mark, Max and Graham always pamper us. Can't say enough about them. Best service ever. Nice fitness center. Resnel keeps it immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “One of our best trips!”
Reviews.Author: rocon98
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa July 16 through the 21st and could not have had a better trip! This was our first trip to Key West and we were not sure what to expect. We were blown away! The hotel is beautiful. I am a Diamond member with Hilton Honors and we stayed on points. However, we upgraded to a one bedroom oceanview suite for a small additional nightly fee. Thanks Brandon!. The room was perfect for my family of 4 and had an outstanding view. As I read the other reviews, the housekeeping staff did get some negative comments. I must say, we did not experience any of this. Our room was cleaned promptly and when we requested additional towels and sheets and they were right on it. I do have to say that the service throughout the hotel was great. Especially the beach and pool staff. We met Max on our first day and to be honest, we give him credit for making out trip fantastic. He spent quite a bit of time each day giving us suggestions on excursions and restaurants and getting our chairs on the beach or the pool. Max made all of our reservations for us. The waverunner tour of the island, the sunset cruise, the sailboat/snorkeling/kayaking 1/2 day excursion and our scooters for the day. He is truely an asset to the Casa and anyone going to the Casa should find Max on the beach and let him help you make your trip the best! Thanks Max! Hopefully we will see you on our next trip to the Casa! As the excursions go, we were extremely happy with Barefoot Billys which is located on the Casa's beach. Not having to travel to get to the excursions was a huge plus. The waverunner tour is a must do! Don't leave the island without doing this! One other must do is having dinner at Latitudes on Sunset Key. It is well worth the cost! We had the 7:45pm seating so we got to enjoy the sunset from our table outside. The dinner and view of the sunset was amazing and not to be missed. Thanks to the Casa and Max for one of our best trips! We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and views......but”
Reviews.Author: JTDT_11
Reviews.Content: My husband brought me here for my birthday. The hotel and lobby were beautiful, the views were amazing. That being said, being a 5 star hotel I expected to be amazed by my room. The first night my husband and I tossed and turned all night, couldn't get comfortable we found out in the morning why...the sheets on our bed were disgusting, it was as if they were never changed from the previous guest it was awful, when we nicely complained to the front desk they said someone would be there shortly to to fix it and a few hours later it wasn't fixed. Thank goodness for Mark at the beach. He came by and asked us how our stay was and when we told him he lit a fire under someone.That night we had the cleanest sheets and pillow cases along with a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolate covered strawberries with an apology letter. Mark also gave my husband and I free drinks by the pool for my birthday, he went above and beyond and made the rest of the stay enjoyable. One more thing...request a room without an adjoining room. The person next to us kept their tv on all night and we were awoken all through the night. All that said it was a beautiful hotel and we had a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds in Key West..”
Reviews.Author: kidzeyedoc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent the first week of June at the Casa Marina. Although there are many wonderful places to stay in Key West, we wanted to stay where we could soak in the "flavor" of Key West, but also someplace that offered a more resort-like experience...truly, the Casa Marina had both. It is one of the most historic and well-known properties on the entire island, as it was financed by Flagler in the early 1900's. The lobby is beautiful, with the original circa early 1900's hardwood floors and staircase. The pools and grounds are very beautiful and well-maintained, reminding us a bit of the Grand Wailiea in Maui, which is also a Waldorf Astoria Resort. Our room was quite spacious and the bed was VERY comfortable. We LOVED the extremely large balcony we had (that had wooden plank flooring, 2 chaise lounges, 2 chairs, a small table and large umbrella - I joked that we could have easily entertained guests on it). My husband was not crazy about the fact that although we had an "ocean front" room, there were so many palm trees on the property that we could barely see the ocean! (Personally, I liked the palm trees!) The resort beach is small, but one should not go to Key West expecting expansive sandy beaches. The beach was well equipped with comfortable lounge chairs and several hammocks tied between palm trees. Honestly, to me, there was nothing better than lying in the hammock and listening to the palms rustle in the breeze! Another highlight was eating breakfast each morning literally only steps away from the beach and the ocean. (The food quality was also quite good.) Bike rentals are available at the resort, and we enjoyed riding to several places in town and along a path that runs along Smather's Beach to the airport. We only had two complaints about our room: the bathroom was quite small (but that is to be expected in a historic resort, as I have experienced in other fine historic hotels such as the Don Cesar in St. Petersburg, FL and Hotel Hershey, Hershey, PA), and noise easily tranferred through a connecting room door...or maybe the gentleman in the room next to us was just very loud while talking on his phone. The only other downside is that the resort is a bit further from Duvall Street and many of the prime attractions than other smaller Inns or B& B's...but the upside to that is that it is much more quiet and peaceful not being in the middle of all the action. Honestly, we were able to walk or take an inexpensive cab ride to wherever we wanted to go. The Old Town Trolley also stops right at the resort, so that makes sight-seeing a bit easier if you don't have a car. Would I stay at the Casa Marina again? Absolutely. It was a wonderful place to stay with great food, service and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Elegantly sophisticated and sexy - not just my date, but the hotel too!”
Reviews.Author: Agaememnon1
Reviews.Content: I have to say - this was a most enjoyable, full service accommodation that we have stayed at in a long time. After the concierge and I worked out all of our plans (thank Ann) and we ate til we dropped (go to Hot Tin Roof!) - it was nice to sit at the watering hole and really be treated by the attentive staff. People like our server (Stefan) who was there everyday to greet us and bring frozen eucalyptus scented towels, Max - who made sure our sunglasses were cleaned and our drinks were full and finally not to forget Mark and his beach attendance and suggestions like goto Louie's backyard for an on the water experience....hint, hint - it's next door. - I dont want to forget Ramona - room staff - she made sure that the beautiful room that looked down the causeway onto the beach, was in perfect order and clean every single day! Thank you all for Making this a very nice experience - we will return. I recommend this location for people who want to be pampered and arent concerned about paying a little more to assure that they get it. - p.s. - go see Judith for a serious massage!

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: StefSchampaert
Reviews.Content: we ended our family vacation in Casa Marina and what a treat it is... When checking in, Patrick from reception promptly invited my son to go fishing at the hotel's pier. A welcome we won't forget... Rooms are spacious, clean and the hotel's fix resort fee offers free internet, drinks of the day and clean towels whenever you want at the pool,... we took a Breakfast package and it turned out to be a great idea. Just make sure you have breakfast early if you want to sit inside... The private beach and piers that offer a great swim in the ocean are a plus. We also took the 2hours jetski ride that takes you on a 27miles trip around the island... a must... The hotel is perfectly situated in a quiet spot but within proximity of Duval street. Great place to stay - not cheap but worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Location-A Key West Original”
Reviews.Author: dlrvdth
Reviews.Content: Great location in Key West. One of the few with it's own private beach. Walk to "Southern Most Point" and Duval. The hotel is like walking through the grand old times past of the original railroad millionaires. The "original" rooms are somewhat small but have amazing character. The pool and beach area will blow your mind.

Reviews.Title: “Great setting, soothing room, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JWUSA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Marina at the recommendation of a friend and the hotel did not disappoint. I was glad to have splurged and gone for the Flagler King with the view of one of the two swimming pools and the ocean and beautiful palm trees. The room was clean and done up in soothing colors. It was hard to leave the hotel's beautiful grounds and hammmocks to have dinner in town but the next morning, we had the ample and fresh breakfast buffet on the outdoor terrace, followed by a snorkeling trip that you can board at the dock right on the property. Both were very convenient and reasonably priced. My only critique would be that...when I got up to take pictures of dawn and have a pre-breakfast swim, the pool area was littered with cups, beer cans and towels from the night before. Someone came to clean but not until about 7:30 a.m. and still there were no towels until much later. I tried to take a laid back approach and take it in stride but it would have been perfect if the pool area was clean. The staff was really nice - esp. the one from Boston at check-in and check-out and our Turkish waiter!

Reviews.Title: “Bad service...”
Reviews.Author: GidgetGoneCajun
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful and in the best location. The problem was the service... They told us to expect servers around the pool and beach.... The concierge said,"You've paid the fees so let us "wait" on you!" We were there every day and never had a server come to us without asking the bar for one. I am 30 and was carded every time I went to the same bartender and they even sent me back to the beach to get my husbands ID. Remember, I shouldn't have even had to walk to the bar because of so said beachside service. The walls to the room were paper thin and the room was small and had a modern design. The carpeted hallways smelled terrible. We had a great time in Key West outside of our hotel.....

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing...Luxurious...Wonderful Service...Historical...Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RainLuva
Reviews.Content: Been here twice now, got engaged on the beach and back for our one year anniversary. Will be back many years to come. Always ultra relaxing. Love the hammocks and palm trees. Close to Duval without being right on Duval. Food choices are excellent. Dinner on the beach is a must

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxurious hotel with a perfect service and an ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Marc_Bxl
Reviews.Content: We received a great service from the dedicated hotel team, taking really care of their customers. The room was fantastic : very clean, well located (sea side) and with all the comfort expected (and required) in a luxury hotel (most probably the best in Key West). We enjoy the private beach, (2) swimming pools, and the fun and entertainment possibilities (top class !).

Reviews.Title: “Elegance Meets Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: TannaNicely
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina oozed old world charm with the upmost attention to detail. While we are the beach (chairs and umbrellas were put up complimentary by wait staff), the staff provided us with Ben and Jerry treats, sample drink of the day, sunglass cleaning, and discussions about what to see around town. All of those services were free! Wear plenty of sunscreen, but dress is casual. The main street of Key West is within walking distance, but next time we will rent bikes. Even my teenagers loved the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved every moment”
Reviews.Author: plain-jainTucson
Reviews.Content: This beautiful and historic hotel is set on a private beach - a tranquil setting away from the hub-hub of Duval street. We enjoyed a sunset dinner with our toes in the sand, massages on the beach in the breeze, cocktails at the pool bar and lunches at the SunSun restaurant. Quality of food is excellent. The staff are exceptional and I would like to mention in particular the following people - Max, Mark, Graham and Stefan who made our beach time wonderful with Popsicles, fruit flavored iced water, cool mistings, frozen towels and sunglass cleaning along always with smiling faces. Ellie in the SunSun Restaurant was attentive and cheerful - a pleasure to see every day. Don and Ann at the concierge desk took care of great restaurant reservations and were happy to help in any way possible. We had an ocean view suite and found the amenities to be very good. Comfortable bed, fluffy quality towels and very clean well maintained accommodations. We were there during school vacation, so there were many families with children at this time. Go! Have a good time!

Reviews.Title: “Super location”
Reviews.Author: globeric
Reviews.Content: Stayed a week at the hotel with my wife. The location was perfect being right by the sea and with a private beach. Our room supposedly had a sea view and yes, you could technically just about see the sea through the small window (which could not open) and the trees. The pools were excellent and the open air bar nice and relaxed with super service. The beach was OK but not for swimming, too much sea weed. The room was pretty average and the maid service so so, and the concierge service pretty lame. Not what I would have expected from this kind of hotel. Without the location (and the bar :-) this hotel would be dead in the water.

Reviews.Title: “Fun week in paradise,we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: carolynspinacolada
Reviews.Content: The only resort that has it's own private beach.we looked at others but why go second best and have a boardwalk someplace else when you can actually swim,snorkel in the ocean a minute from your room or lay in a hammock right on the beach?This resort is BEAUTIFUL.Also has 2 pools on the property with ocean views.You can sit at the pool or have your own umbrella,table and lounge chair set up where you want on the beach..Just ask JAKE,WILL,or TYLER and these guys will go out of their way to make sure you are #1.They also provide frozen towels,drinks of the day,etc.And you have to see LISA at the bar for the very best cocktails and service.I loved her pina coladas!! Please make sure you tip these people well as they go all out for you.The GM should be very proud.Take advantage of concierge to plan family activities(thankyou Caroline)prior to your vist or while your'e at the resort.We went on the sunset cruise and jetski tours offered at the resort.Had a blast!They also planned other events such as White Knuckle Thrill boat(they will pick you up and bring you back to the resort)and Sebago all day adventure was fun(gotta do the parasailing).Take advantage of the wonderful breakfast buffet,order lunch at the bar(LISA)or take it to go (cheaper than room service) for the kids if they want to snack in the room.Mallory square is walkable,but take a cab for $3.00 per person .Cab rides from and to the airport are $8.00.Buy you're sunscreen at cvs on the island,the resort gift shop set us back $19.07 for a bottle!(that's my only beef).We got a OCEAN VISTA 1 BDRM SUITE (2012)AND HAD THE MOST BEAUTIFUL VIEWS OF OCEAN AND POOLS).It had a sofa bed and side couch that our teenagers slept on.(the 2bdrm suite was not available).You have to go to Sloppey Joes and see Barry Cuda at the piano,fun.Haggle a little when shopping Mallory square and get items 50-80% off.You can get t-shirts and bathing suits for $5.00!They will accomadate late check out if possible and secure your luggage until your flight.(Thankyou Patrick,Front Desk).We love this place so much that we are planning our next trip at Casa Marina.THANKYOU AGAIN TO LISA,JAKE,TYLER AND WILL.FOR GOING THAT EXTRA MILE TO MAKE OUR STAY SO VERY SPECIAL!!

Reviews.Title: “Our "go to" place in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: anastassia27
Reviews.Content: It's been close to year since we've been to the Casa Marina and a month doesn't go by we don't talk about getting back to this BEAUTIFUL property! Right on the beach, two gorgeous pool areas, exceptional customer service and a wonderfully relaxing, luxurious experience! Everyone on staff are fantastic! Out of my several trips to all of The Keys Casa Marina is so far my favorite stay!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the hype”
Reviews.Author: QuarterDano
Reviews.Content: Problems from beginning to end. Check in was fast, but didn't get our bags to the room for 25 min! Had to call and was still another 15 min. Unacceptable. Check in fine Service acceptable but kind of attitudey. Lobby is pretty but dark and has major lighting problems. Room was so unimpressive for a Waldorf Astoria. Very basic. Too basic. It took over 20 min to get bags to our room. Had to call front desk and still another 10 min. Porter said he'd replace our missing luggage rack, but never showed. Room was VERY basic. Not impressive. Toilet was a cheapy Home Depot type which clogged and had to call front desk to fix. Coffee not replaced and had to call to get replaced. Went to the private "beach" and concierge didn't offer towels, drinks, water, cold towel, etc, which is what our "resort fee" was for. Staff very attitudey. All in all this did not live up to a Waldorf property expectation. Save the money and go to a private bed and breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “simply awesome!”
Reviews.Author: cp167
Reviews.Content: After booking our trip to Key West, I read a lot of reviews of Casa Marina on this and other sites, and started worrying about some of the negative comments - don't let them dissuade you. This place was great!! The property was stunning and we had an amazing time! If you're the kind of person who likes to complain, then, sure, you'll probably find something negative to say about Casa Marina. However, if you enjoy beautiful scenery and views, friendly service while relaxing at the pool or in a beach hammock, and delicious food and drink, then you'll do well staying here. We had no issues during our 5 day stay and really enjoyed our time there. It was the best of both worlds. Casa Marina was far away enough from ' the action' of Duval street if we wanted to relax at the resort, but not too far a walk from anything that we wanted to do in Key West (we walked everywhere). We'll look forward to staying here again when we head back to Key West!

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE!”
Reviews.Author: tx_2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed July 11th-15th. This place was nothing less than paradise. The most beautiful place i saw on the trip. Our patio looked out on to the volleyball court and we had an amazing view of the water. We did enjoy the pool a few days, the ice cold wash cloths were just perfect on those HOT days in KW. The breakfast buffet was delicious and so were the Mojitos! be sure to try both. The rooms were nice and the beds were really comfy! The hammocks on the beach were really nice at night, they were the perfect place for my boyfriend to pop the question! :) we will definitely be back, maybe for the honeymoon! i hope everyone enjoys their stay as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool Services and Location. We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: sarahsz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Casa Marina with my boyfriend while in Key West for a wedding. We couldn't be happier with our stay. The amenities made our vacation stress-free and the location is ideal. We loved the pool/beach towel and chair services, especially the help and advice of Max and Tyler. Max gave us some great advice on local eateries and even called to make a reservation for us. We would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Best Key West has to offer!”
Reviews.Author: dianejacobson
Reviews.Content: Another great holiday in the Keys. Hotel is as lovely as ever. The couples massage on the beach is fabulous. Very relaxing

Reviews.Title: “Relaxation at its best”
Reviews.Author: Rook3rs
Reviews.Content: We came for a week of relaxing in the sun and that is exactly what this hotel can offer. Since the hotel was fully booked, we were given a room overlooking the car park and side street but it was quite quiet.. The room was fairly large with plenty of storage space although the bathroom was very cramped. The staff were very helpful and the pool staff were exceptionally friendly. The pool area is the best part of this hotel with two decent--sized pools and sufficient sun loungers and umbrellas. More loungers/umbrellas are available on the small beach although swimming from the beach is not recommended due to rocks. However you can swim from the steps off the small pier. The cold drinks, the drink of the day, and popsickles brought round the pool area during the day are excellent. The food in the restaurants and Sun-sun has ample portions, is very good, and reasonably priced. Although the hotel is on the quiet side of the island (excellent for a relaxing stay) it is only a few dollars for a taxi to the hotspots of Duval street.

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: Ogomez007
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel; great staff; suites somewhat expense. Overall good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with fantastic service.”
Reviews.Author: bjfromatl
Reviews.Content: We are loving the Casa. Upon arrival our check-in was the start of superior customer service. Brandon helped us get upgraded to a balcony room with an ocean view. The balcony is as big as the room. Later that night we received a complimentary bottle of champagne to celebrate our 15th anniversary. The great service continued outside with the pool/beach staff. They made us feel right at home. You do have to walk around a mile to get to the restaurants and bars but we were fine with that. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very good but old hotel with only beach front location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: RMT-Scotland
Reviews.Content: Old hotel built for the railroad which used to exist. Old style rooms with small bathrooms and small LCD TVS dulled the high standard of this Waldorf Astoria group hotel. It is the most famous hotel in Key West which has excellent staff but the building shows its age here and there. eg poor slow lift to rooms which has to be entered by leaving the main entry building to go outside even if raining which is not a good design. We had a good view of the front beach and the hotel staff work hard and maintain the hotel to a high standard. We had a room with an adjoining door to the next hotel room and the sound proofing was very poor. It is not ideal to have to listen to foul mouthed guests in the next room using 4 letter words in each sentence and also with our son with us. The beach front side of the hotel is 5 star and cannot be complained about other again showing its age in a few places eg pier into sea and condition of the swimming platform. It was good that there were not additional charges for using the sunbeds or umbrellas although there was a 25 dollar resort fee to cover a few things. The hotel had two free internet PCS which were often used during the day but available after 7pm most nights. . valet parking 25 dollars per day and 15 dollars per day for self parking. The valet parking was a bit of a rigmarole and we went self parking after seeing what the valet parking entailed. The hotel is not located in the centre of the nightlife and is 2-2.5 miles from the main area at seafront end of Duval Street-main street for Key West bars and restaurants. Long walk in heat or need to use car or taxi. Overall an 85% rating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, family friendly, impeccable service.”
Reviews.Author: hearthorses
Reviews.Content: This was the right hotel in the right location for our family in Key West for 4th of July 2011 weekend. The staff at the pool are 2nd to none - loved the frozen towels, the fruit water, the treats for the kids, and the pool games in the afternoon. The hammocks are the best! Only suggestions for management - move seaweed off the property completely daily and pools need to be a little better maintained each morning before the guest begin using. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend and brought our little dog!”
Reviews.Author: Mr.andMrs.C
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for the 4th of July weekend. We had a great time and even brought our little dog. Dog's under 25 lbs are welcome at the hotel. We booked the jet ski tour, concierge booked an offshore fishing trip with Wild Bill and they picked us up right at the hotel dock, and enjoyed the area. We had great recommendations for food. One night we hit Louie's Backyard and had an excellent dinner. Cute place and within 5 minutes walking distance from the hotel. Room was super clean and they even delivered dog bowls, bone placement and a dog bed upon check-in. It was perfect. The guys that helped set out beach chairs and towels were wonderful. I believe it was Max that told us about the hotel opening up to locals for the fireworks and assured us we'd have our lounge chairs saved all day if we decided to come and go. We will be back and enjoyed the fact that we could bring our dog. It was a great weekend! Thank you for making our trip so wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort with a few issues”
Reviews.Author: catnjim1
Reviews.Content: This is my first review on TripAdvisor. I began using this site a few months ago when trying to decide where to vacation in the Keys - what a great website. So, I felt since many people use this when deciding on vacation, I should include my review: First let me say the resort property is very nice - pools and beach are beautiful. The lobby is very comfy but the couches and pillows could use a cleaning. Our room was not ready when we arrived at 2pm so we went out to Sun Sun for lunch - very nice place to have lunch. Our room was ready at 4pm. Our ocean vista suite was clean and very comfortable. After the first night I requested a room change - the noise from Higgs Beach and the street was unbelievable. The Casa changed our suite that day and put us in a very nice, quiet suite. When booking, request a room/suite not street side. I had read (and still do) about the excellent pool/beach service. I must say, I was not that impressed. We stayed during the week of July 4th. We paid $25 a day for a resort fee which includes "complimentary beach/pool chairs and umbrellas." Well not on July 4th. If you wanted a beach chair the beach/pool guys were charging you $10 extra per chair. Note to yourself - if you're staying over a holiday, be prepared to pay extra for the beach. We made use of Barefoot Billy's for a waverunner 2 hour tour (right on Casa's property.) The tour guide Kris was exceptional. As it was a mixed group of experienced and new riders, he found the perfect balance - would highly recommend doing this. A couple of meal suggestions - best wings we ever ate are in the Rum Barrel - you have to try them! Prime 951 - EXCELLENT Steahouse! Was recommended by a cab driver and was a wonderful way to end our vaction in Key West. Abit pricey but worth it. Overall, the Casa Marina was very nice - would probably return.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise was great but Mark made it so much better! Thank you Mark”
Reviews.Author: jogunthner
Reviews.Content: When we checked to our room at the hotel we were tired. Once we hit the beach, we both settled into our usual routine of reading and lounging. After about an hour, Mark Grey approached us and our stay changed for the better! Some people take customer service to a whole new level ~ and Mark did just that. We ate at a restaurant that was wonderful, we had frozen towels, my glasses have never been cleaner and we laughed until we cried. We are seriously considering a return visit! Thanks for an awesome time on the beach, Mark.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the Sun”
Reviews.Author: karlaisatthebeach
Reviews.Content: One our second trip to key west, we stayed at the Casa Marina for the second time. If you are goal on your trip is to do the Duval Crawl then you may find this resort to be overpriced and in a poor location. If you want a hotel on the beach with hammocks, drink service as well as two pools in an idyllic setting then this hotel is for you. Rooms are spacious and comfortable and staff cater to your whim, truly a resort like no other in key west.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great room, great view.”
Reviews.Author: jimnovak1
Reviews.Content: Service was great, the room was clean with private deck that had a great view of the 2 large pools and the water. Jet skis, sailing, kayaks you name it they have it. But again, the best part was the service. I recommend the Casa Marina to everyone especially my friends. What a great vacation!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Casa Marina, Key West”
Reviews.Author: HappyIslandTravelers
Reviews.Content: We had a great time during our six day stay at the Casa Marina. The hotel, grounds and rooms are beautiful. We enjoyed many free amenities such as cold water to drink, drink of the day, popsicles and a cold washcloth each day at the pool. The workers made it a five star resort. Everyone was more than happy to assist you with anything you needed. We enjoyed breakfast each morning and lunch in the afternoon by the pool or ocean. We saw the sunset at Mallory Square and The Top. It is a 20 minute walk to Duvall Street. We especially want to thank Ellie, Jozef and Patrick for making our stay enjoyable. They are top-notch staff members and would be the reason for us coming back. You will find Jozef in the morning at breakfast and Ellie and Patrick at lunch. Patrick was really helpful in giving us places in the area to eat. Be sure to ask!

Reviews.Title: “This was our second visit in three months!”
Reviews.Author: kip22_11
Reviews.Content: We came in March but for only one night. The experience was so impressive that we scheduled another visit this June. We live in Arizona so it is no short trip! It is beyond a hotel, it's a chance to experience old world charm and history. The staff is warm, helpful, and genuine. Tyler, (who worked the bar and pool area) even lent me $20 to tip the leader of the jet ski tour! Now that's service! The only downside is checking out - who wants to leave?

Reviews.Title: “Pool & beach services”
Reviews.Author: SCarolinaBaseballl
Reviews.Content: We had a great time just relaxing and having family fun. When you get to the pool Graham & Jon set you up. They work as a team and take great care to insure you enjoy your stay. Graham even cleaned our sun glasses for us and found a cocoanut for our youngest who was enamored by all the trees and their fruit. While not at the pool we spent time fishing off of the resorts pier. I'd suggest bringing your own gear but in a pinch you can get what you need at Kmart or the local bait & tackle shop. All in all we had a fun and memorial relaxing week. Thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “Mark did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: nckeysgirl
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful return trip to the Casa in Key West. You can't imagine how excited our kids were when Mark recognized them and gave them a big welcome back to the Casa! It is so wonderful to encounter someone who truly knows what customer service is all about and how valuable it can be when it comes to where people want to vacation. Thank you for putting Mark on the beach. He made our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Surprise"”
Reviews.Author: comett554
Reviews.Content: This was a surprise trip from my husband on my 41st birthday. The hotel was special to me since I have stayed at this hotel since it was the Flagler. Although we were not asked for our Hilton Honor card we stay at Hilton's and Hilton family hotels a considerable amount of time throughout the year. First, the great things about the hotel... the grounds/location of the hotel are very well kept, Elaina- at the pool service was very attentive, Jesse- the Bellman was so very helpful, the beach/pool area and the bar girls who made an effort to make my birthday very memorable, Judith- at the Spa did a great job and the gym was well appointed. Now, the trip could have been ruined if we had let it by a very confrontational front desk attendant named Brandon who insisted we housed our 13 pound King Charles Spaniel illegally in our room and could not help us with house keeping. My husband DID inform the hotel about our pet when making the reservations and again when checking in. We are used to the additional pet fee and gladly pay the fee so that we can travel with our pet. Both times my husband was told there were no problems- the Casa was a "pet friendly" hotel- until Brandon decided to make an issue with our pet. My small dog has traveled extensively her whole life and is very quiet and calm. In fact, on this trip I am 100 percent sure that she acted better than the locals that laid out next to us on the beach the first day and were too intoxicated to walk, the wedding party that kept us up until 3:00 a.m. on Sunday morning and the child in the swimming pool with a regular diaper, not a swim diaper, just to name a few incidents that ensure she behaved. We asked Brandon for our room to be cleaned not once, not twice but three times, yet it was NEVER serviced and after the fact we were told that it was because of our dog, yet we had not been informed that all we needed to do was be in the room with our pet while the cleaning ladies did their work. After the fact, we were also told that house keeping was scared to DEATH of dogs. Realizing our room was NOT going to be serviced probably from the laziness of house keeping, not my dog in her kennel, we simply asked for towels, yet we never saw fresh towels, wash clothes, toliet paper or tissues. The front desk did offer a peace offering of a bottle of wine yet at this point all we wanted were clean towels. If the hotel claims "pet friendly" the entire staff should be just that. Brandon obviously has more on his mind than being hospitable and welcoming. I consider the Casa a nice option when coming to Key West yet after this encounter, sadley, it will no longer be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Christy_P01
Reviews.Content: LOVE, LOVE THIS PLACE! My husband and I have stayed at this hotel 4 years in a row. The staff is extremely helpful especially the beach staff. As we were getting ready to move chairs they stopped us because they said thatâ€™s their job and as guest we are there to have no stress! How wonderful!! On our most recent stay we received a free upgrade to a beach front room. Awesome!! This hotel is beautiful and is definitely a relaxing place; after all everyone needs a little rest from Duvall Street!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Friendly Staff We Will Come Back!”
Reviews.Author: teloulacamille
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Marina Resort for 1 week. The grounds are breathtaking, the service is great and the rooms are very nice. There is plenty to do at the restort; jet ski rentals, kyaking, snorkeling or just relaxing on on a hammock or on the beach with the sound of the waves crashing while sipping on the hotel's specialty drinks.

Reviews.Title: “nice place but...”
Reviews.Author: rsbain61
Reviews.Content: Headed to the Keys with the family for the first time. Our kids are 20 and 18 so we have the freedom of adult like experiences while we are away. We tried to book Hilton at Key Largo Grand Vacation hotel but were unable to apply my points to that property for our entire vacation. This led to a Hilton advisor to suggest a Waldorf property in Key West, Same points and a higher class hotel. Interesting that with my Gold Hilton status, I take for granted a free breakfast buffet daily. My family is good with cereal, yogurt, oatmeal, fresh fruit and on occasion scrambled eggs and bacon. All included. At Casa Marina, breakfast is $26 pp. A bit over the top I would say especially since we are staying 5 days. That's over $500 just for breakfast, ouch. Challenge to be in Florida in the summer is that it is hot. Not just that the sun is hot, but the sun will crisp you up like a nice piece of applewood smoked bacon. Go for a dip in the pool to cool off.....nice try. Pool is 80 degrees! Let's walk down to ocean and jump in....oh my, equally as hot. No place to cool off. Our room is okay. Not much space to put clothes for 4 people. I decide to work out of my suitcase and the girls fight for limited drawer space. This room is smaller than a Hampton Inn room I get traveling on the road for business for $99 a night. And that room does come with a very decent breakfast and warm cookies at night. Okay, enough trashing the place, there are a few highlights. The gym or fitness center is across the street in an old house but is freezing cold and has enough equipment for at least 10 or so to be there at once. We had no problems finding an elyptical and a tread mlll. Free towels and small cold water bottles. Very nice. Also, the outside bar was very good for my daughter and me to watch the US Women's World Cup and the American team beat France 3-1! Daniela was very attentive and nice to us. No attitude when we just wanted cold water. I did have a few beers and ordered the fried conch and it was warm, crunchy and filling. Also, the boys at the pool and beach were terrific. Tyler and Jake in particular were funny, entertaining and extremely attentive. They set us up on the beach with 2 umbrellas as I do not do full sun. They frequently checked in on us, delivered ice pops and frozen wash cloths with eucalyptus. Refreshing! Also Deon was always there when we needed her. We still have a few days left but will probably think twice about Waldorf in general. Not unless I get a huge promotion in the near future. Good luck!

Reviews.Title: “Great property!!”
Reviews.Author: barnes-indy
Reviews.Content: Great property. Service is excellent. Everyone is extremely helpful and friendly. Within walking distance to Duval St or rent scooters or bikes from Barefoot Billy's (on site). Got great advice (and service) from Max (Pool Service) on where to go. He was extremely nice and helpful; took care of making reservations and gave us drink coupons to places. The property has a nice beach and pools...quiet and private. Wonderful experience!

Reviews.Title: “We will be back!!! Perfect for a couple w/no kids. Relaxing beach, great service.”
Reviews.Author: TJO422
Reviews.Content: Get to the beach early if you want a hammock (I did) Can't say enough about everbody from the front desk staff to the waiters at the beach. A+ service. The grounds/building are beautiful, well kept, very soothing.

Reviews.Title: “Go for a wedding, stay for the view.”
Reviews.Author: fastball16
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for friend's wedding on the beach property. My wife and I were very pleased with the accommodations and service. The staff are a diverse group of folks from Boston to locals. They were all very polite and courteous. The place has an vintage feel, with modern improvements to a Victorian resort. Our room was comfortable with cool amenities like a Nespresso machine (better than coffee). The room service is pricey as it is a destination resort, but the menus could have been more creative than UNOs pizza and Fish/chips. Keep in mind the resort is NOT walking distance to Duval and Mallory Square shops/nightlife. The Westin Resort is nicely situated for this. In all, I recommend this place for special occasions and getaways.

Reviews.Title: “Mark on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: zebraroo
Reviews.Content: This was a wedding anniversary stay. Mark, the beach and pool staff, went up and beyond any level of curtiousness and hospitality. As soon as we walked into the pool/beach area Mark was greeting us and asking if we preferred the beach or the pool location. He gave us towels, chairs, daily itinerary and service beyond anything that anyone could, would ever need. The following day he greeted us by first name and asked how he could help us to enjoy our special time. This employee is EXTREMELY SUPERIOR to any other!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mark + Beach Staff = Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: EKLJTL
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came down for a few relaxing days after our wedding and were blown away by the quality of the service provided by Mark and the beach staff. While we were there several more hammocks arrived which we were so grateful for! They treated us like kings every day and ensured that we will most definitely be returning. The food/drinks are, of course, over-priced but worth the spend if you are treating yourself to a special occasion. Rooms weren't well attended to and we nearly had to beg for service which is the only thing keeping me from giving the Casa Marina an "Excellent" rating.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth a return visit”
Reviews.Author: 99drew99
Reviews.Content: The room was below average, for the price the view was of a roof....the bed and bedding was very clean and comfortable as it should be. Pool was cloudy, this place seems tired...

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: PimNordstrom
Reviews.Content: What an amazing view!!!!!! Sunset was awesome!! I grabbed a cocktail and laid in a hammock and just did nothing... Bartender was great (Suz), front desk was very helpful. Overall great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Can't think of a better hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: clutterconqueror
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend the Casa Marina. Probably what sets it apart from the other hotels is that it is situated on a private beach on the Atlantic. Absolutely beautiful. I loved combing the rocky beach for shells. Then if we wanted to swim in the ocean, all we had to do was walk out onto the pier where a set of steps takes you down into about four feet of water for swimming. Smaller kids enjoyed exploring the rocks for shells and snails. And there is also soft sand where beach chairs and hammocks await. Next, they have two lovely swimming pools which face the ocean before you get to the beach. Well sized. Comfortable water temp. We really enjoyed the pool. There are two stations where you can ask a towel attendant for towels and assistance with beach chairs. The attendants were super friendly and helpful. Waiters come around for drink orders. There is also a bar and poolside dining area. The drinks were delicious and the food was also good. Have the pina colada. A great perk of Casa Marina is the concierge. See Don. He knows where all the good restaurants and site seeing trips are. We're not kidding! He directed us to the best dining and to the two side trips we took. A Sea Plane to Fort Jefferson and a relaxing Catamaran trip. We used the valet service often. The valets were really great. They also like to recommend dining places, and they too know what they're talking about. The grounds are lovely. The lobby is historic and stunning yet comfortable. It is important to note that in the gift shop, they have coffee and muffins and fruit in the morning as well as ice cream throughout the day. This is handy if you don't feel like having a full morning meal. There is not a full service-type restaurant on the premises, but they do have a large room and outdoor seating for a morning meal. This can include an all you can eat buffet. I can't recommend this as it was very expensive. They do also have items to order such as bagel, fruit plate, oatmeal etc. We found those to be a better bargain. Sit outside, the view is stunning. Our room was serviceable and comfortable, but not large or decorative. We had two adults and two kids in a room with two qeen beds. It did get a little tight with suitcases and swimsuits. Don't bother bringing beach towels. The hotel offers them at the pool and we were told we could bring them on the sea plane outing we booked through the hotel. Also, there was no place to dry the towels. The bathroom was clean and serviceable. Large shower, no tub, which I preferred. The room might have benefitted from towel bars, a little more storage space and more colorful artwork. However, we spent much of our time out of the room. And I do recall we were able to sleep comfortably and that is really all that matters. No noisy air conditioning and the beds were very comfortable. We also took advantage of their bike rental service. The bikes are well maintianed and fun to ride, although I would recommend riding to the beach path to the east rather than in the more congested areas of Duvall street, et al. We also used the jet skis. I have mixed reviews here. As we were inexperienced and went out on a very choppy day. The group leader rides very fast and well ahead of the group. I think this is intentional so people do not ride too close to one another causing wakes and waves. However, it was difficult to keep up and an adult member of our party did fall off. She was helped back onto the jetski by the leader and we were given the option of being dropped off at a sister hotel and bussed back to the Casa. All ended well. But if you're not adventurous, I'm not sure we can recommend beginning to ride a jetski in salt water and on the ocean. It was definitely a rigorous adventure.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: KBDonald
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Stayed in one bedroom suite and it was perfect for small family. Pools were perfect. Staff very good. Food in restaurants was always good just a little pricey. The only real downer was beach activity staff. They were rude and not very accommodating. Not sure if they were employed by hotel?

Reviews.Title: “Excellent trip”
Reviews.Author: paigebradford
Reviews.Content: My mother and I just got back from a 5 night stay at the Casa Marina. After a rough beginning(the transpertation from the airport to the hotel was taking FOREVER, so we eventually just took a cab instead) upon arriving to our hotel, our room was ready 3 hours early and we were able to go straight to the beach. We then recieved amazing beach service from my favorites Max and Tyler, they were both very friendly, telling us about the happenings of the hotel, and were always willing to bring us whatever we needed. We were above the room where weddings were held, and there were two weddings in the time we were there, but never fewar, there is one perfect fix for a loud room below you, GO OUT TO THE BEACH, there you may enjoy a BEAUTIFUL night with a starry filled sky and sometimes even an outdoor movie on a movie screen. The nights were beautiful, and there is no reason to not be outside enjoying them, even if you do have an early morning, I promise its worth it. The bar and resturant were popular places that we visited, and the service, although could be slower during busy lunch time, was friendly and always happy to help guests choose their meals. Everyone working at the bar was fantastic! our room although not overlooking the ocean, was beautiful. The watersports on the edge of the beach was awesome to rent equipment and go on fun jetski tours, with very hard working, helpful young men working all day. The concierege were all helpful, and showed us many resturants for our choice to feed a picky eater! We also were able to book a snorkel trip the night before it went out on a busy holiday weekend thanks to their help! So thank you Casa Marina, we throughly enjoyed our stay, and I am sure we will be returning, not just for the beach, and the Key West enviornment, but for the friendly hotel service we recieved each day! Thanks! Paige Bradford

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely perfect Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: juliejc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I wanted a relaxing, low-key Honeymoon in a resort that was easy to travel to (from New York) and would allow us to do nothing, or offer us activities/services if we wanted them. We really loved absolutely everything about our stay at the Casa Marina. We had a terrific beachfront room that was clean, quiet, spacious, with wonderful views. The staff was incredibily friendly and professional and responsive to any request. The beach was relaxing and quiet, with plenty of umbrellas and hammocks. We had breakfast and lunch most days on the property and the food was always delicious and fresh. The hotel has a fantastic gym; the two pools were never that crowded (though they were way too warm for our taste), and the constant treats from the pool guys -- popsicles, frozen hand towels, water spritzes, sunglass cleaning -- made for a lovely day on the beach. There are very few options in Key West for a full service resort like Casa Marina. If we do return, I can't imagine staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but I was disappointed”
Reviews.Author: teacherkim
Reviews.Content: My husband, son, and I just returned from a 4 day trip to the Waldorf and I was a little disappointed. We spend quiet a bit of time with the Hilton Chain and really expected them to be the above and beyond hotel. They were nice, clean, and open but no one really did anything to make you feel like you were being pampered. We felt much more catered to at the Doubletree on the other side of Key West and wished we'd stayed there longer. (Only stayed there on the night we were flying out of Key West after hopping the Keys) I really expected there to be tons of staff running around, asking if you needed towels and drinks but really they passed out popsicles, frozen towels, and cleaned your glasses with the occasional waiter/waitress asking if you were okay. Food was good but we only ate there for lunch a time or two. I didn't find it extremely over priced but you can really get more for your money by eating downtown key west (especially if you're having a drink or two) Room was cleaned and turned down daily and we could easily walk anywhere we wanted to go in Key West from the hotel. In fact, we walked to Mallory Square at least twice from the resort with no problems at all.

Reviews.Title: “Just Plain AWESOME!!!”
Reviews.Author: Leonardo0321
Reviews.Content: Had my hesitations from some of the reviews on Trip Advisor....but I must say from the moment I arrived t the time I departed, I felt like a King! Jesse was a delight helping us with our bags and valet of our car. Quite the professional and humorous Brandon got us booked into our lovely room and helped us navigate through all the amenities the hotel had to offer. The pool and beach were picture perfect, the views from our room most gorgeous! Patrick at the front desk was also a standout, as all the Casa staff truly know how to deliver great customer service! Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “The service was the best I have ever experienced!”
Reviews.Author: Nordyjen
Reviews.Content: We spent most of the trip entertaining clients out by the pool. Tyler, the pool attendant, was incredible! He helped us each day with towels, umbrellas, and entertaining us. It was his first day and his personality is beyond awesome. Patrick waited on us in the restaurant by the pool and was also impressive. They make a great team and really know how to make guests feel welcome. The hotel itself is pretty and being right on the beach is great. It is the people we encountered that made it so fantastic! Thank you Tyler and Patrick! I hope they hear about this review.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience of MY ENTIRE LIFE”
Reviews.Author: Robandjazzy
Reviews.Content: Me and my Wife have traveled to every continent LITERALLY our first year married we were in 36 countries and have stayed in hotels of just about every major brand. What was most dissappointing about this one is we came from the Mandarin in Miami Brickel Island and paid less the same as this Waldorf. The Mandarin I didn't feel so bad about spending 6.00 for a cup of coffee, they made me feel like it was worth 6.00. Ever time I spent money at Casa Marina (i refuse to refer to it as a Waldorf Astoria - it doesnt do the brand justice) I felt like I was being reamed and I was over paying. At dinner offisite after one item that broke the camels back I actually had to write down all the issues I had with the hotel to speak to them when I got back. 1. Drove up with my rental after a nice peaceful ride down - took me 10 minutes to get out of my car and get someone to help me with my luggage. 2. Checking in I was standing with a 4 year old for 20 minutes since they had only 1 person checking people in at 4:00 in the afernoon!. 3. It took almost 30 minutes to get our luggage to the room. 4. Carpet on the 4th floor was stained and maintenance room that was in serious dissaray was left open as soon as I got back into the building ( guests don't need to see this) 5. Me and my wife got food poisoning from the fish taco's by the pool BOTH OF US 2 hours later just as we were going to the Weston's Island Restaurant which we couldn't enjoy we since we threw up earlier and had the runs the entire first 1hr of the meal and had no appetite. PLUS everything everyone says about service by the pool totally dead on, NO ONE was there, there were no one to hand out towels, I had to wait around for 20 minutes for someone to get them and they brought 2, one for my wife and me to share and one for my sone I guess there was a towel shortage in the keys. 6. THIS WAS THE KICKER - concierge liseth or something from south africa, told us to go to a restaurant, would be perfect. We arrived at the place and asked the hostess for her honest opinion, where we should eat as a family that is kid friendly, (no one was really at the restaurant and that kinda worried me) she gave her nice honest opinion and said that the owner of the restaurant also owned another restaurant around the corner, that is more kid friendly. We went there and had a great dinner. We saw the concierge the next day and she asked how the dinner was, we stated we went to one of the other restaurants from the owner recommened by the concierge..... 3 hours later my wife gets a call in the hotel room, person has my room number and my last name... we are considering firing the hostes..... we want to know exactly what she said to you???? We downplayed the whole thing, how dare the concierge get us involved in this, she must have been soooo worried about her kickback from the restaurant she tried to get the girl fired, and also gave our information out so the manager of the restaurant called us directly. ARE YOU KIDDING ME????????. after our dinner at the westin ( I HAD SUCH HOTEL ENVY ) i went up to management, where they removed my resort fee ( thanks soo much I didn't realize i had to pay that 30.00 plus parking 25.00 and the room 330 or 360.00 for the night. and then removed half of one nights stay. thank you for that, however I will NEVER ever stay at this hotel again even if they paid me too, and I will always remember it as the worst hotel experience ever. Now I remember having 8 points on that paper I wrote down so I'm sure I'm missing a couple of important factors, but hopefully you spend your money elsewhere in the Keys. Also Thank you in advance Brandon Kuhn for your boiler plate "i'm sorry, we'll learn from this experience", my advice to you, is start over with the staff and for God's sake don't call this place a Waldorf, because if you are going to charge these prices and have that name, you better darn well live up to it.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS PLACE!!”
Reviews.Author: honeymooners_2011_2
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I traveled to Key West 4th of July weekend for our honeymoon and stayed at the Casa Marina and it was beautiful! I love the location of the hotel, the back of the hotel was all private beach with beautiful pools and several hammocks and chairs to relax in. Everyone there was very polite and helpful. I would recommend that you rent a scooter to get around town, but the hotel is nice and close to downtown so if you'd rather take a cab it's like an $8 to some amazing food. Whatever you do make sure you eat at "Mangia Mangia" and "Mr. Z's" they are AMAZING!! I loved the beds they were soo comfy, the rooms were slightly smaller than the pictures showed but still great. Breakfast is not included either, you have to pay $20 a person for the buffet but again "Camille's" is just down the street and they have amazing breakfast. You do have to pay for overnight parking but if you find parking on the street that's free. There's a company on the property "Barefoot Billy's" so it's super easy to book parasailing, jetskies, scooters, bikes, kayaks, paddleboards etc.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, But Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: mackenz320
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous - I'm talking oceanfront with beautiful beaches and 2 pools. I went with my boyfriend and we stayed there 3 nights for a wedding over the weekend. Now, with that being said, please know that the service was HORRIBLE. Not just from my perspective, but my very easy going boyfriend thought so as well. I ordered a salad from the pool bar (which is the only restaurant on-site) and it took ten minutes for a server to come up to us just so I could order. There were 4 pool servers standing by the bar chatting the whole time we was waiting for service. After finally being able to order, the waiter (her name was Deon) brought me the wrong salad and then tried to tell my boyfriend and I that I ordered chicken salad (which I do not eat chicken). She said I would have to wait longer if my order changed and I did wait, and the pool server staff started making rude comments as they walked by our table....absolutely ridiculous. This is just one example. Another example is the service at the concierge (or lack thereof). We called down to the concierge to have a cab called for us so we could make it to our dinner reservations. The concierge attendant said "Oh, you just have to come down and wait. We're not really the type of place to call ahead for you." EXCUSE ME??? This hotel is $300 a night!? What the heck is wrong with these people? Another example of this horrible service is when we went downstairs to speak to someone at the concierge about our party's wedding plans (which were at the Casa Marina). We waited 30 MINUTES for a concierge attendant to come down, but no one was available and the front desk said they couldn't help. We left without getting results from anyone. The whole 3 days we stayed at the Casa Marina our experience was like this...the maid wouldn't come to the room unless we called down to the front to remind them we needed maid service. For $300 per night, you can get a whole lot more out of your stay than crappy service without a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience with tremendous service”
Reviews.Author: smagley12
Reviews.Content: From the time you walk into the entrance of the hotel, service and a friendly smile are presented by the staff/ bell hops". The hotel is exceptionally clean, and the view is wonderful. The Beach/Pool under the direction of Mark provide a great vacation experience for families. Having been here multiple times, the new changes are impressive. Jon is in constant motion with your vacation as his priority. The suporting staff of Max and Adam were right there for your beach vacation. Overall, would take my family and children for a yearly vacation in the keys.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive, but warm and welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: ap2011
Reviews.Content: Stately elegant hotel with beautiful modern rooms. Tons of friendly staff. Well maintained lush grounds including 2 large pools, big beach, plus the use of the pool and beach at the Reach next door. 5 minute walk to the nice restaurant/gallery end of Duval Street, not the trashy carnival end. Tranquil but not boring. Great water sports on the property. Several terrific restaurants 2 minute walk. Plus the concierge knows everything.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf It's Not”
Reviews.Author: Kiwisdaddy
Reviews.Content: Yes it is a beautiful building, very clean but certainly not of the standard of the NYC Waldorf. So clean the help was running a floor cleaning machine behind me as I tried to eat my breakfast. The service was somewhat rude. I was told by a Concierge "not to blow you off but ask someone at the desk" when I asked about lost and found. The staff was not friendly from entering the front doors which most of the time I opened myself and waited while other rude guest filed in. Not one housekeeper said so much as "Hello" in the hall. The valet brought my car and asked if there were others coming and then vanished without helping anyone with the luggage. The elevator to the 4th floor was stuck on the first and when I told the desk they could not have cared less even though my two friends were at the top with luggage waiting. I carried mine down the staircase. But they were happy to take the $25 resort fee a night that I didn't know anything about until I got the bill. Room service did not answer so pizza was ordered at a late hour and then we were called from the front desk to come get it. Even though I realize Key West does not hold up to the standards of New York or other large cities I really thought (and bragged) about how good the service would be since I have stayed at the real Waldorf Astoria. They should just stick to calling themselves a Hilton owned property and not trying to just the Waldorf name. It is expensive and on a Holiday weekend it was the only place I could find that would book for two, not three nights. Had I known I would have gone somewhere and just not used the third night. Overall I think it was a letdown but please feel free to make your own decision.

Reviews.Title: “Average and felt let down.”
Reviews.Author: ElliottR83
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a break from the hassle of Orlando for my wife and I to relax and get away from it all. We went for a balcony ocean view room. Which was very nice. The staff checking us in were pleasant and helpful and the staff around the pool area were really good. After getting to our room we noticed a large amount of mould on one of the net curtains. so on our way to go to the beach we told a member on the front desk who said it would be dealt with. So off to the beach. When we came back the curtain was still there. So we got ready to go out for dinner and whilst doing so the fire alarm in our room went off, now this things emit a high pitch screech for a couple of minuets. Nice! anyway security came up and said they would reset it. Also they were having a wedding in the hall below our room, the band had just started playing and it was echoing through our room. So we went out, telling the front desk AGAIN about the curtain. When we returned early at about 9.30 (we had a fishing trip at 7 the next morning) the curtain was gone. But the wedding below was in full steam. It was like being in an earthquake simulator. Everything was vibrating and the noise was so load there wasn't a chance of getting an early night. We ended up leaving our room and lying in a hammock on the beach for some silence. The second night was the same, another wedding and another earthquake test site in our room. To top it all off at around 2am the fire alarm went off, again. Luckily the third night our final was peaceful and the fire alarm only went off at about 11pm If I do get a chance to go to the Keys again I will really be looking elsewhere. For a 3 night trip I think it was really let down by the fact we were subjected to the parties below.

Reviews.Title: “The Concierge service is very good”
Reviews.Author: dmdmtaylor
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Casa Marina. The positives were the concierge service at the pool and beach. They actually come by and clean your sunglasses, offer iced water, popcicles, frozen towles, and even good casual conversation. I was impressed. They also had an Absinthe night at the lobby bar. Very good. Everyone at the hotel was helpful and professional when we needed suggestions for meals and sightseeing. The only negative was $15.00 per day for parking, but we parked on the street so avoided that dilemma. The hotel is also on the South East side of the island and a little walk from the action on Duval, but we enjoyed the excersise anyway and even rented bikes a couple of days. If you are a runner, you can run early 6am-ish and there is no traffic. Very nice vacation and I recommend spending a day or two on the beach or by the pool. You can also snorkle off the end of the pier. Bring your snorkle gear.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: CAMotorCop
Reviews.Content: Had such a blast at this hotel. Everyone was fantastic. Mark and Max worked the watersports and help all around the pool area. . . . Stephan made sure that all the drinks were continuously served . . . .The housekeeping staff made sure our room was taken very good care off and the rest of the staff made it feel like a home away from home. Thanks to everyone and see you all soon.

Reviews.Title: “Very special place!”
Reviews.Author: SchLibraryTeacher
Reviews.Content: We attended a destination wedding from April 9-11, 2011. We were not guests at the resort, but spent time in the restaurants and at the beach, with the parents of the bride. We just loved it and would definitely come back to stay at Casa Marina!!! The beach boys, Niko and Zack, really pampered us. As for the restaurant staff and the wedding function coordinator and staff, we cannot tell you how very impressed we were with everything! The food for the rehearsal party, the cocktail hour and reception and the Sunday farewell brunch was just outstanding. They took care of everything...no detail was too small. The brides' parents, as well as the bride and groom, told us how very pleased they were. We definitely recommend the Casa Marina Resort for vacations, weddings, and other special events. The time we spent celebrating the wedding and visiting with our friends is truly a "moment to remember!" Sincere thanks to all the hotel staff !

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Drew-in-Indy
Reviews.Content: Great staff, great grounds and beach, great friends, with interesting history to the hotel. Great beach on the south side of island, but within walking distance to the north end of Duval St. I wish we were still there...

Reviews.Title: “TOTALLY PAMPERED BY FRIENDLY BEACH & POOL STAFF”
Reviews.Author: pjkohl
Reviews.Content: We felt totally pampered at the pool by Mark and Max... free popcicles, body and feet water misted, towel service, free body lotion samples, free drink of the day sample, frozen towels, food delivered pool side, etc. etc. Mark and Max were always there to serve... best hotel stay to date for us.

Reviews.Title: “Mark and Max on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: jamespawling
Reviews.Content: Great service from Mark and Max. Cleaned sunglasses, provided lotion and gave information on dining in town. Observed Mark leading games for the kids around the pool. The hotel is lucky to have him as an employee. Having hammocks on the beach was a great idea. There were plenty of clean towels, lots of fruity water, free drinks of the day, ice cold towels and popcicles. The pool staff provided all that and more. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down!”
Reviews.Author: bert255100
Reviews.Content: We came to Key West for a holiday with our family - (2 adult children and couple) We read the reviews on Trip Advisor and thought this hotel looked perfect, boy were we wrong! From the minute we attempted to check in things went down hill. They had us booked in for 4 nights, when we only booked 3, check in was supposed to be at 4pm - we arrived at 3:30pm and didn't get into our room until 5pm - didn't receive our bags until 5:30pm. We asked the concierge to book us into a restaurant and when we got there, the reservation was made for 2, there were 4 of us. The elevator was broken for 2 days, the lamp was broken in one room, and took them nearly an hour to come and fix it. Finally, room service was ordered, 45 minutes later we called to check on it and were told the order was never put through. There was a black out on our first night and the walls are paper thin. Airconditioning sound kept us awake all night and noise from other rooms and floors was quite loud. This hotel is surviving off the reviews, and is, in fact quite poorly operated, and completely over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great time ; would love to go back!”
Reviews.Author: epkhamilton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina (Key West, FL) and loved the service by the pool and beach. The guys and gals were great!! They made us feel special and were very very attentive. The little extras they did like frozen towels and popsicles were such a treat. They were available to answer questions about the town and were friendly :-) They really made our stay memorable. Thanks to Ellie, Adam, Graham,Tyler, Max and Mark. Housekeeping could use some improvement. All in all great stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, great staff, great beach, great pool and pool staff!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenFromMarietta
Reviews.Content: I'll get my one negative out of the way first...I had a 1 BR suite w/ocean view and it had a couple issues. The big one was that it was really a pool view - if you went out on the small balcony, and looked to the left you could see the ocean. Also the shower handle fell off when I went to use it. Having said that, I slept well in the room, it was comfortable and very quiet at night. The A/C worked great. There was a free espresso coffee maker in the room and a pull out sofa bed in addition to the separate king size bed in the bedroom with door. I noticed in some reviews that people were surprised there was a resort fee and that parking was not free. My only comment is that they must not have done one iota of research before booking at the Casa Marina. I knew about both the fees before I went and it was simply because I had reviewed the Casa Marina website. It's not like they're trying to hide anything. All the hotels in Vegas now charge a resort fee which includes things they would separately charge for in the past like internet, newspapers, etc. Free parking is almost never found anymore... Getting back to my review: The entire staff of the hotel was great. The concierge desk was extremely helpful with helping us get setup with activities and dinner reservations. I never felt rushed speaking with them and felt I got 100% of their attention. The beach staff was also excellent (Mark, Tyler, and Jon). I would disagree completely with a comment I just read that staying at the Casa Marina was like staying at a Fairfield. There's no comparison! If you like a nice beach and beautiful swimming pools and the extra special touches like having your sunglasses cleaned, receiving a frozen towel in the afternoon after a hot day of sunning and swimming. Fruit flavoured water...It was generally just very laid back and yet elegant. The location is good. It's on the Atlantic side of KW. We walked everywhere - I believe it's about a 2 mi walk to the Gulf side for the fabulous sunsets. If you don't wish to walk there are bike rentals available and lots of Taxi's. We did the Parasailing adventure (my first time) and it was AWESOME!!!! We also did a bike tour of the island which was also awesome and very interesting. It's an easy place to walk and/or ride b/c it's so flat. Don't miss the Hemingway House and the Butterfly museum (if you so inclined). All in all KW is a great place to unwind. The people who live in KW are all extremely nice and the staff at Casa Marina was no different. I'd stay there again. .

Reviews.Title: “Not the best place”
Reviews.Author: Ashoshwar
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Casa Marina based on reviews and a family members recommendation and were very dissappointed. To start with we booked directly through the hotel in order to get adjacent rooms (which would have been cheaper if booked through orbitz/travelocity etc). When arriving we were told we couldn't have the adjecent rooms that whomever booked our reservation made a mistake and there was nothing they could do about it. We ended up with 1 suite and 1 double room on opposite sides of the resort. Both were suppose to be ocean view however the suite was surrouded by palm trees and couldn't see anything. The suite air condition unit was aweful. It reached 79 during the day and only cooled to 73 at night. When complained they said they couldn't do anything because its a old building and they brought us box fans. By the third day i had had enough and finally spoke with the manager and she gave us a new suite. But what was annoying is before i could even explain she new what it was....so many must have complained before. Also the are shutters in the suite so light comes through--no sleeping late. There are 2 pools but are only 4.5 ft deep so they are hot. The beach was rocky and water is full of grass. Food was poor to average. Don't eat at the resort==check out El Siboney & the commodor,

Reviews.Title: “We will stay here again next visit”
Reviews.Author: StacyScottyAlan
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Casa Marina for 5 nights in June 2011. Our room was lovely with a view of the ocean. The bed was incredibly comfortable. There was a sectional sofa with a pull out couch for my son to use. The mattress on the sofa bed was not comfortable, so he slept on the couch which was quite comfortable. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating, especially the staff poolside and in the restaurant. The concierge can recommend and arrange most of the activities nearby and many leave right from the hotel which is convenient. The water in the pools was very warm! It was great for a long soak and for night swimming. Overall, we loved the resort and will go back there as soon as we can get back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Best Part Pool Staff”
Reviews.Author: radh13
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to Key West we stayed at the Casa Marina Resort. The best part about this resort is the staff at the pool. Tyler made our stay most enjoyable, our family didn't even have to ask for anything, he knew what we needed before we could even ask. Tyler is an asset to the resort. Robin at the Cabana bar, always greeted us with a smile, she makes a great drink, and will make sure that your lunch/dinner orders are just the way you like it. Where we were really let down was the by the staff inside the hotel and valet. I found that Xavier needed additional training and if you need a cab it takes an act of Congress to get them to call for you. I found the front desk to be rude and they acted like they were too good to speak to you. The guy who checked us in was great, but I forgot his name. Forget about the concierge she was rude and if you asked her anything she did it with the roll of the eye and attitude. Casa Marina is one of the nicer hotels, if I was the manager, I would have some of the staff stay at a Ritz Carlton, this way they would know what the true meaning of service is. Better yet, have the staff inside the hotel talk with Tyler and Robin, they are true professionals and really know how to make a guest feel like a star.

Reviews.Title: “Although pricey....an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: mia7903
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I took a trip to Key West with another couple and stayed for about a week at this resort. The only negative was that at checkout you are hit with unexpected additional "resort fees" of 25/day, and parking is 15-20/day. But seriously, that was the ONLY negative. We give this "excellent" review based on the really great experience that we had. We got completely screwed over by an activity company, and the hotel really went out of it's way to make it up to us. Barefoot Billy's is the water sports company that is located on the Casa Marina property. The staff there is beyond nice. To Mark, Nick and Matt of Barefoot Billy's and to Patrick and Don of Casa Marina staff....thank you so much for all that you did to help us out!!! You guys are amazing!
