The hotel is clean, and the amenities are well worth the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...pool and beach great!”
Reviews.Author: karlakono
Reviews.Content: Terry and I had been to KW before but the stay at Casa was a first. Nice, clean but indoor staff could have been much friendlier and accomodating. The outside staff was another story. The guys were fantanstic! Starting with Mark, all the guys, Tyler, Jon, Will, Graham, Jake and Adam went out of their way to please. They were friendly, talkative and sincere in making our stay memorable. I watched them work and each one gave the same personal attenion every guest. We Met Barefool Billy also and told him what a great staff he had in Chris, Ryan and Tom. We would probably try a different hotel next time but would miss our new friends at Casa. Karla Konopasek, Griffith, Indiana

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: tropicalgirl60878
Reviews.Content: We came June 16, 2011 to celebrate our 30th anniversary. This is our third stay at Casa Marina. The staff was wonderful. Mark at Beach and Pool Services went out of his way to make sure we had a special stay. He had some great restaurant recommendations and made the reservations for us while we were in the pool. All the poolside food and beverage staff were awesome. The food at the Sun Sun is so much better than it was our last stay 3 years ago. The bed was really comfortable and the room was clean. We will be back as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “This is an Astoria...? Disappointed....”
Reviews.Author: msweeks
Reviews.Content: This seemed like a typical hotel to me... We only stayed one night but were disappointed based on our expectations in this name brand. A few notes with our stay....property was pretty by the pool and water, and probably one of the few properties with a beach. Front desk service was great. I'm a gold HH but there was no difference in the service received. Next time I'd rather just opt for a low end hotel vs. paying $250/night. A Fairfield would have been equivalent. Nothing bad to say about this place, just paying a lot for what you are getting.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: roseleahy
Reviews.Content: We recently attended a conference here for work, and had a great experience. The service at was outstanding. Jake & Tyler at the pool area treated us above and beyond providing Aloe for one person who was sunburned and frozen towels for everyone to beat the heat. As we travel often for work this incredible service is hard to find and valued when found! I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming and overprices”
Reviews.Author: Slimjim05
Reviews.Content: We have recently returned from a wedding held in June a this resort. Having travelled around the world and staying at many resort hotels we found this hotel extremely disappointing. Check in at this hotel was not until 1600 hrs and whilst we arrived at 15.30 only 30 minutes before scheduled check in we were advised room not ready. We asked about parking and tol d to swipe our room card at the gate and not told $15 per day,parking fee, we knew nothing about this cost until departure, at which time we had limited time to dispute as we needed to travel the 4 hour back to Miami to get a connecting flight to Las Vegas where car parking was free. Although this is an historic built hotel it seems to be living on its reputation and not its current status. The staff were at best unfriendly at worst surly apart from the beach/pool staff who were extremely helpful to please, especially one young Irish man. The buffet breakfast was not up to the standard of a truck stop with lack of selection of 'cold/hot food'. The rooms were disappointing with lack of view (over the car park) and no balcony. The airconditioning unit in the room was constantly on and the noise was irritating and caused lack of sleep We were both sick the day after the wedding whilst unable to identify the cause it could have been the food the hotel supplied at the wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: dv325
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to stay at Casa Marina. I had a wonderful time with my friends. I especially enjoyed the pool and beach area. The pool staff (Mark, Jon, Tyler Max and Ellie) were very attentive. My favorite amenities were the frozen towels and cucumber eye treatment. I do have to say housekeeping could use some improvement. Other than that, I would recommend the resort and can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “We didnt want to leave!”
Reviews.Author: missydkny
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing trip! Jan and Robin were friendly and attentive bartenders by the pool. Stephan ( from Slovania) was our waiter and probably the nicest person we've ever met! Also Patrick at the front desk was knowledgable and so nice! The guys in the front gret you with huge smile soon as you get here. The price cant beat... we are def coming back for Christmas break!!!! the cleaning staff also made our room imaculateand food was great. not a bad thing to say about our stay :)

Reviews.Title: “!”
Reviews.Author: LIZ34172
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for four days and thoroughly enjoyed the stay! The pool/beach area was amazing. All of the staff were attentive and extremely helpful, especially Tyler. Tyler would greet our family everyday and make sure to set up chairs and umbrellas on the beach for us as well as give us ideas for things to do around Key West such as good restaurants. This resort clearly puts much emphasis on details, like throughout everyday the staff would bring around treats for the guest such as popsicles, frozen towels, cooling aloe and, frozen cucumbers (for your eyes), sunglass cleaning as well as water all complimentary services. This vacation was wonderful and out entire family agrees that we want to come back to this wonderful resort and city! Our trip was beyond anything we could have imagined! The staff was friendly, knowledgeable, and helpful, however Tyler, one of the guys who helped in the pool/beach area, stood out as exceptionally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff and resort!!”
Reviews.Author: sarbear04
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one week and loved every minute of it. There was so much that i loved! First off, 90% of the excursions were offered right at the resort. They made it extremely easy to sign up, and it was, literally, a one minute walk to the pier where the excursions left. Second, the staff was amazing. They treated you like kings and queens. I loved the "free" sample alcoholic drinks, popsicles, fresh fruit, and even sun glasses cleaning at poolside! (which really ended up being included in a $25 fee you prepay when you book the room, but it was nice to get it without shelling out cash or handing them your credit card). Dont fret about getting a taxi! They call one for you that comes in less then 5 minutes, or they are waiting across the street. The staff really go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable and have everything you need. They were really nice and always served you with a smile. I especially felt compelled to right this review when I lost my cell phone at the pool, and the staff took time out of their schedules to search through over 30 bins of towels to find it!!! And, they DID find it! Amazing! Third, the resort was within walking distance of Duval Street which was basically the night life of Key West; it included lots of stores for shopping and restaurants such as Margaritaville, their famous Sloppy Joes, HardRock Cafe, and lots of bars with live bands. Now I must say, probably the only thing that could have been better were the rooms. What I mean by that is they were not very convenient for "settling" in. We had a standard ocean-side room with double queen beds and a balcony facing the pool/ocean (which was amazingly beautiful!), but, with a family of four, the bathroom and the room had NO space for storage! It was really inconvenient to pack up my toothbrush, facewash, and other necessities EVERY time I went into and out of the bathroom. The shower had no space to put anything and no place to sit down (if us ladies wanted to shave our legs). There was no tub, so small children couldnt take baths. Granted, the other rooms may have been different, so make sure to check that out when you book! The room had two large chairs in the corners which could have been replaced with some units with drawers for storage. I know Im on vacation but I dont want to dig through my suitcase, everytime, to find anything. And everything seemed to end up on the floor or the bed because there was no place to put things. Anyway, with the bad aside -----which isnt sooo terrible---- I really would recommend this Resort to anyone. If I ever went back to Key West, I wouldnt even look around for another place to stay, I would choose this Hotel! No lie. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful and private!”
Reviews.Author: cjstx
Reviews.Content: Our room was very clean, well decorated, and roomey. The beds were very comfortable and turndown service was available. Our bathroom was a bit small, but still good. We did not get a balcony, but most of the other rooms had them, we had a great view of the ocean. The amenities are great. There are two pools, a bar, and eating area. This was a full service area. My husband and I enjoyed our overall stay and enjoyed learning about the history of key west and the hotel itself! The only problem that we had was the price of drinks. We had been on Duval St and had eaten out and ordered two margaritas that were very nice size with choice of tequila for 6.00 each. One night we decided to sit by the pool and order a drink. We only took 20.00 down to the pool. My husband ordered the two margaritas which came in a small plastic cup and a cheap tequila-the total came to 20.43 for the two drinks. I thought that was a little rediculous! Other than that incident we loved our stay and the facilities were beautiful and very accomodating. It was our anniversary and the gave us a free movie rental and champagne! I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a classy place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: MichaelRinck
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from June 17-19 to celebrate our wedding anniversary. The hotel is a very nice and historic place and we absolutely loved the island of Key West. We chose this hotel because we are Hilton Honors Gold members and we had enough points to use for both nights we were there. It was a little bit of a walk to the sights on Key West but one that we always enjoyed. We had a little bit of an issue when we checked in because the first room that they placed us in constantly shook. When we called the front desk they immediately knew of the problem and after initially telling us that we could switch rooms the next day, we were able to switch rooms to one that didn't have a constant reverberation. It's kind of strange that they would put us there in the first place. It was actually bad enough that the glasses in both the bathroom and on a tray table in the main room were "pinging" like crazy. I initially thought there was a big rig outside the window but when I went around and outside there was nothing but vents and what looked like AC units making a bunch of noise outside as well. Very strange indeed. Once we got all that taken care of we were able to enjoy the pools and the beach area. The pool staff went out of their way to set us up. The pools were pretty warm which felt nice at first but then after a day of walking around the island in 90 degree heat, I personally wished they were a bit cooler. My wife thought the temp was perfect. The room was renovated and nice. The bed was a little too soft for me and not the best on my back but some prefer them a bit softer. There was a flat screen TV and a desk and the bathroom was well stocked. The highlight of our stay was a wave runner tour of the island that we booked through Barefoot Billy's at the hotel. It was a 2 hour tour that covered around 30 miles around the island that was very fun and informative. There were a couple weddings at the hotel when we were there and it was a great setting for special events. The renovations of this historic hotel were impressive and the place sparkled. We were impressed. Overall, we really liked how this hotel gave us a "resort" feel that we wouldn't have gotten at a lot of the other hotels on the island. It came at a cost of a little bit more of a walk, but one that was well worth it. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina back for more”
Reviews.Author: sgoebel
Reviews.Content: This time it was a family outing that brought us to Casa Marina in Key West. It is a beautiful hotel and the guys at the pool were great, Max, Adam and Darrin keep to your every need. They brought dry towels, drinks, food and more. We spent a lot of time at the pool this time it was very relaxing. Also, the beds are awesome, extremely comfortable you fall asleep quickly. We rented a suite so all five of us fit in one room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Key West”
Reviews.Author: expataecl
Reviews.Content: Spent couple of days here with a group of women and in overall we had a nice stay. The hotel is a bit worn out, but still decent. The premises with two pools and a beach are actually quite nice, but the hotel stays a bit far from the happening area. I personally enjoyed being away from crowds and jog in the mornings to a closeby peer with hardly any people. I tried the massage at the beach, and that was excellent! A slight disturbance was the motorsport employees screaming some engine numbers from the water to shore next to massage booths? I missed the sound of the waves instead... The rooms are quite basic for my taste but afterall this is not a place to stay at room. Roomservice could be though a bit more attentive with complimentary cheeses; I received them in the evening while having a dinner, so unfortunately I was not able to enjoy them. Next day I return to my room in the afternoon and wonder what is stinking here; the cheese! They had not cleaned them away! In general, the service at the hotel was good and as said our overall stay was positive.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly nice, but just expected a little more.”
Reviews.Author: csfbrooks
Reviews.Content: I agree with some other reviewers that the grounds and look of the hotel was lovely, but for the money and as a Waldorf, we just expected a little more. There were small things. We arrived at 330 pm, but our room wasn't ready and even though we were told someone would call us when it was, we had to go back and check an hour later to find out that it was. The room was fine and clean. view was of the parking lot off the resort, but that's not always controllable. Bedding was nice and pillows were super comfortable. The shower was fine, but the luxury level drops there. Tub and curtain seemed cheap and there were no washcloths provided (so strange), so we had to use a hand towel. Also seemed strange that there was no minibar given the 4-stars. The pools seemed very nice although we didn't spend a lot of time there and the beach at The Reach seemed to be nicer (we heard this from a bartender in town as well) because it is more like a real beach w/ a little surf to go with the sand. Overall, the hotel was fine, but for the money, we'd probably check out another hotel on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “We will always come back to this resort!”
Reviews.Author: snowbunny1212
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about Patrick at this hotel! We had a bad experience with the taxi service from the airport and he made up for it big time even though he didn't have to. Our room was fabulous and so were all his suggestions. From where to go for stand up surf boarding, breakfast, dinner dancing...you name it he knew the place! This hotel is beautiful and the location is great too. The hammocks are all around and by the ocean so it makes for a nice nap either during the day or like we did at night. The pools are clean and the staff if very accommodating, whether you want a drink or food, they seem to be right there. Again if you stay here ask for Patrick when you check in. Thanks again Patrick, I can't wait to see you again next year! Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely best in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: Discriminating06
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina before the Waldorf Astoria renovation and again last week. It is even better now. The staff, the services, the management, and the room was outstanding. We were especially impressed with the beach staff. Every day we were treated to frozen facecloths, Popsicles, the drink of the day, ice water, cold cucumbers for our eyes, and the friendliest and most polite service we have received at any resort. We will definitely return to the Casa Marina next year. Everyone there made this a truly beautiful and memorable vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Style and Modern Elegance”
Reviews.Author: joeconfer
Reviews.Content: I want to express my sincerest gratitude to all the staff at the Casa Marina but I want to say specifically the front desk personnel and let me tell you why, I wanted to propose to my girlfriend Darlene while in Key West, she and I love tropical weather but I was concerned that airport security would detect a ring in my luggage so I along with the incredibly gracious staff at the Casa worked out a way to get it there undetected I mailed it to the front desk addressing it to me with good postal insurance. I was understandably concerned about doing this and even went so far as to ask them to not announce that my package had arrived when we checked in to avoid spoiling the surprise. They came through with flying colors helping me conceal the surprise until the end of the week, wow what a great group of people they are; never letting on what was about to happen. Their interest in making this event special and private is something we will â€œneverâ€� forget. I was able to coordinate an unbelievably romantic reservation directly on the beach at Latitudes Restaurant on Sand Key for the actual proposal, she said yes as the beautiful Florida sun was setting. I have stayed at many hotels over the years but I have never seen a staff so intent on delivering a memorable and relaxing experience while providing such high levels of luxury, We hardly had to even open a door all week but I never felt as though work was going on all around me and I think that "defines" luxury. The grounds are simply without par anywhere in the Keys and for that matter most other locations I have visited; what a beautiful property. The pools were very large and not crowded the free drink of the day and popsicles were also a very nice personal touch. We will always have a very big place in our hearts for the Casa Marina staff and we will sure come back soon for a visit..... Exceptional is the closest I can come in describing this place and its people, do yourselves a favor and drive to the end on the US and get some truly special attention at The best place to do that; the Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “A positive experience, a few things that really detracted”
Reviews.Author: laneymc
Reviews.Content: The pros: the room was nice (we had a one-bedroom suite), the pools were nice and very clean with lots of room, they gave out free things randomly at the pool (drink of the day, popsicles, apples, frozen towels, etc), nice beach area, food was good (but expensive--but that's to be expected), nice area of town (not too close to the action but not too far either). Pool side service was fast. The cons: Housekeeping was infrequent and inattentive (we ran out of tp, didn't have enough blankets, etc.). There were a few rude staff members (one towel guy and one bartender in particular). I hate saying that because several staff members were very helpful and accommodating but one bad apple ruins the bushel! Drinks were small and watered down--definitely not worth the price. When I checked out, they tried to charge me $10.00 for a "Casa Marina History book." I asked what in the world that was, and the guy was very vague and said it was a book in the room and if we took it we got charged for it, adn that housekeeping had reported it missing on the third day of our stay. I told him I had no idea what he was talking about, had never seen it, and if I went to the room and found it would he remove the charge? He removed it right then anyway, which makes me think there was no such book and they were trying to see how much they could get away with. Did not use the spa or the any of the adventure/water sports services so I can't comment on that, but I will say that those prices looked HIGH and you'd be better off finding a shop in town for either of those things! I would stay there again if need be because overall it was enjoyable, but would rather look around for other options.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort”
Reviews.Author: georgiachampion
Reviews.Content: Ocean front room at a good price. Especially nice was the service at the beach by Max and Mark. Iced towels, lotion. cucumber slices for hot eyes, and delicious drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: kjbargas
Reviews.Content: Tyler, Patrick and Mark gave amazing customer service! Thank you all for making this a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Can't see how you can find a better location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: lockedforediting
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina in my opinion is hands-down is the most perfectly situated area for a vacation getaway in KW - amazing beach access, amazing spacious beach (has to be one of the best in KW), amazing walk-ability to town and almost anywhere you'd want to go, on site water sports.... Mallory Square needs a cab, but who cares.... The property itself is first-rate. The common areas, the pools, the private beach, the outdoor restaurant and bar areas, the pier - there is just not one negative thing I could even dream to say about the resort overall. The beach service was excellent, with touches that make you know that you're @ a Waldorf property - fruit in the morning, drink of the day at noon, popsicles at 2pm, cold eucalyptus towels at 4pm. Simply first rate. Seriously. We were there June 11-17, super hot, amazing, hot, super sunny 100% of the time, and we could always could find a place on the beach, watch the boats go by, read, tan, stroll up to get lunch or fruit soaked water, and just enjoy the scenery. We made day trips to Islamorada for deep sea fishing (Seahorse Charters - 2 thumbs way up for any level novice to expert - we caught a ton of mahi and it was a fantastic experience with Cpt. Rick Rodriguez) and Marathon to the Dolphin Research Center, also super amazing to do the interactive swim with Pax our dolphin buddy. Otherwise spent all our time in and around the Casa and in town. The only reason that this stay didn't get 5 stars was the room. We had a standard room, #429, and it was just so-so. It was motel style, opening to the public outdoor area. Which actually was a good thing in my opinion - it felt natural there. And it was generally updated But it was just extremely small, the bathroom was so small that literally only one person could be in it @ once, pretty bad plumbing for the shower and the toliet, outside door didn't open or close without throwing a hip at it, and very, well, just so-so. The trip was just for me and my son - I cannot see how any more than 2 people would be able to navigate without stepping on one another in a room that small. It was a bit dissapointing considering, but no way to complain too much about what is otherwise an outstanding "belongs in a postcard" property. Also, housekeeping couldn't seem to get their schedule down or work very fast - alot of people waiting for their rooms past 4pm.... But bottom line, if you're looking for an extremely beautiful property, in a great location, that has access to whatever you need, and you are coming here for R&R, and the vibe of the beach, and that relaxing, "out of the chaos" feeling is important to you on property, then you cannot in my opinion pick a better place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “NIce but expensive”
Reviews.Author: ZitasTravel
Reviews.Content: This was a nice resort with private beach access, bike rentals etc. Nothing was spectacular in the room or service-wise. Since it was december, it was kinda windy and the water was cold and we didn't exploit the beach or boardwalk as much. There weren't many food options around or inside the resort. There was one place nearby, walking distance I forgot the name, that was simply great. Overall I am not sure it was worth the money spent, maybe it would have made more sense if it was not so cold those days.

Reviews.Title: “The Casa Marina has the rare combination of understated luxury and a relaxed friendly atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: bengalbouter77
Reviews.Content: We had a suite and a room. The suite was beautifully appointed with no detail left to chance. We like historic luxury hotels but sometimes they can be stuffy or a bit worn. The Casa Marina exceeded all our expectations. They manage to cater to every demographic group. Our 82 year old mother loved it and so did our 10 year old nephew. The two pools were beautifully maintained with every amenity and the pool side wait staff were fun and efficient. There are two piers with steps leading into the ocean for a refreshing dip. Also beach side among the palm trees they provided plenty of comfy hammocks and lots of umbrellas and chaises- as well as lots of fun outdoor games. We only stayed 4 days and we are already planning a return extended stay.

Reviews.Title: “Get Ready to Relax--In Style”
Reviews.Author: SandyOma
Reviews.Content: We stayed here June 9-14 and I can honestly say it was everything I had hoped it would be. The grounds and amenities are first rate, but what makes it special is the staff. The guys at the pool and beach are so friendly and helpful that you feel like one of the family. The service is great, but their attitude is even better. Every staff member greets you, which is amazing, since for years I was GM at a large resort and know how difficult that is to accomplish. My son called one day as I was lounging on the beach drinking a pina colada, and he said if I sounded any more relaxed, I'd need to be resuscitated. And while there, do yourself a favor and book a massage on the beach with Livia. It's expensive, but WOW, totally worth it. I have chronic pain and have been doing massage therapy for years, and she knocked my socks off (well, they were already off, but you get the idea). Really. Do it. The resort is several blocks from Duval St., but easily walkable, and if you poop out there's always a pedicab or taxi close by. Beware the pedicabs though, they're spendy. Casa Marina gets four thumbs up from us.

Reviews.Title: “Great 50th Birthday trip”
Reviews.Author: vacationgoddess61
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West and South Beach to celebrate my 50th birthday. The Casa Marina Resort was excellent. It was very busy but the staff did a great job accomodating it's guests. The rooms are very nice and the bed was comfortable. Awesome beach area with the bar close by for drinks and food. I can not rave enough about how amazing the Island is and everywhere we went was a memorable experience. Our overall experience with Casa Marina was great!

Reviews.Title: “5*Staff, 4*Resort, 3*Rooms, 2* Housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: mgtopagent
Reviews.Content: Overall, we loved our stay at Casa Marina. The nicest beach and pool area in Key West â€“an island which has almost no beach except on Atlantic side. While not on top of Duval Street, it is walkable to it. A shout out to Mark, Will and Patrick at the pool. We have never had better attention or more pampering at a beach resort. All day, they keep on bringing out to everyone surprise â€œtreatsâ€�: ice water, drink of the day, popsicles, cool cucumbers for your eyes, chilled lotion, frozen scented wash cloths, cleaning your glasses and on and on! Amazing. Beautiful water and fabulous beach setting, very good food â€“ dine at Sun Sun with your feet in the sand and very nice breakfast. Beautiful lobby and beach, azure warm ocean - no waves due to coral reef. I was however, very disappointed with the room. I have no idea how they could have a four diamond rating from anyone â€“ the rooms are simply sub-par. Old bathroom with, weird stall shower with half glass (spotted and never cleaned), and half beige shower-curtain and sloppily patched broken tile floor , Everything looks shabby, beat, and soiledâ€¦..grimy swich plates, stains on the ceramic floor and furniture, they change the linens and mop the tile floor but not much else. I doubt the room is ever thoroughly cleaned and the dÃ©cor is light â€“ yes, but dismal and dull. I donâ€™t get how a cardboard box wrapped in dirty beige muslin is an attractive piece of wall art or lighting fixture. We paid quite a bit for an upgraded ocean view and saw nothing but the top of a palm tree â€“ so donâ€™t bother. Also, skip the fourth floor â€“ third or second probably better â€“ the top floor has a higher cement barrier and obscures the view even more from your balcony. Separating our balcony from neighbors was more of the soiled beige muslin/canvas stuff they love in this place. Also â€“ the rooms do not all have interior corridors and your entry overlooks a roof and what looks like a prison courtyard. No effort at all made to obscure or dress this up even a little bit. The hallways in the rooms that do have interior corridors are dark, soiled carpet, and smell moldy, damp and musty. You do have to realize that this is an older historic property as the front desk explained â€“ but that has nothing to do with housekeeping or decorating. The elevator leading to our room always had dirt, food and spills on the floor and stained and rusted stainless steel doors. No one at the hotel seems to stay on top of this. They seem too busy doing other things. It seems that hotel management stresses the services at the pool which are stellar â€“ but no one pays attention to running a tight ship with housekeeping â€“ no one suggests tips to these people â€“ whereas tip suggestions to all the other staff are quite evident. Therefore, housekeeping people have no real incentive to do anything extra and have no role-models or standards to keep as I have come to expect in a four diamond property. We had just come from the Conrad hotel in Miami which is also a four diamond Waldorf Astoria property by Hilton â€“ that had a spotless and beautiful room and new marble baths plus shower. Two hotels, same chain, same rating, worlds of difference. We were told that the Casa Marina recently completed an 80 million renovation â€“ not sure where they spent it â€“ if it was on the hotel rooms , dÃ©cor â€“ they sure got ripped off. The status of the room condition and housekeeping is not likely to change much since they seem to be 100% occupied per the gentleman at the desk I complained to when I wanted a room change. They average seven weddings a week and have loads of business meetings and events hosted there which we observed. I am sure they make quite a bit of money from this. These events can actually feel a bit intrusive and even annoying,. On Sunday, when we were relaxing on the beach they started setting up buffet tables right in front of us at the ocean edge around the middle of the day. However, bottom line, if you want to stay in Key West and also want a beautiful and expansive ocean front and beach setting with lots of amenities â€“ this is really your only choice. The one other option might be to stay at the Reach â€“ the sister property about a block away (separated by another property). That is newer and PERHAPS rooms are nicer (you'd have to check that out)â€“ the guests of each property have priveleges at the other resort. In spite of my gripes about the room, I would likely return and overlook much because we loved the overall Key West experienceâ€“ it is a fun vacation and destination with lots of water sports, great snorkeling and many good restaurants. Oh look, thereâ€™s a chicken! I did my own cleaning. Hopefully the management will hear these complaints and get someone in charge of housekeeping who CARES about it and add in a bit more sparkle and clean and elbow grease, scrub that floor and clean the shower glass daily and put in new baths, etc etc. One more thing - high speed or low speed internet did not work most of the time in our room. After several complaints - they got it working - but very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing.”
Reviews.Author: Majelly
Reviews.Content: Amazing resort, highly recommended!! Please see Jake, Patrick, and Mark beachside. They are the best ever. Jan and Darrin at the bar are wonderful mixologists...yes I said mixologist..because they make some seriously delicious drinks. Jafre and Stephanie at the front desk was super accommodating and really made us feel welcome and special. The staff here overall is A++++++++++++++. I will forever rave about Casa Marina and when I come back to Kew West, there is no way I am staying anywhere else. (Truth.). Love you Casa!!! Till next time....

Reviews.Title: “Heaven!!”
Reviews.Author: Sfarmer1228
Reviews.Content: We took the Key West Express from Ft. Myers for an overnight trip to Key West. When we arrived our rooms were not ready (it was 1130am) so we put on our bathing suits and went to the pool. The adult beverages and food were fabulous! There were two pool areas located on their little beach area. Hammocks between the trees and ample chairs for everyoone on the beach. If you want to swin in the ocean, you have to enter from a pier as just off the beach you have the coral reef. Snorkling from the little pier is great! Once we got our rooms, we were pleasantly suprised that the rooms were done in a kind of contemporary motif, but not over the top considering this is an amazing old hotel. The room was spacious and well appointed. Everything seems to be top of the line. We really enjoyed it and would go back in a hearbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Beachfront Resort”
Reviews.Author: CCRBanker
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina was an exceptional resort property that completely exceeded our expectations. Many sites' photos are deceptive, but Casa Marina is actually more beautiful than even its photos depicted. Its palm-tree lined beach was more extensive than we imagined. It was well-manicured daily and featured hammocks between shady palm trees. The beach staff provided superb service. Friendly staff quickly hustled to set up beach chairs with towels and umbrellas. They continuously circulated bringing various free refreshments (drink-of-the-day, frozen face towels, popcycles, ice water, etc.). Almost every room faces the ocean which is less than fifty yards away. Rooms, though compact, are renovated with ceramic tile floors, new furnishings, flat screen televisions, and in-room expresso maker. The restaurant and outdoor cafes served excellent fresh meals moderately priced. A bountiful breakfast buffet featuring fresh fruit, an omelet bar, pastries, cheeses, waffles, eggs, breakfast potatoes, bacon & sausage was a bargain at $20. Dining was available indoors or outside amidst well-landscaped gardens and pools. It was a tropical paradise. Food servers were quite friendly and provided good service. The weekend featured an authentic steel drum player serenading with tropical island music. The location is on the southern end of the island with one of the few true beaches available on Key West. It is 6-8 blocks from Duval Street. We have traveled much of the Carribean and have found few resorts any better than Casa Marina. It was truly one of the most relaxing vacations we have ever had. We will definitely return to Key West just to enjoy this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: russellpatsel
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina in Key West is amazing. The staff bends over backwards to make your stay amazing. Mark and Jon at the pool are great. Lisa, Jan and Robin at the bar make great drinks, and Dion worked her rear off to make sure we had drinks all day long. The Casa Marian is a wonderful place I would definitely visit over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “We will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: marcy602004
Reviews.Content: The Casa is a great place to stay in Key West. Our room was spacious and our bed was actually comfortable. The hotel staff was very friendly. Every thing about this property was extremely nice. Very well kept and beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “first class attention”
Reviews.Author: peterdcpa
Reviews.Content: thanks to evelyn at the front desk and Mark and his "beach boys" for being so friendly and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service... lovely pools"”
Reviews.Author: neweekender
Reviews.Content: We traveled with friends to celebrate a special birthday June 6 -8. The Casa staff were pleasant and attentive, the grounds were kept immaculate. We enjoyed many hours at the pools, with friendly staff and lots of extras, including: samples of the "drink of the day", fresh fruit, frozen scented towels and chilled aloe lotion! Mark and John made sure our pool and beach experience was perfect, and always with a smile! Lunch on the beach was also nicely done, good sandwiches and service. Our room was in the main building, the beds were comfy, and we had plenty of towels.The patio provided great views and a nice place for morning coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great place and service and very relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Jsingh31
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights in May 2011. Clean and very relaxing. Great service - friendly staff. The are also children's activities and our 7 year old daughter loved it. A special shout out to Fred ( at "The Reach") and his manager for going out of the way and taking care of us. Thx guys for helping out our kids with the crafts and starfish painting & setting up spots on the beach. Highly recommend making reservations for tables for beachside / seaside dining.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: CraigDorfman
Reviews.Content: We were only there for one day but everything was first class. Front desk staff was terrific. In addition, we were well-taken care of by the pool and cabana staff, and especially Jon Baird, who was extremely attentive and made sure everything was perfect for us while we spent the day by the pool. We look forward to returning there later this summer.

Reviews.Title: “I've never been this pampered!”
Reviews.Author: LauraA64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a week-long stay at Casa Marina for our 25th anniversary and I can't tell enough people how wonderful it was! It is off the beaten path and a few blocks from the end of Duval Street, but still walkable. They also rent scooters if you'd rather drive around the island. We stayed in an ocean view suite - incredibly comfortable bed and soft bedding, nice balcony and it was so quiet. The housekeeping staff was excellent and very nice. Service was spotty during lunch at the restaurant and also hit and miss on the beach for drinks (with the exception of Patrick, who is awesome). Then again, it's not that hard to walk to the bar to get a drink yourself. The food at lunch was quite good (I had the mahi tacos several times and would highly recommend them). The highlight of our stay was the unbelievable service we received on the beach and by the pool from Mark and his staff. They set up your chairs and umbrella, bring fresh fruit to you in the morning, a free sample of the drink of the day at noon, popsicles in the afternoon and a frozen towel in the late afternoon! One day, they offered cold cucumbers for our eyes and spritzed us with cool water. On top of that, Mark would come by and clean your sunglasses! I told my husband that the frozen towel moment was always bittersweet because it felt so heavenly but signaled that another perfect day in paradise was coming to an end.

Reviews.Title: “Beach service is outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hungrymama73
Reviews.Content: After a small snafu at checkin we had a fabulous stay. The excellent beach service is what made this feel like a tropical getaway and why I will want to return. Patrick, Mark,Max, Jake and Adam were so attentive and happy to get you anything. I want them on all my vacations!! Have to say that housekeeping to the room was inconsistent. Always clean but had to request washcloths and shampoos some days as they were not always replenished. But I will return to Casa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “Great beach service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hungrymama73
Reviews.Content: Definitely would stay here again. But would have to get better clarification on the room reservation next time. After a snafu at check in we had a fabulous time at Casa Marina. The beach service is what made this feel like a tropical getaway. Patrick, Mark, Max, Jake, Adam and others on the beach are so attentive and happy to get u anything. I think I will be disappointed at all other beach vacations now!!!?!

Reviews.Title: “I believe the title above says it all. We thought it was gorgeous, beautiful, serene, pampered all day at pool.”
Reviews.Author: hatterslane
Reviews.Content: Pool, Bar and Gift/Coffee Store personnel with Max, Jake, Patrick, Charlotte and Monika, being attentive, conversive and a great pleasure to meet. I have one slight dissapointment. Room service, with the heritage of Waldorf Astoria, I thought would be better. Not a turnoff, as I/we did not spend a lot of time in the room, as Key West (Our first visit) is a beautiful location which we will return and happily stay at Casa Marina. The entire staff is tremendous, which is your most valuable asset!! Best Regards, Stephen Jones-Hesketh Suite 3024 May 21 through May 26 2011.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort - enjoyable and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: schultz3232
Reviews.Content: We recently visited this property and thought the service was a notch above what you normally experience. Mark, Will, Graham, Jake and Thomas did an especially great job of taking care of the guests at the pool with refreshments, frozen towels, ice cream bars, towel service, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: MrBeachSunSand
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a conference. It was our first Waldorf Astoria property, we were very impressed. Everything about the hotel was 1st class from the moment we exited the taxi. The room itself was roomy and very comfortable. We stayed in 283, a nice corner room, worth asking for. The grounds are beautiful, nice pools and beach area. We loved how the soundproofing was there, from our room you couldn't hear any hallway noise or noise from above or below. The most impressive aspect of the hotel, that differed from others, was the Barefoot Billy's staff onsite that run the pool and beach area. They had ample towels, frozen towels on hot afternoons, they would setup a beach umbrella and chairs for you each day in the spot you desired. They had ice cold water available for free with citrus slices, a nice tough at the beach or pool. Mark, Will, and Max were great every day. We'd go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as last year”
Reviews.Author: sheilac655
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights in the West wing. The elevator was so small, the bathroom was just as small. The bathroom was not clean, fingerprints and dirt on the door, the finish was coming off the mirror frame, mold in the shower, shower curtain was not fitted correctly to keep water off the floor. Patrick, at he front desk told us he could put us in a larger room on our 3rd night. He kept his word but was rude when we tried to get a time frame for the move. The room was much nicer but the fridge was broken, took awhile to convince the staff it was not working and I needed it for medication. The pool staff was friendly and offered good suggestions on places to eat and things to do.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: StephanieMFP
Reviews.Content: Beach is great & relaxing! Pool concierge is very accommodating, ask for Max! He is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Annie0407
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina is beautiful. The rooms are clean and spacious, and the beach is the largest of all the Key West hotels, with a pier which allows you to enter the water without walking over the rocks on the shore. Service is friendly and helpful. We loved being away from all the action, because it gave us some quiet time, and gave us many chances to walk. The walk to the main action on Duval is about a mile. The restaurant service is wonderful, and dining on the beach can be arranged (recommended!). Only downsides I would mention are that the sofabed is not tremendously comfortable, (although the bed in the bedroom is very comfortable) , and our room (suite) looked over a parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GetawayGirl502
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with a lot of great space. We loved the beach, hammocks, pools and the view. The staff is very welcoming and attentive. They pass out popcicles and frozen washclothes in the afternoon. They even come around to clean your sunglasses. It would be amazing with a ping pong table! It's in a great location - close enough to the action by cab and far enough away from the action to recouperate the next day! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect atmosphere for a conference and what a beach!!”
Reviews.Author: hokiehi
Reviews.Content: While my daughter was at her conference I was on the beach by 9am. Mark, John and Max were wonderful. They had our chairs, towels and umbrella all set-up. All the special "treats" they brought around was appreciated. Just a super time. Casa Marina has something for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location BUT lacking service in areas”
Reviews.Author: hello_travelaround
Reviews.Content: I just couldn't give it 4 stars but there were a number of reasons. To add $28 more per night for a resort fee and $16/night for parking on an already steep price just seems sneaky. Add it in the price already! Rooms- clean except for the filthy cloth chairs and the empty coffee cartridges that weren't replaced. Electronics- the ipod clock radio/speaker didn't work and when I called to remedy the problem: night guy discards my request to replace, fix or help me. Really? Views- gorgeous from coastal side The Hotel and grounds- stunning and very well maintained. Don- concierge was very accommodating and nice Stephanie- trainee at check-in was very sweet and professional Breakfast- hostess(forget name) from Brazil was personable. However, the service at breakfast was lacking a bit. My girlfriend and I, along with the couple next to us, got very frustrated after requesting several times to get drink service--waited 15 mins. +. Ending up getting our own drinks They broke down the buffet before telling us. Um, ok. Suzanne the bartender- her service was deplorable! We sat at the bar and politely asked to get the cluttered area cleaned. She hands US the cloth to wipe it down ourselves! She wasn't even busy. No eye contact, not helpful with drink selection, didn't ask if wanted anything else after we had 2 drinks and some appetizers--just hands the check to us and walks away. Needless to say, we felt very uncomfortable so we avoided the bar area for the rest of the vacation. I am involved in the service industry so when I am on vacation and don't get superb service, especially when I pay for it, it's very difficult to let this go unnoticed. I would still go back, however, hoping they tended to the areas mentioned.

Reviews.Title: “A solid 4 star resort that falls short”
Reviews.Author: jeztravel
Reviews.Content: First let me start off by saying, our stay at the Casa was pleasant. There is no one thing that ruined our vacation and generally speaking, we had a nice time. I am not going to be one of these people that dings a hotel because the toilet paper wasn't folded into a triangle each morning. I am a Hilton Diamond member. I have traveled the world staying in hotels that range from hostels in Europe to bungalows in Tahiti. I know what to expect and I hold hotels to the standard that their brand and rates command. I don't expect a Motel 6 to have turndown service and I don't expect the Ritz to give me sandpaper towels. I think that is fair. I don't rate hotels poorly who don't upgrade me due to my status when their occupancy is at 100%. I am reasonable. That being said, there were several issues at this property that made our stay mediocre given the cost and branding of the property. Let's start with the good. Mick and Max at the pool were excellent. If I were a bean counter, I would continue to enhance your offerings with the pool concierge. It is the one service that is truly 4, almost 5 star. Also, the rooms and decor, while small, are quite functional and pleasant. The showers were luxurious while not large and the lotions and potions were spot on for a 4 star experience. Now for the not so good. 1) Bar and food service at the pool is AWFUL. It was nearly impossible to flag down a waitress. During the one occasion we did, the waitress completely forgot my wife's order. When she finally came back, she brought a virgin. When she went back again, she brout the wrong drink. On the fourth attempt, the drink was correct, however, the alcohol was nearly absent. I have absolutely no problem paying $9 for a drink on the beach at a nice resort; however, at least serve it correctly, with a smile, and the appropriate amount of alcohol. 2) Housekeeping was completely sporadic. While rooms were always clean, during turndown service, towels were seldom replaced and the shower gel and shampoo were never replaced despite having empty bottles. When towels were replaced, we received pool towels and we were able to get shower gel the one night we bumped into housekeeping during turndown. THIS IS UNACCEPTABLE for even a 3 star resort. If you are going to offer a turndown service and freshen the room, then do that. Don't skimp on stupid items like fresh toiletries and towels. I would rather reuse the nicer bathroom towels than use a lotion filled pool towel that resembles sandpaper. This is either cheap, lazy, or both and management should take note. Remember, this is a beach hotel and guest will take showers twice a day. The hotel should be able to accommodate. 3) Concierge and front desk staff were indifferent. No one was particularly helpful or caring and service was often cold. One morning, I approached the concierge to pre purchase a ticket to the Hemingway house. She indicated that the hotel did not sell these. When I asked if she could assist me with booking through their site and printing the tickets, she directed me to the business center. At the business center, the cost to use the Internet for ten minutes and print two tickets to the Hemingway house would have run $10.50. Am I missing something here? A concierge should be able to provide this service free of charge. It is almost an insualt to send a guest to the business lounge at a resort of this caliber when a full service concierge is on staff. In closing, I hope I have provided some meaningful feedback to others who may be looking at this resort. It is a wonderful building with comfortable rooms and decor. However, this resort falls way short of its reputation as a Waldorf property. I cannot point to the actual cause of the problem, but I would start with resort management. Whether misguided by accountants counting pennies in a back office or poor training for the workforce there is room for improvement. They may be able to charge $300 a night in the short term, but the long term success of this property will require some leadership.

Reviews.Title: “customer service at pool site”
Reviews.Author: Aubrey34345
Reviews.Content: I want to think Mark, Jake, Max, they gave us the best custmer serve to me and my family. I have never received that much attention. I will definetly will come back. Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Just beautiful! We will go back”
Reviews.Author: Pegnorm
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay as Casa Marina. It really felt like a historic well preserved resort. The beach was excellent! We enjoyed the hammocks and the service. I can not complain. We have booked our air again to visit Key West this October. I am not sure I can find a resort to beat Casa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “CASA MARINA KEY WEST = AWESOME!”
Reviews.Author: RevDude
Reviews.Content: The pool manager, Mark, is the BEST! Nice to see a true professional! He made us feel very special on our 29th anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “fabulous hotel , sheer luxury”
Reviews.Author: TheThomasTrio
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at The Casa Marina in Key West and loved every minute of it . The splendour is magnificent and classy . Our room was in the left hand block and was light ,very spacious and very clean . Room service and housekeeping was great. The hotel facilities were wide ranging . We didnt try the main restaurant but a delegation of 300 medical reps used it without complaint and a wedding party was smiling the whole day . Concierge , valet parking and bell boy service excellent . Incidentally valet parking was $20 and self parking across the street in a secure lot was $15. There are 2 large pools in the lush gardens and the wide ,palm tree lined beach is at the end of the white marble deck . Between the crystal clear waves and the cream coloured sand is a small flat rocky area ,typical of Key West but access to the water is provided by a large wooden jetty and steps . We swam alot in the ocean and the jetty was well used . Service around the pool area is efficient and the pool bar made great cocktails and served cold beer . Although the hotel is 5 star and in the Waldorf chain, prices on drinks,snacks and rooms were reasonable .Some of the beach and pool services were ,to say the least indulgent . The pool attendants would bring you drinks,food, lay your beach towels on your bed for you ,along with cleaning your sunglasses and spraying you with cool water . Popsicles and cool water drinks every hour . On the edge of the sandy beach is a large hut with waverunners ,small sail boats & scooters for hire . We rented bicycles & $15 a day as Key West is very cycle friendly . We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Casa , the town of Key west is only 10 minutes walk through leafy ,palm tree lined avenues .It has fabulous nightlife , restaurants ,architecture and scenery .Most of the entertainment is on Duval Street. For great gourmet food try Mangoes & New York Pasta Garden . For cold beer ,fries ,big burgers & great live music go to Sloppy Joes Cowboy Bills & Jack Flats . Key West and the Casa Marina made for an excellent holiday location and we will definitely visit again very soon .

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort and great staff”
Reviews.Author: garylynneharrison
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this wonderful resort and a thoroughly relaxing time. Inparticular I must mention Patrick on front desk who on discovering I was interested in fishing kindly offered to accompany me fishing on the hotels pier. This he did not just once but twice and he was excellent company. Throughout our stay the staff were extremely pleasant and helpful. The facilities offered by the resort made for a most memorable vacation. I would highly recommend the Casa Marina to anyone considering a stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved it - We will return”
Reviews.Author: Robin_estee
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff and tour guides for the jet skis went out of their way to do anything they could for us. We particularly were pleased with Darrin and Robin in the bar, the consierge, I think his name was Don, Patrick at the checkout desk, and Chris and his crew at the jet skis. For the service we received, it was well worth the price. We will return - soon I hope.

Reviews.Title: “One of the few nice beaches in the keys.”
Reviews.Author: Ladylee1986
Reviews.Content: The Casa marina is a very nice hotel. Our room had an ocean view balcony. The room was a bit small and sparsely decorated. Bed was comfortable. The bathroom was small as well with poor lighting. But the beach and pool area were great with excellent service! The concierge service for recommendations of things to do in the area was great, and they gave great recommendations. We loved! our sunset cruise, and the fine dining recommendations. The hotel is on the less crowded, more relaxed area of the island. This was great for us. If you want to drink and party with several hundred people non stop this is not the place for you. If you want a nice place to stay that is close to other attractions without the non stop party atmosphere this is a good place for you. The keys do not have many beaches which will surprise you. Lots of boating activities. Very pretty, clean beach at the casa marina. Great view.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous fun for everyone!”
Reviews.Author: dannywny
Reviews.Content: The private beach was beautiful - and the location of the actual wedding!!! In addition lounging around the pools in the days after was an absolute treat! ROBIN at the pool bar was AMAZING -- I highly recommend her Miami Vice! and Jon couldnt have been more helpful finding chairs and sharing advice about "must-see" places around the island.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Just4fun44
Reviews.Content: At first I was afraid it would be too far from Duval & other attractions, but it is not. It is on a great beach, (rocky just in the water) with a beautiful view! We were there four nights over Memorial Day, there were a couple of weddings, with bands etc and we did not hear any of the celebration in our room. All staff was very accommodating , room was clean, bed was comfortable - only compliant I have is the need for counter space in bathroom. There is a breakast buffet, Toes In The Sand, (beach front dinning) & food @ the bar, but not a restaurant for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View and Location. Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: canegirl08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this as a getaway trip just before Memorial Day. I had never stayed on this part of the island and was looking forward to the "quieter" side. The hotel was AMAZING. The location was beautiful and the rooms are very updated. They have two pools that overlook the ocean and it was wonderful to sit by them. The H2O concierge (pool boys) were great and they even had servers to come serve you drinks and food at your lounge chair. At first I was worried we would be too far away from things we wanted to visit but it was an easy walk to Duval and they had some very cute and delicious places to go very close to the hotel. The only small complaint I have is that breakfast was a bit ordinary. They have a buffet (well worth it) but for such an amazing resort, I was expecting a bit more for F&B.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All the Way”
Reviews.Author: twistasista
Reviews.Content: My husband and I visited this resort and thoroughly enjoyed every minute. The staff was polite and attentive the few problems we had were rectified immediately. They even have someone who goes around cleaning your sunglasses! The beach is rocky but if you enter the water from the dock the beach is not as bad and the water was unbelievably warm and crystal clear. The drinks were reasonably priced and we hung out at the bar a few nights and the atmosphere is so relaxing. However, the breakfast buffet was $20! A little steep for breakfast which is usually the cheapest meal of the day. The food was really tasty and despite the price my husband and I ate there twice. There is a bike/scooter rental place on the beach which are really good ways to get around Key West. After two days on bikes our butts were sore so we rented a car from enterprise and they came and picked us up from the hotel. The car rental was less than scooters! Great deal. There is also free parking on Reynolds st, the street near the hotel, so don't feel compelled to pay for the $15/ day parking or valet. Also make sure your bill is correct prior to check out.

Reviews.Title: “(FANTASTIC HONEYMOON)”
Reviews.Author: ddiamond35
Reviews.Content: We stayed on our honeymoon 5/15/2011, and The Casa Marina must be just short of this side of Heaven, staff out of this world, A few to mention, Mark,Graham,Max,Mel,Julie,Tom,Thomas,Adam,but sorry forgot a few names, lets just say we were waited on like a King & Oueen, we will be back for sure and hope the best for all Staff, looking forward to seeing them all again soon. Norma & Todd

Reviews.Title: “Amazing place for a Wedding!”
Reviews.Author: ltruex
Reviews.Content: Key West is so much fun and Casa Marina is the best place to stay on the island!!! My husband & I were just married here and most of our 60 guests stayed with us at Casa Marina. The staff was very accommodating & pleasant, making our parties stay a wonderful experience! I heard talks of family and friends wanting to make a yearly 'reunion' trip back, which meant they really loved Key West and Casa!! I would highly recommend to anyone a wedding at Casa Marina! Our corner ocean front suite had amazing views & was perfect for the bridal party to get ready in. The day was beautiful and flowed with ease. The food, service, and ambience was all first class and Reina (events manager) was more the helpful and supportive through the whole process.

Reviews.Title: “Service,Service,Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: dharris956
Reviews.Content: What a great, beautiful, place to stay. The amenities beach side and poolside provided by Billy, Mark, and Graham of Barefoot Billy's, was over the top! Each day, they would provide special services with a smile. From frozen washcloths at the beach to pop sickles. They made us feel so pampered. Hats off to Billy, Graham and Mark!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: carenms
Reviews.Content: I returned today after having spent four wonderful days at this resort. I have stayed at hundreds of hotels (business and pleasure) and four & five star resorts. Only one other time have I experienced such exceptional customer service as this. What made it so special here was that the staff was sincerely friendly, consistently attentive and professional and fun throughout our entire stay. Small but telling example: a porter was rolling a large cart stacked with chairs. He saw me go by, stopped his cart, walked around me and opened the door. Special thanks go to: Patrick (from Chicago who checked us in and was just awesome); Stefan who served us breakfast (could not be nicer). Haythem (supervisor) -- It was just after 9pm and we wanted to get a snack from the gift shop. It closed at 9pm. My boyfriend commented to me that it was closed. Haythem overheard us. He offered to get a key and get our snack - he let us in, got our snack, rang it up and we got our snack. How nice was that! Big thanks go to Mark who manages the staff that oversees the beach/pool area. I watched them hustle and give each guest personal attention. No detail was left. Chilled cucumber slices to cover your eyes, popsicles, frozen towels to cool you down...all delivered to you on your chair with a smile. Mark and his staff truly helped to make our time amazing with their "no request is too much" attitude, professionalism, and friendly manner. And, to top it off - they kept it fun. Mark is totally on top of his game. Special kudos goes to Mark's protege, Max, who was so sweet and attentive and funny - he was great. The location was fabulous - near enough to Duval St but far enough to enjoy the serenity and quiet. The pool area is beautiful and the beach is lovely. Food was very good. Only "negative" /areas of improvement: it was Memorial Day wknd and they did not have enough wait staff working the pool area. Effie, the waitress, had little to no support yet, she was competent, friendly and nice; Bathrooms could use upgraded towels, shower curtain and an exhaust fan. Walls are really thin so can hear other guests talking/televisions sometimes. It was a great time and we will be back there.

Reviews.Title: “VERY RELAXING.....I WOULD HIGHLY RECOMMEND”
Reviews.Author: jolice
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went on vacation to Casa Marina resort, and we loved it very much......We went jetsking, we...the sevice was very good and quick....we got the biggest balcony. The guys at the poolside with very nice, and the tour guys as well. We would so stay there again....we had a good time on the resort...Very nice place....But if you are looking for a nice sandy beach....then Miami would be the place to go....but just to relax, Casa Marina is the place....The best room is 724, just because it's the biggest balcony, and you have a good ocean view of everything......

Reviews.Title: “Blissful”
Reviews.Author: signup_pro
Reviews.Content: My girlfriends and I just finished a 4 day birthday diversion trip and stayed at the Casa Marina on Key West. It was fabulous. The food was good, the beach, rooms, and hotel was great. The service was impeccable. The beach side service was unlike anything I have seen. the staff was courteous, attentive, and down right enjoyable. Each day brought unexpected treats of frozen eucalyptus infused towels, iced cucumbers, free drinks, popsicles, and sun glass cleaning! Not to mention the beach spot set up with chairs, towels, and umbrellas. It was my friend's birthday, and they treated her like a queen. The hotel had all the activities you could want to do on-site. I cannot wait to return with my friends again and my husband. It was a great time, and I highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, not great sleeping b/c of thin walls, need better security with outside guests using facilities.”
Reviews.Author: jgoodwin10
Reviews.Content: Although we would definitely still recommend this hotel to a friend, there were a few things that could have been better. The walls are quite thin, therefore, sleeping wasn't great as you could hear every little noise. A few other areas of opportunity were the times at which they cleaned the facilities. I understand they need to stay on top of cleaning for obvious reasons but we were constantly having to get out of the way of housekeeping. From sweeping the lobby floors to vacuuming the halls, I've just never seen so much going on under the guests feet before when traveling. I also felt there should always be complimentary tea/coffee for guests in the hotel lobby like most other hotels offer....having to pay for Starbucks coffee every morning in their gift shop was beyond crazy to me when you are already paying such high rates for a nice hotel. They had these small espresso/keurig type of pots in the rooms but the coffee out of them was awful so we had to pay for Starbucks coffee which we don't even like. The last thing which was quite upsetting was the number of outsiders coming in to use the facilities when they weren't even staying at the hotel. They came by the carloads and when we were the ones paying the high prices to stay at this luxury resort, we somedays couldn't even get seats by the pool, drink service, towel service. There should be some sort of security to minimize this abuse and it would have been quite easy to take care of it as those people were loudly bragging about what they had done to everyone around them. This happened on multiple occasions throughout our 5 day stay. Now, with all of those suggestions, the one thing I can't say enough positive things about was the pool side service...most especially, our pool side concierge, Max. He went out of his way to make us comfortable and meet our every need and ALWAYS with a huge smile! Even on his day off when he came in to pick up his paycheck, we found him moving pool chairs around for guests on a busy holiday weekend. Max was the best part of staying at this resort and I would pay him our highest compliments! Overall, I would still recognize this hotel as a good place to stay but with some minor improvements, it could be a great place!

Reviews.Title: “This place is paradise”
Reviews.Author: kirschc62
Reviews.Content: This resort is a little slice of paradise with a private beach and 2 pools. Never felt crowded. Room was spacious with a balcony overlooking the pool and ocean. Service at the beach and pool was superb. Graham and Max set up our chairs and umbrella every morning. The Sun Sun Bar staff, Robin and Lisa were wonderful with drink and food selections. Robin made sure our meals were prepared as asked. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The concierge was also very helpful with finding restaurants and even helped us find a car wash.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and absolutely gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: schubeal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Marina for a 5 night vacation with my girlfriend. Overall we found it to be an excellent resort. The Awesome: -The grounds. It looks like something out of a movie. Just beautiful. Palm trees, sand, outdoor dining, really makes you feel like you're on vacation. -The staff. Everyone was very friendly while getting you what you need ASAP, be it beach chairs, a cab, a drink or an excursion. -The pools. They have two medium sized pools that never got crowded and were kept very warm, probably 85 degrees or more. -On site dining and bar. They had good, sweet, tropical drinks. In particular, my girlfriend thought her Key Lime Pina Colada was the best Pina Colada she had. The dinner there was very good and the lunch was fantastic (yellowtail fish n' chips). The Good: -Location. Very close to Southernmost point and a couple of restaurants. It's a 30 minute walk to the bustling parts of Duval street and closer to 45 to get to the marina area where you'll catch most snorkel/scuba/sailing trips. That was not a problem for us but it might be a bit far for some people. Cabs are almost always waiting outside the hotel and it was $11, including tip, to get to the marina. -The beach. It's not huge but it's private to the resort and felt pretty spacious. There is a strip of coral rock in between the sand and the ocean so don't expect to be in and out of the water very much. Really, if you are looking for a purely beach-centric vacation Key West is not the best place. It doesn't have the massive strip of sand you get in Miami beach or Virginia Beach and main part of town is on the opposite side of the island from the public beaches. The so-so: -Our room. We stayed in a Flagler Ocean Vista room. It was spacious and nicely appointed. It did have a wide ocean view but you couldn't see out the window from most of the room, there was no deck, and the window itself was painted shut. If you are dead set on an ocean view it is worth getting one of the rooms in the newer part of the hotel (NOT the Flagler building). A couple quirks included no bathroom fan or rack for a hand towel. The TV was small relative to the size of the room but it never got turned on so that wasn't a big deal. -The hallways have dated, mustard yellow and brown carpet. It might look good at a southwestern themed hotel in Taos or Santa Fe but it was a noticeable downgrade from both the room and lobby appointments. Overall, the Casa Marina was an excellent hotel with great service, a comfortable-enough room and excellent amenities. We will almost certainly stay here again for our next stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A trip of rest and relaxation by the pool”
Reviews.Author: Avalon3883
Reviews.Content: The resort was very beautiful and a lot of fun. The pool staff was fantastic. Both Will and Max were not only helpful and attentive but very personable as well. Will and Max always found us the best seats by the pool and always had stuff for us to play with in the pool. Thanks Will and Max!

Reviews.Title: “If you're expecting a Waldorf-Astoria like experience, THINK AGAIN.”
Reviews.Author: NJStyle77
Reviews.Content: Just stay elsewhere in Key West, this place is not worth it. I pay attention to the simple things that should be easy to get right by hotel staff and this place misses the mark on the following: Irons that work and won't spit brown water on your clothes, professional pool staff, responsive housekeeping staff (we had to call 3 times for the first iron, and I'm still waiting for the replacement), cleaning lady comes after 2:30 pm to clean the room when we were gone since 10 am?!?, allowing hotel guests to leave chairs on the beach unattended for hours to save it. It wasn't a pleasant experience at all and not worth the extra money. The main street in town is Duval where the "life" is...it's within a short bike ride from the hotel. I won't be staying here again, fortunately.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Honeymoon Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Garygamecock
Reviews.Content: After a lot of searching, my new lovely bride and I chose the Casa Marina on the advice of a travel agent friend, and we are SO glad we did! The grounds, pools, and beach area were all immaculate, and all the staff truly tried to make our honeymoon something special. Of special note were Ellie at the pool bar (what a true sweetheart of a person she is!), the beach attendants Max and Jake (good college kids that were very attentive), Ann the Concierge (recommended a couple great places for dinner), and Patrick at the front desk (did his best to accomodate a special request). Too often these folks go unnoticed, but these 5 truly stood out! What we really liked about the location was that it was somewhat secluded from the craziness and insanity of Duval Street, but a quick cab ride or pedi-cab got us to that craziness. We also enjoyed strolling Duval Street early in the morning, then making it back to the Casa Marina for beachtime in the afternoon. Also, I'd highly recommend renting bicycles early in the trip to ride some of the back streets to get a true feel of Key West. All in all, a beautiful resort that we'd highly recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: SalesLeader
Reviews.Content: Our sta has ben amazing at this beautiful hotel. In particular the ENTIRE staff has been unfailingly friendly and helpful. Patrick who checked us in is the BEST front desk professional I have EVER met. Mark Gray and Max who work the beach and pool area were beyond amazing - helpful and focused on us having a good time. I travel all over the world as a speaker talking about Sales Culture these people get my top grade for skill, professionalism and customer service. The rooms are really nice and could use better pillows and towels..but thats it....

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with a great service”
Reviews.Author: Travelnathalie
Reviews.Content: We were at this hotel for two nights. It's a very nice hotel with a great service. Check in was nice and smoothly without waiting a long time. We had diner on the beach and it was very romantic with candle lights and again a good and friendly service. The food was good and not that expensive. Our room was very nice, comfortable bed and big. Nice bathroom and very clean, wifi access. Although the room was very good, we asked the front desk for another room because our neighbors where a little bit loud. And we got a new room without any hesitating and they even gave us an upgrade to a suite right on the ocean. Breakfast was also very nice, with some Caribbean music, you just feel yourself in paradise. The beach is also nice, but for swimming I found it not so great because there were a lot of algae and visibility for snorkeling was not that good. Even on the beach there was a good service, the staff came by with some frosty towels.. really refreshing. So Yes I would recommend you to stay in this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Santo4413
Reviews.Content: I want to say that my stay at the Casa Marina was one of my best vacation I have ever been on. The staff was excellent, especially Jan and Robin at the pool bar. They were very friendly and helped us find spots to eat. John , from the pool, was excellent. He had our chairs set up for us every day and made our stay wonderful. The only problem that I had was when I checked in the room they gave us was right by the street. But it was quickly corrected and our new room was great.

Reviews.Title: “Can somebody do something about the chickens”
Reviews.Author: tangible1234
Reviews.Content: I was awakened all hours of the night by chickens. We had a suite on the exterior(street side) of the hotel. We also had a man living in a yellow VW van outside our window at night . Not really a 4 star Hotel with these problems. STAY ON THE OCEAN/POOL SIDE.

Reviews.Title: “Our group will return!”
Reviews.Author: mich08406
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for the second time and we are so glad that we chose the property again. If you are familiar with Key West you know that while the action of Duvall St is fun, the Casa Marina provides an Oasis which is a nice long walk or short cab ride away. The property is beautiful and is located on one of the few beach areas in Key West. The rooms are spacious and comfortable but what will really win you over is the service. The rooms include a $12 per person per day charge which is well worth the money. Your stay at the pool includes everything from towels to free drink samples to sunglass cleanings, frozen face towes, fresh fruit(the list goes on). The staff makes sure that your stay is incredible. Our special thanks go to Mark who provided our group with excellent recomendations, to Will and Dionne for their great service and to Graham and Thomas also for excellent service. Thank you staff of Casa marina for making our vacation everythig that it could be.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: smithandzip
Reviews.Content: It's so relaxing to be in Key West, generally speaking, that it's difficult to discern which part is the environment ( laid back) and which part is the resort. Off to a rocky start, the first room we were assigned was an implausible journey ( one of us is disabled) that didn't make any sense at all. The second, assigned by a friendly young woman at the front desk, had a view of a generator and a rooftop and was unfathomably miniscule for 2 people. The third, assigned by an apologetic man, was facing the front of the hotel parking circle, not a bad location, actually, as it was peaceful and the vegetation is lovely. My main complaint about the room is the teeny-tiny bathroom that does not have a door that seals. It has a double door arrangement, like window shutters, which, if you are traveling with anyone, affords no privacy whatsoever and if you don't want to have to listen to the private ablutions of your tripmate, you are stuck. I don't know about you, but bathroom privacy, especially when you are traveling with a friend is important. I mean you are not in a bathroom-intimacy relationship type of thing, so a double bedded room with virtually non-existent door is undesirable. For that reason I would not return to Casa Marina with a friend.It's not an appealing setup. And I would even ask if in a kingbedded room ( if traveling with a significant other) whether there is a real door to the bathroom.) Speaking of doors, I could not open the door from the inside due to the intensity of the hydraulic seal combined with the heaviness of the door. If you are a petite woman who is not buff, or has some sort of physical challenge, this would be challenging. They sent a workman to adjust it. which then made it requisite that we ensure the door would shut fully behind us, and that whole process ate up at least 30 minutes.
