Combined with the room assignments being initially problematic, check in was a time bandit. On the bright side, the grounds are beautiful. 2 pools. If one is filled with noisy kids, you can go to the other one.As usual, smoking around the pool is irritating if you are allergic or asthmatic,and it may be a workable idea for them to designate one pool a smoking area and the other pool smokefree. But the smoking issue is a serious factor in a trip to Key West , we discovered. This is "land of smokers", evidently and at every Key West location, it is almost shocking to see the ashtrays in the 21st century. We got into a taxi that REEKED of cig smoke. The driver was a smoker and everyone is seemingly indifferent to secondhand smoke. The resort on the inside, however, is smokefree.But in a location where tie dye never went out of style, it makes sense that smoking is still the norm. You might want to consider this before planning a trip to Key West, especially if you want to go into the town. It's worse than NYC, smokewise. The staff at Casa Marina were mostly very friendly, with the exception of a disinterested breakfast waiter. Which raises the topic of food. This is not a resort that you want to eat meals at----as has previously been mentioned in other reviews. The food is absolutely awful. After one inedible lunch only eaten because we had eaten all day, and that breakfast, we passed on dinners , or repeating the experience. The food is slung unto a plate of some sort, boring, tasteless, go someplace else. Surprisingly good is their miniature Spa. Heather is a phenomenal Reflexologist. You have to at least try the short appt. Amazing! A very no-nonsense facialist did extractions that , while taking a week to recover fully from the work, has restored the problem area on my skin. Their lobby is exquisite at this resort and just walking through it lends an air of a bygone era of stately elegance and spacious beauty that is worth the stay. Take the Hemingway house tour. ( By the way--- to the review who criticized the property for not "draining the pool" after an incident with a toddler. You do not "drain" a pool for that. You " shock" it with chlorine. You would not know when and whether they had done so, but I feel certain they must have because it is standard practice and a regulation.)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service in an idyllic setting.”
Reviews.Author: PecosBill21
Reviews.Content: this was an unplanned trip with no reservations. My wife and I had just spent four nights at the Ritz in Naples FL for our national sales conference. While we were satisfied with that stay, we were not unduly impressed with the service at the beach or the pool. I called ahead to the Casa Marina and made reservations for two nights. We arrived at 5PM after a long drive down the keys and were immediately struck by the property, location and the service at check in was friendly and fast. We headed into town and had dinner at the A&B lobster house. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND THIS. Overpriced and very poor service! We headed back to the hotel and hit the sack in our beach front suite. The next morning we went to the beach for the day to relax. WOW! The beach was nice but the service was outstanding!. Jon with the beach service had us set up with lounges and an umbrella within 2 minutes. Jon with Beach Service, gave us a full day of great service even though the property was packed. Darin, our waiter, waited on us hand and foot with food and drinks. Overall these employees put the Ritz to shame.

Reviews.Title: “The Casa is Mi Casa when in Key West”
Reviews.Author: rrzucidlo1
Reviews.Content: Our time spent at the Casa was restful and so enjoyable. The staff from the person who assisted with our reservations to Max and Adam at the pool were all amazing. Brandon assisted us in locating the perfect room, which we will long remember as a highlight to our stay. Max and Adam made each day such a joy, lounging around the pool. They were attentive and a joy to talk to, we want to thank them for making such a difference in out trip. The sunrise is something you should wake up at least one morning to catch....and catching a sunset from the long pier is also worth the time to catch as well. After a sunrise you should wander down to your own hammock and set-a-swing in the quiet of the morning before the Casa wakes up for the day. The Casa is a restored hotel and in it is a lot of history. The rooms are clean and elegant and the housekeeping staff very good. The Jet Ski tour with Thomas was a highlight. Highly recommend making sure this is on your to do list. The only draw back or a plus depending on your view point is that you have a bit of a walk to get to Duval and the more action packed activities. We ventured out each morning for a brisk walk of about a 1-2 miles before selecting our location for breakfast. That is something we enjoy so not being in the middle of the Duval scene was a plus for us. There is a bike or moped/scooter rental on site so if you are not a walker, there are these forms plus a shuttle and cabs available anytime you desire. If our travels take us to Key West again...the Casa would be my first choice to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing property but the service is even better!”
Reviews.Author: michellelynne13
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about Mark and Thomas. Not one detail was was left unattended.

Reviews.Title: “Top location in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: scippics
Reviews.Content: We stayed 12 nights in the Casa Marina from May 1st until May 13th 2011. It was one of our best holidays we had. Almost like to be in paradise. The weather was beautifu: about 30 degrees Celsius in the day and 26 degrees in the night. Water was about 26 Degrees. Water was calm as usual (there are no waves because of the reefs 7 miles outside of Key West). Pools and beach are perfect. The service was excellent. Thomas and Mark from the pool and beach service provided us with all we needed: chairs, towels, umbrella, drink of the day, popsicles and iced towels. You feel like in heaven relaxing in your hammock under the palmtrees with a view to the turqois water of the ocean. All public area are well maintained and beautiful. The hotel lobby with its dark wooden floor is wiped many times a day. The staff is very helpful - they open the doors for you, call you a taxi just like you expect it. We stayed in a King Ocean View room with a good view over the beach and the ocean and a balcony. The room was not not too spacy, but we also had a sepate table where you could eat. The bathroom is a bit small but it was ok. Bathrobes are provided - but they donÂ´t fit XL size people ;-) . The rooms has a small fridge, a safe and a Nespresso coffemaker. Wireless LAN is provided all over the campus and the hotel rooms. It was free of charge (at least for us). In the hotel lobby are 2 PCs that can be used by guests free of charge. Our room had a connecting door - you coul hear almost any word from the other room. Also the sound of people walking and talking in the hallway was a bit disturbing. Housekeeping did not a good job in the first couple of days. We complaint at the reception and talked to the manger a couple of times until our room would be nicely cleaned and made up. We received a satisfaction recovery and got a bottle of wine along with some cheese, ham und fruit - thank you for that! The concierge was very kind and we did a waverunner trip (2 hours round th isle of Key West) and a snorkeling trip to the reef with a sunset ride back to the hotel. Both were absolutely stunning expieriences and worth the money! From the pier at the beach you can go swimming or snorkeling. There are so many corals and fish - even in the shallow water. There was also a group of more than 20 big Tarpons just relaxing under the pier - you could snorkel in between them. Wrapped up: it was a fantastic stay in the Casa Marina - we are looking forward to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but very mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: RandyLanier
Reviews.Content: This is one of the only spots on Key West that has beacfront and these people clearly know it. Having just paid a nearly 5 star price it has fealt like a 3 star experience. The location is awesome and the beach front/pool access is just about perfect. However there was a consistent lack of attention/class/caring from just about every staff member encountered - except for Mark and Gram who provided excellent beach/poolside service. Matt and Tom at the on-site Barefoot Billy's adventure excursions were also exceptional, providing great tours & fantastic local restaurant recommendations. Every other staff encountered from doormen to concierge to bartenders to waiters through out the facility could hardly bother to be helpful much less simply polite. Felt very much like local people working reluctantly to serve tourists in spite of the nearly $300/night premium. The bartender @ the high priced Strip House steakhouse at the neighboring Reach Resort was particular rude. I reluctantly recommend this hotel to others, but what else would you do?

Reviews.Title: “The good and the not as good.”
Reviews.Author: jlkdoh
Reviews.Content: Our stay will be remembered by slow waiter service, grumpy valet service, but a fabulous private beach with extraordinary amenities. The attendants, Mark and Graham, always found us a lounge and umbrella. Also, Matt and Tom at the watersport rental were friendly and provided the best restaraunt recommendations. If you are staying here, it is well worth introducing yourself to them.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great People”
Reviews.Author: steelers0355
Reviews.Content: Staff was friendly and attentive, with minor exceptions. Concierge (Kathie) helped figure out a lot of the unknowns, made reservations and provided contact info for local services needed. Room was great. Although a little on the small side, the HUGE terrace made up for it. Right on the water with its own beach. Service provided on the beach and poolside was a big positive. Parking rates are a little high, though. Dated hallway carpets seemed to detract from the overall qualiy of the hotel. With a great location, the views from the room were somewhat obstructed by high palm trees. We do not recommend Barefoot Billys watersports, though. Still a very positive experience.

Reviews.Title: “Massage on the Beach is the best I had anywhere!”
Reviews.Author: BRoerig
Reviews.Content: This trip, we were staying at the Westin on the other side of the island. However we revisited Casa Marina just to get massages on the beach. Edith and Lania are amazing! They offer massages on the beach under a tented area (one area handles one person, the other allows two people to receive side-by-side massages). In fact, with various friends who visited with me over my 9 day stay in Key West, we went for massages three times. They are all professional and provide areas of concentration based on your body. Even if you don't stay at Casa (and I have many times over the years and have nothing but good things to stay about the accomodations), get a massage on the beach. Lunch at the Sunset bar area is great too!

Reviews.Title: “It was the best relaxing enjoyable vacation ever.”
Reviews.Author: EdBaird
Reviews.Content: The service at the house by the sea was excellent. From Lizelle the concierge who set up a wonderful dinner on Sunset Key best table in the house and she would not tell me how she arranged to have 2 dolphins playing in the Ocean while we enjoyed the sunset. Our room was very nice with a balcony view of the Ocean. Clean and well kept by the attendants.The service at the Bar and pool was excellent. From the waiters (Darrin) to all the Bar tenders(Jan Robin Lisa and Suzzane) a big thank you for making our stay special. The Pool attendants and the amenities were excellent. Location was convienent and private and the exercise buidling was perfect. All the water sports were available right at rhe Casa Marina. Rent a scooter or a bike was also available.The food and service was outstanding also. This was our second stay and we will be coming back for 3, 4, 5, 6, etc. Thank you all for making it special.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional stay throughout”
Reviews.Author: Bubba1034
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Casa Tuesday through Friday before leaving for the singer songwriter festival. We were greeted with a smile even though we did not arrive until after 10pm. From the front desk, bell hop, and Stacey the conceirge, everything we needed from the staff began with a bang. The next morning we were greeted by a friendly face in Max who got our chairs, umbrella, towels and later brought by the drink of the day. He encouraged us to take the Jet Ski trip where Kris showed us a great circling the island. The next day we took the snorkle/sunset trip and Dave and staff showed us great hospitality, educated us on the water, marine life and some history of the island. We paid a little extra to leave from the hotel for the trips, but saved on time and parking so felt like we got a better deal. If your looking for an upscale hotel with all the amenities, the Casa Marina can't be beat, at least not in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “had a great time”
Reviews.Author: beawhit
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights at the Casa Marina and had a great time. The hotel is beautiful and has a great beach. I loved the espresso machine in our room, the comfy beds and the robes. I did have to request to have our room cleaned daily and track a maid down for extra linens that weren't replaced when the room was cleaned, but overall we had a nice stay. I also enjoyed the ipod radio in the room. Mark @ the beach was so attentive to us. I loved the frozen towels, grapes, sunglass cleaning. Great service! One suggestion to staff is to not use the yellow cab service. The pink service was much better. The staff called a yellow cab for us one night (our party included 2 pregnant women) and the cabbie showed up smoking in the cab. It was also dirty and old. For a high class hotel, they should use a better cab service. The pink service even charged us a $1 less on the return home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience thanks to superb staff”
Reviews.Author: pc12drvr
Reviews.Content: We arrived late on our first evening due to a complication in our travel plans. Upon arrival we were warmly and graciously greeted by Brandon Kuhn. The manner in which he treated us made the difficulties of the day melt away. Now, I was staying there on Hilton points, so I was happy just to have a room. But Brandon was very concerned that the only rooms he had available had double queen beds, and not king beds (my wife and I were traveling over our anniversary). Not only was the room he gave us in the main building lovely, it had a good sized outdoor balcony overlooking the grounds and ocean. The next morning a larger room became available, but because of our balcony and view my wife and I elected to stay put. Brandon was so generous and gracious in a most unnecessary way feeling we somehow needed to be compensated for our inconvenience. During our stay, we were so impressed with the staff. Friendly, courteous, caring, and most importantly treating us like valued guests truly impressed us. We had such a delightful time and much of it was a direct result of the high standards held by the staff. In my job, I am on the road 186 days a year. Nothing insults me more as a Diamond Member than being treated like some schlub off the street, and unfortunately it happens more often than it should. The experience my wife and I had at the Casa Marina made us feel like Royalty. In fact, we enjoyed our experience so much we canceled our other plans and elected to stay! We had several travel complications on this vacation as well as the cloud of selling my Father-in-lawâ€™s home (and dealing with realtors and lawyers) hanging over us. Yet, the wonderful way in which we were pampered and cared for made it all fade away. This was truly one of the best vacations we have ever had. I've read some of the complaints people have had and while it's too bad anyone had a bad experience here, I'm not sure I understand. The photo's on the Casa's website accurately depict the resort. The rooms are not lavishly appointed, but are that Euro-clean aesthetic look. It's not everyone's cup of tea, I know. The beach has a small area that is directly into the water from the sand, otherwise, it's over the coral-rock or off the pier. This is not unusual in the Key's. When booking a room, the resort fees are clearly outlined. The prices may not be cheap, but good God - you're at a resort in an expensive vacation place to begin with! BTW, the cold buffet which included an array of smoked salmon, sliced cold meats and cheeses, berry tarts, and yogurt parfaits in addition to the usual fruits, cereals, breads, and danish was only $15.00 per per person which included juice and coffee. If that's beyond your budget for breakfast there are several great places for breakfast within a 10 minute walk. And I, for one, am glad the bar in the pool area serves drinks in plastic and not glass regardless of how much they charge. sheesh.

Reviews.Title: “Beach, Restaurants, Common Grounds are first class -- but what happened with the Rooms?"”
Reviews.Author: MJSKS
Reviews.Content: $45 Million renovation and it seems that they ran out of money when they got to the rooms. Ive stayed at this hotel 3 times over the last decade -- and not since the major renovation about 5 years ago. The beach is beautiful, bars at the beach well appointed, pool area is wonderful, breakfast outdoors at the restaurant first class, lobby area very pleasant. We had a premier room -- facing the beach with a patio. The rooms (and I looked at 4 or 5) are drab, boring and completely void of any charm. The bed quality was very good -- We had a quality plush mattress. But the room itself had few if any appointments, and really just lacked any style or charm. Carpet in the halls were worn and again drab in color. In the 80's and 90s - the rooms had style, their were interesting awnings on the portal and the hotel had charm. The Hotel is still very pleasant, rooms passable -- but any charm is gone.

Reviews.Title: “Got very sick from this resort. Watch your bill and your food!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angelalana50
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this so called resort from 5/5/11 to 5/12/11 for our honeymoon. Oh were do I start. 1st off this resort is very expensive and doesnâ€™t have the quality that you pay for. They penny pinch every little amenity that is available and have tons of hidden charges. They charge outlandish resort fees, oh and these resort fees did not include the $15 a day self parking which is also taxed.. LOL! Iâ€™ve never heard of anything like that. We had other guest with the same last name that was charging stuff to our room. The staff had to go through the receipts to see for themselves that the charges were not actually ours before he would even consider deleting them. I know things like this happened but itâ€™s the staffâ€™s job to make sure the correct charges are being made to the correct rooms. We made the fatal mistake of leaving an opened Capri Sun on the counter in the ice bucket over night. We woke up to ants covering the entire corner of the TV table. We couldnâ€™t throw anything with left over food residue in the trash cans inside the room because ants would swarm it within an hour. Even when food wasnâ€™t around we still had the ant problem the entire stay. The food at this place was very mediocre for a 5star place. Iâ€™ve went to buffets that served better quality of food than this resort. I ordered Calamari that taste like I was chewing on rubber bands. The breakfast buffet was just ok but the price turned us off. $52 every morning for both of us to eat breakfast is just ridicules. I ordered Fish and Chips from their over priced, very limited menu on Sunday the 8th . As I was eating it, I noticed the fish was halfway un-cooked in the middle. I got very sick on Monday morning the 7th and had to sleep the entire day. Now Iâ€™m reading different reviews and thinking back on the dates. I see another review said that some one pooped in the pool on Saturday the 7th and the staff didnâ€™t drain the pool. Thatâ€™s nasty!!! Now, I canâ€™t tell if my sickness came from the un-cooked fish that I ate on Sunday the 8th OR from the possibility of contracting E-Coli due to the hotel staff not draining the contaminated pool on Saturday the 7th. In which I did get into that same west pool on both days, not knowing about the poop incident before hand. Again â€œThatâ€™s some nasty ishâ€�. I feel sick to my stomach just thinking about it again! Drinks were very expensive and some of the bartender had sucky attitudes. They charge $9 for a Pina Colada and had nerve to put it in a little plastic cup. You would think that a $9 drink would be served in a high glass for that price. Service Walls are very thin and hollow and the hotel hall way carpet was dingy. It has a very bad beach location. I mean I know itâ€™s a man made beach but geesh, the beach had slimy rocks at the edge and you couldnâ€™t walk directly into the water. You had to walk onto a pier to get into the water. They only had one little section of the water that didnâ€™t have rocks and that was on the end where the Jet ski rentals were. We had a 1 bedroom partial ocean view suite with a balcony. I can surely tell you that the view sucked, it was all covered up by palm trees as we were on the 3rd floor. I had to peak around the banister to see the ocean. Was suppose to get free breakfast on Friday for the rest of our stay due to the ants but the guy who promised us had left didnâ€™t leave a note in compensation of our ant problem. He didnâ€™t come back until Sunday and the other hotel staff would not honor his promise unless they first talked to him as if we were lying. Every day when we left the resort I would become happy and content with my surroundings. Thatâ€™s how much negative energy this resort gave off to me. Every bad experience we had during our entire honeymoon was on this hotel premises. Itâ€™s very hard to believe that they are apart of â€œWaldorf Astoriaâ€� This hotel is not worth the money they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Hard To Leave”
Reviews.Author: BCorr
Reviews.Content: Everything was great. The only problem was we didnt want to leave. The prices where hard to believe reasonable. It was cheaper to have lunch on the beach then to eat on Duval street and much better food quality. Breakfast in bed was cheaper then a pot of coffee in most big city hotels. The stay was great, hard to leave the Hotel which is more like a resort. Spent 3 days in the Keys and loved every second of it. TIPS Having day trips (snorkle, sunset, scuba,etc) leaving from the dock means no stress on getting there. Breakfast is a steal Drink of the day is a nice touch. They make the big cup you pay for with more booze= better Steaks at the Reach resort where good Air and water show, Navy jets and boats going by all day. snorkle and sunset cruise where great Beach valets and pool where wonderful best airport trip ever, only about 6 minutes away. It took 13 minutes to get from the planes door to the front desk!!!!!!!! Water so clear you can see the fish in the water CONS Sister resort is not close it is probably a 3 to 4 bloock walk with a couple of turns Nothing to do with the resort but Hemingways house was the only rip off at $25 bucks for my Wife and I.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will return ASAP!!”
Reviews.Author: NC_traveler_11
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days (extended our stay 2 xtra nights) and thoroughly enjoyed the resort. The pool and pool staff were great!! The beach was nicely appointed with chairs and hammocks, but don't go there expecting a smooth transition to the water as it's more rock than sand. We were able to walk to various restaurants and points of interest (Southernmost Point), but took cabs to Old Key West. We will definitely return and stay at this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Ktbaxter
Reviews.Content: The hotel common areas are beautiful, and very clean and well-kept. Staff is constantly cleaning and maintaining property. Front desk and bell staff was excellent. Restaurant and bar staff was a little slow at times, but you have to adjust for "island time"! Beach staff was great. Recommend taking the jet ski tour of the island. Ask for Matt as your guide-he was awesome and the tour was informative and fun. Bathroom was very small, but its a historic hotel. I recommend this hotel, and also the sister property The Reach next door.

Reviews.Title: “Change your entire Key West Experience”
Reviews.Author: CaTraveler53
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina is exquisite. Have been to Key West several times previously, but staying here changed the entire experience. Historic hotel is back to it's original splendor, the rooms have been updated to modern but welcoming chic, dining here is better than any hotel should be - it tempts you to never leave the grounds. What makes Casa Marina our choice, however, is the staff. They are the best of any hotel we have ever booked anywhere in Florida. From the front desk (Evelyn) to the wait staff to the bartenders to the cabana and bar staff, they have returned service to a level we thought had been forgotten in hospitality. This hotel will be my first choice in Key West from now on. P.S. We were also at the pool on May 7. The hotel did everything possible to minimize inconvenience considering that the "poop in the pool" incident occurred during an island-wide power outage.

Reviews.Title: “someone pooped in the pool”
Reviews.Author: Chicago9458
Reviews.Content: Someone pooped on the pool (the west one) on May 7th. It was our third day there. As one woman pointed out, it was "adult sized". Clearly, this happens in pools. I'm not blaming the hotel staff (because it was obviously one of the guests). But what I'm about say ruined our trip: THEY DIDN'T DRAIN THE POOL. They scooped out the poop, poured some chemicals on it, and an hour later, people were back in the pool (clearly guests who didn't know about the poop). it happened around 10 AM. When we went to get lunch (we left the pool after the incident and went to the beach), we saw people in the pool and almost vomited. Frankly, HILTON CORPORATION, you should be filled with a great shame. And possibly lawsuits if someone got sick. I'll continue to review though Service - really depends on who you get. There is a short blond woman from England that we nicknamed "Kristin" after my wife's lazy cousin. She is the worst. A few of the waiters were great, most were not. Accommodations - our room sucked. I hate to be one to complain about the bathroom, and i know its an older hotel, but for what we paid, it was not worth it. And, the staff barely cleaned the room. Having said that, the beach area is very nice. Front desk - I thought the girl at the front desk had an attitude.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ChaceGoral
Reviews.Content: We were sad to leave yesterday and had the most amazing time at Casa Marina for our honeymoon! Our suite on the beach was beautiful, clean, and the staff worked above our expectations. The breakfast buffet is huge and delicious and the food at Sun Sun Grille was awesome. The bar was our favorite spot and bartenders Lisa and Suzanne became our friends fast. They were quick, friendly, and made the best drinks. I recommend the mojitos that came with rock candy:). On the beach the H20 concierge boys including Max and Adam went above and beyond everyday getting us chairs, umbrellas, towels, Popsicles, drinks and food very quickly. Uponleaving we met Patrick checking out who was made for his job. His personality and friendliness topped off our week and we can't wait to go back! Reading the less than desirable reviews on this site male me question of those guests stayed at the same resort. Everything was perfect and the quality was amazing. Thank you Casa Marina and we will be back. With love from Boston:)

Reviews.Title: “The Best Resort On Key West”
Reviews.Author: Curttina
Reviews.Content: We had the best attention by the beach service managed by Mark.He made excellant suggestions for watching the sunset also transportation on the island. The waiter staff on the beach provided umbrellas, towels, cold brinks, popscicles,iced washcloths to refresh you. We have never received such service, THANKS The outdoor dining areas are beautiful with ocean views and all our meals were delicious with excellant service by the waite staff. Our room had a magnificant view of ocean with a picture window along with a balcony which was the best!

Reviews.Title: “Mark and Patrick pushed it over the top!”
Reviews.Author: Janis1953
Reviews.Content: From Patrick at the front desk to Mark & his crew on the beach, the service at Casa Marina goes way beyond the norm. The last three years Patrick has checked us in and been extremely accomodating doing all that is possible to ensure a pleasant stay. There is no way he could remember us yet he made us feel like old friends. The ammenities on the beach made it hard to leave the resort. We can't remember all their names but everyone was gracious. Super friendly people like Cruz and Niko and even the grounds crew trimming the sea grapes went out of their way to make us welcome. Mark talked with us each day and gave us great advice on restaurants, sunset spots, and even helped us procure an electric cart for the day. He is a true asset to the Hilton organization. We highly recommend the Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: kvroulston
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina was a wonderful place, it's a perfect setting, beautiful facility, has everything you need to have a wonderful Key West vacation. But I would be remiss if I didnâ€™t specifically call out the wonderful folks at the Sun Sun Bar and Grill who made our visit there â€œover the top wonderfulâ€�. Lisa and Suzanne were extremely helpful providing us with dinner options from their personal perspectives and pointing out must see and do activities that we may not have figured out on our own. If you are heading to Key West, I recommend you go to the Casa Marina, and you definitely should drop in and see Lisa and Suzanne for all your cocktail needs!

Reviews.Title: “Pool and Grounds Great- Hotel and Rooms Not Waldorf Quality”
Reviews.Author: kmc1974
Reviews.Content: The pool is lovely and the pool concierges are fantastic. Graham at the pool was helpful, friendly and delightful! The other concierges, including Adam, Max and John, were also great. Robin, the bartender at the pool bar, was fabulous! We really enjoyed the grounds and pool. The hotel- not so much. First off, we were staying here on Hilton Honors points. Generally Hilton treats their guests that are using points very well when providing rooms. I have been a diamond member for years. Not the case here. When we checked in they tried to give us a terrible handicap-accessible room that looked worn-down and dirty. It was terribly shaped with no way to even watch the TV (not that you're there to watch TV, but come on!) and had a shower that was basically just a drain in the floor with a shower seat and a flimsy curtain. If I was in need of a handicap room and I was put in that I would be offended. I do not appreciate being treated like a bother when I use the points that I have literally spent tens of thousands of dollars at Hilton-brand hotels to acquire. When we requested a new room they did move us, but to a barely better room, overlooking a parking lot and street with no balcony. Not impressive at all and certainly not Waldorf quality. The rooms are bland and worn-out feeling. Do not expect luxury. In addition, the walls are paper thin and you can hear absolutely everything, particularly from the hall-way. Do not expect to sleep past 7:00ish when loud people and kids hit the hallways. Other than the pool area and breakfast one morning, I was not impressed with the overall service. It just seems like a factory. Not at all personal, helpful or enthusiastic. Food was OK- we only had breakfast and one lunch. Breakfast service on the terrace was lovely thanks to our fabulous server Jozef. Bottom-line- the grounds and beach/pool are great, hotel not so great. There are so many great places in Key West to stay, don't think I would waste my money here, especially if you end up in a sub-par room like we received. Although we might stop by again to hang out with Graham!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: lippa7
Reviews.Content: My husband & I traveled to Key West for a wedding and booked our hotel at the Casa Marina expecting it to be very pleasant since it was a Waldorf Astoria property. Our 2 bedroom suite was so run down, the furniture looked 30 years old and the couch in the main sitting room was old and and uncomfortable and extremely dirty. There were marks of some sort on the cushions as well as the arm rests. IT WAS DISGUSTING!!! The bathrooms had no counter space and terrible water pressure. Also there is no turn down service, the maid only services the room once per day. Our cable tv upstairs in our bedroom did not work when we arrived and only fixed it our second day there. The worst part of the trip was the room service. It was one of the worst I've ever experienced and we tried to order different things over our 5 days. They start serving at 7:00am, so if you're an early riser, you can't even get coffee. The do not have a continental breakfast and NO ICE CREAM!!! In Key West where it's 90 degrees, HELLO!!! They overcharged me for breakfast, I asked for there breakfast that included 2 eggs, meat, juice, toast for $18.00. I request 3 additional eggs (a la carte). They brought me 3 full breakfasts, charged me extra $10.00 for an english muffin which hadn't been toasted. They tried correcting the bill twice, finally to charge me for 2 breakfasts and the english muffin because each additional egg is $5.00 !!!! I think they've lost their mind! The buffalo wings and salads had so much dressing they were inedible. Oh and the best part is the delivery guy who brought our room service on Friday night looked like he crawled out from working on the air conditioning unit. He looked unshowered and was unshaven, scruffy and his uniform as if he pulled it out of the laundry basket. The good part were the beds were surprisingly comfortable and the air conditioning worked well. Otherwise this hotel was dump. I would never stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Self-contained luxurious perfection”
Reviews.Author: BigDPilot
Reviews.Content: There is only one thing wrong with this hotel, and that is the hike that is required to get to the action on Duval street. Other than that, this hotel has it all. The beach, the restaurant inside, the restaurants right next door, the pools. You can take a cab from the airport here and never leave.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Justme1127
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful Hotel the service is excellent Mark, Thomas,Will and Adam could not do enought to make our stay great. Its nice to be pampered by the pool and they made sure not to disappoint. Mark did a great job on recommending really good restaurants in the area. I had a great time cant wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: trentsgal
Reviews.Content: This is a spectacular, historic hotel on the beach in Key West. We had a pool/ocean view suite on the 2nd floor. The room was large and well appointed. We like having a mini fridge in the room for our sodas and snacks. We had no issues with the housekeeping. Our room was designed to be an adjoining room, and as such, we could hear everything going on in the room next to us. Including the spat the couple was having late into the night. A quick phone call to their room number explaining that we could hear the was the end of that issue. This is grand old dam of a hotel. The architecture and surroundings are magnificent. You will not get a huge bathroom, but you will get mature landscaping with palm trees and quiet, serene surroundings. If you're looking for a 'state of the art' modern hotel - then you need to look elsewhere and let someone who enjoys quiet, stately sophistication have the room. As others have noted here, the beach staff is phenomenal. Kudos and a shout out to Max on the beach. Couldn't ask for a nicer guy - anywhere. Mark - who is large and in charge - is great as well. They truly made our stay at the Casa Marina an outstanding experience. Unfortunately, I can't say the same thing for the guys at the bike rental shack - even though they are managed by Mark and are part of the same group as those on the beach, these guys all seem to have a terrible, "can't be bothered if you're not going on a wave runner tour" attitude. The word 'snotty' comes to mind. Rent your bikes off-site. There are PLENTY of bike rental companies that will deliver your bikes to the resort, and charge you LESS than the Casa Marina. More problems with renting our bikes than I can detail here. Tip - Get the best price you can on Priceline for the hotel (4 star Key West) and then upgrade to the Ocean Vista suite for $40/night when you get there. Tip - Ditch your car and rent a bike. The Old Town area of Key West is an EASY 10 minute bike ride from Casa Marina. The whole island of Key West is one big bike path. Parking in old town and anywhere close to Mallory Square is a nightmare - but there are bike racks everywhere. I am almost 50 years old, out of shape and have bad knees, and I thoroughly enjoyed the bike. Be prepared for the $25/day resort fee and $15/day parking fee

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: JCDIII
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about our stay at the Casa Marina. We will definitely be back. Special thanks to "Mark on the Beach" for all his restaurant recommendations.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service, Attention to Detail and Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: carachasney
Reviews.Content: I recently traveled to Key West for the first time with my mother to check out the Casa Marina and other vendors for my wedding in November. From the moment we walked in to the time we left, the service was spectacular and we were in awe of the grounds and view. Patrick at the front desk was knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and recognized us each day. Will at the West Beach pool was helpful, professional and funny, and he hustled all day to make sure his guests were taken care of. The service at the pool was spectacular. We were served cold fruit in the morning, a signature cocktail of the day in the afternoon and frozen grapes on skewers as the day was winding down! What a difference those little things made to our experience! We had a menu tasting with Reina that was divine. She was the best! As was Lubos, who paid attention to our conversation and was able to grab things from the kitchen without us even asking! After this trip, I can't wait to get married in such a great setting with such great people taking care of us! I hope all the little things we loved remain in November! Thank you, Casa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “Still basking in the glow of the Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: Lilywife
Reviews.Content: Even though we're back in the cooler weather of the Mid-Atlantic, I'm still basking in the glow of the Casa Marina from the beautifully appointed hotel to the accommodating staff. Our poolside activities director, Mark made excellent suggestions for dinner complete with reservations all the while doing such pampering as cleaning our sunglasses, serving frozen popsicles, cocktails, frozen grapes, and even spritzing us with a sprayer equipped with a fan. It just doesn't get any better than that! We followed Mark's suggestions to experience the best of Key West and had an absolute excellent time. It's a definite return trip!

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS!”
Reviews.Author: sweetsu00
Reviews.Content: Best trip ever thanks to Mark.....what a personality and great guy....had soooo much fun...thanks Mark...will be back WITH Friends!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place. The service was GREAT!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: honegrl
Reviews.Content: We came several times to this property. Will always stay here!!! The staff is the best. Mark, Will, Adam and Thomas, at the beach are very attentive and help us will anything we needed. Reservations, things to do suggestions. Frozen grapes, sprayed us to cool us down, sunglass cleaning, popsicles, cool water. The ammentities were fabulous!!!!!! Deon was the best server. We missed her the last day we were there. We did the around the island tour wave runners...Capt Matt gave a great tour. Do the tour with the hotel it is worth it!!! We cannot wait to come back!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Ocean views are wonderful”
Reviews.Author: axle234
Reviews.Content: The water Staff was the best thing......... these Guy's Julian and Thomas are the greatest. Julian busted his butt putting up umbrella's and pulling chairs and towels for our large group of ten........... everyday!!! He would set us up, check on us later and bring us popsicles and the drink sample of the day. IF the house clean staff was just as good we would have giving the resort a 5 all over. When problems with house keeping was address it WAS taking care of. The gym was pretty big with alot of equipment, similar to my gym @ home. The food was very good with prices comparable to resort pricing. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay @ the Casa or the Reach when I come to Key West !”
Reviews.Author: Fryckchic
Reviews.Content: I started coming to the Casa in 1990, and have come back every year since! Sometimes twice a year. The hotel is in a great location and has a beach. The beach service is awesome and MARK always makes my stay special! He is the BOMB!!! Glad he is back on staff. Billy has been here since I started coming here and is always available and attentive, making sure I have everything I need! I highly recommend these sister hotels! Stay at one , play@both!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel, but not exactly "Waldorf Astoria" style”
Reviews.Author: Pilatescutie
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is a lovely, historic hotel on the beach with great food, accommodations and service. Although it doesn't live up to the Waldorf name, it's a great place to stay as long as you're expecting a "beach resort". We were actually disappointed when we first checked in (expecting it to be grander); however, it grew on us and we'd be happy to stay there again. The service was outstanding...we particularly enjoyed the beach thanks to "Thomas" who personally set up our lounge chairs and towels making sure we were comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel poor housekeeping.”
Reviews.Author: Lori1352
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay but the housekeeping service was horrible. We had to call the front desk almost every day to request coffee, towels, bath mats. Certainly not the service you would expect from a very expensive hotel. The bright side is that the beach and bar personnel were outstanding. Robin, Graham, and Adam were professional, courteous, and attentive. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Is there a better property on Key West? Probably not and overall we had a great time.”
Reviews.Author: SusieBella
Reviews.Content: I have to say I was a bit disappointed in the hotel, wanted to love it. Yes, this is a great location (removed but not remote ) with lovely grounds and a nice beach but overall the staff is just not that friendly. I read the reviews ahead of time and this seemed to be a pretty common refrain. I figured we are self sufficient adults and we donâ€™t need or seek to be fawned over, so I was not deterred. Pleasant should be the baseline personality to work at a resort, sadly, I would give this property a 50/50 ratio of nice to surly. As to the room, we loved our ocean front suite. The rooms are a bit austere, restyled modern is accurate. Note the shutters from the bedroom into the courtyard let in a surprising amount of light if you are a light sleeper this will be bothersome. While we were very happy to have an early arrival accommodated by Patrick (he was pleasant), unfortunately the room hadnâ€™t been fully serviced by housekeeping. By that I mean a dirty robe hanging in the closet obviously inside out and the first two towels I reached for had long black streaks on them. Not a good start, then somewhere during our stay the bath mat went missing, not a big deal. This was all remedied promptly but it did leave me with a very uneasy feeling and it is definitely not appropriate for a Waldorf property. Irritation was quickly dispelled by the very accommodating and cheerful beach side service from the fellas at H2O. Graham was outstanding over the course of our 5 day stay, as were Adam and Jon... very helpful with or without cash on hand to tip. We actually moved several times one particular day to avoid cigarettes and then naughty children and there wasnâ€™t a bit of resistance just that cheerful service while we got resituated on the beach at the far, far, far end. As others have mentioned the drink of the day, ice pops and frozen towelettes are a nice touch. Unfortunately this service was not uniform. The wait staff at the beach are pretty inept â€“ we didnâ€™t really expect prompt service on the beach since itâ€™s our choice not to amble up to the bar but we do expect napkins, utensils and condiments when we finally get our lunch, otherwise we are taking our lazy butts up to the restaurant to fetch them (2nd trip since the 1st was usually in search of a server). Did my husband chide me for tipping anyway â€“ of course! At breakfast the wait staff, Darren and Eloise our hostess, were lovely. The rest of them I could do without -the woman at the sundries shop was downright surly, anyone can have a bad day â€“ she had several. The folks at the concierge were fine, not pleasant, but not rude â€“ interestingly neutral. Maybe they are not all suited for a job that entails answering dumb tourist questions over and over, day in, day out â€“ I wouldnâ€™t want to do it either. Lastly, at checkout our bill didnâ€™t accurately reflect the resort credits we were due with our package or the breakfast option we purchased for a variance of about $300. Check your bill carefully! Nit picking you may say - I think not when it comes to housekeeping or billing errors but I will grant you the rest. However, when you are staying 5 nights in a suite thatâ€™s quite pricey you expect standards to be met consistently as befitting the Waldorf flag. Is there a better property on Key West? Probably not and overall we had a great time. Room for improvement for a hotel that advertises timeless luxury and service? Most definitely. Thumbs up but with reservations.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: Fred3876355378
Reviews.Content: Beautiful venue. Service was spectacular especially the Beach & Poll staff, in particular Thomas and Julian.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment on every level”
Reviews.Author: Nyktravel1
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying at the Casa for a wedding and I am beyond disappointed with the rooms and cleanliness of this resort. And it is nothing short of offensive that they charge what they do for the "luxury" ocean front rooms. Save your money and stay in a standard room that is at least clean and does not feel like a jail cell. The bathroom is the smallest bathroom I have ever seen in a hotel, ever. You can touch both the shower and sink at the same time without stretching out your arms. There is only a shower stall which is fine, but it's about 1/4 of the size of a normal stall. The ceilings are so low that my husband, who is under 6 ft, hit his hand on it when changing. And to top it all off, there is mildew in the shower. The floors in the bedroom itself just look dirty and worn as does the patio furniture. The walls are paper thin so you can hear everything going on in the rooms next to you and in the hallway. Having said all that, the common spaces of the hotel are beautiful and poolside service is okay. The lunch served poolside was disgusting ( how do you mess up a blt and Cobb salad?). And to top it all off, the wifi is supposed to be included in the $50 resort charge at is in your bill, but they still tried to charge me $15. Truly the worst hotel I can remember staying at in a really really long time.

Reviews.Title: “It was a very nice place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: klahovich
Reviews.Content: The staff was very accommodating. The pool staff - Julian was exceptional and extremely hard working. This was our first time at this hotel and would be our choice when we return to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rcscpstraveler
Reviews.Content: Exceptional location, away from the maddening bar scene near Mallory Square, and right on the Atlantic shore. Great waterfront with two pools, bar, grill, and lots of sand. Mark runs a service oriented beachfront. His staff was responsive and always pleasent. Front desk staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, staff, and experience...”
Reviews.Author: JennyDog2008
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried about going to Key West with teens, but when I called the resort they said it was family friendly. It was that and much more...the resort is a picture perfect setting with a beach and wonderful pools. We swam in the ocean, swam in the pools, played lawn games, and rested in hammocks. All beach activities are available at the resort (though a quite a bit more than if you go direct to saw a dive shop, but it is the convenience factor). We had a suite and it had enough closet and drawers for the entire family for the week, as well as frig so we can have snacks on hand (as they are teens and never stop eating). The service was consistently great - Dion and Adam at the pool made sure we were always well hydrated and happy. Thanks for a very relaxing Easter!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Key West - Simply the Best”
Reviews.Author: AlohaTX
Reviews.Content: Simply an amazing visit over the Easter Holidays. The resort is by far the nicest on the island and the staff extremely gracious and courteous. Brandon Kuhn mentioned in many of these post is FIRST CLASS and represents everything you would expect with the Hilton Waldorf brand. The rooms are upscale chic island in dark woods with a light and airy feel. The grounds are well maintained with manicured beach area, best in Key West, just foot steps from your room. The food was delicious and service great. The staff are the "icing on the cake" - making this a great experience. Highly recommend the WA Key West resort for any occasion. I can hardly wait for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “realxing wonderful mini vacation”
Reviews.Author: kelliseger
Reviews.Content: This is our return to this beautiful resort...wonderful staff, great accomodations..Ann from the consigere desk was pleasant, helpful and had wonderful recommendations for what my family was looking for The Beach service was amazing...Graham and Jon were extremely attentive and helpful..setting up chairs and towels, Making sure unbrellas were available for my sun burnt children ...they really could not have been more pleasant and accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “We had a paranormal incident ....I wanted to get out of there”
Reviews.Author: Phinla10
Reviews.Content: We were 5 women on a Bachelorette Get Away.. Super Excited about the Resort.. went there and the check in was easy and they hooked us up with Suite #1007.. Service was very nice. The Resort was beautiful....We were excited to be there.. First night we stayed up till 3 AM talking, laughing and having a good time. Our last night night we stayed up talking , laughing and enjoying our last night there until my friend heard the water running in the sink.. We thought it was the sprinklers outside but it seemed so close to us , so we thought it was our sleeping friend in the bed room who got up to use the bathroom ... so we called out to her and she answered us from the bed room.. we freaked out.. so we woke up our other sleeping friend and she went to check the bathroom and she said the light was on and the water was running .. mind u.. we were all on the pull out bed sticking close to each other.. I was the last one in the bathroom and I know I switched off the light and the water..We Started freaking out and the Bride to be was crying.. We started saying our prayers and just as we started praying.. the water stopped running... We freaked out even more and waited a while to use the bathroom coz all the fear made us want to use the bathroom.. Wanted to call room service but decided not to..what were they going to do?.. I wanted to get the heck out of the room and sleep in our car... but I soon fell asleep on the couch.... The next morning I did not want to go into the bathroom alone... SCARYYYYYYYY!!!! The interiors look old and beautiful and the out doors was gorgeous l but I will never ever in my life go back there for any amount of money or if it was for free... NO THANK YOU>>>>>.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort property with private beach and two pools!!”
Reviews.Author: dschneider601
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in an ocean view king room in mid-April. We were on the 3rd floor, so the palm trees were at eye level and blocked some of our view, but still a very nice view and worth the upgrade to ocean front. The room was a bit smaller than expected but very clean and well appointed with a cloud for a bed and luxury bedding that included a light-weight down comforter and duvet cover and lots of soft pillows. A flat panel TV, coffee/espresso/tea machine and soft robes in the closet were nice touches. The only thing missing for me was a safe which I like to have in hotel rooms for my jewelry and other valuables. The resort grounds were absolutely beautiful and well maintained. The large private beach and two pools are why we chose to stay at Casa Marina, and we were not disappointed. The poolside service was excellent, the food was good and the prices were reasonable (I think it was $14 for a big chicken ceasar salad, which is what I would expect to pay at home in the Annapolis area). Poolside staff passed out FREE frozen frappuccino and popsicles everyday!!! We kept our car in the self-park lot for $15 a day and took a cab to Mallory Square in the evening, at $9-10. I'd recommend The Grand Cafe on Duvall St. for dinner followed by a must stop at Sloppy Joe's Saloon. There is bike rental available at the resort. One morning we took bikes all over KW, went to Southernmost Point, Butterfly Conservatory, Hemingway House, Audubon House, and then stopped to have brunch at Blue Heaven. Louie's Backyard was completely booked up while we were there, so I'd recommend making your reservation a week or two in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Found! Couldn't have been nicer!”
Reviews.Author: kjs1019
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina is just what the "doctor" ordered. Complete indulgence, gorgeous property inside and out, impeccable beachside service. I truly felt pampered. The price is a bit steep, but we wanted a stress free indulgent trip and that's just what we got. Thomas, a beach attendant, was the best! He will treat you like royalty!

Reviews.Title: “Best Poolside and Beach Consierge Ever”
Reviews.Author: funrun130
Reviews.Content: Mark and Tom and their staff were just unbelievable....always there to help.....running to set up or take down lounges so all patrons could enjoy the pool or the beach. Their service was superb and they were the nicest people ever, always looking to please. I heard each of them say on several different occasions when a patron was trying to set up their own umbrella, or move their lounges..."Let us do that...this is your vacation and your time to relax and enjoy...and that we did. There wasn't anything they would not help you with. An absolute pleasure!

Reviews.Title: “A mixing bowl of resort comfort and the eccentric personality of Key West”
Reviews.Author: mor5304
Reviews.Content: First class accommodation, full of history, modernized for today's resort traveler, but not loosing sight on the service reputation of the brand. We have had the opportunity over the years to spend time in some beautiful resorts in the Carribean, Mexico, Hawaii, and continental US, but Casa Marina provides white sand, well appointed pools, the blue/green Atlantic, lots of resort amenities, water activities, a fun family stay...all within an easy walk or bike to great dining, rubbing elbows with the locals, people watching the diverse cultures that visited, eclectic shopping tinged with adult entertainment, more history, albeit a seedier history, and glorious sunsets. And yet, at the end of the day, you can come back to the serenity of the Casa Marina. Yes, we had a wonderful experience and this, even though we stayed in one of only three rooms in the entire complex that overlooked the ocean BUT had no balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach service!”
Reviews.Author: BrendaBloomsburg_pa
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 days here in February and found the service to be MUCH better than 2 years ago. Mark on the beach was incredible and deserves a raise!!! He was very helpful and went above and beyond our needs. Liko (not sure if that is spelled correctly) WAS WONDERFUL also-- We'll be returning next year!!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: WORLDTRAVELER239
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is a great resort. The staff goes out of their way to serve. We were welcomed with a tour of the resort so we could get oriented. The grounds are well manicured. The rooms are average with updated fixtures. All water sports can be accessed on site. There are two large heated pools. The prices for food and drink are outrageous. You will pay $4 for a coffee and $4 for a soda. Beer averages $6. Our first meal was 2 burgers and 2 beers and it cost us $60. Food was tasty but not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great all around resort”
Reviews.Author: camlb
Reviews.Content: The staff , food and premises were exceptional. John and Heather gave us the best massages, ever. Mark, Adam and Jon attended to our every need at the pool and on the beach-setting up chairs every morning with umbrellas, provided cool towels, lotion, popsicles, spritzing, hustling to make us happy and comfortable. Patrick and Julie were the best servers at the restaurant, with smiles and laughter always. Patrick at the front desk is also an avid fisherman and helped my kids learn and enjoy the art of fishing. Lizelle planned out our itinerary and was fantastic as our concierge. Tom was the most fun at the watersports and we had a blast on his jet ski tour around the island. Louie's Backyard is a must for lunch or dinner if you go off resort. Many others made this a memorable trip-we highly recommend Casa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “Kid Friendly Casa Marina...single travelers be forewarned”
Reviews.Author: Carlton_Tampa
Reviews.Content: Looking for a relaxing resort on Key West? Don't choose the Casa Marina. I was looking for a nice resort to relax. Thinking price would keep away the rif raff. My bad, this is an excuse for rich parents to let their spoiled children to run all over the resort. Even many of the pool staff and bartenders were fed up. Instead I sat in pools with screaming kids and floatees. Very disappointing. Although the resort did move me to thei sister property, "The Reach," by then it was a little too late (Sunday thru Tuesdays are quiet in key west). Kudos to Brandon and Jeanette for honoring my request to escape kid ville. I met a great bartender, Candice, at a great restaurant on Duval, the old town mexican grill. She said the Pier House is the place to stay for adults. However, I'm not planning a trip to Key West anytime soon. If you have been to Bourbon street, Vegas, you have done Duval. A bunch of college kids getting drunk on their bachelor / bachelorette party. Key West is a day drip at best or cruise stop for a day.

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly , restful and the guest service was outstanding !Matt was the man !”
Reviews.Author: debigirlontario
Reviews.Content: The place goes out of its way to make you feel very special . The poolside service , and beach service everyday by the "BOYS :" was bar none. If want to go away and feel like you are being spoiled , this is your place to be. We , my husband , and brother and sister in law had gone last year , and were anxious to return this year , but stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: AspenMN
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina resort was great, we had a very nice time. The staff were very friendly and the grounds were spectacular. There were two separate pools and an outdoor bar and restaurant. The fitness center was also one of the nicest I have ever seen at a hotel. There were a couple of negatives though. First, the room was a bit small for the price. Second, they say that they have a beach, but it is actually mainly rocky at the water's edge, so it is not easy to go into the ocean. If you get a chance to stay here, we would highly recommend doing the Jet Ski tour around the island. It lasts for 90 minutes and you go about 27 miles around the island with a tour guide. It was a blast. We would also recommend checking out the mechanical bull at Cowboy Bills on Duvall street if you are looking for a good time. We would definitely recommend the Casa Marina to anyone looking for a nice resort experience in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Every bit as beautiful as a Caribbean resort”
Reviews.Author: Vagabond052
Reviews.Content: A perfect Gals' Getaway! Service was top notch, even though there was a wedding going on during our stay. Our first room in the main building was huge with a city view. After the wedding, we moved to an oceanview room. Although it was smaller, it had a beautiful view of the resort and beach. Working in the travel industry, I visit many resorts and this one is up there near the top. The history of the resort is fascinating and we even saw a ghost tour in the lobby looking for the celebrities' ghosts of days gone by. The pool was lean & relaxing, the food was great and the beach snorkeling was nice with lots of fish near the piers. Special kudos to Evelyn on the front desk who arranged our move without our lifting a finger, Lisa at the pool bar, Nigel the night bellman and Darrin, our wonderful server at the pool restaurant. Be sure to do the wine tasting with the yummy cheeses & fruits. When I go to Key West, I usually stay in town but this is my new favorite resort. Thanks to everyone who made our stay so special.

Reviews.Title: “Matt from Barefoot Billy's provided excellent service”
Reviews.Author: McRacken
Reviews.Content: Matt went out of his way to provide us with amazing services and did everything in his power to get us the best snorkeling trip possible. Matt also found out that we had just gotten married and offered us a bottle of champagne. Service like this will definitely make me come back to key west and also stay at casa marina on our next adventure. Thanks Matt for the hospitality! McRacken room 216

Reviews.Title: “Key West Gem”
Reviews.Author: DJFoodieDallas
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four days at the hotel and had a very relaxing enjoyable time. We were upgraded to a room with a balcony which made the stay even better - thank you Hilton. The rooms are rather small but very comfortable. The highlight was the time spent at the pool being pampered by the wonderful staff - love the popsicles and frozen cloths - very refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “GROUNDS NICE - POOLS LOVELY - ROOM NOT SO MUCH”
Reviews.Author: trudysmom666
Reviews.Content: I must say I was a little disappointed. This was one of the original Hotels in Key West & it was bought & refurbished about 3 yrs ago. Why didn't they furnish it & design it with some original character ? It looks like any other Hilton. The bathroom was no bigger than your average Motel bathroom. I may be spoiled from staying in Ritz Carltons but I think if you want your Hotel to be a "Luxury" property you definitely have to have amenities ! The grounds are quite nice. The Pool's (2) & grounds are quite lovely. The outdoor Bar & Restaurant are also nice. Staff is very accomodating. Location wise you really have to take taxi's or the Trolley to get to Duval Street & Mallory Square & most reataurants. I stayed at the Hyatt my last stay in Key West & it was a mush better location for walking to everything. Also, Housekeeping at the Casa Marina needs to be trained how to clean a little better .

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: DPFVACA
Reviews.Content: The resort is fantastic...service excellent, food great, pool amazing, and beach the best in Key West. Every minute there is something that makes you feel special...free popsicles at noon, cool washcloths at the pool spiked with eucalyptus, drink of the day etc. The BEST part is that Barefoot Billy's is at the corner of the resort. If you want to parasail, jet ski tour, etc...no need to do anything but walk. Matt from Barefoot Billy's took us on a jet ski tour on day one...he was great. Made the kids feel special and they laughed the entire time. Well worth the dough...we have done all inclusives, cruises etc..will be back!!!! Rooms are great, food very good...a bit of a walk to Duval but if relaxation and pampering is what you need...the CASA MARINA and BAREFOOT BILLY'S is it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort, top notch staff!!”
Reviews.Author: nycbabs123
Reviews.Content: Great vacation, awesome staff!! We loved Jon the pool boy!! Not to mention Robyn, Jan and Lisa the bartenders. They sure know how to take care of their guests, so professional yet FUN!! Thank you Jon, Robyn, Jan and Lisa for making our vacation one to remember!!! See you next year when we return to the Casa Marina!!! Barb and Bryan

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking and friendly total environment for my daughter's wedding!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler34153
Reviews.Content: My daughter was married along the Beach at the Casa Marina Resort in Key West and what an incredible experience. The view of both the Hotel as well as the ocean was stunning. Guests commented it was the most beautiful wedding they ever attended! The Spanish architecture of the Hotel combined with the gorgeous coastline made it a most unique setting. Catering and events Manager led by Ronnie Rupe, a most personable guy, made the coordination of the weekend lots of fun. His Assistant Arme Torremania was most helpful in the logistics and organization. The food was very good and service was first class from the Front Desk down to the beach boys, Niko and Zack, and the Beach Manager, who was most helpful with where to go and enjoy Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious resort”
Reviews.Author: johnwthomas313
Reviews.Content: The facility is of " Superior Waldorf " quality. The staff is exceptional , especially Evelyn Summer , Anne , Cliff , Jonathon , Ozzie , Jan , Daniella , Felicia , Katarina . Just go there and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Boys Niko and Zack”
Reviews.Author: bird033
Reviews.Content: We were visiting for a wedding and spent much time on the beach. Niko and Zack made sure we were comfortable, in the shade (what we prefered), had plenty of dry towels and stopped by, often enough, to ask if they could do anything more for us. They contributed to our very memorable visit at your resort. We couldn't have been made to feel more comfortable or welcomed. Jean and Jim

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in the beach was amazing, I loved that spot!”
Reviews.Author: Bubba9898
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing time at the Casa marina. Loved the service from Graham and Adam at the pool and beach getting out the chairs and towels, that great! Also the frozen towels are my favorite. Everyone at the hotel was nice and helpful, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Another fabulous stay at Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: LynneF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from another fantastic stay at the Casa Marina. The resort is wonderful from the front desk staff (Patrick) and the staff that does so much to insure each guest has a great stay. I have two minor complaints. There were too many small children at the resort, which put a damper on enjoying adult time around the pool. This is a dog friendly resort. I dont recall this from our last stay, but there were alot of people with dogs. I have 3 dogs of my own, and dont think dogs should be allowed at a luxury resort. Otherwise, I highly recommend this resort. Only minor complaints, but can be bothersome if you are looking for solace from children and animals.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty, accommodation, and service at its best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sebastianpr
Reviews.Content: My second time staying at the Casa Marina and they did not disappoint me. The rooms are beautifully appointed and with spectacular views. The housekeeping staff always were prompt and thorough in assuring my room was maintained in such high standards as anyone would want and expect. I especially want to mention the special treatment I received from Jon and Matt from Beach Service and Robin and Jan from the Bar. They all went above and beyond their duties to make my stay at the Casa Marina enjoyable and special. I am looking forward to returning their next year and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “In love with Key West”
Reviews.Author: maggiemay7
Reviews.Content: What a fabulous trip we had for my husband's birthday & our anniversary. Key West is a wonderful place to visit and the Casa Marina Resort is in a terrific location with grounds that are absolutely beautiful. The rooms are a bit on the small side, but very clean and comfortable. We had a very nice ocean front room with a balcony and we really enjoyed it. The only complaint I would have is that by the 2nd night, the mattress does get a bit uncomfortable - definitely time for new ones. What really made this stay special though was the outstanding services of Don the Concierge and the beach attendants Mark and Matt. Every recommendation Don made for restaurants was fabulous and he made my husband's birthday & our anniversary a very special day indeed (grazie mille Don!). The beach service is so nice with cold drinks and fruit being served (may I suggest frozen grapes would be a nice touch). Again, staying at the Casa Marina Resort made our trip to Key West all the more special.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: givemeabeachtowell
Reviews.Content: When you arrive, make reservations for a massage on the beach and dinner on the pier or the beach. Those fill up. Check out the yoga on the fishing pier with Graziella--it was truly wonderful. We LOVED the spa offerings, including massages in the "tiki hut" and facials. The spa staff is wonderful and talented. Food and service at dinner was fabulous. Kudos to Julie and to Jose. Beautiful beach--we liked it better than the beaches at the 2 all-inclusive resorts we went to in Mexico. Just a great setting. The hotel is a great contrast to the wildness of Duvall Street. Went on two friends' recommendation. Glad we did.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place!!!”
Reviews.Author: notpicky1
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina has to be, in my opinon, the greatest place on earth!! The service was second to none and the jet ski tour with Kris, Kelly and Matt was a fabulous way to see the island. I recommend it to anyone who wants to see the island from a different perspective. Two thumbs up!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: NewportGuyNewportRI
Reviews.Content: Our annual trip to the Casa Marina was perfect as usual! We are in the hospitality business and recognize all the hard work and attention to detail the Casa and it's employees make to pamper their guests. Jon, in pool services, is an asset to the core team! Towels, popsicles, sample drinks of the day are small little touches that make our stay great each year. The lunch menu seems to get healthier (a good thing ) each season although this 40 yr old can't resist an occasional order of chicken fingers !! Keep up the good work and we'll see you in November!!

Reviews.Title: “Will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: indyfan21
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at this beautiful resort - loved the open spaces (lobby, grounds), pools, beach, food, other amenities, and the staff! We wanted a sun-filled, fun-filled, relaxing vacation - and we got our wish here! Looking forward to coming back in the future. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets!”
Reviews.Author: Bluefinguy
Reviews.Content: Having never been to Key West before we had no idea what to expect with the hotel and the town. From the moment we arrived we experienced an attentive, engaging, and smiling staff who worked to assure that everything about our stay was perfect. Special mention must be made of Brandon and Evelyn at the front desk, Jena in foodservice, and the pool/beach guys Jason, Graham, and Zack. There is no question we plan on returning to this hotel again and will recommend it to anyone seeking a great time at a beautiful property with an outstanding staff.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous beach service”
Reviews.Author: KG1110
Reviews.Content: Just gotta say jon and zack are great. They made our day on the beach great. Chairs, towels, drinks of the day, popsickles, trash pick up!!! We will be looking for them next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!! Everyone was so Friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: JJellison65
Reviews.Content: What a Beautiful place to stay, we spent the majority of our afternoons at the outdoor bar over looking the ocean. Our bartenders Suzanne,Nate and Darin were Phenomenal and in our opinion Top Notch! Customer service wasway above average. Thanks guys for making our first trip to Key West extremely rememberable.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Property with spectacular service”
Reviews.Author: DrewBacon37
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough nice things about the quality of this resort. They do it right with a smile. Check out the concierge staff for obsessive attention to detail. There is nothing close on Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Will come back again !”
Reviews.Author: CyndiHOO
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest places i have ever stayed ! Comfortable beds and pillows . Maids on time and friendly . VERY helpful staff ! The best food ever ! Hammocks by the sea for relaxing . 2 Great pools . On site reservations for excursions on the sea . Walk to duval st .

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value for the price and oh so beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: Kojo63
Reviews.Content: The price is right for what this gorgeous hotel has to offer. The only reason I didn't give it a 5 is because I reserved a king size bed and received 2 full size beds instead. I was offered the opportunity to move to a king size on day 2 of my stay but at that point it didn't seem worth it because we were only staying for 3 days. Sleep quality compromised because of that. But now on to the positives.....the place is breathtaking at all times of the day and night. You really need to spend at least one day just at the hotel pool. From the minute you enter the area you are treated like royalty from the concierge staff. They will set up your chairs, put your towels down, get you an umbrella, bring you complimentary drinks of the day and fruit infused ice water, popsicles, and my all time favorite indulgence...a frozen washcloth sprayed with eucalyptus oil at about 2pm when you're just starting to feel you've had enough for the day. There is also chair service for cocktails and food and whatever else you can imagine....games for the kids, wipes for their sticky fingers, etc. The entire staff will go to whatever level you need them to to make your day the best you've experienced. I highly recommend dinner at the Strip House too (their sister hotel's restaurant). Food and service there impeccable. Casa Marina will be the only place I stay when visiting the Keys in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “breathtaking, great service, amazing food, all around thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: wendywew
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of going to Casa Marina for a 3 days with my two sisters for a girl's get away. This place is gorgeous,the view, private beaches, the pools and decks, the amazing food, coctails, and one of the best breakfast buffets I have ever seen are reason enough to stay. But the staff is really what makes it so special. Robin the bartender was so fun, and warm and really made us feel welcome. Patrick the beach server was a blast, and such charisma. Matt and Thomas with the bike rentals and towels had a beaming smile no matter how hot it was, and Suzanne the bartender,and Deanne our waitress were also friendly and kind. The resort is gorgeous, but is is the staff that make it so special. Thank you !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfull place to spend your get away!”
Reviews.Author: kinetic365
Reviews.Content: Beautiful resort many amenities. Exceptional beach services provided by Mark, Jason and Graham. Friendly, informative individuals and attentive. Served, drink mix of the day, (also order your drink of choice), popsicles, cool off towels, cool down fans and personality! You can stay on the beach all day, tan swim, lay in a hammock even play volleyball.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Banana427
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel! It was relaxing and historic. Even though my boyfriend and I are younger we enjoyed the family aspect and still got to party a little! I recommend this resort for any age!

Reviews.Title: “Great property but way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I've been to the Casa before but this is probably my last. The property including the pool and beach are very nice but at the end of the day it's just not worth it. The rooms are really basic, we stayed at a Courtyard in Miami on the trip down and the room was better (and 1/4 the price). The cab rides to and from dinner got old. The front desk staff couldn't smile to save their life. The drinks at the pool bar were good but small for the price. I stay at a lot of Hiltons so kind of expected some kind of upgrade, not here though, they could care less. If you're not dropping a ton of cash on a wedding they don't seem to care (and ive seen that that go bad too, make sure you're in top of ten if you're getting married here). House keeping is slow and loud in the morning. Guys at beach are awesome. I want to love this place but just not worth the money, they have a lock on best beach property in KW and they don't seem to care about too much else. If you stay here at male sure you get the best room you can afford b/c the basic rooms are a let down especially for the price)

Reviews.Title: “Great Facility - Poor Staff”
Reviews.Author: CDOYB
Reviews.Content: The location and facility is first-class. Our room was very nice and the view was exceptional. So far, worth the almost $500/night. The outside staff was a different story. Not rude or difficult, just not really...there. We spent most of our time by the beach (beautiful). In 2.5 days of being 25ft from the waitresses, we were offered a cocktail exactly ONCE. The cabana boys were prompt, helpful and fun. Try to get a meal or drink from a table poolside/beachside and you'd die of thirst and/or hunger. The servers were nice, just SOOOOOO slow. At one meal (lunch) it took 1 hour and 15 minutes to get our meal. This may sound trivial but when you have 3 days on the beach, all I really wanted was to lay on the beach and have a bunch of drinks.
