I figured at this price (both room and food/beverage) We'd get great service and we could relax; not so.

Reviews.Title: “Mark & Beach Staff....”
Reviews.Author: gregmarf
Reviews.Content: If you love to be pampered.. these are your fellas!.. Attentive, fast and friendly!..: frozen eucalyptus towels, cucumber slices, rose scented aloe lotion.. water with fruit, ice pops.. all offered while you relax.. . what a special staff and attention to detail KUDOS!! Hotel 2 pools had many little children, however the beach was quieter. so- (family friendly, couples or friends) . Brought extra items to room promptly. Room service was also fast. One problem was the A/C not so great especially for the people sleeping in the loft room.. very warm and humid.

Reviews.Title: “Good thing for Mark on the Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Rooftop3
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel and property. We felt as if we were back in the roaring 20's.. There were four of us down for girlfriends birthday. We had booked the room well in advance, however it seems as if the staff is not familiar with their rooms. We had asked for a certain type of room, and even confirmed this upon check in. We were told there were two balconies, and that we would have two beds in one room. We had one balcony, and the bellman said there are no rooms with two balconies... two beds? Not in the loft....Not a very good first impression. When booking room we had also spoken to Allison (concierge) about getting birthday balloons, and booking a snorkel trip. NOne of the above were taken care of, and we had even left Allison three messages. Luckily I arrived before the birthday girl, and a different woman (Liz) was so helpful, and corrected what Allison did not do. After we got over these glitches, everything was really great. If it were not for Mark on the beach, we probably would not be back. The service on the beach was incredible, better than any Ritz, or other property I have stayed at. He thought of everything we needed- chilled cucumbers for our party eyes from Duvall Street, cold eucalytptus towels (frozen) , even came around with aloe lotion and spray misters! I had lost an earing in the water, and he even found a way to try to retreive it without me having to get off my lounge chair. Mark made us feel like the spoiled queens that we are- and believe me, that is hard to accomplish!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation in Paradise"”
Reviews.Author: mee070
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful trip, and the highlight was the incredible beach service provided by Mark, Graham, and Jason. They were VERY attentive and made the experience delightful!!

Reviews.Title: “Kris Waggoner/ jetski guide”
Reviews.Author: LeeHayden
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed Everything about the CASA MARINA. Especially the Tour with Kris Waggoner and the Jet Skis... Made us FEEL Extra Special.. Loved the SUNSUN the pools, the beach... thanks CASA... WE WILL RECOMMEND "U" and "KRIS" for a tour of the ISLAND.......

Reviews.Title: “the most over-priced hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: grahamcares
Reviews.Content: Seriously, plastic cutlery at the poolside bar, an incredible lack of detail to service (e.g. come back to your room to find the newspaper on the balcony floor, the hotel supplied bathrobe on a chair). It gets worse. The same poolside bar: we sat there for 15 minutes watching staff clean up after dinner and were not approached by a single staff person, not to say 'go sit at the bar', 'we are not serving here now', NOTHING. Ok, so they want to go home, I get it. But what about the customers paying an exhorbitant rate for what? The New York Times. One exception, the pool jockeys, actually on the ball. As for the rest? Waldorf and Astoria are both spinning in their graves.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Bartenders and Staff at Sun Sun Beachside Bar”
Reviews.Author: Nicoleb30
Reviews.Content: Nothing beats the fantastic Ocean view and killer cocktails mixed up by Robin and Jan in the afternoon and Suzanne and Nate in the evening at the Sun Sun bar. The bartenders are top notch professionals that aim to please; which enhances the pampered vibe of this first rate hotel bar. Suzanne always has the perfect drink suggestion to compliment your palate and mood! Order dinner at the bar and enjoy the fabulous food while watching the sunset. It does not get any better than this...

Reviews.Title: “Great resort! away from Duval tourists”
Reviews.Author: led5k
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect if its not too expensive for you. Beach is beautiful (some rocks like all Key West) but docks were great and water cool and pretty. Pools very nice. Food good. Hotel was full but didnt feel overcrowded. We stayed in old historic rooms w balcony-they were fantastic- large, beds v comfortable, balcony enormous. Any activity if you want. We loved it was away from touristy section abd Duval St.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: lawstar1
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff was friendly, informative and prompt. Room was nice, beds a little small (but when aren't they unless your in a king!) The beach lay out and pools were awesome. Best we've been too. Pool side restaurant was great. Pool staff (Jason Lynn, Graham Geaghegan, Zack Tressler and Jon) was amazing with towels, finding chairs, serving water, fruit, drink of the day samples and popcicles...all for free:) Only complaint, size of bar drinks along with the price.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect spot for a relaxing stay in Key West.”
Reviews.Author: CUtiger09
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed every minute of our stay at Casa Marina. The property is absolutely beautiful. The location is great - a 10 minute walk to Duval means you're insulated from the madness, but close enough to walk to it if you choose. The staff was friendly and helpful, and we had a nice, clean room with an ocean view. The pools and beach weren't crowded, even though we stayed during peak season. We really enjoyed a jet-ski tour of the island that we took with Kris at from the resort - he was a great guide!

Reviews.Title: “Because of Mark Gray...We'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: nckeysgirl
Reviews.Content: We travel quite a bit and always stay at a Marriott as their service and properties are simply the best. We were quite pleasantly surprised, however, when we went to the pool. We have never experienced the level of service that we received from Mark and his staff! He was the most courteous, attentive, professional employee we have ever come across. He knew what we needed before we even knew ourselves. Anything we asked about, from great local restaurants to activities around town, Mark and his staff knew. As long as Mark Gray is at the Casa, we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous seaside resort”
Reviews.Author: SusieFromKS
Reviews.Content: Great relaxing by the ocean. The pool service was one of the best we have experienced. Mark, Graham, and Jason went out of their way to make us feel pampered. We would highly recommend this resort to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Your money goes towards the best pool and view on the island!”
Reviews.Author: ldemaio
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I just got back from a week at the Casa Marina Waldorf. After reading some of the reviews, we were hesitant to stay here however our week was amazing. We thought the location away from Duval was perfect. The island is small enough that you could bike/taxi/walk downtown but the Casa Marina was secluded enough to make you feel like you are at a resort. The hotel is situated on the beach with access to any water sport, boat, or beach activity you'd like and is within walking distance of Louie's Backyard (our favorite dinner spot). I will agree the rooms are not what you expect for the money you are spending however with 80 degree weather, two pools, a bar, and a beach, you don't spend time in your room anyway! In addition, the service at the pool was superb. The rooms were just fine, if you are the type of person who wants to have a luxurious room than perhaps this isn't the place for you BUT if you want a week of being pampered in the sun, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great property and beach location”
Reviews.Author: rj3rj3
Reviews.Content: The cabana staff featuring Jason, Graham and Patrick will take great care of you while you catch the rays. Very, very attentive to your every need.

Reviews.Title: “A confounding conundrum of a property... good with the bad?”
Reviews.Author: fryfrye
Reviews.Content: I now understand the wildly varying reviews in this forum. The Casa Marina is a property that has it all -- and thats not always a good thing. First lets start with the location -- its a decent but not great location -- the sister property "The Reach" seems to have a much better location for quick walks off property to eat and explore. The views from the lobby to the pools and beach is nearly perfect at the Casa. The Casa Marina has two pretty decent sized pools -- and while the property was a capacity during our stay, the pool areas were full but not crowded as most people did a pretty good job of spreading around the property. A word of caution about the beach -- it is a coral and grass beach which means that for the most part if you want to swim in the ocean you need to use the pier that is built out over the coral to get to deeper water to swim. This is the only real downside about the beach and had we known this (or had a done a better job reading the reviews) I would have stayed at "The Reach" Onto the rooms. We were upgraded to an ocean view suite in the main (read older) building. We had a corner room with an ocean "view' (the palm trees at the Casa are mature and tall -- so they obstruct some of the view). The room was large with wooden floors -- and more than a little dirty. Now that we travel with a toddler its a little more important to have clean floors :-) We asked and the housekeeping staff cleaned the floors again and we didn't have to ever ask again. No problems with towels and such. The Carpets in the main building are a little worn -- but at a hotel that sits on the beach with no foot wash coming off the sand -- dirty worn carpet will happen. I'd like to see them take some time to re-think the furniture in these rooms... luckily the suite had more floor space but in a regular room it looked cramped. The service was either fantastic (front desk, concierge, H20 concierge) or HORRIBLE (Sun Sun wait staff, breakfast wait staff) since we were traveling with our little guy, we decided to eat our Breakfast and Lunch on property (we don't normally do this at hotels). Once you get past the fact that you are going to be robbed (which is the norm at most hotel settings) you at least hope that your going to 1) get good service or 2) get good food On both accounts the Casa pretty much failed us. Waits for food (after ordering) were sometimes as long as an hour -- once it took me 60 minutes just to pay the bill -- yeah the thought crossed my mind too -- just leave. Breakfast buffet is average -- but drinks are handled by the wait staff -- getting an OJ or water refill was nearly impossible. I admit that my wife and I are spoiled by our stays at truly high-end properties where they get 99% of everything right 99% of the time. The Casa was a big miss for us and I should have heeded the reviews here and stayed elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Service Extrordinaire!”
Reviews.Author: funoneBrantford
Reviews.Content: Just want to say that Zack Tressler provided superior service and looked after my every need. Despite the heat and crowds he worked non stop to make sure we were happy as well as the other guests. I highly recommend Zack Tressler on Beach as an exceptional employee of the Casa Marina

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Proporty and Outstanding Service.”
Reviews.Author: RogerFromBrazil
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Casa Marina on a 3 day break. Propoerty is beautiful and the staff wen out of their way to accomodate our every need. This will be my home away from home in Key West. Defininitely reccomend it to anyone going there.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: providencemelis
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is beautiful - the grounds, the pools, the beach...I don't feel it is worth the amount of money they charge.You are quite far from Duval St. and the main action (some people like that), and they do not offer shuttles to Duval as some of the other hotels do (Marriott) - you have to cab it everytime. Also, the day we were there, someone pooped in the pool (we later found out it was an adult) and they had to close down the pool for the rest of the afternoon. In my opinion, that is totally disgusting and all the guests using that pool should have been comped for drinks that day. I do disagree with some of the reviews on here - our experiences with hotel staff were very positive. Overall, I was not impressed with this hotel and would not recommend it to friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Thank-you Matt who works on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: mbrowne4477
Reviews.Content: I am writing to give a big thank-you to one of the hotel's beach employees, Matt, who really went above and beyond to help our family on our recent stay in Key West. Being from snowy Wisconsin, we wanted to squeeze everything warm and tropical from our 5 day stay in sunny Florida, including a swim in the ocean. When ouur youngest daughter cut the bottom of her foot on a piece of sharp coral, Matt was a tremendous help, getting first aid supplies from his own backpack and helped stop the bleeding, clean out her cut, and wrap it up using Neosporin, Band-aids, and a protective ace-bandage-like wrap to keep her cut clean. As a mother, I usually have these supplies on hand, but I did not have any of them handy in our beach bag - Matt was pleasant and kind to our entire family, and he did an amazing job of taking care of her foot injury as well! I thank Matt so much for not letting a cut to the foot get in the way of enjoying our experience at your fantastic hotel, and I congratulate you for having people like him on your staff to take care of unexpected things like this in such an efficient and friendly manner!! We hope to be back next year! Thanks again

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility. Most of the staff is sub-par.”
Reviews.Author: YourNextGuest
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful historic hotel located right on the beach in Key West. The views are gorgeous, the facility is nice, but many of the staff were pretty bad. We were given a room that was not cleaned. We had to wait for 2 hours for the room to be prepared for us, but when we were told it was ready, we went to the room and found that the only thing ready about the room was the bed. The bed had been made, but there were dirty linens left in the room. There was trash left from the previous guest and there was half eaten food still in the room. The poolside service was very slow and got our order wrong literally half the time. Finally we decided to go get our own food and drinks since the bartenders were good and some of the restaurant staff were helpful as well. I guess I just expected more from a Waldorf Astoria Resort. Considering all the options available on Key West, I won't be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “We had a wonderful time at the Casa Marina!”
Reviews.Author: JAM4764
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay in Key West at the Casa Marina.It is a beautiful property located away from the busy area of Key West.They have the best beach in Key West.Wonderful work-out area, too. Our room was very nice and clean.Jenny Mirand was very helpful on the phone with us before arrival, because of a mix-up in our reservation.She handled everything beautifully! We had wonderful service, especially on the beach, from Matt and Jon and the rest of the guys! Ann was also very helpful with our questions about restaurants. We will definitely choose the Casa Marina when we return to Key West! Thank you again, to all the staff at the Casa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “Delectable spring break”
Reviews.Author: maggiedo1
Reviews.Content: This is our third year in Key West and also our third time at Casa Marina. Had a terrible experience at their sister resort the REACH the first week there and secured a room at Casa as soon as we could. Small room, but well appointed with a gorgeous large deck and amazing view of the pools and ocean. The service we received from all of the staff was wonderful and many we remembered. The Sun Sun oasis and bar by the pools is the best. We were warmly greeted by Jan, Lisa, and Robin and made to feel like returning family. They are charming, helpful, hard-working, funny and feel like old friends. Many thanks ladies for your kidness. Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Expensive. Limited eating options on site.”
Reviews.Author: jimskibum
Reviews.Content: Excellent service by Patrick and Qinn at Sun Sun restaurant and Zack Treyball of the beach boys. Food was good, but expensive with limited dining on site. Nice rooms. Great pools.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view,wonderful food and people”
Reviews.Author: julie4040
Reviews.Content: we came here for a convention,the staff were wonderful,good food,Matt and Jon the pool and beach guys were great!! The beds in the hotel were so soft you melted with comfort every night.The halls of the hotel were made up of some beautiful hardwoods. I would recommend this hotel to everyone for that special vacation or looking for a second honeymoon

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf it is not, reviews below spot on...”
Reviews.Author: Aimeed2011
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably beautiful grounds, there is no question about it. Service with a smile, probably not. My guess is that everyone who works here goes out and gets hammered every night and they are trying to work through a massive hangover while surviving the workday. They will get your creamer, but they won't be thrilled to do it. Maybe some voice inflection to indicate concern over assisting you with something else? I highly doubt it. A monotone, can I get you anything else? Is really more of the Lurch tone from the Addams family. The housekeeping is astoundingly poor: sometimes I get a bathroom rug and other days they take it. I'm not sure what they do with it, give it to someone else for awhile, or maybe I left too many towels on the floor and now I am penalized. I actually sat in the room while it was being cleaned when the housekeeper said she had no more pillowcases....my response? You can get more, right? She said she wasn't sure. I asked her to check, and voilÃ , they had more. I have had an empty Kleenex box for 3 days. They actually left a plate of food, that was clearly done being consumed, and penalized me by giving me no washcloths...I still have the bath rug today, not sure what gives there. Outside of the room, the biggest pet peeve would have to be the lack of communication between each department. I studied Waldorf in school for Hospitality business and this property goes against every standard they have. There are 2 exceptions, the beach/pool staff and the valet staff. They were all quite helpful. Do not ask anyone outside where you can go/who you can talk to to get a spa appointment...they don't know, nor will they help you find the answer. The grounds almost makeup for the rest since it is so beautiful. If you can let the service roll off your back and you spend very little time in your room, then it is kinda worth it....for less money. Oh, and I write this from my beautiful view of the ocean, as I don't checkout until tomorrow

Reviews.Title: “Not up to Waldorf Astoria expectations or standards”
Reviews.Author: Emeran
Reviews.Content: Prior to this stay in Key West we have enjoyed two great experiences at Waldorfs. To say this 3 day stay was a disappointment would be a gross understatement. Here are some of the issues we experienced: 1. Being a Diamond member we did not get any of the room enhancements e.g. water, treats etc. 2. Room was located on the north side of the old complex and did not get any sun. Weather was in the upper 40s in the evening and the hotel did not have any heat. We had to go outside to get warm. We were provided with extra blankets when complained about the temperature. 3. The hall carpets were in need of shampooing. Also they were not vacuumed daily as we had a Cherios outside our room for 3 days. 4. We repeatedly asked for an upgraded room but none were made available to us. 5. The room itself was minimal at best and not worth the price paid wether in $$ or 60,000 HHonors points per night. On a previous visit we stayed at the Hilton Garden nearby and had a very delightful experience. 6. Overall this hotel does not provide the value for the price and certainly does not represent the Waldorf brand. We tried to check into alternate accommodations but none were available due to spring break. 7. On check out we expressed our disappointment with our stay. Not a word in response. I definitely would not recommend this hotel as there are better alternatives in Key West even in the Hilton chain at reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Best Pool and Beach Service in Florida!”
Reviews.Author: blnorris
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a warm and wonderful week in the Florida Keys - stayed at the Casa Marina Resort. The beach looked like the best in Key West, and the pools were wonderful. Matt and Jon always made us feel comfortable, very friendly and knowledgeable about the local sites, restaurants, etc. Chef Drew went above and beyond one day by making homemade chicken noodle soup for my daughter when she was sick one day - she says it was the best soup she ever tasted! Patrick, Andrea and Lisa always provided service with a smile. We had a room in one of the older parts of the resort. The room was fine although decor was a bit sparse, and carpet in the hallways definitely needs to be replaced. The food was very good and the location within walking distance from all the fun on Duval Street. Would definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation in Key West”
Reviews.Author: rhamilton955
Reviews.Content: I booked our spring break vacation to the Casa Marina Resort this year. Reading the reviews made me a little apprehensive as there were a lot of really good and really bad reviews out there. Here is my take. The hotel location and grounds are outstanding! IMO, this is the best property on the island. Absolutely gorgeous. The pool and the beach area are outstanding and I thought the staff was really good. The 2 Zacks and Niko were attentive and engaging . The only negative is that the pools were not heated...They were a little on the chilly side for early March. We had a basic island view room which was fine. A little on the small side but nicely appointed. Service was good, not great. Housekeeping was good, not great. My biggest complaint was that room service dishes were in the hallway from late at night until mid afternoon the next day. Maybe this is a little ticky tack but it is something that shouldn't happen at a nice resort. The workout room was really good.. nice equipment and very clean. This is a really good resort. However, this is not a 4 seasons, ritz carlton, or the Breakers kind of hotel. It is really a Key West resort... kind of casual but very nice. While on the island this trip we spent time at the Hyatt and Westin on the other side of the island... I can't speak to the rooms but there is no comparison to the Casa in the grounds and overall feel of the resort. It is pricey, especially during the season. However, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stars are falling........”
Reviews.Author: Bobbetto
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 days at Casa Marina in March 2011. When we arrive the first comment was: this resort will get 5 stars in the Tripadvisor review! The suite (ocean view) was quite huge, while the layout is "bizarre": small room in the bottom of the suite, long corridor, living area very huge, with old-looking sofas, some ants in the room (not a big issue), bathroom so so (please consider that this is a Waldorf Astoria!). Second comment: maybe the rate of Tripadvisor review will be 4! However the pools area and the beach, as weel the lobby are gorgeous, I would say the best in Key West. The service on the beach was very, very good. Breakfast was one of the best,in term of quality, variety, assortement, location;just the service was quite slow and vague. Main issue of the suite are the noises: the wall are paper thin and you can hear the people on the hallway or in the side rooms: Sorry this is not accetable in such hotel Third comment: rate in TP will be 3! Second day about at 3 PM I had to chase a chamber maid for the houskeeping of the room; they forgot to do that! Same day I discovered that while the WIFI is free (!!!) in the room and ground areas, to use the business center and to print, you have to pay! Please take alook at other hotel of the same chain (e.g. Hampton Inn) where the a complete business center is free. Fourth comment: sorry guys, the rate will be 2!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, exceptional beach staff, mediocre in most other aspects”
Reviews.Author: TomskiOh
Reviews.Content: This property is bipolar with some pluses and a lot of minues, Let's start with the minuses and there are many. It began when we checked in. We were given what I imagine is one of the worst, if not the worst room in the hotel- number 183 I believe. It had unmuffled Harley Davison motorcycle parking next to the window and shared a wall with the pool's women's restroom. I shudder to think what room we would have been given without my Diamond status.... The property needs a lot of work, both physical and mental. The hall carpet needs to be replaced; the shower curtain in our room was moldy; the tv was tiny and ancient. There was a major disconnect between between the front desk staff and the housekeepers on several issues. On most days room service "remains" were visible throughout the hotel for hours. Curiously, although the room had stationary, it did not have either a pen or pad for notes! The pluses- The location is great. We did not rent a car and walked everywhere. It was an easy 30 minute walk to the end of Duval and Simonton. Next, Mark and his staff at the pool and beach were phenomenal! Jon, Matt and the two Zacks provided excellent,personalized customer service. These guys are an great source of local info and we found their advice on point. We dined at Salute, El Siboney, Louies, Alonzo's and The Conch Republic based on their insights. This team is a gem and would be the only reason we might return. The team working at breakfast was also good. They had their lapses- coffee grounds poured into cups etc but were friendly and accomodating. All in all, this property has along way to go to justify being called a Waldorf. It looked like the tired Wyndam it was before, Not a very good show.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and great service!”
Reviews.Author: jayme89
Reviews.Content: The service guys at the beach were great! Mark was fantastic at making sure we were taken care of. Zack Tressler, Zack Treyball, and Chance were all great, too! We had such a wonderful experience!!

Reviews.Title: “"Sun Goddess Vacation"”
Reviews.Author: nashville1967
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to Casa Marina now for six years and never have been treated better than this trip. Mark who is out at the beach side service is at the top of his game, he misses nothing that we need! I would also like to mention if you need any help at the beach area to ask for Chance, Zack 1 & 2 and Thomas 1 & 2 for anything. They treated us so well and we will definately be back for the summer!!!

Reviews.Title: “Average property”
Reviews.Author: Skean53
Reviews.Content: While a nice property in KW, for the money and name it is definitely AVERAGE! Pool area is very comfortable. Rooms aren't that great size wise and bathrooms are fair. Friendly staff - very helpful. If I had it to do over, I'd likely stay in a nice B+B......

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina / BarefootBilly's the best”
Reviews.Author: NewHartfordCt_Bigboy
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in Key West every winter for a week since 1989. This hotel is one of the best, if not the best in Key West. Th rooms, grounds, housekeeping were great. The hidden jewel here is Mark and his staff from BarefootBilly's, in the pool area/watersports. these guys go the extra mile for you. Service like none other. Just to say AWESOME, is really not enough! These guys are the best! al from ct

Reviews.Title: “Best Pool Service”
Reviews.Author: cymruuk
Reviews.Content: Arrived with special need for wheel chair, Uniform Services Manager met us , checked us in, wheeled me around hotel with guided tour before taking us to our rooms, he has very knowledgable and helpfull, great start to our stay. The main person to make our stay so memorable was Mark at the H2O pool staff. He went out of his way to make us comfortable, he made us feel like royalty and every day attended to all our needs. He was a valuable assett and wealth of knowledge on Key West. Every restaurant he recommended was first class and he gave us so many usefull tips to make our stay so special. Thanks Mark and his team for a job well done.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: ABush13
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful week of rest and relaxation at the Casa Marina. Jon and Matt's beach service was phenomenal! They were very accommodating and very knowledgeable of the island. They made wonderful recommendations and turned a great vacation into an unforgettable one!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Casa”
Reviews.Author: URJUBILEE
Reviews.Content: Every time I stay there I'm spoiled and unable to imagine staying anywhere else. Beautiful and breath taking,

Reviews.Title: “This place is Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: laurie642522
Reviews.Content: Zack at the beach was wonderful. We sat and he made sure we had everything we needed....with a smile. Your staff is incredible - made for a wonderful, relaxing stay. We are definatley coming back next year!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grounds, activities and service were perfect... but rooms were a major letdown :(”
Reviews.Author: jetsetcitygal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for a few days in early March. Let me start by saying that the pools, beaches and facilities were on point. The staff was friendly extremely friendly and helpful. We liked that the hotel wasn't right on the main drag (we stayed during spring break and are past our college days) so we had a reprieve from the madness that is Duval Street. You are definitely walking distance to Old Town which was nice but be aware that they do charge you to park at the hotel ($15/ day self park, $20/day for valet). The best part of our stay was our Waverunner Tour with Kris from Barefoot Billy's which is right on the grounds. He was FANTASTIC! This was one of the best parts about our stay at Casa Marina so if you stay there be sure not to miss it. If you mention the barefootbillys.com discount you will get $10 off too. The only downside to this hotel was that the rooms were a major letdown. For $400/night at a Waldorf Hotel you expect luxury and extravagance, but that is not how I would describe the wing of the hotel we stayed in. When you walk into the main lobby the rooms in that portion of the hotel look like they are really nice, but since that is not where our room was I can only assume. We had to hike around to a side wing of the hotel which is serviced by a separate elevator. The exterior looked like it needed a really good powerwashing and once we got to our actual room there was dingy carpeting that smelled musty in the hallway. Our room was decently clean looking, the beds were immaculate - which is the most important thing to me - but the furniture and fixtures looked like they had seen better days. The shower curtain was icky and needed to be replaced. We called and complained and they removed the resort tax for the first night (about $25) and offered to send up the housekeeping director. This was an improvement but still frustrating for the amount of $ we were paying to stay there. I cannot however reiterate how amazing the staff was at this hotel. Everyone was incredibly friendly and helpful. We particularly liked Joe from the bellhop service and Patrick from the pool bar. Everyone at barefoot billy's was really great too. All in all, the Casa Marina would have gotten an A+ in my book if it had been a $200/night hotel but since it was so costly, I can only give it a C-. If you are used to staying in luxury resorts, you will have to readjust your expectations or this is not the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Best Resort and Service”
Reviews.Author: Bjluther52
Reviews.Content: One word "AWESOME" Great location with a great private beach. Rooms a little small but very clean and fresh, besides who spends time in their room when you have such a beautiful resort to enjoy. The entire staff was very pleasant and went out of their way to speak when passing. Kathy was most helpful with GREAT recommendation and making reservations. Matthew and Jon at the beach are the BEST ever. Took care of our every need, had our towels and chairs set up every morning and check on us throughout the day even bringing fresh watermelon, fresh towels and anything else we needed. Beachside bar and restaurant were great. Dinner was wonderful and bar was a great spot to cool off and hang out at night. I recommend doing the SPA for a treat, get staff and environment. I first ever visit to Key West and already planning our return visit to the resort. Thanks Kevin and your entire staff for making this out BEST vacation EVER. See you soon.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the relaxation - son thought it awesome!”
Reviews.Author: travelrjn
Reviews.Content: It started out rocky, some problems with reservations, but then that got fixed and our long weekend started. We loved the room with the balcony, we enjoyed the breakfast, the concierge service was excellent and the Beach Service provided by Jon and Matt was probably the best we have ever received in our many travels. We had towels, drinks, our shade moved when needed and they even put our stuff under shelter when we went parasailing and it started to rain before we got back to the pool. The room was very clean, the fixtures and furniture were in great shape and the beach equipment was great. Make sure you schedule enough down time, we did not leave enough time for massages by the beach or snorkeling. Though downtown Key West was great and we REALLY ENJOYED the Truman Little White House tour. 2-50 yr olds, a 28 y old and a 12 yr old and we ALL GOT TO DO what we liked!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly resort”
Reviews.Author: Rita1003
Reviews.Content: The pool and private beach were top quality. Service was outstanding. We especially wanted to note how great Zack and Julian on the beach were in getting us set up in the right spot and checking in on us. The outdoor bar was well stocked and open late for some quiet time outside.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed and quiet getaway”
Reviews.Author: tarheelgirl8592
Reviews.Content: This hotel is lovely. It has been renovated; the lobby is very inviting with clean lines, dark stained wood floors and modern furniture. Our room was located in the main historical building on the second floor above the entrance (not an ocean view rooms), very quiet and spacious. We requested two beds, which were double beds and not as comfortable as a queen when you're sharing with a tall teenager. There were no drawers for storing your clothes, although there was a small dresser with the mini bar and safe that had a couple of shelves. The bathroom was very small - good for only one person at a time. Ours had a European shower - no tub, and open. The outdoors area is very nice with two pools, a variety of areas used for dining: two areas close to the front of the hotel for breakfast, and two areas beside the pools and beach for lunch and dinner. There are two nice sized pools, and a great beach with hammocks, beach games and plenty of attentive concierge staff to set up umbrellas and chaise lounges. The service is excellent. You pay a resort fee per day (which also includes wi-fi) so you do not have to sign a tab for beach chairs or towels, and the beach staff bring fresh fruit, flavored water and frozen treats throughout the day. There are many activities such as sailing, parasailing, bike rentals, snorkeling, diving, etc offered on the property and a sister property, The Reach, offered additional things like jet skis. We only stayed two nights, but wish we had stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “great potential”
Reviews.Author: surfside08
Reviews.Content: Hotel was immaculate, beds very comfortable, good food........overall service was terrible, we kept describing the staff as the nicest, most incompetent people ever. The one exception was the pool staff, they were fabulous and really fun. Matt, John, Deon and Jan worked their tails off wearing smiles on their faces. It's a shame because the hotel could be diamond but falls short due to the service.

Reviews.Title: “the best resort property in key west”
Reviews.Author: fbski4
Reviews.Content: The property is the best in key west. Staff very pleasant. The beach services people Mark, Jon and Matt are the best.of the best. Catered to our every and then some. Front desk very helpful. We plan on coming

Reviews.Title: “a gastronomic experience”
Reviews.Author: sab2359
Reviews.Content: MARK the pool concierge went above and beyond to make our vacation special , fetching water ,cooling spray downs, iced towels,cleaning sun glasses, .Then he would recommend a restaraunt to dine at, then he would make our reservations at the best tables ,every one was perfect , check them out, michaels,antonios,louies backyard,blue haven,salut'e,to name a few. the concierge team (zak) even organised a fishing trip . We enjoyed the trip so much we are going back next year. mark realy made it an awsome experience.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort”
Reviews.Author: bobsledcyc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the resort for three nights. The resort is at the same time refined and laid-back. Service was exceptional from check-in up to check-out. The location makes for easy walking to KW's sites. Rooms are a bit small but very nicely appointed and the balcony views are outstanding. The beach is nicely situated with plenty of shade from a grove of palms. Hammocks are available and make for a great place to relax. Breakfast was included with our room rate and was excellent every morning with a wide selection of fresh fruit, baked goods and fresh egg and griddle options. All around great stay that will bring us back.

Reviews.Title: “"Three Star Resort with Five Star Grounds"”
Reviews.Author: ChrystineConcord_NH
Reviews.Content: I approached my vacation at Casa Marina with trepidation based on all the mixed reviews I read. Our suite we booked was handicapped and quite asture to say the least. I figured we got the "handicap" suite since we used an online booking group. I didn't complain even though the bathroom was musty smelling because the suite was large and a number of reviews complained about size. The bellboy was very friendly. Breakfast was eaten outdoors overlooking the ocean. It's the view you're paying for definitely - just gorgeous. We had the breakfast buffet which was delicious and varied. The waitstaff was unexceptional though - a little slow and one girl even snapped at us when we asked about the status of our pancakes. I think they are interns for thte most part and still learning customer service. We didn't spend much time in the room or even on the beach or at the pool. We spent our time taking in all the sites of Key West. The one time my daughter asked someone to set up a chair and an umbrella for her (she's 16) she was told you have to make a reservation for that service. What??! With the money we paid for a resort fee?? We didn't eat lunch or dinner at the hotel. We did lay on the beach for an hour one afternoon. Matt was extremely accomodating - the only staff member who was notable. The concierges were helpful but as to be expected for a "five star hotel". Overall, the Casa Marina is nice. It's upscale and classy - no screaming , wild kids or barrage of explatives which I heard on the streets. If you're looking for a private beach with hammocks and lawn chair service, this is the place for you. I didn't swim because the water was too cold but the pools were clean and beautiful. The spa massage was mediocre and very expensive. The resort is a little pricy for me since I'm not a big pool or beach buff but the place is beautiful on the outside. It was relaxing and there were no wild guests which was my goal.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway Spot!”
Reviews.Author: ckcockcroft
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about our stay. The staff were excellent and very accommodating. The resort is beautiful and meticulously maintained. Our room was large and very contemporary and I loved the hardwood floors! The bar by the beach is great during the day and evening. One of my favorite things were the hammocks on the beach. We rented jet skiis and scooters right on the beach in front of the hotel. I would highly recommend the resort and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING in every respect !! WILL return again next Feb vaction!!”
Reviews.Author: fbent
Reviews.Content: I can not praising the service at Casa Marina , from Patrick and Ms. Summer who printed out legal affidavits for me at the Reservation desk to Matt and John poolside.They are the face of Casa Marina.As a business owner I can only hope my employees reflect the same graciousness, zest , and helpfull attitude be it 7:30am or 7:30pm. Their diligence in making people comfortable and feeling happy is a tribute both their personalities and training. In short, my wife and I have only 359 days till we return to our newfound friends!! Thanks for such a wonderful vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: DarlingJJ
Reviews.Content: It was a good hotel but I wont stay there again because its not convenience to go to downtown. We have to get taxi or pay money about car lot if we drive by ourselves. Waste of money! But if you just want to be relaxed, it will be a good place. Pool service is great. Compare to them, the food service was really bad. I ordered breakfast I asked room service but they were ignored. Finally I went to the restaurant but food wasnt enough. Breakfast is important for our health. Anyway have enjoyable your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, beautiful views, great beachside service from Zach”
Reviews.Author: lynndiana
Reviews.Content: What a great place, good food, beautiful views, and spotless rooms. Beachside service with Zach made for a great day at the beach

Reviews.Title: “I Love this Place!”
Reviews.Author: DSRH
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Casa for many years. Whenever I stay there I feel like it is my second home. I know much of the staff and they ALWAYS take care of me. It is a great place to stay in Key West. Yes it is on the south end of the island and that is where I want to be. Away from the noise of the North end. Key West is a "small place." I can get anywhere by scooter, car, or bike in minutes. This is the place to be. You will be treated very well and you will want to come back. I should also mention you should go to Anna's and have breakfast one day. It is just up the street. Spend an evening at Louie's Backyard two blocks away. Like I said...a great location, a good time. This is my home in Key West. Go see my friend Maria at the front desk. She is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful place to stay and use as a base to experience Key West”
Reviews.Author: hwardsmith
Reviews.Content: We had an absolutely terrific stay at Casa Marina. The resort is beautiful and the staff is wonderful. Every question is answered with, "Absolutely, no problem" or "Of course, I can get that for you." Everyone from the reception staff to the beach/pool guys to the housekeeping staff have your comfort and good time in mind. The beach, pools, and entire atmosphere is comfortable and relaxing. The resort's location is perfect for exploring Key West by foot or bike. We can't wait to go back to Casa Marina again!

Reviews.Title: “100% Lovely, Wonderful and Gorgeous.”
Reviews.Author: KeyWestGal44
Reviews.Content: This was by far the best hotel I have stayed in while visiting Key West. It is right on the beach and the view is spectacular from anywhere on the grounds. Just the hotel itself is a view, with itâ€™s 1920â€™s charm. From morning till night my partner and I felt like we were walking on air. Everyone goes out of their way to spoil you from our bellman Nigel to our activities planner Cathy. They make everything so easy. We snorkeled, rode jet skis and rented bikes, right out of the hotel. And let me just add that renting bikes is the best way to get around Key West, especially staying on this side of the island. We hopped on our bikes and were right in the heart of Duval Street in a matter of minutes and it was such a pleasurably ride. Electric cars and scooters are all fun, but bikes are the way to go. Cheap and easy to park anywhere and relaxing to ride with someone right next to you. Lounging by the pool or on the beach is wonderful and be sure and have a frozen mojito. We had breakfast one morning, which was nice and lunch one afternoon which I very much enjoyed. I had the blackened snapper sandwich, yummy. We also had dinner on the beach, which was nice because we were on the beach but the food was not the best we had that week at the wonderful restaurants of Key West. I would say, have a drink on the beach, maybe even lunch, but for dinner head elsewhere like Louieâ€™s Backyard, which is right next door or CafÃ© Marquesa which is amazing on Flemming St; five minute bike ride! Overall though, loved this hotel and cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Beach and Beach Staff”
Reviews.Author: illikrates
Reviews.Content: Our overall stay was very nice. The room was okay; it was clean and nice, but was small and you could hear everything that was going on in adjacent rooms. The beach and the beach staff made the trip for us. The beach was awesome, and Mark and the rest of the beach staff was amazing.....just ask them for dinner recommendations. The rest of the staff leaves a little room for improvement though.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking property with a few issues.”
Reviews.Author: SyracuseJulie
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week at Casa Marina. Oceanfront beach and pools are to die for but the rooms lack a bit. Bathroom is small and windowless. Beds are a bit dated and creaky. Check in was a problem as we requested adjoining rooms (and I called at least twice to confirm this) with a king and a double double, only to be told there was no king available and no adjoining rooms. We were given the option to move the next day to a room that had what I originally requested. Maria, the manager is very helpful as were Niko and Zack, who are Water Concierges. They'll arrange any water activity you could imagine as well as provide drinks, towels, or information about the area. The food at the hotel is very pricey and not as good as the local restaurants, which are in abundance. We tried to have breakfast twice at the Blue Heaven Restaurant (about a mile from the hotel) but didn't want to wait an hour and 1/2 for a table. Had wonderful Cuban food as well as amazing seafood at various places on the island. Ernest Hemingway House is a must do.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place to be”
Reviews.Author: danoli516
Reviews.Content: When you arive at the Casa Marina Hotel the tension just falls from your shoulders. The bell staff is always at the ready to help with your bags (particularly AJ) and the door to the beautiful lobby is opened for you, the first sign that you are entering paradise. The front desk staff could not be more helpful, particularly Patrick and Maria. On this arival we showed up a little early so the room was still occupied but the staff called us immediately upon the room being ready and we grabbed a little lunch while we waited. We hadn't even finished lunch when the room was ready. Any concern we had during our stay was promptly handled by the front desk staff and we were always welcomed with a smile and willingness to help. The grounds are magnificant, truly memorable. The walkway to the beach with the reflecting pools on each side show an elegance while not losing the tropical feel. Don at the concierge desk helped with his knowledge of the island and its trips, points of interest and restaurants. The two pools allow for a swim any time of the day or night and are maintained in a pristine manner. The guys on the beach (particlarly Matt and John) could not be more helpful, they remember where you want your chair and will have it waiting for you if you let them. Sample drinks, popsicles, cold towels and water sprays are offered during the day but the guys will get you water throughout the day as well. The views from the bar, the beach, the pool and the Island view rooms are magnificant and a sunset can be seen from most of the beach side of the property. Suzanne at the bar knows her wines and is very freindly. In addition to all these great things there is a killer health club available to guests with top notch cardio equipment and water sports and on the beach massage is available, all without leaving the property. The Casa, as everyone calls it, is a place that just makes you want to return, as I have done many times. In fact, it is calling me back as I write this.

Reviews.Title: “The pool is the best part of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: alibarbaraMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: Many others have already tipped you off on the bad service and lack of housekeeping, so why add more complaints? The service at the pool and beach outweigh all the cons. Yes, it's expensive. Yes, you expect more. But at least this is the best location on the whole island for a beautiful beach and pool. If you're coming for leisure and plan to spend the whole sunny day outdoors, this is the place. Everyone of the pool staff was so attentive- providing pool and beach toys to our kids, bringing drinks, ensuring we enjoyed our vacation. We loved that part of our stay. Thanks to all of them! I also have to give credit to the outstanding breakfast/dinner staff. We had several functions and they were the same people there waiting on us regardless of time of day. Pure dedication. They were quick to chase the seagulls from our plates when we ate outdoors and made sure the coffee was fresh.

Reviews.Title: “From the time you arrive at the hotel, the bell staff, front desk personnel are exceptional, professional and a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: parkee516
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina in key west is the only hotel that I stay at when I visit Key West. I usually visit 5 to 6 times per year. The reason I return there is their wonderful staff, the beautiful private beach. The gym is first class and the best hotel gym I have ever worked out in. Additionally, the staff makes me feel so welcome and at home each time that I am there.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: patrishColumbusOhio
Reviews.Content: casa marina resort is top-notch. we had a lovely room with a great view. the staff could not be nicer or more eager to insure a lovely time. the pool/beach service is wonderful....the staff is fabulous....mark, jon and zach go out of their way to insure a relaxed, fun experience. the only downside to our stay was an issue with hot water and water pressure in our room. the hot water was limited at best and the pressure came and went. maintenance visited our room once and the water temp improved but was still not consistent.

Reviews.Title: “A trip to HEAVEN ON EARTH”
Reviews.Author: MsDQueenMother
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina and what a stay. The room was not only above our expitations it was magnificent. The property was a tropical delight. We had dinner on the beach and the service was great. we did not have a reservation and it was busy and the manager was able to seat us within 15 mins. From the bellman, front desk to everyone on staff their attention was to service and customer satisfaction

Reviews.Title: “very very nice place to stay would come back again...”
Reviews.Author: jwhptoys
Reviews.Content: everyone was great on the staff inclouding zack tressler on the beach went out of his way to make sure we had a great time...

Reviews.Title: “Not as great a hotel”
Reviews.Author: silverdudie
Reviews.Content: You expect certain poshness w/Waldorf's name, and this hotel doesn't deliver. The suites are lovely, but the rooms (west wing) are too small and good luck in getting the housekeeping to clearn your room! Resort Fee is a great addition. No worries on calls to be made and the staff takes good care of you at the pool or the beach, but know that parking is not included in the fee.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort with pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Judarell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here because of my husband's company dinner which was nearby (thankfully we didn't have to pay the tab which was about 300 a night). The hotel boasts beautiful dark wood architecture, pristine and scenic outdoor area on the beach with great seaside dining. Lots of water-sport options. Peaceful, quiet. Breakfast buffet was really good!!! Didn't eat lunch or dinner here since there were so many other nice places nearby to dine at for much less $. Cons: no balcony in our room (rm 275), window sealed shut, thin walls, no bathtub,room looked too plain. Service was slow at breakfast restaurant "Sun Sun"...waitress barely acknowledged us and basically disappeared after seating us.

Reviews.Title: “Zack Tressler watched over us”
Reviews.Author: garbo02
Reviews.Content: Zack Tressler took care of us for our entire five day stay. From meeting us day one and getting us set up on the beach, he had chairs, towels, umbrellas and even his own binoculars at the ready when we arrived at the beach each day. He took care and went out of our way to see that we were comfortable. The binoculars were a great touch to observe the big boats sailing by. Kudos to Zack!

Reviews.Title: “May be 5 star but is really a 3 at best...”
Reviews.Author: FroggySmith
Reviews.Content: Ok, bofore I start to say anything negative, the location is beautiful. You can watch the sunset from outdoor bar area and eat breakfast looking at the ocean. If only my room had been clean!!! I stayed in a one bedroom Isle Vista Suite that I thought would look out on a courtyard. Well, if you sit in the doorway of the room you are doing just that. However the patio overlooks a street and parking lot. The room was dirty. Floor was gritty and stuff stuck to the bottom of my feet if I walked without slipppers. Oh yes slippers, they were supposed to be in room but were not. The sofa was stained and smelled. The maid replaced all the cushions covers. The handle in shower fell off and the toilet seat was so off that you ended up with one half of yourself on the bowl. The coffee machine did not and after reporting it, never got any response. A prior guest left underwear in a drawer and that took two calls before it was removed. I was in room 3009 for $407 a night. Few staff bright spots.Mark took care of us at poolside and was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very average”
Reviews.Author: AlwaysAcadian
Reviews.Content: I'm really ambivalent about this hotel. It's beautiful with well appointed rooms. The layout of the hotel is awkward, some rooms have entrances off of exterior hallways. The rooms are small. We are traveling with two tween aged kids. This was not a particularly friendly place for them. The hotel was fairly stuffy, the concierge wasn't very friendly nor were the restaurant staff. Overall, this hotel just didn't have an identity. It felt like it was stitched together from parts. The restaurants had no casual dining with a casual menu. The adult menu was mostly formal meals while the kids menu was chicken fingers and standard fare. The wait staff wasn't very flexible. Breakfast was the same. The whole family felt like this was a flat experience. We are now in Key Largo at a Hampton Inn. The first thing the kids said was that this was a more spacious room that had better amenities. In all, we expect more from a Waldorf branded hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dont judge a book by it's cover. Nice grounds and exterior”
Reviews.Author: CharlesSenne
Reviews.Content: Let me start out with the fact I stay over 120 nights per year on the road and my wife also travels the same amount of nights, so I feel we have other properties to compare.(yes both Diamond member's) First the positives. The grounds of the property are fantastic and the jet ski trip around the island organized by hotel was great. Now let me list a few of the things that all seemed little at the time, but added up during the week. 1. I had sent e-mail prior to our arrival advising of an early arrival, when we arrived the room was not ready. This was ok because we needed lunch. We ate at the pool bar and waited for the room, over the next few hours we went back to the desk to inquire and were told they would call when the room was ready. Finally after returning to the desk we were advised the room was ready. (the NEXT day a message was left on my phone advising me that my room was ready) 2. Arrival to the room found minimal space for storage, no dressers so if you want to hang everything or live out of a suitcase this will not be an issue. 3. Issue with the toilet overflowing once and also running with a slow drip that lasted the week was corrected by keeping bathroom door closed. We were told by hotel staff that some of the toilets since the remodel have had issues they cannot figure out the cause. 4. Water and shampoo were not stocked daily and at one point we called down for replacement shampoo which arrived one hour later, water was requested one evening at 10:00PM and arrived at 1115AM the next day. 5. In accurate billing of room charges is still in the progress of correction. If you like tennis the PUBLIC courts are a one minute walk from entrance. If you want to rent a scooter for the week, as we did use a local company A&M charges were about 200.00 per week versus 80.00 per day at hotel. The Casa Marina just missed on what we expected from a Waldorf property. There were very little diamond privliges as seen at other hotels. ie: Breakfast coupons. Executive lounge. Diamond check in with staff willing to pass along property information. Even a request for late checkout or access to shower prior to leaving for airport was denied due to no spa or fitness center with shower's. Turn down service was hit and miss maybe 50% and some of the times a treat was left sometimes not. We had one room from 2/3/2011-2/10/2011 and one room with friends from 2/4/2011-2/7/2011. Fortunately we only had to use 660,000 Hilton points for the stay

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful location with service and amenities to match.”
Reviews.Author: esinedmorr
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at the Casa and we plan to go back. The location is absolutely beautiful, on the quiet side of the Key. The amenities and service are terrific. Two complaints - Small bathroom made inconvenient and even smaller by door placement. And acoustics - we stayed in historic section of hotel, the noise from room above has been bothersome both years. This might not be the case in new sections of facility.

Reviews.Title: “Key west rocks and the casa marina is the beat that supports the whole groove.”
Reviews.Author: jsamz
Reviews.Content: The casa marina is a great relaxing time. The beach guys are great and the top notch service provided by zack tressler out on yhe beach was top notch. He took care of us like we were friends of his. Provided great ideas to enhance our stay. Love the whole place.

Reviews.Title: “Mark saves the day”
Reviews.Author: Venicefever
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like the hotel. Physically it is absolutely gorgeous, located on a beautiful beach,two swimming pools and a beach staff that doesn't go the extra mile, it goes about 3 miles. But, we made two moves to get the right room. When we arrived the room we requested was not available. This was at 5pm. At 11pm two rooms later(both unacceptable), my original request was granted and I had a large choice of rooms. Don't get it. The rooms are quirky, with no bureaus and one of the rooms had the closet in the bathroom. There were several complaints about dirty rooms altho ours was not. Many of us noted the showers flooded the bathroom, including our room. But sitting on the balcony and watching the sunset made it worthwhile. Only ate one breakfast at the hotel and chose the buffet. It was fine and I thought reasonably priced. I found the wait staff to be on Caribbean time. Getting coffee at breakfast a challenge. The bar was beautifully located but I had a difficult time getting a drink. Not just one night but every night. But then along comes Mark and the beach staff. Literally perfection. They were always there to help you and make the hotel look like the luxury hotel it was supposed to be. Not only were they there with popsicles, frozen towels, drinks and water sprays but they constantly watched the pool to take care of all needs. Mark discovered it was my wife's birthday. After determining my wife enjoyed the recognition of her birthday, Mark alerted everyone at the pool there would be a rendition of Happy Birthday. Mark slipped a balloon on her carry bag and then led the singing. he put balloons on her chair and bought her a round of drinks. In short they made her feel special (which she is). They heard people say "i wish..." and they went out of their way to do it. If the entire staff was like the beach staff I could recommend the hotel, even with their flawed rooms, but at their prices I just can't do it. Can't wait to return to Key west but unless the prices are less, it will be elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “3-star service, food, and rooms at 5-star prices.”
Reviews.Author: ChromeAce
Reviews.Content: This is supposed to be a Waldorf-Astoria hotel, the crowns of the Hilton family. But the valet ignored us for 5 minutes after pulling up and got out our own bags. The "Island View" room overlooked rooftops and parking lots. A/C worked well. Dinner faire was mediocre and poolside drink service was unattentive. I waited an hour for a 2nd piÃ±a colada. The $25 breakfast brunch had no fresh juice or any special dishes like Eggs Benedict... very basic. The private beach setting is very nice and quiet. The rooms, not so much. We were awakened by noises of suitcases running over floor bumps and an ice machine right outside our door. Would not recommend at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “I'd love to give them another chance...beautiful vista and property.”
Reviews.Author: ChickyLaD
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival the property wows...grand architecture and perfect beachfront setting entrance. Our room was overlooking the sand and that went a long way to overcooming the quirks we experienced. Elegantly renovated to chic standards, there is a lovely style standard being upkept, however, in our suite there was a strong and lingering musty odor that was not "freshened" until the day we departed and it did detract. Food service was average for a hotel of this category. We did some outdoor dining and were quite cold due to the failure of the staff to keep adequate space heaters running continuously. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet and the snack bar and found the food nicely prepared. The waiters were a little slower than one would hope, displaying a little too much "island time" mentality. This was a girls retreat weekend, and OVERALL, we had an amazing time. The highlights were certainly to be found on the sand. Especially HIGH MARKS to the towel attendants, Jon & Matthew. These awesome gentlemen were not only helpful, gracious and gregarious, they were able to overcome what some of their counterparts overlooked. Matthew went the extra mile by climbing a tree to raise a fallen hammock for one of us, while Jon chased away gulls and generally entertained us at every turn. There can be a fine line between overly solicitous even flirtatious attention, but these guys were purely and genuinely friendly without agenda. They made our two days of beach time fun, lively and memorable as well as comfortable. We enjoyed the free tastings offered as "Drink of the Day" but later found the bar service on the beach to be erratic at best. Concierge went the extra mile to get us great reservations at a local restaurant in town. Maid service was wholly unpredictable and had to be managed, which is not something we had expected at such a highly rated resort. We unfoturnately had occasion to interact with the Security Staff, and while the incident was unsettling, loud, violent argument between men in a nearby room, we found the Security Team to be of the utmost in professionalism and courtesy and they calmed our fears to mild trepidation. Sadly, there was no way around the disrupted sleep and that was a precious commodity for these moms on vacation from obligations for whom beauty rest is golden. Would we try again...? Certainly. The managment is trying hard, but they still have a few strides to click into perfect symmetry. We wish them success. It is a lovely place to put ones toes into the sand and lose the worries of the day in a sunset while siipping champagne.

Reviews.Title: “Great property for a business meeting”
Reviews.Author: Julia105
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at Casa Marina. Our room was adequate with a great view of the beach. I thought it odd there were no drawers for clothing. We didn't mind there was no restaurant per se. Also thought it strange the lovely bar was never open in the evening. I had a great massage, again it was odd they are just using a suite for these services. The business center was tiny and not airconditioned. Fitness Center was great. The beach was the best. Zack and Will showered us with attention. Loved the frozen towels and drink service!

Reviews.Title: “I loved every single minute of my stay”
Reviews.Author: Caroldel
Reviews.Content: The pool attendents were amazing. I felt totally pampered by Mark, Jon, Matt, and David. Everyone who worked at the hotel was so friendly and nice. The rooms were small and nothing special but we spent little time in it. We were having too much fun at the pool, beach, and in town. The watersport and bike rental place on the property was super friendly. We had a blast with the bikes and jet skis. The pool area could use a pool table or ping pong table, giant checkers set etc to go next to the pool. That would be fun for the kids and adults!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed not Waldort Astoria quality”
Reviews.Author: Badiedog46
Reviews.Content: Marketed as a room with an island view. The view was of the parking lot. No dresser in the room to unpack clothes. Only a pocket door on the bathroom which afforded little or no privacy. Room oddly shaped so one could barely see the television from the bed. Outside amenities were far better than the rooms. Food at the place was average at best and very expensive. Spa did not have a complete line of services and when I went to make an appointment I was sent to a hotel room with a sign that message in progress.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect vacation in a lovely hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mlu982
Reviews.Content: Last night we returned home from five days in Key West, and I highly recommend the Casa Marina Resort to anyone who is looking for a spectacular vacation in a truly beautiful location. After we booked our reservations at Casa Marina I read several reviews (on this website) of the hotel, a few of which were less than positive. However, having read those reviews made me pay particular attention to the condition of the hotel, the cleanliness of our room, the service provided by the staff, etc.. I am writing my own review to emphasize that my husband and I could not have been more impressed with the Casa marina. We got to the hotel a bit early on our arrival date, and the staff quickly made sure that they found us an ocean view room, as we had been promised. The room was in excellent condition, extremely clean and well-appointed, and we had a lovely view of the pool area and the beach. Immediately after our arrival one of the staff came to our room, checking to make sure that everything was satisfactory, which it definitely was. Later on, before dinner, I was trying to check out the available in-room movies. I noticed that there was a problem accessing them. On our way to dinner I mentioned to a staff member at the front desk about the problem. A little while later, when we returned to our room, there were already two technicians there addressing the issue. They couldn't have been nicer! They even helped me to get on-line with my laptop. We ate breakfast and lunch at the hotel several times. Our food was very well prepared, and the service was great. In addition, the service at the pool and on the beach was amazing! Daily complimentary drinks of the day, ice water, and popsicles, as well as anything else we asked for were delivered to our chairs almost immediately. The entire bar / pool / beach area staff was fabulous, especially Matthew and Jon, who were absolutely terrific. Thanks so much, you two! I also need to mention that during our stay every single member of the Casa Marina staff we dealt with was extremely professional, personable, and anxious to provide excellent service. Needless to say, my husband and I can't wait to return to the Casa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “NOT what you would expect from a Waldorf hotel. Customer service lacking...”
Reviews.Author: honeymooners3032
Reviews.Content: With the exception of Tom, Nick, and Evelyn (which I will provide details of their outstanding customer service), the customer service and sense of urgency were extremely lacking. My husband and I absolutely love Key West...we got engaged there 4 years ago and decided to take a second honeymoon back to the island. My husband did quite a bit a research and since we are Gold VIP Hilton Honors members - we ended up at the Casa Marina Waldorf Astoria. We had put in our request for an ocean front upon booking and also reminded them when we checked in. Once we got into the room, we quickly realized that we actually had a view of the roof and giant fans directly outside each of our windows. We called down to the front desk and let them know that this is not what we had requested and to change our room...this was at 2pm on Day 1. I had to call back 3xâ€™s times to find out if they were able to find us another room. Maria (the hotel Manager) finally told us that there was no way they could move our room until the next morning. She asked me to call at that time for an update. We were a little disappointed, but we thought it would be worth the wait. The next morning, I called at 9am and they did not have a room for us. I called again at noon and then again at 3pm - nothing. It was not until 5pm that they were able to find another room for us. We had dinner reservations at 6pm, so we were in a rush to get ready. As soon as we moved rooms, my husband jumped in the shower to start getting ready. Within 10 minutes, I noticed water gushing out of the bathroom door into the main area of the room. The drain was backing up and our room was flooding. I quickly called the front desk and they waited about an hour to transfer us to another room - needless to say we cancelled our dinner reservations. Our vacation was half over and this was the 3rd room we had visited. This room, which was on the 3rd floor, had an extremely loud fan that was almost directly over the bed. It pretty much kept us up all night! We did not want to change rooms again, so we just dealt with it. We got up the next morning and decided to go over to Barefoot Billy's (which is the water activities part of the Casa Marina) â€“ the first person that we met was Nick. He was extremely knowledgeable about each activity and gave us some great suggestions on what we should do that day. He sold us on the 27-mile wave-runner tour of the Keys with Tom. Both Nick and Tom were extremely personable and professional - you could tell that they truly enjoy what they do! On the wave-runners - Tom gave us a remarkable tour with very detailed information on the history of the island and the surrounding areas - we felt like locals when we were finished! On our final day there â€“ they had recommended renting bikes and gave us some great ideas on where to go for breakfast. My husband and I are both in sales/management and great customer service is a top priority. They both exceeded our expectations â€“ BTW, they do work off of tips â€“ so we made sure that we showed our appreciation. Right before we left, we wanted to let the manager of the hotel know that we were disappointed in the overall service, with the exception of the water activities teamâ€¦.Evelyn, the manager on duty, assisted us. I told her about our VERY negative experience with the rooms, she was helpful and patient with making sure we left on a good note. I appreciated the way that she handled the situation; I just wish that there was a greater sense of urgency from Maria (the other manager) early on. It probably would have helped out a great deal. Needless to say, we will not be staying at the Casa Marina next time we visit Key Westâ€¦although, if we are close by, we may stop by and rent bikes or jet skis from Nick and Tomâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Laidback tropical paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: Technog0at
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of our two-week road trip of Florida. Having worn ourselves out in Orlando in the first week followed by some serious mileage through the Everglades we were looking forward to a few days to relax. Key West did not disappoint!! We loved the drive across the Overseas Highway with the amazing ocean views from our convertible and the hotel was easy to find with plenty of parking available on a lot opposite. The hotel, lobby & it's grounds are amazing with great character - the style reminded me a little of the Ahwahnee in Yosemite perhaps reflecting the era of construction. The pool area is beautiful with a grand facade leading to the white sandy tropical beach complete with palm trees & hammocks. There is a pretty pier extending into the sea - perfect for watching the famous Key West sunset! Our room had been nicely modernised - I liked the Nespresso machine so much I am now the proud owner of a similar model. It was clean & comfortable - more than meeting our needs for the stay. We thought the location was great - it is a fair walk to Mallory square & you have to travel the full length of Duval street to get there but we found this pleasant stroll to be a great way to soak up the laidback atmosphere of the place. They are also on a stop for the trolley bus tour which makes a fun introduction. We loved our stay in Key West - there is loads to do & see. The restaurants were great & we ate some fabulous seafood around the Marina - typically followed by a slice of the delicious Key Lime Pie. Of course the famous Mallory square is a must for the daily sunset party. Unfortunately, throughout our trip the weather had conspired to cheat us of a full senset - each evening a cloud would drift from the horizon blocking the last few rays of the sun. As luck would have it, on our final day we took the Jolly II Rover schooner sunset sail & were rewarded with a flawless romantic sunset. Having had such an amazing trip this seemed the perfect time to propose so I made my declarations on bended knee to my unsuspecting partner. Happily she said yes! What more can I say? Our trip round Florida was fantastic for many reasons & we look forward to returning to Key West on many occasions in the future. We will of course be staying at the Casa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “General customer service”
Reviews.Author: jvferrara
Reviews.Content: Mark at the beach was great and very helpful and did a great job for the 10 days we were there. We tried to get a massage and talked to the Italian person in charge and as per ;our conversation we were to call her which we did on Thursday and left a message to call us back and never got her call. I left my number two times to make sure she received it but no call and we did not pursue? The Pier straight off of the hotel needs the nails on the boards hit down before someone gets a nail in their foot. THe pigeons are terrible, You need to have some wind socks around the beach on small wire poles and also around the outside eating area? They attached us on the first day. We were not anxious to each out again. You are looking a lot of revenue. Betty in Coffee/gift show was lovely and very helpful. Patrick at check in was very helpful and accommodating .

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, as long as you don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: QTravelers
Reviews.Content: We wanted a luxury vacation, so booked the suite. Big mistake. Even though recently renovated, furniture were really dirty. Balcony was small and the bedroom was swamped with ants. After alot of efforts to convince the front desk, we moved to the king vista room. The room was beautiful, with a great big balcony and fantastic views. However, dirt was everywhere. ants on the coffee table, dust stuck to the walls, and cigarette remains on the balcony. Also, showers don't seem renovated at all. We still enjoyed the pool, restaurant and bar, the really comfy bed, and of course, the gorgeous views... But in terms of maintenance, cleanliness and service, not quite what you'd expect from a Waldorf Astoria.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: sunshine32261
Reviews.Content: A former travel agent and having travel extensively I would consider myself a good judge of hotels and there services. Myself and my extended family, including 4 teenagers had the pleasure to stay at the Casa Marina over New Years. The property is beautiful and relaxing. It is one of the few properties in Key West to be located on a sandy beach. The property is located about a 15-20 minute walk from Duval Street where all the restraurants and shops are located. The property offers 2 pools and located in the middle of both pools are a restraurant and bar. The conceraige Don made many wonderful recomendations for dinner and water sport activities. Fin was our favorite restraurant! If you get a chance stop by for a spectacular "tapas" dinner. Another favorite for breakfast was Sara Beth's (try their homemade juice). We used the fitness center (located across the street). The facility was huge and offered plenty of equipment with no wait, fresh towels and water. We also ate breakfast (buffet) outside and lunch outside at the hotel both were excellant, wait service was very accommodating. Water, samples of the drink of the day and popsicles where brought around the beach and pool daily. The popsicles where a welcome sight midday (a great way to cool off)! The property was just beautiful worth the Waldolf Astoria distinction. My whole family enjoyed our stay and can not wait to come back to this hotel!! Great staff, great property!

Reviews.Title: “Real nice, clean place...pretty pricy.”
Reviews.Author: Whatever033
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our stay here. The beach is nice and clean...and very safe. If you don't mind a bit of a walk, you can get to Duval in about 10 minutes but Sloppy Joes will take about 25 or 30.
