Its an interesting walk getting back late at night and it never seemed unsafe...maybe a litte dark in places. A couple hints; if you like music in your room, you'll need an IPod. No CD player and radio reception is week. Keep windows and doors closed with AC on. Floor get slippery from humidity. The staff is very accomodating and friendly. We needed to leave our luggage a few hours after checking out and that was no problem. I recommend the Jet Ski tour...they ran right off the beach and run about 1 1/2 hours around Key West and a few other islands...about $65/person....oh and there's a great Cuban restaurant about 4-5 blocks on Margaret called El Saboney...Like most of Key West, more good food and fun staff and not so much flashy facility. Back to Casa...excellent workout facility but a little hard to find. Its in a building across the street that doesn't look like it is part of the resort. No one ever there...kinda strange but excellent equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon!!! :)”
Reviews.Author: swarren87
Reviews.Content: We absolutely the best honeymoon spot. The hotel staff was helpful and willing to show us the best places to eat. They upgraded our room as soon as we arrived. The rooms were spacious and had all the amenities we could have asked for. We loved the 2 pools, drinks by the pool at noon, the chair service & of course the hammocks :) We would highly recommend everyone stay at the Casa Marina. :) Within walking distance we could walk to great eateries such as El Sib :) Great neighorhood and water sports :)

Reviews.Title: “Just seems to get better”
Reviews.Author: BMSAJAC
Reviews.Content: There may be nicer locations than Key West in November but I haven't been there. This was our sixth meeting at Casa Marina and it just seems to get better every stay. The property is beautiful, the check in and wait staff cater to every need and the event\catering folks are the best and easy to work with. We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service And Super Location”
Reviews.Author: coachvance
Reviews.Content: Everything at Casa Marina is good. Service is EXCELLANT. Drink of the day, popcicles, lunch on the beach AWESOME. MARK on the beach was a great help to our family. Try the Jet-Ski tour its a little expensive but it is an well worth it, the sights are incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Non-existent Service from a non-caring staff”
Reviews.Author: Earl5152
Reviews.Content: I've never written a review of anything before, but my stay at the Casa Marina in Key West was so bad that I had to write something. First, the positive. A good looking hotel complex right on the ocean, & the room we got overlooked the ocean as promised. That was it. The negatives. The carpet in the the hallway smelled of vomit, the room had a desk lamp that was broken, and there was only one robe. Housekeeping staff could not understand English. No in-house sit-down restaraunt! They only provided meals from a kitchen located somewhere in the back of the hotel. Forget getting a meal or drinks around the pool either; the service out there was horrible. I was at the pool for 45 minutes before anyone came by. No pool towels available when I was there either. Normally, I could let some of these things slide, but when they want to charge you a $25 "resort fee" on top of their room rates, then that's when I draw the line. I got them to take off the resort fee from my bill, but I am still waiting for the hotel manager to call me, per my request. There are so many other properties in Key West at more reasonable rates; this place is a rip-off, in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “I love this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: deborah2
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here many times over the years...since the 1980's, before and after the renovation, and we have ALWAYS had an absolutely WONDERFUL time!! It doesn't matter that there is no restaurant because there are so many great places to eat in Key West. I can't wait to go back next year!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Facilities However Could Improve Rooms”
Reviews.Author: cmh001
Reviews.Content: The location and grounds and top notch and can hang with many Ritz or Four Seasons. The service was good however we didn't utilize many property amenities so can't give too much feedback on service either way. Our room was good however the bathroom was poor relative to other resorts in this price range. Furthermore, our shower was not clean and when we asked to have it cleaned, we were told that the dirt was permanently embedded in the grout and could not be removed without redoing the shower. Not a huge deal, however at this price level you expect more. i do like the historic feel to the property.

Reviews.Title: “Save your money and go to another hotel. The service was very poor and not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: mshroyer
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by say over the years I have used the trip advisor to pick hotels all over the world. Up to nown I have been very pleased. The service at Casa Marina was very poor and not worth the cost. The hallway to our room smelled like wet dog. The room was average but not worth the $ 350 per night cost. I could never figure out what the $ 25 per night resort fee was for since it only consisted of access to the pool and beach. The light on our desk was broken and we only had one robe. Several hours after checking in, we had a knock at our door. It was a staff member who spoke no English. We had to get an interpreter to figure out what he wanted. The next day, we decided to get lunch by the pool. We sat at a table for 30 minutes and no one stopped at our table, so we left. We went to sit by the pool but there were no towels. We had to go into the lobby and track down the manager to get a pool towel. I went up to the bar after sitting by the pool for 45 minutes with no service. I was served a flat diet coke and ice tea for $6. I would like to say this is the end of our bad service but I'm still in the hotel with one more day to go.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service”
Reviews.Author: postrawb
Reviews.Content: This trip was for my family and when we checked in they put us in a room that we did not ask for. We had reserved a room with a large balcony but instead the balcony was tiny. We had paid extra for this but the front desk could have cared less. Also the breakfast service was terrible and the front desk and room cleaning was horrible. This was like staying at a red roof in at Waldorf prices. The bar and beach staff was very good and the only reason we did not leave early. I am even a diamond member of Hilton and got this type of service.

Reviews.Title: “Resting on its laurels”
Reviews.Author: kukiman
Reviews.Content: We were guests from 12-23-10 to 1-1 -11, in a one bedroom ocean front suite. At $679 a night plus tax and a $25 a day resort fee, we expected a little more. Love Key West! Love the Casa Marina! We are 30 year visitors to KW and multiple time visitors to the Casa. However, I would expect the couch in my suite to not have stains on it, and I would expect the maids to at least give a cursory sweep of the floors, and PLEASE buy some new towels. Those scratcy, threadbare things you are offering would not make the cut for the rag bag at the wino shelter!

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation experience of my life. I've never been pampered so well!”
Reviews.Author: raebella
Reviews.Content: Typically photographs of a hotel online do not ever compare to the real thing. More often than not, reality leaves us wanting in comparison to the marketing online. However, in the case of the Casa Marina in Key West, the pictures could not begin to do the hotel justice. This magnificent jewel is unquestionably exquisite. The beauty of the hotel, the quality of its beaches, and most importantly the top-notch staff is beyond reproach. There was not a single unpleasant person on staff. They were quick to take care of our needs, knew our names and even knew our circumstances. I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone considering a stay in Key West. Five star all the way! My children are 12 and 15, so they enjoyed the water sports associated with the hotel also including the two awesome pools. The activities lined up for the kids (and adults) were incredible and made us feel so special. If you plan on doing water sports while vacationing at the Casa Marina, be sure to have the front desk arrange it for you. They are experts and really have great connections. The room accommodations are incredible also. I cannot emphasize enough how fantastic this hotel is. You may pay a bit of a premium to stay here, but you DO NOT get what you pay for at the Casa Marina....you get more than expected! If ever traveling again to a city that has a Waldorf Astoria hotel, I will do my best to make a reservation with them. They are a top notch, five star experience. One I would recommend to anyone. Thank you staff members of the Casa Marina for making the end of our vacation the best of our vacation!

Reviews.Title: “I could not believe this was the same hotel we loved last year”
Reviews.Author: EXIT17SSP
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel and there is still a lot to like about it. The grounds and public spaces are beautiful and meticulously maintained and the beach/pool staff terriic. The rest of the stay was pretty awful. I booked a King room with the usual understanding that we we have either a King bed or 2 doubles based on availalbity. When we checked in we were advised that we were "UPGRADED" to a suite. What a joke! There were 2 rooms but it there was a single Queen bed in the bedroom when I called to expalin that this was not what I ordered, I was told that since the couch pulled out to a bed there was nothing to be done. Somehow a 5 Star resort thinks that 6 nights on pullout is the norm. The bedroom had only one night stand, a pole lamp on the other side of the bed hung so far over the bed that you hit your head on the light. The cover was missing so you looked into a bare light bulb. The TV was kind of small and set TO THE SIDE OF THE BED. Why would anyone place a TV on the side of the bed? You can't just sit in bed and watch TV without twisting your neck. There were no drawers for clothing. There was an entertainment unit for the TV but it had shelves and was open in the back so our attempt at putting our clothes away resulted in things falling out the back. We kept our things in our suitcases the entire time. The faucet in the sink was broken and the table wabbled so badly it was unusable. It was like staying with friends who set up a cot in the den. The bed was made every day, but I don't think the bathroom was cleaned until Sunday (5th day) and we were never sure what linens they would decide to leave. Some days bath towels, some days hand towels occassionally a wash cloth. We learned to snag a few towels before leaving the beach to ensure there would be something with which to shower. The food has always been just OK. Not great but perfectly accepatble hotal fare, so we usually had breakfast on site. This time, there was a large covention holding private functions in the hotel restaurant and dining patio, so the only option for breafast was an overpriced buffet crammed into the pool bar area. I asked to speak to the both the manager and the Food/Beverage manager on separate occassions but they just never seemed to be available. Not surprised. I would hide too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Kcwu
Reviews.Content: The staff were excellent. Don, Nigil, Mark, and Billy were incredibly helpful for organizing activities from Jet Skiing to Shark Fishing, to dinners.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Inconsistent service not up to the quality of the Waldorf.”
Reviews.Author: mellymel215
Reviews.Content: Great Location - Inconsistent Service not up to the quality of the Waldorf. My husband and I stayed at the Casa Marina for 5 nights at the over Christmas. We came from New York and have stayed at Waldorf in New York many times, so we were expecting the same class of service. I should have know we were in trouble when I walked into a room that looked like it had not been dusted in weeks. The morning after I asked the front desk to have someone clean up the dust on all the surfaces, the floor and clear the spider webs in the bathroom. We came back to our room later that day and surprise it was not done. Again I complained the next day to have the room cleaned, again they failed to clean the floors properly. I finally ended up pulling the maid into our room, cleaning the floor myself and then showing her the filth on the floor. Another issue with the rooms are that the windows on the island view rooms do not open. This is a serious issue for there is no fan in the bathroom, so the moisture collects in the sheets, so by the time your ready for bed, you feel like your jumping into a pool, its a disgusting feeling. I had to wear my sweatshirt and sweat pants to feel dry while sleeping. Room service is hard to order with no menu. When we asked for a menu they said they would bring it right up. It didn't arrive and we waited like idiots for 40 minutes. We then just ordered a generic lunch for we had no idea what what they offered for lunch, for we never received a menu. The gym, gross!! The treadmill was not cleaned in the 5 days we were there. The smell was so bad, my husband propped open the back door so we can get through our work out. Another issue, the bartenders and service people around the pool are on some other time schedule that I am not aware of. No one walked up to take our order for 15 minutes. They have absolutely no customer service skills. On the final day we had a person ask us if we needed a drink. When we ordered a coffee, they brought us Starbucks paper cups, not a proper service, with no sugar or milk. Its very interesting that the prices of the rooms and resort fees are that of a five star hotel, but the service is that of a 3 star holiday inn. All the staff are super polite and welcoming when you walk into the hotel, but what is the point of that when they disappear, don't clean your room, and don't serve. The GM of this hotel really needs to spend time with his people and get them on the same page and turn around the service component that is needed for a hotel that charges over $300 a night. The only positive of this hotel is the location. I strongly suggest you have all your meals outside, and don't expect drinks to arrive at a reasonable time, and your room to be clean.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel OK- Staff Great”
Reviews.Author: nolagirl74
Reviews.Content: Mark was great! He set up chairs, helped with dinner suggestions and was super nice, friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at The beautiful Casa Marina went out of their way to make our trip enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: tlcnudde
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel was really beautiful and so much fun! The views, beachside dining and pool service were awesome. The front desk staff went out of their way to give us everything we needed and wanted. All the staff, including the pool staff, had great personalities, and made our trip so much fun. We looked forward to poolside popcicles, drink of the day, icy fruit and cool towels. The hotel has a wonderful location, just the right distance from Duval Street...close enough to walk to bars and resturants, but far enough away when we got tired of the craziness. We dined on the beach at the Casa Marina on New Years Eve, complete with music and champagne...perfect! We thought this hotel was a great bargain. Many other hotels charged much more and didn't have the ammenities The Casa offered. The Casa Marina is beautiful, histotic, fun, great location and a great value. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setting”
Reviews.Author: JPDVLD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights using free HHonors certificates (hence the lack of a value rating). I had read the reviews before choosing the hotel, so was aware of some of the "horror stories". However, our experience was just the opposite. We had a fairly large room in the old part of the hotel, with a limited ocean view. Agree that the sink is a little awkward. There was no tub, only a shower enclosure, and the TV is definitely too small, but otherwise we had no complaints. The hotel setting couldn't be better -- private beach, palm trees, two swimming pools and ocean swimming facilities, outside bar and restaurant. It was a bit of a walk to get to the downtown areas, but not too bad. (We needed the exercise!) If I went back, I would avoid the $15/day self-parking charges, and find a place on the street. Parking spots seemed ample in the vicinity at all times, and the neighborhood safe.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Guest Service”
Reviews.Author: Doguefriendly
Reviews.Content: My boss stayed for a week. I needed to send him an urgent FedEx. FedEx tried to deliver the package FOUR (4) times the first day & no hotel employee was either in Receiving or Security to sign of it!!! I called the hotel THREE times and asked to speak with either the general manager or manager on duty and received voicemail with each call that didn't give a name in the V/M message just what extension I received. Finally, day 2 the package was signed for by a hotel employee. TWO hours after signing, my boss STILL DIDN't have the package!!!! If that is how this hotel is run, I would NEVER STAY HERE!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Setting, spotty Service”
Reviews.Author: paddletennis
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a week's stay at the Casa, the week between Christmas and New Year's. The Front Desk completely messed up our reservation, three rooms to be next to each other as we travelled with 5 children. After much discussion, and lies and run-around, we finally settled in. They seem to have the bad habit of not providing the guests with the full story to cover their mistakes...After this snafu, our lock on the room malfunctioned, we had to wait an hour while the staff ran around trying to figure out a solution. Inaddition, the dogs in the room next door barked all evening and early morning. Really unfortunate given the price of our room. They did nothing for us for all these trouble. The room is lovely however, comfortable patio, great bed! Wish the refrigerator was stocked though. The beach and pool staf were EXCELLENT - Mark and his staff, in particular, really were the only staff members to fully understand customer service. The drinks of the day are great, the popsicles, the advice for dinner and recreational options, all very appreciated!! Overall, the kids and the adults all had a ball, the front desk needs some instruction in customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Shockingly bad”
Reviews.Author: shlevine
Reviews.Content: I came to Key West for New Year's Eve ('10 into '11), using points for this hotel. The Trip Advisor reviews were mixed, and it was clear that the "Waldorf Collection" is a misnomer, so I was prepared for an experience unlike the famous NYC Waldorf Astoria. Granted, I'm here on HHonors points, and I am well aware of the fact that I therefore take second priority to paying guests (this is dumb, but I understand how the world works). Even still, I've been incredibly disappointed by virtually every element of my stay. But in the spirit of starting the new year on a positive note, I'll first identify the plusses of this hotel: * the setting, on a private beach, is lovely, with great old-world architecture (in the main building), a grand walkway to the beach (lined with mini-reflecting pools), a grand veranda overlooking the pools/ocean * staff set up lounge chairs w/ample towels upon request * this is the most dog-friendly hotel I've seen in America--a deal-breaker for some, no doubt, but as a dog-lover extraordinaire, I love it * the (comped) self-parking lot is just across the street, so it's easy to check in, drop off your bags, and park in just a few moments * the gym, while in a separate building, is quite well equipped, with not only a lot of cardio machines, but a rack of free weights, a universal rack, numerous exercise balls, jump ropes, and a number of Nautilus-esque (I didn't note the brand) weight machines * the decor of the lobby and rooms is a nice blend of old-world and modern * the concierge called to let me know I'd left my credit card with him Ok, upon reflection, that's a long list of positives. But the overall experience has been very disappointing: * our first room was small and extremely far from the lobby, with a view of a parking lot * this room had a tub so filthy I wasn't eager to stand in it to shower * the a/c dripped water (internally, but it was LOUD) all night The front desk was somewhat surly in informing me that New Year's Eve is a very busy week, and an ocean-front room simply wasn't available. But six hours later, the front desk did call my cell to let me know my bags had been moved to a 2nd room in the original (1920s vintage) part of the hotel. This room is much larger. But the noise from the hallway is EXTREMELY LOUD, whether guests walking by or, more common, housekeeping staff gabbing incessantly. I wouldn't put up with this noise level in a $80/night Hampton Inn, so here it's especially egregious. Ok, so the rooms leave a lot to be desired, though if I had an ocean-facing view, I'm sure I'd be less annoyed. Other criticisms: * ALL of the staff have been surly except for the guy who set up lounge chairs/towels on the beach * the breakfast was terrible--overpriced, of course--but skimpy in portion, weak in execution, and overall completely dissatisfying * my friend left a t-shirt in the first room by mistake; 36 hours later, despite a call and a voicemail with housekeeping, he's not heard a word about its whereabouts * the gift shop serves fake (i.e., "brewed by") Starbucks @ $4.50 for just a basic coffee (nothing fancy) * the flat-screen television (24" at best) is so small I can't see it from the bed and therefore haven't even bothered to turn it on * the modern bathroom sink has a contemporary faucet mounted on the left side; while aesthetically appealing, it's virtually impossible to wash your hands with this setup * the windows don't open Overall, I am just totally disappointed by this hotel and especially the surly and unhelpful staff. I will not return, and plan to let the manager know that just because it's New Year's Eve is not an excuse for this crappy service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, BAD Service!”
Reviews.Author: kwres
Reviews.Content: This place could have been a great get-away. It is a beautiful place on the beach, and the management seems to know this. Their attitude conveys that they don't care if you don't like their hotel then you can go somewhere else (but they will keep your money!)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: Ira_Sh
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for a day, it was charming, beautiful, great service, vallet parking, room service and the buffet breakfast. There is a tram tour which departs from the hotel, which I really recommend. The concierge will guide you to the city's best restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Hammocks on the Beach”
Reviews.Author: maxima0359
Reviews.Content: What a great way to relax! The hammocks are right near the water edge tied between palm trees with a beautiful view of the Atlantic. How good does it get! A definite plus for this beautiful resort. The views were great. The service top notch. The staff greeted us every time we passed. The resort is a short walk from the Southern Most Point and then to Duval Street. The rooms are smallish like most reviewers commented, but if you are staying in your room you are missing the best part of being in Key West. They are appointed nicely and as far as we were concerned had everything we needed. The balcony out to the beach was nice feature too. There are two pools and enough outside eating and drink options. All in all a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “A view straight out of a magazine!”
Reviews.Author: DsGregory
Reviews.Content: The hotel, especially the pool areas, looked straight out of a magazine ad or a MasterCard â€œPricelessâ€� ad. The beach was also fantastic, such water! They even set up chairs and umbrellas for you. And the hammocks on the beach were a dream. They even set up dinner tables on the beach, if you are willing to pay the price. We were lucky enough to have a sea view on the top part of the original hotel, and really enjoyed it. White the room was minimalist, we found it to be very nice. The bathroom is a bit small but luxurious, and after all, it is a historic hotel, Waldorf-Astoria/Hilton group has done a good job at restoring and preserving so many beautiful, historic sites. The historic part of Casa Marina was wonderful, and I bought the history book that was in our room. We got a pretty good deal on the hotel, possibly because November is a low season. November is definitely the time to visit South Florida. The temperature is in the 80's, the water is like bathwater, about 70's (if you are from more temparate areas, the Floridian thougt it was cold). The humidity was low, no mosquitos, and best of all, very small crowds.

Reviews.Title: “My Dream Wedding Location”
Reviews.Author: Avi101010
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I had our dream wedding ceremony beach side this past Oct. 10th. It was an absolutely beautiful. The staff was amazing and very attentive to us and to all our guests. We checked in several days earlier due to it being a destination wedding. Our room was beautiful- overlooking the ocean. Champagne and strawberry were waiting for us. The food and service was all we expected and more during the reception it was all amazing, we had a private waiter that only helped us and made our plates from the buffet. I did not have any have issue the day of Ronnie and Yunior were AMAZING!! my guests enjoyed every bit of our wedding and our location. I remember the next day passing by our ballroom and my new husband telling me what a great wedding we had but I could not have done it with out Ronnie Rupe & Yunior Rodriguez. I wish I could do it all over again the money we spent was well worth it. We had our dream wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh.”
Reviews.Author: Cookie1975
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. I encountered nothing that concerned me, other than the musty, strange smell that was always present in the lobby. Everything seemed clean, in good repair, and the bed was comfy. I got good service at the pool and beach, and they did have "drink of the day" samples and free popsicles. The gym is spacious and has nice new equipment. The beach was clean and pleasant, and it's not the resort's fault that Key West doesn't have sandy beaches where you can just walk out into the water. But there was nothing really special or exciting about the property either. There's nothing in particular that makes you feel at home or that you'd really like to come back. The service is fine but not outstanding, there are not really any special touches or things they do to make you feel like they really value you. If you eat at the resort, the food is fine, but not that interesting, and it is definitely overpriced. I was fine with the location - it is at the far South end of the island, a few blocks from Duval Street, but not the end of Duval where the action is. That was fine with me because it was quiet, and I felt like I was burning plenty of calories with a brisk 1/2 hour walk down to the other end where all the bars are, but if you want to be right in the middle of things you should probably choose somewhere else. Also, Key West wasn't really what I hoped it would be. Unlike the reviewer below, I was prepared for it to be full of non-conservative people who like to drink a lot, but I guess I was also thinking it would be like a big fun party with some good shopping. In reality, it's actually kind of lame. I did love the Happy Hour specials with half-price or BOGO drinks and apps, since I'm from MA where we don't have happy hour drink specials. But other than that, blah. It's just kind of tacky, and I feel like it's catering to a certain kind of person that isn't me. Someone with some money but no taste, maybe, who's a hard-core alcoholic and wants to be surrounded by people who won't judge them for that? The shopping was either low-quality / no-style T-shirt shops, or trendy designer stuff at high price points. I was hoping there would be boutiques that had fun, cool, and unique clothes and accessories at moderate price points, but there was really nothing like that. Evan and Elle is the kind of store I was looking for, but just too expensive. And the galleries were full of pretentious salespeople and a lot of tasteless art in garish colors. Ok, not all of them, but a lot. And Mallory Square - stay away! Gross. We liked Venice Beach in L.A. and thought this would be a similar scene, but it's just way too creepy and weird. The "entertainers" all seemed like people you'd encounter in a psychiatric hospital, and you felt like your pocket was going to be picked at any moment. We walked in and walked back out. Sunset Pier was a much nicer place to watch the sunset with a drink in hand. Overall, we were looking for somewhere warm but within the continental US to relax for a few days and completely chill out. I thought this would be it, but it wasn't. Something is just "off" about the whole place, that I can't put my finger on. I did encounter exactly that in Fort Meyers at the Sanibel Resort a couple of years ago, but without as much night life as I would have liked. It didn't help that they were having a cold snap down there and we brought the wrong clothes and ended up wearing jeans and a sweatshirt every night, but neither the location nor the hotel did anything for me that counteracted the disappointing weather. This is my honest opinion, and I do want to state that I like to party, ride a motorcycle, and enjoy any occasion where I can have a few cocktails and dress up in crazy costumes or what have you. I love the beach and warm weather. I would have thought Key West would be my kind of scene, but it just wasn't. Do some thorough research before you decide, if this is your first visit.

Reviews.Title: “As always a great place that makes you and your guests feel welcomed”
Reviews.Author: russ048
Reviews.Content: AWESOME Place... Cant say much more than that From the time you enter the front doors AJ the door man makes you feel speical at checkin Patrick welcomes you if you its first time or welcomes you back and even remebers your name. How great is that. Pay the little bit of extra money.. service, food, atmosphere and overall experince is worth every penny! Russ Beckenstein Owner FIrst Class MOtorcycle Touring

Reviews.Title: “Casa distinctly average for it's class, and will never return to Key West!”
Reviews.Author: AnonFreqTraveller
Reviews.Content: Visited the Casa Marina in Dec 2010 having travelled a long way and having been subject to lengthy flight delays. So here's the true run-down of things at the Casa (and Key West in general): Casa Marina - First impressions of hotel were good - nice building, nice lobby, nice grounds.Pools were nice but very cold, beach looked nice but was a bit coarse and not anywhere near as soft and clean as areas such as Naples. Our room was clean and bright but lacked a homely feel. We ate breakfast a la carte but it was always delivered cold to the table - we complained once but when it recurred we just stopped mentioning it. We took lunch at the Sun Sun restaurant which was ok in taste but over-priced (as was all food at the resort). Dinner menu was ok, nothing special, but the after dinner decaf coffee delivered to the table was so strong as to be completely undrinkable. Pricing for the bicycles and mopeds at the resort was simply ridiculous, and stopped us hiring completely. Staff at the resort were variable in manner - the central European staff were not particularly friendly and in some cases almost surly, whilst the US and Carribean staff were fine. Key West: A strong word of caution. Neither I nor my partner are particularly conservative, but we both felt very (very!) uncomfortable in Key West. I believe Lonely Planet describes it thus - "it's as if someone has shaken the US and all the nuts fell to the bottom" (we read this after arrival). We found Key West to be a place frequented by (what appeared to us to be) misfits and/or alcoholics. Walking Key West at night, we did not feel secure. We found Duval Street to be sleazy and seedy, and indeed found Key West as a whole to be very down market. We are a normal couple, earning average salaries and with average tastes, and we have vowed never to return to Key West because of it's weirdness and downbeat feel. If you are looking for a relaxed, upmarket island feel, go to a nice Carribean island, NOT key West. You have been warned...

Reviews.Title: “Run away from this place!”
Reviews.Author: Waltertainment2
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at Hampton Inns that could run circles around this place!!! My spouse and I decided to stay here for a weekend getaway. I frequent Hilton brand hotels quite a bit for business so we decided on this hotel instead of the Doubletree, since it is one of their premium brands. We arrived at 3:30pm. Since check-in is at 4pm, the front desk agent said that our room was not ready but that they would give us a call as soon as it was ready. Because of my Hilton Honors status, they were nice enough to give me an upgraded room. Unfortunately, instead of the King bed, I was given two full size beds for me and my spouse. No biggie! I liked having the private balcony. After waiting about 2 hours, we still had not received a call. When I went to the desk to inquire, I was told that the room was ready. When asked why no one had called, the agent apologized and blamed another person. No biggie. When we arrived in our room, it was nice but I did have some concerns that I did not voice. Mildrew in the tub. Finger prints on the walls. Spots on the floors, lamp shade and bedding. Poorly cleaned crown and molding. Keep in mind this is apart of the Waldorf Astoria Collection! On the next day when the housekeeper cleaned our room, she only repIaced the towels and made up the beds. She did not give us any additional soap or take away the dirty drinking glasses. I requested the complimentary water that was promised (Hilton Honors) but it never arrived. On day two I asked again, and 3 hours later it never arrived. I went to the front desk and after listening to another guest complain about a few things I decided to write this review. The staff need hospitatlity training. The customer service is not warm and friendly. You get the feeling like they are doing you a favor by assisting you. Stay away from this place. I will never stay here again or any other Waldorf.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of character”
Reviews.Author: Addicated_to_SBH
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in November and really liked the place. It had a cool vibe, and although it is older it has a bit of character. As a Hilton Diamond, they gave me 1000 points because the hotel was sold out and they could not upgrade me (yippee...not), and my room was a bit small but understandable as the hotel is older. Completely renovated and nice decor, several bars and restaurants, 2 cold pools (disappointed that they wern't heated) and a cool beach-side bar. The beach really isn't a beach, but had a bunch of seaweed that really stank but was manageable. really close walk to Duval Street so it was just fine with me as I had free nights and didn't pay a thing! Did not try the restaurants so can't comment on those....be sure to park on the street nearby as they charge something like $35 a day for parking! Totally would recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property, lacked customer service!!!”
Reviews.Author: tuccor69
Reviews.Content: We spent our Thanksgiving at this resort, the Hotel itself and the property is amazingly beautiful. Check in was at 4PM and they would'nt let you check in till that time. We got there at 3:45pm, No biggy we waited and self parked during that time. Much to our surprise we read all the rules that came along with all the added resort fee. (There are many) We stayed in a King Bed room with a Island View (parking lot) The room was OK. It was interesting that there was no dresser to put clothes away, There is a full closet. Including 2 robes to use while you are there. The room was nothing special. very small. What had us very surprised and why i am writing this review, was the lack of customer service at this caliber hotel. There was none. We also experienced the Sunday buffet breakfast, it was Ok. Pool service didnt exist, we had to find our own towels and the pool is not heated so you really needed one or two. You could have sat there all day and no one asked us if we wanted drinks or appetizers or towels. Needless to say the lack of customer service continued all around the property.. The housekeeping didnt even replace all the towels or soap they took from the room, I had to ask for bath towels and soap. As for location, its a great place to be. We would like to return to this place again, but only if changes are made. We often stay there affilliated hotels and find better customer service there, they are all sister hotels so i dont get whats up with this Casa Marina. Hopefully it was just a one time experience.

Reviews.Title: “Tis was the best vacation of my life!”
Reviews.Author: greeneacr
Reviews.Content: My 23 year old daughter and I stayed there for two days in November and it was spectacular! We had a VERY relaxing stay in a magnificent hotel! The staff was awesome (especially the Cabana Boy!) The service was wonderful. Everyone was VERY friendly. The hotel was peaceful and spectacularly beautiful! They also have the best beach in the Keys!

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place to stay that is in the perfect part of town, but pools were often overcrowded.”
Reviews.Author: KMB808
Reviews.Content: Our visit to Key West was fantastic! We purchased our hotel accommodations from hotels.com and were pleasantly surprised how nice everything was given the price. The hotel was gorgeous, the room was comfortable, and the location was perfect. We did not eat a full meal at the hotel because the food on the main street in town was so appealing, but our hotel snacks were pretty good. Our biggest complaints (which are minimal) were the pools being overcrowded with kids that had large flotation devices, service was a hit or miss, and the room only had a stand up shower (no large tub here).

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: dufflo
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is an outstanding hotel. Their employees, especially Jafre at the front desk, are all very helpful and friendly. Good food and better drinks, what else could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Great location, staff and pool bar!”
Reviews.Author: ScottNe1964
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Casa Marina. The staff was friendly and attentive. The pool bar is a gem - the beach just a short saunter away was amazing for Key West (which has very few beaches). The rooms were a little low on the appointment and comfort level when compared with what you might expect from a Waldorf property. Let me be clear - the rooms were not a problem - just not as plush as expected. Thanks to the staff - we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular setting....a grand dame!”
Reviews.Author: Flagirl56
Reviews.Content: We had just spent 2 prior nights in Islamorada and were looking forward to this hotel. I had read the reviews and researched the area.. I booked an Oceanview room through the website. They offer AAA and AARP discounts. Since we are a Gold member with Hilton, we were upgraded to an oceanview suite on the ground floor. The room was updated, bathroom big but with the Hilton (Waldorf is a Hilton brand) trademark small shower/tub combo???? Also if the hotel management is reading this, please put a towel bar or more hooks for hand and bath towels. (Only one in this bathroom). I loved the tile floors and the bed was comfy. The best part of these grd floor suites was we had a little patio just steps from the beach and pool. For me that was what made this a hotel great. The resort fee plus a parking fee was the negative about this resort ($25 resort fee plus $15 to self park). You can expect resort prices for the restuarants on the property. We had a late meal at the bar..burger and chicken club, both very good. All in all a beautiful and elegant hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: JulyT
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my stay at Casa Marina and I was so disappointed! When I booked our trip I specifically asked for a quiet room where we could relax. I was assured they could accommodate us. However, when we arrived, we found they had put us in a room right over a wedding reception. I find it hard to imagine that this reception had not already been booked when I called to make our reservation . We asked to be moved but were told nothing was available. The manager assured us the reception would be ending in about an hour. No problem...we could handle an hour. Two hours later the reception was still going strong and the manager disappeared. She would not answer the phone and I kept being sent to voicemail. Finally, the hotel operator told me the manager told her to tell me the reception would be ending soon. Apparently the manger couldn't get on the phone herself and apologize for misinforming us earlier about how late this would go on. We would have left and come back later if we knew this would go on for two more hours. After the reception was over there was the taking down of the tables which was quite loud and went on for an hour. Then at six in the morning I awoke to carts being rolled around downstairs because...guess what...the breakfast buffet was to be served right under our room and they had to set that up. That's ok because we would be up soon anyway as housekeeping finds in necessary to vacuum at 7am here, although they won't show up to actually clean your room until around 2 pm. In addition, our room was tiny and our "grand ocean view" was obstructed. Overall, I left feeling like I was lied to and ripped off.

Reviews.Title: “Who needs Hawaii?”
Reviews.Author: ChristyReyn
Reviews.Content: After visiting Casa Marina in 2009, my husband and I took a trip to Oahu. Throughout that trip we kept asking ourselves why we schlepped halfway to Japan when everything we wanted was in Key West at Casa Marina. We returned to Casa for five nights in November and were so pleased to be back. I really don't know how anyone can say anything negative about this hotel. The grounds are beautiful, food and drinks are delicious, and the staff is incredible. Big shout out to the entire bar staff...some of them even remembered us from last year. Everyone at the bar was amazing and super cool! I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina is a fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: sscastle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with our Daughter, Son-In-Law and twin 2 year old Grandchhildren stayed 4 nights at this wonderful hotel. We had reserved 2 one bedroom connecting suites. We arrived a bit late, and our suites were just as requested with 2 cribs in one suite. The suites were spacious, very clean and well kept. The service throughout our stay was excellent. The outside areas were lovely, and very accommodating to families. We will definitely stay here again, and tell anyone we know traveling to Key West to consider this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dream wedding at the Casa”
Reviews.Author: OTN123_10
Reviews.Content: We had our wedding at Casa Marina in November of 2010. I had rather high expectations, given the cost, and they were not only met they were exceeded. The staff both in charge of planning and running the event were phenomenal, highly attentive to our needs, and clearly were very concerned everything ran smoothly. The food at the wedding was, hands down, the best food I have ever seen a hotel produce for a large event. I must have heard 20-30 times, "This is far and away the best food I've ever had at a wedding." Granted, we were fortunate enough to "upgrade" the food selection, but even more mundane items such as the Caesar salad, pasta, and risotto were phenomenal. The location was great, the pictures turned out well, and we couldn't have been happier. I would strongly recommend this hotel to anyone contemplating getting married in Key West. A+!

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before booking this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: rossfraser2020
Reviews.Content: We visited the Casa Marina resort in Key West as part of a special birthday trip to Florida. We spent a lot of time researching all of the accommodation in Key West and chose Casa Marina because it is part of The Waldorf Astoria group, which is a name you associate with luxury and quality, but also because of the good reviews the hotel has received. The hotel itself is fabulous, with a stunning entrance way. Our room was spotless, air conditioned and had an uninterrupted view over the pool and out to sea. In general, you will find that the prices in Key West for â€œqualityâ€�(4 or 5 star equivalent) accommodation are extremely high. There is no real justification for this, apart from not having a choice once you have arrived and many tourists wanting to make Key West a vacation stop(often having to drive for 4-5 hours from Miami). We paid 378 dollars for the room for the night(including breakfast), which is on a par with the price you might pay for an extremely nice hotel in New York or Miami. However, I would not consider the attractions or amenities in Key West anywhere near in comparison with either city destination. Sure, it's a holiday destination, but we were expecting more from the Keys, in terms of expectations and other people's recommendations. The main issue that we had with the hotel was that unknown to us, they were hosting the annual â€œParrot headâ€� conference. This is a charitable organisation with positive intentions, but we did not feel this hotel was a suitable venue for this event. After having driven 5 hours from Miami to get to Key West, we were tired and were looking forward to chilling out by the pool, in a luxury hotel(one of the most, if not the most, expensive hotels in Key West). We have stayed at equivalent luxury beach resort hotels around the world so we were expecting a relaxing atmosphere. Strangely, the pool area had loud, live music in the afternoon with people shouting, clapping and jeering. Don't get me wrong , live music can be great, in the right setting and context. This was neither. The singer could best be decribed as country and Western and was singing songs with lyrics including; â€œI caught my wife on another man's lapâ€� and â€œbeer-run, I love drinking beerâ€�. This music did not seem fitting to the venue and we were unsure whether this was typical hotel entertainment(no mention of this on hotel website) or if it was part of the entertainment for the â€œparrot headsâ€� conference. The next day we went down to breakfast. Due to the volume of people arriving and staying at the hotel, the breakfast area felt like something from a Las Vegas buffet(although with much less choice and less quality) â€“ People were scrambling to pile as much food on their plates as possible and this was not what we were expecting. People were starting to arrive from other locations in the area for the event, so the foyer and pool area were becoming extremely busy. It appeared to be a dress down occassion with people wearing multi-coloured t-shirts saying 'gypsy palace' (which I found to be offensive). After breakfast, we checked out, put our luggage in the car and went for a walk around Key West. When we came back there were literally hundreds of people milling around the front of the hotel. We walked back into the hotel, to use the toilet, through the main foyer and were asked by a member ofparrot head security if we had a 'pass'? We said â€œnoâ€� and were told we were not allowed in the hotel! This instantly made us somewhat surprised and outraged. We had just spent shy of 400 dollars and were not allowed back in the hotel. We were not the only hotel guests party to this treatment, as another guest whose luggage was in his room was also not allowed back in. By this point, I was very angry and depite my explanations about staying at the hotel, was not allowed in. We ignored the â€œparrot head'sâ€� security and walked on in. We were then told; â€œI'm calling hotel securityâ€�, which we urged him to do, to hopefully get the situation resolved. My partner was almost manhandled out the hotel. We eventually got hold of a member of hotel staff, who agreed that the current situation was ridiculous. She told us that a member of their own staff had not been allowed in! The long and short of our stay is this- 1. It's a beautiful hotel in a fabulous setting. 2. It's overpriced. You don't get what you pay for â€“ however, if you want to visit Key West, this is the norm. I had a good look at other hotels and feel the Casa Marina was the best quality hotel in the area. 3. In my opinion, we should have been told about the Parrot head event. If this was the case, we WOULDN'T have booked this hotel. I also do not feel this hotel was the sort of hotel that should have been hosting this event. Good cause, wrong venue. 4. I personally don't blame the Parrot head security for not allowing us in. It was the hotel who had organised this. However, this should NEVER have been agreed in the first place, so I blame poor hotel management. I have never been at a luxury hotel before and made to feel like a 'criminal' for entering back into the hotel that an hour before you had just handed over 378 dollars to. It has left a bitter taste in my mouth and I will think twice about booking into a Waldorf Astoria collection hotel in the future, if this is their approach to running an event at the same time as claiming to provide a pleasant guest experience. A good tip would be to check if an event/conference is taking place at the same time as your stay. Your hotel will be unlikely to let you know.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: shlak
Reviews.Content: We Stayed at the Casa Marina for 5 nights. We were upgraded to a small suite which had a separate living room with sofa. Although we didnt have a great view, room was very nice and updated. Definitely worth it. The hotel was great. Two separate pools with plenty of chairs. We thought the food at the hotel was good but there are plenty of other options within walking distance. You arealso only a short cab ride or 15 minute walk to the heart of Key West. If you are looking for a nice but quiet place to stay, you have found your place.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond to satisfy guests”
Reviews.Author: Bmwheat
Reviews.Content: My company has been at Casa Marina since July rotating two man teams out every two weeks. Regardless how long we have been at the hotel the employees continue to go out of there way to make sure we are satisfied. One employee inparticular stands out. If you decide to stay at Casa Marina be sure to ask for Patrick at the front desk. He will go above and beyond to make sure you are happy and that you have a great stay. The man loves to fish and can often be found on the resorts pier in the evenings. If he is out fishing he is always more then happy to show you a good time catching snapper and grunt (highly recommended!!). Now for the downside depending on where you are in the hotel your room size can vary from rather large to fairly small. The internet service can vary greatly depending on your room location and what floor you are on. The hotel can be expensive if you are not careful nothing is free.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ssneeringer
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were excellent. We had an outstanding time. The rooms were very clean- very new very nice!!! I am a picky person- and this hotel was outstanding!!! thank you casa marina!!

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: Tink051050
Reviews.Content: There aren't enough words of praise for this resort and it's personnel. Special mention goes to Patrick Anello who is part of the front desk/concierge staff. He's the best! Another special mention goes out to Robin at the poolside bar who has a talent for making you feel at home. ALL the poolside staff are friendly and work very hard to make a guest's stay not for want. I wish I knew all their names to mention. Please make sure they all get a special mention.

Reviews.Title: “WOW DID I JUST SPEND >$300 TO SLEEP IN A CLOSET”
Reviews.Author: Urocat
Reviews.Content: I have to admit my husband and I had very big expectations when we picked the Casa Marina for our first visit to Key West. When we arrived we where impressed by the entry and the out door pool, the beach front / pier was gorgeous. Then they showed us our island property view suite, what a waste of money. The room was the size of a closet and the one chair was not very comfortable. The hotel is with in walking distance of the island attractions however once we walked over to the 90 miles from cuba buoy we noticed that there a LOT of hotels that are closer to Duval street and and they are a lot less expensive. We also noticed that for 300 + a night they do not replace the little lotions in your room and they charge you a $28 a night resort fee which I am not really sure what I was paying for because they charge you $15 a day for self parking access The breakfast at the Casa Marina was a great value and and the staff there was friendly, however if you are expecting true luxury and value look elsewhere

Reviews.Title: “Best beach location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: rika82006
Reviews.Content: It was right on the beach and we couldn't have asked for a better view. The rooms were very nice and clean with up to date furnishings and I loved the coffee machine. As we were there in the off season not everything was open and it is away from the main part of town. There isn't much in the way of restaurants or shops nearby. We stayed here and also at the Hyatt on the other side. This was our favorite hotel but the Hyatt's location was better as we could to walk to almost wherever we wanted to go. We had a vehicle so this wasn't a problem and Key West has good taxi service at a reasonable cost. The service was very good at the hotel and the staff attentive and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Another day in paradise...”
Reviews.Author: scottintl
Reviews.Content: Having been to Key West on dozens of occasions, this was my first stay at the Casa Marina Resort, and this will be where I stay on any future trip...! Clearly the "Grand Dame" of Key West, the Casa Marina has it all: a strip of private beach, a gorgeous pool served by an attentive staff, lovely grounds and a hip yet unpretentious interior. The resort's level of service and its food & beverage offerings were way above par, but if venturing out, the Casa Marina concierge will know where to direct you, and seems able to get a table anywhere on the island, even during the busiest time of the year -- Fantasy Fest. I was there with buddies looking for laughs, but I'd certainly recommend the resort as a great conference venue or as a terrific spot for a beach-front wedding.

Reviews.Title: “I need to go back!!!”
Reviews.Author: caddy6834
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Casa Marina and our visit was everything you could wish for. This was my first time back since they renovated the hotel and I must say that it looked beautiful. I had stayed there in 2005 and it looks much nicer than it did back then. Upon arrival we were greeted with friendly door staff that gladly took our bags. Everyone had a smile and seemed to enjoy working there. My wife and I had friendly conversation witht the man at the check in counter and he decided to upgrade us,(I think the room was a couple hundred dollars more per night than the one we had booked)!!! As soon as we got to the room we were in love with its huge balconey and beautiful pool and oceanfront views. The room was decorated very nicely and the bed was extremely comfortable. I took my wife for a walk and showed her the grounds and they were absolutely perfect. If you're looking for a nice ocean view this is the place to be. The pools were very clean and there were no screaming children to be seen. If you are looking for great food this is the place for you. We ate at the hotel three times because the food was sooooooo good, try the conch fritters! This was by far one of the best trips I had been on and the Casa Marinas staff was top notch. If you don't want to be in the thick of the Duval action this is the place to stay. A cheap 2 minute cab ride will get you to bars and restaurants. One bad thing did happen and it was my own fault! My wife was laying in one of the beach hammocks at night and I left her to go get a drink at the poolside bar. When I came back I went to the wrong hammock and interrupted a couple that was smooching. I felt like an idiot but we laughed about it later. Great place, go there ASAP and you will not be dissapointed!

Reviews.Title: “Far Exceeded Expectationsâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: smlou
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Casa in mid-October began with our arrival five-hours prior to check-in. NO WORRIES! We were in our room within 40 minutes of walking in the door (thanks to â€˜Jafreâ€™ the very polite, friendly and accommodating front desk staff member!) Everything during our stay exceeded our expectations. Our room was spotlessâ€¦The view was magnificentâ€¦Every member of the staff went out of their way to make sure we were enjoying ourselves at all times. The beach was beautiful, quiet and relaxing! A favorite memory of our stay was falling asleep in a beachside hammock with a full moon and the sound of gentle waves!

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, few very small areas need improvement”
Reviews.Author: KVblueflowers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina and were more than pleased with the hotel's service. Every member of the staff was wonderful and the beach side service was great. The fact that the beach was private was a huge plus and made the slightly higher price worthwhile- it wasn't overcrowded and extremely rowdy like Smathers Beach. There was always a chair to lounge and relax in, but the hammocks were most often taken. The food was good-but not worth the price. We self-parked our car and preferred to eat out at local restaurants rather than the hotel. It is a bit of a walk down to Duval Street, so I would suggest taking a cab or parking near the area (10$ a day was the cheapest we found). The room was what I expected from an older hotel-there were cracks in the bathtub and the walls were a little dirty as well, but the bed was comfortable and the towels and robes were soft. The main areas of the hotel are beautiful and they were updating parts of the hotel while we were there.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - One of my favorites of all time”
Reviews.Author: LA-CRM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with another couple this past weekend to Key West. We stayed at Casa Marina. Our stay was wonderful. Everything was perfect. The hotel is fabulous. The entire staff is so helpful and freindly. The grounds are impeccable. We can't wait to plan our return this hotel and Key West. We rode bikes all around the island and we very happy that we chose to stay in this resort. You really never have to leave, it really is that nice.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Experience.”
Reviews.Author: magda2519
Reviews.Content: We went to Casa Marina Resort for our 36th Anniversary. We have rated this place in the top three resorts we have stayed at! The best of the best>>>>

Reviews.Title: “Best of Key West”
Reviews.Author: dylanbgreen
Reviews.Content: I always read reviews and map things out before travelling to a destination and found the others here helpful with the exception that I actually prefferred the 'resort fee'. To preface, I am a frequent traveller and have stayed at all levels of hotels both independents and branded so I have seen it done all different ways. I can assure you that you will not get the level of service at the beach and pool for a better price anywhere else. While it would be very nice to not have this at all most other locations simply charge extra for the additional services/amenities and it will typically add up to a higher cost. Using only my experiences in Florida I have typically had to pay at least $20-$30 to have chairs and umbrella set up on the beach. This can usually be charged to the room but in some cases I have had to pay directly at time of service. At this property they rake the sand each morning on the substantial private beach and as you arrive you are greeted by the team and they set everything up for you wherever you would like on the beach, next to the pool, in a hammock between palm trees or in the shady grass area. They set up the chairs and umbrella's, bring fresh towels and anything else needed to start you off (followed of course by the waitstaff with refreshments). On hot days they will even pass out popsicles in the afternoon. Another benefit is that they have snorkel gear, sand toys for kids and many other 'extras' to loan you (as opposed to 'rent'), they even loaned us a fishing pole for my son to use off of one of their two piers. The fee also provides free internet which is usually a separate charge at upscale hotels. To sum this up, the set $25 resort fee was a much greater value than the a la carte format. Key West is a tropical paradise, however, if you are looking for 'beach' front location be aware that most properties do not offer this or if so not very well. This hotel is from what I have seen the single exception to this. They offer a substantial beach area with a small pier in the middle that takes you out to where it is deep enough to swim/snorkel (about 15 yards or so), there are no waves in this area and it is only about 2 1/2 feet deep 10 feet into the water. This offers the best of both worlds. We travelled with 2 small children (twin toddlers) and our 7 year old son and this allowed all of us to enjoy the beach and warm water of the ocean without concern of waves, undercurrents, riptides or dropoffs. There is also plenty of sea life all around the island and it can be experienced without leaving the resort with only a snorkel. In addition to the on-site activities director who had wonderful things for the kids (Merideth), the beach/pool staff (Tom and Niko (sp?)) took my son around the beach/pool area to show him the wildlife they would stumble upon throughout our stay (hermit crabs, the resident iquanas, the fish easily visible from the pier, sea urchins when the tide is right and much more). The team at the front desk was phenomenal help. They took great care to make sure we had a room that would fit our families needs needs and had excellent advice/reccomendations throughout our stay, they really made our stay (Thanks to Ruth, Evelyn & Patrick) Our rooms were cleaned thoroughly daily and they would refresh our towells again when providing turn down service in the evenings. The food at the hotel was good but we ended up eating out for most of the stay, they did offer dining right on the beach at night and you get a great sunset at this location. The main area of town in walkable but it is a good distance, cabs are plentiful and it is only a three to five minute drive. All of the public beaches are on the side of the island beginning right next door to the hotel (though you will not need them with all of their private beach). Also directly next to the hotel, right on the beach, is a restaraunt Salute. We had another guest reccomend this to us that went as a couple and we found it to be one of the best places we have run across to have dinner with children. They offer a great and inexpensive childrens menu but the highlight is that it is literally separated from the sandy beach by only a walkway. Children were running all around the beach and playing on the volleyball courts allowing adults to enjoy and adult meal without worry. We left feeling like we really knew many of the guests and the hotel staff, it is great to be around friends. We cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Service not worthy of Waldorf Astoria”
Reviews.Author: First_time_in_Venice
Reviews.Content: Husband and I wanted to celebrate his birthday and our last trip as just a couple (babymoon) in the US in case anything would happen. Being Hilton Diamond, we picked this hotel in Key West. We contacted the hotel twice after we made our reservation to request early check in, late check out, shuttle service and we also mentioned the reasons we were coming. Never got a reply. So when we showed up at the airport, we took a cab (8$/ pers) (in the end, we learned that the shuttle or cab is the same price when we left) and of course our room wasn't ready ( afterwards, we received a call while out for lunch to let us know it was). I can't complain because it's not fair to expect a gesture, but we unlike other reviewers didn't get a special gift in our room even though we had said it was for a couple of special occasions. As Elite Hilton Honors, you will not get anything for breakfast, only a discount on the resort fee. In some way, our gesture was to be upgraded to an ocean view room. I should be appreciative, but it's almost a given as Elite (if not full)... There is a N*spresso machine in the room with a few doses that were replenished every day. A not so funny thing: toilet paper was running low, and there were no spare rolls in the room. Wasn't changed at next service. We actually really ran out and had to use tissue for 2 days until they finally realized it... Bathroom is poorly designed. Shower is narrow. There is no room around the sink to put your stuff. I ranked the "sleep quality" quite low for a couple of reasons. Mattress itself wasn't bad, but the box was making noises. We joked about it at first and then it became really unpleasant when I had my frequent nightly bathroom trips. Also, they vacuum the hallways at 8am and will bang at your door even if you have the privacy sign. And the maids don't understand english when you yell "no" or "later" or simply open the door and show them the sign. Let me now talk about the pools/ beach. 2 pools, I didn't see a hottub. Pretty disgusting: I know you have to expect sand in the pool, but not necessarily hair, fibers, oil and other gross things that were in suspension. I think they could clean it more, or better. Resort fee includes free popsicle ice creams and drink of the day samples. Never saw their "drink of the day samples". Pool boy #1 showed up on day 1 and I told him to give the ice cream on his way back so that my husband would be back (he was just getting out of the water). Never came back. Pool boy #2 comes 1h after and asks me if he can get me anything. I mention that I am still waiting for the popsicles, he says he would take care of it. Well, I am still waiting. Next day, I wanted to get a glass of water at the tanks available at the pools. It was empty, so I ask pool boy #1. The guy complains that he has already filled it twice. I don't care. The beach is not nice white sand: there is glass which is not being removed even if they rake the beach everyday. You should wear flipflops or be careful and I would be worried with kids unless they were the plastic water shoes. There is a small pier to go into the water. It's slippery because they do not take care of the algae. I actually slipped one day and fell even though I was being careful (adult, aware, pregnant). I would be very concerned with children. You can swin to an isolated deck which has a little bit of nice sealife to see (you can rent snorkeling for 8$/h, 20$/ day, or buy at the hotel shop or even walk to C*S and buy for less). Snorkeling gets much better if you are not afraid to swim a little more to a bigger pier on the left. It separates the hotel area and a public beach but the sealife that surrounds it is great. There is a corner and some of the pier is collapsed so you can go to the other side. We saw a stingray, numerous colorful fish (I have no clue of their names), conches (they were alive, we were just diving, picking them up and looking, not taking them out of the water), starfish,... It's one of the best snorkeling place in KeyWest unless you do a boat trip. Actually, a few years back, we took a boat trip and we didn't see anything (streams were strong and sand was in suspension). But don't expect it to be DryTortugas either, this is worth the trip. We had lunch at the beach restaurant one day. It was ok. Breakfast: only buffet while we were there, 20$/pers. Buffet is ok, but really not impressive at all. Some basics were not there like waffles, pancakes, or french toast. There were pastries, muffins, bread, omelette station, potatoes, ham, oatmeal, cereal and fruits. Unpleasant surprise as they charged us different amounts on different days for the same things (buffet!) and they forced an 18% tip on the bill. I am sorry, but if this is buffet and I get up and get my food and someone comes once to get me my drink and not even remove my plate, that's not 18%. I complained and this got fixed. We were going out for dinners and most lunches. There are a couple of nice places if you don't mind walking a little or taking a cab. Mallory square is 30/45 min walk. That's good if you want a quiet family resort, not so good if you plan to party all night. Overall: It's a nice place (nice resort facility, nice snorkeling, room comfort is ok), but service is clearly not up to the Waldorf Astoria name. I guess it's fine if you are aware of it. And I would still recommend the place, we still enjoyed our time there.

Reviews.Title: “We had a lovely time”
Reviews.Author: loulouloop
Reviews.Content: we had a lovely time at the Casa marina. It's a beatiful hotel in a good location, nice and quiet and just a walk away from the main action in Key West, The room we had was comfortable and clean, more than enough storage and a very comfy bed. The hotel grounds are gorgeous and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The only thing I can fault the hotel on is the parking charges ($15 for self park????) they seemed a bit steep considering the car parks were half empty during our stay. The walk to Mallory Square took about half an hour but was well worth it for the sunset. I'd definately recommend the trolley tour which stops directly outside the hotel as well, fun and informative a great way to learn about and see Key West!

Reviews.Title: “nice place, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: mandy3710
Reviews.Content: several things went wrong that put a damper on this beautiful property. we were told over the phone that we could get a free nights stay and when we checked out that was not honored. Also, the 4th of July "buffet" was not a buffet. $25 bucks for one measly plate of food. The drinks at the pool bar were small and not that tasty. Fortunately for Casa, they don't have much competition in the keys!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect vacation!”
Reviews.Author: cberry_10
Reviews.Content: We just wanted to comment on how wonderful our stay was at the Casa Marina resort. We were waited on and treated exceptionally well! Everyone was pleasant, helpful and overall outstanding! The food and drinks were delicious, the beach was beautiful and clean, and the pools were delightful! This was by far the best vacation we have ever had and we plan on coming back again next year! Thank you for the perfect vacation! Christopher and Tiffanie Berry

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Getaway”
Reviews.Author: adam03054
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Casa for 3 nights. We went there for a short honeymoon as we did not want to deal with the potential for hurricanes in the Carribean. We loved our stay, everything was great. If you are looking for white sandy beaches, you will not find in Key West, the beach at the Casa is not the best compared with other tropical locations, however it is the best in Key West. The staff was very nice and always willing to help, never had a problem getting a chair or umbrella for the beach and there were plenty of waitresses coming around when we were at the pool. We stayed in a one bedroom suite, ocean view, room 1014. The room was really nice and private, and the bed was extremely comfortable. Never had a problem with room service. We looked around at other hotels and from what we could see, the Casa was the biggest and the best, no other hotels had two large pools and a private beach area. The breakfast buffet is a little expensive for the selection, go find local places to eat, much cheaper. The Strip house at the sister property Reach Resort is a great place to eat, but it will cost you some money, but your on vacation, live a little. Rent some bicycles and go check out the island and Duval St ( must go to Sunset Pier !!! ) Overall I would recommend staying at the Casa Marina to anyone looking to travel to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing yet elegant Anniversary!!”
Reviews.Author: boxylady
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from The Casa Marina Resort and it was absolutely fabulous!!! What a beautiful property. I know there are many places to stay on the island, as we looked at many, but we were so very happy with our choice to stay here. The staff is wonderul and the hotel itself has a fantastic history. We dined here twice for dinner and I must say the food was quite good. Julie was fantastic! She not only made us feel very welcome but she also gave us great tips about where to go while we were there. The accomodations were nice and we had a great view right on the ocean. Can't say enough good things about this hotel. We will definitely attempt to return in the near future!! Also, the walk into downtown/Duval St. is only about a 20- 30 minute walk. Not far at all!

Reviews.Title: “It was awesome”
Reviews.Author: karenrae2
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean and the view was amazing. People that worked there were extremely friendly. Walking distance to all the action. Had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing. Loved the hammocks on the private beach.”
Reviews.Author: akg_jsc
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Key West for 4 nights for a friend's wedding. We had a wonderful ocean view room with a nice sitting area separate from the bedroom and a huge beautiful bathroom. Beautiful pools and outdoor sitting areas. We had a little too much fun one night, but had a wonderful relaxing hangover day laying in a hammock-for-two on the private beach. More kids around than we would like, but not annoyingly so. You either have to bike or take a cab into downtown, but not too inconvenient.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: mauidave65
Reviews.Content: This resort was exactly what we were looking for. I have stayed at many high end resorts from Florida to Hawaii and this was as nice or better than all of them. Everything was perfect from the moment we checked in to the time we checked out. I was using points to pay for the Island Vista room which was upgraded to a Flagler Ocean view room. After we checked in my wife asked if we could still upgrade again, and when I went down to check Patrick actually apologized for not trying harder to get me to the ocean front room when he told me about it earlier. Everything and everyone associated with this resort were absolutely top of the line. We will be staying here on our next trip to Key West

Reviews.Title: “Well-beyond pleasant!”
Reviews.Author: Hpytrvlmom
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Casa Marina Resort with my family. We enjoyed every minute of it! The rooms are beautiful and very clean! The view is amazing! The location of the resort is perfect; so close to downtown. The pool/beachside at the resort is so nice, though, you'd have no reason to lay in the sun anywhere else! The staff was super friendly, especially a young lady named Meredith! She played with our son for a while so my husband and I could sip piÃ±a coladas (super yummy!!) by the pool in peace! The food is amazing, the service is stupendous, the whole enviornment is truely paradise!! I would recommend staying at the Casa to anyone who wants their Key West vacation to be well-beyond pleasant!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place, great value in low season.”
Reviews.Author: Tiger061
Reviews.Content: Our first visit to the hotel and Key West. The hotel is lovely with very attentive staff. I has a private beach which is rare in Key West. Based on our stay, I strongly recommend the Casa Marina. I will add that we were there in low season which was quite a value, but I do not know the prices in high season.

Reviews.Title: “The only place to stay in Key West........wonderful”
Reviews.Author: slc1
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this hotel we were amazed at the service,cleanliness and utter elegance of this hotel. The bedroom we had was a Flagler Ocean vista and what a wonderful view it was.It took our breath away. The bed linen is of high standard and the room was spotless. Ckeck in was smooth. We did park on the side street to save the parking charge and actually our vehicle was nearer to the hotel than the parking lot because it is across the street. The parking at the front of the hotel is valet only. The pool areas are wonderful,the staff were so helpful and friendly around the pool. No noisy blasting music,just soft mood music playing in the background which added to the wonderful ambience. the pool towels were lovely as were the sun loungers. One morning we sat around the pool,the palm trees were being trimmed and we were given fresh coconuts,the milk we drank was wonderful. We did get a taxi to mallory square for the sunset celebration. It cost $12 and we walked back slowly along Duval Street,soaking up the wonderful atmosphere,having had a lovely meal at the Hard Rock cafe where we thought the prices were very reasonable. It is a short 10 minute walk to the southern most point. I have been to Ley largo and Marathon Key before but had never travelled as far as Key west but it is something not to be missed. We have travelled extensively throughout the U.S and I have got to say Key West is up there with my favourite destinations and this hotel added to the whole experience. I would tell anyone who is unsure wether to book that you will not be disappointed. The hotel is pure understated elegance with service to match.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jmsvss
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Casa Marina in Key West. It is now part of the Hilton chain. Service was excellent, views were excellent, meals were excellent, rooms/staff were excellent, pool service was excellent. What else can I say, it was excellent. The prices were what you would expect at this level. Actually, for Key West I thought they were very reasonable. The location isn't ideal and at first I was a little put off by how far away from "the action" it seemed to be. This turned out to be not so bad. We had rented a car in Miami and driven down. I was there for leisure while my husband was attending a conference. I returned the rental at the airport in Key West and hoofed it for the remaining five days of our stay. It turned out to be fine. I enjoyed the neighborhoods, it is a very walkable city. The internet service in the business center was not good during our stay but that may have been an isolated problem. I highly recommend Casa Marina.
