Reviews.Title: “THE ONLY TO BE IN THE KEY”
Reviews.Author: Pnat132
Reviews.Content: By far the most beautiful hotel in Key West. No other hotel on the island has this view of the ocean. The accommodations were AMAZING! The staff was super friendly & outgoing. First class all the way. Not a trick was missed. The best example of their staff's willingness to please is one day while relaxing in the pool one if the head chefs came out in full attire.....recognizing he was a chef i made a comment about craving a simple pb&j (strawberry) sandwich, which was not a staple menu item because we are obviously not in a kids restaurant, he commented how he agreed it was his favorite sandwich as well. I made a joke how great it would be to have one sent up to my room & provided my room number. About a half hour later a staff member knocked on my door & presented me with the most unbelievable crustless & strawberry pb&j sandwich accompanied by huge berries and a cold glass of milk. It really doesn't get much better than that and I cannot recall ever in any of my trips, and there have been ALOT, a staff member to ever pay so much attention to detail and then to go above and beyond like that to actually accommodate a silly half serious request. It was one the highlights of our trip. Every door was opened for us and greeted with warm friendly staff everywhere we went on the grounds. Poolside service was incomparable to any other....it included towel service (as well as outstanding food & beverage service), mid-day mistings for those really hot days, free popsicles and sample drinks of the day. The entire hotel was maintained immaculately! We heard they had recently completely a multi-million dollar renovation and boy does it show! We love to work out (yes even on vacation) and were pleasantly surprised with the fitness center. Much bigger than most hotel gyms and had everything you need to work off all of the delicious food & drink consumed during your stay. Honestly don't have any complaints other than we can't go back as often as we would like! The Casa Marina is the only place we will stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort grounds, small rooms, & a long walk to the fun.”
Reviews.Author: ladybug1022
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary. We have also stayed at the Waldorf hotel in Puerto Rico, and honestly I don't understand why they classify them under the Waldorf brand. The resort grounds are nice, but I feel like they are trying to make the rooms modern but using cheap Ikea furniture. The room and bathroom are both very small. We stayed in a ocean view room w/ balcony on the top floor. Even from the highest level there isn't much of an 'ocean view' due to all of the palm trees. It still is a pretty view of the pool though. The one plus to the rooms is that the bed is very soft & comfy! The other downfall to the resort is the distance from Duval Street & Mallory Square. It took us around 15-20 minutes to get to Duval. If you want to make it to the far end of Duval or Mallory Square I would guess that it would take 30+ minutes. We took a cab when we needed to go to the opposite end of the Duval strip. On the plus side, the pool & pool bar were nice to hang out at. The hotel also offers a great sunset catamaran trip on Wednesday and Saturday nights for $55 per person. The boat only holds a max of 20 people so it's not a crowded party boat. They also offered some snacks and beer/wine/champagne. This was our favorite part of the trip & I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality at it Best!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: maros63
Reviews.Content: My family and me went to this magnificient resort lat week -end and that resort is spectacular, very upscale and charming. i never seen people so attentive and friendly trying to make your staying perfect and best ever! Thank you Casa Marina!!! Oscar & Martha

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Beach side sunset service "Sun Sun" Resturant Toes in the Sand”
Reviews.Author: harrisnance
Reviews.Content: I was in Key West for vacation and to also celebrate my 25th Birthday, which turned out awesome due mainly to the fact that this location was great to relax and have superb service. I was able to sit out on the beach a couple of hours before sunset and watch a beautiful beach wedding while feasting on appetizers and to top it off with dinner. Chef Ayanna & Chef Oyisle "Oyster" Dlepu made sure that everything I asked for was cooked to perfection. I drank about four Pina Colodas which were to die for they were the best I have ever had by far. If you are ever in the mood for great food and relaxation this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go to the spa”
Reviews.Author: VIPtravelN
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is a beautiful property. We had a very relaxing trip and overall enjoyed our stay. What you see in pictures is exactly what you get. This is not a very large resort so you don't have to worry about getting lost it is pretty easy to navigate. The pools were nice and there were always plenty of chairs available, just wish there was a hot tub. Pool service was often a bit slow but the food was good. Our room was small, but it was fine we did not spend much time there anyway. Housekeeping was sort of sloppy...our bed was made with the remote in it and the amenities were never replenished, but overall not a big deal to us. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY OR TIME ON THE SPA!!! It is not nearly the level of class, sophistication and luxury that I was expecting from a Waldorf Astoria property. We discovered that the "spa" (which is a hotel room) is actually run by an outside vendor and the service was poor. Hands down the worse massage I have EVER received in my life. The beachfront massage is not secluded and you are likely to hear the noise from the beach or the volleyball court. Overall had a great time, if you find a good deal you should check it out.

Reviews.Title: “You won't want to leave.”
Reviews.Author: two4one919
Reviews.Content: We were pouting the day we had to leave this beautiful resort. The stay was comfortable, quiet and extremely relaxing. The resort itself is gorgeous - from the sparkling pools, to the grand lobby, to the sophisticated sleeping rooms. However, the service is what makes this place really stand out. The guys in charge of the pool and beach set up your chairs and umbrellas for you, periodically bring you yummy popsicles and cold towels and are really fun to talk with. The bartenders, Rockin Robin, Suzanne and Jan (voted #1 bartender in Key West) were a lot of fun. It was great spending evenings with them at the beachside bar relaxing in the amazing ambiance. You absolutely must have one of their famous pina coladas - the best we've ever had. The housekeepers did an excellent job cleaning our room everyday and were very friendly whenever we passed them in the hallway. The bellman were always on top of opening the main doors and hailing cabs. This is hands down, the best place to stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “most beautiful sunsets right off the pier & best beach side service ever, the hammocks are great for a eve nap.”
Reviews.Author: scubacinz
Reviews.Content: I was checked in promptly, the room was beautiful. The beach is exquisite & the water clear most days. We snorkeled the entire area & saw many things lots of cool sponges, around the pier is a ton of mixed variety & even saw a barracuda about 6ft, a sting ray, leopard shark, & tons of lobsters. There is a lil seaweed to go thru, but it is worth it. The pool/cabana people were the best service ever, I was always promptly served & the best pina coladas ever! I had a deluxe suite with a balcony, & was very disappointed in the cleaning staff & turn down service, not 1 spoke a word of English & my room was only done correctly 1 night out of 9 day stay, I asked for the queen sleeper to be turned down EVERY night & folded up & tables moved back, floor swept & balcony. It was impossible to get them to understand this. I finally called the manager to the room & let him see it & asked him whats wrong with this picture?! Brandon was very accommodating & took care of it off my bill. I would like to thank him for his service & special treatment. All in All it is a fabulous place to stay, the pier is my fav place with a drink to watch sunsets & YES I will stay there again. most comfy bed next to my own !

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing- Save your money and DO NOT go to the Spa”
Reviews.Author: need2hitlotto
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the grounds are great. The pools were nice and the "Beach" is about as good as it gets in Key West. The water is clear as long as it hasn't stormed recently. Hotel Rooms: Hit or miss. Asked to get another room if you are not happy with the first. The Waldorf Astoria classification is a bit of a strecth. The food is very good, only had lunch. Fish Tacos and Burgers were good. The drinks were good (but hit a liquor store and make you own). The Spa was awful. The service is terrible, people walked in and out of the massage room and talk loudly during our massages. Don't waste your time or money with a massage. Instead, get a hammock in the shade and let the sound of the ocean take you away. Parking- Park on the street for FREE.

Reviews.Title: “Foul odor and visible moulds in hotel rooms”
Reviews.Author: rolafisc
Reviews.Content: We have spent some days around July 4th at the Casa Marina Resort and first got a room with which was very humid with moulds on the ceiling. After claiming so we have been shown a number of other rooms which showed the same disagreeable signe. Finally we got a "dry" room towards a parking lot and hence had to say good-by of spending some days with the primised view to the sea. We would only selectively recommend this hotel and would certainly look for an alternative in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: TpaSunSearcher
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic. The whole family had loads of fun. Ricardo and EJ made the trip extra special with thier hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Very Mixed Review”
Reviews.Author: labrador2
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Casa 2 weeks ago..... Pros - Visually beautiful......nice pools....pretty beach...good fishing from the piers....great outdoor bar....good sized room for 4 ,Ocean VIsta 1 bedroom suite........great beach valets (Tom and Nikko)......pleasant and helpful front desk staff (thank you to Patrick).....location quiet but close to everything. Cons - Very uncomfortable and small pull out couch in living room. Sold as a room for 4, however pull out not big enough for 2 teens so three people in the bedroom king and one in the uncomfortable pull out sofa.........housekeeping lacking...ran out of things like toilet paper,,,,,,Specifically requested FULL OCEAN VIEW. Was put in a semi- pool view with lots of palm trees in the way, Patrick at front desk switched us but don't assume that the 1 Bedroom Ocean Vista Suites are Ocean view even if you request it!!!! Having big problem with an excursion booked through hotel's water sports division......won't go into detail here but if you have a complaint or something goes very wrong, FORGET IT!!! Hotel management horrible about returning phone calls or helping out!!! Still working on resolution! This is not WALDORF CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Happy Birthday”
Reviews.Author: Griffinsmom
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 days at the Casa to celebrate our son's birthday. Our stay can be summed up by the birthday boy's question at departure. "I don't want to leave. Can't we stay?" The hotel is beautiful and the location is perfect. Away from busy Duval St. but close enough to walk to anything you might like. The staff that we came in contact with were all friendly and professional. When we reported that one of the ice machines had no ice someone arrived at our door in less than 10 minutes offering to get ice for us. The watersports guys did a great job accomodating us for parasailing with about 30 minutes notice. We were suprised they pulled it off. We will return to the Casa every chance we have and certainly will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: miamiman1967
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed the Casa Marina in the Florida keys. i was going to stay 3 days but after we paid for our small updated room w/ a view of the parking lot. I thought other wise. $250 a night well get you little service as well. No room service at night. Room was tiny with 2 full beds that were not very long at all my feet hung over the end. i am 6'1. pool area is very nice but i am not renting a room in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, but could use some fine tuning..”
Reviews.Author: Victoriaangel1
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Casa Marina. The location is perfect, and the resort is beautiful! The rooms are spacious and comfortable. We had a one bedroom suite, and it was perfect. We did find the Food Quality to not be as delicious as the first time we went. The Hammocks on the sand are so enjoyable. They could have used a larger coffee shop, and gift shop. We loved the fact that the resort was animal friendly, and we could take our little Chihuahua with us. I have recommended this Hotel many times to friends,but I hope they improve the food quality...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAFF -GREAT EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: leeleenyc
Reviews.Content: My soon-to-be 89 year old Mom and I spent 3 nights at the Casa Marina and loved it! We had a Ocean view room that the staff made sure was easily accessible for her. We enjoyed the room and found the housekeeping staff to be warm and friendly. In fact, we enjoyed all the staff and found they went out of their way to speak to us and be friendly. The beach is lovely -there are plenty of palm trees so there is always shade plus umbrellas. The day we arrived, there had been a storm at sea that worked up the surf and made the water sandy with no visibility. The next morning my Mom and I headed for Fort Zach Taylor State Park as it had been recommended for snorkeling. But that beach was so rocky that you needed shoes in order to access it. When we got back to the hotel we appreciated this beach much more. Plus the water was getting clearer and by the next day the snorkeling was excellent. I saw a 4 ft tarpon about 3 feet in front of me under the pier. There were fish everywhere and it was very enjoyable. However the ocean swimming isn't suitable for children unless they are proficient swimmers unafraid of water that is neck high on an adult. The food at the hotel is great for breakfast and passable for everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Service above and beyond”
Reviews.Author: NorthernVAmom
Reviews.Content: I was in Key West for a wedding with my husband and 2 sons, ages 11 and 12. The wedding was at another hotel. We stayed at the Casa Marina. While we were there, my son was having his 11th birthday, and I invited my whole family to come to the Casa Marina for lunch. I spoke to Ilsa at breakfast and she said she would take care of everything. When we arrived at lunch, the tables outside were set up with some balloons and Ilsa had arranged for the fabulous cupcakes in the coffee bar to be served with candles for dessert (at a very good price.) We had a great time. This was just one example of the helpfulness of the staff at the hotel. From the front desk to the pool attendant, they always went the extra mile to make us feel welcomed. The hotel is beautiful - the grounds with the palm trees and beach reminded me of similar hotels we have stayed at in Hawaii and Costa Rica. We stayed in a 2 bdrm ocean suite which had a king bed in the loft and a king bed in the downstairs bedroom. The only negative was the loud air-conditioner in the loft, so that my son ended up sleeping on the sofa. Otherwise, I would highly recommend this relaxing place. It was great to escape to at the end of the day. (BTW we kept our rental car and always found a shaded, free parking space on the street adjacent to the Casa Marina. The main downtown area is about a mile away, and we would park in the Westin garage for $4.00/hr.)

Reviews.Title: “We were EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED in the accommodations at Casa Marina Key West.”
Reviews.Author: emmakatemiller
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, my husband and I were given an Ocean Vista one bedroom suite that was supposed to be ocean view, but was pool and garden view instead. The $400 per night suite was more like an older run down room with modern furniture (not sure I would have ever sat on the couch because it was dirty looking). The pictures that were shown on the website were not nearly the same as what we got. The pools were over crowded with small children and large floats, and there was no sandy beach entry to the ocean. The hotel service was the absolute worst we have ever had. It was more or less, if you are unsatisfied, then you should leave attitude. That is EXACTLY what we did. We ended up in a fantastic suite at the Pier House on Duval Street. Excellent vacation from there on out. Our 2 friends were stuck at Casa Marina that we were traveling with due to booking through an agent. They spent every awake hour at our resort and have stated they, too, would never recommend Casa Marina to anyone. Don't waste your time or money. It is also a $15 cab ride to Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “One of the top resorts in the Key's, No doubt!”
Reviews.Author: getsmart
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at Casa Marina. My wife and i spent 7 nights at Casa Marina in August. They offer some pretty good deals there in the off season and we took advantage of it. Every encounter we had with the hotel staff was pleasant and professional. The resort location is away from the activities of mallory square and duval street, which is just fine with me. the man made beach leaves a bit to be desired but that's the Key's. You have a choice of sitting by two pools or on the beach. We swam in the ocean just about everyday. The best way to get into the ocean is via the pier which takes you out over the coral and on to some sand and grassy areas which are not uncomfortable for us. The fitness center was one of the best i've found in a hotel in a very long time. I didn't give the resort 5 stars for one reason. when we checked in i was told we'd get an upgrade to a ocean front suite at no extra charge. We got the upgrade to the suite but we ended up behind some palm trees way back behind the pool with no view of anything. I didn't complain. The suite was very nice and comfortable. We'll go back here again one day, i'm certain.

Reviews.Title: “A Waldorf Property, Really?????”
Reviews.Author: ziggy2111
Reviews.Content: I traveled to this property with my family using Hilton Honors points for 4 nights in mid August. The property is beautiful and well maintained. The basic rooms are just that, basic. Rooms at a Hampton are nicer. I ran into some of the same issues other Diamond members have written about, the front desk if Very indifferent. No use of your name, no recognition of your status, and very matter of fact about upgrading your room. Check out was not any better. At noon each day at the pool, they serve a free drink of the day, the gentleman seated with his wife next to me at first did not want the drink, then changed his mind. When he asked for the drink, the young man bring them around said, "dude, I just asked you if you wanted one" Is this Waldorf service? Overall the resort is beautiful, but they may want to reconsider calling it that with the spotty service.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Disappointing "Beach", Not 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: theend451
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay at the Casa Marina through Hilton central reservations a week prior to our arrival. They quoted us the wrong rate, but thankfully the kind manager at the hotel agreed to honor the original verbal quoted rate. We arrived after a long drive from the Miami area and were please with the look and feel of the lobby, but it is rather small and dark. Our room for the stay was an Ocean View King with a separate living area (with roll out sofa). The room looked tired and worn. You could tell they used very cheap drywall when remodeling the room and it was peeling in many places and you can easily hear into the next room. The AC worked very well, but the drywall was wet all around the vents and mold was evident. We had a very nice view from the room and enjoyed it as much as we could. The room does have HD TVs in all rooms, but no HD channels are available sadly. Pros: 1) VERY FRIENDLY STAFF - most all of the staff we met were very helpful and genuinely happy to talk with you (this made up for the hotels faults in other areas). Darrin at the pool restaurant was the best! 2) COMFORTABLE BEDS - better than Westin heavenly beds and the linens were of good quality! 3) NICE VIEWS - especially from the outdoor breakfast area and pool CONS: 1) LACK OF A REAL BEACH AND DANGEROUS STEPS INTO OCEAN - this hotel does NOT have a sandy beach. It is very rocky and you have to walk out onto a pier and down a VERY SLIPPERY set of metal steps (encrusted with seaweed) to get to the water. My mother slipped and fell on the steps and hurt herself while at the hotel. The hotel needs to fix this liability ASAP... it's a lawsuit waiting to happen. Also, why was the lack of a real beach never mentioned on the website? 2) LIMITED DINNER MENU - don't even think of eating at the hotel for dinner. There's barely any entrees to choose from and they are all mediocre at best and far overpriced. We were quoted $55 if we wanted twin lobster tails! The hotel should really have thought of adding an FAMILY restaurant that is reasonably priced to keep the guests at the hotel at night to generate more profit. Hardly any guests at the hotel every evening. The Hyatt in Key West is the place to dine for dinner (best sunset in Key West and FREE sparkling water!) 3) POOR CRAFTSMANSHIP IN ROOMS - drywall in a sorry state, mold issues, dirty walls in room.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay - not Waldorf class”
Reviews.Author: Wardfamilyhgate
Reviews.Content: Had a very good stay with my family at Casa Marina. My points would be: Very nice grounds, two good pools, beach is articficial, but is very large for the keys, you can not really walk in to the sea due to rocks, which are needed, otherwise the beach would wash away as it is not natural. We found the staff very good, free drink and iced popsicle at lunch time around the pool, very good service on the pool chairs etc.., loved the hammocks. Casa is at the other end of Key West to Mallorey Square and the busy end of Duval St. I do not see this is a negative, indeed a positive. Other good quality hotels in Key West are right on the docks, with little privacy. Key West is less than 2 miles wide, it's not far to Duval, and a taxi is US$10. We found a number of decent restaurants within walking distance. We have stayed at a number of other Waldorf collection hotels (Naples Grande and the Waldorf Astoria) the rooms at Casa are by far the worst. We upgraded to a Ocean View Balcony. Be aware standard rooms over look the road, and have no balcony. Even in our upgraded room, the bathroom was very small, tiny bath for kids only, and one small sink. This compared to the Naples Grande, which has a huge bath, walk in shower, and two large sinks. The rooms are more 3* standard, unless you pay for a top end suite. We enjoyed our week at Casa, but more down to hotel grounds / location and Key West itself. During the same trip we also Stayed at Cheeca Lodge and Hawks Cay, both half way down the keys. Both these resorts are of higher quality than Casa.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: rocknrollmama7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for four of the most relaxing days and nights at this wonderful hotel. The staff and I mean all of the staff were freindly, knowledgeable and couldn't do enough for you. We enjoyed our ocean view room and the balcony. Service was supreb! We enjoyed all of the amenities that Casa Marina had to offer. We stayed on the beach and by the pool all day. We loved the frozen wash clothes that the beach guys passed out in the afternoon! What a treat. We are Floridians and we have been to Key West many times we will never stay anywhere else. Close enough to Duval Street. The pool bar and dining was great! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to enjoy your holiday”
Reviews.Author: Shooterman
Reviews.Content: We visited the Casa Marina Resort during the busy Memorial Day weekend but the hotel was big enough to enjoy our stay. We really enjoyed the time on the beach and aside the pools. Breakfast overlooking the water and chameleons passing by really make you really forget about work ;-). The center of Key West might be a little far away from the hotel, but the walk passing the southern most point and through Duval Street shows you some nice visitor points for the tourists (loved the food at the Grand CafÃ© Key West). You can always use the bicycle taxi. For those who don't want to go out at night to grab something to eat, there is the possibility to eat on the beach with a wonderful view on the water. There are also enough activities to book during your stay so you won't get bored. Friendly and helpful staff . We would definitely recommend this hotel for families with children.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book at the spa”
Reviews.Author: Heather S
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Casa Marina. According to the website, they have a lovely spa with all the amenities. In truth, the spa is a room with a few beds in it overlooking the road. Or you can lay on a table on the beach in front of everyone if the weather is good. IF you are booking the spa, ASK exactly what you are getting. Overpriced for the facilities. Hotel is outdated. Front desk personnel confused.

Reviews.Title: “This is an over-priced tourist trap and you should stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: HappySummertime
Reviews.Content: I feel compelled to write this negative review out of a sense of obligation to warn my fellow travelers about money-sucking tourist trap trash. Normally, I would not devote my time to this endeavor. In short, there are far better places to stay in Key West. That is the bottom line. Here are a list of reasons not to stay at this hotel. They are in no particular order. 1. The location is awful. This place is far away from the center of town and there is nothing to see or do near this hotel. You can't even find a place to eat near here. This is perfect for the hotel, since you will be forced to eat their average food and pay gourmet prices. Also, when nightfall arrives (assuming you don't have a car and why would you?), be prepared to pay inflated cab prices to get to and from the center of town. These costs pile up and you will feel cheated. 2. The private beach is awful. If you like rocky, smelly beaches without a shoreline, then this private beach is for you. Don't be sold by the lure of a private beach. In general, beaches in Key West are sub-standard. This place is no different. As a aside, if you are looking to lay on a nice beach on your vacation, do not go to Key West. Save some money and go to Miami instead. 3. The service is not very good for the money. The people at the front desk are borderline incompetent. When I arrived, I was given a room that was already occupied. (Luckily, I heard rustling through the door, which stopped me from walking in on this stranger.) The woman at the front desk apologized saying "I don't know how she got in there" and assigned me to another room. (What a terrible excuse! Great way to shift blame on to the woman in the room. Assuming the woman did not belong in there, what does this say about hotel security?) All in all, we wasted our time here. Don't make the same mistake. I am eternally grateful that we also stayed a few nights at La Concha during our stay in Key West. It is a far superior hotel. Let the morons who did not read this review stay at Casa Marina. I really have nothing good to say about our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location w/a minor but....”
Reviews.Author: DaveandMissy
Reviews.Content: We travel a lot and this hotel is fantastic! After a week cruise out of Ft. Lauderdale on Independence of the Seas, we rented a car and drove to Key West for a week at Casa. The drive was all we thought it would be and more. Just beautiful. The grounds were beautiful along w/the pool and friendly staff. We had a balcony room with an ocean view and it was superb. Rented scooters from the hotel and they let us use them longer than the 24 hours we paid for at no additional charge. Got a couple parking tickets downtown so be careful where you park. Made for an expensive lunch (+$70). Sunsets at this place are incredible and seem to last forever. Upon checkout, I asked the gal "what is the one thing missing at this resort that would make it a perfect 10?" She got it on the first try. A hot tub! That would be my only negavitve, but it is more like an absence of an ammenity vs. a negative. Would go back in a heartbeat even w/o the hot tub. It's just one of my things to be out in the hot tub at night under the stars w/a stogey and an mp3.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds”
Reviews.Author: Laffites1815
Reviews.Content: Nice place and right on the water. Not many hotels in Key West are actually on the water with a private beach. Location is far enough away from Duval Street to get some peace but only a $10 cab ride to the crazyness. The staff is helpful and you can always find someone around if you need anything. The rooms are a little expensive for their size but who really wants to spend that much time in the room when you are in Key West anyway? The grounds of the Casa Marina are the nicest in Key West - awesome. I enjoyed laying in the hammocks on the beach under the palm trees. I would certainly recommend the Casa to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: Roxanne1
Reviews.Content: I was wary after reading the mixed reviews, but we loved it. I would not stay anywhere else in Key West and believe me, I walked around and into other hotels. The hotel is beautiful, the beach is nice, lots of fish under the pier. The staff was extraordinary. Our 1-bedroom ocean view room had a view of the pool and the beach. I would not recommend this hotel is you want plan to do the Duval Crawl every night or hang at Mallory Square as those areas are on the Gulf side of the island. We walk a lot so we actually walked from the Atlantic Ocean to the Gulf of Mexico a couple of mornings of our stay. We had a rental car because we drove from Miami, but we walked or took a cab the entire time in Key West. The island is only 2 miles wide so not too far to go, narrow streets, and not much parking. We did not eat at the hotel as it seemed overpriced and there were many restaurants and less inexpensive places to eat around the island. There is a little Cuban restaurant a block away with $5 breakfast sandwiches....and a little store that sells beer and wine.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in paradise”
Reviews.Author: gschaafs66
Reviews.Content: There is no better hotel in Key West. The Casa Marina has the nicest pools, the biggest beach (one of the only hotels in KW with a beach), and the highest level of service of any of the places I've stayed in my 30 or so years of visiting. The main restaurant is excellent , and the menu for food and drinks at the 2 large poolside cabanas is perfect for a leisurely lunch or dinner. Did I mention the spa and workout facilities, and abundant parking? How about the coffee and pastry store? Perfect for families with kids, romantic getaways, business conferences, weekend get-a-ways, etc. This place is where you'll want to stay. We love the combination of the old-school charm of the original Flagler hotel combined with the recent renovations and the updated luxurious touches.

Reviews.Title: “Best Stay You could possibly have in Florida”
Reviews.Author: tdiluver12
Reviews.Content: Service was so friendly and helpful. The room my family and I was beachfront, and air conditioned, which we appreciated. It is now a regular stay. My family has been going since 2007. The food was outstanding, especially the beach/poolfront smoothies. Pools were equisite, both of them. Definitely a spa resort type of place. Beach is pure sand. I look forward to going again!

Reviews.Title: “A terrible day until...the service turned it all around.”
Reviews.Author: idiotsrule
Reviews.Content: Want to quickly relay my experience at Casa Marina back in April `10. The hotel is very nice (albeit a stretch for the "Waldorf" classification) and the location/beachfront cannot be matched. However what blew me away and has galavanized me as a permanent patron is a horrible day we encountered. Through a complete cluster-F snaffoo with the front desk, we had an recurring issue with maid service scheduling due to the fact that we had 2 Chihuahuas with us. These snaffoos set off a series of other blunders with trying to schedule our day and enjoy KW. After our day was shot, I asked for the Manager on duty at the time. Turns out the Manager on duty (Cindy A.) was actually the night manager filling in. To make a long story short, this Manager received my numerous compaints with complete professionalism and immediately jumped into action with a series of offerings to make good on the blunders. IN short, her attitude of "we're going to do what ever it takes to make this right" was beyond exraordinary -- an attitude that is almost extinct in the realm of customer service today. My wife and I were both so impressed and validated on our complaints, that suddenly Casa Marina was the best resort we had ever visited. A little over embellished, perhaps, however Cindy definitely understood the platform that positive customer service can reverse a negative experience all day every day. The net loss to the hotel was probably $50 in F&B charges, but what they gained was at least 10k in future guest profits from our stays to come. Not a bad ROI. In this day and age, sales people are glorified for the "acquisitional" sales home runs all the time. However when a professional like Cindy saves a relationship--and in turn solidifies future "retention" sales--that is the grand slam.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Getaway”
Reviews.Author: reactance02
Reviews.Content: Views, landscape,beach, ocean clean and beautiful. Rooms, service, food great. Staff friendly and courteous.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and Charm”
Reviews.Author: jobybonnot
Reviews.Content: Great stay, worth every peny. On the beach (which is rare in Key West), great history and charm and away from the busy Duval street. Kind staff that always says hi and welcomes you. Definetly want to go back soon. I am sue it is hard to find a better place on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Service With Old World Charm as Ususal..........”
Reviews.Author: Baker6689
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to the Keys and Key West for over 20 years and could not dream of recommending a resort other than the Casa Marina. The old world early 20th century charm combined with Waldorf Astoria elegance and service is incomparable. I love being able to walk to the night life Key West is so noted for, but also being on a private beach. The Casa Marina is definitely in it's prime......I did stay at an alternate resort on one of my travels and will never make that mistake again!! I just saw a news report a couple of hours ago that mentioned 25% of Americans think that the oil in the gulf has reached the keys........This could not be further form the truth. It is not remotely close and the water in the keys is as beautiful as it has ever been.........

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - would go back”
Reviews.Author: whodatqueen
Reviews.Content: The hotel doorsmen greeted us when we arrived on a shuttle from the Key West airport. We received exceptional service from the moment we walked into the beautiful lobby. The grounds are well kept and the property is on the beach. There are plenty of hammocks and there always seemed to be a breeze. There are two pools. We had an ocean front room with a refridg. A circle K convenience store is within walking distance as well as a fabulous wine store/bar. Our room was clean and spacious and we had a ocean front balcony. It is worth the money. My only complaint about the room is the walls are thin and there were some very loud noisy drunk guests hanging outside our door at 2 in the morning but this is not really the hotel's fault.. `The food at the hotel is a bit expensive. The bacon cheeseburger was incredible and worth the $16. Really. We enjoyed a fantastic tapas-style dining at Louie's Backyard. What a dining experience that was. I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel and the super friendly staff made me feel welcome and pampered.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Manager is a Disaster for a Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachesdb
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to this hotel for 30 years and have not had a bad experience until now. I'll keep it short and to the point. I lost my wallet on a boat trip with my credit cards, cash, and DL. I spent the better part of Friday morning organizing western union money and Visa 911 to arrive on Saturday. I brought my passport so identification was not a problem, and I was certain my cards were not in the wrong hands so I didn't have to cancel them at that time.. Heres the problem regarding the front desk manager Maria: I had an account with the hotel as all travelers do when they give them the credit card. I needed to put a small amount of cash on my hotel account to catch a cab to obtain the cash from WU. Not only did Maria say no, she never came out to talk with me directly, but rather she pawned it off on Dan the front dest clerk who was nice. I was totally humiliated as I had to walk 10 blocks to western union. Fortunately, several guests saw what transpired, and that I was limping due to broken leg rehab and offered me money for the cab. Thank god for those guests and thank you! I will repay you by helping someone in need...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to relax”
Reviews.Author: antmarcos
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience, to stay at this hotel, I really loved everything about it, pool, beach, room, lobby, service. I want to come back soon also liked the sister hotel. Good job :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfect beach location”
Reviews.Author: karlaisatthebeach
Reviews.Content: Definitely the best part of our key west vacation. I loved the pool/beach/pier area. We had dinner on the pier on our last night and it was perfect. We ordered the specials from the restaurant and the chef came over to ask what we thought of our dinner (delicious!). The hammocks on the beach were great. My only criticism is that I wish there were more of them! The beach was not good for swimming but it was hard to find anywhere in key west that had a rock-free beach. The breakfast buffet was also great. Everybody at the hotel was very nice and willing to help. We had the island view room which was for the most part very clean and luxurious. My problems with the room were mostly in the bathroom. Specifically, it was very small and hard to manage with my young family. The shower head was not detachable so it was difficult to give the kids a bath. However, I would go back to this hotel in a heartbeat. Next time, I will probably try the suites.

Reviews.Title: “2nd visit and great again!”
Reviews.Author: Ohwee
Reviews.Content: Wife and I spent a week here recently and once again, it was a great stay! The grounds are beautiful, beach is raked nicely every morning and staff is very friendly and attentive. We stayed here last summer and both times were fantastic. Our room was nice and clean with a great ocean view. Had dinner outside our last night and food was excellent. So this makes twice we have had great stays and nothing at all bad to say. Casha the manager is also very nice. We brought her some SC peaches this time! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced and nothing special”
Reviews.Author: aubergine100
Reviews.Content: We were very much disappointed with the Casa Marina Resort that we stayed at. This was our last stop at the end of our long road trip and we were booking somewhere that we thought would be really luxurious and somewhere where we could feel well looked after and hence were willing to pay a for it. Having stayed there we didnâ€™t feel looked after and considering the price you were paying for it you really felt short changed for what you got. The overall feeling you got from the hotel was that they tried to provide you with the minimum service/facilties for the maximum charge that they could get away with. On arrival we found that there was a $25 compulsory resort fee per day that you had to pay for staying there and using their pool/beach and other resort facilities. And yes, it was compulsory, so why would you not include it in the initial room price? We were not aware of this till we arrived and we were surprised we had an extra charge for staying there when we had already paid for the rooms. If the room price was $25 per day extra we would have still booked here as that was a small cost compared to the overall price we paid but to come here and find out that there were other non-transparent costs really annoyed us. We do not expect that kind of approach when you pay that much for somewhere, and that generally reflected the overall approach of the hotel. They were not interested in making you feel good or in you having a good experience during your stay, they were more interested in maximising their profit for the least effort. The service was pretty poor. We often had to wait a long time to get through to the front desk on the phone. Once I got through and the guy put me on hold, I waited ages before it went onto voicemail and then cut me off. The guy didnâ€™t even have the courtesy to call back after that. We also requested to move room as we didnâ€™t want an adjoining room. They didnâ€™t have a problem moving us but they kept us waiting a long time while they sorted it all out and I didnâ€™t feel like they made any effort in trying to do it quicker as were just in limbo mode waiting to get on with our day. The one positive thing was that the resort pool and beach area was pretty. However, the pools themselves were quite small for the amount of guests there and were always busy. If you wanted to swim you had to wait till the evening to get the space. The beach itself was fake. Itâ€™s good enough if all you want to do is sit around on it but if you want to go swimming in the sea then you had to go onto a pier that takes you into the sea but the water is still murky there with lots of seaweed that I would not recommend swimming there. The restaurant had extremely limited choice of food, and you quickly get very bored of it. First time we went the waiter forgot our order so we waited an hour to be served. Although you are meant to have waiter service in the beach area (as part of your â€˜resort feeâ€™), they were always too busy that you had to go and order at the bar or restaurant. Most hotels we stayed at had free wifi and a free printer connected to a common computer. Although wifi was â€˜freeâ€™ (meaning included in the resort fee), it didnâ€™t work by the pool area and any printing had to be done at the business centre which had excessive charges associated with it. Generally speaking we got the impression that the management wouldnâ€™t go out of their way to help you and were not interested in you having a good experience. After we checked out and got to the airport my husband realised that he had left his hat in the room by mistake. We called and asked if they could send it on the shuttle bus or to put it in a taxi to the airport. It was only a 10 minute journey from the airport and we said we would pay for it so we thought it wouldnâ€™t be a big deal for them but it would have been really helpful for us as it would have saved us time from going back to collect it. In their usual unhelpful way they refused. They said that their shuttle was busy for the next couple of hours and they wouldnâ€™t ask a taxi. My husband then went back to collect it himself and found out that it was a lie that the shuttle was busy, it hadnâ€™t been used since our last trip to the airport and it no further bookings on it either. We got better service and facilities at much cheaper places we stayed at in our trip. It was a total waste of money and we will not be going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: elmame
Reviews.Content: WOW--- this hotel is fantastic-- from the minute you step foot on this beautiful property to the minute you leave you are treated like you are special--- Everything about this hotel is fantastic--- the people who work there, the facilities, the choice of restaurants, etc. etc. I could go on and on--- and especially the staff--- one gentlemen stands out for his superior leadership-- Mr. Rodriguez- I will never forget this wonderful stay-----

Reviews.Title: “This was a great Hotel, Great location but a little pricey!”
Reviews.Author: MD45
Reviews.Content: The service was great and all the employees were exceptional. The only problem is that if your not willing to pay $800 a night for a good sized room then don't travel with kids! We stayed for 3 nights, great city and great atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elizabethsOdessa_FL
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, great location for family visit as it on the southern end, away from Duval Street, yet still close to everything. Prompt, friendly service. Minor glitch of not hot shower taken care of immediately and all of us loved the popsicles they gave away each day! Clean beach to relax and enjoy the beautiful ocean and sunsets.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible sound proofing”
Reviews.Author: geocache5
Reviews.Content: The management is aware of the problem, but year after year, they haven't fixed the noisy rooms.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip to Key West”
Reviews.Author: kathefox
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is an excellent resort! The rooms are well appointed, the resort is super clean and the staff is very accommodating. There is not really anything negative to say. We had a quiet ocean view room, which was practically on the beach. Of all the resorts we have stayed in all over the world I would say it was the best view we have ever had. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and the "Toes on the Beach" dinner dining was great. We had a young chef named Ayanna for dinner each night who came to our table and conversed with us individually. She was also a fabulous cook! We didn't taste a morsel of bad food during our entire trip. If we had to do our stay over again we would do less tourist stuff and relax on the beach in a hammock at the Casa Marina more.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beaches, welcoming staff, and a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: vness46
Reviews.Content: We were pleased to stay at the Casa Marina in Key West. The rooms were clean with pressed sheets and a modern sophisticated decor. Located right on the beautiful beach, you have the choice of sunning poolside or by the water. The noon-time cocktail samples were my favorite! And the Key Lime Coolada was to die for. The staff was very attentive and the accommodations were worth every cent!

Reviews.Title: “Uneven experience”
Reviews.Author: KeithLAtlanta
Reviews.Content: Overall the Casa is very nice hotel but you need to compare with other similar resorts on island Pro - Beautiful resort and updated dÃ©cor - Courteous staff, very consistent - WiFi access - Plenty of chairs by pool and beach - Plenty of good recreational activities located on property for convenience - Free drinks ad popsicles at pool in afternoon - Breakfast buffet was great and fair price - Nice private beach - Nice pool bar - Private pier Cons -Elevator broken for 2 days -Ice maker broken for one day -Door to room was very hard to close, reported on first day but they never came to fix it. -Key stopped working and they had to reset electronic lock -Standard pool, nothing fancy -Young woman who worked concierge tried to be helpful but did not know the town and rates well I asked her a couple of standard key west questions and see had to Google to find answers - Recreational rentals were greatly marked up - Resort charge did not really give you much other than WiFi and Towel service. Other -No shuttle to town, cab cost $3 per person each way, a little too far to walk but possible I had 6 people so around $25 each way. -Self park $15, Valet $20 -

Reviews.Title: “all looks and no service”
Reviews.Author: terarhea
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend went here for 8 days. The hotel is beautiful....kind of. The carpet in the interior hallways smells like mold. Every day the two pools had all kinds of nasty things floating in them like chunks of sunblock and bugs and dirt. It stated in the room that housekeeping would be provided between 9 and 4 daily, but there were a couple of occasions where the housekeeper didnt come to our room till 6 or 7 o'clock at night. The website says wireless internet.,,, it is available at a kiosk in the lobby or you can buy service from AT&T for $16 a day which seemed misleading. Also the service in the dining areas is horrible. I was at the pool and asked a waitress to place an order. She never came back. 2 hours later i finally got another waiter and asked for a menu. It took him 45 minutes to bring a menu.. and when he brought it the menu service had changed to a limited menu. So I missed being able to order normal food by 15 minutes...even though I had tried to get something for like 2 hours. The valet staff was awesome. The guys were very knowledgable of the area and always super friendly. They do have an awesome fitness center too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: CRSFortWorth
Reviews.Content: Resort was absolutely beautiful ... great relaxing vacation .... although occasional glitches, service was spot on! If not concerned about paying for everything, highly recommend! Try Louie's Backyard (walking distance) for fantastic seafood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aztraveler2
Reviews.Content: This Spring, we visited the Casa Marina Resort in Key West. This is our third visit to the resort and we enjoyed our stay more than ever. This visit all construction was completed. The facilities are nice to excellent. Rooms are a bit small and show some wear â€“ even though they were remodeled recently. The pool facilities and outdoor bar areas were great. The staff was very accommodating and friendly. In fact, I think the staff is the true gem of the resort. We had an issue with the wireless internet service in our room and Cindy, one of the front desk managers, moved us to another room where better service was available. If you plan on using the internet, do check your room placement. We met many guests having difficulties. In short, the Casa Marina is a great pace to stay. Itâ€™s not in the heart of the Key West hub-bub, bit it isnâ€™t far either. We hope to return soon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: roxxisoxx
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina July 6-8 in a first floor suite with our 2 kids, aged 6 and 9. We loved the location of the room and the proximity to the ocean and the pool. The lanai made it possible to sit outside while the kids rested or see them as they played in the sand. The beach staff went out of their way to accomodate every guest with beach chairs and towels. On multiple occasions, I saw the guys run to help guests before they could lift a chair on their own. The check in was wonderful and the concierge helped us find two wonderful restaurants- even one on the way back up the Keys after we had already left. The resort was a good mix of families and couples and everyone was respectful of each other. I would highly recommend this resort and we plan to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular Property”
Reviews.Author: IrmoDP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week here for our anniversary. The hotel is beautiful looking with a spectacular view of the ocean. We had a corner suite on the first floor looking at the water. One of the best rooms I have ever stayed in and I travel every week. Maid service was excellent for cleaning times, towels, and turn down service every night. The pool and beach are a great place to relax. They have a drink of the day, popsicles, and water all afternoon. We had dinner here also one night and were pleasantly surprised. They set up tables on the beach and we had a romantic dinner as the sun set. They also hae a very good work out room across the street. The buffett breakfast was pricey at $21.95. We just ordered off the menu and it was reasonable. A little to far to walk to Duval street. We rented bicycles and took cabs at night. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A must see and stay resort.”
Reviews.Author: erickb07
Reviews.Content: I stay 4 days here and it was amazing right on the beach 2 pools my daughter loved it. Id really like to mention some of the employees I tried to remember names so here it goes. Desmond he remembered us from dinner the night before, Teresa, Darren all worked in food and beverage.There was a hostess that worked breakfast very nice to my daughter. The whole staff was very nice i enjoyed my stay very much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel if you are looking to lay by the pool”
Reviews.Author: kttk
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel maybe 30 minutes before check in. Our room was not ready. The front desk girl said she would call me when the room was available. She never called and I waited, sitting right in front of her desk in the lobby. Luckily they had a nice lime refreshment in the lobby to take the edge off the afternoon heat and rehydrate while waiting for our room to be ready. About an hour later I went to the girl and she said she called me and my room was all ready. Anyway I had no missed calls and no messages. Not my favorite way to start a long weekend. For sure, I did not like the dishonesty! Good thing I didn't need her for anything else during my stay. FIRST TIP:There is a ton of street parking. Do NOT pay $15 a day to park. You can park on the street. It was my first time at the hotel so I Was expecting updated rooms given the millions spent on the renovation. Housekeeping was under par for what I expected, like leaving dirty glasses in room, trash cans just tossed into the room. The rooms were more Westin. We had no view but we didnt pay for the ocean room suite either. The hotel grounds are just lovely. The pool areas are beautifully laid out with fountains, plenty of towels and chairs and properly staffed. Lots of places to sit outside enjoy the weather and the stars in the sky. The property boosts a large private beach. Although true, Key West is not known for amazing beaches. I wouldn't even go into the water due to the preservation of wild life, i.e. massive amounts of sea weed and giant fish. NEXT TIP: do not go to key west for the beach unless you like seaweed. I had a gelato that was delicious from the hotel store but the counter girl was not friendly. The hotel is about a 15 minute walk to Duval street. It's a great idea to rent bikes. We rented bikes from the hotel..they were a little more expensive (LIke $5 more for the day rate, maybe?) than the other places around but convenience is worth it. Not sure if I would stay again at this hotel. This was my 3rd time to Key West. Better values elsewhere. At checkout I mentioned to the front desk guy and the concierge that we were checking out early because of a reality show on motorcycles leaving the island at 11:00 a.m. They had no idea about the "massive traffic jam road race" on the islands going from the key through Miami. Key west is a small town why did I hear about it at Sloppy Joe's. Glad I didn't need to ask them anything during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely would stay again, super nice, great service”
Reviews.Author: sparklesque
Reviews.Content: We used Hilton points to stay 4 nights last weekend, and it was a wonderful experience. When we checked in, they had upgraded us complimentarily to a suite (newer rooms, not orginal to the hotel). It was a great room, with 2 TVs and a sitting area, but the bedroom was right next to the elevator vestibule, which made it very noisy. I went to the front desk the next day, and they were eager to make me happy and move me to another room with a king bed. I had wanted to stay in the original part of the hotel anyway, and they let me look at 3 different rooms to choose from in the historic part of the hotel. They were not suites, but the room was big, comfortable, and quiet- perfect. I liked seeing the different rooms too, since their layouts were all different. Our room was outfitted with a book about the history of the hotel, which was very interesting. The staff was so attentive, especially at the beach. They would set up your beach chairs, install and umbrella for you, and even put a little table next to you. There were hammocks on the beach, 2 pools, and a good restaurant for lunch. The hotel store which sold sundries was way overpriced, but what can you expect from a hotel store. Although they didn't have a free shuttle to/from the airport, they did offer a van ($8/pp) to take you there. Taxis were plentiful, Duval street was walkable if you are reasonably fit (20-30 minutes), and the whole experience was great. Beware of the pedi-cabs that roam Duval. They are fun, but it cost us $15 to pedal us to the hotel (minimum charge). The taxis were around $8, and they had AC. Breakfast at nearby Blue Heaven was worth the wait to get in on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing hotel, so far the best hotel I ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: Alisha578476
Reviews.Content: I would certinaly recommend this hotel. For our vacation we traveled around Florida and finished up in the keys and I can say that out of the 6 hotels we stayed in, The Casa Marina certainly made a great impression on us! Its ideal for a honey moon, so romantic and so many activities in the area which keeps you occupied by the day! while we stayed we went jet sking, parasailing, snorkling and sunset cruise. The staff are very friendly and helpful and rooms were very clean and modern!

Reviews.Title: “Best in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Pizzyp
Reviews.Content: Resort was very nice with a few exceptions. -- Pools were a little dirty and salty, need to be clean more often -- Rooms are nicely appointed and service was good -- Grounds are beautiful and pool side eating/service is great -- Location is ideal, away from the busyness of Key West -- Get a good bottle of wine and sit near on the beach or outdoor bar area at night, enjoy the view -- Park car nearby on the street for free, -- Last but not least, I rated the sleep quality low b/c above our room, I heard noises all night long, shufflling, walking, our room was 245. I asked the staff, which room is haunted and was told, room 345 was the one. They mention the haunted room in a book on the history of Casa Marina hotel, included in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: MichelleDance
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina is a lovely property, providing you with the spaciousness that much of Key West does not. (Visited 6/21-6/27) Our room in the original building was very large (easily accommodating 4 adults), small bathroom, excellent beds, and very clean. I did learn that the room sizes vary in the original building (all with high ceilings) so you might want to request a particular room or chat with someone on-site about the rooms. The new wing has more uniform room sizes with lower ceilings. There seemed to always be an adequate number of front desk staff for the amount of traffic through the lobby. The two lunches eaten on the property were very tasty with good service and not terribly high-priced considering the views (4 for $60). Beach staff were always available for chair set-ups, drinks of the day at noon, and Popsicles at 2. The two pools were clean and very popular. Our preference was definitely the hammocks under coconut palms on the beach. With the size of the beach and layout of the property, we simply felt like we had room to spread out, breathe and relax.. The staff was considerate and attentive, property was attractive, spacious, and clean. We look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Anniversary Celabretion!”
Reviews.Author: Paolo17-33
Reviews.Content: Great location, excellent service, clean and confortble rooms. A great value and location!

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Reception”
Reviews.Author: debondeweb
Reviews.Content: Service at this resort is outstanding. Staff is extremely helpful, friendly and always accommodating. As far as the event coordinator, Ronnie, and his assistants I can't say enough positive remarks in this review. They are exceptional: creative, accessible, organized, the list goes on and on. All my overnight stays this past year have been in preparation for my daughter's wedding and reception and I am looking forward to returning to this resort to enjoy their amenities and relax!

Reviews.Title: “An amazing getaway”
Reviews.Author: HenleySTL
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank all of the staff at the Casa Marina Resort for their amazing level of service that my wife and I received on our recent vacation. We did not inform the hotel that it was our anniversary, but we received a basket of fruit and a balloon during out stay. Patrick at the front dest was more than accomodating. My wife really desired a balcony, and Patrick was able to switch our rooms during a very busy week to simply make us happy. I travel a lot, and most of the places I stay are "ok" with customer service, or you simply get what is expected. With this trip, we were blown away. Thanks to all of your who made this happen.

Reviews.Title: “Went for rest and relaxation and that was...”
Reviews.Author: rrohling
Reviews.Content: Went for rest and relaxation and that was what we had. Casa Marina was very nice and the location was wonderful. We were within walking distance of everything. Great time.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!”
Reviews.Author: notinonespot
Reviews.Content: Great accomodations! The property has maintained the original intent of the designer / builder; elegance. Friendly staff. Could use more drink / food service on the beach. Other than that, an easy 10!!!

Reviews.Title: “Husband had business, family had a blast...”
Reviews.Author: angiegid
Reviews.Content: We still can't get over the beauty of this hotel and never want to forget this trip. I visit the hotel website to rekindle the memories of the vastness of this beautiful place. The employees are very nice and welcoming. We can hardly wait to go back. The water and sand is perfect, along with everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Tony_Spurlin
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful and relaxing vacation to Key West for our 24th anniversary. The Casa Marina is a beautiful resort. Overall we received great service from all of the staff and bartenders. The Flagler Ocean View rooms are pretty much your basic old style hotel room with a tiny bathroom and NO balcony. We highly recommend avoiding these rooms as they are just above the Ocean View suites that have wooden deck balconies. So when our downstairs neighbors decided to come back from partying until 4 AM they headed to their balcony, slid the chairs all over the place and continued their partying. It sounded like they were in our room with us. After a couple of early morning wakeups, we contacted the front desk and security was sent to quiet things down. We believe that they checked out the following day and our night's sleep went undisturbed from then on. The next time we decide to go to Key West we will be sure to book an ocean view room with a balcony in the newer part of the facility, which is pretty much a modern hotel construction with concrete walls and floors. The facility is very well maintained and the private beach, pool decks and public areas are always clean. We never had difficulty finding a chair by the pool or a seat at the outdoor bar.Although there are several hammocks, they were sometimes difficult to find available. Drinks and meals are very expensive at this resort. The breakfast buffet is $20 per person and ala carte will still run approximately $20 each. Tropical drinks are $8 each and need a bit more alcohol to make them worth the costs. They always offer drink specials so keep on the look out from them. The drinks specials of the day were hit and miss but they always offered LandShark beer for $3. Overall we enjoyed our stay in Key West and at the beautiful Casa Marina. Our only complaints were the room we booked and the cost of the food and beverages. We hope to come back to Key West as we really enjoyed our vacation but we will use these lessons learned to ensure our next stay is even better.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place, mediocre space”
Reviews.Author: honeywhite
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Marina for a long weekend in June. We arrived fairly late in the evening, with several bags, but there was no one at the door, and therefore no one offered to take our luggage to our room. The sole desk clerk seemed bored and annoyed to be checking us in, and when asked about the location of the SCUBA shop the on-site watersports facility had booked early morning dives for us the next morning, proclaimed ignorance and said "I'm not from here, I don't know." Great, off to a good start. We booked a one-bedroom Island Vista suite, and found our way there--to a first floor room, next to the elevator (DING!!! all night long) and ice machine. On top of it, we were inexplicably given a handicapped room. While I am very happy such rooms exist for folks who need them, my husband and I do not need such facilities, and would prefer they remain available for those who do. Ordinarily I would have asked for a different room, but it was late, we were tired and just wanted to crash (somehow I suspect the indifferent desk clerk would have claimed unavailability anyway). The room turned out to be quite inconvenient for us, however--the bar in the closet was at half height--obviously necessary for guests who are in a wheelchair, but meant that our clothes were dragging on the floor, and some ended up needing to be hung on the shower rod. There was a dearth of shelf space, and only a single towel rack in the bathroom. The room itself was spacious and fairly clean, but the furniture (particularly the living room sofa) was beat up, cheap and uncomfortable, and there was fairly constant noise from the road, hallway, elevator and ice machine. The next day, however, we saw how beautiful the grounds were--the beach was lovely, there were two nice pools (though these were party central all weekend), the fitness room was completely unattended, but there were plenty of machines (unlike fitness centers at higher end hotels, however, no water for those working out). We liked the beach bar and the beachside restaurant, service was generally pretty good (though maid service was spotty--wet towels left on the floor for replacement were still there, in a heap, after cleaning). We were generally able to find chairs poolside, and the attendants were friendly and eager to please. During the day, we were also able to see that the small balcony off our room, while primarily an underwhelming view of the road, also caught the edge of the public beach around the corner. The topper, however, came on our third day there--I came face to face with a huge cockroach in the shower. Now, I know that the beauty of FL comes with a price, and that roaches are just a simple fact of life in Florida--but not necessarily at a supposed four-star hotel. When we checked out the next day, I mentioned this to the front desk clerk who just shrugged and smirked, but did not offer any sort of apology. As we had a late afternoon flight, I had asked for late check-out, but the desk agent snorted as said "check out is ALREADY noon!" but then said they could extend to 1pm. Gee, thanks. So while we absolutely loved Key West, and will definitely be back, I don't know that we'd return to Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean Views!!!”
Reviews.Author: pam692003
Reviews.Content: We went to the Casa Marina for our honeymoon. We loved being taken care of. The staff was very helpful in suggesting different places to eat and things to do. We can't wait to go back. The Ocean view rooms are just that. It was beautiful the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Idyllic”
Reviews.Author: TheStracs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the first week in June and had a fantastic time both at the hotel and in restaurants around Duval Street. The hotel staff are excellent as were the facilities - the food, pool and the beach and of course swimming in the warm sea was a luxury.(We come from Britain and you usually need a wet suit to keep you warm in the sea! ha ha). Key West is a great little island very relaxed, try getting around on cycles its great fun - everyone does. We highly recommend this hotel and Key West.

Reviews.Title: “If you need to relax and feel pampered, this is the place to go. Florida is still open for business”
Reviews.Author: reedtl
Reviews.Content: This was the first time staying at a Waldorf Astoria property and I don't know if I can stay at any other chain again, because I don't think anyone can measure up to the service and accommodations I have become use to. Where to begin.....The resort is not to big, but it has everything. Water sports, spa, beautiful beaches & two great pools. We also had access to another Waldorf property, but why would you leave when you have everything already. Every couple of hours the staff would come by at the pool and beach and offer a sample of the drink of the day, popsicles or frozen wash clothes to cool you off in the hot afternoon sun. I never had to ask for anything. The staff was amazing. If you are planning a trip to Key West, please take a look at the Casa and plan on staying there soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jimwoodbury
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went for our 15th anniversary just before Memorial weekend and really enjoyed the property. First off, there was NO OIL anywhere. In reading some of the negative reviews, I was puzzled after going there because this is a pristine property. The grounds are immaculate if you like the look of a top property. The beach was great (only a few hotels with beaches in K.W.) They also have two big pools. The room was very clean and quiet, they are not huge rooms and the bathroom is small, but we gladly sacrificed the room size for the property. It is a high end resort. I do travel a lot for work and it rates higher than most properties I stay at on business. It's a ways away from Duvall street where the restaurants and bars are, but we rented a moped which is a great way to explore K.W. I highly recommend this property. Jim from Minnesota...

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk prevented the stay, kind of......”
Reviews.Author: hjslaw
Reviews.Content: We came to Key West in late May during the week without a reservation for a particular hotel. So we checked out some in the late afternoon. The Casa Marina has beautiful grounds and a fair stretch of beach which looked very nice. Also, the whole atmosphere of the place when entering through the front door shows class and style. However, upon asking for a room we were left with only two options: 1 standard room facing the back of the hotel i.e. the parking lot and the street or a suite with ocean view. Normally no problem, this can happen if you don't reserve. The strange thing was only that checking on the internet a few hours before and after this moment all room categories were available. I cannot imagine that we just picked an hour in which all these rooms had been taken and that they were cancelled shortly thereafter. So the indifference shown by the front desk employee may have been the reason why we didn't end up there. Maybe we will give it try next time though because it looked promising.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: STLWildflower
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled down with our infant. The staff was amazing from the time we arrived. I've read other reviews about difficulty checking in, but we had none. We arrived shortly after 4pm the check-in time during Memorial weekend and had no wait. True to other reviews I never saw more than one person at the front desk. Our room was clean and comfortable with a large patio (we stayed in an Ocean Vista One Bedroom suite). The pools were relaxing and never crowded. I loved the daily drink of the day and popsicles passed out at the pool. The beach was huge and very clean. The hammocks were fun to relax in. We ate lunch by the pool almost everyday and the food was excellent. For the food quality the resort food prices at lunch were reasonable. We only ate breakfast at the resort once and I do not think the buffet ($17pp!) was worth what you pay. With all the wonderful places to eat on the island try somewhere else. I've read where some other guests walked to Duval St, but we never tried. It was farther away than I thought it would be. Scooter rental wasn't too expensive (we rented from somewhere off the resort) and a cab ride was around $8. The resort grounds are absolutely gorgeous. Casa Marina was such a nice place to have a relaxing beach vacation!!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina - Great Location, Comfortable services and amenities - room, not quite resort-like.”
Reviews.Author: MariHara
Reviews.Content: There's a lot we liked about the Casa Marina. Every staff person we encountered was professional, efficient and friendly. The location was far enough away from Duval to give me the laid back I needed, but close enough that we could easily walk when we wanted a night out. Beach services were a lovely touch - assistance with chairs, tables and umbrellas, cold towels late in the afternoon, complimentary drink of the day samples and popsicles. I'd say the Beach Services staff were the highlights of the "resort" experience, and probably the only part that really merited that category. The pools were lovely, waterfront easy. My big disappointment is that when I think "Waldorf Astoria" and "resort" - I've got some higher expectations. Concierge service was intermittent - there's not a manned station, and the timing for when you could catch the concierge was hard for me to figure out. If we played it right, either Chrissy or Don was there with menu and restaurant options and willingness to assist. But when no one was there - which was often - we winged it on our own, and didn't have near the results. There's basically one restaurant/menu in the entire property. So if you're staying there for a week like we did, the same core menu grew tired quickly. We were there over a holiday weekend, and really expected to spend most of that weekend there at the hotel, to keep away from the chaos of Duval Street over the holiday, but the menu choices had us spending time and money off property much earlier than expected. Even though there is a sister property, The Reach, nearby, which has a high end steakhouse, it meant a good walk, so if we were walking we weren't going to waste the evening on a hotel restaurant. Beds comfortable, hot water aplenty, all the basics covered. The room was underwhelming in every detail, efficient, but underwhelming, especially in the bathroom. Felt only slightly larger than a cruise ship's - but no counter space to speak of, and really no place to even hang a towel, much less 2 or 3 of them. I'd stay there again and would recommend it - much was good about it, but I would definitely be very aggressive in looking for a real deal on the room rate. And i would just reset my expectations that I would be staying at a hotel, not a resort, and at a Hilton, not a Waldorf Astoria. And I'd plan on not dining much at the hotel at all, which is great for Key West and its restaurants and bars, but sure seems a missed opportunity for the Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: dash1_98
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Casa Marina Memorial Day Weekend. Thoroughly enjoyed the visit. CM is a quality hotel with very good service. Really enjoyed Key West -- but dont really recommend it for kids -- too many adult-oriented themes, sites; a lot of drunken partyers and really seems targeted to open-minded adults (even more-so than Vegas, which has a lot of kids activities). Here are my pros and cons (obviously subjective, but we travel a lot and are fairly picky): Room was very nice and spacious, but needs a dresser (just a few shelves in the bureau and a closet for clothes). The cleaning service was spotty (they forgot to come one day). Bed turn down 2 out of 4 nights. I thought the bed was way too soft, but my wife liked it. It was one of the moderate rooms and I give it a B+ -- like a Westin. Grounds were very nice; pools were nice, but very crowded. I was impressed that the staff actually removed some towels off the pool chairs when it was obvious that guests were just reserving them all day. I was also impressed that the staff actually checked room i.d.s and caught "pool crashers!" The staff needs to pick up garbage around the pool more. Staff were attentive for food, drinks, towels, chairs (and umbrellas when available). My wife and i enjoyed playing some of the pool-side games (but they are in need of repair). Pool bar was good, but service was spotty. A resort fee of $25/day includes wifi (but they charged me $15 on top of that and I had to have them remove it at check out??) and a very good fitness center, as well as good pool service, plenty of towels, but not enough umbrellas. Concierage(s) and front desk staff were good and steered us correctly to : Hot Tin Roof" for sunset romantic dinner (pricey but perfect an A+ experience; A&B Lobster House (excellent); a local Cuban place (El Sinoway???); Blue Heaven for breakfast (great but a 1 hour wait -- hint: put your name down and then go do the Hemingway house tour and come back!). Nachos at the touristy Margaritaville were awesome (and we are not into touristy places!! We rented bikes for a day and I scuba dived the USS Vandenberg, booked through the resort's water sports shop (biggest complaint, the water sports folks changed my scuba charge after the event without ever telling me; had i not checked my bill at check-out I would have paid an extra $40. I caught it and the front desk took it off without an argument, but I was peeved.) The resort is located in the "quiet" south part of the island so you will need to bike or cab it everywhere ($12 to Mallory Square -- but if you share a cab 1/2 that amount). We really enjoyed the Resort overall and rate it pretty close to a 4 star "Westin-like" experience

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: Drroady
Reviews.Content: A Memorial Day weekend stay here proved disappointing. The physical property is nice, and the hotel has no doubt spent tons of money on this place, but service falls short. Realizing in advance the place would be packed for a holiday weekend, I was expecting some inconsistencies, but overall, they fell way short. Our Friday poolside lunch turned into a 2 hour fiasco. The overpriced food was good, but the service was poor beyond imagination.
