The young lady waiting on our table of 3 was clueless about service - no water - no drink refills - no silverware - no condiment offerings- nothing, When I went to the service area to get water for the table, (after having been seated for 30 minutes) someone asked me what I needed. My reply was, "we'll take anything at this point." We left 2 hours later and did not eat at the hotel again. I was also disappointed that the hotel had no inside dining, although it really didnt matter since we were not eating there again. The advertised indoor dining room, we were informed, was only open for "special occasions." Apparently Memorial Day is not a special occasion to this place. The main bar is also permanently closed, only allowing a small afterthought of a "bar" aside the overpriced sundry shop. Our suite was full of termites. We were told we could not move because the hotel was full - full of termites, full of themselves, full of what? This was an unacceptable explanation. A gesture of perhaps spraying would have sufficed, but this is, apparently, too much to ask for a $600 room. Expensive? You bet it is. Worth even half the price; don't even think about it. And a Waldorf Astoria Property? You've got to be joking. Check out the Waldorf in New York and you'll see the difference.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: wears_trousers
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina grounds were always immaculate, service was always polite and prompt. If you want to just go back forth from your room to the pool or beach and have everything taken care of for you, this is the place. But it will cost you! Pros: -Service was great and attentive. It takes some getting used to that staff will carry your beach chairs, bring you towels, an umbrella, or a tasty frozen drink if desired. You can even have your lunch brought to you beachside or poolside. The $25 resort fee covers all this, except your food and drinks, which are extra. -Quiet. There were families with kids and even some type of corporate event going on when we were there, but our room was totally quiet, and we never felt bothered by anything else that was going on when we were outside. This place is nowhere near the bustle of downtown, and the beach is private, so it's very relaxed. -Everything is available from the hotel. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner, or you can have room service. You can have a beachside massage. You can also rent a scooter, bike or Jet Ski, as well as sign up for fishing excursions from a kiosk on the property. Cons: -Meals and drinks are expensive on site. $10/drink if you want to sip a pina coloda by the pool, as I did. Room service and restaurant service are both equally expensive. Food is good, as are drinks. But we never had a meal that was under $40, for breakfast lunch or dinner. -Scooter/bike rentals, same as above. There was a place in town that would rent scooters for $25/day, it was $60/day from the resort, I believe. But then you have to somehow get back to the resort after you turn in your scooter, so I suppose you would spend what you saved on a cab anyway. -If you will be going into town a lot, this is probably not the best place for you to stay. I saw posting that you could walk back and forth from Duval, but it is a long walk, and not one that I wanted to attempt on days when it was 90 degrees. We would sometimes walk back in the evening, that was bearable. But once you include tip, most cab rides ended up being around $20, so you end up spending a lot on transportation. To Sum Up: My husband and I wanted to sit on the beach for a few days and not do much else, so Casa Marina was perfect for that, they catered to our every need. We really enjoyed being pampered, as we are both usually frugal travelers. So if you want to splurge, I would recommend Casa Marina. If you are trying to do Key West on the cheap (which I don't think is possible), this place is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Pure paradise”
Reviews.Author: fmmord
Reviews.Content: First rumors dismissal:There is no oil,oil residue,tar balls or any other oil related substance in key west.The private beach of the Casa Marina is immaculate and pristine as ever. Weather could not have been better .Temperature in the mid 80's very little clouds,winds or humidity. Of course the hotel is beautiful,the grounds imaculate There is a feeling of seclusion if you desire ,or ,activities if you desire .But what truly made our stay special is the quality of service we received.Two names I would like to mention for the outstanding quality of attention they gave us are Don and Charles at the front desk. Truly high achievements.My wife and I highly recommend this property for a great Key West experience with a Resort flair . Patrick and Faith B

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ringolewis
Reviews.Content: I would like to thank the entire staff at the Casa Marina for a wonderful stay. My family and I had a great time and it was made better by the outstanding staff at this property. Patrick at the front desk is a rock star, treating me like royalty when I checked in and throughout our stay. He truly makes your resort function once people walk in the door. I believe Patrick is a great addition to your staff. Also, Desmond from South Africa seemed liked he was our server the entire time we were there. He was quick with service and always around when it seemed like we needed each other. We stayed in room 219 and not sure what our cleaning ladies name was, but she too went above and beyond to make our stay fabulous. The night bartenders out by the pool were very friendly and hard working as well.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place !! Had an amazing week!”
Reviews.Author: Barbrook
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel - with great rooms, good service and a fab pool and beach to spend lazy days. It is a bit of a walk to Duval Street for 'the action' about 15-30 minutes. But we didn't mind a srtoll and we usually came back in the evenings in a cab which was only about 8-12 dollars. We had a lovely time here, with no problems at all. Staff were very helpful and the staff that brought us iced water every day while we sat round the pool were brilliant!! The food served was great and we had good meals here in the evening too. Would ceetainly recommend and go again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: bluzrif
Reviews.Content: What a great piece of Key West History. The grounds are beautiful and the views from the rear of the hotel were amazing. It looked like a postcard with the coconut palms and blue water. Great Hammocks lined the beach, which were completely empty one evening and it was like we had the whole beach to ourselves. Our room was upgraded since the first room did not have a beach view, and the second room was wonderful. Breakfast in the mornings at the buffet were wonderful and relaxing. The only 'negative', is the location, but we rented a scooter and had a blast getting around town. This could be a positive though, if you don't like being in the mainstream ALL the time. can't wait to go back

Reviews.Title: “HAD A GREAT TIME, POOL AND GROUNDS WERE WONDERFUL”
Reviews.Author: Lebanon_TNFoxey
Reviews.Content: The pool and beach were great !! The pool area and wait staff were awesome, especially Derrin, he always brought our drinks the fastest. Cute too!!! Valdimir was a close second though. The pool area day supervisor was great with recommendations on where to shop, eat and local things to do. Thanks for the info on "keno's", you have to buy a pair. We rode bikes everywhere we went. Also if your a runner, make sure you run alone the beach, it's beautiful. The only negative was the front desk staff, a little disorganized and maybe short staffed.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a luxury resort, but with luxury prices!”
Reviews.Author: tmazza27
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival I was surprised to see so few employees in the lobby area. The checkin process seemed to take very long. I was surprised by the decor - it was very fresh and beachy but didn't really look very special. We stayed in a Jr. suite - emphasis on Jr. The couch in the sitting area looked worn and dirty. The furniture looked ok fromt he outside but contained no drawers - just very shallow shelves. I kept my clothes in the suitcase for the entire trip. The bedroom had very little space around the bed but the actual bed was very comfortable. There is no restaurant inside the hotel so you have to eat breakfast or lunch outside - not horrendus but we had to order room service at night if we didn't go out.- over $100 for dinner for 2 people. The chicken wasn't bad - the same meal was served at the wedding the next day, which took a little of the "specialness" out of it. There was never any extra TP in the bathroom - I had to take one from the cart that was outside my room - unattended. Don't bother to print out your boarding passes - they even etyou for that. It cost me $24.50 toprint out 3 boarding passes even though they show you a number of $7.0 - I guess that was per minute!!! With the $25.00 a day they charge you as a resort fee ( for things you probably wouldn't use anyway) they could at least throw in the darn printing!!!! How petty can you get? I will say that there was one really nice employee who go me a pen, paper and a phone to use when I needed to call my room to get a credit card number to be able to use the printer. When i got home, 2 days later a charge of $345 shows up on my debit card. I had canceled a room 2 days prior and you are supposed to give them 3 days notice. It was nothing that could be helped and I was told that someone would get back to me the next day.Of course no one did so I assumed that all was well. Guess not! With all of the wonderful places to stay and visit - the Casa Marina won't be on my list.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel and Island”
Reviews.Author: RLDCIM
Reviews.Content: We wanted a unique destination vacation and since our son is only 17 months old had special considerations. We settled on Key West and did plenty of research on this site before booking at the Casa. We stayed 7 great nights. Make sure that you get an ocean view room as the other rooms do not do this hotel or property justice. (we switched to an ocean room with balcony after the first night) The beach at this hotel was perfect and much larger than we anticipated. We enjoyed having diners in the sand and the staff was very attentive to our Childs needs. Key West itself is easily walk able and we would not touch our car rental for days. NOTE: You CAN park on the streets in the surrounding neighbourhood and avoid parking charges from the hotel. We loved the restaurants in Key West and felt that the Casa's waterfront restaurant ranked right up there. Blue Heaven was also a favourite and we went back a second time. The back porch was decent as well. Defiantly go the Butterfly exhibit a few blocks away and take the time to soak up Duval Street. The staff was responsive and friendly, the hotel has charm and history behind its updated look. All in all a great time at a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with friendly staffs.”
Reviews.Author: vvivi
Reviews.Content: Great location, private beach, 2 pools. We stayed for 4 nights and had a great time in this hotel. Manager Jeff is friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!!! A Must Stay Destination in Key West!!!”
Reviews.Author: mt996294
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best resorts that I have stayed at in some time, and my wife and I are already trying to find an excuse and way to get back to Casa Marina. Here are some of the key points I must emphasize: 1) The hotel staff was the most polished, professional and customer service that I have experienced. They blew the staff at the Ritz away, and they left a lasting impression. From the minor details of calling you, and pronouncing it correctly, by your last name to making sure that every detail was addressed, they were on top of it. Unfortunately, we were only able to stay two nights, but they were extremely helpful in making sure that our stay was perfect. In addition to being great, they did go above and beyond. I misplaced my BlackBerry and digital camera late Saturday night, and within 12 hours of noticing that it was missing, someone on their staff had located it and turned it into security's lost and found. They called that afternoon, and they arranged for shipping and both were back in my possession within 2 days. I was astonished by the integrity and honor of their staff to do this, and in this day and age it is unfortunately rare. This alone saved me decades of grief from my wife because our pictures would have been lost forever. 2) The whole experience of the property was wonderful. They had two pools that were well serviced by the staff. They were walking around all day providing drinks and food all day long. We didn't move for hours on Saturday, and they even walked through with free 'drinks of the day' (must try every one!) and also free popsicles to help stave off the 90 degree day. This was one of the few resorts that I saw with two pools, full service bars, and a beach. The whole place had a feel of Havana in the 20s, and they even had tons of hammocks between well matured palm trees. The rooms were perfect, but who really stays inside at Key West? 3) Food and drinks - absolutely the best mojito I have ever had. We got in at 4pm on Friday (drove from Miami) and all I wanted was a drink. We checked in, they took our bags to the room, and we headed to the bar. We got some apps and both had a mojito (handmade) and kicked back and looked at the aqua blue of the Atlantic and watched the sun start to set. We had some of their peel and eat shrimp, and they were some of the best that I have had. The next day we had breakfast served to the room, and were able to sit on our patio and take in the morning. Food was just good (not the best heuvos rancheros), but all in all not bad. Now lunch was a whole different story, we had a beer and I had the fish n chips, and she had the blackened sandwich. First the portions were ridiculously big, and the fish was hands down the best that I have ever had. I need the recipe for their breading as it was almost funnel cake like, and the fish was cooked to the perfect temperature. 4) Spa services - can you say couples massage on the beach??!?!? We didn't check out the rest of the spa, but what we got was perfect. The masseuse I had helped get rid of every knot in my body, and she took away every piece of stress that had been building for the past two years (two kids and a profession will do that!). My wife hadn't had a massage since she was pregnant, and said this was the best that she had ever had. 5) Romance - this place was so very quiet and the scenery was perfect for a romantic getaway. When we got back from Duval on Friday night there were flower petals throughout our room - I never ordered nor did my wife, so they were on their a-game to know this was a special weekend for us. Overall this was one of the best, if not the best, weekend getaway we have had. I can't think of a better place, with better service, with better amenities, or a better location than Casa Marina. Only thing that I would recommend is staying 5+ nights to enjoy everything that Key West and the Casa Marina has to offer!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: wjsmks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Casa May 6-8. We found the service and the staff to be attentive and courteous. Everyone was very accomodating. The room and the grounds were impeccable. Everything was clean and beautiful. The food at the pool bar was good, although costly. We did not have breakfast or dinner at the hotel. There are too many options in the area to stay in one place. At check in, we arrived around 2:30 and our room was ready. We were escorted upstairs by the bell hop who was very helpful bringing our luggage upstairs. When we checked out, it was found that we were overcharged for the resort fee by $10, and the front desk attendant immediately credited us for a free night of parking. We were allowed to store our luggage at the front desk while we continued to enjoy the facilities of the resort until we had to leave to catch our flight. The room (island vista one bedroom suite) was very roomy and clean. Tthere was plenty of room to store clothing in the bedroom and personal items in the bathroom. Although the view was not the greatest, we enjoyed sitting out on the small balcony. The bed was very comfortable and we did not have any trouble with the housekeeping service. The room was made up promptly each day. All in all, for the money paid, this was a very nice resort in a very nice location. We thourougly enjoyed our time at the Casa Marina and would definitley return to this hotel and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton with a nice beach”
Reviews.Author: cartercsdad
Reviews.Content: Just stayed on May 7th weekend...all of the preceding reviews we accurate. The rooms were Hilton quality (not Waldorf). The beach access was nice and views were amazing. I enjoyed sitting a hammock and reading by the ocean. The hotel is very quiet away from Duval street. If you on the more conservative side, stay here. If you like to party, chose another place. The best part of the hotel was Front Desk Manager Brandon K. He made me feel welcome and every concern valued. He is very knowledgeable about the property and the Waldorf Collection. I highly recommend you ask for Brandon when you are there. He will make your stay special.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort for a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: lahardy96
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Casa Marina for a week. The hotel was very nice, and perfect for our trip plan of a relaxing vacation. We relaxed by the pool or on the beach during the day. Most staff were very friendly and helpful. We were able to book excursions from the hotel, and were even picked up at the hotel for our snorkeling cruise. The pools were great, very clean, plenty of sun or shade (depending on your preference, and we adjusted often). The food at the breakfast buffet was really good (although we only had it one day as it was a bit pricey). The lunch menu was limited and pricey (as expected at a hotel), but allowed us to be lazy during the day. If you like massages, ask for John - he was fantastic! Only two complaints. One - the room walls were a little thin, so we could hear quite a bit going on in the room next to us. Two - it was at least a 20 minute walk to Mallory Square. We like to walk, but it was a little far (especially in the heat). We were able to easily (10 minute) walk to the conch or to the end of Duval Street (where we would eat breakfast). However, we had a car, so we just drove downtown each night, which worked out fine as there is plenty of parking (but bring plenty of quarters). Check the hotel's website for deals. We were able to get the 5th night free. Just a warning, they do have a daily fee that isn't optional for wi-fi and other services.

Reviews.Title: “Almost Paradise”
Reviews.Author: BostonRich617
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights last month and agree and disagree with some comments in other reviwes. Yes the grounds are beautiful and pool area is first rate. We had great front desk service as they handled our early arrival( 2pm-they checked our luggage and asked for our cell phone numbers) and they did call when the room was ready. They also arranged for a oceanview room request at check-in , We were willing to stay in a balcony ocean front for only one night just to have the experience. The next morning the front desk guy saw us in lobby called us over to say we could have room for our second night!. Bed and pillows gave us the best 2 nights of sleep we had that week. Our two warnings are :that guests need to be aware that hotel seems to be a hot spot for convention/company outings. There was one going on during our stay( complete with a night beachfront party for 200, with a band) We enjoyed the show from our balcony, but others might not enjoy the sound.We also met people around town who had just left a company function at the Casa and we met others who were just arriving for a company event after our stay. I still don't know what we got for the resort fee- Pool was the pool, beach was the beach. No additional watersports ( available for additional cost). And we parked on the street for free.

Reviews.Title: “Best beach front hotel in the Keys.”
Reviews.Author: johnydolittle
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 weeks in the keys and stayed here for 5 days and the place was amazing. The only thing they need is a hot tub, how can they not have a hot tub? They have 2 pools and an awesome beach with 2 piers. Stayed in an ocean front ground level room that was very nice. Modern decor and walking out the patio to the ocean was a plus. Wish they had a way to lock the patio doors if you leave the room that way, but no biggie. Our room number was 110. They have a little store and a coffee shop. The breakfast and lunch was good at the beach bar and they have beach service to bring you food and drinks which was nice. They also have cabana boys that carry your lounge chair to your area on the beach. The food was good, priced like any other upper end hotel but not crazy. Bartenders were nice, there was one young lady at the bar that was awesome, however I forgot her name. If you are interested in renting any water sports, bikes or mopeds they have a place on site, however they are more expensive than other place in and around Key West. Their mopeds for the day were $70 and we found then a few blocks from the hotel for $40. All depends if you want the convenience of renting right at your door. Hotel staff was nice other than one assistant manager/ manager donâ€™t remember his name either, however he acted and sounded like one of those annoying rich dimwits in the movies with the sweater tied around his neck. The best thing about staying here is the beach and the view, not good for sunsets or sunrises, however very pretty during the day. It is only a 5 min cab ride to Duval was $7 or $8 bucks. The wireless internet is a joke and doesnâ€™t work that well at all. Kinda on the pricey side, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: PJFoyt
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with solid attention to detail and service. There is easy access to wave runners, bikes, scooters right on the property, which is ideal. They also set us up with a wonderful charter boat experience with snorkeling, a private island stop and a delicious lunch - provided by Islescapes. Also, the two pools were great...

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, beginning to end!!”
Reviews.Author: MonicaRiv
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Casa Marina from 4/12-4/18/10. We had such a great trip, from beginning to end! The staff was so friendly, accommodating and far from stuffy. The rooms were well appointed and very clean. The bed was comfortable, the closet was a good size. I have only good things to say! The resort grounds were maintained beautifully, with green grass, mature palm trees, and swept walk ways, which was a great thing when you walked through with flip flops on. The beach is one of the best, if not the best in Key West. The cabana guys were great! At noon they bring you the drink of the day and at 2:00 they bring you popsicles. What's better then that? Oh, and don't forget to tip them, they absolutely earn their tips! As far as the hotel restaurant goes, we did not have breakfast or dinner at the resort, but we did have lunch on the beach a few days. Everything we ordered was good. Oh, and don't miss out on the Key Lime Colada! Do yourself a favor and order one! Before I Forget, the location was great too! If you are someone who doesn't mind a walk to the main attraction (Duval Street), then you will love the location. It's far enough away that you don't have any disruptions at night, but close enough to take a great walk in the morning for breakfast! I think we took 3-4 mile walks every day. It was about a mile to Duval Street. At night, we would take a short cab ride to wherever we went to dinner, and we always ended up walking home. Probably because of the alcohol we consumed during the course of the night, but that's besides the point. The walking was a great way to come back from vacation and still fit in all of our clothes! Overall, we had a great time at Casa Marina and cannot wait for our next trip! This was our first time to Key West and we LOVED it! What an awesome town! One last thing...my husband was not entirely enthused about going to Key West, especially, since we drove from Miami. However, he has since changed his tune. The drive was SO much fun! I'm not sure I'd want to do the drive with kids, but as a couple, we had a blast. It's beautiful! And as for Key West, if you are having reservations, don't. The town is so awesome! There's so much to see, do, drink and eat! There are some outrageously AMAZING restaurants. If you are going and would like some of our favorites, I will be happy to give you recommendations! Contact me!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Tink3
Reviews.Content: It was our first time in the Keys and I can definitely say we will be back. We stayed at the Casa Marina which was a beautiful, clean and friendly resort. When we arrived our rooms were not ready so they told us to go sit outside at the bar and they took our cell phone number and would call us when the room was ready. It was just about 4:00 when we received the call. We went to the room and it was just beautiful. It was on a corner on the 3rd floor and was a Ocean View Junior Suite which had views of the Ocean and Pool. The balcony was really big and had a huge plant, table and 4 chairs. Our room had a sitting room with table and chairs, couch and coffee table and a longer buffet style table that held the TV, espresso machine, refrigerator and safe. We had a separate bedroom with another TV and huge closet to hang or clothes. The bathroom was a decent size and supplied all the toiletries we needed and plenty of towels. We ate breakfast at the resort twice. It was very good but I thought a bit pricey. I would suggest taking a walk up the street to the Deli or Duval where you can get a buffet breakfast for $8.00 instead of $21.00 a person. You could also order off a menu but even that was pricey as I got steel cut oatmeal with fruit for 9.00 a bowl. We always ate dinner in town so never tried the resort restaurant. Our first night we walked to Duval and just grabbed snack food at Sloppy Joes. It is about a 2 mile walk from the Casa but we never minded the walk or the sites. Sloppy Joes was a really fun place and when we were done grabbing a bite to eat we headed out and hit all the other favorite spots on Duval such as Irish Kevinâ€™s, Hogs Breath, Aqua (fun transvestite show) and had a blast at all! Our Second night we walked up to Duval Street to have dinner at Black Fin. We ate outside in the back area which is outside and the owner Michael was so nice and accommodating. He really went out of his way to please all of us. I had the pink shrimp and they were delicious. Everyone raved about their meal and all of them had a beautiful presentation. I would definitely suggest Black Fin to all who visit the Keys. We hit Willie Tâ€™s after dinner and what a fun spot it was. Marcus the guitar player had us all up dancing and he played for 3 hours straight without a break. If you every go to Willie Tâ€™s and Marcus is playing you are in for the time of your life. On Tuesday night we headed over to Latitudes to have dinner. This is another place you MUST do. It was such a beautiful place and the food was outstanding. You go to the Westin and get a boat pass which brings you over to a private island. The new Latitudes just opened a week before we arrived. It was simply beautiful and breathtaking. We had a table for 6 out on the beach and it was such a beautiful night. I would say do not go to the Keys and not have dinner at Latitudes. They even greeted us at the dock when we arrived. We spent most of Wednesday out on the water fishing for 6 hours. Captain Rob was an excellent captain and the 6 hours flew by. We caught a ton of groper, a shark and two 100-150 pound Tarpins. This was my first time fishing and I really had a great time and was happy I went. Captain Rob told us of a nice dinner place called Michaels where we can bring the fish and they will cook it up. It was off the beaten path of Duval but an excellent place to dine. We had a wonderful night at Michaels and apparently it is a place that many locals frequent but we were happy we found it and were able to enjoy the great food and atmosphere. Our last day we rented a golf cart and traveled around to see all the sights such as the southernmost point, Hemmingwayâ€™s house, Key West Light house and Mallory Square. It was a fun day and we loved driving around in our 4 person golf cart. We rented it from Tropical rentals and we found they had the best prices if you wanted a moped or golf cart rental. I was sad to leave when the time came but certainly left knowing I would be back. The Casa Marina was absolutely beautiful and everyone who worked there was so nice. We enjoyed sitting at their bar and getting a drink before and after dinner. We would have a quick snack or lunch each day and enjoyed it very much. They made the best pina coladas and I really over did it. I would definately return to the Keys and the Casa Marina as well. I had a wonderful vacation but not sure if I returned well rested. With so much going on in the Keys who can rest.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, excellent service, and will go back!”
Reviews.Author: jackofalltravel
Reviews.Content: My frieds celebrated their wedding here this weekend and everything was fantastic- food and service. Great experience from the pool-side service to the food and beverage- definately not a bargain, but everything met my expectations for a high-end resort. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “High end resort- one of the best in the Keys”
Reviews.Author: AOC59
Reviews.Content: Lived up to expectations as part of the "Waldorf Group" Beautiful grounds, nice "Keys" beach, very clean, excellent/friendly service, all watersports/bikes/scooters available on site, great fitness room, pool side drinks/dining, "on the beach"- literally - dining. Across the island from the old part of Key West/Mallory Square- walkable, ~ 2 miles. Our 2 young teenagers loved it. Liked free daily NY Times. Downside- it cost$ to be in a nice resort . Complaint- Still can't figure why this and other hotels still charge for wifi($15/day)

Reviews.Title: “Lost its Historic Charm-no longer special”
Reviews.Author: traveltina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Casa Marina many, many years ago & it always serves as such a special memory of what I liked about Key West. Historic, tropical, authentic, quaint. I'll never forget walking into the dark wood lobby with those sideways tropical fans oscilating. It was very much "Hemingway" style or what we now refer to as "Tommy Bahama" style, I would guess. Sadly, today, it is like a generic hotel-anywhere--all white paint & finishes--attempting to be chic. The pool, while lovely, is just nothing special--it could be any Miami hotel.... We actually stayed in a suite. Very small balcony view of a side street. A little side view of the public beach. There was some noise from the street-but nothing bothersome. The suite definitely did not have any sort of a "wow" factor to it. Just white, plain, clean but zero luxury. One curious thing was, although I would say the hotel was "clean", the shower glass walls were so cloudy with soap film that I could not believe it! I have NEVER seen this in any hotel, particularly not in a "luxury" hotel. Not sure what the problem was there... Overall, I was disappointed that they "whited out" this lovely historic hotel. I am sure a first time visitor would be happy with the resort, but I was just plain disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: mcohen1
Reviews.Content: Don't expect anything but a parking lot view from the Island Vista rooms. Comfortable hotel, good food, nice beach front.

Reviews.Title: “If you get the opportunity, This resort is a must see”
Reviews.Author: flyboy84
Reviews.Content: This resort has exceeded all my expectations. I would stay no where else when visiting Key West. You would not get the whole experience of Key West if you skipped this resort. From the friendly staff at the front desk, the helpful valet in front that took my lost luggage to my room and called my cell phone to let me know after the airline had it delivered, the friendly employees on the beach that check on you often to make sure you have everything that you need. Rooms are very clean and an excellent view. This resort has everything you need. You can rent wave runners, bikes and scooters right at the hotel and have them billed to your room. This resort is walking distance to Duval Street. Very romantic dining on pier with tiki torches after dark. Don't rent a car, you don't need to. There is all kinds of transportation. Take the trolley tour. They will pick you up in the lobby. Get your ticket early and you can ride all day, get on and off the trolley as much as you like. They will even sell you the trolley tickets in the lobby and bill to your room. The guides on the trolleys will give you all of the history of the island while you ride!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: bamagirlGeorgia
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Casa Marina for Spring Break this past week. THe hotel was fabulous and the service great. We loved the waiters attention while on the beach and pool side and the other wait staff and front desk service could not have been better. This hotel has a great location... a little off the beaten path but just a short walk to the Duval Street. We ate breakfast at the hotel buffet every morning and the food was good and service excellent. We have already planned a return visit this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: camcf5
Reviews.Content: Our family of five stayed four nights over Easter weekend. We were told that the hotel was fully booked. However, with the exception of breakfast, the hotel, pool and beach did not seem crowded. Plenty of seats at the two pools and beach. The staff at the pool and beach were very helpful and accomodating. As is typical, food and drink is on the expensive side. Stayed in an one bedroom, ovean view room which worked well for us. We walked to and from Duval Street for dinner each night. Plenty of good retaurants that offered kids menus.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: bubsTampa
Reviews.Content: This is my second trip to the Casa and my family just loves it! The staff is wonderful and the food is great. Would highly recommend it for everyone!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful historic property, but that's about it.”
Reviews.Author: Homergirl
Reviews.Content: If you are going here are a few tips: 1. Self park your car on the street, and avoid the $20/day valet, which is right next to where you will park. Completely safe. Just drop off your family/partner with bags in front and park. on sidewalk. Plenty of parking. 2. Stay away from the island view suites, or rooms, it just overlooks parking and hvac units. Go for the ocean front, but make sure it faces ocean, not the pool with a peek at the ocean, that just isn't fair. 3. Breakfast albeit easy, wasn't worth it, go to Sarabeth's in town. Worth every penny. 4. if you are noise sensitive, ask for a room at the top level, and not an adjoining room if one exists. Trust me. REVIEW Waldorf Astoria? Aren't they built on "creating customers for life" they need a serious reality check. All staff members, including management, need to go back to hospitality school and retrain, and then train some more. Here are some examples of our stay. Check in: No one there at front door to assist. Because it was pouring, and the front walkway of tile was like stepping on ice. I went down a couple of times, no staff anywhere. Check in desk; Was supposed to get "high floor away from elevator" called the front desk twice to confirm this request before arrival, and was given ground floor right next to elevator/ice machine. Instead of suggesting something else, the woman at the front desk merely stated "there were no more rooms she could give me". So I politely suggested "even if I upgrade?" and then she, completely bothered, had to check, and found a semi-oceanfront room on the top floor albeit next to the elevator, but with a $50 a day increase in price. SOLD. I also booked the "winter escape" package, which she claimed was not so, and she never suggested that she assist me in finding out what happened, she just told me that I needed to show her in writing (which I eventually did) where I booked it. No apology. No one including reception asked to assit with bags, or suggested where our room might be. Which was out the door, to the left, through a cocktail paty wedding reception, elbow to elbow asking them to 'excuse me" as I trudge to my room. Which was in the third building on the left. Room: One bedroom Ocean Suite- I have seen Ikea furniture look better than this. The furniture is clearly low quality and not comfortable, it was, badly beaten, and not very clean. No window opens except the slider to the balcony, so you were forced to have the a/c on regardless. Which was located in the bedroom which faced the pool and the reception of the wedding. Bathroom had one tissue left, very little toilet paper, and mold in the shower. No big deal. The lighting was terrible over the mirror, and there weren't any special touches, like a close up mirror, lighting over the mirror. Bedroom was just a bed and a tv with closet, nothing special, no personal touches or anything to make it feel cozy. Biggest downfall of the room was that if you had a neighbor, you could hear EVERYTHING through the double doors. This was not nice. Ask for a room without this feature if it is even possible. All four days we were here were clearly catered to large parties (wedding/business travel parties) and it showed. It was very noisy until at least 11:30 at night with party goers enjoying themselves, which is fine with me, as long as it isn't disturbing. Food: I had to send back two breakfast entrees. But we generally stayed away for food, too much to eat/see in town. Pool: At least during our stay....the other guests were pigs, who were here to drink and leave their crap blowing into the pool. The cabana boy was pleasant and couldn't be more eager to please you, which was refreshing. He was clearly overworked and was running a lot. The free drink of the day was pink lemonade and vodka, in a small sip cup. C'mon.......And the free popsicle at 2pm, was a joke as the staff had to fish out most of the wrappers from the pool 10 minutes later. Spa: I didn't partake, but it is oceanside in open cabanas, there is no spa here, so you are in plain view, and most likely a volleyball game is going on right next to you. Sounds relaxing right? Staff: Most seemed foreign. Nothing wrong with that, but they never greeted you, most looked down as you passed. All in all, this hotel has SO MUCH potential. They clearly need a better GM of this hotel to manage it properly. If they could upgrade furniture, standards of cleaning, and train staff to address issues with grace and poise they would have my repeat business. But for $400 a night, not including the "resort fee" with the "Waldorf Astoria" name, it just isn't worth it. I would rather stay at a Sheraton and pay half the price. At least there I know what I am getting.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: traveler10173
Reviews.Content: Absolutely gorgeous grounds. Was like paradise, absolute luxury. Did not want to leave! The rooms did leave something to be desired in terms of decor, but the beds were super comfy, and the room was very quiet. Loved the pools and people bringing us drinks. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only downfall was the location because it was a little far from all the action of Duval St, but that did make it quieter and more peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great time and will definitely return again.”
Reviews.Author: ctrice
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Casa Marina and we were very pleased with the service and the amenities. We were particularly pleased and impressed with Patrick Anello, the front desk attendant that handled our check in and check out, as well as some other items that came up during the course of our stay. This is not to say that the rest of the staff did not do a great job, but Patrick went that extra mile to insure that we were satisfied with our accommodations and enjoyed our stay. Patrick is a pleasure to deal with, he is straight forward and efficient while retaining a sense of humor that is delightfully engaging.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! Great place to spend our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: BrussoDallas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina 4-4 - 4-9 for our honeymoon (we got married in Islamorada). The Casa Marina was awesome! It's so beautiful. We probably wouldn't spend this much on a hotel on a normal vacation but we splurged for our honeymoon. It's one of the few hotels on the island that actually has a beach which was a big plus for us. It has two pools & neither were that crowded during the day. The beach was pretty large, very well kept, and the "beach butlers" were very helpful. Although the hotel is 100% smoke free our room smelt like smoke (because you can smoke on the patio) when we arrived but after keeping the patio door open with the AC on full blast it seemed to go away. The hotel is located on the South side of Key West so you'll do a fair amount of walking to get to the busy end of Duval, Mallory Square, or the harbor where most excursions leave from. So make sure to bring comfy shoes or plan on renting a bike or scooter (which is how most people get around Key West). We rented bikes from the resort which were $20/day per bike. You can probably get a bike cheaper from one of the many bike rental places on the island but it was jus easier for us to use the Casa Marina's. They pretty much don't have the internet. There are two computers for public use in the lobby but they are so slow after 10 min of not getting very far most people gave up. We heard other people at the hotel that had laptops with them that say they couldn't get a connection either. The Casa Marina is one of the Old Town Trolley stops which is nice. Neither parking or breakfast is included in the cost of the room. $15/day to self park, $20 for valet (plus tip of course), & $20/person for the breakfast ~ we never tried it so we don't know what it was like. The concierge was kind of a joke. He's only there Thur - Sun, but don't use him anyway. When we first arrived, we asked for his (Don) advice for food, we just wanted some appetizers for a mid-day snack. After being there for a while and trying all sorts of places, we realized his reccomendations were probably the last places I would tell somebody to go because there are so many other better restaurants. During the week, we used the "Guest Services" button on the phone, which is free, several times to make reservations and they were great, every reservation was made at the exact time and place we wanted. The people at the front desk also made reservations for us and were very helpful throughout our trip. If you're looking for coffee in the room, there is a Keurig style machine. They give you 6 K-cups (3 decaf and 3 regular) and the coffee cups are small.

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY---Part One”
Reviews.Author: traveler58201
Reviews.Content: We just checked in. We had reserved three rooms for nearly a week for our family. We were promised rooms with a "nice view" and we were told they were "good rooms". Well, at this hotel "island vista" means parking lot and or HVAC roof equipment. Our room came equiped with bloody tissues in the waste basket and a pubic hair on the tiolet. The view is of the parking lot and our table shakes from the HVAC just below us. Our son's room was meant for someone else who obviously objected tot he room as is shown by the anniversary baloons in the room. Not their anniversary. The poor girl at reception could not help as our rooms had oviously been given away. This is supposed to be a Hilton property but it is run like a low end rip joint. No management, no class. Unfortuanr]tely we are here and here we must stay or pay penalties etc. Avoid this place if you have a group or if you expect a modicum of quality or a decent room for a big price. Oh, and don't even get me going on the "resort fee" which is added to the bill for use of the resort's beach, etc. Rip off! More to follow as our saga continues.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: bearpixie
Reviews.Content: We were on honeymoon here and it was the perfect location for us. Excellent food in the restaurant, attentive staff, well equipped gym, nice pool, beautiful beach, jpeaceful, just superb all round. Cant wait to go back one day!

Reviews.Title: “Won't Stay Anywhere Else in Key West”
Reviews.Author: ksweldon
Reviews.Content: Wow. It's gorgeous. It's sprawling - which in Key West, where everything is right on top of each other, is unheard of. It's historic. It's comfortable. It's got the best beach on the island. They spoil you rotten. I mean R-O-T-T-E-N. I asked for two pool towels. The cabana boy said, "Are there two of you?" "Yes." "Let me get you set up." Takes for towels, spreads them out to cover the top and bottom of each of our two chairs, and finds an umbrella, brings it over and adjusts it to make sure my fair skin is out of the sun. The bartenders know how to make an awesome Painkiller, and they have the nutmeg to do it. When I asked for after-dinner coffee to go, our server went to the Starbucks coffee shop in the main building (we were dining outside near the beach) and brought it back to order in a to-go cup. It's seriously dog-friendly. Under 25 pounds for $125 cleaning fee per stay - that's it. We asked for puppy water at the pool bar, and they brought it out in a ceramic dog bowl. Dogs allowed basically everywhere, including the beach. One day in the lobby, they apologized for being out of doggie bones at the front desk. Sunset dinner on the beach (reservations only) is awesome. Good menu, great food. The bed sucks you in like nothing my husband and I have ever slept in - and we *always* prefer different mattress types. We took a photo of the mattress tag so we could buy one. My husband travels lots for business - we stayed for 8 nights on points, so I can't address pricing/value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: 4thefamily
Reviews.Content: After spending 3 nights at the Casa Marina, I understand the mixed reviews. Some items were compatible with a 5 diamond resort others a Super 8 motel. There was a lot of inconsistency. Service Example, one day at the beach we had Bobby as our beach attended. He checked on us frequently, had a waiter attend to our food and beverage needs, brought us the complimentary drink of the day and complimentary popsicles. The next day we had a different attendant. The waiter checked on us once; we got our own food and drinks. Chef and wait staff at the pool cafe, friendly and accommodating; waitress at bar rude. Patrick and the rest of the front desk staff excellent. Housekeeping was rude. The first day we left the room at 7:30 and returned at 3:45 to shower and leave again. The housekeeping staff was socializing in the hall way. They watched us enter our room. At 4:00 they tried to enter. I asked that they give us 20 mins. we would be leaving soon. At 4:20 they knocked again. I asked for a few more minutes. At 4:25 she tried to enter again. I allowed them in the room and told them that we were early risers and they could clean our room early. She informed me that was not how their schedule worked. Needless to say their $5 tip went to $3. The next day they cleaned the room with my husband in it. For the first time I left no tip. The people at the watersports rental were rude. In fact we walked all the way to Moped Hospital to rent a scooter from friendly people. We did call Barefoot Billy's at the Reef Resort about jet ski rental and they were very friendly. Cosmetics The beach, pool and public areas amazing!!!!!!! Room, I have stayed at nicer Hampton Inns. The first day I went to put on the robe. It was stained and worn to the point of needing to be thrown away. I asked for a fresh robe and received two similar looking robes. I quickly discovered that the bath towels were in the same condition. This place has great possibilities. Someone needs to come in and over haul the rooms with contemporary chic not cheap chic and order fresh bath linens. They need to hire staff that is consistently service oriented. Some of the staff rated with what we have experienced at 5 diamond resorts like The Cloister, Ritz Carlton, and Registry Resort. This resort has great potential.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Resort, Key West”
Reviews.Author: talimar
Reviews.Content: While we were there, they were working on the grounds around the hotel. One pool was empty, but with the beach right there, this wasn't a problem. The staff was very friendly, and since the hotel was a stop on one of the tram tours, you could use that to get to the rest of the island, or just drive. Key West isn't known for ample parking, however. If you're into walking, this hotel is right on the beach, but yet far enough away from the madness of Duval street and the rest of the tourist areas.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: NuclearDuo
Reviews.Content: From when we checked in until our departure 5 days later, we greatly enjoyed this hotel. The staff was attentive and courteous (cannot understand some of the previous reviews which claimed otherwise). The rooms are modern, but the hotel itself is nearly 100 years old, a grande dame. Only had breakfast on the property, that too was very good. My wife and I travel extensively on business, we know a good hotel when we stay in one. Nice oasis of serenity on the quiet side of the island, but the crazyness of Duval St. is still close by.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Joyce166
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 6 night stay at the Casa Marina. It was the most fantastic hotel I ever stayed at. The hammocks on the beach were a delight--so relaxing with the sound of the waves gently breaking on the shore. Two large pools to relax by so there was never a crowd and always chaise lounges available. Great pina coladas at the poolside bar. A truly secluded paradise. The staff was always very helpful with calling taxis and suggesting restaurants in the area. Loved relaxing over breakfast on the outside terrace each morning. Would definitely return and highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Never want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: soulmates11
Reviews.Content: What a stay .The weather was not cooperating but it did not matter anyway.The resort is spectacular .In every way imaginable .From service to location and say nothing of the hammocks on the beach in the cool breeze!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, but a little pricey”
Reviews.Author: luckyone11
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the casa marina because my boyfriend was dead set on having a beach available and the c/m has the largest private beach on the island. the service we received from the bartenders, beach attendants, and bellman was great. the onsite scooter/ bike rental and water sports (we did a jet ski tour and parasailed) provider was extremely convenient and the entire staff was very friendly and pleasant. room service was very quick, i think the longest i waited was maybe 25 minutes and they apologized profusely, usually delivering food in 15 minutes. the concierge was very helpful although he has limited hours. the property is gorgeous, but the rooms are pretty small, especially for how much we paid per night. it's a great place to stay if you want to unwind and unplug, no crazy partiers because the lobby bar closes by 10pm, although when they're open they pour a stiff drink! Oh, and the spa appointments are very limited so book early, even though in my opinion the services are overpriced- I would go to one of the other spas on the island.

Reviews.Title: “Memories of Relaxation”
Reviews.Author: marinaontario
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from Key West and a "second honeymoon" at the Casa Marina. No wonder it is so highly rated. Everything that was in its website came true, from the black and silver cypress ceiling in the airy and yet sophisticated lobby, to the pristine beach and our room. Upon entering the resort there was a relaxing aroma (would my guess of lemongrass be correct?), memorable view of the pool and ocean. I'm not sure what the combination is on your bedding, but I would bet Egyptian cotton? The history of Flagler dream was clearly relayed in the in-room book about the resort. We have returned to busy, and often stressful jobs and I find myself thinking back to our stay and feeling better - even though I'm not there!! There was only hesitation I have as to whether we would return and take family with us. This could hopefully be passed onto the Key West Chamber Of Commerce as it was pervasive through all the places we visited during our 4 day stay - 99% of the front line staff were caucasian. So very rarely did we see anyone of colour unless they were cleaning or maintenance staff. The Casa Marina have the very engaging, and professional Jafre-Paul as a bell-hop/front doorman and it is our hope that people like him are given a chance to advance if they so desire. I am caucasian and my husband is black. We found it very interesting that less than a mile away from the resort there is a great memorial to blacks rescued from slave ships in 1860, yet there is very little representation of equity in everyday life after 150 years. We like to take our children to places that represent hope, advancement, equity and hopefully we will hear from the Casa Marina staff to indicate that progress is being made. Doreen & Alfonso

Reviews.Title: “No 5 star here!”
Reviews.Author: torontosummer
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2:30 after travelling 8 hours to reach our destination. Was told room not available but will contact us immediately when room is available. Waited until 3:50 and asked again regarding room. Told still not ready. At 4:00 on the nose we were given a different room right by the elevator and ice machine. Asked to move but told it is sold out. We stated we saw a room still being cleaned. Oh yeah, O.K. you can move there. During the wait we went to the restaurant Sun Sun for lunch. We had to get our own menus after waiting 10 minutes. Service was slow and nobody cleared dishes. Finally the manager came by to clear dishes. Asked for dessert - it never arrived. Finally we left the restaurant without our dessert. On second day, we arrived back to our room at 6:00 p.m. only to find that the maid had never been there. Morning breakfast buffet left a lot to be desired. No meat offered like bacon or ham. Custom buffet omelet took over 20 minutes to arrive. They definitely have a problem in the kitchen. Seemed to be students working at the breakfast who had not been trained. Lastly, after arriving home found items charged to my account in error. Overall, not a pleasant experience. Would expect more from a "Waldorf Astoria collection hotel".

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service - Very Family Friendly”
Reviews.Author: josy10
Reviews.Content: Spent 5 nights with family 15 and 11 year old. Exceptionally friendly staff, very helpful, beautiful spot with great pools and outdoor meal service. Activities on site with a very helpful staff, jet skis, para sailing, arrrange fishing and scuba etc. Easy location to get to walk to town. Very nice roooms. But what really made the trip was the hotel staff and the great setting.

Reviews.Title: “The Casa Marina experience is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Sunfun2009
Reviews.Content: We have been going to Key West for 10 years and almost always stay at the Casa Marina. The property underwent new management and a complete renovation and remodel about 3 years ago. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous - it is paradise! Don and Patrick at the front desk are extremely accommodating and helpful. Don provided us with the name of several great restaurants that we had not tried before. He knows Key West and is willing to take the time to share his knowledge of the great restaurants and attractions. The rooms are clean and peaceful. The flat screen TV was appreciated by our daughter. They have a Star Bucks on property - a necessary for our coffee in the morning. The Casa Marina has two beautiful pools and a large sandy beach front area available to sit out in the sun. Brian set us up with chaise lounges and towels by the ocean. He also alerted our daughter when she became a little "rusty" his term for too much sun! We had Casa Key West Lime Coladas, under the sun with the nice breeze of the ocean. I must say that the physical property of the hotel is beautiful and well maintained, but it is the staff like Don, Patrick and Brian that made the trip so enjoyable. I would highly recommend this hotel to friends. We will be back next year and are planning on bringing other family members with us. The Burshem family

Reviews.Title: “We left after two hours.”
Reviews.Author: 3weeks
Reviews.Content: We drove to Key West from Miami--my husband and I and our 9 month old baby. Upon check in (at the designated time) we were told that our room was not ready--so annoying when that happens. We were told our room would be ready within an hour so we decided to tour the grounds. I will say that the grounds and pool are beautiful. We were very excited about our planned 3 night stay as we walked around the lovely property. Then we got our room and it went down hill from there..... our room had to be the worst room in the hotel. It was in the older part of the hotel, an Isle Vista 1 bedroom suite. We were assaulted on both sides by noise. It was a first floor room right next to the elevator. The bell was ringing constantly and it was right outside the bedroom window!!! When we looked out the bedroom window we looked at people shuffling past us to get to the elevator--no privacy! On the other side of the room, in the living room area, was a window & sliding glass door that faced onto the somewhat dingy street---not a nice view! LOUD Harley Davidson motorcycles were zooming by every few minutes startling our baby. The room itself looked like a dressed up motel room. I wouldn't even sit on the couch--it looked like it belonged in a frat house. We promptly called the front desk and asked to be moved to another room but were told there was nothing available but we might be able to move the next day. They did have a single room available but my husband went and looked at it and said it was tiny and would not fit all of us plus our baby gear. After listening to the elevator and street noise for about a half and hour we decided to leave and started calling other hotels in the area knowing we would not get any sleep in that room. The manager on duty was nice enough to not penalize us for leaving early and we promptly vacated to the Westin. As I was checking out there was another irate family at the front desk complaining about the poor quality of their room, so I know it wasn't just us! As we were leaving with all of our luggage we had to weave through a large conference of business people. All in all it depends on what you are looking for in Key West. If you want a good beach and pool this hotel offers that, but the rooms are shabby for the premium "Waldorf Astoria" price.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible, Relaxing, Awesome Service”
Reviews.Author: Speakerman
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina Resort is like it's own world. You're a short walk to Duval St and the other sights, but at the Resort you feel surrounded by comfort, attentive staff, great beach and wonderful accomodations. You can just feel the worries of the world melt away as you're enjoying the weather and the scenery. It's a great place to get away!!

Reviews.Title: “Going to Key West...don't consider staying anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: vickynb
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was exceptional. The ambiance, the food, the cleanliness, and especially the service. Our experience at the front desk (Patrick) set the tone for the stay. Professional and friendly is the best way to describe everyone we encountered, from the front desk, to the waiters, to the maids. We watched them clean and rake the beach in the morning, getting everything ready for the day. Lots of little touches throughout the day to make the guests feel COMFORTABLE AND APPRECIATED. Really, I wouldn't consider anywhere else on my next trip there.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel I've ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Silffy
Reviews.Content: That was my first time in Key West. The Waldorf Astoria Resort is very luxurious, has great rooms, grounds, everything that you would be looking for a great vacation. It has private access to the beach and I didn't see any other hotels which had one. The staff is friendly and professional. It was the nicest hotel in the area by far. I will stay at the Casa Marina again next time I am in the area. Stay at the Waldorf, you won't regret it! Thank you for the opportunity to share my experience!

Reviews.Title: “the food and view are worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: coloradomichelle
Reviews.Content: although I discovered later that Key West is not exactly "kid friendly" We really enjoyed this hotel. the beach is beautiful, food is great!!!! recommend without hesitation beware!!! the pull out sofa is hard, very uncomfortable!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant without the snobbiness”
Reviews.Author: travelerlmLaJolla_CA
Reviews.Content: We rode our Harley from South Miami down the Florida keys to Key West for biker weekend. Regaled in our motorcycle gear, visions in black leather, we were treated as well as any other guests, it seems. We had a top floor room on the 3rd floor and found it to be elegant, spacious, clean, and quiet. Our king-size bed was comfortable, the bathroom was clean with big turkish towels and robes in the closets, and a small workspace. Chocolates given at turn down service, and an expresso maker which was easy to use (unlike many other upscale coffee machines we've come across in other hotels). We dined in the hotel restaurant and food and service was lovely. The grounds are beautiful, very high end with access to the nicest beach in Key West. We only stayed for the one night, but I would come back for a longer stay. Only disappointment was the weather! It was unseasonable chilly, but that's not the hotel's fault! Pay the big bucks - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Romantic...Phenomenal Views...A Gem!”
Reviews.Author: mjs05s
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Casa Marina for 6 days in early March. Like almost everybody we spoke with, our stay was thanks to our HHonors program and associated points. Normally, the rooms are $300 and up. The views of the water, sun, and beach were breathtaking. The fashion in which the resort was laid out was very open and spacious. Customer service, cleanliness, and staff attentiveness were A-1 - I don't think I had to open a door the entire time I was there! There were plenty of poolside chairs, as well as chairs and air loungers on the beach. The fitness room had state-of-the-art equipment and had plenty of weights, machines, and treadmills. In my opinion, this is not a place you want to take your little kids - it's more of a quiet, relaxed atmosphere with limited kids' activities. Also, the prices of food and drink are a little high...$11 for a mixed drink, $13 for a burger, but hey, you are on vacation and are paying for the convenience. Self-parking in the lot was $15 per day, or you could valet for $20 per day. Or, you could find a spot on the street (user assumes all risks). We chose to go with the $15 per day. The resort is on the opposite end of Mallory Square, in a quieter neighborhood (sorrounded by $1.5M homes). It's about 2 miles that is easily (and safely) walkable. I do recommend you make a stop at "touristy" places like Sloppy Joe's, Hog's Breath, and A&B Seafood. There are two places that have exceptional Key Lime Pie...Kermit's Key Lime Pie Factory (across from the Conch Republic Seafood restaurant) and Kimberly's (on South street). If you put your pants on one leg at a time like most people, you HAVE to stop by B.O.'s for some great local seafood. It is near Elizabeth and Caroline. You will not be impressed with the "curb appeal", but you will love the food and "character" of the hole-in-the-wall shack. Make sure to stop by Mallory Square and watch the street entertainers (specifically, the Cat Man named Dominique). I hope this review encourages you to book a stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Grounds, Poor Rooms”
Reviews.Author: kimberlynyc120
Reviews.Content: The grounds are really beautiful, sprawling, two pools, a beach area with docks, hammocks, a beach front bar/restaurant, lots of beach games like bags and beach volleyball. The service around the pool was "iffy," the food was fine, nothing spectacular, a very good tropical drink list though. The lobby area is great, there is a small shop that sells Starbucks coffee, toiletries and snacks. There is also free internet in the lobby and a small bar with a larger bar in the back. The rooms were nothing special, just inside the border of comfortable but not well appointed at all and the bathroom door was a heavy, difficult to move sliding one. We were also on the ground floor so we had to get dressed practically in the dark to avoid providing a peep show. The hotel is also a good 10-15 minute walk to any drug stores,restaurants, etc. Overall a good choice, as most places on Key West are B&Bs and this place has nice amenities and is perfect for hanging out by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great!!”
Reviews.Author: TropicalCouple
Reviews.Content: Very nice accommodations, grounds, food, bar and right on the ocean. What else could you ask for?

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed tropical elegance”
Reviews.Author: hattie400
Reviews.Content: Picked Casa Marina using tripadvisor for our first foray to the Keys and was rewarded with a hotel and room that reflected tropical elegance - less palm tree decor and neon and more woods and neutrals - and KW history. Loved the beach, the view, the location - just close enough to Duval for a long walk or short cab ride and far enough away to feel nestled in a hideaway. Recommend springing for a room on second floor of the original building with a terrace rather than a balcony - 2 chairs and 2 chaise lounges provided. Patrick at the front desk was most helpful from the moment we arrived. Amazing pina coladas; awesome conch fritters.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Rooms, useless front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: Miguelation
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights for a break from the noisy city and we landed next to the elevator equipmnet room, paying $375 a night for that. reuqested another room, and was told they could do it if we waited by 5PM. We waited and was told, that the morning guy didn't leave any instruction as of that and they didn't have any other room, but that. Bottom line, we heard the hydraulic pumps coming and going every 10 seconds or so, 24 Hr a day. Since it was winter, and the building does not have heat, even when outside was in the mid 50F, we couldn't use the A/C fan as white noise. So we spent over $2,000 over 3 days at the Waldorf-Astory in Key West and couldn't sleep for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sldreamer
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina Resort was one of the most incredible resorts my family and I have stayed in! The views from pool side were beautiful.The food and service on all ends were great... rooms and beds were extreamly comfortable and clean!! The front desk was very accomodating to all our needs. A special thanks to Maria at the front desk for making our stay extraodinary.

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising - this is not a "Spa Resort" as there is no spa.”
Reviews.Author: anders4334
Reviews.Content: As you consider booking your stay at Casa Marina, do not book if you are looking to relax in a full-service spa as part of your overall experience. There is no spa on the property or sister property as we were very surprised to find out. This will either be amusing - when you come upon what they're currently calling "Spa al Mare," (http://www.casamarinaresort.com/resort_activities/spa.cfm) or it will be upsetting - when you realize that you're paying the same price for a massage in a back corner hotel room (not yours) that you would if you had booked at an actual Spa with amenities you'd expect,...sauna, steam room, lockers, etc. All services are administered from one of two hotel rooms, "Suite 1001," in what appears to be an older wing of the hotel. The Casa Marina website falsely claims that, "The Waldorf Astoria Collection introduces Spa al Mare, offering rejuvenating spa services for guests. Take pleasure in the extensive menu of this oceanfront Florida Keys spa resort." FYI.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond disappointing, the service was shameful.”
Reviews.Author: hopper319
Reviews.Content: The hotel setting was beautiful. Unfortunately, our experience was shocking for the high star rating of this hotel... Our room was not cleaned during the day -- not once -- but twice during the week! Beyond the noisy plumbing, the final straw was the brazen rudeness of the staff. During breakfast, the server actually argued with me about my order. He told me I HAD to take the food he brought out to me, even though it was clearly not what I had ordered! Sadly, there are more similar stories! We will not be returning...

Reviews.Title: “A Jumbo Shrimp of 4 Star Hotels...”
Reviews.Author: miameme
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I were inspecting this hotel and its services for our Wedding in 2010. We both loved the building and the grounds but the rest of the hotel was missing all of the details that would qualify it as a 4 star hotel. The rooms that were said to be the best in the building, had an amazing view of the water and could not be upgraded from, were a joke!! The amazing view that could have been possible, were completely covered by the Palm Trees in the court yards. Which were so close to the balcony that the very details of your conversations held on the balcony could be heard by those below. The bed was the hardest thing I have ever slept on. The TV was so far from the bed in the smallest room I have ever paid $380.00 plus dollars on that there was no point in watching TV. Not to mention that shower head was so low in the shower that I had to bend over to use it. Also if you think you can combat this misplacement with a bath, there aren't any bath tubs.....In Any of the rooms!!! We were at least hopping that the services that the hotel offers would make up for these details missing in the rooms. Alas disappointment again :( The breakfast was a sea of grease on a plate that Ketchup, Salt or Ranch couldn't help flavor! The coffee was burnt and the cream was curdled. Dinner was not much better. The limited and thoughtless menu sealed the nail in this sad 4 star coffin. As a idea for a wedding spot for a family that is looking to pay for 4 star and above accommodations and more than $200.00 a head for a dinner they are asking to move Heaven and Earth. If you want, I hear there is a very nice Youth Hostel that would accept your money and would provide better services.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely flawless....”
Reviews.Author: DoctorDKansasCity
Reviews.Content: we had a fabulous time...great hotel, great beach facility, great food service, great service...we enjoyed massage, golf, dining, and recommendations from Patrick @ the front desk as well as the concierge... we will definitely return and recommend to our friends and family... FIVE STARS.....thank you!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Grounds”
Reviews.Author: wizardnolo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful. There are activities on the beach, and the pool is nice. The rooms are nice, not spectacular and not very spacious. Beds are very comfortable. They were always very clean, the staff was outstanding with their availability and friendliness. Last year we stayed at their sister property, "The Reach Resort". We preferred the rooms and the beach at the Reach. Whichever resort you stay at, you have the ability to use the amenities at both properties. We will stay again at either resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property....Ugly Service......”
Reviews.Author: Gaytraveldollar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property at the height of season and booked a room through Hotwire for about 250$. I was excited about this based on the reputation of the Waldorf Astoria and the reviews I read generally. Wow was I disappointed. From the moment I checked in, the staff treated me as if they did not need my business- and it was not what they did or did not do- it was how they did it. Upon check in I requested a king room instead of 2 doubles. The request was denied, but instead of saying I am sorry we don't have a king, I go a "this is all we have." Then we were taken down a hallway with no lights to our room. It was a nice room, but my island view was a parking lot with broken curtains. I wanted to then go to take a dip in the hot tub- only to find out that the resort does not have one- again when I inquired no apology that this supposedly great resort lacks a basic ammenity. When I wanted to check out, I requested a late check out. The phone rang about 20 times before it was answered and then I was put on hold and forgoten. When I called back to make the request,.... yep you guessed it....I was denied again. The wording was, " we have so many checkin in and out I can't do that, but you can use the resort," in a condescending tone. Finally- the worst was that I left a few shirts in the room that were nicely pressed on hangers. A couple hours after I checked out I realized that I did that and called the lost and found to report the issue. No one answered. The message is." leave a message and we will get back to you within a few to 24 hours." What if I had a plane to catch? Not wanting to wait for this process, I returned to the hotel to collect my shirts and they were wadded up in a bag. I expressed frustration and the employee ( again with the tone) says, " you did leave them in the room right?" None of this is 4 star service. In fairness, the hotel is beautiful. It has the best setting and facility in Key West including a rare beach for the island. That said, I have had better service at a 2 star inn than this supposedly 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “WOW...What an AWESOME place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Danjangant
Reviews.Content: This is a gorgeous hotel! The beach is immaculate, staff is friendly and very helpful, the rooms are beautiful and immaculate, as well as extremely comfortable! The bed is better than mine at home! It is within walking distance of all the action but we did get tired of walking all the time! They also make the BEST Pina Coladas we have EVER tasted!!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING”
Reviews.Author: beersloot
Reviews.Content: My Fiancee and I along with another couple stayed here for a long weekend. It is a little far from Duval but it is well worth it. The service at the pool and beach is slow but if you don't mind (which I didn't because I am used to it) walking to the beach bar 40 yards, at most, away you can get a drink in 2 seconds. If we didn't want to drink at bars we would have stayed at the resort all night. All day we drank there, all night we drank on Duval. Cabs got expensive so we stumbled back after a night of drinking then went to the pool and beach bar, which was still open at 11. We had an amazing time, I might stay up towards where the dock is more next time, but to relax ...Casa Marina is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “The charm is gone.”
Reviews.Author: VAItalyfan
Reviews.Content: I've enjoyed visiting Key West at least 6 or 7 times and have always stayed at Casa Marina. Years ago, it was reminiscent of a plantation or tropical resort with island furnishings, paddle fans, and an inviting feeling of "Ahhhhh" as you entered the lobby and looked through the grand palladian-windowed French doors to the ocean beyond. Someone got an idea a few years ago, I guees, that the place needed to be "updated. The old comfortable, inviting lobby is now a sterile cavern of bare wood floors, retro furnishings in muted neutrals and minimal decorative art. No color, no warmth, no luxury. Our room with a water view had one window that didn't open. Again, bare wooden floors, a sisal mat under the bed and a bathroom with absolutely no storage room for personal toiletries or cosmetics. The concierge was marvelous, but the restaurant staff was hurried and snippy. The lobby offered two guest computers which were constantly occupied, and the business center was in a tiny room that was cramped and not worth the fees charged for usage. On a very positive note, the grounds of the place are still magnificent and well-maintained. I still respect this historic "grande dame" and hope that current or future owners bring her back to the glory of her past. Until that happens, I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: robash980
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful place to stay for a two week business trip. The staff was very easy to work with, especially when it came to last minute items or details. The grounds were immaculate and made working a pleasure. Overall, I would definitely bring my employees back again.

Reviews.Title: “A great way to ride out the Mid-Atlantic blizzard”
Reviews.Author: cookswithpassion
Reviews.Content: Perfect timing for my vacation away from DC. While my neighbors were snowbound, I enjoyed the lovely surroundings and warm sunshine, beach and relaxation by the pool; leisurely strolling to Old Town; and a bike ride on picturesque side streets. As other reviewers have written, it is a distance from Duval Street, but it's walkable, and there are so many interesting shops and restaurants to see on the way. The resort is an historic landmark with accommodations that are modern and comfortable. I also agree with reviewers who said that the housekeeping schedule is inconvenient. After a morning of exploring or relaxing by the pool or the beach, I sometimes wanted to come back to my room for a nap. I put the Privacy sign on my door, but housekeeping would call at about 4:30 to ask about cleaning the room. This should be done in the morning, or at least by 1p. I also think that the resort fee is ridiculous. It does not provide much of value except internet access and the fitness center. Who needs free phone calls when they have unlimited cell phone minutes? In-room coffee, refrigerator, beach activities, newspaper, pool chairs, etc., should just be expected in a Waldorf property that charges the rate it does. If anything should be included in the fee that isn't, it's the use of bikes. It cost twice as much to rent a bike at the resort as it did from Moped Hospital a few blocks away.
