I don't play beach volleyball or bocci ball or life-size chess--more options should be available. Staff was helpful and friendly. I recommend the resort, but management should re-visit the items covered by the resort fee, or just incorporate it into the rate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KamperGirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only one Saturday night in January. This is a lovely property that feels miles away from the all night parties of Duval. The main hotel building was a little smaller than I expected, but has been recently renovated with lovely furnishings. I was a little disappointed with front desk staff and the bellman. They were all very young, and although they were pleasant, they did not have the level of customer service as you would expect from a Waldorf property. We stayed in a king room with an ocean view. The room was lovely, but small. The bathroom was just ok (no bathtub and the shower tiles seemed dated). The balcony had a nice sliding door from the room and a great view of the property and the palms along the beach. The balcony is one long balcony the runs the length of the building, but they have made the individual terraces relatively private with screens. From our second floor room we could not see much of the water, even though we were facing it, as they have large palms lining the beach, but it was a beauiful view. The property became quiet earlier into the evening than I expected, even with 2 weddings going on at the hotel that evening. We spent hours on that balcony, as the property is lit at night, and with the sound of the water.... ahhh. The walkway to the water, with the ponds lining it is out of a magazine. This property has a dock, and a very nice beach - but those who have never been to the keys needs to be aware - this is not a "sandy beach." They have put out sand, so it is easy to lay out, but the waters edge is very rocky. But the resort built entrances to the water for those who really need to get into the ocean, and they have 2 pools (but sadly - no hot tubs). One odd thing was that we had to walk outside the main building to get to the building that our room was in. Not a big deal, as it was a short walk - but no one offered to talk our bags for us. Then, when we got to the elevator, it was so slow (It was ALWAYS slow) and the second elevator was broken. Not a "five star" feeling. The morning when we left, it was pouring rain, so we again had to take our bags back to the main building to check out, and there was no way to escape getting a little wet. Not enough to ruin a stay, but to be made note of if you are looking for five star luxury.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: dreamer1979
Reviews.Content: what a beautiful place! hotel was lovely and spotless as one would expect for a hotel of this kind! staff were generally lovely and helpful, although as you would expect for a hotel of this sort - everything is very expensive, from a coffee to your watersports. The nice thing was that despite having their own watersports facilities, they were still happy to assist us in booking with another company which was fab! we only had one meal there which was lunch - and it was delicious and admittedly not unreasonably priced. Key west as a whole, was great for the watersports and the hotel, but overall not much else to do there. The night life was a bit strange compared to what we were used to - but then as we had come from miami, I suppose it was bound to feel a bit odd! the hotel is definately worth visiting, as it is so tranquil and amazing. make sure you go to the chilli sauce shop! fabulous concept! oh and dont leave key west without sampling the famous key west pie! :) !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: monkey0704
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing with amazing staff and service. I have never been treated so good in a hotel before. My friends and I had a wonderful time and the manager of the Sun Sun did a wonderful job on the surprise birthday party. We will definitely be returning to Key West and the Casa Marina Resort. AND we will tell all of our friends and family to visit this resort. I can't say enough good things about it. AAA+++ Thank you so much to all! Cherie

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon off to bad start- Thank!”
Reviews.Author: Malibob
Reviews.Content: It was the first night of our honeymoon in Key West and I had a room booked at the finest resort in Key West; or so I thought. When I arrived at the check in desk I was informed that my room was given away because they decided not to charge my card (the room was booked in February). They let me know that a room would be prepared for me the next day but for the night I would have to sleep in a double queen room. Already disgusted I informed my new wife what had happened and we accepted. Once we got into our room it was moist (broken A/C) and cruddy she even happened to find a couple of bugs running throughout the room and I found trash in the furniture. At that moment I decided to explore my options in leaving this "resort". Hardly what I expected from a Waldorf property. When I explained what the situation was back at the front desk, they as much as brushed me off. They told me that they were already doin what they could and that I could leave if I wanted. I will never stay at a Waldorf property again. I did leave and went to the Reach Resort at the opposite end of the island. What a difference. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE, YOU WILL NOT BE TREATED LIKE A VALUED CUSTOMER!!! Oh yeah, no beach as described either, the only beach on Key West is at the Reach!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort”
Reviews.Author: Crsearcy
Reviews.Content: If you want leisure at its best Casa Marina is the place to be. It is the only hotel on the island with a beach, and a great one at that.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff and mostly beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: JulietBravo
Reviews.Content: stayed here in a triple room for 5 nights... intially we got a ground floor layout with a small living room which was ok, next day a nice gentleman by the name of peter upgraded us to a much larger room with a balcony for a couple days... so nice of him! also there's some really cool guys at the bike / scooter rental (my fav activity there) place and it was nice to have it onsite... the hotel is a bit isolated in a residental area and has a private beach which was nice and bc all of key west is 8mi it was so easy to get around. also highly recommend cafe sole for good veggie food and kermits has the best key lime pie ice cream and stir fry sauce... dont get any imitations... still crave it!!! and dont miss the hemingway house and mallory square... i LOVE key west, so much to do, so many nice eats, great sunsets and cultured people so close to home!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect in every phase!”
Reviews.Author: hdiron
Reviews.Content: The hotel, surroundings, view, room, food, cleanliness, pools, private beach, staff and customer service was second to none! I do not see where it can be improved! I rate the entire experience the max - 5 stars in every category!

Reviews.Title: “Winter wonderland on the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: successandsuccess
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Key West, was one of the most wonderful Christmas experiences ever. My spouse, our dog, children and teen grandchildren all stayed at Casa Marina Resort. We were all lucky enough to be on the Ocean. Staff, including check-in, housekeeping, and restaurant staff were beyond expectation. I still have little grains of sand between my toes, and plan on keeping it there for the most special memories.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: kmerinda57
Reviews.Content: I was lucky enough to stay at this lovely hotel, but can only comment on the view, the hotel, the staff, and the location - I was not there long enough to try the food or explore as much as I would have liked to. To me, a New Englander, it resembled resorts in the Caribbean. I was already on cloud nine being in Key West - with the sun - but this hotel made my night. My room was gorgeous and the staff were very nice. Honesty, the price is not much higher than a motel down the street and well worth the extra cash. I felt safe and it was clean and classy. There were two weddings within the span of one night and one morning. It was a very picturesque place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Goodbye Caribbean state-side retreat, hello Eurotech”
Reviews.Author: Dixon429
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina has been an occasional destination of mine for 25 years; each time I visited, the relaxed yet upscale island atmosphere provided a wonderful stateside getaway. Several weeks ago, I returned for the first time since CMâ€™s huge renovation two years ago. The beautiful structure is still there of course and from the outside, it still projects a welcoming, if much more formal, personality. Inside, however, it has assumed all the characteristics of every high-end Euro-tech hotel on the planet, and that includes the rooms themselves. Everywhere one sees the triumph of form over function. Just one example â€“ the showerâ€™s hot/cold control is easily 7 feet from the shower head, which combined with restricted water pressure means reaching a comfortable temperature takes an inordinate amount of time. Yes, itâ€™s still nice, but in the room, I could just as easily have been in Los Angeles or Toronto. Even the modern beach-side bars manage to look uncomfortable so near the surf.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Workhard2Play
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Key West. The hotel and staff were remarkable. We could not have asked for a better group of people who went out of their way to make our visist exceptional. Although the weather did not cooperate, Corey the Bellman suggested things we could do that would be warm. Rebecca from your marketing department coordnated activites for the meeting. All went well. We could not have asked for a better team than what you have at Casa Marina. We will definitely be back. The Trolley Ride is worth taking. The food at the Conch Republic was great, especially the Conch soup.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Babymoon Destination”
Reviews.Author: countrytraveler
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina is a fantastic hotel. My husband and I enjoyed a "babymoon" 1/8-1/12, I am 7 months pregnant. It's my 5th trip to Key West. Our room was huge and well appointed, room 1013 East Wing Island Vista One BR suite. We were on the first floor, and had views of the public beach and tennis courts and a nice balcony. The bathrooms were very spacious, though it only had a shower not a tub. Loved the espresso machine, and the two flat screen TV's, in the living room and in the bedroom. The bedroom had a comfy king sized bed, and was in a separate room with its own door for privacy. The main room also had a large L-shaped sofa and even a dine-in area. The only negative about the room is that it needed a fresh coat of paint, furniture needed scratch repair and the draperies/rugs needed drycleaning, surprising for a Waldorf Astoria. In spite of this, the room was super clean, the housekeeper did a great job keeping the room spotless and refreshing our towels. I was also disappointed that the spa did not offer mani/pedis. The hotel breakfast buffet was yummy, we enjoyed it every day. We had dinner at the resort once and it was excellent, one of the best dinners on the island. Service was good but slow (typical Key West). The resort had everything you could imagine, two grand pools, pool service, a beach, a nice pier, amazing views, watersports, spa, etc. Frequent travelers to Key West know that the beach space is limited. This hotel actually had a nice sized private beach and pier, a rare find at most KW hotels. Keep in mind the hotel charges an extra $20 a day resort fee. The weather became so cool during our stay, we could only used the resort on one of the days but still had to pay the pool fee every day. My husband loved the hotel but prefers to stay on Duvall Street, because the walk downtown was long for a pregnant lady (30 minutes each way) but we just grabbed a cab if we needed to. We have stayed at the Ocean Key in the past but I wanted a more of a resort experience this time. The resort is so beautiful, I thought it would be a great place for a destination wedding!! I would definitely stay there again or recommend it to a friend. PS: Make sure to leave time in your schedule for a visit to the Audubon House. It has the most beautiful garden on the island and a great collection of antique Audubon prints. Ask for Bob, he is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Survived the chilly week!”
Reviews.Author: Trixiejoey
Reviews.Content: My daughter, age 22, and I stayed at Casa from January 3-9, 2010. We wanted to relax in the sun by day and shop/dine in the evening. The temperatures reached record lows during our stay but we were fortunate to have booked a Grand Ocean room with a huge protected balcony. Truly, the balcony was as big as our room. We spent every day on the balcony lounging on the two chaise lounge chairs and managed to be warm and content with a fabulous view. Our room was not ready when we checked in so we stored our luggage and headed to Duval Street. The hotel notified us by cell phone by mid afternoon that our room was ready. After getting our keys at the front desk, we retrieved our luggage from storage. No one offered to help us with our many groceries and luggage which I thought was odd but we made our way to our room. I was not happy with our room as it was on the end and had a smaller balcony but we were quickly moved to the room next door which was great. This is an old hotel so they have to work with what they have so expect a room no bigger than 350 square feet and a bathroom that holds only one person....barely. I was pleased with the empty fridge for our groceries and the nespresso machine. i was surprised that there were absolutely no drawers for storage. We didn't bring much so it was fine. Ron, the concierge, was fabulous. There is no question he cannot answer. The staff at the restaurant where I picked up lunch daily (very good) to take to the balcony was wonderful. Absolutely no complaints about the staff other than the initial bell hops. There were numerous employees constantly cleaning the hallways, lobby, stairs, bannister, hedges, etc. I have never seen such care taken to the common areas both inside and outside. What surprised me, however, was the inconsistent housekeeping. There was a notice in the room that you could schedule housekeeping to come at a specific time so I called and requested noon since my daughter is a late sleeper. I had to call every day by 1:00 to request service. One day they forgot to leave a floor mat in the shower (a necessity I assure you) and another day they did not refill the coffee. On another occasion I was asked if I wanted the sheets changed. i asked when they were changed last and she had no clue. Housekeeping was truly the only shortcoming. It is a beautiful property and I would return and book this type of room only. Half the rooms are on the back of the hotel and many facing the ocean only have a window or very sheltered tiny balcony. The large balcony on our room made it feel bigger and brighter. If you choose Casa you will like its understated elegance but be prepared for a tiny room and bathroom....even in the highest room category excluding suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, Great Town”
Reviews.Author: paddletennis
Reviews.Content: We went to Casa Marina the week after Christmas, and stayed through New Years. We had three families that went together, with 9 children ages 12 - 21. Everyone had a ball. The resort was beautiful, accessible, and the staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms were a bit small, but we spent no time in them , but the beds were great!!! We had beach chairs set up for us each morning, great staff bringing us lunch each day. THe resort is outside the crazy city center of Key West but a 5 minute walk to Duval Street and the piers. It was nice to be able to do that easy walk into town and come back to the peacefulness of the resort. My only complaint is that the Concierge was terrible, unhelpful and unknowledgeable. He stated that he would not get us reservations for a table of 15, however, we called each night and had no problems. Otherwise, a really great week!!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally disappointing - little more than a posh motel”
Reviews.Author: lizcunningham
Reviews.Content: The Waldorf Astoria conjures up a sense of luxury and high end amenities. This hotel is little more than a posh motel. The best thing about it is the location, right on the beach. But the rooms are small, our bathroom can only fit one person in, it has no bathtub. There are no lounging areas in the hotel and the "bar" backs onto the Starbucks coffee shop. The hoel lacks sophistication, we have stayed in better Hilton Garden Inns.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great staff!!!”
Reviews.Author: martafoos
Reviews.Content: We had a great time there, and mostly it was because of the gentleman Corey James who works there. He took us to our room told us all the hot spot of Key West, and gave us tips we would have never found out on our own!!!! We love him! He is part of the reason we will be visiting Key West and the Casa marina next year! Plus the hotel is beautiful... very clean and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Food could use some improvement.”
Reviews.Author: frankie868
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there from 12/27/2009 - 1/1/2010. We had a nice suite, room 1014 on the first floor near the beach. In fact, the beach was a stone's throw from the room. The hotel is very clean, and all service personnel were extremely friendly and helpful. We had arranged all dinners with the concierge before we left the mainland. Louie's Backyard was the best of the restaurants we dined in. The Cafe Marquesa was also very good. We were disappointed in the Sun Sun restaurant (hotel restaurant). We arranged to have New Year's Eve dinner on the beach. The setting was very attractive, but the food was fair at best. The fish selections my wife and I had for our entrees` were tastless. The waitress couldn't have been better, though. The hotel grounds are quite beautiful and well maintained. We booked an evening sail on a catamaran at the hotel. We really enjoyed the experience. All in all, we would return without question. However, we doubt that we would have dinner in the Sun Sun restaurant. There are plenty of very good restaurants not far from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay.”
Reviews.Author: JoanieM3
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean but small. The service was a little bit slow all around. But then again, we're all in a bit of a hurry here in the northeast.

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy Festival hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Phila_PA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during Fantasy Festival. Gorgeous hotel, superb service, and great location. Was able to partake in all festivities and then go back to seclusion of hotel. Pools were nice but there was not a big beach area. Most people swam in pools in lieu of ocean. Rooms were very nice and clean with views of beach. Will absolutely stay here again when visiting Key West. If attending Fantasy Festival but want a quieter hotel this fits the bill. Easy walk to Duval Street where most activities are. Although I would not recommend visiting the area with children during this particular festival (may be a little too risque) this hotel is far enough away from the main strip that you could stay here and not be bothered.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, bring money. Very clean and safe. Well maintained. Comfy beds.”
Reviews.Author: anonymous_euonymus
Reviews.Content: Bed was very comfy. Had some problems with the fridge and toilet, which they were willing to fix immediately. The phone voicemail is incomprehensible. As a computer geek, I should have been able to intuit it, but could not. They have the New York Times delivered daily, plus the local paper on Sunday. The maid staff works all night long. This can be a problem if you are an early to bed person (7-8 PM), and they come to turn down the bed. They will not clean the room unless you are not there, so some days our room did not get cleaned since my dad likes to read in the room. Moped rentals at the hotel are quite expensive. $5 martini Thursdays in the bar is fantastic. The bar lady (not the man) really knows how to make a good drink, especially since she is willing to chill the glasses first. The pools are nice, as is popsicle time at 2 PM (you can get a free popsicle). Beware, you pay for this through a $20 non-negotiable 'resort fee' every day, so don't be surprised when it gets tacked onto your bill. The 'Sun Sun Restaurant' at the hotel is fine for breakfast, if pricey, but better than looking around for your breakfast. The breakfast buffet is $20, but they have an excellent assortment of food.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: keysttraveler
Reviews.Content: We loved the casa marina, it was very clean, everyone was welcoming and nice. People were very friendly, and the amenities are great .I am grateful to Marcinello who helped me book a room at a good rate for an extra night there. We'll come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect but well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: konken1
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property tucked away from the noise and traffic of Key West. Our rooms were very nice-beds super comfortable etc. But, we only got turn down on one night. The view was bad--we overlooked a yard that looked like it was a storage facility for broken equipment and bikes--oh and the garbage. I expected better especially because we rented 2 rooms. The sound carried from the room next door. We were in a courtyard next to the elevator and the sound echoed all over. Someone had spilled a pink drink outside of our door and it wasn't cleaned until the next day. We arrived 3 days before Christmas and seemed like the resort was just gearing up for the holidays....just getting started--I felt like we woke them up from a long nap! AHh"Island time" All of this aside--the resort is very clean, staff extremely friendly and helpful. The food is pretty good--all in all a really good experience outside of what I mentioned above. FYI-the desk will call a taxi company that charges $3 per person to almost anywhere on the island--I think it is the pinktaxi co. Its a great deal. Lazy dog kayak and boat rentals is great-they will pick you up (no charge)we did a kayak eco-tour that was quite fun. Banana Cafe is a GREAT lunch/breakfast restaurant--huge crepes of any kind you can imagine. Louies backyard for a great dinner with an amazing view and deck.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible guest service and policies”
Reviews.Author: naplesminneapolis
Reviews.Content: WARNING: If you are going to book a room at this hotel and have to make a change or a cancellation be prepared to be penalized. I booked a room with this hotel in July for our 25th wedding anniversary and paid a deposit of $415.00 for our stay in December. When I called the hotel directly to cancel one of the three night's booked, the reservationist not only was rude and condescending, but I was told my room rate of $349 per night would change to $599 per night, and thus I would have to pay an additional $500 to cancel the one night. When I spoke with whom I was told the hotel manager, he also refused to let me cancel the one night without paying $500. I have been travelling for over 40 years and stayed in many 4 star hotels, but have never been this disappointed in a hotel before. This is not how a 4 star hotel should treat its guests.

Reviews.Title: “BEST EVER”
Reviews.Author: Kevin_Sophie
Reviews.Content: It was a wonderfull hotel with great accomadations and nice staff and beautifull rooms,views, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy bed ruined vacation”
Reviews.Author: MarkMHouston
Reviews.Content: The most basic facility in any hotel is the bed. We have stayed in $35 motels, and we have stayed in $400 resorts, and this just happens to be the worst sleeping experience we have ever had, apart from the motel 50 yards from the railroad tracks when we were students. We initially liked the king-size bed in our suite, but during the first night we realized that every time one of us turned over, we were both woken by a loud clanging noise. We concluded that the bed was defective and the next morning, we reported it and were assured that Engineering would take care of it. We suspected that it had not been repaired, and sure enough we couldn't sleep on the second night either. When we asked at the front desk on the second morning, they admitted that they had done NOTHING the previous day!!! After we kicked up a bit of a fuss, they again assured us it would be repaired. This time, Engineering did come in, and were supposedly coming back. We don't know if they did because we went out for the rest of the day, but we do know they failed again. When we came back later and tested the bed, we quickly determined that it was still defective. I decided to take matters into my own hands and removed the mattress and box springs. I discovered that this bed is supported by a metal frame similar to the cheap ones you get for free when you buy a mattress set. The legs in the center were about half an inch off the floor, so they banged on the floor every time someone moved on the bed. Being surrounded by a hollow metal box, this generated the terrible noises we had been suffering. There were a few wooden shims lying around the legs, so apparently this is not the first time this has happened. (I presume they are dislodged by the housekeepers, although judging by the dust, they don't clean under there very often!) In five minutes, I had replaced the shims, and we think the bed is fixed. Tonight is night 3, so we will know by tomorrow! Having used 300,000 Hilton Honors points to reserve 5 nights in this resort, we are quite disappointed to have two nights ruined, and to have to perform our own repairs. We explained all this to the front desk, and their solution is a $100 room credit and a promise that the Engineering manager will contact us. I guess my wasted 120,000 points and tewo sleepless nights are worth $100!!

Reviews.Title: “The Casa seems to think they are doing YOU a favor by having you as a guest!”
Reviews.Author: IronBird0
Reviews.Content: I planned a week long stay at the Casa Marina - Key West, FL in order to plan my wedding. I found that the front desk staff was very lacking in regards to customer service. As a result, I was very disappointed and decided not to even consider having my wedding there. I believe that the staff at the front desk appear to have an attitude as if they are doing you a favor by letting you stay there! I've stayed at the Waldorf's in New York and London, and have never ever experienced attitudes such as this as displayed at the Casa. If I needed to talk to the front desk, I constantly had to wait at either of the 2 front desks for staff to come overwithout any indication that they even saw me most of the time. When I asked for an upgrade, due to being a Hilton Diamond member (The Casa is part of the Waldorf Hitlon chain) the young woman at the front desk actually chuckled at me in a snide way as if I am an idiot for even asking! On the bright side, the room (small and overlooking the parking lot) was at least clean and modern with a decent flat screen tv, nice radio, mini fridge. The gym, which is across the street, is above average for a hotel gym. It is clean and spacious with good quality, modern equipment (treadmills, ellipticals, bikes, free weights and nautilus type machines). The only other positive I can give the Casa is that it is a beautiful hotel and has very nice pool area. Which, if you don't care about lousy service, then it may work out just fine for you.

Reviews.Title: “Still the best location in Key West”
Reviews.Author: JuJu18
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel, then owned by another company, about 30 years ago. It was the best location and facility in Key West then and it remains so today. When you check in, be sure to ask for Patrick. He will take absolutely excellent care of you. Then should you have any questions about where to eat, what to do or what play to see, ask Don or Ron; both are an excellent concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Great Fitness Center”
Reviews.Author: dlovvanPhiladelphia
Reviews.Content: To start with the negative: $20 daily resort fee; $12.99 self-parking; $19 breakfast buffet; taxes, plus your nightly fee. It can really add up. That being said, for weeknights or any deal where you can stay for under $300, it is really worth your penny. The hotel and rooms are beautiful, clean, elegant, and well-maintained. I've read reviews that the bathrooms are small; they are, but they are clean and new and, aside from the size and strange, high-pressured shower stream, are perfect. The room otherwise is very beautiful and new. The grounds are beautiful as well; many spots for great photos. The fitness center is well-stocked with modern, high-end cardio equipment, a cable machine (2 cables, 4 different handles), a Smith machine, two benches, about 8 nautilus machines, and free weights up to 50 lbs. It was the nicest fitness center I've been to with the exception of those found in some luxury health spas. Service was great; very friendly and accommodating staff. Location is about a 20 minute walk from Duval Street, which is good because you can enjoy the hustle of Duval and escape to the relaxing and quiet location of the hotel. Just a note about food: the restaurant is pricey and not worth it; especially when there are such great restaurants on Duval. I would hit the Publix or Winn Dixie supermarkets and buy drinks (mini-fridge in most rooms) and snacks. For lunch, you can order delivery from several places on Duval - your first night there, hit Duval and collect some delivery menus. For dinner, go to Duval and eat out. Only eat at the expensive hotel restaurant if time is an issue. You can score a great meal at a much better price on Duval.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: SteelersFan27
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina Resort from 12/5/09-12/9/09. We travel quite a bit and are fairly picky about where we stay. We were very happy with the resort, aside from the daily resort fee ($22.50) and self parking fee ($12.00). But, we knew about it ahead of time, so I can't complain too much. It seemed like we could have easily found parking on one of the nearby streets and avoided the self parking lot, but we didn't realize this in time. We booked an Island View room. The room was very nice and very very clean. (The "view" left much to be desired-dumpy houses, but again, no complaints because we didn't pay extra for an oceanview.) There is a mini-fridge in the room, which was nice to keep stocked for breakfast and snacks. Don't even bother going into the little store in the lobby- it's beyond overpriced. We went to a little convienence store a couple of blocks away. We spent time on the beach and at the pool, both of which were nice. There's a beach volleyball court, but we didn't see it being used at all while we were there. The hammocks on the beach were fantastic! It wasn't crowded at all while we were there, but early December is a pretty slow travel time. If you're a "beach person", then Key West might not be the best option. The beach at the resort was ok, but it's not a picture perfect, white sandy beach. It's manmade and there are alot of rocks and seagrass. The pool was nice though, and the beach is still very pretty and nice to relax and enjoy the view. There was a little watersports center right at the resort. We rented bikes, which was a fun way to see the island. You could also rent scooters, kayaks, wave runners, etc. The Casa Marina was about a mile walk from the busy part of Duval Street. We walked down for dinner each night, which took about 20 min or so, depending on how far down we went. I would definitely recommend all the places we had dinner- The Blackfin Bistro, Blue Heaven, and Mangoes. They were all really good, but Blue Heaven was my favorite! Food in Key West is quite expensive though. The highlight of our trip was going to Dry Tortugas National Park. It was so gorgeous!! We booked our trip through the hotel for $160/person. There is only 1 boat that goes out each day (normally 2, but the other is getting painted)- The Yankee Freedom. It didn't seem to matter where you booked it, the price was always the same. We went snorkeling and walked around the fort. There's a very pretty beach too. Make sure you walk up to the very top of the fort- the view is amazing! The trip was expensive, but worth it. It was our favorite day of our vacation. If you are prone to motion sickness, invest in some less-drowsy Dramamine!! I still didn't feel very good, but there were some people that were in pretty bad shape. It helped to be sitting outside and looking at the horizon. Keep in mind that it's a long boat ride- 2.5 hours. If you are thinking about going to Key West, you won't be disappointed with the Casa Marina! It was beautiful and the service was great! We probably won't return to Key West because there's other places we want to visit, but we're glad we went and loved the Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: jennaplum2
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed, booked a suite and had to be transferred to a room in the historic building, the suite was so sub-par. It felt like a motel with low ceilings and overall inattention to details. Not-upscale. The resort itself is nice, but does not begin to compare to other 4-star establishments, which is what I thought I was getting. The staff was accommodating in switching our rooms and letting us drop a night off our stay due to our unhappiness. The most upsetting part is that I feel the photos on their website are extremely deceptive in representing the rooms, espically the suites. Everything is several notches less luxurious than it appears on thier site, and yet you have the high price tag associated with a classier, more exclusive boutique hotel. Casa Marina Resort is NOT a boutique hotel. Other than this deceptive portrayal, it's fine, but not special. Other noted complaints: bathrooms are beyond tiny and definitely not updated (again, deceptive website photos) and their is a sickening smell of peppermint air freshener that permeates the rooms and halls. In the case of the "suite" it smelled as if it had been shut up with no ventilation for months. Positives were the concierge was great and the front desk staff worked to resolve our issues in a satisfactory way, which is very refreshing given the disappointment of the accommodations. This property rates a three star in my book, just barely.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Winter Escape”
Reviews.Author: JoeSt_Louis_Mo_63129
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina was everything we had hoped for and more! Staff was extremely friendy - especially Jeanne, who checked us in at the front desk and gave us plenty of ideas for places to eat and things to do. She really got our stay started to the right foot! Casa is on the south end of the island (a little quieter) - but everything is within walking distance (no need to get a car on your stay - you will pay to park it!) Weather was 80+ and very pleasant. Hotel was extremely clean. Everything was spotless, and everyone from the beach chair attendants to the maid aimed to serve. Beach was probably nicest in Key West, pools were fabulous too. Don't miss Dry Tortugas or Duvall Street!! US citizens can enjoy tropical climate without a passport!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous romantic get-a-way”
Reviews.Author: tcs4
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Casa Marina was a relaxing and romantic experience, made even more enjoyable by a very attentive ,friendly and helpful staff. What more could you want than to be able to view the spectacular Key West sunsets from your private patio or the resort's secluded beach? 2 large fresh water swimming pools ,reflecting pools, hammocks suspended between coconut palms and other amenities create a tropical atmosphere.Yet you are within walking distance to many of the island's tourist attractions including busy Duval St. A not to be forgotten highlight for us was a candlelight dinner "on the sand"-delicious food and drink with the sound of the surf in the background.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: OopsadaisyLondon
Reviews.Content: We spent our Thanksgiving Break in Casa Marina and had a truly relaxing stay. Our room was on the ground floor and looked out directly to the beach so we were able to watch the sunrise and set without moving! Breakfast was comprehensive and the service was very good. Drinks of the day and Popsicles were served around the pool each day. There were numerous weddings throughout our stay and is the perfect location to get married. As far as outstanding service - they really went beyond the the call of duty. On the last evening we realised that our daughter's precious soft toy that she had from birth had mistakenly been taken in the bed linen. Realizing how important it was for them to find it (as the linen is sent to Miami for cleaning) they called the truck back to the resort and set about wading through 16 bins of dirty laundry! To our amazement they found it! We are extremely greatful for the effort they went to of us and will hopefully return in the not too distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Could not find a better place to say in Key West!!!!!"”
Reviews.Author: treesa85
Reviews.Content: This was my second time in Key West and I stayed at their sister Hotel the Reach which I loved!! But The Casa was Wonderful!!! Excellent staff and room. They are just the best! met any needs that we had! I miss Key West. And that wonderful Bartender "Jan" Next vacation is going to be there for sure!!!!! Thanks soooo Much!

Reviews.Title: “Great place but disappointed that had to pay for internet & no hot tub”
Reviews.Author: PHIPMOTM
Reviews.Content: If we wanted internet service we were asked to pay $11-$12 per day!! With free internet available even at many restaurants - this is something that this hotel needs to consider changing. This is becoming part of everyday life - not just for the business traveler. Business center connection was very slow - not sure if printer was available.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a Highly Recommended Resort”
Reviews.Author: Southlake_Texans
Reviews.Content: My wife and two teenage daughters just returned from a one-week stay at the Casa Marina Resort. We were in the Suites wing, staying in a one-bedroom suite with a pull out sofa (if I had to do it over again, we'd have picked the two-bedroom, two-bath suites in the same wing. Sharing one bathroom with 3 women was insane.) Although the rooms are on the smaller side, they are nice and adequately furnished. I was told the hotel was built around 1920 with a communal toilet down the hall. Adding bathrooms to each room drastically cut down the size of the rooms. Seems plausible. The built-in mini-fridge is almost a joke, so don't plan on keeping anything cold more than a few soda cans. Although the maid service was very friendly and serviced the rooms twice a day, I would recommend you ask in advance that they not knock any earlier than 10:00 am on rooms not checking out that day. Ours consistently woke us up at 9:00 am (we like to sleep in - this is a resort after all, right?) The resort itself is breathtakingly beautiful and well maintained. We rarely had to open a door ourselves and were always greeted with a genuine smile. I'd have to say that the friendliness of the staff was top notch, and all seemed very well educated, intelligent, and well dressed. Where we consistently felt the staff needed better training was in the wait service. Morning breakfast outside on the main porch under the palm trees could have been a dream. The view is spectacular, the air warm, the food excellent, and friendly smiles greet you from the wait staff. Enjoy that smile, because it will be the last time you see your waiter after s/he sits you for at least 30 minutes. Order an a la cart menu item instead of the self-serve buffet, and you may wait up to an hour to get your meal. It was this way every morning, whether it was Desmond serving you, or Ian, or John, or any one of the friendly staff members who come to work there from all over the world. There did not appear to be any shortage of wait staff for the relatively small number of people being served, so we could only assume it is a training issue. We never had lunch or dinner on the property, but I can assume the same issue would exist then as well. Unfortunately, it only got worse if you were waiting to be served by the pool or on the beach. From a business point of view, I shudder at the $$$ they're losing by not better training their wait staff. My family would have easily spent three times the dollars we actually spent on food and drinks (especially the latter) had someone regularly come by and asked us if we needed anything. Also, be forewarned, as I was, that you will pay $20/day as an amenities fee, and a minimum of $12/day for self- parking, or $20/day for valet parking. Self parking is a 30 second walk across the street from the front door, so being a vibrant 50+ year old, I chose that. On the whole, I would still recommend this resort to anyone thinking of a stay in Key West. The upsides outweigh any negatives. If you order the $19 breakfast buffet (highly recommend), you don't really need a waiter anyway. I learned quickly where the coffee decanter was located and really did not find it terribly inconvenient to get up and refill my own when needed. It also wasn't any more inconvenient to walk to the outside bar from the pool or beach to get a new drink. Sure, I shouldn't have had to do that in a resort like this, but I also was not going to let a minor inconvenience ruin an otherwise perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the Casa ~ will come back”
Reviews.Author: jawemer
Reviews.Content: We took this trip just to get away and relax. Arrived Friday afternoon on November 20th, for a 4 night stay. We flew in to the Key West airport (EYW). I had called ahead and asked if there was a shuttle from the airport to the hotel - 'yes, of course' was the reply. We get our luggage and there is Caroline holding up a Casa and Reach Resort (another Waldorf/Hilton property just down the beach) sign. She mentions that the fee is $8/person. Uh... that was a disappointment - I'm paying $2200+ for four nights (+flight) and they're charging us for a 5 minute ride?? That didn't feel right. The shuttle is some "... Transportation" so not the hotel's vehicles but some company they outsource to. Anyway, we arrived at the hotel and we were greeted warmly by the valets and the door was opened for us. The lobby is nice and inviting (see first pic) - check-in was a breeze and we were directed to our room. I had selected a "1 bedroom Ocean Vista Suite" - when I paid for it I had requested a 1 King bed suite with an ocean view. Our room, #2004, had two double beds (they looked like doubles, at least - did not strike me as queens) and we had a great view of the pool but not so much the ocean (if you looked out and to the left you could see the ocean about 20-25m away - close but you could not be sitting on a chair and gaze out on the ocean. So, disappointment #2 (& #3 depending on how you look at it). Called down to the front desk and said they would look for another room for us. The room we were in was very clean, nice small balcony (smelled of cigarettes, though so that was gross), bath had a large glass shower (no tub) - there is a living area and separate bedroom - each with a LG LCD - they appeared to be 720p in 30"-32" range. Small fridge and a Nespresso espresso maker - this was nice (my wife preferred the Starbucks in the lobby area, though). None of the rooms at the hotel have any sort of kitchenette. Ron Casa did find another room for us while we were on the phone and said that he would have someone come up with the keys to the new room (#2010). After waiting for about 20 minutes no one had come up. I went down to the front desk to ask for the keys - Ron was helping someone else but the girl that was helping me did see that he had made the change and promptly made the keys for me. I went back to our new room and got in - King size bed (comfy) and a little better view of the ocean (still had to look out to the left, though) - so I considered those issues resolved. This room was not quite as clean but just in the living area and didnâ€™t see anything else - the two glass top tables in the living area had some sand/debris between the glass tops and the wood table underneath. There was also a piece of caramel corn visible underneath a cushion on the section of sofa closest to the balcony. This balcony did not stink of cigarettes but where was an ashtray out there. Rooms are non-smoking and no hint of smoke in either of the rooms we were in. Bathroom had a tub with a curved shower rod, one toilet, shelves to the left of the toilet that are lit from behind (kinda cool), and one wide sink with the faucet on the side. In room #2004 the closet was in the bathroom but in our newer #2010 the closet was accessible from the bedroom. Floors are tile and there is a bamboo-type floor covering in living room area. What is really nice about this room (and hotel) is that it is so close to the beach! (It is one of the few hotels that has any sort of beach - the Hyatt and Ocean Key on the north side, for example, have absolutely nothing). If we walk out our room and down roughly 10 steps you're on the beach! Beach is nice - a little rocky as you go out but plenty of sand to sun yourself and play on. There are PLENTY of lounge chairs and there was never a shortage. They don't lie all the way flat, though - didn't really bother me but to the hardcore sunbather this may be an annoyance. Small tables are also available. There are also several hammocks strung up between the palm trees. Water was a little cool but fine once you are in for a little bit (that time of yearâ€¦). Lots of fish! By the piers you will see schools of fish and larger tarpon, as well. There is a bean bag toss (the game you see at tailgaters), bocce ball set, sand volley ball, and the Spa al Mare is on the beach, as well. From Casa Marina's beach you have access to two (2) piers - great for taking pictures on and viewing either the sun rise or sunsets. Small waves and not much of a tide (while we were there). During the summer you would not be able to see the sunset, though, and would have to go to the Mallory Square/North Duval area to view. Could still hear the waves breaking from our room - sounded very nice. Jim and Bob the Parrot â€“ Jim will be walking around with Bob. Bob is very tame. Heâ€™ll ask for a minimum $5 donation but says it goes to some wildlife fund. Pools (2) - I didn't get into the pool on the west side - the one on the east tasted a little salty but was refreshing. Again, plenty of lounge chairs were available when we were there and they do lay all the way flat. Sun Sun Bar - drinks are weak and expensive. A PiÃ±a Colada or Rum Runner is going to set you back $9. Add a shot to the colada and it adds $3 (standard). But a $12 drink? Needless to say I never felt inebriated while imbibing at the resort. There are 4 ~20" LCDs at the corners of the bar and Nate was happy to change the channel to the Iowa vs. Minnesota game for us on Saturday so don't hesitate to ask. On Friday night there was live music right next to the bar and that guy, playing an acoustic guitar, was pretty good. Also - this is not a "party" resort so it tends to be on the quiet side - lots of families/kids - there will be some music playing softly at the bar but you will not hear it at the pools or the beach. We ate at the bar as well as the Sun Sun Restaurant just across from the bar and the food came out quickly (it's made right there) - pricey but good (e.g., a Casa Club is $12 or Flagler Burger is $14 at the bar and the Tortellini at the restaurant was $26). A local recommended the Sunday brunch at the Casa Marina ($30) but we didnâ€™t get up in time of thatl. Watersports - we didn't do any of these and there didn't seem to be time for them anyway as we were doing a lot of site seeing. I did call about the jet skiing as we thought it would be nice to go around the island. It was $70 for a HALF hour and $110 for ONE hour. They had a 1.5 - 2 hour tour that was $120. It's been a while since I've rented a jet ski but that seemed a little exorbitant. You can also rent scooters, electric cars (those are everywhere down there!), and bikes. Room Service - ordered some food on our last night as we'd had an early dinner. Wife ordered a Flagler Burger and I had a sausage and mushroom pizza. Wife ordered her burger medium-rare and it came back a little too rare (the room service kitchen is different than the Sun Sun kitchen). Called about this and they took the burger off of our bill and offered to bring another one but declined. The pizza was good. The food came quickly, too (in about 20 minutes). There is a 20% room service charge + a $3.00 delivery charge (standard...). Maid service - heard a knocking at around 10am the first morning we were there and it was the maid. Not used to having them come that early and had forgotten to put the "Do not disturb" sign out. They did a good job and didn't worry about belongings (left a laptop, iPod, and cameras out). Cabs are cheap â€“ should only cost around$8.75 - $9.00 to get from the Casa Marina to the north side of Duval, Conk Republic Seafood Company, or Pepeâ€™s (HIGHLY recommend Pepeâ€™s for breakfast, at least!). Also had dinner at Blue Heaven and their key lime pie is homemade and delicious. I would *not * recommend taking one of the bike cab-things. They charge $1.50/minute and they pedal on their slowest (they pedal fast while getting nowher) gear possible. What would have been a $3.50 cab ride from the bottom of Duval to our hotel was a $15 bike cab-thing ride â€“ robbery. ALSO, I only took cabs with the wife â€“ I walked everywhere else and walking to the north side of Duval from the Casa Marina only took 25 minutes. They may say, â€œOh, itâ€™s 14 blocks!â€� but those are Key West blocks â€“ quite a bit shorter than a city block. We also took a cab back to the airport although it is the same price as the hotelâ€™s â€œshuttle.â€� We felt better about spreading the wealth than giving the hotel another $16 for a ride to the airport! There are several convenience stores nearby and towards Duval so can get wine, beer, pop, fruit & food quite a bit cheaper than at the resort. Faustonâ€™s grocery is on Fleming and can take out cash without a $2.00-$3.50 bank ATM fee. The Casa Marinaâ€™s ATM will charge you $3.50 per withdrawal. The southernmost *public* point in the continental U.S. is just past the Reach Resort so only about 4 blocks to the west of the Casa Marina. The actual southernmost point (besides the piers at the Casa Marina) is on the Navy Station to which the public does not have access â€“ didnâ€™t know that before I went down there so kind of makes that southernmost point marker an embellishment. Ok, yes, we would stay here again. Thinking about coming back next year already and bringing family with us. Great location, relaxing, rooms are nice, and good service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful! WIll be going back!”
Reviews.Author: betty1981
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved this resort. It was everything we were looking for and expected!

Reviews.Title: “Well designed hotel but miserabely managed and on terrible service level”
Reviews.Author: Quarterpounder
Reviews.Content: Together with my girlfriend Key West & Casa Marina were supposed to be the final highlight of a 14day vacation. After having spent nights in terrific hotels in Florida & NYC it ended to be a disaster. Long story short: Well designed hotel but on a miserable management level. Main concern is a more than irrespsonsible cleanliness level and undereducated serivce staff. Bathroom cleanliness, dusty furniture and a worn off bed really ruined the overall appearence of the resort. Complaints were actually heard and we received an upgrade, however room wasn't clean and due to its "above lobby positioning" constantly imposed to lobby music. Considering the high pricing we would rather suggest Hotels such as the Pier House (we nearly booked it, and we surely regret not having done so, but checked it out while we were around that area). We still are really disappointed, qualify it as a waste of money and are disillusioned about "Waldof Astoria Collection" branding...

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE”
Reviews.Author: bigguypres2
Reviews.Content: When you firtst arrive you are met by one of the greatest gentlemen at the front door.His name is Manny, Manny has been at the casa foor years. When you get to the reservation desk you are met by two truly courteous professionals. Maria and Patrick are the most friendly, graet people who help you get started on your vacation. Aldo to mention Charles who is in charge of booking and reservations, he is another super person. I will definately be back next year for the annual Parrothead Convention. This will be my tenth year staying at the Casa.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - but our room must have been the unlucky one”
Reviews.Author: krisspy
Reviews.Content: First off , like to say the hotel was beautiful - and the pool was very nice. The staff was semi helpful - if you can find them. However, our room .... clean yes but we definitely got a lemon of a room. The bathroom doors did not close. They were french doors but had to slam it shut to close it everytime. The water would not go down in our shower either. And we did get only the basic room - the room was quite small! Lastly, since there is a banquet hall in the hotel - be aware of lack of parking when there is a venue. We came back after a day around town, to a completely packed parking lot! There was NO valet space even. We had to double park our car randomly somewhere in the hotel and just hope that we the other person wouldn't ahve to move their car. It was ridiculous as many cars were double parked in general in that lot! Lastly, the music was quite loud from the venue, so the res tof hte hotel was not very peaceful but ended by midnite. I am thinking that altho we had these problems with the room, I am thinking maybe it was just bad luck with the room we got...

Reviews.Title: “The only place we'll stay in the Keys from now on!”
Reviews.Author: KJ78
Reviews.Content: We absolutley LOVED our stay at the Casa Marina. Everything was wonderful, from the room to the staff to the resort itself. The beach (which is unusual in the keys) was great with sand, hammocks, and chairs & towels provided by staff. The pier out over the rocks was also a great plus. We loved watching the pelicans dive from the piers for fish. The entire place is just beautiful. Bob the parrot was great too (he's a pool regular). The resort is close enough to Duval to walk, but far enough away to allow for some quiet relaxation. We liked starting our days at the pool or beach with a poolside lunch and then off to Duval or Mallory Square for the evening. You have to check out the acts on Mallory Square. The fitness center is top notch. Just remember to bring headphones for cardio. One other tip, you can park for free on the street near the fitness center. While you're there check out the pub crawl tour. We found some places we otherwise would not have gone and also the Ghost Tour was fun. Hemingway's house is also worthwhile. We can't wait to go back. If you stay at the Casa, you won't regret it!

Reviews.Title: “I volunteer to start the fan club!”
Reviews.Author: zpst7d
Reviews.Content: The best vacation of our lives. The resort is phenomenal - the most beautiful setting on a jaw-dropping sandy beach, plus historic charm and indulgent luxury. From our room to the pool, lobby and restaurants, the entire resort is spotless. Every employee is helpful and upbeat. The absolute only choice we will ever make when it comes to future Keys vacations. It is no surprise the hotel is four star rated.

Reviews.Title: “Great relaxing resort”
Reviews.Author: Lommedalen
Reviews.Content: Hi! We were here for 3 days in October. We arrived during Fantasy Fest, and it was Pets Parade at the resort the day we arrived. Great fun to watch! The hotel was so nice. The room was new, with a balcony right on the beach. Perfect. I think it was room 104. The outdoor are was very beautiful, the breakfast very good, and we also tried dinner one night wich was also good. All in all a very good experience, and I would like to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - But spa? What spa?”
Reviews.Author: ra_wolfe
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to this property. The first time we fell in love with the views and the accessibility of everything. Very family friendly resort. I gave it 5 stars the first time. This time we left the baby at home and were looking for a nice relaxing get away, complete with massages. I contacted the hotel earlier asking if they had an indoor spa as we enjoy our massages in air conditioning along with the amenities that usually come from such a spa - particularly one that bills itself a Waldorf Astoria. I was told that they had a couples suite for massage and I should contact the front desk once we checked in to get directions to the spa. This is not a spa. It is literally a hotel room that they took the bed out of and replaced with two spa tables and candles. It is right on the road, so you could hear the cars traveling down the street. People were coming in and out of the room. The only thing that separated us from the main door was a curtain. At one point, someone came in and took a shower. There was no sauna, no whirlpool. I should have known that it was going to be a mistake when they told us to arrive 5 minutes before the appointment. The therapists were very good, however it was impossible to relax in that environment. After the massages I asked the therapists if they worked directly for the hotel and was told they were sub-contractors for a sub-contractor. Ran into the manager of the "spa" on our way back to our room and told her of our experience and she basically said that's why everyone chooses to do them outside. My husband commented that this was about a half step up from an Asian massage parlor. Very disappointing from a Waldorf hotel. Do not book here if you are looking for a spa experience in the slightest. I found myself wondering where they do the manicures and pedicures and other treatments they offer as well......

Reviews.Title: “Could have been great”
Reviews.Author: gdpylz
Reviews.Content: The resort is truly beautiful. The pools are on 4.5' deep. The beach is a little rocky and the point off the pier is the only area NOT covered by seaweed. We also had an issue with the cleanliness of our pillows. Yet, even with all theses minor things I would go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: beachlovers400
Reviews.Content: Our room was very comfortable and clean and convenient to all activities. We visited the Casa Marina for a gathering of music lovers. The grounds were a perfect setting. The staff was always cheerful, gracious and accommodating. It was especially gratifying to find clothes that we left in our closet delivered to our doorstep within days of our departure from the resort. Thanks Casa Marina staff for a delightful stay and looking out for us even after our check out.. .

Reviews.Title: “Vacation with 3 boys”
Reviews.Author: CPBK
Reviews.Content: Hotel is definitely beautiful, the pools, beach and palm trees... The hotel is extremely expensive in my opinion, I think for a 2 room suite we paid about $700 per night. Rooms were nice, not super big though. Thought the living furniture was very small and not comfortable. Had a problem checking in, room was supposed to ready at 4 couldn't get in until 5! Gave me an excuse, people partied too much in my room and it was a disaster. Ok didn't make me feel to good. However I think they should have comp'd something, they did offer drinks at the bar, right there and then, couldn't do it with the kids. They charge for parking which I think is ridiculous, should be included. The staff was very friendly, very nice to my boys who can be a little loud. Breakfast was a buffet, often cold, but they didn't care if you shared with your children who didn't pay for the buffet, very laid back. The pool area was very quiet, until we arrived. I know they said this is a family resort, but there were very few kids there during our stay. All in all, we liked the hotel, super great location!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Top Notch Staff.”
Reviews.Author: siuwed
Reviews.Content: I went for the annual Meeting of the Minds Parrothead convention hosted by Casa. Although we did not have rooms at the hotel, they welcomed 3500 people with no problem, and we were treated like royalty by the staff. I was not even aware of this resort before I went, now that I am I will definitely be staying there next time. Everything is upscale and very very clean, such a relaxing atmosphere. Nice beach in addition to the pools, with palm trees and hammocks and sailboat, electric boat, jetski, bike, and scooter rental on property.

Reviews.Title: “Hassles, Hassles, Hassle in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: I_go_2_the_Beach
Reviews.Content: When you rent a room in a hotel, you expect free access to the facility, to be able to come and go without impediment. You donâ€™t expect a gang of thugs (two or more + uniformed police), not hotel staff, to stop you at the hotel entrance and demand identification. After some time explaining that you are not a part of the private group that the ruffians are representing, you are grudgingly allowed to pass, only to repeat the process at the other end of the lobby where you need to exit to go to your room. After complaining to the hotel management, they were powerless, and cowed by this organization that had rented out a portion of the hotel. No one said anything about this group function on reservation or on check in or offered any explanation on check in that would have at least alerted me, a full paying guest, of potential issues. I did find a printed notice in my room that informed me that parts of the grounds and facility were rented out to a private party and would not be available. When you rent a hotel room, you donâ€™t expect to waste time coming and going, having to deal with non-hotel elements that treat you like you donâ€™t belong since you are not one of their group and you donâ€™t deserve to be poked, although inadvertently, with 2-way radio antennae, as you enter an exit a hotel. A shorter person would have likely lost an eye. Itâ€™s a free country, and to be accosted by individuals, non-hotel staff, and identification demanded is just not what we are about in this country â€“ wonder what the guest from outside the US were thinking? After some thought, we wondered if the private function included individuals that needed such crowd control and a cadre of uniformed officers and were a little concerned for our safety. The hotel staff seemed to not be in control of their establishment. I can understand, and would support having a security detail for a private function to control access, but not to the hotel itself. I have, been to many private functions, where the function access was controlled. In fact, I attended one last month in Anaheim, at a Hilton property, where a former presidential candidate was behind me in line top check in. I donâ€™t think he would have suffered this indignation that was going on at the Casa, simply because he was not a part of the same function that I was attending. The property is very good for a beach resort, the secluded beach, pool and hammocks are delightful. The food was good, and by Key West standards, in line as far as price. We went for relaxation that we achieved, between the hassles of leaving and entering the hotel. The AC thermostat did not function, it was either ice cold or off. However, we would stay again, the property is that good, if we had assurance that the access, entrance and egress would not be an issue. In summary, call ahead to check that you will have full use of the facility, you might have a great time

Reviews.Title: “WOW - Beyond our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: Hobie16Chicago
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived for a 5 day stay to celebrate a birthday in Key West. The hotel and the grounds are in pristine condition and the staff are very friendly and go out of their way to help. The beach was perfect, a couple hundred yards of beach access to water from the beach itself or from a long pier with steps down into the water. The water is only 4-5 feet deep all the way out to a floating dock. Beach staff are always ready to help with chairs, umbrellas, and towels - they really pamper you. We loved the hotel location and would hang at the pool and beach in the morning and afternoon and then ride our bikes up Duvall to Happy Hour and then dinner and drinks. When we go tired of the crowds on Duvall, we'd simply pedal the 10 minutes back to the resort. Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property on the shore”
Reviews.Author: nomaddicted
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay here based on some of the reviews from others but was very pleasantly suprised. Upscale Astor collection hotel with very comfortable accomodations. Great staff and management. Hotel is located on the opposite side of Key West where all the nightlife is (ie Mallory Square, Duval st, etc) but everything is only a short 5 min cab ride away making it easier to avoid congestion. Outdoor bar is next to private beach, and with reservation, you can have dinner served to you at tables on the beach/on the pier

Reviews.Title: “First-Class all the way”
Reviews.Author: SuperRat27
Reviews.Content: What a great resort. My wife and I had a wonderful time. We enjoyed the service and the hospitality immensely! Very well kept grounds that allow you to enjoy everything. Jim and Bob the parrot were an extra treat we really enjoyed! The true flavor of Key West. Not to mention, very helpful in guiding us on what to do on the island. The best vacation this year! Cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “GO - excellent modern resort”
Reviews.Author: JosieMarty
Reviews.Content: On our way home from our Caribbean honeymoon, we decided to stay in Key West for a few days. With no preparation for what to do or see on the island, we arrived at Casa Marina and knew immediately we would love our 3 days there. Ron, the concierge, is FANTASTIC! From recommending local restaurants that we could walk to, to where we could go on the island for casual dinner or breakfast, he did an EXCELLENT job of recommending places but also describing what type of food, ambiance and local fare the restaurant caters to. He also helped ensure we knew where they were located so that we could decide on our own, when or where we would go. The resort is clean and modern and everyone is helpful. The room had an awesome view and we loved the mattress for bedding. Definitely use the local active/sport/excursion group attached o the hotel - they did a great job for renting mopeds to us and also recommending which excursion might be best. Only downside is that I thought there was a bit too much seaweed/residue in the pool - could be due to lots of kids in the pool or a windy night, but not as enjoyable to lounge in. We will be back again when we visit the island!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: NadiaLima
Reviews.Content: Paradise! Everything was amazing! The view, the hotel, the city... simply perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: AlabamaCrimson
Reviews.Content: Absolutely gorgeous, relaxing, and tremendous service. Nicest person I've ever met is Jim, and his bird Bob was fascinating. They made us feel so welcome and became good friends I will cherish for a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME! Absolutely perfect!”
Reviews.Author: debralg
Reviews.Content: We loved this resort! Beautiful beach, spectacular views, clean, open, modern-everything you can want in a resort! Lots of extras! Jim and his pet bird Bob make it feel like you're visiting an old friend's house, rather than staying at a hotel! On a scale of 1 to 10, this place is a 50! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Would Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: MT_MT_4
Reviews.Content: We had a great time & would highly recommend. One of the most beautiful Resorts/Hotels in all of Key West. All in all we had a great experience at the Casa Marina. The staff was very helpful. We left our Passports in the safe and they shipped them out immediately with UPS. Can't say we had any complaints.

Reviews.Title: “COULDNT ASK FOR ANYTHING BETTER”
Reviews.Author: itsfull2
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the beach was great, the hammocks are very relaxing and the service was outstanding. When our wives went to the beach to lay out the pool guys were very helpful in making sure they had lounge chairs and towels. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you to the security staff after we had departed to go back home they overnight-ed us our passports that we had left in the safe. Thanks to all at the Casa Marina for making our stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Great Romantic Weekend Destination”
Reviews.Author: SydLaika
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel on the island. The service was great, surroundings beautiful. Great pool, pool bar, beach, views, rooms. We really couldn't find anything to complain about. If you're looking for luxury on an island known less for luxury and more for "fun", this is a great place to stay. Only a couple of downsides. $10 taxi each way from hotel to Duval, etc. and the hotel shop is very expensive ($3.50 for a small Starbucks!). Otherwise it's a beautiful hotel and we loved it for a long romantic weekend getaway. We'd recommend renting a scooter from the hotel (really great deal and great way to see the island). Also we took a boat trip out to the Dry Tortuga's for snorkeling and it was an amazing trip. Took the Fast Cat. Great time!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: venetian309
Reviews.Content: Our stay at casa Marina was spectacular. The staff went out if there way to please us and made our stay a luxury experience. Rooms were great,especially the mattresses that were wonderful for my sore back. Luciano Rossi, Lake Worth, Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: StateCollegegirl
Reviews.Content: This resort is probably the most beautiful in all of Key West! We booked the hotel with a Travel Zoo rate of $149 and upgraded (for only a small amount more) to a beach front room. The rooms are good, the views amazing and excellent service! The lobby sums up casual elegance. We booked a couples massage surfside which was truly a great experience. I really enjoyed my stay and would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing - even with a 6 month old!”
Reviews.Author: polar78
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous traveling with a 6 month old, but we were dying to get away for a week vacation by the pool and beach. We were suppose to go to an all inclusive, but long story short, it didn't work out. We booked this on a Saturday and arrived on Sunday. Very short notice! They allowed us to check out the ocean front room first to see if we liked that room or if we preferred the pool view room. Well, as it turned out, the pool view room is the best!!! It has a little terrace with two lawn chairs and two other chairs that you can relax on and watch the pool. This proved to be excellent when our daughter was napping - we had her in the room, the monitor on, and we stayed out on our terrace and layed in the sun. When either of us got hot, we could walk 5 steps to the pool and take a dip. There was a crowd of people there for a wedding on the last two days of our trip, so it got to be very loud. This wasn't too much of an issue, but I could see it would get old if you had to put up with it all week long. The grounds were beautiful, the beach was a little to be desired but I only ever swim in the pool anyway (unless in bora bora!ha!). It was EXTREMELY HOT! Beware of that if traveling in August. It was a bit miseralbe to walk into town because you would just be dripping wet. But, we did the walk everyday. Because of the heat the pools were VERY warm. Not refreshing at all, which is a little disapointing. My husband and I were trying to think of something to invent and sell to the hotel so they could have a cold pool - but we came to the conclusion they just need to run new water into the pool each morning. We took our daughter to dinner almost every night. We also did hire a babysitter from an agency the hotel recommended. It was the best thing we ever did!!! I was a bit nervous - but the lady that came was a nurse at a local hospital and is the same lady they always use. She was perfect. That allowed my husband and I to have an evening out at the bars - which was SO fun!! The hotel restaurant wasn't that great - the food was ok (we just ordered at the restaurant and went and picked it up and ate at our table in the room), just very expensive. Everything seemed expensive. We typically shared lunch and then went out to dinner. For breakfast I would walk into town and pick us up some bfast sandwiches and fruit. Oh, they do a lot of nice things during the day by the pool, which was a nice touch. Drink of the day, ice washcloths, popcycles (the best I've ever had). All in all it was a great trip. Our daughter was very happy in her crib and even though her schedule was completely off, she did very well. If anyone is thinking of traveling with their child, the pool room set up worked very well for us. We also brought a litle float with a canopy for her to float in the pool. This worked like a charm b/c she loved it and she would fall asleep in it from the motion in the pool, so we would take her out and let her take a nap. We enjoyed our stay - however, would have probably only stayed 5 nights instead of 7. Just too hot! Oh, one last tip. There was a bit of construction the week we were there as well as constant trimming of shrubs (why didn't they use hand clippers instead of electical??). Well, we asked for a discount on our stay b/c no one told us this would be happening, and they credited us one night stay. Never hurts to ask!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for a great stay!”
Reviews.Author: foxreporter
Reviews.Content: It was the first few nights of our honeymoon and the minute we walked into the hotel lobby and then our room, my new wife told me, "you done good." The hotel's General Manager agreed to extend the period a couple days of a promotional offer so we could stay "three nights and get the fourth night free." For $180 a night, we had a beautiful room with a HUGE balcony overlooking the pools, beach, and ocean. Service was fantastic, and the hammocks in the palm trees unforgettable. Only drawbacks were charging for internet connection in the room, pricey beachside drinks, and extra resort fees. Bottom line is, Casa Marina is the gem of Key West and my wife already wants to go back for our 1 Year Anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “one word WOW!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandriaLaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina was one of those resorts that you feel at home in, but pampered. The staff was exceptional. My wife left her watch and it was promptly sent to us. The amenities were fantastic. The wait staff superb. Food scrumptious. The view exceptional. One of the finest hotels I have stayed in. I highly recommend to anyone! A little further from "old town" than I really wanted, but the hotel was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not Great--customer service is lacking”
Reviews.Author: Aliskate1
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina would like to be a high-class resort, but in reality its just middle-of-the-road. Keep your expectations low and you will enjoy yourself more. No doorman, and only a few overworked bellhops make it much easier to do things (bring in bags or hail a cab) yourself than to wait for their help. Rooms are small with tile floors. It is nice enough, but nothing spectacular. Key cards are easily deactivated and front desk made me jump through hoops to get it reactivated. Breakfast at the restaurant is HORRIBLE and this is coming from someone who is not usually picky about breakfast food. (I enjoy a McDonald's breakfast) Pastries and coffee available in gift shop are overpriced, so plan to walk into town if you want more than a granola bar in the morning. Lunch on the other hand was quite enjoyable and can be ordered and eaten from your lounge chair by the pool. (A grilled cheese off the kid's menu is amazing when recovering from a Duval crawl.) Location is a bit of a walk from Duval, but not too bad. It is nice to be on the ocean and away from the crowds and noise during the day. Overall, it wasn't a bad experience, I just expected luxury and it's not quite up to par.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous - and super CLEAN - large private beach”
Reviews.Author: janababy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dream. With all the choices throughout the Keys it has everything you could want. It is an Old Florida resort that has been well maintained. We originally booked a Flagler beach view in the main house but ended up in an ocean view room in the newer section. The room was smaller but had a nice balcony and a much larger bathroom. The older section has more of a view of the pool so depends on what you want. It is a bit of a walk to Duval Street - about 20 minutes, but makes for a much quieter experience. That is what we wanted. Beautiful pool area and a real beach with hammocks with chairs and umbrellas for no extra charge. You can park on the street right outside the resort and save the $25 a day parking. Very nice and safe residential neighborhood. Very nice gym covered by the $25 a day resort fee - use it!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: NY_NJer
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip alone w/o the kids (2 1/2 years old twins) that is not within two hour drive of our house. My husband and I desperately need some R&R. I was a little apprehensive after reading some of the negative reviews but we went prepared. We printed out our reservations (we had two separate reservations tat added up to three nights), details to the promotion e made the reservations under, and finally the benefits we should receive as Gold HHonor members. Right off the bat at check-in, there was a mix-up with our reservations and basically they didn't have the room available for the category we reserved for. After much discussion with reservation printouts as backup, we were given an one bedroom suite w/ a private balcony for our entire stay. Technically, we were entitled to this suite, as the Travelzoo promo upgraded us from Ocean Vista to Ocean View, and then the Gold membership gave us another upgrade to Ocean View Suite. The check-in receptionist did not seem to agree, but we stopped arguing because we got what we wanted. The resort is beautiful. There is a mandatory $20 resort fee charge to each room separate from the room rate which provide the following: hammocks, lounge chairs, and beach towels by the pool and on the beach.
