Every day at 2pm, the pool staff give out free popsicles. Had it for two days straight!! Yummy. Also, they give out cooling towels at 4pm every day. Basically wet hand towels rolled up and frozen like a stick. Great after sitting under the hot sun for a few hours. The resort fee also provides daily NY Times which includes SUNDAY NY Times otherwise it will cost you $6 to buy it at the resort store. I loved this place. We had every meal outside the resort except for lunch on the last day. The food at the resort is very good and the prices are reasonable for a resort. Louis' Backyard is literally around the corner from the resort where we had an excellent meal on the first night. El Siboney is a great place for a cheap Cuban lunch (only 5 blocks away). For people who complained about how far the resort is from Duval Street, that is the reason why we chose this place. It is close enough to walk (~15 mins) but far away from the noise and crowd. BTW...if you have a car, DO NOT park it at the resort garage. The hotel charges you $12 for self-parking and $20 for valet but there is plenty of FREE street parking.

Reviews.Title: “Peaceful, pristine and a most pleasurable experience.”
Reviews.Author: Redshoeslouisville
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the newly renovated Casa Marina. We have been vacationing in Key West for over 10 years. We have stayed at the Casa many times. This magnificent historic hotel has been managed by the Marriot, Wyndham and now Waldorf Astoria/Hilton. The recent renovation has enhanced the hotel but allowed the integrity of the original historic buidlding to be maintained. Casa Marina is by far the best hotel in Key West. The grounds, pools, beach front and rooms are prestine. The staff is friendly and works diligently to make your stay one that leaves nothing to be desired. We are always sad to leave the Casa and only hope to be able to return another year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Key West. Beautiful Grounds.”
Reviews.Author: DanielleMel
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina had beautiful grounds and comfortable rooms, tastefully decorated. We did not try the food, because we ate out every day. My favorite place for breakfast was Two Sisters Restaurant. A must try!!!

Reviews.Title: “Key West Vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: inandout715
Reviews.Content: Wow, What an amazing hotel. Although under a bit of construction when we arrived the hotel turned out to be a hidden jewel on the beech. Nothing better than lying on the beech n a hammock being waited on by a server. This was an amazing hotel with top notch customer service. The pools are spacious and the leisurely guests were very pleasant to to socialize with. The hotel staff were on their game and provided excellent room service. We spent 5 days 4 nights at the hotel and every day we spent at least a couple hours by the pool. You can purchase food and from the pool side cafe and bar. The Mango Chicken sandwich was decadent! Overall 5 stars good job!

Reviews.Title: “Best In Key West!!!”
Reviews.Author: drcook1906
Reviews.Content: We have been to Key West 7 times. I absolutely love this island. BY FAR.....Casa Marina is the best resort to stay at. It is so peaceful and scenic. Great Ocean View from just about every part of the resort. The food and service are great too. It is a little distance from downtown Duvall Street so you need a Cab or Car....but it is well worth the inconvienence to get into town. I cant say enough about the beauty of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic resort”
Reviews.Author: LynneF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been visiting Key West every year for 5 years and this was our first stay at the Casa Marina. We will never stay elsewhere. The resort was absolutely beautiful, well appointed and well staffed. It is in a perfect, private location with a wonderful beach. They do everything to make sure your visit is pleasant. The poolside bar has excellent food. My only minor complaints are that the drinks at the pool were very pricey and our last pool day was all but ruined by all of the small children in the pool. We wanted a day of adult rest and relaxation, which we did not get. Other than my two minor complaints, we loved the Casa Marina and will definately be back again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely satisfied with everything during my stay specially the service”
Reviews.Author: aikon9
Reviews.Content: The service at this resort is extremely satisfactory. Great hospitality and all hotel staff were extremely nice and helpful although I have arrived late at night for check-in and I was greeted in an extremely nice way. VIP service is given to all hotel guests. Additionally, at the hotel's private beach the hotels' staff were helpful and seemed glad to take pictures of myself and my wife when we asked them to do so due to we were on our honeymoon. The rooms at this resort are very nice, clean, spacious, and extremely beautiful with big windows and great views. The location of the hotel is excellent and very close to all the major attractions in the Key West. My overall experience during my stay at this resort is that I am extremely satisfied and I would definitely recommend this hotel to others and its a great place to stay for honeymooners and people looking for relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Classy without being stuffy”
Reviews.Author: LynnieBaby1513
Reviews.Content: This is a BEAUTIFUL hotel. The hotel gives the appearance of high class without making you feel self conscious to walk around in your bathing suit. There were some families but I never felt like I was being disturbed by children. The two pools and beach allow pleanty of room for everyone to spread out or gather together, whichever your prefer. One thing that must be mentioned is Jim and Bob. Bob is a parrot that entertains the guests. He is great and very entertaining. Jim, his owner is very welcoming and is the kind of guy who can talk to anyone. I would highly reccomend this hotel for a romantic get away or a trip with the family.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best, if not The Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: taprennoc
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in key west several times at some of the local guest houses, and have always been happy with them.. But this trip based on the great rate and the fact it was a larger resort type hotel, we opted to stay at the Casa Marina, and I am very happy we did. Unlike the guest houses, this hotel has plenty of parking, both valet or self parking, There is a fee to park, but at the guest houses I have stayed at, you were left to find parking on the street. Here you always had parking available. Unlike the guest houses that have very small pools, the Casa Marina has 2 huge pools that never felt crowded. Servers were all around the pool willing to bring you drinks or even lunch from the bar. They also offered us complimentery frozen towel and popsickles during the warm afternoons. They have a sundries shop that also has a small starbucks coffee counter in it that is great for that morning coffee. The lobby is beautiful, the grounds are beautiful, and the beack is one of the nicest on the island. We had absolutely no complaints during our 5 days at the resort. Anyone here who complains that they didnt know about the 20.00 daily resort fee must be on another planet. It was plain as day when we made our reservations, but even with this fee, the resort was cheaper than the local guest houses. Linens were clean and compfortable, rooms were nicely furnished, and the bathrooms were clean and the free soaps and shampoos were great !! I will not stay anywhere else now when going back to Key West. This place is the only true resort on the island. Enjoy !!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina is perfect getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Club3
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had not taken a trip, just the two of us, since our honeymoon. We decided to take a trip to Key West & absolutely loved it! My husband did all the planning and picked out this resort. The stay at the Casa Marina was amazing. The scenery and rooms were beautiful! The service was wonderful. My favorite part about our stay was the hammocks on the beach! And every afternoon the staff would come around and give you a chilled washcloth on the beach. I felt like a queen staying in this place! I would definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place to relax”
Reviews.Author: howlinek
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful, the scenery is great. Staff poolside was so helpful and very nice (Jimmy). The decor is great but I felt desk help could be more helpful. The bellhops were very nice and helpful. Massages were great, on the beach and best massuse I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wish we could've stayed longer...”
Reviews.Author: Caroline
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for 3 nights from 18-21 September. Booked through Alpharooms.com & paid Â£370 (not including Resort Fee of $20+tax per night). First off, can i just say how hard it was to find decent accomodation in Key West for less than Â£100 per night. It was really, really hard! So when i came across this hotel for this price i jumped at the chance. Turns out we were in town at one of the busiest times of the year in Key West, the annual Key West Poker Run, where around 10,000 bikers from all over the country descend on Key West for a weekend of fun & raising money for charity. It certainly wasnt the quiet, relaxing time we had envisioned, but we went with the flow & had a great time anyway! Self-parking or valet parking was available at the hotel, but i had read on previous reviews that parking was available on the street, due to the hotel being in a residential area. So we parked on the street, no problems at all. The hotel itself was lovely. Big, spacious, clean & elegant. There was always staff cleaning mirrors & buffing the floors & keeping the place spotless. The concierge introduced himself & was friendly. The room itself was really nice. It looked exactly like the pictures on the hotel website & was clean & comfortable. The shower had good water pressure & there was plenty of fluffy towels & nice products in the bathroom. We had a large flatscreen TV with plenty of channels to watch, which was ideal for us, as the weather was so hot, we had to sit indoors with the A/C on watching a film until it cooled down outside! The outdoor areas is where the hotel truly shines. There is two identical swimming pools with plenty of seating available. I had read on previous reviews that ice-lollies & cold towels were given out at the pool, but i never saw this. Maybe i was watching a film at the time! The pool guy saw that i had brought my own beach towel to the pool & told me not to bother next time as there is plenty of towels available for guests to use. There is also a bar area outside & a dining area. I had the mango chicken sandwich & fries (around $13) & it was delicious. Our server, i think his name was Darran?, was really friendly & polite. The hotel is in a quiet location in Key West, away from the hustle & bustle of Duval Street. It was a good 15-20 minute walk to the main strip, which suited me just fine. Overall, this hotel was excellent & i would definately recommend it to anyone considering staying in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hoss10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our anniversary in late September. It is not a cheap hotel, but it is worth it. The rooms were very nice, the pool was great, Jimmy was helpful with towels, etc. The beach is very nice, not something you get many of in Key West. The restraunt menu is limited, but the food is excellent. The only downside for us was that the hotel is (relativly) far from the action of Duval Street, but the shuttle, taxi or bikes make it a short hop. It is definately on our list to stay at when we go back to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Great for relaxation but not the best for touring,dining etc”
Reviews.Author: whippetdoc
Reviews.Content: This was a great place right on the water to relax and play in the ocean. There were plenty of hammocks, lounges, convenient waterside bar, and a place to rent water toys such as wave runners as well as bikes and scooters. BUT, if you want to be in the night life and shopping of Key West - this is probably not your best choise - need to drive to get into the main part of town which necessitates PARKING which is all but impossible (and we were there still off season). I specifically booked a room in the historic part of the building. Well, it could have been a room in any nice hotel- no "historic" to be seen. The lobby is obviously historic w/ original wood floors etc, but the wood floors in the historic rooms were laminate. The room description specified bath robes and full toiletries - including lotion and conditioner. There were no robes, no conditioner ( which for long hair after a lot of swimming is a serious PAIN..), and no lotion. The room was very comfortable and very clean. All of the staff with the exception of the gift shop cashier were very nice- and don't expect much in the gift shop - minimal at best. There was supposed to be a breakfast buffet -but the first 2 days it was a very limited menu - then the breakfast buffet opened according to a waiter because so many people complained of the slow service and cold food. The place gave the impression of being run on a minimal staff. Bob the blue and gold macaw was available for photo ops daily for a donation - he was a really neat bird.

Reviews.Title: “Hope this hotel will be around forever”
Reviews.Author: Cathy040402
Reviews.Content: Walking in to the hotel had the feel of taking a step back in time but with all of today's luxuries we are used to. They have kept the integrity of the hotel despite the various challenges over the many years this hotel has been in existence. It felt regal and one could imagine Harry Truman and distinguised dignitaries wandering the grounds and feeling breathless at the view of the ocean and the lush surroundings. The dark wood floors look like they are polished daily. The bartender, Carlos, was generous with the alcohol in our tropical drinks which opened up our opportunity to meet several people at the bar outside and enjoy the amazing breeze flowing through as we conversed with new friends. We did take a quick trip to Duval street which was plenty interesting and offered every imaginable type of entertainment. We wanted to walk forever and peer into every bar just for curiosity. But we ended up at a western bar, I believe, named Salsa Loco(?) and danced the night away and had some surprisingly delicious Mexican food (we even found great Mole enchiladas! The band was from Georgia and were really very good (and I'm from Texas and have seen a few crummy bands). It was all such a nice surprise and was so fun and memorable. Worth the visit and the drive from Key Largo where we started.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected”
Reviews.Author: PHSReunion
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property. Horrible staff. Our room was filthy, no amenities (shampoo, SOAP, tissues) and the bathroom smelled like urine. Staff unresponsive and inattentive to our needs. The A/C was out for an entire day and not one staff member cared. When we complained to the front desk the response was an unacceptable, "Oh, Well". Our group had over 40 rooms and all 40 had rooms had the same problems. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “An incredible vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: ostatenk
Reviews.Content: I went there on my honeymoon and just about everything was perfect. The scenery, the staff, and the overall ambiance. The pictures online don't lie, this place does look this nice. The staff went out of their way to help us out being that this was our first time in Key West. We ran into the valet parking person when we were out our first night, he recognized us and accommodated us while he was off the clock. He let us know some of the hot spots and even bought us a couple round of shots and played a few games of pool with us. The only knock on the place is the price of buying things at the resort. Once again though, the extremely friendly staff let us know where the grocery stores were so that we could go buy some snacks for our stay. They drew out a detailed map and later checked to make sure that we found it alright. It was a very memorable experience and we look forward to going back for an anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Website misadvertises and AWFUL service”
Reviews.Author: buttercup01
Reviews.Content: Advertised as one of the more upscale accomodations on Key West. Hotel room we were given was from the 70s and reeked of cigarettes even though the pictures online were all newly remodeled and claimed it had a balcony and was non-smoking. We had paid top dollar $500/night for our weekend getaway and for that price you can stay at some of the nicest accomodations in the world. It took well over an hour at the front desk and we were finally told that we couldn't be accomodated. We drove across the island to the Westin to try and find somewhere else to stay but with no luck. So back to our rude friend at the front desk who eventually tried to put us into a room under construction!!! We eventually were promised a room the next night and only given a $100 credit for our hours (3 to be exact) of trouble. I was sorry we ever stayed here or booked a room with them. The Casa Marina ruined our weekend getaway to Key West with not apologies and no compensation (there were other people having the same issues the day we checked in, not just our experience at this awful hotel) !!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST Vacation Ever!!”
Reviews.Author: BestAnniversary7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 7th Wedding Anniversary @ the Casa Marina Resort in Key West! Absolutely beautiful resort and the entire staff provided first-class service! Ate Conch Fritters every day - Delicious! Another great feature @ the Resort was Jim's Tropical Bird (Bob). We took many photos with Bob; he was so entertaining and we looked forward to visiting him each day on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “If you got kids, take them to Disney.”
Reviews.Author: toplesstrips
Reviews.Content: Not that this hotel isn't kid friendly, it's a very romantic getaway. After seeing the Casa Marina, we extended our vacation in Key West and moved in. We were originally staying at the Reach Hotel, a sister property about 2 blocks away. The Casa Marina is a beautiful Hotel with an excellent staff. Thank you Patrick. 2 pools, a nice outdoor bar with light dining and a palm tree lined beach with hammocks. One more thing, the cooling towels, nice touch. To swim in the ocean, you can take your chances navigating the rocky shoreline or like most everyone else, enter via the pier. The water was amazing. There is no formal restaurant for dinner. Breakfast is served in a dining room or on a patio off the dining room. The Casa is a long walk to Mallory Square but, doable and there are lots of taxis.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Looking Hotel However Not A Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pslynch
Reviews.Content: Pros -Pools Are Nice -Second Room Was Nice -Hotel Was Nice -Room Sevice Breakfest Was Good But Expensive Cons -First Room Was Loud -Resturant Didn't Have Much To Pick From -Location (It Was Close To NOTHING) -Not Quiet At All -You Have To Pay $11 A Day For Internet -You Have To Pay A Service Fee For $20 For Pool And Fitness Center (You Don't Know About This Until You Check Out) Over All You Pay Alot Per Night And It Really It's Not Worth 1/2 The Price ....

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but very expensive - better value for money elsewhere in Key west”
Reviews.Author: countyfanuk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautiful and the servie round the pool is excellent. However little things do make a difference - no free coffee in room or lobby, expensive to use business centre and be careful about hidden extras on your bill. The price advertised is not always the price you pay. Location is fantastic. Parking is expensive especially when you can park right outside the hotel for free.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: redlabtx
Reviews.Content: the hotel was great- from the lobby to the room. I loved the hardwood floors. The only real drawback was the size of the bathroom- virtually non-existent. the hotel staff was very accomodating- especially outside at the pool and on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Key West Poker Run at the Casa Marina - Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: MikeZmiami
Reviews.Content: I arranged 155 rooms (yes, 155) rooms at the Casa Marina for this years Poker Run at the Casa Marina for Southernmost HOG and friends. We had a GREAT time ! Hot afternoons were spent in the two large pools, with bar-crew bringing us drinks in the water. Rooms, food, service, were all top-notch. Certainly not the cheapest place in Key West, but if you want to indulge yourself a bit, well worth it !

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing, great quality and wonderful people! LOVE JIM & BOB!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bri_nin
Reviews.Content: The suites are very modern and nice with a very large bathroom and sitting area. The beds were also very comfortable and I really enjoyed the down bedding. The views were all gorgeous and everyone was so very helpful, especially Jim & Bob! Jim brings his Blue & Gold McCaw (the most beautiful tropical bird) to the resort everyday and just hangs out. . . Jim is full of great information about the area and things to do and see and is more than happy to help you! Kind of like a concierge service! Bob dances and entertains and loves to take pictures with you! They were the highlight of my trip. . . saying goodbye to them, especially Bob, was the worst part of leaving because they are just so likeable! The vallet parking was great to have and all the drivers were very friendly. I would love to go back again, especially to see Jim & Bob!

Reviews.Title: “Great Balconies”
Reviews.Author: purplemx5
Reviews.Content: Overall we loved the Casa Marina Resort. The grounds were beautifully maintained and very classy. We had an upgraded room with Oceanview and large balcony, wouldn't have wanted any other room. We spent a lot of time especially in the evenings out on our balcony it was so relaxing. It was a bit of a walk to Duval street and we took taxis from time to time, but it was still cheaper than renting a car and parking it at the hotel. Our room was large with a nice shower and flat screen television as well as a couch. We would defintely stay here again when we return to Key West. We had one incidence where we made advance reservations through the concierge for a special dinner and when we arrived our reservation could not be found luckily they had room for us. Our last evening was the Friday of Biker week and the pool area was very loud most of the evening past 11:00pm that kind of spoiled some of our relaxing evening.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: meggyny
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay and plan to return in the near future. Very friendly and accomodating staff throughout the hotel. Pristine manicured beaches with immaculate pools on either side, made a day at the beach spactular. Restaurants inside and out with professional wait staff. We enjoyed every aspect of this hotel, along with it's amazing history. Tom the "Pool Boy," as he called himself was a motivated and professional young man who went above and beyond to provide service to guests. His respectful and positive attitude will take him far. Thanks for a great stay!!

Reviews.Title: “The Casa Marina beach is lined with palm trees and Hammocks”
Reviews.Author: AstridWilson
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Reach Hotel for 2 nights and the Casa Marina for one night. I could not decide between the Reach and the Casa Marina. I am glad we did both, but on a return trip, I would stay at the Reach the entire trip. The rooms were the same price, but at the Reach, we had an Ocean View Suite with a corner balcony and at the Casa marina, we had a partial ocean view small room. The grounds at the Casa marina are FAR superior to the Reaches grounds; however if you stay at the Reach you are welcome to use the facilities at the Casa Marina. The Reach has one pool and a small, but very clean beach. The Casa Marina has two pools and a very large rocky beach. The Casa Marina beach is lined with palm trees and Hammocks while the Reach beach is open. We attempted to snorkel under the pier at the Casa Marina, but the visibility was very poor. We ate Breakfast every morning at the Casa Marina as you can order ala carte at the Marina. Average breakfast is $10 per person + coffee or tea or $16.00 for the buffet. We played Bocce Ball at both locations. The Reach has a real court and it was actually the first time we ever played on a court and not just in the sand or grass. My only complaint is there was No coffee maker at either Hotel. The beds were comfortable at both locations and both places were quiet at night. There is much more activity at the Casa Marian then the Reach. They are both within easy walking distance of Duvall Street; however the Reach is a little closer, as we had a car it really did not matter to us. We paid $12 a night to Self Park at the Reach and at the Casa Marina we parked free on the street. This was easier then in the lot, at least this was true for us as we had a room at the end of the hall and there was an easy elevator to the pool area and the back entrance. Our first evening in Key West we ate dinner at Sloppy Joes. This was the worst meal, I had on the trip. I had Conch Fritters which tasted more like bread then Conch. Dave had a club sandwich, his was much better than mine. Irish Kevinâ€™s has got to be my favorite bar in Key West. Yes, itâ€™s a little Raunchy, but it really is fun. Donâ€™t leave Key West without stopping in.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: VacayNow
Reviews.Content: Our first impression of the hotel was not good - the lobby was being remodeled and no one was available at the valet or as a greeter to tell us where to check in at. After checking in we realized that they had authorized the wrong credit card and charged our card for someone else's room service. After the frustrations with billing were straightened out we were able to relax. The beach was gorgeous and relaxing and the staff outside was very friendly and helpful. I loved that this hotel was on the other side of the island from the bars and nightlife; it made it so quiet, relaxing and peaceful.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel, private beach is wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: LuvMCO
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Casa Marina and I was very pleased overall. I love the hammocks on the beach and the atmosphere is very luxurious and relaxing. Service was very good and the location is decent with regard to proximity to other attractions. My only complaints would be that the pull out sofa couch had a very uncomfortable mattress and there was some mold present in the room (I understand that the buildings are old, but mold should not be an issue at a resort of this caliber). As far as room amenities, the fridge is very helpful but I was surprised that there was no coffee maker or moisturizing lotion provided. Also, the unavoidable daily parking fee seems to be an unnecessary way to pad the bill ($12 per day). All in all, I'm sure I will be returning and I look forward to the completed lobby remodel and the return of the absinthe tasting experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and on its way to being the Best Hotel in the Keys.”
Reviews.Author: wljet
Reviews.Content: The beauty of the south of town location with elegant beachside pools will make this an excellent choice for a weekend stay or longer vacation.This recently renovated property has everthing you need for a relaxing or active stay.Scooters,Jet Skis etc. is available on property from Key West sports. Both Patrick at the Front desk and Ron as Concierge,exceeded expectations. As with most Classic Hotels,The rooms are smaller than new modern layouts but are appointed with a "cooly urban "look with very nice bathrooms. Our only criticism, the hotel staff is uneven for a luxury property but with continued customer service improvements and maybe adding a signature resturant, this could be one the best hotels in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: JerseyShoreGuys
Reviews.Content: We came down to celebrate my partner's 40th birthday and I was a bit cautious given some of what I read, but I have to say that our experience was letter-perfect. Everything about the resort was beautiful and I loved that it was close enough to Duval that we could easily get there but that it wasn't in the middle of everything. The beach and pools were great. We only ate lunches at the restaurant by the pool but have already decided that the next time we go we'll eat dinner and even try the breakfast. Staff was great. And the gym is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “This Hotel Is Just Not a Good Value”
Reviews.Author: MAC3844
Reviews.Content: Service was minimal. Bath amenities limited for resort hotel. Maid service didn't even have proper amenities but a call to front desk finally produced lotion, etc. The room costs 5 times more than a Hampton Inn and not better in size or decor. Location is great with some beautiful views of the ocean. Pool is spectacular. While the lobby is being redone, checking in is a minor inconvenience. Not close to downtown Key West (where most of the action is), however, hotel can always get you a taxi. Internet connection very slow and excessively priced. We were just disappointed in the hotel at a 40,000 point per night level. We should have gone elsewhere and saved our points for a better value elsewhere. One point off for poor service. One point off for diminshed value.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: martyd
Reviews.Content: great is really all i can say, minus points car parking left it on street in end, rooms a little small maybe but im picking plus points hammocks and beach

Reviews.Title: “Can't Go Wrong Picking This Hotel!"”
Reviews.Author: Frqflier
Reviews.Content: Really a wonderfully relaxing stay at one of the few hotels in Key West that has beach access. As a previous reviewer noted it's a young, hip hotel that has a wonderful history. I won't bore you with too many details about a good choice for Key West. If you're a student, party animal or looking for a low-key guest house this is not the place for you. But if you're a couple, or in my case a solo dad traveling with a 7-year-old, you've got a nice hotel to use as a base while exploring what there is to explore in Key West. It has two identical, wonderful pools, set amid beautiful palm trees. It's on the beach, or what passes for a beach in Key West, which is a little sand and a rocky access point. The hotel has a nice pier which goes a way out, with stairs, for access to the water. You'll find a fair amount of seaweed, but hey, that's the Florida Keys. The staff is warm, accomodating, friendly and highly professional. It's a hip place but that doesn't mean pounding discos and a party atmosphere. I was very pleased by the lack of music poolside. Sometimes I just want to totally relax, listen to the beach and not have to listen to Caribbean music, Jimmy Buffett or other resort-themed music. The hotel reeks of history and why it's been renovated into a modern hotel is another topic for another time. I'm sure historians are freaking out at the modernization of this hotel and I'll leave it for the architects and history buffs to debate whether they've done the best thing for the public spaces of this classic hotel. Our room was modern, the beach views wonderful and had absolutely no complaints about anything at this hotel. There's a bike, boat and moped rental place at the hotel and there is also a paid shuttle service to the airport. The taxi ride, all of five minutes, will cost you a shocking $16 (two passengers @ $8.00 each) from the airport. I'm from NYC and a lengthy car service or cab ride to or from the airport, as of this writing, will cost you about $40. A metered cab ride in NYC for an equivalent journey would have cost $5.00 tops. If you're a newlywed, a couple or traveling with kids this is a great choice for Key West. Just wish I'd been able to afford it a lot earlier in life, although certainly can't complain at the roughly $150 a night rate that we got shortly after Labor Day. As others have pointed out, and the Hilton website makes abundantly clear, there is a $20 per room "resort fee" attached to your stay. Why they just don't jack up the room rates by $20.00 and skip the "resort fee" is beyond me. All in all a memorable holiday, my kid loved the beach, the boce ball, the volleyball and the pools. I'd definitely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Most relaxing and enjoyable vacation.....”
Reviews.Author: angel193
Reviews.Content: We found the staff to be friendly and most helpful with everything we needed. The place is absolutely beautiful and love that it is right on the beach. Sitting on the beach relaxing and being served lunch, drinks was great. There are two swimming pools so it was never crowded. The food was delicious and the rooms were clean and comfortable. The only thing I didn't like was the $12 daily parking fee along with the $20 daily resort fee plus tax. We were there for five nights so it cost us and additional $177.00.

Reviews.Title: “The Hip Hotel with Local Color”
Reviews.Author: daninnyc
Reviews.Content: Hotel General: General pleasant stay witha very young staff that tries to make your stay comfortable. Rooms are very small but comfortable although they lack creature comforts a Five star hotel should have. Pools are very warm and completely over chlorenated, and the beach area is too rocky with very slimy ladders for entry and exits. Still, one cannot go wrong with staying at this place although fascilities such as restaurants and shops are missed. Rooms: Functional and in muted modern tones, there is only one or two sockets to charge your electronics..a no-no in todays electtronic age. Bathrooms and tiny with standard showers only and very minimal sundry items. Nothing special or of niote here, but they are clean and comfortable. Common Areas: Hallways do have that Florida bad air smell. Rooms are placed in ill conceived areas making your trip back and fourth difficult. At times depending on what roon you have you may even need to change elevators. There is a large breakfast room that Europeans will find welcoming but the hotel lacks a restaurant. There is an outdoor grill area for lunch by the pool, but no place to just stay in and eat...the breakfast room closes down for the day after breakfast. Pools are maintained wekll although they could use more staff to serve drinks. On our stay may drunk people where enjoying libations and beers in the pool and were loud . The pool water is very warm (think bathtub) and is over chlorinated. NOTE: there can be a very unpleasant sulfur smell from the water at times. The hotel lacks atmpsohere. Although it prides itself on being a combination of him and local color, it truly has neither. The hotel is too borring to be hip and there is nothing hip about it. Local color in Key west is drinking, jello shots and T-shirt shops.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: jlb28
Reviews.Content: A beautiful resort with private beach. At arrival we were welcomed in a lovely contemporary reception area. Location is perfect in walking distance to Duval Street and other sights such as Hemmingway's house and ''Little White house''. A family of 4 we had booked a suite with seaviews and were very happy with the room itself: very spacious with 2 large flat screen TVs and a dining area as well as a nice balcony. Unfortunately we were given the corner room and therefore had part view of a fairly busy street which somehow disturbed the lovely views to the other side of the Atlantic Ocean. Within hours the friendly frontdesk staff had moved us to a suite with better views. In fact the frontdesk really stood out and I must especially mention Patrick who in his free time took myself and my children fishing on the pier bringing rods and bait for us all. Look out for value for money offers like ''one night free'', ''kids eat free'', ''resort credit'' We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: HippoPi
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really beautiful - the building, decor and outside areas are gorgeous. The pool areas were great - even though there some families there, it wasn't crowded and the kids weren't annoying in the pool! Lots of sunloungers were available all day. It was also nice on the beach - very peaceful, and they set up loungers and an umbrella anywhere you want. Nowhere was crowded. Hammocks on the beach were fun, especially at night for looking up at the stars. The bar and restaurant were great - you can eat dinner by candlelight on the beach! Breakfast was delicious, and lovely to eat outside, in the sun or shade. Service at breakfast was very friendly. We particularly liked the ice-cream parlour in the shop! And the free internet terminals were useful. There's only two things I would mark the hotel down for: 1. noise in the rooms. We did hear a lot of noise from the couple in the adjoining room (they talked very loudly when they got in at 3am every night and woke us up!). Didn't spoil our stay though. 2. We didn't have a car or hire a golf buggy - we chose to walk to the sights (mainly around the Duval Street area), which was a 15-20 minute walk. Not good if it's really hot! Would have been nice to be a bit closer. Most people hire bikes or golf buggies etc anyway, so this isn't really an issue. We loved this gorgeous hotel. We'd recommend both the hotel and Key West as a great holiday destination.

Reviews.Title: “"WOW"- Great Staff, Great Service, Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: timmy50
Reviews.Content: From beginning to end, the Casa Marina is totally Key West. Relax Relax Relax, need I say more. The pool, the staff, the Gulf everything was spectacular, especially Patrick at the front desk. Kudos to the staff--especially Patrick, our stay was one of the most joyous we've had in Key West.. Would we stay again? YEEESSSSSSSSSSSSSSSS! Can't wait to return.! Tim and Cynthia

Reviews.Title: “Lacking consistent communication/management”
Reviews.Author: JessiBetzy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during the first week of the "off season" and, although the grounds were lovely, we had several issues. First, the lobby and outside bar were both under construction while we were there and we were never notified about this when booking. There is nothing more relaxing than listening to a floor being sanded and tile being cut while you are swaying in a hammock reading a book on the beach. This was very disappointing. We also had to have our in-room refrigerator replaced THREE times during our 6-day stay. We had medicine that needed to be refrigerated so this was quite frustrating, especially when we called to get a replacement/repair and would wait 2+ hours just so no one would show up. This is the bad communication/management referred to in the title. If you can't make it, at least call us and tell us - don't make us wait 2+ hours before we call back to find out they aren't comning. Also, DON'T PAY TO PARK!! They charge $25/day for valet parking and $12/day to self park in their lot across the street when you can park on the street for free! Don't waste your money (I can only speak for the time of year we went). Outside of these complaints, the staff was mostly friendly and attentive, the food/drinks were good, the pools were clean (but hotter than bathwater - not refreshing at all!) and the chairs/hammocks/umbrellas on the beach were paradise. Happy travels.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, pity about the $32 cost per night for parking your car”
Reviews.Author: Cadismate
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the hotel on our tour of South Florida and the keys. Nice hotel and welcoming staff. Nice pools and decent rooms. Had enjoyed our stay until our departure, when we were told that we owed $32 for overnight parking - just imagine you were there for 5 nights, and as you leave your asked for $160 - hidden charges

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, affordable prices”
Reviews.Author: EllenAtlanta_Georgia
Reviews.Content: it was one of the most relaxing vacations I've had in years! The staff was friendly. We ate dinner on the dock and the fish was great. Lunches were served on the beach or by the pool. The kiwicolada is a specialty drink there. We slept the day away in a hammock on the private beach. The hobie cat was alot of fun too, the water is beautiful, don't forget your snorkle!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: WadeFL
Reviews.Content: PROS: The hotel itself is gorgeous and impeccably maintained, and the staff is very attentive and extremely friendly. The resort is located in a residential area, so surrounding noise and congestion is virtually nonexistent. Although it requires at least a moderate walk to get to the best restaurants and the popular areas of Duval Street, it seems to one of the few resorts on the island with beachfront access. With two spacious pools, an outside bar and food service, large sections of beach that are well shaded by palm trees, and a small dock from which you can enter/exit the ocean with ease, you will be hard pressed to find another location in Key West that will allow you to enjoy the naturally relaxing aspects of the island as well as this one. On the final day of our trip, we never once left the resort and instead opted to enjoy the sunshine, alternating between the pool and the beach. This added an aspect of enjoyment to our vacation that we would not have had had we stayed in a B&B or in a hotel with no beach access. SMALL ANNOYANCES BEYOND THE HOTEL STAFF'S CONTROL: The beach itself is relatively small and very rocky, so if you expect plentiful beach sand, wide open spaces, and swimmer friendly shoreline, you will probably be disappointed. There is a dock that extends past the rocks with stairs down into the water, so the hotel does make the best attempt it can to overcome this. But still, it's just not quite the same. In addition to a rocky shoreline and ocean floor, there is an incredibly high amount of seaweed in the water. The staff clears the seaweed that washes ashore, but you will still find the ocean floor literally covered with it should you decide to take a swim in the ocean. Also, the beach area as well as all the other common areas tend to get quite crowded, especially on the weekends. CONS: By far my biggest complaint is the rooms. While they are perfectly clean and tastefully appointed, they are simply too small and offer insufficent ammenities. Before it was part of the Waldorf brand, the Casa Marina was owned by the Blackstone Corporation under their luxury hotel brand LXR. After Blackstone purchased Hilton (which owned the Waldorf brand), they moved all of their LXR resorts to the Waldorf platform. And as far as the rooms go, they unfortunately just fall a little short of the Waldorf brand standard. While larger suites are available, the standard rooms are certainly no bigger (and perhaps smaller) than rooms of the same category at budget hotels. And although the decor and fixtures are very appealing, there are no more comforts than you would find elsehwere in less "luxurious" brands. Inland facing rooms have absolutely no blacony, and none have a coffee makers unless you specifically request one. Presumably, this is to encourage patronage of their sundry store, which just so happens to sell brand name coffee. But when a resort of this caliber sacrifices customer convenience for the obvious purpose of trying to make an extra buck, it leaves a pretty sour taste in one's mouth. Additionally, the resort adds a mandatory $20 per night fee to their advertised rate for things like poolside wait service, towels, hammocks, beach chairs, weekday newspapers (which we never received), etc. I readily admit that having these ammenities is invaluable, and I would most definitely not be pleased with having to pay for the extra services a la carte. But since all guests are forced to pay this extra fee, it seems that charging it as an "add on" instead of simply including it in the base price serves only to allow them to advertise a lower room rate than what is actually charged. My last point of contention: parking. The Casa Marina charges $20 per day for valet parking and $12 per day for self parking. Being located in a residential district means that there is ample street parking that is perfectly convenient, and charging for parking just seems like yet another attempt to milk as much money from you as they can. Bottom line, if you're looking for a place where you have the option of simply enjoying the abundant sunshine and relaxing in the views and sounds of the ocean without ever having to leave your hotel while still being close enough to the heart of Key West, you won't find a better property or a more professional staff. But just be aware that slight disappointments in the rooms, the beach, and the miscellaneous fees are a possibility.

Reviews.Title: “A little slice of paradise”
Reviews.Author: cafe-con-leche6
Reviews.Content: The elegant yet simple decor of the Casa Marina allowed the real focal point to shine, which was the Atlantic itself and those glorious swaying palm trees. The hotel is beautiful, it's dark wood floors, arches and ceiling fans take you back to the elegant 20's. Our rooms were nice, but then we had connecting ones facing the ocean. Who could go wrong with that view? The staff at the hotel was friendly and helpful from the beginning. We enjoyed all of the wait staff, many of whom were from foreign countries - very enthusiastic and fun! The hotel cat, Snickers, was a big hit with my teens, who often went looking for him. They loved finding him on our porch or wandering the hotel. We walked or biked everywhere, it took about 5 minutes on bike to get to the Old Town section of Key West. It was nice being a little bit away from the hoopla of downtown. We could enjoy it easily, whenever we wanted, but retreat to the tranquility of the Casa. The public tennis courts are across the street and very nice. Key West Watersports is part of the hotel where you can rent your bikes, make arrangements for scuba diving, rent boats, everything. Our scuba instructor, Joe, was awesome. I would highly recommend him to anyone who is a first time diver. The only real problem I encountered - the two Queen beds in the rooms are actually Doubles, which was an issue because of my 6' teenagers. They brought an air mattress in for us, which was a tight squeeze but worked out fine. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: EMUP
Reviews.Content: We loved the hotel facilities so much that we saw less of Key West than we intended to....the kids were happy to sit between the beach and the pool. Staff were great, pool beach great, food and beverage great. I think of the three hotels we stayed in the staff were the friendliest at this hotel. We were a little bit disappointed with our suite initially as we were on the ground floor and our balcony overlooked the main road but we should have known better (living on an island) that an island vista is often going to be the road, we should have booked the ocean view. In the end we liked the fact that we were on the ground floor as it was very close to the pool to keep going backwards and forwards with the kids. Next time we would ask for ground floor but on the pool/ocean side. It is worth the money to upgrade!! Thank you for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pampered Respite”
Reviews.Author: BostonWally
Reviews.Content: They have a first class staff without being pretensoius. The two pools were excellent and the pool-side/beach service was pampering. The hotel is beautifull-I expected to see Bogart and Bacall walk through the lobbt at any moment. Patrick at the front desk was professional, attentive and friendly. I talked with a guest from Great Bitian and spoke of Patrick's personalized fishing expedition. Our one bedroom ocean vista room was impeccable and cleaned each day. Jan at the Sun Sun outdoor bar provided excellent service, as did all staff, and she was a wealth of knowledge on local activities for ther Keys. The pub food at the bar is great for lunch. The concierge Ron was instrumental helping me find resturants that work with customers with food sensitivity issues. We ate at the sister resort eatery, The Strip House and had an excellent meal that accommodated my food concerns. The coral on the beach requires water shoes but after a frozen Margerhitta under the palm trees this is not a big deal. There are Conch shells to be discovered and "left alone" on the beach. Brown pelicans and Royal Terns cruise the beach daily in search of food. We enjoyed meeting people from Italy, Spain, Great Britian and Serbia. The Blue Heaven and Camillia's are great local eatery's and reasonably priced. Rent scooters on-site! So much fun. It was our 40th aniversary and they exceeded our expectations. Everyone is treated the same. We are planning our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “first class all the way”
Reviews.Author: pbt3
Reviews.Content: Room (Casa Grand Ocean Vista) - Gteat Balcony - outstanding with great view staff - First Class Note: Please open inside bar

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings, Hotel Beautiful But Left Much To Be Desired”
Reviews.Author: BullMarket
Reviews.Content: We visited Casa Marina with another couple and eventually had a great time and experienced the relaxation and hot sun we so desired. First the good. The hotel itself, the rooms and the pool area are beautiful and are well kept. The pool scene is fantastic with your daily service charge resulting in daily drink samples, popsicles and frozen face towels - a nice touch that was worth the fee. The pool bar and cafe were good and service out here was fine. Bar is expensive but you can pack a cooler and bring it down to the pool - CVS is two blocks away! Island scene a bit touristy for me, but food, drink and band scene on Duval Street a pleasant surprise, where homeless drunks are around, but in general they dont hassle you and one offered jokes for a buck - take him up on it! Rent scooters, but watch traffic and parking spots carefully. Price seems reasonable vs other nice hotels on island. Now the bad, I checked our reservation three days ahead of arrival to find out our promotional rate ocean view room reservation had been cancelled (they couldnt tell me who cancelled it). I had to rebook at a higher non-promotional rate with parking lot view just to get a room to be with our friends. The reservation system here is a joke - check ahead! After Paddy checked into it for two days, the hotel eventually honored our initial rate but we had no ocean view as we had hoped. The ocean here is not beachy and to enter it, you walk down the pier and down steps into the seaweed infested water. This was a real downer. Our room was cleaned every other day and maids appeared to be less than skilled. A real mixed bag, a real nice spot, but left a bit to be desired.

Reviews.Title: “so happy we chose the casa marina --the best in key west”
Reviews.Author: friendsfromNJ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently vacationed in Key West. Staying at the Casa Marina made the trip perfect. My compliments to the management for maintaining a hotel that caters to its visitors with friendly and caring staff from Manager to doorman. Our handicapped accessible room was quite a welcome sight to my husband in a wheelchair and we found great comfort in the roll -in shower and all the facilities. No reason to look at any other hotel--this is the place to be ....the best in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property; fellow guests are not my crowd.”
Reviews.Author: golerrs
Reviews.Content: The hotel and grounds are very beautiful; the rooms were a bit small for the price, but our balcony made up for the room. The staff was courteous and friendly at all times, kudos to the employees. Unfortunately, the worst part of the hotel were the other guests. I had booked this room to "splurge" for the weekend, and was genuinely embarrassed by their behavior. No matter what the hotel name or brand is, good manners and politeness should be the rule. Again, kudos to the hotel staff!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice grounds, the rest needs a little work.”
Reviews.Author: MikeK413
Reviews.Content: I will say this, we enjoyed our stay at the resort. But, knowing how things should be and what we got are two pretty different things. Yes, you're paying for a resort atmosphere, a big name and you're paying top dollar for it. I am not sure that they really deliver on it though. Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed the oceanfront and we loved our room - had a great ocean view, nice balcony and we weren't right by the main area of the resort (room 304). But I do feel that the service is lacking a lot at the resort. When you come on here and read all these good comments and you get none of that, it makes you wonder. We never got any beach service, it took forever to get a drink, we never got anything additional and I just didn't get the sense that the staff was really up to giving 4-5* service. The pools are pretty shallow and not very relaxing. The beach is also a bit rocky and has a fair amount of seaweed, but it is still more than other hotels offer. The $12 per night parking seemed a bit stiff. In summary, I really like the Casa Marina, but just know you might not get the service you may expect.

Reviews.Title: “Made 25th wedding anniversery one to remember, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sjajaj
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina staff was great. They were helpful and knowledgable. The hotel was beautifal. The grounds were clean. The walk to the other end of key West was perfect. You are close enough to go and see all the attractioins, resturants, etc... but away from all the hustle and bustle when you want. We are already planning to go back again. I would reccommend this resort to any and all travelers that want to feel at home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: mollerCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: This is by far the best hotel we have ever experienced. The buildings are absolutely beautiful restored, the swimming-pools perfect and the beach is amazing with lots of palm-trees and hammocks. Also the service is second to none. Everyone was very helpful and professional. Especially the guys at the pool and beach were amazing. You havenâ€™t arrived at the beach before they were setting you up with chairs, umbrellas, towels etc. And there are litteraly thousands of towels â€“ just grab as many as you like all day long. When staying at the beach or one of the two pools, you are treated with a free drink, ice-cream, watermelon, freezing towels etc. during the day, which just add to the positive general impression of the hotel. Also there are free coolers with iced water at the poolbars, which was a nice touch not having to constantly run to the bar buying expensive beverages to the children. The rooms are also great - we ordered an ocean view room and had one with exactly the most beautiful view at the beach and ocean. Some have mentioned this is an overpriced hotel, but this is absolutely not the case. The prices are quite reasonable keep in mind you are staying at these beautiful surrondings â€“ we were having dinner at the beach actually tabled in the sand, watching the moon rise above the ocean, with nice and observant waiters and paid only above $ 100 for 2 adults and 2 kids. This is just above the average price when eating out at the local Mcâ€™donald back in DK. When you take all the free stuff you are treated with at the pools into account, the self-parking etc. this is definitely reasonable. Coming directly from Miami beach with extreme prices on average hotels, drinks and valet parking we were certainly very pleasently surpriced. The Hotel is situated in walking distance from Duval street, but in a very quiet neighbourhood, which was perfect to us. Only negative thing we can think off was that we only booked a 3 nights stay â€“ should have stayed a couple of days longer at this beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Overrated and expensive. Go somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: macktheknifeBr
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Casa Marina for 3 nights in July 2009 with my partner. We had been to the Boca Raton Resort from the Waldorf Astoria Collection the year before and simply loved it but boy, what a difference! For starters, thereÂ´s a $20 daily fee to cover for ammenities as the hammocks (the most expensive in the world, I guess) and other stuff. If you donÂ´t get to the hammocks early in the morning, forget it. There are not enough for all guests! I suppose, then, that the $20 only allows your presence in the swimming pool, because all other activities were paid. They even charged $5 dollars - yes, FIVE dollars, for a wine tasting. The website says it covers refreshments, which is a blatant lie, since we had to pay for every single thing we had. And you had to go to the swimming pool simply because the beach has no sand in it, only rocks. They built a pier so that guests could reach the water, but frankly, it was disappointing. Lots of people confined in one spot in the sea. Parking costs $12 if you park it yourself across the street, and we decided to pay $20 for the valet in the hopes they would park it under a kind of shelter, since the summer in Key West hits high on the 90Â´s. No way Jose - for 20 bucks your car is roasted under the sun, day in, day out and you simmer in it while waiting for the AC to take effect. Service is non-existent. They charge you and thatÂ´s it. When we arrived, I took hold of a map and asked the valet where we were in the map. After 3 minutes of not so funny jokes, he confessed he couldnÂ´t read a map!!!!!! Breakfast is a joke - even though there were eggs cooked any style you wanted, bread was not fresh and there was not a variety of choices. There were 3 kinds of fruit, and not so many choices of jelly or cold cuts. Obvioulsy, breakfast also costs $15. Not to mention they donÂ´t have a restaurant. The only meals they serve are in the slim pool menu. I had a BLT and a beer and my partner also had a sandwich and a beer. The check? 56 dollars. FIFTY-SIX DOLLARS for 2 SANDWICHES AND 2 BEERS! Oh, yes! And they charge you for wi-fi in the room!!!!!!!! I donÂ´t remember how much but it was kind of 11 dollars. CouldnÂ´t it be included in the amenities that they already charge??? Given the chance to go to Key West once more, I would definitely avoid Casa Marina. So should you.

Reviews.Title: “A nice 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Killer67
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in a 1 bedroom suite. Positives Location- not bad, close enough to things, but not right on top of them. Beach area- Key West is not known for their beaches and it was nice to have one at the hotel. The hammocks are a very nice touch. Pool bar and bartenders- I found all of them great! Negatives Room classifications- very few true ocean view- many pool view. I had an â€œisland vistaâ€� which meant view of parking lot and loud street. The patio was covered with trees, so there was nothing to look at and too hot to sit on. Some service was lacking, but overall it was pretty good in that area. No indoor restaurant on site Hints- If you want a coffee maker ask for one Donâ€™t expect 5 star, which many Waldorfâ€™s offer. This is a good 4 star place! Take the sunset cruise on Wed or Sat night- very nice!

Reviews.Title: “I agree...service is the worst!!!”
Reviews.Author: pink-polka-dots16
Reviews.Content: I got married in Key West back in May. Out of ALL of the hotels, the Casa Marina, was the only hotel that was totally unaccomodating. I had about 8 guests staying at their hotel. I stopped by to drop off my wedding gift baskets for my guests. The girl at the desk told me that I couldn't leave any wedding gift bags for my guests since I wasn't staying at the hotel. She was very rude and would not help me at all. I went to about 20 different hotels to drop off these gift bags (and no one else gave me a problem). It is unbelievable that a "Waldorf" hotel had the worst service in all of Key West. The hotel itself was beautiful and the location was gorgeous!!! However, it is not located near the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Too many screaming kids with no supervision.”
Reviews.Author: BenD0ver
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel many times since 1990 and my second visit since last yearâ€™s major renovation. The hotel is nice and the location excellent. This trip, however, was disappointing. The hotel was filled with kids of all ages that were rude, disrespectful, and loud. Throwing balls and splashing in the pool with no respect for others, running in the halls at all hours and running through the resort as if they owned it. What was worse was the parents doing nothing. They just seemed happy for a few moments of piece. Unfortunately that piece came at the expense of others. Iâ€™m not sure when Key West became a hot spot for children, but I cant imagine anyone would take his or her kids to one of the most bars per capita City in the US. If you are considering taking your kids to Key West, you should have your head examined. We would never take our kids to this City. Thats what grandparents are for. It was pathetic to watch parentâ€™s schlep their kids down Duval street with a beer in one hand and a kid in the other walking from bar to bar. How pathetic. I guess there is the Conch Train, the men dressed as women on south Duval street, the public beach to see the homeless people sleeping under palm trees, the sunset ... yippee and the butterfly house. How memorable. Disney World is still open! We like this resort because of its detachment for Duval and the quietness of the property. The room was nice. It was large and comfortable. For $99 it was a great value. I would not recommend the added $$ for a balcony this time of year. The construction design is old and the Hotel is built like a brick over to protect it from hurricanes. Most of the balconies are recessed with no breeze. The high-speed Internet was nonexistent. The $20 resort fee is a joke. You get absolutely nothing for it, not even an airport shuttle. Bottom line - If you like screaming kids, stay here in the summer. Much quieter and classier in the winter. Never again June - August

Reviews.Title: “a great experience”
Reviews.Author: drmsl
Reviews.Content: A wonderful resort hotel that caters to its guests and is right on the water. The front desk staff were sensational and everyone was so professional and friendly. The pool and beach staff catered to its guests to the max as well and ensured that you felt like you were at a resort. Plenty of clean towels, free sample drinks, cold washclothes, and free popcicles. Rooms were clean and the service was wonderful. In my opinion, nicest hotel in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property with everything to offer, just be ready to get it yourself”
Reviews.Author: CWID
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina is a wonderfully restored 1920s resort property with luscious furnishings and exquisite pools. It is nothing short of absolute eye candy...(feel free to check out pictures on my blog: http://www.highglossblue.blogspot.com/) Within the property there are 2 restaurants, comfortable hammocks and a man-made beach so well crafted you will believe that you are in fact on an island with natural beaches. We rented bikes & a jet ski on the property for very reasonable prices and had a wonderful time. The service however does not live up to the expectations or the price tag associated with the Waldorf Astoria moniker that precedes Casa Marina. The hotel does not offer a shuttle service, but it will call you a cab...so, will the Days Inn. The hotel missed our turn down service the first night and when we asked to order ice cream at the restaurant we were told they were no longer serving it, we would have to order it from room service (which of course comes with an astronomical fee). I know, none of these things are a huge deal and I still really enjoyed the popsicles and the movie the staff showed on a projector beside the pool, as well as my whole experience. However, Casa Marina is missing beats and a Waldorf Astoria Property should miss none.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place”
Reviews.Author: ChelseaPeople
Reviews.Content: Just traveled here with a small group and we had a great time. Nice pools and beach, and the service was solid. Free (not strong) drink by the pool once a day. Beautiful setting. Solid service. Nice breakfast buffet ($19 on weekends). If you don't pay extra for a room upgrade, you'll get a bad or no view - our room was very dark. But who cares, because you don't want to be inside anyway. It is a long walk or short cab ride to Duvall St., but that is not a bad thing really. There was typically a line for the internet computer. Be a bit careful about relying only upon the concierge (Ron), as it seems that he has deals with the restaurants to which he'll send you - though he'll be able to send you to a good place.

Reviews.Title: “Better Than Ever Imagined!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ohwee
Reviews.Content: I am a Hilton diamond and stay at many Hilton properties. Wife and I used points to stay at Casa July 4th wk. Having read some negative reviews about service, etc, we were skeptical about the Casa. Boy were we wrong! Our visit could not have been better. Trust me, don't miss this lovely resort. The staff was always friendly and ready to help. Ron and MJ in concierge were both professional and extremely helpful in every way. Both are super people with great restaurant and activity recommendations. You can tell they really love their jobs. Pat handed out popsycles EVERY DAY and we always got a couple. He would not stop until everyone was chillin with one. Also every day at noon, Darin and others handed out samples of the 'drink of the day'. Key lime Pina Coladas by the pool were the best...hmmm! Nicole at the front desk (and others, can't recall all the names) was extremely pleasant and friendly. She spoke candidly and answered questions we had. (She deserves a raise!) And Kasha, the manager of the resort, although on vacation at the time herself, made it a point to welcome us with a complimentary bottle of chilled wine and an awesome meat and cheese platter on the second day of our stay. What a great surprise to find in the room after an afternoon at the beach! Too bad we didn't get to thank her in person. Wife says we will be able to do that when we return next summer. BTW, wife and I brought our bikes to Key West and we kept them in our room. So, yes the rooms are plenty big. The staff even opened the door for us when we were coming or going with our bikes. Clean towels were always available by the pool. Water sports available on-site. We enjoyed snorkel cruise, dolphin cruise and jet ski tour,,,what a blast!! (Wife threatened to divorce me after jet ski tour as I had to speed past the teenager jet skiers...Ha!) We ate dinner pool-side our last night and the service was stellar. Overall, this is a great place and we had an awesome time!! Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and expensive”
Reviews.Author: v19
Reviews.Content: Stayed @ the CM in June; pleasure trip. Check in was fine; valets were willing to help. We chose 'self-park' option across the street ($12/day vs. $20/day valet). Room was small but very nice; bathroom wonderful; bed great. Didn't ask for a view so didn't have one. No coffee maker, either, so had to trek to lobby each morning. Staff @ pools were attentive with towels, food and drink delivery. Food from pool-side bar was good. Down-side: upon check out, we were charged a $20/day 'resort fee'. Had not been told about the fee, was not mentioned in any literature. Were told that it was 'for all the extras'. To be sure, internet was NOT free, parking was NOT free, room service was pricey. Had I known that, would not have tipped so generously @ the pool. There was no literature in the room, so we didn't know about a fitness center. Rented bikes from hotel; great guys in the rental shop. Enjoyed biking all over the island. Overall, CM is a nice place, but could use some effort in the area of public relations.

Reviews.Title: “Like mediocre service and high prices? Then this is the place for you.”
Reviews.Author: SeasonedTraveler58
Reviews.Content: I have been a Hilton Diamond member for many years and have to say this is one of the worst Hilton family hotels I have ever stayed at. I don't have a problem with high prices at a first class resort but I do have a problem with paying high prices at a second, nay in this case, third class hotel. Casa Marina should be ashamed to call themselves part of the Waldorf Astoria Collection as that name implies a certain high standard of service and quality which this hotel definitely lacks. Front desk gives you the definite impression they are doing you a favor just to check you in. Conceirge was continually missing in action and did not return messages. Inside bar closes early. Rooms looks tired and bath amenities were extremely basic - though to give the devil his due the bed was comfortable. Room had a funky spell from cleaning products. If there is a way to make money on any and every misc and sundry charge you can imagine, the hotel has not missed it. Check out is at 11:00 am and if you want even an extra hour - forget it, they won't accomodate; not even for their best customers. Do yourself a favor and skip at these prices.

Reviews.Title: “Failure to deliver a good experience, Stay Away.”
Reviews.Author: Gotter
Reviews.Content: I reserved an Ocean View Suite at a premium price, but when I arrived it took 45 minutes to check in because no one could tell if such a room was available, A couple of people scurried about, but when we got to our room it overlooked the pool not the ocean. I reserved a King bed, but got 2 doubles. We had to unfold and furnish the hide a bed because there was no service to do it. No spa in hotel (spa services in Room 1001), Few to no amenities in the room that should be taken for granted in a "Waldorf" property--such as No Coffee Maker, no lotion, no blanket. $20 for elementary yoga class. Staff was not very accommodating--coffee shop sold coffee & tea in morning but no Diet Coke even though bottles were in a refrigerator in the same room and used same cash register. This hotel has "rules" for the staff to follow, but helping guests was not one of the rules. Despite the failure to deliver what I paid for, there was zero recompense on the bill--answer was "Sorry. We classify that room as Ocean View." Now for the good points about this hotel. Seaweed wrap for wife was excellent once she found Room 1001 for spa services. Food and staff at pool dining area were both good. CONCLUSION: This hotel needs new management that is guest oriented. Until they get it, STAY AWAY. I am a Hilton Honors Gold member and can vouch for the fact that most Hilton Hotels deliver a much better experience than this high end property--in fact, the next time

Reviews.Title: “DID not Enjoy this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Peeps34
Reviews.Content: Hotel was dirty and the beach area was all rocks. I did not feel comfortable at this hotel. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Plush Resort For the Not So RIch and Famous”
Reviews.Author: sea1503
Reviews.Content: Recently I had the pleasure to stay at this resort.If I could have designed a tropical hotel it would have looked like the Casa Marina.The photos on their website do not do it justice.It is truly the most beautiful place I have ever stayed. During my entire visit every single employee behaved in a most professional manner. I could not have been treated better. The resort is very clean,well maintained and staffed by the happiest group of people I have ever encountered at a resort. I encourage all to visit this ocean front paradise!

Reviews.Title: “A-m-a-z-i-n-g”
Reviews.Author: oldwythe
Reviews.Content: this hotel was amazing all that i could ask for and more, we stayed for three days and left for another resort in Duck Key and that was a huge mistake! We were supposed t ostay in Duck Key for four days but checked out the very next day and went back to the Casa Marina for the remainder of our stay luckily they still had rooms available on sucg short notice. The rooms were very clean and modern, the beach was beautiful, the hotel itself was gorgeous. I have to give props to Patrick who checked us out and then checked us back in, he was sooooo nice and friendly and always smiling. Also MJ the concierge was very helpful with discount coupons. I would recommend this hotel to couples, families or single people wanting an amazing night sleep in their what I call "cocoon" rooms. The beds themselves make you never want to leave your bed and that says alot considering you are in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “poor service”
Reviews.Author: ktos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in July. This hotel had the worst customer service Iâ€™ve ever seen in a hotel of a such class. The floor was nasty in our room when we came and I asked several times both at the reception and the room service to vacuum this. It was done on our third day. It was very difficult to get in touch with anybody from the service crew anyway. We didnâ€™t care for a view so we got a parking lot view which wasnâ€™t bad at all. The hotel is very beautiful and so is the location and surrounding. Just teh service....

Reviews.Title: “excellent resort with beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: Grahamarm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Marina in an ocean view suite with our two young children and enjoyed every aspect of our stay. The resort was very clean and modern with a great outlook at the ocean. The pool area was very spacious with plenty of loungers and the hammocks under the palm trees on the beach were a nice touch. Breakfast on the terrace was most enjoyable but quite pricey for what you get so we did this on one of the mornings and ate out the rest of the time. The bar food by the pool was fine and included most of the options you would expect. Our room was quite large with ample space for the four of us and had a small balcony overlooking the pool and mainly the beach with only a small view of the ocean between the palm trees. The only slight negative was that the walk to the main part of Duval Street was quite long and when coming back to the hotel at night the last few streets are quite dark. Apart from that the hotel was ideal for what we were looking for and we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best resort in Key West w/something for everyone...”
Reviews.Author: indazone17
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina couldn't have made our first trip to Key West any more perfect. The staff was friendly and helpful. Our room was sizable with a very comfortable bed and a gorgeous balcony view of the private beach. Chairs, umbrellas, hammocks and unlimited towels were easily accessible for use. We loved the hotel's watersports facility. For kids, there were several daily activities such as arts and crafts, as well as a game rep on the beach who had everything from volleyball to bag toss. The hotel is far enough away from the Duval Street party scene to avoid the mass drunkards but close enough that we walked there every night. Parking secure and right across the street. We are already planning our return trip and will not hesitate to book with Casa Marina again. Incredible.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Resort - a key west treasure!”
Reviews.Author: Last-Plane-Out
Reviews.Content: If you've never visited Key West, you're in for a real treat. And if you're planning your stay at the Casa Marina, your trip just got even better. The Casa Marina is a classic, old Florida resort that has been renovated, rejuvenated, buffed and polished...it's simply gorgeous. My wife & I are used to flying solo and have stayed at the Casa many times in the past. However, this trip was different as we brought along our 11 & 13 year old nieces and can vouch that the place is just accomodating to families as it is to couples. We were dazzled by our contemporary, two level suite directly facing the ocean. My wife and I claimed the master bedroom while the kids took over the second floor loft (and stayed up half the night giggling). There were several touch points of note at the Casa Marina including Bob, the pool attendant, who bent over backwards each day to see that we had lounge chairs, towels and cold treats. The food and wait staff at the Casa was also outstanding and Daniella was the shining star. On our last night, she arranged an incredible sunset dinner on the beach and it turned out to be one of the highlights of our trip . The only area that the Casa Marina fell short was at breakfast; the ale' carte service was very slow so you may want to stick with the buffet or go somewhere else if you're in a hurry. Overall, we had a terrific experience at the Casa Marina and would recommend the place to all...singles, couples and families.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina was worth the trip”
Reviews.Author: kuleaning_house
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in July 2009. The full size bed was the only down side. We opted not to pay for premium view room (we planned not to spend too much time in there) and we overlooked the parking lot which wasn't a big deal. We pretty much just slept there. The breakfast buffet was fantastic eating pool side. The bay swim area was very nice with fish worth snorkeling for - we saw a yellow sting ray. The platform is very high and hard to get on but once your on its a fun jump off. Service was great - water was warm. We'd stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Do not count on "Waldorf" style of customer service.”
Reviews.Author: tlrn
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is very beautiful with breath taking views from the ocean view rooms, the customer service is totally horrible. They are completely unaccomodating and would rather have you stay in the basement then let you stay in a nice room with a nice view that you PAID for. We booked our stay 6-8weeks in advance and checked in 2 hours prior to arrival to ensure that our rooms were together and they were ocean view. To our dissatisfaction, they were NOT and there was "Simply NOTHING they could do". After contacting the corporate office, there was still no accomodation made. P.S. It was my birthday weekend. NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeH3
Reviews.Content: I almost never write reviews but in the case of the Casa Marina, Key West I feel obliged. I have stayed at this property several times over the last few years with my wife and recently with 2 of my boys. I have always found the resort and the overall experience to be exceptional. The hotel has been beautifully renovated - it is sophisticated and modern but still maintains some of its unique Key West style. In addition, the two pools, the large gym and the outdoor dining and bar on the ocean are all great and staffed with friendly and helpful people. I have only stayed at the Casa Marina for holidays but in looking around the resort it is clear that the banquet rooms and meeting facilities are really first class. Overall this is a beautiful resort and if you are thinking of visiting Key West I cannot think of a better place to stay. G. Hurley Toronto, Canada

Reviews.Title: “the luck of the draw”
Reviews.Author: jondol
