Reviews.Content: Having never been to Key West, we were at the mercy of the various comments about resorts in the trip advisor. We decided on the Casa Marina. From the moment we checked in, and was greeted by Jenny at the front desk, we knew we made a great choice. Everyone at the resort did everything to make our stay wonderful, and wonderful it was. We had a grand vista ocean front room with an enormous balcony overlooking the pool and ocean. Room 276. We opted to include breakfast every day as part of our package. The pool area was big and the pool attendants were most accomodating. First they came around with samples of the drink of the day, then popsicles, then iced towels ( very refreshing ) then fresh fruit. This was every day. The breakfasts were great and so was the lunches by the pool. I can appreciate the 40 million dollar renovation that took place. Our flight left on Sunday at 5 p.m. and they let us have a 1 p.m. late check out. We relish our vacation time and have stayed at a lot of great properties and I would rate this property at the top of the list. Would I go back to the Casa, yes. Will we be back to the Casa, YOU BET!!! Thank you for a great 6 days. John and Dolores Jacobs Cincinnati

Reviews.Title: “Terrible experience - a low class motel pretending to be a 4-star”
Reviews.Author: nk60_9
Reviews.Content: We tried this place after staying at the Ritz in Miami. When we got there they said our reservation was canceled though I had provided a credit-card guarantee. The manager actually accused us of canceling - great; just blame the customer for your incompetence. To make up for their ineptitude they have us a single room which overlooked a street with houses in bad repair. We had originally booked ocean view suites so this was quite a let down. There were no amenities in the room and housekeeping took their own time cleaning the rooms. We spent the day outside the resort to avoid the bad experience and only came back to sleep. Thankfully, the torture lasted only 2 days. DO NOT stay here under any circumstance.

Reviews.Title: “Despite Casa Marina Management's Best Efforts We Had A Great Time”
Reviews.Author: Florida072009
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ©e and I recently stayed at Casa Marina over the July 4th weekend. The hotel is extremely beautiful and the food was incredible. Our room was a one bedroom suite over looking the pool which was incredibly spacious. We had dinner on the pier at sunset which was amazing. Both the beach and the pools were very enjoyable. However, the customer service at Casa Marina is far below what should be expected at a luxury hotel. Everyday room service would not clean our room until late afternoon (2pm or later). When I called to ask housekeeping when they would be able to clean my room they responded by saying they "do not provide guarantees when rooms would be cleaned" and could not provide any timeframe. We were staying in the all suites building and paying top dollar for our room. I can only imagine the lack of customer service received in the non-suites building. Additionally, we had an issue with an amenity arranged by the concierge. When we spoke with hotel management about the issue they were rude, incompetent, and unforgiving. After speaking with several managers over the incident, the hotel rooms manager finally agreed to provide us with a resort credit comparable to the amenity. When we went to check out the resort credit had not been applied to our bill and the front desk manager said no notes were made on our account about any credits. Eventually, we were able to get the credit, but it was only after much aggravation. The hotel management made us beg and fight to receive something promised to us as a result of their error. By far this was the least enjoyable experience I have ever had with hotel management. Overall the picturesque views and food made this a great trip. However, I would not stay at this resort again or recommend it to anyone else. Due to the quality of customer service, this hotel does not belong to be part of the Waldorf-Astoria Collection. If you are travelling to Key West do yourself a favour and stay away from Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Relax, Relax, Relax”
Reviews.Author: wannaplaygolf
Reviews.Content: Nice place. We stayed at the Casa Marina for 4 days (after staying at the DoubleTree for 3 because of availability) and are so happy we did. This is a 4 diamond resort and lives up to it. Plenty of shade and sun on the beach and by the pool. The beach guys are great at getting you set up with chairs/hammocks/table/umbrella etc... Above ratings take into consideration that I expected a 4 diamond place. We had a great room (small but comfortable) - fabulous view and very very large balcony. While there were kids around and it appeared they were pretty happy and they were never a bother. There is a pier and water sports (as well as scooters, bicycles, jet ski's, sail boats etc...) hut at the far end of the hotel to book your trips/activities - so very conveninet to take off for snorkeling, dolphin watching, parasailing, sunset cruises (we did a bunch!!) from the corner of the hotel property. Ok - from a couple of foodies - Food was good (not great but also not terribly expensive considering it's so convenient). Dinner on the beach is a must because it is so peaceful. There are plenty of great restaurants nearby for very nice dinners (great chefs) and tons of must visit casual places for fun in Key West..

Reviews.Title: “Great location - Service shockinly bad - do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: themorgans54
Reviews.Content: We are travelling round the US as this is our honey moon and we have so far had some amazing experiences and great hotels. this one was so bad that we felt forced to write a review. The location is great, quiet with a private beach (though you cannot swim in the sea) the rooms are clean and modern. The staff let it down. on arrival we had 4 cases and no offer of assistance to take to the room. No explaination of how/where to park the car. We got to our room and it smelt very strongly of URINE! we complained and got moved to room 339 with a view of buildings and roof tops. To add insult further we were charged a resort fee for coffee/tea facilites which werent in the room! the staff didnt seem to care they were often stood about moaning about staff shortages. drink prices were too high $10 for a soda! this is a 4* hotel on the outside but the service make it more like a 2* - we have had better services in motels! we will not be staying here again and tempted to check out early and head to Miami!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort.”
Reviews.Author: lb33139
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to the resort as a treat to ourselves for our honey moon. From the day that we arrived everything looked woderful, the place was very clean and very comfortable. Some of the staff was a bit cold but for the most part everyone else was very nice and friendly. The room was very big and comfortable, the pools were very clean and everytime we went to the pool/ beach the staff was very attentive. I think that we will be back every year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, kid friendly with activities daily”
Reviews.Author: puff_momma
Reviews.Content: We thought the hotel was very nice, very accommodating staff, great location. What sold me before I went was that it had kid-friendly reviews and I COMPLETELY agree now that I've been there. I have a 10-year-old that found it very fun. The only downfall that I saw about the place was the maids were not doing such a great job in cleaning the rooms. I found it quite dirty. The beds were clean and comfortable, but the floors needed sweeping.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: rosy68
Reviews.Content: This is our first time at Casa Marina after many visits to Key West. It was also the first time visiting with our children (11 and 16). The service was great. From the bell service to housekeeping. Room was ready early and Patrick was glad to check us in. Room was very clean and spacious (Ocean Vista Suite). Bob by the pool was great. Jane in the pool bar can fix the best Pat6ron Margaritas (Janeritas), The children loved their vacation and my husband and I enjoyed every minute of it. Keep up the good work and you will have us coming back to you every time we visit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and First Class”
Reviews.Author: Indyplayer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went on a trip for just one night - I had a free night and used my Hilton points. The hotel is outstanding in just about every way. The service was very good. The team was very helpful - easy checkin and room was ready a little early. The pool area was great and the pool and beach staff were eager to help. The hotel pool bar was nice too - right by the ocean and the pools. The beach was ok - not your typical FLA beach with easy access to the ocean - more of a manmade deal. All the locals on Key West will tell you this is the best Hotel on the Island. There is a Reach Resort next door (also Waldorf Astoria) but talked to someone staying there and they said Casa was better. I guess you have access to both properties, but we didn't go over there. The rooms are nice - typical Hilton quality - and decent size. Highly Recommend.

Reviews.Title: “i would not stay here again”
Reviews.Author: southernprincess
Reviews.Content: i was not pleased with the level of service at the casa marina. we stayed there a few years ago when it was a marriot property and had much better service than under the waldorf astoria brand. upon arrival there were no bellman or valets to great us. only after we schlepped our bags to the front desk did someone ask if they could help us. it would be nice if they would open the front door for you when you come and go but that was even too much to ask for. the front desk manager did not know how to get us change. she said she was only there a month and did not have a "bank" to make change and would get someone else (a 15 minute experience). the suite we booked (ocean front with a balcony for about 450 a night) had the smallest bathroom i have ever seen. you could not sit on the toilet normally and had to sit facing sideways!. very strange. our friends room had a normal bath. i had to call housekeeping for shampoo, lotion and bathrobes as there were none in the room when we checked in. the suites did not have a mini bar or a coffee machine. we ordered room service coffee for 2 in the morning for 20.00. also, room service does not open until 7 am. all in all the hotel needs work if they want to be a top flight hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel/Good Location”
Reviews.Author: scotlandbride
Reviews.Content: This our third trip to Key West, but our first at the Casa Marina. The grounds were nicely groomed and well-maintained. Our room was somewhat modern and minimalist, but most importantly, our air conditioner worked great, which is very important in June. Also, the view of the ocean from our room was beautiful. This hotel reminds me of other luxury resorts, and really doesn't feel like Key West. But, Duval is a short walk away, and if you are interested in the more touristy areas, they're easily accessible. It is my preference to be on the "quiet" side of the island. Louie's Backyard is a short walk away with its perfect view of the ocean and sunset. Service is really important to us. And, Casa Marina's service was impeccable. When we returned home, I had a question about the bill, and it was answered promptly and courteously.

Reviews.Title: “Requests from the kids to go back...”
Reviews.Author: Fourplease
Reviews.Content: We got a suite at the Reach (sister hotel) and found the room a bit cramped and not what we were expecting location-wise from the beach. The Reach staff contacted Maria at Casa Marina and she assisted us in obtaining two adjoining walk-out rooms. The rooms were spacious and clean and equipped with refrigerators. Maria had a coffee pot delivered to the room immediately upon our request and we were so appreciative for that. Both hotels have wonderful staff, but Joseph - who works with guests on the beach - was beyond fabulous. What a worker! Also, German (a waiter) could not be more professional, courteous, and caring as a server. There were days it felt like he waited on us for every meal. The only employee we ever found to be lacking in social skills was the coffee shop girl. As a guest of either hotel, you have access to the other's grounds. We made our way to the Reach for several meals, some activities, and swimming. The Reach has a much nicer, fine white, sandy beach with clear, blue Carribean water. The downside of the CM water is it is a little murky and there is a lot of grass and much of the waterline is rocky. I sat day after day and giggled watching guests initially shriek and yelp their ways out into the waters. But, this was always followed by elation as they swam back from jumping off the dock and seeing the array of fish that like to hide in those grasses. Our kids have already asked to go back to Casa Marina. We will definitely stay there again if we are back in Key West. The jet ski tour was really fun and we had a good time on the dolphin encounter/snorkel trip.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort”
Reviews.Author: FrenchFred
Reviews.Content: The casa Marina is an excellent hotel. Rooms are spacy and spotless clean. The bathrooms so nice.The park and the swimming pools lovely (you meet there colorful birds and lizards). They arrange water activities for you but though a bit more expensive as elsewhere in Keywest, they are not so crowded. We did the Dolphin encounters and this was a great moment. A flaw : the beach is not nice at all and tiny, the water full of seegrass but I think they are not allowed to change anything for environmental reasons. One other reproach: they gave us -I assume as we only stayed for 3 nights- a room near the air-conditionning central system, which means it was a bit noisy and humming and we could feel the floor vibrating but nothing really terrible. You have valet parking here they charge 20 $ a day which is very practical as is it quite difficult to park in Keywest. A high quality resort in one word.

Reviews.Title: “an awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: cokatoIllinois
Reviews.Content: It was a beautiful trip and the Casa Marina was great. The service was exceptional. I would highly recommend going to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort best beach in key west”
Reviews.Author: harrellrw
Reviews.Content: Was at the Casa 6/15-6/16.Had our Family 8 of us. Great Hotel, Great rooms, staff was great, best beach in Key West.Good food at the pool but high priced go out to eat. Nice walk to all the action down town. Best Breakfast was Blue Heaven,Best Lunch was Hogs Breath Salon,best dinner was Salbert Fried Chicken.Best boat trip Dream Catcher Charters.Two things I did not like. Resort fee $20.00 per day for nothing,parking $30.00 per day.Add these to the room price and you will have happier customers. Other that that it was great.

Reviews.Title: “An overpriced paradise”
Reviews.Author: sgirlaz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Key West for our honeymoon where we had our reservations with Casa for about 8 months. We paid in advance for the bed and breakfast package ($25 a night) and anticipated this trip for some time. Upon arriving, we were set a back due to Casa not providing a shuttle to and from the airport as instructed the night before. We had no other choice but to catch a cab where they charge PER PERSON along with distance (1 mile from airport to Casa cost $16). The hotel itself (lobby, beach, pools) are exquisite. The rooms are nothing special, small, solid white (does resemble a hospital room), and very tiny bathrooms with terrible plumbing (shower did not drain until you had exited). The staff is friendly but very outspoken about tips. When ordering room service, the bill stated: Cost of food 20% room service fee $4.00 delivery fee 7.5% tax and a line for a tip That adds up. The hotel is very pricey and gives you NOTHING. Movies to rent are 13.99-19.99, for example. Internet, $12.00 for 24 hours. No coffee pot in room, no robes, no plush towels, no light for your balcony and these are just to name a few. When leaving the hotel after a week, we checked out and SAW THEIR SHUTTLE finally; however, once exiting at the airport, our fee was $16 after 1 mile. NOTHING is provided for free. Walking downtown is no problem - it's a mile or two. If money isn't an issue - stay at Casa because it is extremely beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at the Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: bev4
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with our two adult daughters stayed a couple of nights at the Casa Marina. We arrived in Key West at noon and took a short cab ride to the Resort. Our room was ready at check-in and from then on the stay was absolutely perfect. I honestly cannot think of anything they do not do well. The room was on the small side but very clean and neat . The food was great , from the breakfast buffet to the lunch and dinner selections. The amenities are what made my family and myself feel like we were in paradise. The drink of the day, popsicles on the beach, staff getting your chair and umbrella set up on the beach, ice water delivered to you while relaxing in your chair--and other perks that make you never want to leave the resort. We saw other hotels/resorts while walking aroud Key West and I am comfortable in stating that the Casa is the best resort in Key West without question. It is truly paradise. We cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: Robbywillie
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Casa Marina on 30th May for a weeks stay (After our trip to Mexico was cancelled). The first room we were offered was on the ground floor looking out over the car park, the second room offered was in a separate building which was a bit like a motel we were finally offered a room on the third floor of the hotel which was fine. Don the receptiionist did not crack a smile once throughout our dealings with him. No customer service skills whatsoever. Food was ok nothing special, staff were attentive as long as you were tipping them. Key West itself is a great place but the money we paid for this hotel was just not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Problems from start to finish at the Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: KeeKeex2
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived at this "resort" in early June for an annual company outing at his place of business. The company decided to treat all 27 managers, avps, and vps of the Florida region and their wives/girlfriends to the keys, and for some reason, chose these accommodations. To make the drive and stay more enjoyable, my boyfriend and I checked in a night earlier than the rest of the group. Check-in went smoothly until we arrived at our room. Right away I was very disappointed by the room size. The room was very tiny, had no coffee maker, a very small refrigerator, and did not have a dresser to put folded clothes in to. In any case, I did my once over check to find an absolutely disgusting bathroom. There were used towels on the sink and the trash contained tissues and used feminine products from the previous guest. My boyfriend went to the front desk immediately to get a room change. After seeing that the room change would provide us with an even smaller room, we requested that the staff come clean the room we had originally checked into. The two female staff members that I encountered were beyond rude. One asked "What's wrong with the bathroom?" I told her it was dirty, showed her the towels, and explained the trash can issue. She then responds, "Well, what do you want me to do?" I thought I had made that blatantly obvious that her purpose for that room was to clean it, but I guess not. The following day, the rest of the couples with the company checked in. I spoke to other couples about our problems with the room and found that 7 other couples out of the 27 that had arrived found their rooms dirty and asked for a room change. One couple opened up their room to find two unmade beds and a baby's pack-n-play. Another couple found their room to have unmade beds as well. One couple encountered so many bugs in their room that they almost left the function all together. Some couples had dirty towels, dirty bathtubs with hair stuck to the side, and even used hotel shampoos in their rooms. Every time someone tried to change their room, they heard the same thing I had heard..."We are sorry... This never happens." I get the feeling that is not the truth. Upon check-out the following day, my boyfriend and I had more issues with the "resort." The staff at the front desk was beyond incompetent. They tried charging the company for the extra night that we had stayed which we had to pay for. My boyfriend explained that the extra night was to be charged to his credit card and not the company account. The woman behind the counter said there was nothing she could do. She went to get another woman to help solve the situation and came back to say "This is your lucky day. We should be able to take care of this." This is your lucky day?!?! These people must be kidding me!!! It was our lucky day that they could correct a mistake that they made? Ridiculous. For the inconvenience, the hotel did give us a discounted rate for the extra night. No number of discounts could make up for the horrible experience we had. Overall, this "resort" was dirty and had rude and incompetent staff running it. We have made sure that the company we were with is aware of the issues we have faced with this place. We would NEVER stay here again and would advise anyone who enjoys a clean, comfortable room to NOT stay here

Reviews.Title: “Horriblle Experience Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: griffexcec
Reviews.Content: I travel regularly as i am the president of a large Manhattan law firm. I arrived with a handful af my assoc. at about 1:30 pm. The ocean view room i had booked was nowhere to be found as it was occupied... in turn i was introduced to a (lets say avereage room )... having no choice with an impending meeting at 4:00 I took the room. The so called manager on duty "Maria" was absolutly of no friendly assistance. It seemed she had absolutly zero experience with the public let alone at one of islands "finest resorts" To boot my leftover room WAS NOT AVAILABLE until 6:00! needless to say the meeting was canceled. In the meantime I was suprisingly greeted by an exceptionaly profesional front desk person, "Jenny" and with the assistance of her collegue "Alex" they quickly arranged an upgrade with complimentary drink cupons with no difficulty what so ever. KUDOS to "Jenny" and "Alex"! however I still remail absolutly baffled as to how this establishment earned a four star rating. I was reluctant to write this review but after being my fourth "runaround" at the casa marina i dont think this was just bad luck.I believe this organization is in desperate need of some real management. Needless to say I nor any of my associates (or anyone else i do buisness with) will be returning to this hotel. May I also add you will be charged for bringing a vehicle reguardless of which option the bellman offers (self park or valet). and there are not even coffee makers in the rooms and as for rollaway beds forget it.

Reviews.Title: “About the best quick getaway ever...”
Reviews.Author: SALinNoVa
Reviews.Content: Only have a couple days? Fly to Key West, check into Casa Marina, do your Duvall Crawl, then recover the next day at one of the lovliest properties I have ever been to. Can't say enough about Casa Marina -- the property is stunning, the rooms are great, the staff is plentiful but not intrusive, all the good stuff. Really, really terrific -- we look forward to a few quick getaways every year, and we'll always put Casa Marina at the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, comfortable, posh, and picturesque”
Reviews.Author: Machaveli1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel the Friday of Memorial weekend using HHonors points. The lobby is extremely nice and reminded me of the Ritz Carlton at Reynolds Plantation with rich dark woods and soft white textiles. The staff was nice and check in was a breeze. The hotel is a lot smaller than the other Hilton resorts we have stayed at and had a quaint, upscale feel. When we got to our room, it smelled like smoke. I went to the front desk and they said all the rooms were supposed to be non-smoking. They moved us to a different room and it smelled fine- really not a big deal. The rooms themselves are large and comfortable. We liked the hardwood floors and furnishings. The flat screen TV was nice as were the beds and linens. The bathrooms were really neat with ultra modern fixtures and a frosted window in the shower that opened to the outside normal window. If you want a tub, you're out of luck. Also, there were some stray ants crawling around, but it wasn't a major infestation. The hotel is on the water, but as with most of Key West the beach at the hotel isn't like a Florida beach. It is a rock coast with a pier that sticks into the water for swimming. The pools look small for a resort hotel, but it is all very nice. There are multiple hammocks along the water front that are great! We loved laying in one and could have almost slept outside that night. The stars were beautiful. The location of the hotel is average. It's on the southern edge of Key West. We walked all the way up and down Duval Street and it's a bit of a hike. We didn't mind, but depending on the breeze and temperature, you might want to consider a cab. The hotel charges a "resort fee", which is a load of crap. I think it's a way to make hotel prices look more competitive when price shopping then they stick you with additional fees. Along the same lines, there is no reason to pay $20/ night for parking. The streets around the hotel have plenty of free parking (at least for the Friday night we were there). Overall, I would say this is an excellent hotel, but only an average value. The rate for our stay would have been almost $400/ night if I did not use points, and this is not a $400/night hotel. It's more like a $250/night. If you get a rate for $250, I think you'll be very happy, any more than that and the appeal diminishes.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful but disapointing”
Reviews.Author: drjeff
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here for 4 days for a meeting. It is beautiful hotel in the claasic senser right on the ocean. The setting and view is exquisite. The hotel is spotless and the rooms and bathrooms are well appointed.The food varies widely. The problem with this place is the service or lack of it. You think that you are in a 4 star hotle until you need something and then you realize that the hotel is not 4 star because the service is so poor. I had several problems and was not even allowed to speak with the manager. I was comped so many times fro bad service that I could not even use all the freebies. Even at the reduced conference rate the hotel was no bargain. I could not understand what I got for the "resort fee" which is rip off- free newspaper and phone? The only service was at the beach where the staff did give good service most ot the time. The restaurant is a work in progress. Only the maitre d' knows what is going on- talk with her. It definetly is the pretties tplace to stay in Key West but try for an internet rate. Also drive here - DO NOT FLY From Miami- the air service is adisaster.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property for a relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: Dennis_Michele
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina Resort in Key West was everything that the wife and I were looking for in a relaxing/romatic getaway sans the kids. What sealed it was the size of their "beach" and the beauty of the property. I considered the Pier House, The Hyatt and few other top properties but it was the beachfront atmosphere that sealed it for the Casa Marina (being a little cheaper than the Pier House didn't hurt). Overall, the resort delivered on my expectations. First, the positives: - The grounds are beautiful. I have to say this is one of the few hotels whose pictures on their website are incredibly accurate. No pics from funny angles to hide potential eyesores or the like. I'm not going to bother with posting my pics since the other reviewers have done an exceptional job covering the resort. - The Beach: while not beaing a classic Florida/Caribbean beach, is excellent by Key West standards and runs the length of the hotel. The beach attendants are top notch and certainly do their best to make everyone comfortable & happy. BTW, ask these guys to send a waitress over rather than wait for one to come around. Tip these guys well! - The Pool: The two pools are nicely furbished with the added advantage of having one of the better poolside dining establishments I have experienced. Yes, getting a waitress poolside can be iffy at times but the dining area is so close it's not a big bother to walk up and ask for someone to come over. - The Beds: Pretty damn comfortable! - The Location - Being on the south side of the island made for a much quieter and peaceful experience (which admittedly was what we were after) and Duval was only a short walk/bike ride/taxi ride away. - Spa Services: We only opted for massages during our stay but the staff they had was excellent. Notice though that I say "services" as the resort does not have a Spa per se. the "Spa" is a renovated 1 bedroom suite with a limited number of options available. It is not a full service operation like that at the Pier House. If you are looking for a spa-type vacation you might be disappointed here. - Activity Center: Located right on the property they had just about every watersport available (for an extra fee) and bike and scooter rentals. Very convenient. I can't say there was anything about the Casa Marina that was a disappointment. More like minor quibbles that prevent me from giving it a five star review. They are: - The Ocean Vista rooms have an armoire rather than a closet. It's in the entranceway and it's proximity to the bathroom door makes opening both at the same time difficult. It also blocks the doorway when open. A questionable layout to say the least. - The service: I had both very attentive service and some slow service. A bit inconsistent but nothing I would guage as terrible. - Ocean Vista Rooms numbered 24 through 28 on any of the four floors have a balcony barely big enough for two regular chairs. Nowhere near as big as the other oceanview rooms. We were able to move but others may not be as lucky. Be aware that rooms on the 3rd and 4th floor stand a very good chnce of looking out at Palm trees! Shoot for a room on the first or second floor. - Concierge service: Nothing overly fancy. The concierge can give recommendations for dining and sightseeing options but they only seem to be at the desk from 9-5p. No hours are posted. All-in-all I would recommed the Casa Marina with little hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “everything and everyone were top shelf”
Reviews.Author: jolynkitch
Reviews.Content: the rooms and the views were great, but the staff were the best. aboslutely a wonderfull experience

Reviews.Title: “just right”
Reviews.Author: swimvacation
Reviews.Content: Nice place. The lobby is classy and smells (great) of old wood. Rooms well appointed, great outdoor/beach spaces. Have the beach attendant set you up on a lounge chair, order a mojito, and forget about your cubicle. Rent a bike to get to the busy part of town. Some minor details need attention: scuffed doors, missing conditioner (shampoo is great, though!), paranoid room charge system, fee for wifi. Don't let this stuff deter you from booking, though.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to escape and relax !!!!”
Reviews.Author: achoover
Reviews.Content: First time to vist-the entire staff were excellent and friendly- John and Lydia gave my wife and I a massage by the beach- they were fantastic! The staff at the pool were great and very friendly. Wanted to please your every need. You must take the sunset cruise that was offered at the resort- it was beautiful! We will definetly return next year. It is paradise! The resort is very clean and well managed! Alan and Debbie- Hoover, Alabama

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Spot Ever!”
Reviews.Author: dharmagypsy7
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Casa Marina and had the most amazing time ever! The place had the old world charm with modern amenities. This was our first time in Key West and just loved the history, architecture and vibe. We could stay there forever. The hotel is flawless in regards to location, history and the architecture. We pretty much stayed on grounds except to dine out. More on that later... The pool is very clean and has the perfect view of the Ocean. It's very family friendly. We have a one year old daughter and one of her highlights were the pool. There were also many families there with their children... But we saw couples, older and young, group of singles, weddings galore (saw 4 this weekend) and it all blended in together. Hammocks were probably my favorite part... I literally swung in one for at least an hour. The beach chairs are nice. could be more cushy but it comes with towels. The service at the pool and the beach was scarce. I think one server had both area, so it was a bit slow... so definitely have patience. The pool does offer resort-like activities like cocktail social, ice cream social, and offers services like popsicle and drink of the day. A definite perk in my eyes. Their attention to service is top notch. The staff was incredibly helpful and kind throughout our entire stay. The only drawback is the food. For a Waldorf-Astoria, I had hoped for a better restaurant than the one they had. Being a foodie and having eaten at many top restaurants in NYC; it was a bit disappointing. I hope that in the future, Casa Marina will build upon their food and beverage dept because I found that sorely lacking. We dined out most of the time except a snack at the beach and breakfast buffet the day we left. However, all the wait staff were wonderful and hospitable. Another drawback I saw was the internet usage charge and parking charge. Since they have a resort fee of $20; I would hope that it would be included. And they don't offer childcare service like it is stated on their website. Overall, this is an amazing place to stay. We are looking forward to coming back every year and even thinking about having our wedding at the Casa Marina. This is how much we loved our stay. I can't say enough good things about this place. I have worked and also stayed in some of the top hotels, and I have to say that Casa Marina is definitely on the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “PATRICK MADE OUR TRIP”
Reviews.Author: andynicky
Reviews.Content: Very simple: Beautiful hotel, we had asked for an upgrade since it was our one year anniversary and the hotel did not updgrade though it was the weekdays and really empty. So we check in and get to your room 420! No shower curtains, iron, refrigirator doesn't work and broken glass (got the wifee in the foot) on carpet. extremely small room and alot of dust and junk behind desk area. So I asked to change rooms or be upgraded and am told nothing until tomorrow but we will move you into a bigger roomier room. Okay so we order in and relax the first night. Next day room wasn't available at 11 am as they had promised but we were going out so they said they would call us and move our bags and etc. We were kind of down after coming from the awesome MONDRIAN HOTEL in MIAMI and then this room of ours that was not up to par. So we get a call from our savior PATRICK at the front desk at 1pm asking us what was wrong and what he could do to make the stay better, After explaining everything to him he said I have put you in something you will really like ROOM 398. So upon our arrival back later we picked up our keys and FELL IN LOVE WITH THE ROOM AND HOTEL!! PATRICK MADE OUR ANNIVERSARY a MEMORABLE ONE!! THANKS AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “The lobby is a mecca for complaints...”
Reviews.Author: FireFlyOjea
Reviews.Content: I really do love the Casa, I've stayed there every year for the last 4 years, but I have to say, It is soooooo over priced for what you get. Let's see, this year it started with the check in. "Oh, we have your king sized bed." Says Alice, but when we arrive at out room, no king sized bed, we are near the ice machine and our view is a dumpster...good times. Anywho, they moved us the next morning, or shall I say, we packed our stuff up and moved ourselves to a much nicer room. I did not reap the benefits of that 22 dollar a day "resort fee" because we were out most days and on top of that the 12 dollar a day parking fee... thanks guys! Come on! Really! To park across the street! Take a hint from just about everyone around the pool... bring a cooler with your own drinks in it! Seems tacky, but I noticed everyone doing it. Otherwise, great property. Oh... about the title of my post, I noticed that every time I breezed through the lobby, someone had a complaint and was bawling out the manager. For a hotel with such a prestigious title, they really should try to actually please their guests instead of making excuses and apologies.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay at a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: entnaples
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at this hotel. We originally booked an "island view" suite. When we checked in, I asked if there were any upgrades available. The young lady at the front desk said she didn't have anything available right then, but she could move us to an "ocean view" suite the following day. The room was very nice, clean and comfortable. All the staff were very friendly and helpful, particularly the concierges Scarlet and MJ who helped us find several great restauants. We didn't eat any meals at the hotel. The pool area is beautiful, although we were so busy we didn't take advantage of it. The location is such that you need to take a car to go anywhere, but this really wasn't a problem. Just be sure to have plenty of quarters for the meters. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience at the Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: NoWorriesMaryland
Reviews.Content: We were there for our ten year anniversary May 16 thru the 20th. Everyone was extreemly friendly and helpful all the way from the receptionist at the front desk to the pool assistant at the georgous pools. The hotel itself was really a work of art with a true Key West vibe about it. The grounds were very clean and well maintained and every morning you would see numerous workers cleaning and preeping the area for the days activities. My wife really enjoyed the multiple hammocks that the hotel had on it grounds...very relaxing laying down by the ocean and getting the nice breeze off the water. The staff was very helpful in providing us with good "local' resturaunts to dine in and they all turned out to be right on point. Also the food at the Casa Marina was excellent at well. Our overall experience was fabulous and we can not wait to return to the hotel for some nice relaxation and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Guys make the difference!”
Reviews.Author: MJLocoDC
Reviews.Content: The Resort is beautiful, relaxing and a wonderful get away. The pampering and ultimate customer service at the Pool is what makes is icing on the cake! Specifically CHRIS AND JOSEPH!!! Those 2 guys are worlds above the rest and truly make the difference between a relaxing day by the beach and a wonderful, pampered spoiled day by the beach. Their level of timely attention, personable approach, anticipating your needs and more are simply unforgettable! They are the MODEL for excellent customer service and make you want to extend your vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing setting”
Reviews.Author: sweetT13
Reviews.Content: We loved every minute of our stay at the Casa Marina. The pools are fantastic, views incredible, rooms/lobby outstanding. We read mixed reviews before we left, but have to say the staff was very attentive and quick to bring towels/pillows whatever. We had an iguana fall out of a palm tree next to our chaise lounge and figured he was already into the rum punch... Starbucks in the hotel is very handy. Wish we could've stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Good. Not perfect, but good.”
Reviews.Author: CTTravelDoc
Reviews.Content: The good: great location, clean/comfortable rooms. The beach makes the experience. The not-so-good: definitely pricey for what you get, food is average, charge $12.00 per day for wi-fi access (it should be included for what you are paying), housekeeping could be more responsive.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic...”
Reviews.Author: Tgreg
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I recently stayed at this resort for a couple days. I decided to stay here due to the reviews I read on Trip advisor, so I had to add my own review. I have worked as a director of operations at a large resort for a number of years, so itâ€™s safe to say that I am a bit of a travel snob. Casa Marina scored above average with me. Upon arriving you can see that the grounds were well maintained and the bell staff are waiting to help with luggage and open the door for guest. I have read other reviews about the lack of service from the staff; however we were not there long enough to interact with the staff. When we checked in there was a bit of a problem, the room that we requested was night cleaned. I could tolerate this if we arrived exactly at check in time on a Friday or Saturday, but we arrived after six on a Mondayâ€¦ we had to wait about an hour and a half. Other than that, the stay was wonderful. The rooms were clean and the view was great. I agree with a couple other reviews on the parking fee, a little outrageous especially for those staying longer than a couple days. Over all, a great resort for the romanticâ€™s at heart.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonyassu523
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 4 day trip to Key West. We stayed at the Casa Marina Resort, and I must say that it was a very beautiful property. Check-in was a breeze when we arrived. I called ahead to let them know that we would be arriving before the 4 p.m. check in time, and they offered to have our room ready earlier. We were able to check in around 2:30, instead of the usual 4:00. We reserved the most inexpensive room, the Island Vista Room, which was more than fine for us since we were only in Key West for a short visit, and we didnt plan on spending our vacation in our hotel room! the room was very clean, the bed and sheets were very comfortable, and there was plenty of space for the two of us. We did not have a bathtub, only a shower, and we did not have a balcony, but that was okay with us, due to the short amount of time that we spent there. The hotel is within walking distance to Duval Street. It took us about 10-15 minutes to get there. I liked the quiet location of this resort. It is tucked away from the hustle and bustle of Duval St., yet just a short walk from all of the action. We did not spend a lot of time using the hotel amenities, so the $20 resort fee seemed a bit unnecessary, but for those travelers who used the pool and beach daily, I think it was more than reasonable. The pools were in good condition, there were always plenty of lounge chairs with umbrellas to go around. We had lunch at the poolside restaurant which was reasonably priced and very good. We went to the liquor store upon our arrival, and made our own drinks to take out to the pool. The drinks were overpriced at the poolside bar, so I'm glad that we made the stop and got our own. We are not picky travelers, and for the most part are easy to please. The only recommendation that I have for this resort is to seperate the pools to have one of them be adults only. We went on Mother's day weekend and so there were a lot of families with children around the resort. It tended to get loud around the pool area with large groups of children everywhere. Overall, I would recommend this resort. Feel free to contact me with any specific questions you may have. Some places I would recommend while in Key West are: Sara Beth's Restaurant for Breakfast Mangoes Restaurant for Dinner El Meson de Pepe for Dinner Mallory Square to watch the sunset Pepper's Hot Sauce bar as a fun stop while on duval st. Conch Republic Seafood Company Danger Charters- 1/2 day sailing, snorkeling, kayaking excursion

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Location, Modern Rooms, Wonderful Sheets, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: canabama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our anniversary at the beginning of May. He originially booked it (it was a surprise for me) and was going to pay for the rooms the "traditional" way - using cash. Then he mentioned it recently changed over to Hilton and I decided to use my points to book as a diamond member for 4 nights. The stay was 160,000 points, I believe. It was the same when we stayed at the Hilton Cavaleri in Rome, also. Unfortunately, my husband forgot to cancel his reservation in time and they were going to charge us a $285 cancellation fee. When we checked in, Patrick took care of the fee and credited it back to hubby's account. They upgraded us to a suite (without an ocean view, but we were rarely in the room so this didn't matter). The suite had a seperate dining, living and sleeping area. The bathroom was large and we loved the framless glass shower with the pressurized-rain-showerhead. The staff was VERY attentive - our room was turned down every night with chocolates on the pillows. Room Service was prompt and always correct with the order (even when we requested extras like more cream, sugar etc...). The pool/beach staff were great as well. The resort beverages can get pricey ($6 for a Corona) so we just went to a gas station and bought our own and made a cooler fo ourselves. We were never questioned about this and noticed several other guests did the same. It may sound ultra cheap, but to us it just made sense - we could spend more money at the restaurants and art galleries around town in lieu of drinking it all away :) The hotel is quite a hike from Duval Street - where the action really gets going at night. For me, this was not an issue - I wanted a relaxing holiday. For my husband, who was very ineterested in the night life - it was a little bit of a let down. We had a scooter rental for one night and parked easily by the sunset pier. The other days/nights we took cabs into town - it was $20 roundtrip including tip. That got pretty expensive after a while. Overall, I would definitely recommend the hotel. I would even visit again if there weren't so many other places I'd like to see!

Reviews.Title: “Insufferable service at gorgeous property”
Reviews.Author: Krivenburg
Reviews.Content: I stay at Hiltons 50-100 nights a year, mostly for business, but with 2-3 weeks of vacation, usually at beach resorts. I can say this was the poorest experience I have ever had at any hotel, EVER, in my entire life. Yes, the rooms are lovely, and the grounds and facilities are gorgeous, but be prepared for horrible service, such as forcing us to change rooms mid-stay, calling 4 times for coffee pods for in-room machine and finding out two hours later that the hotel was entirely out, having to ask three times (and leave three times) for housekeeping to not have it done until after 9 PM. These are just the tip of what were three horrible days there, spending hours each day trying to have the hotel's errors corrected. No special service or freebies to compensate, and I am a Hilton Diamond member. I'm still trying to get my bill fixed, as I was overcharged (deposit not counted and billed as a no-show, even though I checked in the day prior).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with spotless grounds”
Reviews.Author: eol103
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our trip and can't wait to go back. We found the hotel to be very clean and the grounds were well maintained. The staff was friendly, and the beach was nice. The only downside was that it was a bit too pricy for us. Miller Lights were $5 a can! But, I guess that can be expected for a place as nice as the Casa. We also liked that it was on the quiter side of Key West, however everything is in close walking distanace.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant resort but lacking in atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Hevsy
Reviews.Content: The resort is very elegant and beautiful, with a lot of style. The rooms are lovely, decent size and nicely decorated. The bathrooms are very modern and nice to use but for the price I would also have liked a bath. Avoid a room near the generator - the room was quite noisy and full of vibrations. The public areas were elegant and modern but lacked atmosphere even when busy. We ate in the restaurant on the first night. Whilst the food was nice and the staff were friendly but there was only one other couple in the huge room, so we felt a bit strange. Definite lack of life. The location is nice, on the beach with hammocks in the trees. The pools were both good. about 15 minute walk from the quiet end of Duvall Street but it fell quite safe walking there and back late at night. Parking was a choice of valet or self parking but both came at a price. Free street parking very close by which we had not been aware of.

Reviews.Title: “So relaxing we felt at home the second we arrived”
Reviews.Author: DTimson
Reviews.Content: All too often it is only the bad reports that people take the time to write about well I felt that it was important to acknowlege when a superb experience and service had been given. From the second we pulled up and the valet team exclamined as we tried to lift a bag out of the car "stop sir, the only time you have to lift you hand is for eating and drinking", we knew we were in for a very relaxing time. The resort itself was beautiful and we were blessed with excellent weather when we were there. Particular mention must go to Patrick on the front desk for his superbly helpful service, attention to detail and superb recommendation of "Louies Backyard" just round tghe corner for dinner - a must if you stay here, The suite was excellent and the balacony and view perfect, the bathroom was a little small with no bath but this really wasn't an issue for us. there was no mini bar in the room, although there was a fridge but we were happy to get our drinks from the bar or the nearby shop. The watersports facilities were also excellent with both very friendly staff and a good standard of equipment for rental. Thankyou for a great stay and we will be back soon, we actually tried desperately to extend our stay and again Patrick and the front desk team were very helpful but we couldn't make the flights to our next location work out, such a shame. We felt so relaxed here, definitely worth visiting especially after a hectic stay in Miami!

Reviews.Title: “amazing!”
Reviews.Author: boilers01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in their sister hotel the Santa Maria Suites and got to use their pool and ocean front. We had the same staff waiting on us everyday. We personally had Steve and Joe, and they made the stay great! They came around with popsicles by the pool, always asked if we needed anything else, and made us feel like we were their friends not just people staying at their hotel. They were incredible and I would stay there again without a doubt!!

Reviews.Title: “I won't stay anywhere else in Key West!”
Reviews.Author: AAA38
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by stating the negatives. As previous reviews mentioned, at times the service was a little questionable (the hotel was very busy when we stayed) and the daily, planned activities seemed somewhat hit-or-miss. I especially noticed this with the activities planned for my very young children. The timing was either off or the activity never occurred. Also, if you are expecting a huge room you probably won't find it here; however, the hotel was built in the 1920s so you would expect that. That being said, the resort is so nice you probably won't spend much time in your room except to sleep. Having had a chance to see the island for the week, this is the best "resort" on Key West. The pools, the beach, the activities, and the amenities make this the place to stay. Everything you need is at your disposal. It is especially good for families with small children. Every employee of the hotel was very accomodating and the fellow guests were extremely kind. My two boys (three years old and sixteen months) had a blast in the pool and enjoyed the daily popsicles. They had no problem meeting other children and played all day long. The hotel also caters to couples on romantic getaways. Having multiple pools and the beach allowed these guests to have some alone time away from the children if they wanted. On another note, some reviews mentioned the excessive fees. It is true that they charge for parking, internet usage, a resort fee, etc. However, I did feel that I got my money's worth with the daily paper, the popsicles, free cocktail and water at the pool, access to a nice gym, etc. No one likes to pay more than they have to, but I didn't feel ripped off. Another point, eating at the hotel can be expensive, but before you go elsewhere realize that it is expensive to eat anywhere on the island. Some previous reviewers mentioned the $20/per person breakfast buffet not being worth it. After my experience, I'm not sure this is true. The second morning of our visit we decided to go out for breakfast. It cost me more to eat at IHOP ($45.00 for basic breakfast for four) than to eat at the hotel and the food wasn't nearly as good. The hotel was very flexible and allowed my children to eat off my platter since they don't eat very much and just wanted to get into the pool anyways. What I also missed at IHOP was the variety and the view. Finally, that's what I liked the most about the hotel; they were very flexible. They pretty much let you do what you wanted. We had friends staying at a different place who came to see us for the day and were allowed to enjoy the amenities of the resort with no hassles. While the bar by the beach was high-priced, you could just as easily go to a liquor store and stock up for the week and drink at your leisure by the pool or beach. To me, the attitude of the hotel exemplifies what Key West is all about: laid back and chilled. I will never stay anywhere else in Key West and there is no way this resort should be ranked #12 on this website. I'm guessing people are looking for perfection while all I want is relaxation and a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: C_Adventure
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at 4pm - check-in time, we were told our room was not ready. It was not ready until 5pm. When we went to our room, it smelled really bad like sewer gas... we complained and were moved to a better room. One night around 11pm, the fire alarm went off in the hotel... False alarm but the sound was high pitched .. and it took awhile for them to shut it off. The hotel staff were great, the concierge was awesome, when asking questions. The 2 pools were nice and clean, and pool staff was good to set up chairs. Breakfast buffet was great. .. We wished the hotel had a restaurant, for the times we didn't want to go out. Internet connection from room was $12/day. We didn't use this, we used the free internet connection from the lobby... SLOW connection!

Reviews.Title: “perfect setting”
Reviews.Author: carafid
Reviews.Content: had a wonderful stay over easter, crowded but you still felt like you had space. the rooms were immaculate. I heard stories that the pool service was bad not when I was there. Free drinks, water cold towels ect..., I would definitely go again, close to Duval St. but in the quiet zone.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: cenedraNorway
Reviews.Content: When we entered the lobby, it almost took my breath away! The hotel is a Flagler-building from 1920, and renovated for 200 million dollars. This is done in a really tasteful way. The outside area is amazing. The rooms are quite large, and the bathrooms small, like in other old hotels. We were going to stay three ppl in a room, so none of us had to sleep alone. This was written in the reservation. When we got there, we had got a room with a king size bed only. The hotel was full booked, but one of the staff members went out to buy us an extra madrass and we got free breakfast next day - good service. Next day we got a new room with two beds. The breakfast was really pricy - they should have cheaper alternatives for those of us who aren't big eaters in the morning. The breakfast are very good though, and with a lot of different things to eat. Wireless internet isn't complimentary, this is really bad for a hotel like this. It's 12 dollars for 24 hours, a crazy price to pay if you just have to check your email. The internet in the lobby used 5 minutes to download a site, so it was just annoying to use. Taxi to Duval street is about 10 bucks with tip, but is just a short walk (if you're not wearing high heels;)). Key West is worth seeing, what a beautiful place! It's a Â§ 20 resort fee/day. Â§ 12 for parking/day. Â§ 20 for valet/day.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: tampafloridatraveler
Reviews.Content: Our first time staying at this resort and it was fabulous. Why be in Key West and not on the water. The service was spectacular. Our King room (in the new section) had a balcony that faced the ocean. The hotel is walking distance to everything, and the staff is efficient and friendly. I've been to Key West dozens of times, but now we've found the hotel we'll use from here on out.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel...”
Reviews.Author: DiabloWarrenpoint
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights and had a fantastic time. Hotel is absolutely beautiful and an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of Duval Street and the Downtown area. The children liked the pools and it was always possible to get chairs - not the 8am rush that you get with some hotels. The rooms are on the small side but frankly when the grounds and pool area are so nice it really didn't matter to us.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tancouplect
Reviews.Content: We just returned from casa marina we were there for 9 days and what a great time we had.My husband and I love the beach and thats where we are all day.The bar staff is great and if you like to be pampered on the beach ask for Steve he will get your chairs put your towel on the chair for you, tell you some stories he was the best.The night life is also fun don't forget to check out duval street sunsets are beautiful.We will be returing to casa marina next year for the beautififul resort and Steve !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful and First Rate”
Reviews.Author: ardmoreflyer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. The hotel grounds are gorgeous. Two large pools to choose from and they over look the ocean. We spent equal time between the pools and the large private beach. While drinks are a bit expensive at the tiki bar, you have to expect that at a 4 star hotel. Staying at this hotel is like staying in a piece of history. We love the 1920s character of the historic building and can't wait to book this place for next year again. The rooms are clean and comfortable and the service was first rate. We only had to ask for something once and it was taken care of immediately. The staff here are great. The location of the Casa is also excellent for renting bikes, which you can do right at the hotel, to cruise around Key West. In fact, we parked our car and didn't move it again until we left because we ended up riding bikes to Duval every day and evening when we went out. Bikes run about $20/day. You can also rent scooters and mopeds as well as wave runners and boats right on the property. We especially loved the breakfast every morning on the patio with an amazing view of the beach/ocean. We only ate breakfast at the Casa so I'm not sure what the rest of their food is like, but the breakfast was excellent. We will definitely be staying at the Casa Marina again and we're already looking forward to our next trip to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: naperville4
Reviews.Content: We just arrived home from the the most fabulous vacation. I was nervous after reading some of the reviews for this hotel. We found NOTHING to complain about while there for 7 nights & we are picky travelers. The staff is very helpful and friendly. It is truely a luxurious resort. Yes, there is that resort fee that people keep complaining about, but they do tell you about it when you reserve the room- this should be no surprise. Bob and Steve will cater to your every need at the pool and beach alll day. This is a perfect hotel to bring the kids to. The pools were great and we looked forward to the popcicles and frozen towels every afternoon. They showed a "dive in" movie at the pool one night we were there that was fun, too. It is at the quiet end of Duval-but still an easy walk with older kids(7 & 10) to Mallory Sqaure, we did cab it back for $12. We biked everywhere-no car needed. I suggest eating at Salute which is around the corner on the beach-great food and atmosphere. Our favorite place for excellent expresso and a quick breakfast was Anna's Cuban cafe just a couple of blocks away from the hotel. We can't wait to return! Future hotels we stay at now have a lot to live up to! Enjoy your time there...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: beachbums24
Reviews.Content: From the very beginning, the staff was attentive and courteous. Rooms were spacious and clean. Resort facilities were exactly what we were looking for in a beach resort stateside. We plan on coming back next year to visit!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, staff, rooms, and great beach”
Reviews.Author: miamibeach2009
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel, the staff is extremely helpful. Excellent beach at the hotel, hammocks, volleyball court. I highly recommend it and I will return.

Reviews.Title: “Ahhhh Paradise .........”
Reviews.Author: frasier3
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers the best Key West has to offer, a beautiful, pristine beach, 2 pools and a restaurant/bar right on the beach! You don't have to leave this resort at all if you don't want to. The beach staff (yes, there is a beach staff!!) even brings your loungers and towels at the spot you pick on their beautiful beach with hammocks tied to palm trees and a hut where you can book a massage!! The beach staff is there to ensure to take care of any request. The entire staff at this luxurious oasis in Key West is just so very nice and hospitable. They are there to make your vacation a true retreat! The rooms are very clean and comfortable and some have ocean views with a balcony. The exciting night life on Duval Street is a few walking blocks away. Also, around the corner is my favorite restaurant....Louie's Backyard, right on the beach. Make sure to call ahead for reservations, it is fine dining in an open air environment with the best local fish and specials in all of Key West. Overall this is the best place to stay in Key West and this last visit was my third trip. I will always choose Casa Marina as my destination in Key West!

Reviews.Title: “The good, the bad and the ugly...”
Reviews.Author: scarsdaletraveler
Reviews.Content: After reading quite a few travelers' negative reviews about this resort, we were concerned about our planned 5 night stay there in late March. The resort itself is beautiful. It has a nice beach, two pools and a breezy, modern lovely decor. The service was better than we expected - everyone was very nice and exceedingly helpful with suggestions for dining, walking directions, etc. There are some problems with the resort, however, which should be addressed by the mangement of the hotel. First - our room was supposed to be an upgrade from a standard room (our travel agent booked it and told us about the upgrade). The room was small, overlooking the parking lot and had almost no space for clothing, personal belongings. The safe (which didn't work) and mini-fridge took up nearly all the cabinet space (no drawers anywhere) that should have been available for clothing. My boyfriend basically lived out of his suitcase as there was no place to put his clothes. And sadly, not only did the room have no terrace (which we were not surprised about) BUT the windows do NOT even open. We did ask to change our room and were told that they were fully booked and it wouldn't be possible. Much to our chagrin, the "tennis on premises" is a total construction sight. When we asked where the courts were located (we chose this hotel because of the purported tennis on premises), we were told that the courts were "under repair" (not true - we were later told that would probably never be reopened) and we would have to use the public courts next door. Two out the five courts next door were missing their nets and because the public courts are right on the beach the wind was way too fierce to play an enjoyable game. Upon check out - we complained about this and received a credit of the daily resort fee of $20. We did appreciate this, but it didn't make up for the fact that we weren't able to play. We had the buffet breakfast one morning and sat outside to dine. While we (and several other tables) were enjoying our breakfast (food ok - overpriced) a maintenance man was mopping the entire area (with a huge, stringy mop). While he didn't literally ask us to lift our feet to get under our tables, he did get mighty close! And one day the maid came and woke us at 9 AM to clean the room. We asked her to come back later and she never came back! We finally asked the front desk to have our room made up in the mid-afternoon and then were left with NO TOWELS. It took THREE phone calls to actually get someone to bring up towels nearly an hour later! And the computers in the lobby that are for the use of guests are so slow that they are virutally unusable. Anyone we saw using them walked away frustrated that they were unable to check their email, etc. In spite of the problems we did have a good time (the weather was wonderful, after all!) and I feel obligated to mention some of the good things. We were able to walk nearly everywhere (about 15 minutes to Duvall Street) and barely used our car (to park here is an extra $20 per day) We went to some incredible restaurants and had many amazing meals (all outside) - don't miss Blue Heaven (breakfast AND dinner), Sarabeth's (on Sunday night for their fried chicken!), Cafe Sole (hogfish), Azur (mozzarella/tomato/basil salad to DIE for), Nine One Five in the middle of Duvall Street. The snorkeling and kayaking with Danger Charters was terrific. And, if you are driving down from Miami (as we did) stop for lunch at the Morada Bay Beach Cafe at MM 81....what a gorgeous spot.

Reviews.Title: “VERY ROMANTIC”
Reviews.Author: Ugando
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a weekend. This is a great place to stay and I would highly recommend it for couples and families. The food is great and they set up a table for you at the bridge, VERY ROMANTIC. I love it , I will definitely come back . Great location, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in Key West”
Reviews.Author: GiGiBe
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a long weekend. This is a great place to stay and I would highly recommend it for couples and families. The accommodations are great, we had one of the "lower end" rooms and it was fabulous. We did not have a balcony but that did not matter. The view from the hotel grounds right on the water and dock was beautiful, and we did not need a balcony. The hotel was recently renovated, beds were comfortable, rooms were spacious, property was fantastic. We stayed on the beach one day and had the poolside bar right there for food and drinks. Pools are very nice. We enjoyed the hammocks one day on the beach. We also took advantage of the couples massage on the beach -- which I highly recommend. Just make sure you confirm your massage when you arrive. My e-mail reservation was confirmed but when we arrived for our appointed time, someone else had our slot. We were able to reschedule and the spa was very apologetic and accomodating. Staff was wonderful. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet. You can walk to Duval Street from the hotel, but a cab is easier and doesn't cost too much. We did not have a car but rented scooters on the property one day, which was a great way to see Key West. You have to see the sunset at Mallory Square. I have never seen such a wonderful sunset and wasn't expecting it. Very relaxing vacation, the hotel is in a good location near Southernmost point, and I would definitely stay here again. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and would come back with my children. The hotel has a fitness center, which we used every day. It is in a separate building but very convenient across the street. We had no trouble getting on the equipment. Food at the hotel's restaurants was good. We had dinner there and I would recommend the breakfast buffet. Not cheap, but very good. Nothing in Key West is cheap. The property is beautiful. Staff is very accommodating. I can't say enough good things about this resort. It was a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “awsome”
Reviews.Author: chuc214
Reviews.Content: Casa was a wonderful resort, Manny at the front door is hilarious! rooms were clean beach was great and the bartenders kept the drinks flowing. I went with a group of 12 guys and we all had a awsome time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: autryp
Reviews.Content: The Bell/Valet staff was A+. Very fast and attentive. We had a suite with an ocean view. Room could have been cleaner. There was a small amount of food on the floor from the previous guest. Very beautiful pool area and oceanside grill. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Solid service but ...”
Reviews.Author: 4Shizzle
Reviews.Content: Our mid-March trip to the Casa Marina did now begin well. As appears to be case for many visitors, our Kind bed room which we had reserved was not available and we were instead directed to spend the first night with a ground floor, interior facing, 2X double bed room. Add to that, as we were on the front end of Spring Break, we were also next door to loud, drunken college kids (I was one, too, not so long ago. I'll give this a pass..) Of course we were disappointed with this and made our case to the front desk. Patrick at the front desk was extremely helpful and was able to remedy the situation and get us into an ocean view king bed room later the next afternoon. He was extremely courteous, friendly, and highly effective. It's no suprise I see his name mentioned positvely in other reviews. He's truly an asset to the facility. Other than the room, the beach and pool are very, very nice. Beach service was also excellent. Namely, Scott from Oklahoma on beach and pool service was exceptional and made a particularly good impression on us with his attentive service and personality. Assuming you get the "right room" , I think this is a great spot to spend your time in Key West. Close enough to Duval, without being too close, and has some quality beachfront space. It's also not cheap. While a $300/night room would appear to be a good bargain for a Waldorf Collection resort, that $300 only gets you in the door with a basic room and this is net of the egregious charges and resort fees that get slapped on and have been discussed in other reviews... The hotel was pretty packed when we were there, so obviously, the market will bear these charges so I'd expect the hotel to continue to charge them. That being said, for a very similar pricepoint, you can stay up the street a couple blocks at the sister facility The Reach Resort which is a far superior experience I understand.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: carsons8
Reviews.Content: This is the most stunning hotel I've ever seen in Florida. The grounds are impeccable and beautiful. They lobby area is impressive and the rooms are spacious/clean. The beach had lots of hammocks to lay on which was so relaxing. Only con is that the location is a bit far from Duval Street. Definitely not too far to walk though.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Rembems
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay at the Casa Marina after looking at many hotels in Key West, and overall were quite pleased with the experience. pros -Beautiful setup, right on the water -two pools and beach with easy access to water sports - very aesthetically pleasing -perfect proximity to Duval St. and the heart of Key West cons -slow service (when we checked in one of the rooms still hadn't been cleaned and a call for tech. support took about 35+ min.) -expensive (although not as expensive as some of the hotels in Key West, a pop at the hotel shop was nearly four dollars for a 20 oz. bottle, plus the wifi was not free) - Although thte cleaning service was good, one morning I was told that the cleaning lady couldn't come back later in the day and that I would have to leave my room that moment in order for it to be cleaned. Overall we were quite happy with the experience

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: SegGliders
Reviews.Content: I have to say the hotel was awesome! We stayed for 3 days it was great. The private beach was nice and clean. The food is pricey but worth it! The staff was great parking is tough but leave the car at home and fly in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing vacation”
Reviews.Author: staci29
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Casa Marina. The suite was beautiful and the grounds were truly impressive. Everything was clean, nice and comfortable. The staff was pleasant and helpful. We were checked into the wrong room at first and had to wait briefly while they finished cleaning ours, but were compted with free drinks at the ocean view poolside bar while we waited. We ate there a couple of times...the food is quite good and if you reserve or get lucky you can get one of the few tables right on the pier. Lovely! You can find better food in town, but sometimes you just don't feel like the hassle of parking etc. If you stay, walk down to Louie's Backyard for dinner-that's fine dining! Also eat at Blue Heaven in town and be sure to save room for their key lime pie. A few minor complaints....there is only an instant espresso machine in the room. If you want coffee you have to go the lobby and shell out $3.25 + tax. And there is a daily $12 charge if you want internet in your room....you can get free internet at far less expensive motels everywhere....this is just wrong!! There are 2 computers you can use for free in the lobby, but people are always waiting to use them, so first you wait, then you feel rushed because others are waiting for you to finish. There really isn't tennis, as stated on the site, it's a public court down the street. The resort fee $20 daily added to your bill was supposed to include fresh fruit....I never saw any. Usually, if you are staying at a resort this nice and paying this much, the staff comes around in the evening and brings fresh towels and chocolates, or at least has cookies in the lobby. Here if you have a sweet tooth in the evening, open your wallet, again.... Don't get me wrong, we had a great time...I would recommend the place and I would stay there again....just little annoyances that would class the place up a little more.

Reviews.Title: “Nice facility”
Reviews.Author: augievikings1992
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Casa Marina. Check-in was very muddled, however. Our room wasn't ready so we were asked to sit at the bar and told we would be called when the room was available. Two hours later, we checked with staff and learned they had just forgotten to call us which was really irritating. Other than that, the hotel service was quite good. The grounds are very beautiful and peaceful. Hotel is quite a walk from Duval Street, but that was probably good given all we ate and drank during the trip. Great massage at the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: marian2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina in a Grand Ocean View room overlooking the front entrance to the property on the ocean side. It had a huge balcony and stunning view. The room was very large although the bathroom was small. It was very clean and well maintained on a daily basis. The front desk people were wonderful, especially Patrick and Maria. The hotel is very beautiful and well manicured. It is a bit of a walk ( 35 minutes) to Mallory Sq. but worth it because of the peace and quiet of the area. I was very pleased with my experience at the CM. The only two things I would suggest to improve the overall guest experience would be to 1) remove the $20 daily resort fee ( a pretty ridiculous charge for amenities that should already be included in the room rate) and 2) provide free coffee in the lobby in the morning. (The in room espresso machine was useless in my opinion). I did enjoy the complimentary NY Times each day as well as the refreshing lime/mint cold drink provided in the afternoon. I asked for a late checkout and was denied initially, but after talking to a manager (Jeff) I was accommodated. I am a Hilton Honors member which I suggest joining if you are thinking of staying at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “For the most part, absolutely beautiful and luxurious, with an attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: highheels1117
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for six days and loved it. Steve on the beachfront/pool was absolutely fabulous and helped us with towels and beach chairs. We had lunch at the resort's restaurant every day and were thrilled with the quality of the food and drinks. Service was speedy every day but one, which was understandable because a wedding was taking place at the resort later in the day. I was disappointed with the pools, as they had a salty taste to the water and they were not saltwater pools. This was a little disconcerting, but the wide stretch of beach and ocean were absolutely beautiful. The gift shop workers were very friendly as well as the front desk people. The men working the outside booth found us taxis quickly when we asked for them, there was no waiting involved. The rooms were very small. We paid to have an ocean view room, and upon arriving realized how small it was. We had three people staying in one room, and while the king size bed was comfortable, the pull out sofa bed was horrendous. However, the TV worked well, the coffee machine was a delight, and the shower and bathroom amenties were perfect. On top of this, we had a delightful balcony with a sliding glass door and a perfect view of the ocean and Key West's beautiful sunsets. The cleaning staff was attentive and always on time, and the rooms were perfectly attended and cleaned. Everything here is pricy, but it is understandable as Key West imports almost all their ingredients. But, for what we pay to stay here, the luxury and attentive staff are definitely provided. On top of that, the resort isn't too populated and there were always beach and/or pool chairs available, and Steve came around with wet cloths and glasses of ice water to refresh us on the hot days. For the most part, we loved this trip and would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds. Great Service Great Pool!”
Reviews.Author: GettingMarried0708
