Reviews.Content: My husband and I split our honeymoon half Disneyworld half Key West. We arrived at the Casa and were greated by warm the front desk. From the momment we arrived until the day we left they were they to answer any questions, supply maps to the town, and suggest restaurants, etc. We requested a view of the ocean but upon arrival had 1/2 view of ocean 1/2 view of parking lot. The hotel was able to move our room the following night and sent complimentary chocolate covered strawberried and champagne to our room! Very nice treat after a night on the town. The grounds are beautiful! As everyone states the beaches arent great! BUT the water is beautiful and the Casa has a pier that you can walk till the end and swin there. Water is shallow and beautiful! Beds are comfortable! Room was cleaned everyday by the time we returned to the room! Overall Great Experiance We did not spend much time at the Casa bc we were busy with activities and seeing the town. We will be returning to Key West and July and will make this stay more relaxing!

Reviews.Title: “Huge Disappointment! Don't be fooled by the pictures.”
Reviews.Author: Wanda08
Reviews.Content: My husband and I live in the keys and we wanted to do something really special for our anniversary. So we chose the Casa Marina for its great location. The beach really is beautiful and the hammocks are wonderful, but certainly not worth $300 a night. We checked in and our room was TINY, I would estimate it was half the size of your average hotel room. They say ocean view but what they really mean is an ocean peek. The small window in the room didn't even open, so you couldn't even get fresh air. We had no tub and no patio. So we called to be upgraded to a room with a tub and patio and the man was very helpful. He upgraded us to a one bedroom suite. We checked into that room and once again were disappointed. Our patio was nestled between the stairwell, the hallway and the parking lot, we had a flat screen tv with a blurry in and out picture. On top of all that, you would think for $300 a night (and that was a discounted rate too!) the coffee and shampoo and conditioner would have to be included. Nope, they charge you a 23.00 "room fee" for the coffee and the other amenities in your room. They even charge you to park!!! What exactly is the $300 dollars for if you still have to pay for every other convenience you should naturally be offered at any hotel! Also, definitely make a stop at the liquor store before you check in if you plan on having a few cocktails. We were hanging out on the hammock and decided to get a beer from the bar. Draft miller lite and bottled coronas were our only option and after paying our $16.oo tab for one beer each we decided to go sit in the hot tub, only to find out they don't have one! To end on a positive note, the one great thing about this place is the pool guy Steve. We hung out at the pool the next day and he was so helpful. Friendly and enthusiastic, he made us feel welcome and comfortable. Just a word to the wise, there are many beautiful hotels in Key West, this is not one of them.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous grounds,but it ends there.”
Reviews.Author: cmfairygodmother
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Honors Gold Member, we have stayed at some of the most amazing hotels. Including the Hilton Cavalieri in Rome, Hilton's flagship hotel. Imagine my excitement when I found that this beautiful hotel was a part of the group I have enjoyed. Upon booking, I was told that I would recieve a $50 credit for booking early. When I called later on to add my Hilton honors number, somehow that $50 disappeared. I requested an upgrade on "My Way" account. When we arrived, my heart sank as there was a huge conference for Urology. The hotel was all set up for all of these doctors to enjoy the conference here. Check in was harried. The fellow at the desk was very pleasant but apologized for not seeing the $50 credit, and informed us that there was no upgrade available, even if we wanted to pay for it. Upon checking the website later on, that was not true. Off we went to our room, and it was tiny. No problem, we are staying in Key West. We have this beaufitul hotel to enjoy swimming in the pool and the beach as well. I went to wash my face and there were no facecloths. I found a housekeeper that brought me some. I went back to the room and found a pubic hair on my bed. Now I am starting to cry. I went into the bathroom to wash my face and as I look around the floor is filled with hair. It was surface cleaned only. Gross. I called the front desk to ask what kind of amenities do I get for being a Gold member. I was told I get water and cookies. I got the water, no cookies. Why bother? I was not informed of any breakfast on the beach, or any free breakfast, or any dining in the hotel at all. We walked Duvall Street and ate at Blue Heaven....LOVED it...the food is well worth the price, you get what you pay for here. In the morning, we woke up to an alarm blaringat 6 a.m.. We couldn't shut the darn thing off. Don't you think that would be the first thing a housekeeper would do? Turn off the alarm from the previous guest? We went to the pool and beach and Steve the supervisor there was just wonderful. He doled out towels, got us beach chairs and was top notch. I won't stay here again. I feel like the unwanted stepchild tucked away in the back wing of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, but we were a disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneLynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week. The hotel is beautiful, and the grounds are lovely. Here's what we really liked: Hotel location was great; not too close to Duval, but not far either, 10 minute walk. Beach was nice, pool was great, loved the hammocks. Steve, one of the pool/beach staff guys, was terrific. He was friendly, and always right there with our towels. Quality bed linens were nice too. What we didn't like: When we checked in, the front desk folks were really busy. The lady who helped us was nice enough, but as she checked us in, she kept stopping to take phone calls (guests calling about where to make dinner reservations, etc. etc.). After about the fourth call, I felt myself getting a little irritated. We'd been traveling all day and wanted to get to our room. For what we paid, we expected a little more. We were disappointed that we did not have a balcony/patio (not really the hotel's fault; we assumed the island view rooms had balconies) . The window in the room was not made to open, so we were also bummed that we couldn't even get fresh air. We requested a king size bed, but instead got a room with two double beds. When we called guest services to ask why we didn't get the king, we were told that when we made the reservation we could ony request a king, that there was no guarantee we'd get one. No sweat, we made due with the doubles. The room was quite small, and I was disappointed that there was not a closet or a dresser. There was only a wardrobe, and that was the only place we had to hang our clothes and store our suitcases. The sink faucet in the bathroom made a horrible thumping noise when the hot water was turned on. The litte counter area which housed the coffee maker and cups/glasses was dusty. We had a couple bags of snacks on the counter and when we got up the next day there were tiny ants crawling all over the bags. One major reason we chose this hotel is because it allows pets. We brought our small dog (she's 4 lbs), and we paid $125.00 non refundable pet fee, which was seemed reasonable. Our room was a few doors up from an exit to the outside stairwell, and while we were out of the room, our dog must've barked when she heard people coming in from outside, because on our last night there, we came back from dinner (around 10:30PM) and found a nasty note posted on our door. Not from the hotel staff, from our "neighbor." The next morning we get a call (6:20AM) from the front desk, telling us they'd received a complaint about a dog barking. We check out that morning around 9:00AM, and we again find another nasty note on our door (from the same person). I'm sorry our dog disturbed a hotel guest, but it wasn't necessary to leave the ugly notes on our door. So, something to keep in mind if you're contemplating bringing your dog. This was our 5th trip to Key West. Previously we'd stayed at the Galleon, Eden House, and twice at The Southermost Motel. I'd always wanted to stay at the Casa Marina, and now that I have, I don't think I'd stay there again. The resort fees ($22.00 daily), the parking fees ($12.00 daily).... not happy about those either. In my opinon, you're paying for luxury, but you're not truly getting luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Great winter getaway”
Reviews.Author: maggiedo1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful staff, just what's needed for winter relaxation. We stayed at Casa Marina last year due to a devastating fire at our home. We needed to get away and were rewarded with a great experience. Staff was very attentive and the concierge was helpful plus. Rooms were clean, modern and comfortable. Enjoyed the pool area and attention to detail immensely. Liked being a little distance away from the hubbub of Duvall Street, yet closed enough to get there easily. We have definitely recommended this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: ontario_flutist
Reviews.Content: All I can say is "wow". The hotel was just gorgeous. Beautiful beach, nice (but small) pools, restaurant overlooking the water. Our room was large, king bed, very clean and modern looking. The bathroom had a large shower, no tub. Our room did not have a view, because it was not worth it for us to pay more. However, once you are outside you have all the view you need! The staff were excellent, especially when you are on the beach. They come around all the time to ask if you want a drink, etc. There are also kids activities scheduled every day, but since I don't have kids I can't comment on the quality of them. You can also hop on the trolley tour at the hotel. Cons:The breakfast buffet was pricey for what you got. However it's an expensive hotel, so that is to be expected. You have to pay extra for internet access (strange, when every other hotel we stayed at had free wireless). There is also a "resort fee" of $20 per day. Not sure why, because it's a mandatory fee. It should just be included in the room rate.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, classy place”
Reviews.Author: CandyC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights on my recent trip to Key West, I found it through Hotwire and compared to other hotels in Key West the base rate was better at $178 per night; however there is a $20 per day additional charge for 'amenities' as the beach chairs, hammocks, internet, etc. But I didn't mind that too much because if I went to a public beach I would have to pay $10 for a beach chair alone, and I would also have to hunt for and find an internet cafe and then have to pay for that as well. So this way everything was right there in one spot. The parking situation I didn't like too well, I had a rental car and the choices were valet parking for $20 a day or $12.50 per day to park in the lot across the street. I chose the valet parking because it was easier, but I really didn't need a car at all on Key West as everything is pretty much in walking distance or you can rent a bike or scooter to get around. Though I felt the rooms were rather small for a resort of this size, I absolutely LOVED the bed in my room! It was soooo comfortable that I found it difficult to get out of it to do anything once I lay down in it, it was very conducinve to helping you relax and fall asleep. The pools were not crowded at all, and I loved the hammocks on the beach, spent one afternoon doing nothing but relaxing in the hammock. The pier is nice and the water at the private beach is very shallow so you can walk out quite a way. The whole place is very beautiful and clean, the staff were bending over backwards to be helpful and friendly, and they were always available and visible. The food at the restaurant was so-so; nothing special but good enough if you know what I mean. Not outstanding in other words. I can't wait to go back to Key West and would definitely stay at the Casa Marina again!

Reviews.Title: “Changing reservation is like buying a car”
Reviews.Author: minnesotahswediepie
Reviews.Content: We made reservations directly through property's website, allowing +/- one day for air reservations. Upon finalizing our trip, nearly four weeks before arrival, we needed to make a change to the reservation, as actual arrival/departure times were more a matter of airline availability. Upon calling reservations, I learned that the property had changed hands, and that in order to change our reservation, we would now have to book and the going rate, which was over $100/night more! Supposedly, this was conveyed, but I can tell you, I would NOT have made reservations without finalizing air reservations. Either it was not conveyed, or it was obscured. I was told by April in reservations, and Thomas, weekend supervisor in reservations, that my email confirmation should have told me. It mentioned no such thing. Bottom line, I was supposed to call back M-F, but he (Thomas) has been in the business for 10 years and that's how hotels operate, a reservation is like a contract. Could I just say, EVEN AIRLINES AND CAR RENTAL CONTRACTS CLEARLY AND EXPLICITLY STATE THEIR CHANGE POLICY! So I asked him to forward a message to the person in charge, which he said he would do, but he couldn't "guarantee" they would call me back. Go figure. You know, I'm really having issue with a hotel that seemingly regards me as an annoyance, when all I want to do is patronize their establishment. Bottom line, if this is how they treat me BEFORE I stay, why would I want to waste my hard earned money to risk further insult after I arrive? What I'm hearing is they don't need my business, which is too bad for us because now we have airline tickets.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: familykidd
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for two night and wish we'd stayed longer - it is beautiful and immaculate and we had a wonderful time. We stayed in a two bedroom ocean view loft suite - expensive but exquisite. The pools were quiet - plently of beds free and the lovely beach and hammocks were much appreciated. The hotel is a short walk (@10 mins) from all the action at Duval. Our only gripe was the tendency to add hidden costs - parking at $12 per day and a resort fee. When you're paying in excess of Â£1000 for two nights accommodation you don't expect to be stung for extras in this way and it felt mean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful breakfast in the sun but mind the spoiled children”
Reviews.Author: K76
Reviews.Content: plus: This was truly a holiday. A breakfast in the sun while at home people are enjoying wind and snow haha. Nice rooms, clean and good size. Liked the coffee maker. neutral: distance to Key West main areas is good but not perfect. We don't mind a walk. minus: A little bit too many children in the pool, beach and terrace area though. And parents who don't mind that there children are annoying other people...

Reviews.Title: “stylish resort....too many kids”
Reviews.Author: lzhPennsylvania
Reviews.Content: The weather was the best part of our five day trip to Key West. The hotel is a classy place on a not to classy island. My only complaint about the hotel is the number of kids in the pools. There are two lovely pools, so why not designate one of them as 'Adults Only'? Some guests are there to have a break from their own kids, and it's not relaxing to hang out at the pool with so many kids. (I counted 14 kids under 10 just in the pool!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: skurny
Reviews.Content: Some friends and I went down for Super Bowl weekend and really enjoyed our time at Casa Marina. The staff were great, from the front desk to the bartenders and the outdoor area made the trip. The location is decent...about a 15 minute walk to Duvel/Whitehead area. The hammocks and beach chairs by the pool and beach were really nice and overall, it was a great few days there. The concierge was also helpful in recommending restaurants and things to see. The beds were comfortable and the dark, hardwood floors were a nice touch. The Ocean Vista's are great as well...for an extra $20-30 a night, I'd highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a good experience”
Reviews.Author: westcapejosh
Reviews.Content: Hilton just took over the Casa Marina and maybe they can get their act together but here were some issues. 1. The building has NO heat, so on a chilly night good luck 2. Fitness center was not finished when we visited 3. The cleanliness of the floors was not up to Hilton standards 4. No back up power generator on the property for emergancy lighting. Key West looses power often and a hotel of this size should have at least safety lighting 5. Front desk staff is lacking in knowledge of the area

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Stay - too short!”
Reviews.Author: SenEngTeacher
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a trip to the Keys. We had decided early on to stay just one night in Key West at Casa Marina and do the other three nights in Key Largo at another Hilton property. That was a mistake. We should have stayed longer in Key West! The resort is absolutely lovely. The staff is very friendly and accomodating (especailly Tracy who helped us navigate around Key West and offered great suggestions for restaurants etc.) I accidently left an outfit hanging the closet when we left for Key Largo. I made a phone call and they shipped it out UPS to my house*free of charge!* and it arrived today. I would go back in a heartbeat and stay longer as there is much to do in Key West and the resort offers comfort and total relaxation. My only regret is that we didn't have a bigger room. I felt that when we paid for an ocean view room that the room would be large and the balcony spacious. This was not the case. Our room was rather small and as our balcony was a corner one, it was very cramped. I guess we should have asked for something better but as this was Valentine's Day weekend, they were all booked up. When we return again, (as I know we will) I will want a larger room. All in all, we were very pleased with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Kanorth
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Casa Marina. The hotel is a lovely resort, probably one of the best properties in Key West. The resort has two very large pools along with a significant beach front which most Key West hotels don't have. The grounds are lovely and very clean. The rooms were clean but small and pretty tight quarters for the price. The shower was a little weird in that it had half of a glass wall which meant water spayed onto the bathroom floor. I had a massage in the spa that was very relaxing. Not your typical spa in that its a couple of suites in the hotel. This is a good hotel if you don't want to be in the middle of everything that's going on in Key West. A short cab ride takes you to Duval St, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property, Poor Service”
Reviews.Author: travelandeateateat
Reviews.Content: My husband was attending a conference at the Casa Marina, so I went along to enjoy the activities and nice January weather. The property is beautiful. The grounds are well kept, the pools looked clean (I didnâ€™t go in, but they looked nice) and the beach is steps away from the rooms. I enjoyed eating at the breakfast buffet each morning as it was relaxing to sit outside and the selection of items, plus the omelet bar was nice. The room was simple, but cleanâ€¦ a typical 4-star hotel room. Nothing incredibly fancy, but nice enough to enjoy being on vacation, with a comfortable bed, flat screen TV, small sitting area, desk, mini fridge and coffee station. The major drawback with the hotel is very poor service, which seems to be known around the town by locals who use the pool and other amenities. It is such a shame because the property is so nice, so if they could pay more attention to training their staff, it would be wonderful place to stay. We had a few different instances of poor service from a situation with the shower in the bathroom to requesting late check out and being scoffed at over the phone. Other people attending the conference also mentioned that they thought the service wasnâ€™t what it should be at the hotel. Beyond the poor service, I enjoyed an 80 minute massage in the Massage Studio and it was fantastic and the masseuse was so nice. This was the one exception to the rule on the poor service at the hotel and Iâ€™d definitely recommend treating yourself to a massage while staying at the hotel. The hotel was quiet and the location is convenient. I walked to Duval Street a few times and felt safe doing so alone. (It's a bit of a walk, but I like exploring new cities on foot.) We went on a dolphin watching/snorkeling trip through Key West Watersports, which is connected to the hotel. It was a little bit more expensive than some of the other advertised tours that I saw in brochures and along Duval Street, but the tour left from the Casa Marina dock, rather than the other side of the island where the rest of the tours docked and the boat was clean and spacious. I think it was worth the extra cost for the convenience of not taking a cab to the other dock and the crew of the boat was friendly and I felt safe during the entire trip. On the boat, there were sodas, beer, bottled water and chips for a snack after snorkeling. I needed a haircut while I was in Key West and went to Headlines Hair. CherylAnn was awesome. Great cut for a reasonable price and she recommended some great activities and shops. A few doors down from Headlines was the Red Chandelier where the owner, Eve, finds great clothes at amazing prices. She carried clothes that I would find at boutique shops in San Francisco, but at half the price. She mentioned that her rent is lower because sheâ€™s just off of Duval Street, which helps keep her prices down. Eve also gave me some great suggestions on things to do in Key West. Overall, we had a nice stay and the location was relaxing and convenient. Again, if the Casa Marina can improve their quality of service, I would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect 3 day getaway”
Reviews.Author: tuckerfore
Reviews.Content: The staff, and Patrick at the front desk, in particular made this a wonderful stay. Our desire was to avoid the "tourist trap" restaurants and clubs and Patrick made sure to keep us off the beaten path. From cuban to seafood to breakfast at Sarabeth's, each recommendation was outstanding. Our room offered a lovely view of the ocean and swimming pools. The beds were very comfortable and the room was spacious and bright. The highlight was sipping mojitos on the beach at midnight while swaying in a hammock under a full moon....heaven!

Reviews.Title: “Good after the refurb”
Reviews.Author: clarkio
Reviews.Content: This hotel has under gone a three year refurb which is now finished and as we were walk ins we got a good deal $200 all in per night. However when checking out a $20 a day resort fee came into play and after further discussion it got removed so check before you buy. In general the hotel offers good size rooms a great terrace and pool area backing onto a small beach. Get a room with ocean view as it will be worth paying the extra. The hotel is about 10 min drive from down town which is very busy and ful l of tackey cloths and gift shops .the restruants at the waters edge are good but shop around as you may get od on pecan pie

Reviews.Title: “A lovely relaxing stay at a Caribbean-like resort”
Reviews.Author: MbeanColorado
Reviews.Content: We booked here at the last minute, as we had a few extra days with sunny weather forecast. We had a small issue with our first room, and it was quickly addressed by the staff. Our room was an "Island Vista" room, translation: not facing the ocean. It was crisp, contemporary and spotless. Very comfortable king bed, lovely linens, and small but exquisite bathroom. The room was quiet, the pools were terrific, and the beach was lovely. The hotel is not in the "night life" section, which suited us just fine. It's an easy cab ride to anywhere on the 2 mile by 4 mile island. We had lunch and drinks by the pool, very nice. The day on the beach was wonderful, nice lounges, towels and cruising, but not hovering, service staff, a few hammocks between palm trees, and lots of room to relax in the shade, or sun next to the water. Our next stay we will upgrade to an ocean view room with balcony! Since we didn't know the hotel, we weren't sure if it was going to be worth it. Since our room was in the "old" but remodeled section, our windows didn't open, which is my only minor negative comment. If that is an issue for you, reserve accordingly. The hotel is lovely throughout. Favorite thing: after walking home from dinner, we found gelato for sale in the gift shop! Perfect ending!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect vacation , every aspect perfect, Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This resort was perfect from reservation to last minute. The staff was perfect, service same , the room was great. the views just as in the web site tours. Get the Casa Grand Ocean Vista Room.............. anything less is not right ........this room has a huge deck with large French doors and a best of the resort view. Breakfast is great on the patio and Dinner on the beach is wonderful when the sun is setting. I will be going again. oh yea the beds and pillows are heavenly and the expresso in the room is great . Well worth every penny I paid .

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: SunSeekers0
Reviews.Content: As a walk in guest having driven down from Florida that day we had no problem checking in and we managed to get a room with a sea view and a large balcony. Although we only stayed for 1 night I don't think we could find any fault with the Casa Marina. The beach and pool areas were clean and tidy. Staff were all really polite and helpful. All the amenities in the room that you could wish for and really comfy beds. The building is really stunning and in terms of the location it was easy enough to walk to Duval St in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Pool Bar Gals”
Reviews.Author: HAYWIRED1
Reviews.Content: Vacationed for a long weekend from Miami at the Casa Marina. It was our first stay at the property and we were amazed at the view and the huge area on the ocean with two pools, pool bars and a area for the kids to swim in the ocean. I must say it gave you the feeling of having the beach to yourself while getting served fresh fruit and popsicles for the kids, gratis on the hotel! We also enjoyed hanging out at the pool bar and getting to know Robin, Jan and Laura who worked the bar. They made the best virgin pina coladas for our kids. All in all a great place.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Venue!”
Reviews.Author: BoardmanMijas_Spain
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay 12 nights at the Casa Marina so we have a very good idea of what it is like over a longer period. First and foremost, what is impressive about the Casa is its setting. It's a stunnng paradise. The grand, imposing main building oozes class and tranquility with wonderful symmetry falling away to the pools, bar and grill, and then to the beach just 20 yards away. Classical paradise palm trees interspersed with hammocks and more than enough sun loungers etc. As you look out to the horizon there are beautiful old wooden piers to your far left and right and catch both the sunrise and sunset. We would definitely recommend an ocean view...spectacular every morning and night. Better still get a ground floor ocean view room. As you open your terrace doors you have your own sun loungers and table and chairs. Past these there are the grasses and 20 yards away, the sandy beach. From what we saw Casa Marina has the best beach on the island. We were very happy with our room which had a king bed but was still very spacious. Everything seemed pretty new and in very good order, including ipod docking. In terms of service, nothing was too much trouble. We were regularly asked if everything was OK with our stay and we have to say it sounded genuine rather than the usual soundbytes you get in some places. The staff really did seem to care and we have to mention Maria on Front Desk who is just lovely. They weren't just very professional and helpful but they would always stop and pass the time with you if that was your want. One didn't get any impression of a great hurry which added to the really relaxing experience. Re location, well we thought it was perfect. Far enough away from the craziness of the top end of Duval and Mallory ( which was chaotic) but walkable after a fun night out. If you don't fancy the walk, a cab takes minutes and costs circa 12 dollars. Absolutely the best of both worlds. Re prices and value, we found Key West on the whole very expensive ( don't go anywhere near LaTeDa Bar 23 dollars for2 glasses of wine!). But Casa was surprisingly reasonable. The breakfast buffet was 19 dollars each plus tip but was very extensive and delicious and you could have your eggs or omelette cooked before your eyes as you wanted. No need for lunch afterwards ! Otherwise you really do get what you pay for. Tips............The Reach up the road is a sister hotel and has a fantastic restaurant ..The Striphouse...gorgeous food if a bit pricey. But they have a fantastic gazebo for romantic evening strolls. Cut through to Duval by leaving the Casa complex out of the Watersports exit. Walk straight on and then 1st left into the Reach resort and cut through to Simonton (where the Cuban deli is)and then Duval..believe us it cuts out a lot. Also check out the 5th Floor observation deck at The Reach which also has some chairs etc where you can see across the whole island and get another view of the sunset and the cruise ships going in and out. Hope this helps and ......Enjoy.................

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: strtofdrms
Reviews.Content: This was a two week stay for me on my honeymoon. This is a great historical resort on the quiet side of Key West. Don't be fooled...this is the best place to stay in Key West. It is quiet, but close to the action...there is a private BEACH, not just a dock like most other 'resorts' have. Plus, it is huge and beautiful. The rooms are newly renovated and, a rarity, have really high quality bath products that we are still using at the house. You can buy them at the gift shop (but the bottles are big enough to take a bunch home). The pool is also gorgeous and the room service is adequate. The tvs are large flat panels and there are in room movies. We took in the spa services and enjoyed a great massage on the beach. We never got to the water sports or snorkeling offered by the resort, but they are there. Volley ball, guided tours and a friendly staff round out this establishment. We had a ball downtown, but after a long night...it was nice to come back to a quiet oasis where we could unwind. A gem.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific”
Reviews.Author: prec320
Reviews.Content: Terrific Resort. We had an ocean front room and the view was terrific. My only complaint was the corner balcony was very small. The room was not large, but adequate. This is a great place to relax. Ocean frontage, hammocks, pools, and water recreation was available. I'd stay again. The only meal we had at the hotel was lunch on the beach. The food was very good. but a little expensive for breackfast and lunch. We spilt a salad and a sandwich for $40.00. We found a Cuban deli not far from the resort that served great coffee and food. It is just a short walk from the hotel. I think it was on the corner of Simpton and South St. -- I wish we could have stayed longer. 5 days was not enough for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: KNaughton
Reviews.Content: Very nice resort. Beautiful property. Friendly service. Good food at the outside bar/dining area. Away from the hustle and bustle of Duval, but only a 10 minute bike ride away. Would stay there again. Only complaint is the shortage of beach chairs and umbrellas and beach staff not very motivated about turning over those that are no longer being used or coming around to see if you want drinks or food.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible value for money - DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: cybertraveller696
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Great beach with loads of activities - Facing the right way to catch sun throughout the day - Quiet neighbourhood - Very friendly valet staff Cons: - Terrible value for money - room felt like a Holiday Inn - This hotel has no character - it looks like a prison once you get past the grand entrance hall - Dirty rooms - Small rooms - Grumpy staff, especially the chewing-gum chewing unenthusiastic reception staff - Awful view onto construction site - Far walk to Duval Street compared to Hyatt All in all, this is a badly managed hotel with a terrible value for money proposition. I would recommend the Hyatt at the other end of Duval Street instead.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely going back”
Reviews.Author: floorbye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for four nights over Christmas 2008 and loved it so much that we will definitely be going back on a yearly basis! Check in was charming, efficient and friendly. The room (Island Vista on the 3rd floor) was well-sized, clean and very comfortable. The bed was pillow-top with a down mattress top - incredibly comfortable. Bathroom was well sized with a shower - no tub (absolutely fine). Breakfast was really good though a bit expensive (but good luck trying to find anything less expensive on the island). Food at the pool side restaurant tasty but the menu was a bit limited. That said, after doing sundowners at Mallory Square one night, we'd had enough of the tourist craziness and decided that the best place on the island to watch the sun set was right at Casa Marina. Food at the Striphouse (the restaurant at the Casa Marina's sister hotel down the beach) was excellent - very romantic setting too. My only complaint? Wifi cost $12 for 24 hours which seemed a bit petty all things considered. That said, that was a pretty minor "infraction" in our eyes. We'll definitely be going back and would certainly recommend the place to our friends going to Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing holiday feeling”
Reviews.Author: JurgenBockstaele
Reviews.Content: We have spent 3 days in the Casa Marina Resort. The welcome and check in/check out was good, fast and clear. The room was big (two queens) with even an espressomachine in the room. The room was well cleaned. The garden is very lovely with two pools and two bars. I missed a little bit a jacuzzi in the garden. The private beach is lovely with nice palm trees. The breakfast is a buffet wich you can take in the garden. It costs about 20 USD and you get everything: salmon, waffles, show cooking with an omelet, sausages, ham, pastry, fresh fruit, ... A complimentary ice lolly on the beach. There is a big valet and selfparking; but we stand for free next to the hotel in the street. A 15' walk to the heart of Duval street is not much. We liked the resort very much and would return here.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Trip”
Reviews.Author: arilives
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina from 12/21 to 12/27. Overall, we were satisfied with our stay with a few exceptions. The property is beautiful, and the front desk and concierge are very helpful. However, we had bugs in our room (and it was on the 3rd floor), my husband left out a package of beef jerky and when we woke up in the morning the package was actually vibrating due to all the bugs! Guest Services solution was to send in housekeeping again, I thought we would at least get another room. Whatever they did seemed to work though, we didn't see bugs again for the rest of our stay. The resort fee is ridiculous, we spent hours by the pool and or beach everyday, and only once did anybody ask us if we wanted water, so I suppose I paid $ 20/day for someone to offer us water once in a week's time. I don't know who passes out the frozen fruit and popsicles, but we weren't offered any. I did see waiters and waitresses assisting the beach goers who were near the pier, but they didn't venture to where we were seated. The food was extremely overpriced, but what you expect at a resort (Christmas brunch was $ 42/person USD, and normal breakfast buffet was $ 19/person). Ask for the daily special drink at the outdoor bar, which is $ 5.00, compared to a $ 11.00 frozen mojito and $ 10.00 pina colada. The bartenders were great, as well as the concierge and kind attendants at the front desk. Other than that, I wouldn't praise the resort's service. I don't know if I'd stay here again, overall it was pleasant, but for what you pay I would expect better service. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Very, very mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: ultrafrog75
Reviews.Content: The ad for casa marina states "luxury redefined". Unfortunatly this property is nowhere close to a luxury hotel. On the plus side, the casa marina has a large resort area with two pools and a private beach (which is acceptable, but really not the most beautiful in Key West). On the negative side, the rooms are VERY small, and quite noisy (we could hear our next door neighbor most of the time). But the biggest problem of casa marina is service : the staff is just here will just do what it's here to do, service is mediocre (housekeeping just ok, regular shortage of towels at the pool/gym -which in my opinion is unacceptable when you are paying a 20$/day resort fee-, not enough waiting/resort staff and overall, unfriendly attitude of the staff towards guests. This resort is ok but nowhere near a luxury property where staff get outs of its way to satisfy its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds, Not so Good Service”
Reviews.Author: travelmonkey247
Reviews.Content: I booked an Ocean Vista room for $310/night during high season. When we arrived at the hotel, we were really impressed. The hotel is without a doubt one of the most beautiful I have stayed at, and I have stayed in many beach resorts all over the world including the Caribbean, Hawaii, and Thailand. There were plenty of hammocks and beach chairs and the palm trees just made the scene perfect. Check-in was smooth and quick and the bell staff was nice. We drove our car here and self-parked for $12/night instead of $20 for valet. There are 2 computers in the lobby for guests to use for free internet. It was a 5-10 minute walk to get to Duval Street but there were plenty of taxies also. The room was nicely decorated with a tropical and luxurious theme. We had 2 queen beds which were very soft and comfortable. Our room was on the first floor with direct access to the beach from our balcony. I would recommend getting this kind of room if you decide to stay here. The expresso machine and iHome dock were nice touches to the room. The TV was flat screen. The bathroom was very small with only a shower, no tub. The shower got really annoying because the water would spray onto the floor because there is no door for the shower. There is a watersports company on the property that offers snorkeling trips, sunset cruises, kayaks, jet skies, and other rentals. I used it because of its convenience. The beach on the hotel is calm an very few people are in the water. If you have seen the hotel picture with the little diving platform in the middle of the ocean, it is impossible to get on because they have blocked it off. Our first problem occured when we found a trail for beach ants on the floor and sink area. We told management and they sent a mechanic with cleaner spray, which is a joke. The management then gave us the option of either switching floors immediately or waiting the next day to switch rooms on the same floor. We figured that this would be too much trouble for us since their options were pretty weak. This is a four star hotel and I payed good money! They should have offered better compensation(at the least a free bottle of wine or something) since we found the room to be infested with ants. Our next problem occured with their activity sheet, which by the way is a total joke. The hotel gave us a schedule of activities that they would have during our stay. One of the activities was a kayak tour to the Southernmost Point at 9 in the morning. I woke up early to prepare to go but when I arrived at the meeting location they gave us, no one was there. I went up to the front desk and they were pretty much clueless and didn't seem to care at all. They sent me to the pool director but he wasn't anywhere. Later, I went to another activity scheduled and again, no one was there. I then gave up on the activity sheet. It seemed to me like they made the sheet to make themselves look impressive. Our last major problem occured when we needed pool towels. Half of the time when I went to get beach towels, there were none left. One time, I went up to one of the pool guys who was standing right beside the EMPTY pool towel cart to ask for some towels. He told me that someone would be out with some in a minute so I stood there waiting. I think he thought that I would leave and come back later but I didn't so he and his buddy left to fetch towels. Do I smell liars? I think so I would hesitate to stay at this hotel again. I have stayed at many four star beach resorts around the world and this service is the worst. I would only recommend this hotel if you want a nice beach scene because that is really all you get. If you have not been spoiled by good service from other hotels or receive a good rate, I would stay here. This hotel has lots of potential if they would make sure their service is better.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Resort, Key West - Best service I've seen”
Reviews.Author: legs79
Reviews.Content: I was escorting a foreign government official and received the most professional treatment I've ever seen in my career (30 years with the military). Maria Bennett is absolutely phenomenal and the whole staff was such a pleasure that I didn't even feel like I was working! You will not have a worry on your mind while staying at the Casa Marina. This hotel is world class. All amenities one can think of in the rooms. Quick, courteous service (food, check-in/out, parking, concierge ...) Gorgeous environment (inside and out) at the hotel. I've been spoiled here!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Key West”
Reviews.Author: MarleneD
Reviews.Content: Simple gorgeous! Hidden away from the center of town but close enough to get to all the action. My husband and I had a wonderfully relaxing time. The resort is beautiful, the staff attentive, and the room perfectly designed. We definitely look forward to visiting several times a year and referring our friends!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Key West”
Reviews.Author: emurphy00
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina is by far the nicest hotel on Key West. The rooms are newly renovated and comfortable and the hotel has the largest and best private beach on the island. My boyfriend and I just returned from a week in Key West and the Casa Marina is what made our trip really special. It's perfectly located - far enough away from Duval St. that you aren't bothered by the party animal fray but close enough that you can enjoy a nice dinner and stroll back to the property. The beach is what really sets it apart. It's beautiful and the staff is remarkably attentive. They bring around free water, a frozen cocktail and ice pops everyday to cool you down. There are almost hammocks along the beach so you can lay down and relax and listen to the waves.The Sun Sun restaurant is affordable and serves fresh light food - which is hard to come by on the island. Overall, the staff was warm, friendly, polite and very hospitable. Overall, I would definitley go back and if you are looking to save some money on a beach vacation Key West is a great place to go and the Casa Marina is the place to stay. Oh - if you are thinking about upgrading to a beach front room - do it and request a room on the ground level. You'll have a little patio where you can watch the sunrise and sunset.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Views and Resort - Expensive add on fees”
Reviews.Author: SuaveShell
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina resort the last two days of our Key West trip (Fri/Sat). The first two nights we stayed on Duval street, so we wanted to get a way and see the beach. For those of you that don't know, Key West only has a few beaches, and they are mainly on the south side of the island. Casa's beach is beautiful. You could swim in it if you want but with many Atlantic beaches (aside from the Bahamas and Miami beach), they are a little rougher and rockier. It is large as is the resort. There are many palm trees and many piers to go out on. A great way to see the sun rise and sun set. This is the type of place you see post cards made from. There are free hammocks and lounge chairs for those who just want to sit on the beach and soak up the sun. Great for those notherners who come here in December. Like many places in Key West, it is a potpourri of different ethnic groups which is nice and refreshing. The hotel itself is an old hotel but very modern and pretty. The rooms are a decent size with very modern decor, even in the bathroom. I highly suggest a ocean view as it is perfect (other then the palm trees which seem to be in the way of many good pictures). There is a boat (jet ski, paddle boat, etc) rental right on site. There is a spa here as well which we did not use. Many ballrooms for those who want to have private functions here (seems like a very nice place for a wedding). The staff was very nice and always were opening doors for you and greeting you. Also the restaurant here served pretty good food be be forewarned, it is outside dining only, so it can get chilly. On to the complaints, and there weren't too many. FEES!!! $20 resort fee, $12/day parking, $12 internet (and don't think about using one of the two free internet computers in the lobby, not only are they 56k modem slow, but people will sit there and stare at you until you get off. And then general high priced items that you find at any hotel/resort. Lunch was a decent price, dinner seemed way too high for the options (which we didn't eat). Also, between 6:30am - 7:30am, the grounds crew was cleaning up the beach. While this may sound good, it was VERY VERY LOUD waking both of us. We like to sleep with the door open to hear the ocean but that still didn't matter. They had a guy driving a tractor around combing the beach (something that could be done by hand or with something electric that is not so loud. Also, a guy was trying to clean off the sand on the walkways with a leaf blower. Again, very loud, right outside our window, and something a broom would have done a much better job at. However, the good definitely out weighed the bad and then some. Many have said that Duval street is still walkable, but I'd stay its at least a mile to the south end, then another .5 mi to get to where the action is so a cab would be a better idea cause parking isn't really realistic on Duval. And there are cabs waiting outside the hotel 24/7. We booked on the hotel website which had a special of $50 credit for each two days you stayed which was nice as was our stay! Could have been closer to the action but with two pools and a nice beach, this is the place you come to relax at as the action of Duval is not too far away.

Reviews.Title: “Phenominal Resort”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinegirl0509
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Casa Marina Resort in early December. Having stayed at the resort frequently in the past and most recently during their renovations I can report the resort has transcended from nice place to stay to phenominal vacation getaway. Between the landscaping, two pools, restaurant and the added benefit of having their sister property the Reach Resort only a block away, the Casa has it all. The room was cleaned promptly and thoroughly each day. The restaurant staff couldn't have been more efficient. The front office staff was the highlight of my stay. Between Maria, Jeff, Don, Carla, Patrick and EJ they ensured I had everything I needed. If you want to choose a resort where you can lay on a beach, listen to the waves crash against the shore and have everything you need taken care of, the Casa Marina is the place for you

Reviews.Title: “problems with the resort”
Reviews.Author: sweber81
Reviews.Content: If you got your fill of flock of seagulls during the 80s, then don't have breakfast at the hotel. My husband and I decided to enjoy a beautiful morning by having breakfast at the hotel restaurant outside at one of their tables. After getting my food, I promptly was attacked by seagulls which literally were standing on my plate eating my eggs. Also, when my husband turned his head they grabbed a croissant right off the plate. After contacting management regarding the problem, we were informed that it happens often. We were not warned of this prior to being seated outside. Further after moving to the inside dinning area, our waiter brought dishes from outside which had been landed on by the seagulls for us to use to eat. DISGUSTING!!!! Other problems with the hotel include dirty bathtub and clogged drains.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: Travis__33
Reviews.Content: We went to Key West for a friend of ours' wedding and decided to stay at the Casa Marina. We hadn't been there since back in 2003, before they had finished remodeling the resort, and were curious to see what they'd done. The service had been extraordinary on our previous visit and was nothing less than perfect this time. The staff have been well versed in going above and beyond for their guests and anticipated our every need. We were very impressed with the upgrades they have made, the flat screen tv's, the beds were super comfortable, the amenities were luxurious and the decor was modern yet very comforting. We would definitely recommend this resort to anyone visiting Key West!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay”
Reviews.Author: firstaf
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Casa Marina December 1 through 4. The resort itself is on the south eastern Atlantic side of Key West. The resort's main building was built in the 20s and is beautiful. The resort staff was always attentive and friendly. Our room was located in the newer section of the resort. It was spacious and well equiped with many high end features. The resort grounds and beach area were keep well manicured and clean. There are hammocks along the beach area between the palm trees that I could have spent the entire day in. The hotel resturant served a really nice breakfast either on the patio or inside if you preferred. There is also a bar and a snack bar out between the two pools. While you are around the pool and beach area the hotel staff checks on you to see if you need more towels or even cool moist hand towels and pop cicles when it was warm. Duval Street and most of the attractions were an easy 15 minute walk from the resort and if you didn't fill like walking there were always taxis standing buy and the resort had bicycle and scooter rentals. We truly enjoyed our stay and plan on returning.

Reviews.Title: “Hammocks, Palm trees, cocktails, and a killa Beach”
Reviews.Author: ThePunChicago
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay, very affordable through hotels.com. Staff, beds, rooms, beach, food, drinks, and hammock made me feel all warm and fuzzy inside. We plan on staying there again and again!! Great modern design with classic Arch, perfect mix of Key West tradtions, modern luxury, and relaxation. Bravo!!!!! A+++++ In fact I had a better stay here than I did at the Ritz Carlton in South Beach the week before.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise Destination with the BEST Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: DEJArtist
Reviews.Content: Our daughter's wedding reception was held at the Casa Marina Resort in Key West, Saturday, November 22, 5 - 11 pm. It was "over the top"! We also stayed for one week at this wonderful exceptional resort where customer service reined supreme. Jim Short was nothing but exceptional dealing with all the reception needs: appetizers ocean side with steel drum music and cocktails, the food and table settings at the reception were wonderul, the staff was marvelous. Jim assisted us with many choices about other vendors, DJs, florists, etc. He was a great resource and we used him and his excellent advice. Patrick Anello, Jeff Sanders, MJ Maceri, plus many other staff at the front desk were terrific help with any question or concern. We had no concerns except the usual...where to eat, entertainment, storage for wedding supplies, etc. The bellmen and women, Jamie Cox, Tamara Riedi, Manny, Brian, Mert, etc. were always friendly and willing to help in anyway. They were most gracious too. The wait staff, Aline and Fadi to mention a few, were willing to work hard to keep us happy. Poolside or oceanside you were spoiled rotten by everyone, just like inside the Casa Marina. The customer service was infectious from everyone! Room service was the same; everyone wanted to make sure you were happy and well cared for and we were. All of our guests were pleased with their accomodations as well as ourselves. And there could be no perfect place than the Casa for a wedding reception or wedding. We were so totally pleased, we are booking our next visit now. Give the Casa Marina a try as you will not be disappointed for the quality of services rendered. Obviously it felt like home because it was easy to have conversation with any employee if you wanted. We did and we got to know so many as we truly liked them all. I cannot wait to go back and see them again, not to mention the spectacular grounds. It is paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Could not recomend to friends”
Reviews.Author: uwomba
Reviews.Content: We are in a peculiar place because although we can't recommend Casa Marina to friends we may go back. I booked an Ocean Vista Suite and carefully read what that means. This is from their website: "Ocean View Suites feature your own private balcony, either directly on the beach, or overlooking the tropical pools with the beach just beyond." I also booked the bread and breakfast package. We arrived and you cannot see the ocean from the room. If you go out on the balcony and take turns peering around the corner through the trees you can see the ocean. When I asked the bellman about this he said "Our policy is to describe the view from the balconies" This in my opinion is deceptive and I told him so. We requested a crib when we made the reservation and I am happy to report that they don't charge extra. Internet is $12 per day which annoys me. Why is it that if you stay in a Motel 6 for $39 you get free internet but you stay at a $300 hotel in it is extra? (I'm not criticizing just Casa Marina here...the George V did it to me in Paris) When I checked in, I asked if the crib was in the room and they said no but we see it here on the request. So why wasn't it in the room? They said it would be up in 5 minutes. I had a tired baby and said so. Thirty minutes later and after requesting to come and get it myself and being told rudely by an operator named "Alexis" that I wasn't allowed to go where they kept them, it arrived. The hotel website doesn't market itself to families with toddlers and justifiably as the pools are too deep for a toddler to go in so think about that if you have small children. There is however, a delightful little paddle area in the ocean that my 2 year old loved. The worst part was the food. DO NOT EAT HERE! Have I made myself clear? We had been specifically warned that the food was bad but we aren't particularly picky if we aren't out for a nice meal. I had mussels and my wife had gnochhi our first night. I was actually worried I was going to get sick from mine and so ate less than half. the sauce they came in was bland. The gnocchi was just tasteless. The next morning we had breakfast. My wife liked her omelette from the buffet well enough. I had Huevos Rancheros which Ihtought was impossible to screw up...the tortilla must have been found in an old pirate stash it ws so dry and hard. The next day I had eggs sunnyside and they were cooked hard. The third day I decided to have the omelette guy cook them and still had to demand he stopped cooking them when he thought they were not ready...they were just over cooked. And the toast was cold and the butter frozen...yuck. The grounds are very nice and it has its own beach which is the reason we may possibly stay there again. We certainly won't get the breakfast package and we won't pay extra for an "ocean view" suite. So although we may go back we can't recomend this place to friends as they may have the same problems we had and then our credulity is shot. Key West is a blast though!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay could not have been any better”
Reviews.Author: thedoms
Reviews.Content: We used a website called What a Hotel/lorraine Travel & paid more to get potentioal upgrades. I thought it wouldn't happen, but we received an upgraded room (a perfect oceanside room that opened to a patio at the pool - - -room 194), free breakfast buffet (enchanting waffles, yummy parfaits), and a late checkout our last day.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jewels63
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about booking because we were with another couple and I was making the arrangements. I would hate to ruin someone else's vacation! We were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The staff was attentive, hotel was beautiful (and clean) and room (we had a suite) was beautifully furnished, balcony was 50' from the ocean and a beautiful beach. Whether on the beach catching some sun or at a table eating a meal, the staff was always there to be sure we had everything we needed. Beaches are hard to come by in Key West so be sure to select a hotel that has a beach if you are interested in sunning and putting your toes in the sand! The beach had beautiful white sand and recreational opportunities like parasailing, sailing, jet skis, snorkeling, etc. I will be staying here again on a return trip. I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Service”
Reviews.Author: Ling888
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, the check in computer system was down. In the next 2 hours, I went back to the desk asking to check in 2 other times. The lady kept saying that the computer system was down and would call me on my cell phone when the system is fixed. Me and a few others kept waiting until someone told me that we could have checked in manually!! When I told the same lady that I would like to check in manually, she knew exactly what to do. She just didn't want to do it. It's demeaning to pay this kind of money and be treated this way. On my way back to the airport, the hotel said that it would have shuttle to take us to the airport. Because of the conference, it would have a shuttle ones every 15 minutes. I waited for 30 minutes and still didn't see the shuttle. I had to ask them to call for a taxi. The taxi arrived in less then 2 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Off-season delight!”
Reviews.Author: FeinschmeckerNyc
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate to get an excellent rate for a mid-November getaway. .Upscale look and feel, low-key ambiance in a great location. Yes, you have to walk or bike to town, but we're New Yorkers. Not a problem. (Ten minutes to Duval Street) Exceptionally friendly staff, without being obsequious. Nespresso machine a big plus in the room. Hotel attracts lots of Europeans, otherwise wide range of ages. The view from the pool to the beach is wonderful. Insist on an oceanfront view, although you might, as we did, get a room with windows that don't open. Which wasn't as big a problem as you might think, as we spent most of our time outdoors. Completely relaxing resort. Nice place. Oh and go to Sandy's Cafe for the cuban sandwiches.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy”
Reviews.Author: coolio
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 night earlier this week for a crazy rate of $149 for a 1 bed suite. For Key West this is very good. We arrived around 5pm due to car rental issues in Miami. We found it easily enough, and checkin (Mohammed) was very polite and made great conversation. The room was very nice, gorgeous bedroom, bathroom (no tub) that was the best I had seen and a separate lounge/dining area. We took a couple of beers down to the beach and enjoyed the privacy and 2 piers they have. The grounds are very nice and you always feel like you're staying somewhere special. However, a few niggles. We tipped the cleaner but the conditoner was not replaced, nor was the coffee or milk. We had to call down for this, and only the coffee and milk turned up. Usually when we tip in hotels, we get these things in abundance. Also, one day we were walking upto the main entrance, and a luggage cart came rolling towards us pretty quickly. The bellman had let go of it at a car he was loading. Instead of coming after it, he just stood there and watched as the cart came hurtling towards my partner who had to grab it in order to avert it hitting a car, and was pulled a few metres by it. No-one seemed particular grateful or apologetic, which irriated me a bit. The in room book which usually gives details on facilitieshad nothing and just said 'call XXXX' which wasn;t much help. Apparantly there were 2 hot tubs although we never found them, or found where to get towels for the pool. Apart from the above issues, the room and the hotel in general was pretty stunning enough for me to forgive the niggles. The hotel is literally a short stagger from Duval Street. I thought we'd have to catch a cab but from a Brit who is used to a walk back from the pub,it was perfect, literally 8-10mins stagger.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Great Staff and wonderful views of the sunset”
Reviews.Author: wipledale
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a conference my husband was attending and just loved it! The staff is excellent and very knowledgeable. I would stay again. 2 very nice pools....

Reviews.Title: “I Love the Casa Staff...”
Reviews.Author: DSRH
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Casa Marina in Key West for the last 10 years. They recently went though a major renovation and everything is like new. When I come to Key West there is only one place I stay, the Casa Marina. They are on the quiet end of the island but close to anything you want to see. In fact this historic property has most anything you need without leaving! My advice? Get a bike or moped and see town when you want and return to the Casa to relax. The absolute best part of the Casa Marina is the staff. This is the reason I come back year after year. These people know how to take care of you and it is cool to see the same smiling faces year after year. From my favorite doorman to my favorite manager Maria I never want to leave at the end of my stay. In fact I have to quit writing now and book my next trip. See ya down the road. Andrew

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: stiflerIRL
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an amazing setting. Key west is an amazing place. The hotel was exceptionally clean, the pool area and pool were cleaned every morning and it gave me one of the best experiences of my life, the most amazing sun rise I have and probable will ever see. Apart from breakfast the food her was below average but from what I hear almost all hotels in key west are like this, so I advise you go somewhere else to eat during the day. There is a private beach, which is small but very nice. Key west itself is very european in its style and entertainment, but with a little extra. My girlfriend has said its was by far the best place she has ever been to in her life I hope this review is helpful.

Reviews.Title: “A place to be spoiled”
Reviews.Author: CtLucky
Reviews.Content: We attended an off site meeting with my husband's company and were impressed from the moment we entered the lobby. The staff was friendly and professional. We especially enjoyed being spoiled on the beach and by the pool by Darrell as well as the expert mixologist, Jan, at the poolside bar. Her "Janerita's" were the best! Food service was also good from Latoya. All in all, this was an extremely relaxing and pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “lindisimo!! very cozy!”
Reviews.Author: normalvarez
Reviews.Content: the hotel has been remodel in a very minimalist, neutral style, it is very nice, specially the people who works there, front desk, swimming pool, reception, all of them. The room was very small for my taste, guess we had bad luck,given the fact that arrived when the annual meeting of J. Buffet fans had place there,a very noisy experience,I did not look for. All in all, the hotel is great, not the fans, very thoughless people.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: blondie2501
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 2 weeks in Key West Florida. What a lovely experience this hotel was, and we have been 5 times previously and stayed in all kinds of different hotels. The Casa Marina is the best we have stayed in and that includes Pier Resort which is supposed to be the top. This was absolute luxury, wonderful staff and service, lots of little extras i.e. free drinks or ice lollies brought round at regular intervals whilst using the pools or private beach, free use of computers in lobby, free ipod charging in rooms, the food and bars were expensive by Key West standards, but it's only a 10 minute walk into key west town itself where it is plentiful and cheap, my only complaint is having to pay for parking - but - on the other hand the hotel is surrounded by roads with plentiful free parking so not a great problem just rather unusual for a top hotel. I would recommend to anyone who wanted something a lot more than a holiday inn type hotel but for very little extra price (approx $30 per night more) - very good value for money, I will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: dede3
Reviews.Content: The resort was above my expectations. The staff is extremely helpful and professional. This is the only place I will stay in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could try harder”
Reviews.Author: Jason.Charity
Reviews.Content: We chose the Casa Marina because of it's beach location and price, which looked reasonable for a solid 4* hotel. Good points first: The hotel (particularly the old building) is lovely, although the newer building looks from the back like a block of flats. Not particularly great. The beach was great (by Key West standards) and is cleaned every morning; and we had no problems getting sun beds. They also serve complimentary drinks mid-morning, and cold towels in the afternoon, which is a nice touch. Staff generally very professional and friendly, although non memorable. Room (Ocean Vista Room) was of generous size with perfect ocean views. The room had windows/patio doors to two aspects and although the room was decorated in muted colours, it worked well for the hotel and location. Things they need to work on: We arrvied at the hotel after 14 hours travelling. Tired and slightly disorientated, the least I expected was to be shown to my room. The receptionist was more interested in "processing" us than ensuring we were welcomed. We took directions from her... got lost and then eventually found the room. A poor start, I thought. The room was not serviced daily to an acceptable standard. From what I could see, the bed was made and towels changed, but no real dusting, floor cleaning, etc. Such that by the last day, the room was dirty. And one day they just "forgot" to even make the beds. The power to Key West went off on our last day. The hotel had back-up generators which powered key lights. To their credit, they kept the kitchen open and served food from the outside restaurant. The chef needs a medel for working in the dark! No, to start with, they had some lights on at the restaurant, but then decided to turn them off, with about 40 people eating. Luckily for the two people on reception, the ENTIRE reception was illuminated. Now, I get that power sometimes goes off, but I don't accept that management cannot be organised enough to ensure a supply of candels and keeping lights on in areas where most guest reside. Thankfully, immediately after dinner the lights came back on so we went into town! They seem to have surcharges for EVERYTHING, which turns what, on the surface, look like a reasonable hotel, into something more expensive. To contrast, after KW we headed for Miami and stayed at the 5* The Raliegh. The cost was the same. Be careful, as they add on charges for use of the beach, parking, etc, etc... Overall, we did enjoin the Casa Marina but it lacked the polish that I expected. I realise that this is not a 5* hotel but it scored poorly on too many fronts, even for a good 4* hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: sunnyRI
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon. We were upgraded for free to an ocean view. The lobby to the pool, beach, and service was excellent. The rooms were kept very clean and staff was helpful. We lost an item, left a message, and the item was bought to our room moments later. The only complaint we have is that they additional taxes and fees are not disclosed upfront, so in the end our total bill was more than what was quoted on the phone. Despite this, we plan to return!! It was beautiful and would not have to leave resort if you did not want to.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Experience... Recommend to Everyone!”
Reviews.Author: gurucastano
Reviews.Content: We had an unbelievable experience. Everyone was incredibly professional and accommodating. The hotel was above and beyond. The food was great, the service was awesome, and the location was excellent. I recommend the rosemary chicken and please order their margaritas by the beach or pool side. Jeff at the water sports area was so helpful. He can help you with reserving anything from our scuba diving to a sunset ride on a catamaran. This was definitely, one of our best vacations. Thank You Casa Marina!

Reviews.Title: “1920's charm in a modern, well appointed resort”
Reviews.Author: Caymus59
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had our Commitment Ceremony on the beach at Casa Marina with 35 friends and family. Everyone stayed at the resort. We arrived early and spent 4 nights and 5 days. The hotel and catering staff, especially Kaitlin Wright, was absolutely fantastic. They even kept the rain at bay until 10:45 PM!! Everyone loved their stay at the resort and could tell what a fantastic job the catering staff did for our event. We stayed at Casa Marina twice before our event (June and Sep 2008) and will definitely be back. The resort is away from all of the noise and activity on Duval St (but walkable). It is closest to the beaches for a long walk and is just doors down from Louie's Backyard. Be sure to get an Ocean Vista Room on the beach...well worth it. It's great for peace and relaxation but close enough to all that Old Town has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely relaxing and private beach pampering!”
Reviews.Author: Poseidon21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to Key West for just the weekend. We had some idea from the pictures online of the hotel, but were blown away by the wonderful lobby decoration (we both love modern furniture with a very inviting feel). Our bags were taken to our room for us as we immediately wanted to see the pool deck area and the private beach. We didn't want to go anywhere the first night but stay at hotel, relax in the pool, watch the sunset, and swing in a hammock. The room was large and open for a standard room. Nicely decorated. The only complaint in the room was that the bathroom sink faucet was on the side of sink instead of in front (just wasn't used to that positioning). After a long day of snorkling, boating, and walking up Duval St...we admit, we couldn't wait to just get back to the hotel and relax by the poolside and have a Mai Tai. I would highly recommend this hotel and I plan to make this my permanent hotel of choice when I revisit Key West.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place to be”
Reviews.Author: Miri1976
Reviews.Content: With the moment we arrived our dream started. Entering the reception hall which is very elegant in a colonial style interiored, nice and competent people will warmly welcome you at the front desk. The rooms are also very comfortable and - what it extremely important for visitors like us who looked desperatedly for a q u i et location - the hotel is really quiet. In comparison to other high standart hotels, casa marina is right at the oceanfront without a noisy streat inbetween the hotel and the beach. We as a loving couple felt very "at home" and could relax completely after traveling through the USA (NYC, DC, Miami, etc) Finally, we would like to mention one outstanding employee which did not only served us perfectly but also is a perfect embassador for the American country and its people. Patric, working at the front desk, always had an open ear for our wishes and needs. At the same time he explained us a lot about the USA, its culture and people. We really appreciate meeting such a kind person at a front desk of a hotel. In sum, we have been tremendously happy with our stay and would recommend this location to everybody! Thank you PATRIC, Thank you CASA MARINA. We will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “I"m glad I walked in”
Reviews.Author: keywestbandit
Reviews.Content: to be fair i must first set the stage,years ago (2001-2002) i was assigned to the key west area for work. fellow co worker suggested not to stay at the casa marina due to different issues. in sept of 2008, i walked in the casa marina to make inquires on the resort. from the moment i walked in i was impressed, the front doorman and valet parker were pleasant and extremely helpful. the fresh scent and decor of the front lobby/reception center was amazing. i was greeted with a great smile and a desire to help me. i requested information on the resort and proceeded to share my fear of what i had be told by fellow co-worker. i was assure by the front desk shift manager that the resort has the best interest of all their guests. being that i'm staying on an average of 3 days a week in key west, i decided the next time to stay at the casa marina. since then!!! i haven't stay any place else, the room are clean, modern and with great amenities ,the beach area and the services is incredible. from jet skies to scooters you name it "if you can do it in the keys they have it" the views are great at sunrise and sunset. best of all are the people in the staff. i have yet to get a no! or maybe! the staff is incredible from the pool attendant,room service, front desk to the groundkeepers. the gym is huge!!!!!!! with great equipment better than any gym in key west .since that first day in mid sept my co-workers and myself have stayed approx 15 days. i have yet to hear a complaint or an issues from any one. i will recomend the resort with my eyes close trust me i have stay in key west my share of nights. i give special kudos to that shift manager (maria bennet) for convincing me to stay one night...... ...................for that matter the entire staff at the casa marina deserves kudos

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a resort - stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Patt_Dana
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel appeared nice at first glance, the problems were ongoing. But, first the positives, the hotels common areas were lovely and the pool was great. Had a small, but descent beach and a bar/grill next to the pool for convenience. The food and drinks were extremely pricey, but thats to be expected and its helpful to pickup a few snacks before arriving. Now the negatives - This is not a resort by any real defintion - the $20 resort fee is just a way to extract extra money for nothing. For all they say was included in the resort fee, we never saw - Never offerred cool towels, never saw any additional activities other than fee rental for motorized water equipment (not a "resort" fee type amenitiy). Next, the walls are paper thin and the hotel is extremely noisy all night long. Ask for a room in the newer addition or the center of the hotel. We were placed at the end of the hotel next to the stairwell and were awakened every 30 minutes or so with loud slamming noises until we asked to be moved at 4:00 am. The staff were not helpful, nor empathetic to the situation. Once moved, we finally went to sleep only to be woken very early with the noise of coversations in the next room. We could hear them all morning (and I don't think they were being that loud). As others have stated, there isn't much around for meals - Only one restuarant we found a block or so away. You'll need to walk a few blocks or more for anything other than the hotel grill or room service and it's a good 2 mile walk from the pier at Duvall Street. Be wary of parking if you drive and look for off street parking. The hotel did not tell us this, but we found it on our own. It's an additional $20 per day for valet or $12 to self-park across the street, but we parked on the street, next to the hotel for no charge. Look for this if you choose to come. With the alleged "resort" fee of $20 + parking if you drive (and the added taxes to both) that can add quite a bit extra to your hotel bill. The Concerige was little help in giving us information on sight-seeing and various attractions. After getting little information at the hotel, we struck up a conversation at a restuarant for breakfast and found out everything we wanted to know from the waitress there - Thank you IHOP for the great service and staff! If we had not prepaid, we would have checked out after the first night, but after reading the reviews, I felt confident booking for the three nights we planned on being there.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Busterluv
Reviews.Content: We originally booked at the Reach Resort and it was OK but nothing compared to Casa Marina. The Reach has this awful generator on its rooftop that was deafening at night and ruined the outdoor beach tranquility. I had booked a beach massage at their sister hotel the Casa Marina and asked if we could move there for the rest of our stay. They were so accomodating and they upgraded us to a suite that was so beautiful. The setting was perfect, the restaurant great, from doorman to bartender, I could find nothing wrong here. Beautiful beach and pools. Will only stay here if we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: urchicagogrl
Reviews.Content: My Boyfriend and I went to key west and stayed at for 3 days and 2 nights. Was suppose to be for 4 days and 3 nights however we had to get evacuated for hurricane Ike. Really enjoyed our stay. The balconies were alright wasn't blocked off completely from neighbors. I would recommend it for couples to family. Dining at the restaurant for dinner was alright, not to many choices. Highly recommending renting a bike or a scooter while staying in the key west, best way to travel around

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina gone south”
Reviews.Author: travelswithjimmy
Reviews.Content: You can find better at any Motel in Key West. This Luxury Hotel has fallen far below those standards and is not even at the level of a " good Motel" Now.
