Room service did not clean the room, No restraunt in the hotel and the finger food would be better left to a walk to Duval street, of course for a price unless you care to walk the three miles and back or take a cab for $ 10 each way. Pool bar ran out of beer! Awake at 5:30 each morning as the staff prepare for their current convention breakfast......? Too bad for you if yoyu want to sleep to 8am? DSL of course for a price! Or you can wait in line for an email, I was told by the desk clerk on Satruday that if I wanted a newspaper, I would need to walk my quarters to the local machine down the street, made me feel like a street urchin, not a customer paying over $ 200 per day for my stay....When I left I told them I had a terrible stay and they did not even resond in any way! I would definately not recommend this Hotel for any Honeymooners, we met a few at the pool bar who wished they had stayed somewhere else. If you want the Key West experiance, I would recommend a cruise, then you have the accomidations of the ship and it would be much more affordable!

Reviews.Title: “Not what it used to be!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SFResident1
Reviews.Content: My family has been staying at the Casa Marina hotel since the 70's. My husband and I just recently visited the island for a long weekend after not visiting Key West for 16 years. I was very disappointed at the lobby and room decor. I am not opposed to modern but it really does not fit in with the Key West style. The air conditioner was not working properly in our room. It was blowing out warm air. Front desk said the whole hotel was experiencing a problem with A/C. I asked three guests who said they did not have a problem with their A/C. I complained to front desk and they moved us to another part of the hotel in an upgraded room. That room's A/C was also very warm and not what we set the tempature to. We waited a few hours. It was totally unacceptable. They moved us to the Reach Hotel(their sister hotel) which was not as nice, but at least the room's A/C was working properly. I will not be back and will go to the Pier House from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Casa Marina Hotel Key Largo”
Reviews.Author: MProla
Reviews.Content: We spent a couple of days at the Casa Marina Resort just before Hurricane Ike. Upon arrival we were graciously greeted by the staff and offered the choice of valet or self-parking. After prompt & courteous check-in we were escorted to our room with a brief tour by one of the staff members. The pools are beautiful!! There are hammocks right on the beach where you can lay and relax. I enjoyed that late evening, a wonderful way to watch the stars. The pool attendants were great, laying out towels on the lounge chairs, bringing drinks and even when we did not want a drink he came back with ice water, complimentary!! What a pleasant surprise. Later I went to the beach he bought us 2 lounge chairs, towels & a table!! My only regret is that I didn't have time for a spa treatment!!! The evening before we were planning to leave there was a mandatory evacuation of guests. The staff was very apologetic and sympathetic to everyones needs. They could not do enough to accomodate all the guests that I saw at the desk off and on during the evening. Many guests were using the free internet to track Ike and the hotel placed a large map and updated news in the lobby. Wedding parties were permitted to stay a bit longer to evacuate with residents, realizing this was the event of a lifetime, the resort bent over backwards to accomodate. We hope to go back again. The night life is GREAT! Taxi service outside your door. I have traveled all over and this was the best vacation ever!! OH-YES--I loved the bathroom products "CLEAR" and bought plenty to bring home --if you like lemon scent :-) In fact I left a package and MJ made sure it was sent--THANKS MJ!!

Reviews.Title: “Just great!!!”
Reviews.Author: K0libri
Reviews.Content: We (2 adults,1child) spent four nights at Casa Marina on our roundtrip through Florida. Casa Marina was one of our best hotels we had during our stay in the United States. The location directly on the beach just a few minutes away from the Duval Street, the excellent service, the newly renovated rooms, the perfect cleanliness made our stay at Key West a special one. Our daughter is still talking about the hammocks on the beach, she liked best. We are already looking forward to our next stay at this beautiful resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel although lacking some niceties”
Reviews.Author: RayNJ08
Reviews.Content: I booked a family 65th Surprise Birthday Celebration at the Casa Marina by contacting the property directly. The booking agent was very nice and extremely helpful in room choice options, unfortunately however, many of the comments and requests initially made were not followed through to my check-in. It was remedied but I thiink the overall total would have been less if I had taken the original room option "I" had chosen. The hotel is ABSOLUTELY beautiful....on the ocean and the physical property itself. The check-in process, although quick, did leave me with some concerns. I have stayed at MANY hotels and if arriving early the check-in staff has always worked with me to provide a place to freshen up, shower, and change OR get me into a room that was available, not the original room placed on my reservation. This hotel did not get me in early so I had to check every 30 minutes to assess availability. I acknowledged the fact the hotel does stipulate a 4p check-in but it only has a changing room, not a shower. This is also an inconvenience when checking out because you need to check out by 11a and without a shower, even in the health club facilities, you cannot utilize the property unless you want to get on the plane sticky, smelly from sun tan lotion...etc. I suggest the site look into all of the check-in practices/ "other than room" shower facilities. PROs: 1) Property, bell staff, doorman, waitresses, concierge, complimentary computer access in lobby only if you need to take a quick look as MANY people are awaiting to use some times. 2) Pool staff periodic walking around with complimentary watermelon, popscicles, and "small " drink samples. CONs: 1. Check-In process and willing to work with guests that arrive earier than check-in or want later check-out. 2. NO COMPLIMENTARY WIRELESS ACCESS. I have not stayed in a hotel or guest house in quite a few years that does not offer. 3. Onsite restaurant/pool bar is EXTREMELY expensive and drinks are watered down. NOT worth the price. 3) Location is a bit remote if you are looking to be in life of it all down on DUVAL. It's a 35-40 minute walk to get from hotel to Mallory Square area. My family did it daily, however, needed to take a taxi a few times...especially if dressing up nicely for dinner. 4) No whirlpool/hot tub on property. Overall- I would stay again if had family with me due to the property being right on ocean. This is a rarity for Key West and people do like the ocean. However, when traveling alone or if being on the ocean is NOT a requirement there are MANY MANY MANY other Guest Houses on Key West that do offer all the conveniences and luxuries I require and it's a more personable experience. TRY them...it's such a lovely time.

Reviews.Title: “the absolute best!!!”
Reviews.Author: beachbum9308
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed at the casa with some family and friends for our small wedding at Ft. Zachary Taylor (which by the way has an amazing beach, worth checking out!) The service is excellent! Patrick and M.J. at the front desk were both very sweet, upon learning about our wedding/honeymoon, we got upgraded to a bigger room with a huge balcony, they even gave us two comp. drinks at the bar! Patrick really went above and beyond! Robin at the sun-sun bar was awesome as well, she gave great recomendations for places to eat, even sent a bottle of champagne to our room on our wedding night! Even though we got evacuated due to IKE, we had the best time at the casa. Since there are two pools they are never too crowded, pool boys come by often to offer cold towels, drinks, watermelon and even popsicles! Also the pools are open all night which was a lot of fun. The private beach is so relaxing with hammocks and the pier to walk out on. Room was brand new and so clean, excellent maid service! Food is a little expensive, but that is a given. We walked to the cuban store (about a 5-10 min. walk) to get stuff to make sandwhiches to take to the pool to save money (would recommend!!) Duval St. is about a 15-20 min. walk so pack comfy shoes! I've read a lot of complaints about this but the walk isn't bad, we had fun seeing everything (you see a lot more walking!) But a cab ride is $7 if walking isn't your thing. There is an Italian restaurant called "Salute" right next to resort by Higgs Beach, literally a 5 min. walk and had great food and service. Overall everyone was so sweet and accamodating and we won't stay anywhere else but here when we come back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great ocean views, poor front of house service.”
Reviews.Author: TheBearsAway
Reviews.Content: The outdoor areas and poolside at this hotel were great and the staff very attentive. rooms were satisfactory but if you are going to book insist on a room in the original part of the hotel as the more recently constructed extension where we were situated was 'motel like'. The front of house check in team really let the place down for us and need training in how to deal with guests professionally particularly as this resort places itself at the higher end of the market.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Travellergirl75
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a fantastic time at Casa Marina. We travelled from Miami on the 29th August but due to the threat of hurricane Ike called the Hotel before we set off. I was concerned about the storms but the hotel were very helpful and understanding and offered to refund our deposit if we chose not to travel to the Keys. We decided to brave the weather and we are pleased that we did. The resort was perfect for our needs, the pool area was great and we also had the option to relax on the beach. The rooms were large, they bed was huge, we loved the coffee machine and they had some great films on the in room entertainment. I would have given the resort 5 stars but they lost a point due to the amount of chidren in and around the pool area. They made made my few days away less relaxing than I would have liked. There are two pools so it is a shame that one isn't dedicated to families and the other to those who want a more peaceful break.Also when we arrived the glass on the balcony was dirty and there were cigarette butts wedged in the glass. When I reported the problem the glass was cleaned but the fag butt remained !! Top Tip for dinner - 915 on Duval Street ( amazing staff and high quality food ). Worse place for dinner - Grand Union Cafe ( they sat us at the worse table at the back of the patio , even though better tables were sitting empty, the food was bland , if you get a voucher for a freebottle of wine - make sure you understand exactly what you have to order to get it before you order ! )

Reviews.Title: “Doing the Keys in Style”
Reviews.Author: Lucky_Lina
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Key West with my husband and 16 yr old, and 23 yr old daughters for March break. I selected the hotel purely because it was beachfront. Although the beach was not the best for actually swimming in (rocky) - it was still worth it to sun and frolick oceanfront. The hotel did not disappoint. It was luxurious and full of old world charm. It takes you back to a more glamorous time -- the architecture and landscape looks old Keys. Don't get me wrong -- it wasn't stuffy. It was a casual vacation spot. We all loved it. A nice 15 minute walk every evening into the busier parts of town was fine by us. Pleasant! The only drawback is that the food at the hotel is expensive and breakfast is overpriced. Unfortunately there isn't another eating spot within 5 minutes so we opted to eat the morning meal at the hotel (but grumbled about it). Great for families. Pool is great and staff are very friendly. Would love to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: nturtur
Reviews.Content: The casa marina is a fabulous place to stay, the service was fantastic, the rooms were nice and clean as well as a great view of the ocean, the tiki bar at the pools had wonderful service they would bring your drinks and food right to you at the pool or on the beach. The Pool attendants Mike and John are absolutely wonderful they will set you up on the beach with towels and chairs, bring you complimentary water, drink of the day from the bar, fresh fruit, popsicles, cold wet towels to cool off withâ€¦â€¦You really donâ€™t have to do much for yourself this place will pamper you! The price is reasonable too with 3 kids and a budget this was the most relaxed my husband and I have been for a long long time! We are planning a trip this spring to go back to the Casa Marina! We highly recommend this resort and will not stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Too much fun!”
Reviews.Author: omahakings
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Casa Marina for our niece's Key West a la Jimmy Buffett style beach wedding and everything was perfect. We spent much time around the beautiful pools being served by Joshua, who soon became like one of our family/group. The service was outstanding at the Casa and the rooms were beautiful, clean, and comfortable. Grandma Shirley enjoyed the personal attention when she came down for her morning breakfast buffet and everyone appreciated the comfy beds - fit for a king. It was easy to get transportation from the Casa to the downtown sites, so you have the best of both worlds. You are away from the commercial noise of downtown Key West being pampered by the Casa staff but you can still head down for the nightlife when you feel like it. Everything was great about this hotel. On the flight back home, we read the history of the Casa Marina and it was truly a lavish retreat for the affluent and famous. Thankfully, it has been refurbished so that we can all enjoy it. We'll definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facelift”
Reviews.Author: EandHEdinburgh
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in July, the first time we have been back for four years. During that time there have been some terrible reviews as the hotel has had it's facelift and we finally decided to return once the makeover was finished. We are pleased to report the hotel is much better than before and the money has been well spent. The rooms are excellent, we had a balcony overlooking the pools and sea and it was very spacious and very modern. There were a couple of design flaws, however, the aircon blew right onto your face as you lay in the bed so we had to turn it off during the night, and, as mentoned in other reviews, there are no doors to the shower so water gets all over the floor. All staff in the hotel were very helpful but the hotel is missing a restaurant for the evening. We took the hotel to be away from Duval Street but you have to return there in the evening for food (or phone out for a pizza). The breakfast was OK but a bit expensive but there is a great little bar connected to the shop that no-one seems to notice and it always has a special offer each evening. The gym is outstanding and it certainly has the best pool area in Key West. Despite the bad press from the past, the hotel is definitely back on track and we believe it is the best hotel in Key West and will definitely be returning again in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience... what a view!”
Reviews.Author: TinTinTraveler
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful resort. My wife and I enjoyed our anniversary by taking a trip down to Palm Beach and Key West. Luckily, we had perfect weather (with the exception of one day) despite the evacuation of the Keys due to Hurricane Fay; our trip to Key West started the day the evacuation was lifted. We have stayed at several Key West resorts, and this hotel is the nicest in Key West. It sports the only true beachfront experience in Key West, and has amazing views from oceanfront rooms as well as the common areas. Sitting at the outdoor bar was certainly our favorite experience. Jan the bartender was phenomenal... what a kind and fun woman, and she makes a mean cocktail! If you face the ocean from the bar, it reminds you of the commercials for Coronna.... you know the ones. I noted that on my stay, and when I showed a colleague some of the photos from the bar, she said the same thing without my coaxing. Absolutely wonderful. The food is casual, reasonably priced and tasty. We enjoyed our lunch there each day of the trip. Overall the hotel had excellent service. It was clean and enjoyable. While outside at the beach, cabana persons will set up umbrellas for you, get you towels, provide cool wet hand towels to refresh and cool off with as well as complimentary fresh cut fruit. While I would normally give it a top rating, I did have two slight complaints. The children at the pool can be a bit much. I do wish they would enforce some rules at times. My biggest complaint did not affect my rating though as it was not necessarily the fault of the Casa Marina. The hotel has a sister hotel called the Reach (a few blocks away), which my wife and I have stayed at in the past. We dined there one night at a relatively pricey (not outrageous but not cheap either) restaurant called the Strip House. I am aware this is a small and growing chain and do not know the exact relationship with the two hotels (they might lease the space, but might also split profits in some way with the hotel operators). I have to tell you, the food was exceptional and the service from the busboys was very good as well; however, our waitress was abysmal. Her name was Carol. I cannot tell you how angry we were as she ignored our table for lengthy periods. Most of our service came from the busboys (we'd call them over). The meal started with her attempting to upsell our wine, which she noted was only a few dollars more. When I looked at the price, I laughed becuase it was 66% higher in price. After declining, she seemed to become cold and rarely checked on us. This represented the worst table service I have had in years. I worked for tips when I was younger, and am very tolerant; but this woman really was horrible. Of course we got the typical bright smiling Carol as she presented the check in that typical pathetic bad waitron fashion attempting to garner a better tip. I left a reasonable tip only because I figured they might pool their tips and those poor busboys were working hard. Worst of all, I stepped out for a cigarette between courses and noticed this gem of a waitress chewing out one of the busboys that was actually working hard. Really disgusting. I rarely write complaints, but I couldn't help myself on this one. When we return to the Keys (we usually go once a year), I will walk out of that establishment if she is working. If she is, I promise I'll never eat in any Strip House again. Very sad, as the restaurant was fantastic but for good ol' Carol.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Casa”
Reviews.Author: heidibluebell
Reviews.Content: My family of 8 and I just returned from 6 days at the Casa Marina. We were scheduled to stay two additional nights, but the mandatory evacuation from Tropical Storm Fay cut the last two nights short. During this difficult time, the staff was very helpful keeping calm and courteous .... as all guests had to be evacuated from the resort. We found The rooms to be crisp and clean and we also enjoyed the espresso maker in the room. The view from our rooms were spectacular. The staff was extremely pleasant. especially LaToya out at the pool restaurant and bar. I would recommend the Casa Marina to almost anyone. We will definitely come back again. Heidi

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms, terrible restaurant”
Reviews.Author: MarieMontreal
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Casa marina Resort week of June 23rd for 4 nights. Great rates, had two connecting rooms. Hotel is freshly renovated and the rooms are quite nice. Pool area is beautiful as is the reception area. Beach area is not the best, but Key West is not known to have very nice beaches. Lots of seaweed in the water. Tried to rent a motorized paddle boat but they could not get it to work (kids were highly dissapointed). Only negative thing I can mention is the breakfast at the hotel. Staff was not the nicest. We had the buffet the first morning and when the bill arrived it was way more expensive than on the menu, only to be told that on Sundays it is the Grand Buffet (let me tell you nothing GRAND about it!). 127$ breakfast was definately not worth it. Try Camille's way better and way cheaper. We had Breakfast at the roof top for the same cost but at least breakfast there was outstanding. Overall good stay, restaurant staff left a negative feeling, might stay there again, however would explore other hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing trip”
Reviews.Author: canadiancountrygal
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing, no other words to describe it. The resort is beautiful, relaxing, clean....The staff right from the bellmen to the water sports couldn't be any nicer. They all were very friendly, very welcomming, and very much there to help with any questions. The pool and beach staff Bryan, Larry, Ryan, & Matt very nice very friendly. Great job guys. Key West watersports guys Jeff and Doug, you two were great, thank you both for everything the parasailing was amazing and something I will always remember. Staff at the Sun Sun Bar and Grill, amazing food amazing service...I have severe allergies and the chef was great. Natt, Jan, Robin and Will you guys are all great, again amazing service and amazing food. Latoya and Eric very nice and friendly always there to help. Nicky in the gift store, you are a doll. MJ and Patrick thank you for all your help and for answering all my questions. You all made this trip, a trip that I really enjoyed and one that I will always remember. Thank you again each and every one of you, you all added to my trip this was amazing and I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Way To Celebrate Your 25th”
Reviews.Author: kimcol1
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic way to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. From the terrific reception and assistance by Karla at the front desk the 8 nights were as magical as our first night 25 years ago. The surprise strawberries and champagne were a wonderful touch. The trip would not have been complete without the always smiling and helpful faces of Jan and Robin at the outdoor bar. Their advice on local activities and eating establishments were always a hit and never disappointing. In all of the trip the only down side (and this by no means put a damper on the trip) was the use of both pools by families with children. If I had to suggest a change it would be to make one pool for families with children and one for adults only. Again this was the best 8 day vacation we have ever taken and will definitely draw us back to Key West and the Casa Marina again. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: sgoebel
Reviews.Content: This resort is just gorgeous and the people we great and very helpful. I would like to especially thank Rebecca Atkins and Lobos for making our event run so smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Casa was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ksestokas
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I traveled down to Key West to investigate whether or not we wanted to book our wedding at the Casa Marina. From the beginning we felt a welcome and wonderful reception. Kaitlin Wright the catering manager made sure we had a fantastic hotel room, and surprised us with a make your own mojito kit! If you go to the pool bar, make sure you have Robin make you her FANTASTIC mango mojito. I cannot stress how delicious this was..so refreshing! The breakfast and lunch was great and the room service was so fast, which was a nice change cause i was expecting to have to wait for a while. Another thing that was sooo soo great was the fact that the bar outside that hotel stays open so late. My fiance and I got home late that night and Damon and RJ at the bar served us until we were ready to leave!! I'm talking 3 in the morning it was great! We decided to have our wedding there and can't wait to take advantage of everything that Casa Marina has to offer!!

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Pats021
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Key West and the Casa Marina is by far the best resort there. About half an hour's walk from the main part of town - but we liked that as you were slightly removed from the tackier side of Key West. (The shops are all pretty tacky). Rooms were pretty good - not overly luxurious but very comfortable. The food was excellent and, on the whole, the service was very good. On the beach massage is a must. As for restaurants in Key West you should definitely go to Seven Fish and Michael's - both excellent. It was very hot and humid in August ... perhaps not the best time of year to go. But we loved it nonetheless. Very chilled out and you could not ask for a more relaxing time.

Reviews.Title: “NIce&BADDD”
Reviews.Author: wpkimpel
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great NICE POOLS! Air conditioing did not work in room. Outdoor pool bar was HORRIBLE barmaid had personality of a drill sergant and was RUDE>

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: trained1
Reviews.Content: We spent the final 3 nights of our holiday at Casa Marina, and enjoyed it greatly. Highlights were the lovely scenic location, and excellent pools (fantastic in the evening) and the very comfortable rooms. The beds were excellent. In-room coffee making facilities were the best we've experienced. Hotel staff that we met were all friendly and helpful, especially Bree, who really went out of her way to assist us. Things that need improvement: Soundproofing between adjacent rooms (the connecting door seems to be the main problem as I heard nothing from the other adjoining room where there was a solid wall) More real vegetarian options needed in the menus - there was little other than salads (though this was a problem we experienced throughout our time in Florida)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Casa Marina in Key West”
Reviews.Author: LuLusKiss
Reviews.Content: We just spent a long weekend at the Casa Marina in Key West, Florida to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. Our travel agent had suggested the resort and we also had friends that have stayed there. It met all our expectations. The resort was beautiful. From the moment we arrived we felt like VIP's. Our room was clean and comfortable. We had a room with an ocean view which made it extra special. Having a private beach for everyone to enjoy was really nice. However, the thing we enjoyed the most out of our stay was the outside bar right by the pool. Jan & Robin (the bartenders) were spectacular. They made us feel right at home. They were funny, always ready to take your order and serve it with a smile. They made us feel like we were all old friends.! It made it extra special to sit down, have a drink and Relax! Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: catchick3
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 year old daughter and I stayed 4 nites at the Casa Marina. It was a beautiful place and you could tell they spent lots of time and money on their recent renovation. It was quite expensive for what you get, however. The staff was nice, but you had to drag information out of them. When we checked in, the desk clerk was nice, but when we got to our room, we realized, we didn't know where anything was (restaurant? breakfast times? where to go on property to find activities?, etc) Even though there is a binder with vague answers to most of those questions, we felt we were just left to figure things out as we went along. Also, the waitstaff seemed disorganized most of the time. When you're paying $60 for a breakfast buffet for a family of 3, you would expect to have your coffee warmed regularly and the buffet to be continually stocked (we found lots of items empty and in need of replacement when we dined arouned 9 am). Over all, we had a very pleasant experience at the Casa Marina and would stay there again. But when we go back, we'll make sure we bring our own snacks and water/soft drinks ($2 + a bottle!) But everything is a little more expensive in Key West.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Key West 08/0508 thru 08/08/08”
Reviews.Author: ivegotalife2
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina was the lovliest resort in Key West. My husband and 2 daughters ages 7 and 11 will return because of the beautiful location. We had a beautiful view of the pool and beach. The rooms were clean. The service was not up to my standard. When we checked in we should have been notified that we needed cards from front desk for our children to eat free. I had to go back the next day and get them. Poolside service was terrible. It was easier to get your own drink at the bar then to get the attention of a waitress or waiter.Our elevator near our room was out of service as was one in the main lobby. Although the food was good it would have been nice to have an upscale restaurant for evening dining. We did explore ( bring lots of quarters for parking on Duvall St.) We enjoyed two restaurants very much. Cafe Marquesa on Simonton and Fleming and Michael's on Margaret St. The food was excellent ... yes, we took our well behaved children to both. Overall we loved Key West and were comfortable at the Casa Marina. Management needs to button up the wait staff and valet parkers as well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it...”
Reviews.Author: travel_jane08
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Casa Marina Resort for two nights and we had such a wonderful time! The hotel is absolutely beautiful, we could have stayed there forever. Our room was great (and we got an upgrade to one of the ocean vista rooms), the Pools are wonderful, we loved the hammocks at the beach and the complimentary fruits and popsickles they had every day. The service was outstanding, everybody was helpful, friendly and almost like a best friend - from front desk to concierge and servers to the chef at the pool. We had the breakfast buffet on both mornings and liked it a lot while sitting outside and enjoying the resorts great atmosphere. We also had the best burgers ever, ordered and made by the chef in the restaurant right next to the Pool. If you want to do something truly romantic - ask for the tables they have at night right at the pier, with some candles and right next to the ocean. The only thing I have to complain about is the job housekeeping does which is definitely not the best one. When we checked into the first room the bathroom was not done at all which was not a big deal since we got another room one right away and something like that happens, but in the other room were so many little things which should not happen: there were fingerprints all over the desk and the windows, there was some stuff on the bathroom door I do not want to describe in detail, there was mold in the shower although everything is so new, and the wooden floor they have in the room had footsteps all over and we also found three long black hairs in the bed. It was not too bad, but it was simply not perfect for a resort like that. But otherwise I would highly recommend the Casa Marina Resort to everybody who is looking for a quiet, beautiful hotel in Key West with a special atmosphere and great service. We had a great time and will be back one day. Thanks a lot!

Reviews.Title: “great resort!”
Reviews.Author: swoop56
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at the Casa and once again had a wonderful time. had stayed there before when it was owned by Wyndam and love the remodeling that has taken place since then. Staff were all great and friendly. Breakfast buffet had variety but was a little pricey. Preferred walking to cuban carryout/restaurant down the way. didn't care much for the strange half shower door, but we had no water on the floor, just kind of wierd. Loved the pools, beach and piers. Our beach staff were very friendly and accomodating. brought out popsicles and watermelon daily. The hotel needs to have a restaurant though instead of only the outside SunSun for food. Half hour walk to Mallory Square was fine-hot and sweaty-just like Key West is supposed to be! will definately stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “They made it new but not very good”
Reviews.Author: stanleyp
Reviews.Content: Totally renovated ultra modern from classical beauty. $20.00 to Valet and $12.00 to self park. No drawers in the rooms. People very good

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and Refreshing”
Reviews.Author: nicki00
Reviews.Content: We spent five nights at the Casa Marina in late July/ early August 2008. Had some difficulty with the 800 reservation service when we wanted to add an extra night to the beginning of our stay the weekend before we flew down (they redid our entire reservation at current/higher rates than we had booked several weeks prior), but all was resolved/reinstated to our satisfaction when we worked directly with the hotel's Rooms Control office on Monday morning. The hotel was very accommodating to our request for an oceanview room with two double beds (as opposed to one king) and later than expected arrival due to flight delays. Had a minor issue with the room not having been properly vacuumed upon our arrival, but the front desk handled promptly and satisfactorily, including compensation of the resort fee for that night (and then an additional night when the resort fee removal was not reflected on our bill at checkout). Housekeeping throughout the rest of the stay was without problems. In the end, these few minor bumps were far surpassed by the beautiful surroundings, private beach, two pools, beach/pool concierge extras (ice water, sample drinks, popsicles, watermelon slices, and cold towels), and in-house dining at the Sun Sun Bar & Grill. We enjoyed several meals at the Sun Sun--lunch every day of our stay and dinner three nights of our stay (one at a private table set up on the beach). Everything that we ate was excellent and far exceeded other meals that we ate outside the resort. But, what stood out the most was the service provided by all of the Sun Sun staff and, in particular, by Joshua. Whether serving us at the grill itself (conveniently located between both pools and sides of the beach) or beachside/poolside in our lounge chairs, Joshua ensured that we wanted for nothing and that absolutely nothing was a problem. In addition, he made us feel welcome, learned a bit about us and what we wanted out of our visit, answered questions without ever making us feel like we were a bother, and offered suggestions/ideas for our consideration. You can view photos of a resort on its web site and have a very good idea about what the place is going to look like. However, web site photos cannot attest to the service that you'll receive and the manner in which you'll be treated once at the resort. In the case of the Casa Marina, I can't say enough about the staff's friendliness and outstanding service. Without a doubt, it was the service provided by the staff in addition to the beautiful surroundings and accommodations that made for a truly relaxing and refreshing vacation. Looking forward to returning and highly recommend it to all looking to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Spanish Architecture”
Reviews.Author: Abel73
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina Resort is a lovely hotel with wonderful Spanish architecture that was recently refurbished, so you'll find many modern touches throughout the resort and in your room. Casa Marina has 2 medium sized pools and it has its own private beach, which is mostly covered by sea grass and rocks, but that is the case in most Florida keys beaches. You can sign up for a variety of water activities and tours right at the hotel. Breakfast was good but not outstanding and selection limited, especially when it costs about $20 per person. We had a couple Mai Tais at the pool bar and they were just fruity, somewhat watery, with no significant amount of alcohol present and overpriced at about $9 each. The hotel is about 2 miles from Duval St. There is valet parking and self parking across the street for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Missing that special something...”
Reviews.Author: Joesluckygal
Reviews.Content: We visited Key West July 18 - 21 and chose the Casa Marina for the location and great beach view. We were down for the weekend to check out venues for our wedding next May. I will start with the likes: We loved the grounds-minus the seaweed, but this is the time when they do have a lot of seaweed. We liked that we could chill out on the beach in a hammock or a chaise. We also liked the large pool floats that we both could float on, which was relaxing and with all of the kids and adults playing around in the pool. We liked our ocean view from the room, especially at night. I liked the mp3 player/alarm radio (I don't say IPOD because I have a zen and mine worked just fine). The bed was comfy. The service was decent. The staff was helpful when you asked for help. I liked that I could be at a more quiet end of the island without having too far of a ride to get to the action of Duval. Now, the dislikes: The seaweed, which is not their fault it is a naturally occurance, but I thought the upkeep could have been better. The poor service on the beach and poolside. I'm a small woman, and I can take care of myself. My fi would usually gather our chaises to lounge on the beach, since the beach staff never came over to offer help. One day, I had to get a chaise by myself, which I have no problem doing, except they were stacked a little high for me and I struggled a bit to release one..again, not a problem until I turned around a saw the hotel's beach attendant sitting down and looking at me as I was dragging the chair to my location without ever offering to assist me. He then gets up to remove empty chairs. Apparently, you have to go up to him and ask him for assistance. This would be an example of lacking that special something. Also, we never once had anyone take our drink order at the pool or on the beach. So, I never witnessed any of the staff going that extra step to provide excellent hospitality. The drinks at the bar....SKIP THE BAR if you want a decent mixed drink. We're used to paying a lot of money for drinks and is not a problem when they have alcohol in them. The drinks seemed watered down and after two days I decided to watch them make the drinks and if they didn't give me the right pour (I've bartended before) I would ask for a remake. Which they would do, so not a problem except I shouldn't have to eagle eye the making of my drinks. We did not like the shower stall in the rooms. I'm short so not a problem for me to push the shower head all the way back so water doesn't land all over the bathroom floor. But my fi is 6ft and this was not an option for him, so we ended up with wet floors, and having to ask for bathmats (which were not replenished) to clean it up. Room service was ok. I ordered huevos rancheros with avocados, and the avocados arrived brown and mushy. The thin walls. I could hear my neighbors. So I know they could hear us...Sorry to my neighbors :-). We are not loud people, but normal bedroom activities can be heard. I also heard a neighbor urinating in the toilet and then flushing. Some other comments: Saw two weddings at the same time. Which seems like a factory to me. The beach area was not cleaned up for the ceremony. I had checked out Casa Marina prior to my trip for wedding info, and I know that it is not an inexpensive venture to host a wedding there. So they could at least have made the area nicer. I decided when we arrived Friday, that I would give the Casa a chance as my venue, so I called and left a message with the wedding coordinator at the resort. 6 days later and still no phone call. I've chosen the Hyatt and I love the location, and as another reviewer stated the water is clearer. So Casa definitely lost out on business with me. All this to say, we would probably stay again, but in the off season when the rates are less, as it's not worth it to pay more than what we paid. The view is fantastic, but I wasn't wowed. And if you drink alcohol, bring your own liquor and mixers and some plastic cups and enjoy them at the pool or beach. You'll save money and disappointment. On a positive note, my fi left his running shoes, and called back yesterday and they said they would mail them back to us for free. So, that's a good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Resort!”
Reviews.Author: Kelbena
Reviews.Content: I will keep it short.... this was a fantastic experience for my girlfriend and I ! Very clean and up to date rooms, 2 large nice pools with their own open bars right next to them! :-) You could hire scooters there, both on land and in the water and other nice in-water stuff. Hammocks all over in the palms next to the water which we enjoyed at late evenings with a drink or two. The people working there was a blast, giving us the best service we have to this day experienced! Thanks Casa Marina for a fantastic stay!

Reviews.Title: “Top value - top place!”
Reviews.Author: gjedden
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Casa Marina Resort for eight nights this july and were really supriced that it was as nice as it looked in the hotels homepage. We stayed in the cheapest room possible,with no seaview, but felt therfeore, that we got really a lot out of our money. The room and bathroom was really classy. The pool was also very nice with enough sunbeds, but be in time in the morning if you want a sunumbrella. The seawater and beach was not as nice as the pool, but ok. We had some lunches and dinners at a restaurant between the hotel and The Reach resort. This was not so expencive and only 150 meter from the hotel at the public beach. We recomand this place for the food and since it was so near the hotel. The Casa Marina Hotel was the best hotel we have ever stayed at!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A fair review for an "okay" place to stay”
Reviews.Author: krcc
Reviews.Content: Third time to Key West, first time at the Casa Marina. I stayed at their sister resort a few years back, the Reach Resort (it costs less, but was much better in my opinion) We travel often for business and pleasure, so I'll give you the good, bad and the ugly about the Casa. The Good: beautiful architecture from the early 1900's, has a private beach, but it's covered in smelly sea weed (most of the island is.... there is a small private beach next to the Hyatt that is all gulf of Mexico water and you can see the bottom, no seaweed), Nice big gym across the street, decent food even though it's overpriced (but all hotels are), Ipod clock radio in room, wave runner and other water sport rentals on site. The Bad: No bathtub in ocean view suites, Our first room smelled of thick mold and we got moved to a smaller room, Wedding guests get first priority, Staff with thick accents or non-english speaking which was very frustrating, they do not clean your room every day unless you remember to leave the "service please" tag in your door, modern upgrades to room were inconvenient (for example, no glass door on shower or shower curtain, only one exposed socket for electronics), Pool has no deep end, so the water was actually hot, giving no relief (you have to walk out on the pier into the ocean to cool off), the staff puts large rafts in the pool and allows paddle ball and other sports in the pool leaving very little room to swim (not to mention it's obnoxious having balls flying past your head in the pool, one almost hit us) The Ugly: There is a resort fee of $20 per day on top of the parking fee (self-park is $12 per night or valet is $20 per night), Valet is not always outside to fetch your car either! The breakfast staff is super slow - better off going to IHop on Truman/Rt 1 or going to the Banana Crepe Cafe on Duval St. for breakfast, also the hotel is not in walking distance to any nightlife or restaurants. Our next trip to Key West is next summer, we will probably stay at the Hyatt Resort and try that one out. We will not return to the Casa and I would not recommend it to my friends. Key West is a great, fun place with many options. Don't get sold on the pictures from the Casa web site, the entire island is gorgeous no matter where you stay. Also, if you're thinking of a wedding there beware, we saw one take place on the beach - they didn't even move the beach chairs or trash cans and there was smelly seaweed in the backdrop (you'd think they would rake it up!) Also, the best restaurant to visit it A&B Lobster house -- it's dressy and a pricier meal, but I can guarantee you won't find a better seafood meal anywhere in the country. Happy travels!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty, but. looks arent everything”
Reviews.Author: TXWV
Reviews.Content: This place is truly beautiful, dont get me wrong but there were some downfalls to this place. First, you get the usual parking fee which is always a bit of a bummer, but then upon check in we noticed that we also get charged an additional $20 per day for things like the workout room and concierge! Since this place is not cheap, I kind of thought we would get that for free since we paid $300 per night! The morning breakfast was pretty crummy as well- another $20 and service was horrible. I had to beg for some coffee! And last but not least, this is not close to the town activities. Which could be a good or bad thing depending on your tastes. For a cab ride to town $10 each way. If you decide to rent a scooter, dont do it at the hotel- they charge around $35 per hour, when you can walk a block and pay $35 for the whole day!

Reviews.Title: “Very Romantic and Peaceful”
Reviews.Author: gopherstateguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked the Casa Marina for a brief honeymoon stay in mid-May and it was incredible! The grounds of the Casa Marina are second to none from what we explored in Key West. They are pretty much done with rennovations and have excellent service and ammenities! From the hammocks under the palm trees to the free popsicles and cold wash clothes, the resort continued to impress. They were extremely responsive to upgrading us due to our occasion and even sent champagne and strawberrys to our suite upon arrival. We would love to go back, but it will be difficult to top our first trip there!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: lkmercer
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the casa for 5 days and let me say it is an amazing resort. the staff was so friendly and we did not met a single one that did not have our best intrest at heart. When we got there we were early check in is at 4:00 we arrived at 12.00. The front desk clerk told us our room would not be ready untill 4:00, but they had a room with 2 double beds if we wanted that we could get it right away. I thought the gesture was nice but we said we paid for a king so that is what we stuck with. While we waited we went to the pool bar and had a few drinks and ate some lunch, before we knew it they called our cell phone and told us our room was ready. We are so glad we waited the room was great, on the first floor with a porch that you could walk right out on the beach. The room was a little small but sleep is all you are going to do there so who cares, and at night we felt like we were the only ones at the resort because where we were on our porch and it was so quiet. The prices of the drinks and the food is a little pricey but it is the same at every other resort we have stayed at. The best thing to do here is go to the water sports part of the beach and take a jet ski trip around the island they leave from the reach resort which is next door but it is so worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: nikkit138
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina Resort is a beautiful hotel that provides excellent services. Anything you need is provided and the staff is more than accommodating. The atmosphere is nice and relaxing and the food is delicious. The sports area has a lot to offer and they will compensate if they cannot offer you a specific adventure. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “LUXURY, WARMTH AND SERVICE WITH A SMILE”
Reviews.Author: UZIMAX
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got home from a wonderful stay at the Casa Marina. We absolutely loved it and will definitely be back. This was our second time in Key West (1st time was 8 yrs ago) and although many things have changed there, this little island continues to amaze me. This time, my sister and future brother-in-law joined us and we had an amazing time!!! There so many things that we enjoyed at the Casa and I'm afraid I'll run out of room to review all of them, so here's a "short" list: 1. The BREAKFAST BUFFET is soooo worth it ($20pp)- it's a buffet people-you can eat as much or as little-this includes coffee and juice that your server will refill and refill and refill to your heart's content! There is a hot and cold station, complete with an"egg station" where Ivan will whip up eggs made to order. Look for Erik, our server, he is FUNNY and he loves his job! 2. The two POOLS do not have a diving board (future brother-in- law and husband not so happy about this) and the deepest part is only 4'6" (my sis was happy about this, hubby and b-i-l were not). I didn't care either way because the ocean was only a few feet away if I wanted to do some "real" swimming. But, once again, the service is outstanding: towels are arranged for you and, if desired, they will also set up an umbrella for you (there aren't that many so try to get a spot early). There is also waiter service poolside - have the pina colada w/a Myer's rum floater- DELICIOUS! And may I add that they do not skimp on the alcohol whatsoever. And oh yeah, the FREE popsicles and watermelon are also a nice touch. Mike, the pool guy, is great and yes, "service with a smile" exists here. WOW! 3. The BEACH- yes-it's rocky and the "dirt" is called seaweed and that "smell" is the ocean. Let's not forget that Key West sits on fossilized coral which makes for rocky beaches (but in the modern world we have what's called "aqua shoes" to solve this problem). The Casa is very diligent about combing the beach and removing the seaweed every morning. Here, the staff will also set up chairs and umbrellas for you and YES- there is also waiter service along with the FREE popsicles and fruit and lemon water. There is alot of seaweed at this time of year but one tends to overlook this when the water is so warm and inviting. There are so many seagulls flying about (pretty), but mysteriously, there is no bird POOP. 4. Our ROOM was a one bedroom ocean vista suite. We arrived an hour and a half early and to our surprise, both rooms were ready. I requested to be right on the ocean and I was literally steps from it. The suite was on the 1st floor and the balcony faced the water. Every morning, I sat on the balcony to watch the sunrise and the guy combing the beach, as well. My only pet peeve was the cigarrette butts that people would toss from the higher balconies, but I believe this was cleaned up throughout the day. The suite is very clean and very new and the bed is COMFORTABLE. The bathroom is HUGE and we had a shower door. My sis and her fiance had the Flagler room and there was no shower door (as reviewed by previous guests, the wet floor was a problem for them). Our rooms were cleaned everyday and the New York Times was delivered every morning. No complaints here. Note: The only minor distraction from my relaxing experience at the Casa Marina was the amount of children at this hotel. Now, I like kids, don't get me wrong, but 30 kids splashing and carrying on by the pool will eventually become annoying. So, if you are looking for that ultra romantic, secluded and "adults only" feel to a resort, the Casa is not for you. Maybe, during school season, there won't be that many kids. Also, we did NOT encounter the non-English speaking staff here at the Casa, only the very pleasant and "could not do enough for you" staff. And by the way, everyone says "good morning" here. I'm from NYC, so this is a WOW factor for me! For you non-walkers, the Casa is about a 15-20 min. walk to Mallory square, but there are cabs and the hotel has bikes, mopeds and electric cars for rent. We walked all over the island and explored "outside" of Duval street. Very interesting......

Reviews.Title: “Tranquil Paradise”
Reviews.Author: bjp981
Reviews.Content: About two weeks ago I had the pleasue to stay at a beautiful resort in Key West, FL, the Casa Marina. It was my fisrt trip to Key West and was very excited to be going. After the 6 hour drive we pulled up to an Old World Style Elegant Drive way of the Casa Marina. The lobby is beautifully furnished with modern funiture and deep dark hard wood floors and pillars. It seems their renovation kept the best of what it was, and encorporated it with fresh modern style. After checking in with a very capable front desk staff I walked to the room with the dissapointment that my room was located on the first floor. My dissapointment was shortly changed as I walked in to the room, walked to the curtains, pulled them back to see the awe inspiring ocean view where we could literally walk off of our patio on to the private beach of the resort. Not just the view was amazing but so was the room. Once again beautifully furnished and modern design. The pool and the beach are gorgeous with staff stopping by your lounge chair periodically offering a frozen washcloth to cool off with or fresh watermelon. Definatly first class service. They even came poolside and offered this to people in the pool. The resort also offers water sports such as jet skies, snorkling and parasailing. Be sure to check-out thier website and take advantage of all this resort has to offer. Excellent service great accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Pampered Resort”
Reviews.Author: BeckyLM22
Reviews.Content: Was very pleased upon checking into the Casa Marina. Everything was new, clean and modern. Check in was a breeze. When we got to our room we were both a bit disappointed in the size, but it was clean and comfortable and we had a patio that went right out to the pool, which we ended up really enjoying. The bed was heavenly! Only complaint would be we could hear noise from the other rooms. Pool area was magnificent. Mike, the pool attendant, was very attentive - setting up towels on the chair for you immediately, and periodically going around with ice waters, popsicles and fruit juices. Spent little to no time on the beach, but you can swim in the ocean via steps off the pier. Breakfast buffet in the morning was nice and they have THE BEST yogurt parfait. We had one every morning for breakfast (can also buy them in the gift shop). Location is a little off the beaten path, but within walking distance to Duvall. If it wasnâ€™t so hot, we wouldâ€™ve done more walking, but opted to take a cab more often (between $8-$12). If you have a car, park in the lot across the street. It is $12 a day, but you can come and go as you please without paying additional. Other minor complaints would be prices at the bar ($6 per beer) and for food. Very expensive, but in line with lots of other prices we encountered. I would suggest stopping by the store for beer, water, etc. and storing it in the fridge in your room. Mahi sandwich we had at the restaurant outside for lunch wasnâ€™t edible. Also, when I was in the bathroom I did step in a sliver of glass when we first arrived and we couldnâ€™t get our safe to work. We called the front desk and within minutes housekeeping was vacuuming our floors and the maintenance person was fixing our safe. They also offered first aid, but I was able to get the sliver out on my own. I was glad they reacted so quickly. All things considered, I would recommend the Casa Marina. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Outdoor_zee
Reviews.Content: I just loved the decor and architecture of this hotel. It seems like they just renovated the place. This place feels like a beautiful mansion rather than a hotel. I would definitely stay there again. Service was really good. Parking is free. There are computers in the lobby for personal use. Decor: A mix of southern architecture and modern decor created a beautiful luxurious ambiance. I'm very picky about hotel decor and this place just amazed me. It was very different from the typical hotel lobbies with chandeliers, gaudy flower vases and colorful carpets. This place had a clean and elegant feel. Room: Dark Hardwood floors. Spacious, Modern, Clean, Luxurious. Loved it! Bathroom: Renovated, Marble. Shower area is a bit open so the water sprays out when you're taking a shower which creates a mess on the bathroom floor. Pool: 2 big pools. I don't think there was a hot tub there. Beach Access: There is no easy access to the beach and the beach is a bit rocky. II was only there for one day so its possible I missed something. Water Sports: Available but more expensive than other places in the town. Restaurants: Not sure, I normally go out for food because the food is usually over priced or not great at hotels. The food around the town wasn't that great either.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing stay - loved it”
Reviews.Author: gem115
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Casa Marina for two nights, this was the hotel we decided to have as our luxury treat on our trip to Florida, and it was from the very first moment we arrived. In summary I would say it had the wow factor when you walk into reception, the staff were professional yet friendly and very helpful, our room wasn't ready but they were able to provide another room, the room was very nicely furnished, the bathroom had a very powerful shower, good food in the pool snack bar although it is a shame there is no restaurant for evening meals, the breakfast is excellent - very fresh both hot and cold options. The hotel has two pools and you are provided with fresh towels, hotel has its own beach (we didn't use but looked amazing with palm trees and hammocks in some of the trees!). Overall it is one of those hotels you could easily never leave during your visit (apart from the evening meal!). Would go back in a shot!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Resort Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: orchidlady_8
Reviews.Content: June, 2008 Don't miss an opportunity to stay at Casa Marina. It is a casual , elegant resort with tastefully appointed rooms, clean lines, and ever so comfortable! The suite had everything you would need with the ultimate view of the pool and the Atlantic. Spacious patio only 20 steps from the pool. Housekeeping was impeccable. Grounds nicely landscape and well taken care of. Pools very clean and maintained. Plenty of towels. All staff I encountered greeted you with a smile, and were eager to answer any questions. Amenities definitely designed to allow you to relax. The aroma therapy massage was excellent. Breakfast staff cheerful and up beat. The experience exceeded my expectations and I only wish I could have stayed longer. I have stayed in many places and would rate this resort as one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina was Great with some little things”
Reviews.Author: tussle
Reviews.Content: I had done a lot of research on this property and all in all was satisfied with our stay. The location is a bit away from Duval and you will need transportation. This was not a problem for us as we had a car and parking was never a bother. I was somewhat expecting a little more, being that the hotel recently underwent an expensive 'rivitalization'. We encountered a musty smell in the lobby when we checked in and also in our rooms. The rooms was somewhat modern which is to my liking but the bathroom was a bit small. I really loved loved the property. Two pools, bar, sitting areas, the view, hammocks. Very relaxing and very clean. However, the beach was a disappointment -- too much sea weeds and it was somewhat smelly. The afternoon drink in the lobby was also a real treat and the pool attendants did a really great job. All in all, the Casa, from all appearances, seemed one of the best hotels in Key West. I hope management vents the place with somethng similar to Ocean Key (I did a rest stop there on our way to Mallory Square and the place smelled divine). All in all, I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good TIMES”
Reviews.Author: cainjax1
Reviews.Content: What can i say this property is beautifull. Key West is the only place you can go comprable to the caribean without needing a passport. We stayed 5 days 4 nights at the Casa and the time flew by ..The grounds are beautiful,and clean. The rooms are very spaciaus and immaculate. The out side bar is a little pricey buy hey your on vacation...... There was one miserable bartender named Chris, he would close the bar at night before it was time to close, when asked why he replied "because I am very tired and have alot to to tomorrow" excue me but isnt this your job????? All in all it was a great trip, and I would definetly return.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Wannabe Resort”
Reviews.Author: Funtravelgal
Reviews.Content: Okay, Simply: don't stay here. Very quickly issues encountered: Given horrible room on check in, just had to say it stunk and was upgraded... Shower only was half finished, meaning it only had a partial door...which meant water leaked out everywhere!!! Gift shop did not have stamps...what's the big deal, you think? It's a resort, it should have stamps. Top of bathroom ceiling was a sprinkler which lacked encasing of some sort, I've seen Hampton Inn's better kept than this... Double check your prices on everything...they like to gorge...did not tell me about additional "reserve tax" even though I had specifically asked about all taxes, resort fee, etc. Misquoted on massage, shuttle service and taxes. Don't be fooled: the "spa" is simply a room, converted into a spa. Now, the massage I received from John was great...but a spa atmosphere this is certainly not. I was stung by a jellyfish...well, that's what you get for swimming in the ocean, you might think...I would agree...except I was the 18th person that day!!!! A staff member helped me and said the management doesn't like to put signs up, b/c they think they look tacky!!! Two children were really stung badly right before and after me. After countless calls to general manager I talked him in to putting up signs...it's one thing if one person gets stung, entirely different if numerous reports (especially when one could be allergic and have a death reaction) After talking to him, he said he wanted to send something up, perhaps wine? Not necessary, plus staying with a friend who was preggers, so no drinking for her anyway...sent leftover fruit from breakfast buffet...we were gone all day when these arrived and came back to a table full of ants/bugs everywhere!!!! Someone had to come and spray. I'm tired, there was more, but enough said....the pool conceirge was very nice. I just really had to work on this "vacation" it felt. Do yourself a favor and stay at a real resort...this is not it at all.

Reviews.Title: “really good but.....”
Reviews.Author: supersas
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina Resort is a comfortable and attractive place to stay so much so that we have stayed there each year for the last 4 years. It was the Flagler restaurant that existed pre 2005 hurricane that caught the charm and romance of the hotel. Since the renovations, the hotel remains a fine hotel and resort but there are some issues that still need to be improved on: 1. Guests have to leave the hotel to find an evening meal that meets more than fast food standards. The absence of a proper restaurant becomes a major inconvenience when staying for more than a few days. 2. For many people, umbrellas are needed to provide sunshades on the beach. The umbrellas that were weighted down have been replaced by umbrellas that are spiked at the bottom and as the beach is fossilised coral beneath the shallow sand, the spike is not able to penetrate the ground, despite strenuous efforts of the beach attendants. Result is umbrellas not able to be used and stressed guests hoping that one of the limited areas of shade beneath the palm trees will be available when they want to relax on the beach. Please bring back the beach umbrellas that are weighted down at the bottom. 3. Radios without personal earpieces are permitted on the beach so the peace and relaxation sometimes becomes difficult. When 2 groups of people were trying to drown out each others music, the peace of the beach was replaced by the battle of the bands. so in essence; Key West is a fabulous place and the Casa Marina is a comfortable place to come back to but I think that these points need to be considered for improvement.

Reviews.Title: “Very classy, perfect for a romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: rizariza
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have travelled extensively around the world and have stayed at several five-star resorts, so it's safe to say we have high standards. As soon as we walked into Casa Marina we were absolutely delighted with the building, interiors and atmosphere. There's a real Old World charm to the place and all the furniture and decor are extremely tasteful. It really feels like a tropical setting in colonial times. We arrived early and our room wasn't ready yet, but they made us feel welcome by inviting us to relax at the pool while they kept our luggage for us. The international staff were friendly, courteous and efficient, contrary to what other reviews have stated. As soon as we got to our room, they brought our bags up without delay. The pool areas were picture perfect and extremely clean. In fact, maintenance and cleaning started like clockwork early every morning. Towels were always available and the waitstaff very attentive. The resort might have recently replaced some of their earlier staff because there was no evidence of employees who couldn't speak English, as mentioned in other reviews. Food and drinks were very good, and no more expensive than in any other luxury hotel. If you're shocked by such prices, you have to realize that this is standard for a place like this. Our bedroom was clean and very stylishly decorated. Our balcony was large - with a perfect view of the pool and ocean. We were lucky to have gotten an Ocean Vista room, actually in the main historic building. (Balconies in the new building aren't as large as the one we got.) Overall, Casa Marina was perfect for a couples getaway - quiet and relaxing - not too close to the downtown action. We walked to Duval Street everyday with no problems at all. It's about a 15-minute walk. We also rented bikes, which were available right at the hotel. This isn't a place where you'll see guests who are loud partyers. In general, it seemed like the clientele were more like my husband and myself - professional couples on a getaway, as well as families. The doorman was gracious almost to a fault. As we left, his parting words were, "We hope to see you again at Casa Marina!" That makes both of us.

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina Dream Vacation”
Reviews.Author: GrandmotherOfGirls
Reviews.Content: June 23, 2008 Reviewer: Dona D. My two granddaughters and I spent a magical week at the Casa Marina Resort in Key West, Florida. Our every wish and whim was attended to with a professional but personal attitude. We went out on the Tiki boat, arranged through Key West Sports onsite, and the girls swam and snorkeled. Captain Duck and First Mate Dave went above and beyond anything necessary. My youngest granddaughter had a panic attack in the water and Dave dove in without hesitation and rescued her. NOT ONLY did he rescue her, but he calmed her and offered to stay with her or swim with her to the reef. She has asthama and I was truly afraid she might have an attack brought on by her panic. I simply find it difficult to convey in words my gratitude toward Dave and his instant response to her situation which I think could have become a serious problem without his immediate action. Both Captain Duck and Dave treated all of the passengers as if they were each a very special person, which made the entire event just amazing. We found the resort food delicious and well prepared with ample servings. (We could never finish all of the food on our plates.) The amenities were perfect. The staff was more than accomodating and very kind. Any inquiry was immediately addressed with a satisfactory result. We will surely return to this lovely resort because of the outstanding staff and the breathtaking views, beach and pools as well as the convenience of having everything close at hand. We enjoyed riding bikes around Key West and delving into the true flavor of the island. The girls are already planning another trip next summer!!!! (I hope they are also planning to get jobs!) When I asked them their favorite and least favorite parts of the trip their response was, favorite was "everything", least favorite, "having to leave". With two teenage girls, that says a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Ronny is the best wedding planner.”
Reviews.Author: HappyDayMilwaukee
Reviews.Content: Attended a wedding in May. The resort was fabulous, and Ronny the wedding planner was, too. He attended to every detail and made the wedding a day to remember forever.

Reviews.Title: “Relax by the Sea”
Reviews.Author: ColleenRinaldi
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at Casa Marina and really enjoyed it. We stayed in the one bedroom ocean front suite. I asked for a room as close to the ocean as possible. Our room had a terrace overlooking the sea. We were on the second floor and simply had to walk down a flight of stairs to our beach chairs in the sand. This made things so easy. I could run up to my room for a beer and be back down to the beach in no time. Our suite was as pictured and was clean and new. The refrig is small so bring a cooler. If you plan on eating in the room bring everything you will need. Food at the hotel is expensive so we ate at local places. Don't park at the hotel. Plenty of street parking is available. The beach is large but rocky as are most in Key West. The hotel keeps everything looking great and clean. If you are looking for a place to relax by the sea you will love Casa Marina.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! No complaints...”
Reviews.Author: crazyreggie
Reviews.Content: We read and read and read reviews of many different hotels in Key West. Casa Marina was running a great deal and we hadn't heard anything substantially disappointing about the hotel other than some construction issues so we decided to stay here. We arrived early and decided to see if our room was ready. Surprisingly, it was ready and we had our room keys within minutes. NOTE: we thought we had a king room, but little did we know that it wasn't guaranteed, so we ended up with a double room. Not the biggest ordeal and the hotel provided us with $50 resort credit (which was originally free breakfast the next morning a $44 value, but we spoke with the manager and got it changed to general credit since we weren't interested in a breakfast buffet). We stayed Monday thru Wednesday, everything was great! There was no construction going on. Everything was new, clean and very luxurious. We hung out by the pool both days and chairs were easy to come by but umbrellas were not. Given the Key West heat, they were in high demand. Servers came by on the hour with either a free drink of the day or popsicles to help keep us cool. Also, in the afternoon, they serve free "key lime coolers", basically a virgin mojito, in the lobby. Those were awesome! We were not familiar with the area before heading down there and we were told that Casa marina was further away from duval street which keeps it quiet. Personally, Casa marina has an awesome location. You can be on duval street (the opposite end of the partying) within 2 minutes via scooter. BTW, rent a scooter from Tropical Rentals on duval (very reasonable, if not cheap, prices). A solo scooter for 24 hours ran $35 and a double runs $75 a day, and cheaper for extra days. If you want to travel to Mallory Square at sunset, it will take you about 10 minutes with all the traffic lights. Key West isn't a big place, so everything is relative. To complete your stay, here are some recommendations that were given to us before we went down: 1. Blue Heaven (brunch on the weekends, breakfast-lunch-dinner throughout the week) 2. Ambrosia (sushi, very close to casa marina, excellent food) 3. Salsa Loca (mexican, excellent!, closed on mondays) 4. Better than sex (dessert restaurant, very good and intimate, closed on mondays) 5. Ana's cafe (walk-up window, cuban food...great breakfast!) 6. Michaels (cheese fondue at the bar, excellent and a lot of food, off the beaten path)

Reviews.Title: “Another great Casa Marina trip”
Reviews.Author: kdhsam
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Casa Marina yesterday from a six night stay with my husband, my parents and my sister and her husband. We had a fabulous time. This was my first trip since the renovation, yet we have stayed with the Casa on several other occasions. Here are some observations and highlights: - The coffee and danish bar in the hotel lobby store is a great alternative to the expensive hotel buffet. If you are a small eater for breakfast or watching the budget, check this out. Chocolate Danish is awesome! - Cab fare downtown is $2.50 now per person (when you have 4 or more in the car. Slightly higher for a couple, but maybe only a buck more.) This is very reasonable and convenient. - Onsite activities offer lots of water sports incl., jet skiing, parasailing, fishing, hobie cats, etc. w/o ever leaving the property. We rented bikes one day from here - $15.00 pp for the whole day - was fantastic. - the pools and beach are wonderful. No complaints and Mike our pool attendant was friendly and always accomodating. The cool towels, popsicles, watermelon, and water w/ lime poolside is a much appreciated treat during sunbathing or pool time. - a few negatives - I would think if one is going to spend 40-some million on renovations that insulation in the walls would be on that list. Due to the buildings age there are some issues with noise and sounds from the hallway and street. Its really no big deal - but just an observation. A friendly rooster in the parking lot woke us every morning around 5:30 am : ) Ocean side may not have that issue. And the new designs and furniture are beautiful but some of it doesnt make a lot of sense in the real world - like the astetically pleasing shower w/ a 1/2 glass door, looks fantastic but doesnt quite contain all the water from the shower leaving the door and floor wet. And be aware that in the new bathroom behind the solid french doors, your room mate can see into the bath. Just and FYI for the modest among us. Overall the Casa is wonderful and its very hard for me to find anything at all negative. Oh - one other surprise - the shuttle from the airport used to be a free service, this is no longer the case. the shuttle will do airport service, but its $7.50 pp. Just for those that have been here before - its a surprise. A new find for me on this trip and a must do next time --- Smather's Beach. I've been to Key West probably 10 times, and have driven by Smather's many times, but never walked out there until this trip. We had seen a month or so ago on the Travel Channel that this beach was highly rated and its easy to see why - absolutely stunning. check it out! I'll be happy to answer any questions about the hotel or anything Key West as we just returned. Feel free to ask.

Reviews.Title: “not worth the Money!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mamamochilla
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip because we had a special deal on the hotel. The hotel room we stayed in was very nice and clean, but our bedroom was in the front of the room. So we could hear the hotel staff yell down the hallway. So you get a 8:00 am wake up call every morning without calling in for it. This hotel originally stated that there was a hot tub on the premises but there is not a hot tub. We complained about this at the front desk and they told us that this information was changed on the website after we arrived there. The beach there had trash all over and broken glass. I have stayed in many places and in the third world countries there is hardly any trash on the beach in front of the resorts. There are two people there to give out towels and chairs and no one to clean the beach. My credit card was over charged by $200+ dollars my bank did remove the charges but I tired to call the hotel for an explanation as to why i had all these extra charges and they could not explain why I was charged or offered to remove the fees. When we stayed there a wedding was going on and we were blocked from part of the pool and bar area while the service was being performed. The grounds are very nice and the location was great but stay else where if you want to relax. We actually stay at the crown plaza for a few days as well and liked it a lot more. No beach front but a lot better atmosphere and roof top pool.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: suzeusag
Reviews.Content: This is my first visit since the rennovations. I am impressed. it is modern and minimalist whilst still being comfortable. The landscaping and pool areas are clean, fresh and relaxing and the property whilst being close to Duval is far enough away that it is quiet and does have a relaxing Keys feel. The poolside service is excellent with cold face cloths, popsicles and cold fruit being brought to you. There is a beach front and you can swin from the pier. At night they have some dining tables at the beginning of the pier which are somewhat secluded and romantic. There is no formal restaurant on site but the poolside/room service menu is reasonable and the bar serves a good tapas selection from 4.00 pm. However, the breakfast menu is somewhat limited. I would highly recommend a stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Casa Marina!”
Reviews.Author: Mireilleh
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Casa Marina was great! The room is very comfortable. The bathroom is very clean. Furniture has been renovated, everything looks new. Modern style. The pools are great, beach is nice. Good restaurant! Staff is very serviceable. My husband and I loved it! I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: hawking
Reviews.Content: I am convinced that some people that write these reviews tend to look for faults if something doesn't go their way at the onset. Faults can be found at any location if you look hard enough. Our stay at the Casa Marina was excellent!! The Pros; early check in, late check out, Beautiful grounds, not a lot of screeming kids, beach front massage, excellent room with great view, hammocks on beach, outstanding staff from bellman to pool attendant to housekeeping and front desk(especially Patrick), could not have been more attentive or professional, on site water rentals as well as scooter rentals. The cons; seaweed on beach,but it is removed daily by the hotel and their is a pier to get you past it if you want to swim, concierge desk staffed infrequently,but was helpful when staffed.
