Location is a little remote(about 2 miles from Mallary Square, about your farest point) but plenty of transportation options, and the walk to and from "downtown" is beautiful and enlightening(many galleries,restaurants,bars,attractions). Did not eat at the hotel, but be sure to visit Sevin Fish(top notch,short walk), Pepes(near Mallory Square,reasonable and you will think your in the French Quarter).

Reviews.Title: “Don't pay for parking”
Reviews.Author: Rycher
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice. The pools are excellent. The beach is serviceable. The wireless internet does not work and the "business area" is 2 computers with the worst bandwidth I have experienced in 7 years. They try to soak you for $20/night valet or $12/night in a lot across the street, but street parking is free and readily available.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: ufpig
Reviews.Content: Spent Memorial Day weekend with my wife at the Casa Marina and had a wonderful time. The beach and pool are beautiful. The popsicles, watermelon, and ice water were a nice touch. The attendant even came out to us on the far end of the beach three different trips. Having lived in Key West for many years I knew the beach was not your traditional beach, very rocky. The two pools are easy to get to when we needed to cool down. There were plenty of beach chairs and towels, even on the busy weekend. Drinks at the pool bar were pricey, but expect that everywhere in Key West. There is a fridge in the room for beer and soda. Bring a cooler down to the pool with your drinks in it and save a few bucks. Don't bother with the hotel restaurant, there is much better food all over the island. The rooms were very nice and the bed was comfortable. Overall, left the resort very relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Loved This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelgrls
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just spent two amazing nights at the Casa Marina in Key West. From check in to check out we were so impressed. Every staff member we encountered from the Front desk ,pool,restaurant and even housekeeping could not have been nicer to us. The bed was AMAZING!! We were given the royal treatment and we are two fairly picky women who were very impressed. We will be back soon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Swanky hotel experience”
Reviews.Author: swankytravel1
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina 's renovation has made it incredibly swanky. The european design is beautiful and elegant; the grounds are stunning and clean. Upon check-in, we were upgraded to an ocean-view room, with a walk-out balcony. The balcony was huge, shaded and had 6 chairs and a small table! our room had high ceilings, wood floors, plenty of room to move around and a modern bathroom. The in-room ammenities, like the bathrobes, shampoo, towels and especially the bedding were nice. The mattress was very comfortable. We would have liked the option of regular coffee, either in our room or the lobby, because the standard espresso machine in every room was impressive, but we don't like espresso. Also, a restaurant would have been useful because we aren't morning people and we had to go into town to search for breakfast (room service was available, but was pricey). The service and guest communication still needs to be upgraded, however. For example, on the day of our arrival, there were complimentary, non-alcoholic mojitos in the lobby. However, we never saw them again, even though we looked. Perhaps they are served at a certain time each day or only on certain days? Is there a happy hour where drinks or snack are served half-off, for example? If there are organized events for the guests, we were not informed of them. We saw beach buffets, but had to inquire about them because we were not informed of them at check-in. And, the in-room hotel literature and TV station information need to be updated to match the renovation. For example, both advertisements state that there is a whirlpool on the premises, but when we couldn't find it and asked at the front desk, we were simply (and impassively) told that there wasn't one anymore. The only services that were "perfect" were the valet and the pool attendant. The valets were helpful, kind, funny and quick. The pool attendant (Mike) was thoughtful, respectful and attentive, bringing towels, sunscreen, water bottles, fruit and even popsicles, upon request. I even saw him arranging beach and pool chairs and chatting with all the guests, whom he called by name. He definitely earned his tips!

Reviews.Title: “Casa Marina - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kjhall
Reviews.Content: While we were a little leary after reading a few of the reviews, we went ahead and kept our booking at Casa Marina. We are so glad we did. The rooms may have been a little small, but definately clean and comfortable. The pool was great and the pool attendant, Mike could not have been better. He was hard working and always trying to make us feel welcome. The bartender at the Tiki Bar was also friendly and made the best Pina Coladas. Breakfast was pretty expensive, so we passed on that. Would have been nice to have music by the pool, but everything else was great and would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A NIGHTMARE”
Reviews.Author: Bluesmanusa
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 NIight Had To Call The Front Desk Security Twice Because Of So Much Noise InThe Halls And Rooms We Coundnt Sleep .We Left At 7AM. Overpriced And The Walls Seem Paper Thin. I Want My Money Back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: CasaLuvr
Reviews.Content: We stayed this past weekend (5/9/08-5/13/08). I was a little apprehensive since some of the reviews were not as good as I would have liked, but my insecurities were gone as soon as we set foot on the property. The Casa was the most beautifully decorated (IMO) property in Key West, being that Key West is an older city, a lot of the properties there look a little run down (at least on the outside) but the Casa is luxury from the parking lot to the beach. The service was good from the moment we got there too. I guess we are just not picky people and we weren't expecting much form the hotel to begin with since we were mainly going to the Keys to relax and get away, not to act like little divas. We just slept there and chilled at the pool area, nobody bothered us and we really weren't looking to bother anybody either. They did pass out popsicles and towels which was nice, there are two pools and neither are ever really crowded which is a plus, there were always plenty of chairs for everyone, there was always someone asking if we needed something, but they weren't pushy about it so that was good, we enjoyed ourselves and will definitely be going back to the Casa next year. They had a nice Mother's Day brunch, but we did not try it since it was way over priced for our taste, but we weren't bothered by it, it was just expected, we simply went to town for food. Our room was clean every day after breakfast but we had to make sure we put the sign on our door in order for the staff to do it, which makes sense, imagine being on your honeymoon and having the cleaning people walk into your room to clean it. LOL! The only thing that we didn't like was the fact that the casa was not as close to duval street as we thought, which can be a good thing since it makes the casa a quiet get away, but also a bummer if you didn't plan on driving or taking a taxi, so plan ahead for transporation. The staff was always 2 steps ahead of us when we needed a taxi, which was nice, they would arrange for anything, we were very well treated at this hotel but as I previously mentioned, we weren't there to bother anybody or to nit pick over small details like fingerprints on a glass door. If you're looking for a nice relaxing get away, this is the spot, the weather was perfect the whole time, the staff from the front desk to the maintanance was professional and corteous, sure, you could tell that english was not the frist language for many but I certainly understood everything they said and also felt that I was understood as well, everything was perfect. I could go on and on about our stay. I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “A Beautiful, Tropical Beach Resort...”
Reviews.Author: EasRegDir
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a five day, four night stay at the Casa Marina Beach Resort. My wife and I were a little timid in our decision to stay at the Casa based on some previously left reviews a few weeks back. With that in mind, I will simply say they must have cleaned up nicely; we could not have been happier with our choice while in Key West. Yes, you are on the opposite end of busy Duval Street but you are away from the hustle of all the tourists dropped there from their cruise ships. You can always walk down to the Old Town district, or rent a scooter as we did and see the whole island. The staff at the Casa were "top notch" all the way. Check in and check out were smooth and efficient. The two pools are both tastefully decorated, clean and always well maintained. The beach was manicured each morning for the guests. The rooms were recently updated with all new fixtures and furniture. The floor was a beautiful, polished marble as are the walkways throughout the resort. What a perfect place to stay, we will definitely be going back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, lacking in service and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: BostonTravelers02118
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Casa from 4/24/08-4/27/08. We have been visiting Key West annually for 8 years and love the relative peace of the Atlantic side of the island. So, unlike some of the previous reviews of this property which comment on its location, this review will discuss only the property itself. We arrived at the resort as the third leg of a week-long, multi-stop vacation and had two fairly large suitcases, with which no one offered to help us when we checked in (no bellman on the curb when we arrived by taxi from the airport), but that was fine. The very first thing I noticed about the property when I walked into the lobby was a ballroom door to the left whose glass panes were absolutely covered with fingerprints (the light was hitting the glass at such an angle that you couldn't miss them). The lovely dark wood floor was also streaked with visible grime. I don't usually look for these things in hotels, and maybe if it the Florida sunlight hadn't been streaming in, I would have missed it completely. But it looked like they had simply neglected to assign a staff member to "lobby duty." I then spotted a welcoming glass jar of icy lime spritzer that was empty (save for a few melty ice cubes and lime wedges) and surrounded by so many used glasses they were covering the entire surface of the small table. I had hoped that this amenity would be refreshed before the check-in process was completed, but it was not. The first room we were given was so small, it was impossible for two people to move around in it at the same time. We were told this was because it was the last available room in the property and we would be moved the next day when another room became available. If possible, I would advise guests to try to steer clear of the tiny, angular "Flagler Ocean Vista" rooms the website describes as having "unique shapes." This may have just been the tiniest room in the hotel, but it was so overcrowded with furniture that there was literally no room for our suitcases (there were also no dressers or luggage racks). It also had just one full-size window (and one tiny shuttered one) that looked directly at the side of the hotel. If one bent around the opposite way and stretched to see it, a tiny piece of ocean was just visible beyond the pool area. This lack of natural light made the room very dark. I was disappointed to find a sticky substance on the tiled bathroom floor, to which my rubber-soled flip-flops became stuck. We asked to have this cleaned while we were out, but it was not done. We visited the outdoor bar for a pre-dinner cocktail and were, again, disappointed by the lack of cleanliness. The bar was not particularly busy but the bar surface where we sat was covered with crumbs, which our bartender ignored. He was not particularly friendly and allowed another couple to sit in our stools while we went for a short walk around the pool. The next day, we moved into a much larger, cleaner, and brighter Flagler Ocean Vista Room which faced the ocean directly. While it did not have a dresser or bureau (apparently the designers decided to forgo clothes storage for a "credenza" that houses an empty mini-fridge, a wide variety of barware, and some useless shelving), at least there was room to set up 2 luggage racks and move around our suitcases. Adjacent to the bed was a sitting area with a comfortable chair and reading lamp. There was also a wicker settee, which looked sharp and fit nicely into an oddly-configured corner of our room but was in no way a practical piece of furniture (its creamy white upholstered cushion will soon be filthy as guests choose to use it as a suitcase rack). A small dresser would have been a much more practical choice for this space (guests in KW aren't spending much time wearing clothes that need to be hung up in a closet: it's a laid-back town and shorts and T-shirts are the norm). We loved the grounds of the resort. The first day we sat by the water, we were greeted by a friendly staff member who set up our chairs and towels for us. We also had excellent food and beverage service on the beach, with staff checking on us often. The cool watermelon slices and popsicles were a very nice touch that put this property on par with luxury resorts we have visited. On our last day at the property, we decided to try the breakfast. We were seated at a table and directed to the buffet, which was very good. When we returned to our table, however, we had no silverware. After hunting around the buffet and searching for a serving station, none was to be found. We sat, hot food on plates in front of us, for at least five minutes as several servers disappeared to attempt to locate some utensils. This seemed very odd and was quite frustrating, but eventually the issue was resolved and the food was tasty. It may be worthwhile to note that there are many employees of this property who do not speak English. There were several times during our stay (including this breakfast) when we attempted to ask a question of a staff member who did not have even the most basic grasp of the language; this made for some awkward and frustrating moments when we could not get the information we needed. During our last swim in the pool, an attendant came by and removed our towels from our chairs. When we explained that we had planned to use the towels upon exiting the pool, he told us towel service was ending and rudely refused to bring us new towels. We then watched as other attendants brought handfuls of fresh towels out and happily obliged when guests came over to help themselves. This was rather maddening, but not surprising given the highly inconsistent level of service we had received during our stay. In short: the outdoor grounds are top-notch, the rooms are stylishly appointed but lack some practical amenities and come in a wide variety of sizes, the common spaces need much more attention to cleanliness, and the service is very spotty and inconsistent. The Casa Marina has great potential to be a top-notch resort property but it has a ways to go.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful setting”
Reviews.Author: DrAProco
Reviews.Content: Key West is lively, outrageous, loud, and fun, so this property a bit of a distance from Duvall Street turned out to be the absolute perfect spot to catch your breath. The setting is absolutely gorgeous -- two beautiful pools, clean beach and lovely scenery. I watched the grounds keepers literally manicure the place each morning. The staff was terrific and the water, Popsicles and watermelon on the beach was a nice touch. If people complain about the cost, they need to realize that everything has to be shipped into Key West and most hotels are pricey there. Compared to some of the dumps in South Beach it was certainly worth the money to stay in a quiet, classy facility.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, needs to sharpen up waitstaff and reservations.”
Reviews.Author: CTTom
Reviews.Content: Checked in 4/20, out 4/25. Our printed reservation confirmed a handicapped ocean view room but their system did not and they had already given it away when we arrived. Gave lame excuse about their res. being handled by third party that did not always pass thru all info. I was not impressed. Was not offered an upgrade either. Took non-handicapped ocean view room. Fixed the tub stopper and sink stopper myself. After two nights, we asked to change rooms to any handicapped room as with a wheelchair the room was very cramped. Patrick, at the front desk told us he'd take care of it and for us to go about our plans for the day - very reassuring and professional. He did call my cell a few hours later and let me know he'd arranged a switch. Wish he'd been on the desk when we checked in. The handicapped room we got was mostly fine, but had no low mirror in the bathroom and no shelves for toiletries except a narrow one under the mirror. Also, no hook to hang the hand-held shower. No way to roll a wheelchair to the beach without going down a step and/or over grass and soft sand to the paved beach path. Breakfast was a disaster one day, with confused waitstaff, no teaspoons, and several irate guests. Waitstaff tries hard but lacks management and training. However, the beach is beautiful, the grounds are beautiful, the hotel is quite nice, the pools and beach/pool staff are great. No charge to valet park with handicapped sticker. Bell staff was good to excellent..

Reviews.Title: “A bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: draker087
Reviews.Content: My experience was overall positive as I enjoyed the long weekend in key west, but I can't say that I would go back to Casa Marina if I had to pick a place. Pros: - most important thing was the view of the beach and pool (I wondered how disappointed the people facing the back must have been. on the website the back room are called "garden view", but rest assured that there is nothing resembling a garden in the back) - room clean, confortable and spacious - room service pretty efficient - and my feeling going around key west was that there were not many resorts with a private beach, so I guess this is a unique feature of the place. Cons: - the feeling at the end of the holiday is that you are being charged for a luxury resort, but this place, while it is nice, it's nothing near luxury. - The main house, which is the old and charachteristic building is a bit run down (they did say it was going to be renovated...) and when you walk in you can see the glass on the main entrance doors is all dirty with fingerprints. Sorry but this you would never see in a real luxury resort. Fortunately the rooms are much better, but most of them are in the new big concrete building which has no character at all (metal doors etc..). - you are being charged for a tons of little things on top of the room, which is already quite expensive. One thing for example is access to the beach for what they call "towel service", regardless of weather you actually went to beach or not and of course you find out only when you check out, which is always unpleasant. Luxury to me means that beach and sunbeds are included in the price. - restaurant food service is extremely slow and totally unprofessional: just to get a table to sit for morning breakfast it takes three people to coordinate. and for lunch you have to wait AGES to be served. - they have a bar on the beach (concrete structure, not the really the typical caribbean palm tree bar), but anyways, if you try to have a drink around 7PM, you find one barman all sweaty and tired beacuse he is working there alone since noon, vomit and alcohol stink all around...I mean I was disgusted!! Bottom line, they want to sell it a luxury resort when it's really not even near, but they have the advantage of being in key west, of having a private beach and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: bubbadonna
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Casa for 5 night/4 days last week, with our 3 kids, ages 11 & twins 10. Was a bit nervous about staying here due to some negative reviews, but was very happy with our experience. The hotel was beautiful, from the lobby to the pool. The lobby was very nice, and had a great scent. Our room was nice, stayed in a king suite. The staff were all very nice and accomodating. Staff by the pool brought out fruit, drinks, popsicles, and even cold wet face clothes to cool you off. Nice touch!! My children loved ordering frozen virgin drinks poolside.The beach had hammocks and a water sports hut. My daughter & I rented a wave runner, that was fun. While, my husband and boys went snuba diving, something we booked from the hotel. The hotel is away from the nightlife. We liked being at the quiet end of duval street. (Oh, except for the roosters, they are everywhere on the island, and they do wake you in the early morning).We rented a car so we just parked on the street, meter parking when we went to Duval and Mallory Square. We did a trip to Fort Jefferson, kids loved the boat ride over. The fort was very cool. Also, went deep sea fishing 1 day on the Southpaw, nice boat for a family. We all had a great vacation! Would definately recommend the Casa, and would love to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: SpecelecNC
Reviews.Content: Casa Marina does have a beautiful space on the island. It's too far to walk to any nightlife and requires taxi to most other locations. It would have been sufficient to stay there but the food was mediocre for the price and service sub-standard. Staff was not familiar with the island and we were constantly directed to all the "tourist traps". Rooms were clean and nice. Just did not feel that we got value for the price. Based on how far we were from the action on the island, the lacking amenities and average food. Not sure we would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Going Back to the Casa”
Reviews.Author: munchkin80
Reviews.Content: My 12 year old son and I stayed at the Casa for 4 nights/5 days during his Spring Break and we can't wait to return. The property is beautiful and the staff was wonderful. We were supposed to checkout on the 10th but we extended our stay one extra night because we were unable to book a trip to Ft Jefferson until the 10th (definitely worth one trip to the Ft but book with Yankee Freedom; which you can do online before your trip - we booked through one of the Key West Info huts along Duval St and they failed to mention a fuel surcharge for an additional charge). The Casa is not located in the heart of the action and that was perfect as it afforded us peace and quiet with just a short walk to the heart of Duval. My recommendation is if you plan to shop then I would drive to one of the parking lots (Mallory Square is $4.00 per hour with a max of $32 per day) or bring LOTS of quarters as you only get 10 minutes for each quarter at a parking meter. Otherwise, you should just grab a cab (there is one designated just for the Reach/Casa resorts but it is not complimentary) or walk the short distance with the rest of the crowd. I will admit that I was quite concerned based on all the 2 star ratings I saw prior to my trip and was seriously considering other options. I am so glad that I decided to stick with the Casa. While we were there we bought two seats (called a Split) on the Captain Conch charter boat (which was booked via the hotel's water sports personnel). Captain Jason and First Mate Daryl were great and the 4 hour trip was definitely worth the $149 per person (you also need to tip the First Mate 15-20% so bring cash for that additional charge which the booking agent failed to mention). My son caught a 12 lb Bonita and a 20lb Amberjack - he's hooked (I know, I know) on fishing now and can't wait until he can go again. You take turns with others (kids go first then its everyone for themselves on a rotation that you decide) for each "downrigger" that's called and one gentlemen had his dream come true when he caught (& released) a 7ft sailfish. You can keep some of your catches and have a local restaurant cook it up for a fee or you can (and in some cases must) release - which we did with the Amberjack (they kept the Bonita for bait). You can even have a replica or your catch mounted via Gray's at a cost of $200 per ft ( and you must provide a significant depost). Camille's was great for breakfast (and they have whole Key Lime Pies wrapped to go for $20). I wasn't impressed with the Conch Republic's idea of a Filet steak but they had a great gift shop. Lobo's for lunch was good and they have a great bartender who is funny, charming and handsome (he paid me to say those things - just kidding) and indicated he gets a lot of customers based on Trip Advisor's recommendations. Caroline's (Duval St) was good and Sandy's Cafe (on White St) serves Media Noche sandwiches that are as big as the deli sandwiches at Katz's in Manhattan - not the usual thin Media Noche's - you could make two sandwiches from their one. The locals all know and love the place. The Ghost Tour is also a must for a Key West trip (there were people with/without kids). We're sorry this trip had to end but we'll be back and will definitely stay at the Casa when we return.

Reviews.Title: “Super stay”
Reviews.Author: london10019
Reviews.Content: The Casa Marina Resort was a pleasure to stay at. We had an ocean view suite which allowed us easy access to both the swimming pool and the beach. They were both literally just a walk away. The view was amazing and we were able to enjoy the sun from the comfort of our own patio as we had two sunchairs. Altogether the suite felt like a mini apartment and was so spacious! The furnishings were also very nice. Some of the accessories included in the suite was an espresso machine and a fridge which was extremely handy. All the staff were very courteous and the towel gentleman in particular always aimed to please us. Because we stayed during the Easter break, there were many children about and the resort showed a film (Finding Nemo) on one of the nights which I thought was such a nice entertainment for kids and family. When checking out, the staff at the valet stand were very helpful with our luggage and booked us on a shuttle van which runs every half hour to the airport, this made things a lot easier. I would most definitely recommend the Casa Marina Resort to everyone, great resort, great staff.............can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Strange and $$$ stay at Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: katebuddie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Casa Marina for 4 nights, 5 days. Overall, the place is nice. They upgraded us to an Ocean View room because they didn't have any lower level rooms left, so that was lucky. The rooms are completely adequate, but I'm not sure that they are completely 'renovated' because there were definitely spots in the shower, the furniture and on the floor that made it seem a bit dated. The walkways have peeling paint and so the rooms in some spots. Maybe we just weren't in the right wing. The cleaning staff is great- they even change the sheets every day! The Nespresso machine in the room is great and so are the ameneties. The view is amazing, as is the pool, the beach and the snack area by the pool. There are plenty of lounge chairs on the beach as well as hammocks. The staff was okay, we never had any problems with them, but they all seemed kind of uninterested in what they were doing. There is really nothing going on at this resort. We wanted to get a drink at the bar at 11pm one night, and the TV was on but no one was home. There were other people with the same idea, but there was no bartender there each night. The place is without a doubt strange and expensive. The small brunch they offer is over $22 per person. Go to Camille's for breakfast and your entire check for two people will be less than that, and you will get much better food. All of the drinks at the Casa are $9 and up, all of the time. Room service is outrageous. We finally bought beer and wine at the circle K and stocked our refrigerator because after a while, $9 drinks add up! We weren't even sure if they offered dinner or not because there were no advertisements or anything. It's almost like no one knows what is going on there, or they aren't interested in sharing it with you for some reason. We just went into town every night for dinner. The elevators were almost always out of order during the day, which made getting around the property kind of a pain. It would also be impossible for an elderly or disabled person to stay here because of this. Overall I would say that we were satisfied with the Casa Marina, but there was nothing that made us want stay there again next year. We ended up spending a lot more money than we would have liked. There are a couple of places down the street that are probably less expensive with more charm and service, and are a bit closer to Duval street as well. The cab rides from the Casa to Duval street varied with cab drivers, which was pretty annoying. It could cost anywhere from $7.00 to $12.50. I say rent a scooter. Definitely stay on this side of the island, though!! We ran the entire island and the other side isn't anywhere near as cute and interesting as the side with the Casa and Duval street. If it's the beach you want and the other places don't offer it, you could just walk up to the beach at the Casa and use it anyway. You could sit there and buy drinks, food, use the chairs, all without being a guest. They would never know.

Reviews.Title: “Best spot on the island”
Reviews.Author: Glurch2891
Reviews.Content: After reading numerous reviews I was very hesitant about booking into Casa Marina, but several friends had advised me that they loved it there. Needless to say, we loved it there as well, the facilities and staff were top notch, even during the busy spring break period. I have come to realize that Tripadvisor is a great resource when booking trips and researching vacation plans, but some of the information has to be quantified by the enhanced motivation of someone whom has had a bad experience versus the individual that had an average or pleasant experience. There will of course be a much higher percentage of posts from the people who are complaining than by the people who had no or trivial complaints. I found this resort to be top notch, great location and with a helpful staff, but reading prior reviews I thought I might be booking into the Hanoi Hilton. Stay at the Casa Marina, it is a very nice resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the pampering!”
Reviews.Author: Miamibeachbum
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 11-year old son and I spent the weekend of March 29-31 at the Hotel. I had requested an early check-in and when I arrived at 2 PM, was immediately given a room. The room, an Ocean View room, had a beautiful view of the beach and was fine for a few nights for us, but would be too small for a family of four. The best part of our stay was spent at the pool where we were pampered by pool attendants putting out an abundance of towels, waiters walking around with cool fruits, popsicles and samplers of smoothies. There is a full kitchen by the pool serving a full menu with a great bar. The only negative was an hours long failure to bring drinks to my husband who was lying happily in a hammock on the beach. Breakfast the next day was in the patio and was good with friendly service. The walk downtown is a bit long for a child or after a long evening and a shuttle would be helpful. The resort has all the watersports that you could want with friendly assistance, but is not inexpensive at all. A jetski rental for a half hour is $70. The resort fee is overpriced and does not provide for anything that you would not get at any other hotel for the normal price, but unfortunately is par for the course at a luxory hotel. The bill should be checked out carefully at the end as there were a few errors. On the whole, the hotel was lovely and the day we spent by the pool and the beach will always be a wonderful memory.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: concors
Reviews.Content: We were a bit apprehensive about staying at the Casa Marina after reading some negative reviews but we had a pleasant stay and I would stay there again. Most of the recent renovations were finished. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite (1014) overlooking the ocean. It's true that the beach is not the sort of white sandy beach you might find in Sarasota or Siesta Key but it is still a beautiful ocean view. The suites are arranged around the elevator and ice machines so you can hear them but activity tended to diminish after 9-10 pm so it really wasn't a problem. The rooms were small but nicely appointed. The service was adequate and everyone was very friendly. We mostly ate out but the two or three meals we had at the hotel were decent. I think my biggest criticism would be that for the money (about $600 per night) one might have expected just a little bit more service but this is really nitpicking. We asked for a late check out and got noon instead of 11 am. Overall we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “awesome time!”
Reviews.Author: momtrieshard
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 6 nights at the Casa with our 4 kids 11 and under. It was Easter week, so I expected it to be vvery crowded, but we had a very positive experience. We had 2 adjoining rooms overlooking the ocean and pool. Unlike other reviewers we had great service, whether it was front desk, housekeeping, towel service, lunch, room service, baggage help, consierge - you name it. I even had to call maintanence to borrow a hammer after our stroller broke and the guy came right up. I could always find a chair in the shade, a hammock, a beach chair away from other people. The pools wqere surprisingly uncrowded - the most I ever saw was 15 people in it and 4 were my kids! Usually it was 10 or fewer. The staff cleaned up cups and towels constantly - very clean. They brought around ice pops, lemon water and watermellon. One day when my son missed the pops the guy went back to the freezor and brought one out for him. The breakfast buffet was good - pricey of course. I stuck with the Starbucks - whcih isn't cheap of course, but for a muffin and coffee it's not $21 and that's all I needed. We never waited in line for anything - food, drinks, water sports, bikes etc. The one exception was computers, of which there are only 2 and no free WIFI. We walked to restaurants each night (Blue Heaven was good) and a few sites (Butterfly Conservatory), but mostly just lounged on the beach and pool - we were escaping the snow and cold in Chicago. The beds were comfortable and quiet - I was only bothered once by late night voices in the hall - it was not a spring break party place. I slept great! There were conventions, but they had their own set ups for lucn and dinner and never interfered with our getting chairs or service. Some resortts you can only eat lunch at 11 or 2 to really get seated and served - but we ate with our 4 kids at noon every day - no delay. You seat yourselves too- again no waiting.The mango chicken sandwich was tasty. Not gourmet, but good. You could eat at the tables, on the beach or at the pool. I appreciated the lack or rules - I've been to places where you have to sign out towels, pay for umbrellas on the beach, can't sit in certain reserved chairs etc - there was none of that. I felt very relaxed. It was child friendly too - they had the Easter Bunny and a movie night with popcorn by the pool. It was not overrun with kids, however, so the noise level was fine. There were no lifeguards, which I appreciate b/c I can watch my own kids and don't want to hear whistles or "WALK please," every 5 minutes. There are rafts that the resorts has and the kids loved balancing standing on them - I'm sure lifeguards would have discouraged that. We swam off the pier and over where we rented the boats - the coral was not a concern, although I was glad I'd read about it. And, yes the sand is a bit rocky, but it looks nice and they kept it clean. We were on the 2nd floor and used the stairs (the elevators were slow) and from room to beach chair was all of 60 seconds - very convenient layout. I could watch kids in the pool and on the beach at the same time by sitting in a chair on the boundary of both. One day I had one kid on the room balcony, 2 in the pool and one in a hammock and did not feel overwhelmed - I could see them all! (My hubby went back to a meeting in Chicago for the day). Kudos to Mike at the pool and Patrick at the front desk - always seemed genuinely helpful. The only negatives were: the balconies were separated by canvas dividers - you might as well been sitting with your neighbors if you were out there at the same time. The lack of shower doors did result in some floods with the kids. Also, there are non-resort people who come and use the pool and the beach - I resented subsidizing their towel service when we were paying So much to stay there. But, overall it was just what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Nickle and Dime”
Reviews.Author: rabenja
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at hotels all over the world, for the price I would expect more. Good things: The view is very nice. The pools is excellent. The staff have been courteous. The room's furnishings are also very nice. Picky, picky: Looking at the sheetrock wall in front of me, apparently, they do not know how to tape and mud here in Key West. There are nail indents all over the wall that have not been taped. The room is dusty and the balcony had not been swept. I was walking around the room barefoot after my morning shower and had to clean my feet before putting my socks on. The door to the passageway outside the room provides zero noise reduction you can literally here every word said from several doors away... so we were wakened at night every time someone walked past our room after we had gone to bed. There is plenty of pretty beach sand to sit on under the palms overlooking the sea, but not much room to actually swim in the ocean unless you want to start from the reefs. The site says check-in is 4 pm and they mean it. We arrived at 1 pm and the room was not ready. The check-in person removed the "Resort fee" for the inconvenience. Nickle and dime: Speaking of the resort fee, this is what pays for what you would expect at any decent hotel: coffee/tea in the room, small in-room safe, towels at the pool, chairs to sit on at the pool. Charge above room rate: $22.30, tax on that: $6.90. Total charge for what you would expect to be included at any hotel: $29.20 We drove to Florida from Minnesota and on the way down we stayed at Hampton Inn's whenever we could. They provided free internet. Here they charge $13/day. Tax per day is $74... Now the charge above the room cost is $109... Then you add in the room cost and you come up with a substantial fee. You could stay at an all-inclusive resort on a very nice beach almost anywhere in the Caribbean for what you pay here. I have been to St Lucia, Jamaica & Aruba, so I do know. The resort is 1.5 miles from Front street where most people aim for (walking along Duval st). Walking there and back gets long more than once a day. The hotel could provide a simple shuttle service but they do not. They do not provide transportation from the ferry either. I would not stay here again and I would tell anyone who actually cares about value to find a better one.

Reviews.Title: “Nobody's Home”
Reviews.Author: siouxieWashington
Reviews.Content: We took our kids along for a week-long conference in March. All the guidebooks listed this as a very family-friendly property, but the kids' club and other features are long gone. In fact, the change in management seemed to have left this properly chronically short-staffed. My husband self-parked the car because there was never anyone at the valet stand, and it was impossible to reach anyone in housekeeping, ever (and the very nice housekeepers confirmed they were overworked). The front desk clerks were very nice and helpful as well, particularly with restaurant suggestions that would work with kids, but they were clearly swamped. Rooms in the new section are nice though somewhat motel-like. The two swimming pools are the best feature. Overall, it's perfectly nice as long as you don't expect a kids' club, etc., but the fact that this is called a resort (and charges accordingly) sets up a different expectation.

Reviews.Title: “Frustration with Casa Marina”
Reviews.Author: jeannine1101
Reviews.Content: My travel agent booked a room with a king size bed and a sleeper couch, however, the email confirmation listed a king room no couch. When my travel agent called them back they assured her that there was a sleeper couch and the next day when I called (she asked me to confirm just in case) they said there wasnâ€™t one! My travel agent got me on a conference call with them where a woman named Carrie assured us that I would get the room I wanted. She said she would be there when we checked in if there was a problem. Upon check-in I was told that the room we requested didnâ€™t exist. When I asked for Carrie they had no idea who she was! When I complained, they gave us an upgrade to a double room with an ocean front balcony and took off the resort fee of $20 per day. And while they did â€œfixâ€� my problem, they really didnâ€™t seem to be too concernedâ€¦and that seems to be one of the problems with Casa Marina. Casa Marina wasnâ€™t a horrible hotel but I was disappointed in several aspects including this initial problem with the room. Some of the other problems include: â€¢ Elevators with broken plastic buttons, scarred walls, chunks of the floor missing â€¢ Dirty scuffed walls in the halls â€¢ Very little space for clothing â€“ a few cubby holes and a small armoire â€¢ Scuffed wooden soap holders in the bathroom â€¢ The worst is the indifferent customer service. Casa Marinaâ€™s pools were very nice and the beach was serviceable, as long as you understand that Key West really doesnâ€™t have great swimming beaches. The beach bar was nice andâ€”not too expensive but once again, not the best customer service. It took at least 5 minutes to be acknowledged. I understand being busy but at least say â€œIâ€™ll be with you in a minuteâ€� with a smile. We didnâ€™t eat the breakfast buffet or any other food, but lots of people looked like they were enjoying it. There were two weddings going on at the same time. Neither bride seemed upset but I would have been furious. It's not a large hotel, so they seemed to run together. I think if we had paid $250 a night, I wouldnâ€™t have been as frustrated and disappointed but for almost $400 a night, you should get a little more of just about everything!

Reviews.Title: “So much promise. Failed to deliver”
Reviews.Author: fosters2
Reviews.Content: I've been in the consulting business for 20 years, so I stay in a lot of hotels and resorts worldwide. This property has a lot of promise and under the right management, could be an exceptional property. The staff are very courteous and generally aim to please. The management and execution are another matter. My wife and I arrived with two young children in a rental car. The arrival area was a scene of complete chaos, with nobody directing anything. We had to get our own bags out of the car. The front desk was pleasant and assigned us our room. I double checked to make sure we got the one bedroom suite we had reserved. I was informed that they didn't have any, but would give us two rooms instead. I asked if they were adjoining and was told no they weren't . We worked through this issue and finally got a one bedroom suite after all. The room was nice, except the floors were dirty, one of the tv remotes did not work, multiple lights were burned out, the iron did not work, there was no coffee for the coffee maker...... you get the point. I made a call and all of this was fixed, except for the iron and the tv remote. Multiple requests but neither was fixed. I just gave up. The bed was one of the worst I have ever slept on. Checked with multiple guests and they concurred. Not a good thing to skimp on cost. Service in the hotel was generally good, but spoiled by the apparent lack of management oversight to prevent bad experiences. For instance, we and another family went to breakfast together (party of 9). The hostess area was completely disorganized. A party of 13 came after us, yet they set up a table for the party of 13 and prepared to seat them. I was then approached by another staff member and asked how many in our party. I told them we had already registered as a party of 9. She apologized that it would be impossible to accommodate us outside, but that we would be able to get a table inside with a 15 minute wait. The person with the party of 13 stepped in and told them he had come after us and he said we should be seated first. To make a long story short, myself and the other guy were able to work with the staff to have both large parties seated outside by moving around a few tables (which we did ourselves). BTW, no apologies from any of the staff. Nothing. The waiter was great. We will be coming back to the Keys but we will not be staying at the Casa Marina again. That's sad as it holds so much promise.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Key West”
Reviews.Author: Debo57
Reviews.Content: I loved staying at your hotel, your staff was excellent! Kirk was very outstanding and made sure to take care of all my hotel needs. He was professional. Along with all your staff, your room service was excellent, I cannot say enough about my breakfast. Every bite was perfect. I enjoyed sitting on my patio and listening to the evening music. The sunsets were perfect from my room. The pool side manner choose to be nothing but perfect. I would recomend this place to everyone, it is first on my list for my future stays in Key West. You have the best of everything, pool, beach, music and an awesome staff. Thank you so much for making my stay pleasureable!!!!! Deborah Denty

Reviews.Title: “We checked out the next day-only staying 1 night on our 5 night vacation”
Reviews.Author: Jacobs-Family
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby and beach grounds look very nice - but don't be FOOLED~! I had mixed feelings about staying here based on other reviews but we had a free night through our booking agent, so we decided to give it a try. We will never stay here again. Yeah the place had just been renovated but they freshly painted moldy walls and bathrooms. Our first floor room smelled of mold and fresh paint. We moved to a 4th floor room but were greeted with the same smells, and it seemed the air conditioner made it worse when we turned it on. We ended up spending the first day of our vacation frantically trying to find other hotel accomodations for the remainder of our stay; it was spring break during our visit. We checked out early the next morning and were not given any other options for different accomodations. We got a "sorry your room smelt" from the front desk manager, that was it. We were willing to move to a different room or even upgrade to a suite but we were not offered any other options. There are tons of wonderful places to stay in Key West. Try a bed and breakfast, but dont stay here. Stay at the Westin if you want a resort type atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “We thought it was GREAT!”
Reviews.Author: TwoTrips
Reviews.Content: We had booked a room at the Reach Resort, but when we got to the hotel to check in we found the hotel under construction with no restaurant and no bar. We contacted the Casa Marina and they offered to let us stay at their hotel for the same price as the Reach and upgraded us to a suite. We found the pools and beach to be clean, the rooms tidy and the staff very friendly. The only thing that we would note is that you can not access the ocean from the beach and the pool bar prices were a little steep, but when you are on vacation..who cares! We would recommend the Casa Marina and will be staying there on our next visit to Key West. I don't usually write reviews, but The Casa Marina helped turn our vacation from bad to GREAT!!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of unsanitary hotel drinking glasses!”
Reviews.Author: lovinlife58
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a conference 3/2-3/5/08 at the Casa Marina. Gorgeous facility. However, BEWARE of unsanitary glassware (drinking glasses, wine glasses and ceramic mugs) in guest rooms. One morning while my husband was at a meeting, I decided to stay in our room and do some work on our laptop. Hearing the chambermaid out in the hall, I asked that she simply switch our dirty towels with clean towels, as well as replace our dirty drinkware with clean, from the kitchen; she politely obliged. She came into our room as I worked on the computer, but I was soon distracted by the continuous running of water from the bathroom sink: I found her rinsing our dirty glasses in the (dirty) bathroom sink and wiping them dry with a towel. Appalled, and remembering an ABC undercover investigation, â€œAre Hotel Drinking Glasses Clean?â€� (Feb 12, 2008), I asked her what she was doing; she said she was washing our glasses and mugs. When asked whether or not dirty drinkware from guest rooms are run through the kitchen dishwasher, she said no. When asked why she wasnâ€™t at least using dishsoap, she said they donâ€™t use any â€“ just rinse the glasses under hot water. I asked her stop what she was doing and to please bring me clean drinkware from the kitchen dishwasher. She said Iâ€™d have to go through the front desk, which I did, but not before I used my computer and googled the Florida Health Dept, called them, inquired of their health code for hotel drinkware (which they have), and filed a complaint. I was told an investigator would soon be paying a visit to the Casa Marina. I shared this information with the hotel manager when I went down to the front desk to request clean glasses. Back at the room, I received a call from the head of housekeeping; he heard we had problem. I informed him of my findings and he assured me that clean glasses are delivered daily to all guest rooms, in exchange for the dirty. Letâ€™s just say that I was in our room all morning and not once did I hear the clinking sound of glassware exchanging hands from bus boy to chambermaid. Clean glasses were finally delivered to our room from the kitchen (yeah!) but only after a couple more encounters of unsanitary utensils onsite. Pretty gross and appalling that a resort of this caliber can be in such blatant violation of health codes. Iâ€™m beginning to appreciate the cheaper, more generic hotels which offer plastic cups sealed in cellophane.

Reviews.Title: “What a Difference a Year Makes”
Reviews.Author: tinman71
Reviews.Content: The hubby and I got married here in December 2006 in the midst of all the construction that was going on. It was at the time absolutely horrendous with jack hammers from 7 AM on. The rooms were not nice at the time either. We returned and stayed for 4 nights in February 2008 and WOW. The property now totally renovated is gorgeous. The rooms are sleek, modern and new. The bed was very comfortable. The two pools are great as are the areas of the beach. I love how the staff came by with cold towels, fruit, popsicles, etc. There are several hammocks now. They do get a bit frazzled by the pool when there are too many people, but it was not a really big deal. Downside was the walls are thin as per other reviews. I would definitely stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Looks Like a 5-Star, Runs Like a 2-Star”
Reviews.Author: PeevedInParadise
Reviews.Content: Although beautiful, and on a highly desirable piece of property, it appears that the resort management feel no need to make an effort to please its guests. The hotel is overpriced, the food is very overpriced, and the service throughout is forgetable. Calls to the front desk for extra towels are ignored. The room fridge and safe both don't work and can't be fixed. I realized after check-out that I had left something behind in the room, but my repeated calls to the security staff to locate this lost item were ignored for over 2 days. I wouldn't recommend this hotel based on the, at best, indifferent service.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel on the beach, great service”
Reviews.Author: fenway485
Reviews.Content: Spent four days at the Casa Marina over February break, with kids age 9 and 12. We had a lovely ocean view suite, big enough for the whole family. The hotel is very clean, and the service is great, especially the front desk and the pool/beach area. We can't wait to get back to the conch republic.

Reviews.Title: “Sea~Stars in Key West from MN”
Reviews.Author: SeaStarsKW
Reviews.Content: This is our "girls week" to lay out in the sun and have fun at night and that is exactly what you do in Key West. We have been coming to Key West for 8 years and have stayed at the Casa several times. The renovation is beautful I love the way the pool is set up and the view is spectacular. When we got to the hotel the computers were down and they graciousley sent about 20 of us to the pool bar and took care of our tab until we were able to check in. It wasn't bad and gave us time to meet others and relax after a day of travel. When we went to check in Larry at the desk gave us an outstanding upgrade for our troubles and Rashad the bellman had our bags in our room when we arrived. We love to lay out and relax during the day and the Casa is the place to do it, It is peacful and vey relaxing. Johnny the "Cabana Boy" was right there to help with towels, chairs, popsicle, watemelon and a cocktail every now and then. They really know how to treat you right. The room was very nice and there were no problems with noise. We were probably the problem!! The patio outside are room was big enough for a hot tub and a party! It was really nice to enjoy morning coffee with an ocean view. The resort is very pricey but we know that going in but the experience is well worth it. We will definately be back next year! There is one thing you can count on in Key West ~ Beautiful weather!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway with a few notable exceptions!”
Reviews.Author: UpstateNyMaudie
Reviews.Content: Overall, had a great stay and would return, although i would try and get a better rate. We loved the beach even though it was not natural, and had fantastic food although NOT at the resort. I say get a rental car, Get a fodor's and check out Louie's Backyard, right around the corner. LOVED IT. Rooms were nice, clean and roomy. I saw a suite without a view and would def. pay extra for the ocean vista view rooms, big difference. Our housekeeper was amazing on the 4th floor and cleaned our room before 10am everyday! Gorgeous balcony w/view and we were lucky to not have noisy neighbors. Guys on the beach (Mike and Johnny) were great service-- setting up our chairs and towels. Definately recommend the massage on the beach but good lord it's expensive--more expensive than some of the best spa's in the states. Not so happy with the functions (weddings conferences) as they kept all the guests off a prime piece of the beach for much of the day on Saturday. That got in the way of the guest experience. Management was totally absent during our entire stay, which for "luxury" resort is not a good sign. Also didnt like that i had to pay to use a bike, what did i pay a 20 resort fee for? Beds were comfy and linens great...espresso machine in our room was amazing to have on hand. This is not luxury, though as we visited Little Palm Island resort during our stay and to be totally honest, THAT WAS TRUE LUX! Nice place on Key West especially if you want to avoid the madness of Duval Street.

Reviews.Title: “we were disapppointed!”
Reviews.Author: cincy-marfa
Reviews.Content: we recently came back from a 6 night stay here and were disappointed at what we got for what we paid. this place has a beautiful setting and could be a 5 star resort. i realize that february is high season and expensive but there were things that can't be excused. we had very dirty glasses in our room on 2 days in a row. they had been used by us and the maid put them back on the coaster as if they were clean. you could see lip marks and smell what had been in the glass! i was horrified! i called housekeeping after we again found dirty glasses the next day and spoke to the manager who was very polite and professional. i think he couldn't believe it either. the room was small, though the bed and pillows were very comfortable. the bathroom was tiny. there was a leak in the bathroom on our first day and it was promptly and pleasantly fixed. the service at the restaurant was good on some days and terrible on others. the tables in the bar were not cleaned between customers. they took away the dishes and glasses but did not clean the tables. the beach was nice, for key west, and the water was beautiful and blue! there was no hot tub as advertised and several times i had to hunt down some towels as i couldn't find the towel guy. though he was very pleasant when i could find him. the front desk people didn't seem to know alot, though the bell captains were friendly. i just read some of the recent reviews and couldn't believe the 5 star rated ones. i don't consider us really picky people either. i hope that they can fix some of the problems that they are having because the resort is really beautiful and could be top-rated! i also think it would be nice to have a free shuttle to mallory square every hour and coffee in the lobby, as high level, expensive resorts do.

HotelInfo.Name: Casa Marina, A Waldorf Astoria Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 1500 Reynolds St, Key West, FL 33040
